title: b'Data Scientist\r\n    '
jd:
['\n',

The NRMA was born to keep people moving, and we have been doing this for nearly 100 years. Our vision is to create indispensable connections with our Members’ mobility through my car, my journey and my destination.

Our Members enjoy our legendary roadside assistance, car servicing and repairs, Thrifty car and truck rentals, the latest fuel prices and more via the mynrma app, discounted travel and accommodation at our Holiday parks, Travelodge and Hotel Kurrajong Canberra

Your opportunity

Data is an incredibly important area of growth for the NRMA. This year we have made a significant investment in our people and technology and have already had a fantastic response for the real-time Fuel and Parking features which we launched in the MyNRMA app late last year. But this is just the beginning.

The Data Scientist will have a stronger focus on expanding and enriching our member-customer data assets & capability, through close collaboration with Technology and Product Management.

Here is where you come in!

, '\n',
  • Support the continuous expansion and enrichment of Data Assets and Capabilities
  • Perform predictive analytics and build models for customer engagement, retention, lifetime value
  • Grow data and business knowledge of Membership and Group Businesses
  • Ensure timely and accurate delivery of reports for designated stakeholder groups
  • Hands on analysis and visualization of complex web based data utilizing a variety of tools
  • Manage the campaign data design, build, delivery, and measurement of all Member and Customer communications
, '\n',

Your experience

You will have the customer experience at the heart of what you do and be able to demonstrate:

, '\n',
  • Tertiary related qualification in computer science, statistics, marketing, or IT related discipline
  • Minimum 7 years’ experience in an analyst role responsible for campaign, reporting, and analysis
  • Advanced SQL skills and experience dealing with large and complex data sets
  • Ability to adapt and navigate through complex systems
  • Strong analytical, business acumen, and problem solving skills
  • Possess a positive “can-do” attitude couples with excellent communication skills
  • Experience in data warehousing, data modeling, propensity modeling and scoring, statistical inference and validation, segmentation, clustering, regression and response modeling
, '\n',

Your benefits

We offer a competitive remuneration and our benefits include 50% discount on insurance, free NRMA Premium Care Membership , product and travel discounts, 50% discount on Village Roadshow Theme Parks, plus many more!

We moved to a brand new office in Sydney Olympic Park. Here you will enjoy the convenience of free parking or being on the doorstep of the train station, plus the atmosphere of vibrant cafes and restaurants to appease your appetite.

Your journey with us starts here, so get in the driver’s seat and take control of your career. Apply now.

, '\n',
, '\n']

[DATA SCIENTIST - TOP 100 ASX COMPANY,
, ' ',
  • 6-month contract
  • Passionate team
  • Strong Data Science strategy
  • Top 100 ASX Company
, ' ',
, ' ',
, ' My client, a top 100 ASX company active in the financial industry, is strongly investing in Big Data and Data Science. They are currently looking for a Data Scientist who will play a key role in the strategy. You will have to bring your expertise to a wide range of departments to help them identify and address business issues. You are not only going to work on technical works, but as a proper Data Scientist, you will have to approach business as a whole – strategically.',
, ' ',
, ' If you are willing to join a reputable company with a strong Data Science strategy, please send me your CV.',
, ' ', Job Responsibilities – Data Scientist,
, ' ',
  • Provide your expertise through machine learning models and make sure your models are strong and bring value to the business
  • Exposure with various stakeholders: understand their needs and provide them with tailored solutions
  • Bring your own vision of the business and deliver analyses and recommendations
, ' ',
, ' ', Requirements - Data Scientist,
, ' ',
  • Previous relevant experience in Data Science
  • Business acumen
  • Strong background in either Python or R
, ' ',
, ' If you would like to hear more about this role, then don’t delay, get in touch with me today! Click on the APPLY button or call Jeremy Corbet on: 02 9238 42 01 ']

title: b'Data Scientist\r\n    '
jd:
['\n',

At Caltex, we’re with you all the way. We keep millions of people moving every day, and continue to be Australia’s leading transport fuel supplier and convenience retailer. We’re a diverse, multi-faceted business full of people ready to make a difference. Our growing and changing business means we’ve got career opportunities across different parts of the business. Where do you come in?

You will be responsible for providing advanced analytics and machine learning to derive insights from large and disparate data sets. Partnering with a range of key business stakeholders, you will define, design and build statistical and analytical modelling strategies to provide organisational solutions. You will contribute to improve visibility of big data analytics across the organisation whilst driving business performance.

As the successful candidate you will have a relevant tertiary qualification in mathematics, statistics, computer science or actuarial science or similar; coupled with working experience in advanced analytics and machine learning with large complex data sets. You will have sound communication skills with the ability to explain complex concepts simply and present large data sets in a compelling descriptive analysis.

Knowledge of open source tools for distributed computing (i.e. Spark), programming in python and R coupled with Cloud Based Infrastructure and Machine Learning would be essential.

Caltex is renowned for an excellent team environment and passion for customer service. If this is what you are looking for, please click 'Apply Now' or visit our Careers website at https://jobs.caltex.com.au/. Applications close 18th May 2017.

Caltex Australia acknowledges the Traditional Owners of the lands on which we work. As part of our efforts to leave a sustained positive footprint in the communities and broader economies in which we operate, we strongly encourage Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples to apply.

, '\n']

title: b'Data Engineer/Scientist/Analytics Consultant\r\n    '
jd:
[A leading IM Professional Services consultancy is looking for a Mid to Senior Analytics consultant who possesses a Data Engineering/Scientist background and wants to move to the next level in their career.,
, ' ',
, ' This leading Australian Professional services company has an excellent track record in the Business Intelligence and Datawarehousing arena and as times & technology develop and change, so do they. Their Advanced Analytics division explores the science of data whether from traditional analytics to Big Data and they need new staff.\xa0',
, ' ',
, ' They are looking for a mid level to senior candidate with good analytics skills ideally in the consulting space.You will be a confident & effective communicator with an ability to deal with executives, project team members and end user staff.',
, ' ',
, ' Ideally, you will have the capability to qualify user requirements and have a commercial edge to your skillset that has yet to be utilised fully as their is scope for pre-sales & client engagement development work within this role\xa0',
, ' ',
, ' Some ideal technical skills for this role would include:',
, ' ',
  • Experience with Hadoop & Spark and related cloud environments 
  • Python and/or Scala for general purpose programming
  • Common analytics skills such as R, SAS, SPSS, Angoss, Alteryx
  • Familiarity with common BI tools such as Qlik, Microstrategy, Tableau, Shiny, gg-plot
, ' Please note this role may require interstate travel and visa sponsorship can only be offered to overseas candidates who fit this profile perfectly. ']

title: b'Sr. Data Scientist - Perm -Sydney\r\n    '
jd:
['My client is seeking an experienced Data Scientist with more than 5 years of experience in similar data and analytics related roles. This role would be part of a very high performing team of analysts, data scientists, and consultants.\xa0',
, '\n',
, '\r\nIn this role, you will apply machine learning, statistics and advanced analytics concepts and models to extract insights from large datasets. You will be part of a growing team and contribute towards some really exciting projects. You will lead a team in this\r\n role.\xa0',
, '\n',
, '\n', Your responsibilities:
, '\n',
  • Lead a small team of data analysts and data scientists
  • Explore large datasets, discover trends and patterns and extract insights  
  • Apply Statistical/Machine Learning techniques to build data product and features.
  • Develop scripts to extract and analyze large data sets and build statistical models
  • You are technically hands on and will contribute to any piece of work if required.
  • You will be building statistical models utilizing descriptive and predictive statistical modeling.
, '\n', Your skills and experience:, '\n',
  • Australian citizenship - Very highly regarded, due to the nature of the job and clients. If you are an Australian citizen, please mention in your resume. Candidates with Australian PR can also apply but short-listing depends on case to case basis. 
  • Experience in Fraud Detection - Good to have
  • Healthcare or Medical background: - Very highly regarded. If you have experience in Medical Clinical codes, please do mention in your profile.
  • Education: Post-graduate qualification in Statistics, Mathematics, machine Learning. 
  • At least 5 of experience in a commercial advanced analytics and insights environment - Required
  • Solid skills in SQL and R for data extraction and manipulation and to create reports and dashboards.
  • Skills in NLP, text mining, or network analysis 
, '\n']

title: b'\r\n          Data Scientist\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',

THE ROLE

, '\n',

We're looking for Data Scientist to join our newly created Forward Deployed Data Science team. The heart of this team is to ensure that our proprietary product 'Anna' and our clients have a long & successful relationship and to help us with this, you will be the go-to Data Scientist responsible for solving our clients data analytics' problems. 

, '\n',

Working closely with the Customer, Data Science and Engineering teams, you will own client data on-boarding, reconciliation and analysis. Working with other data scientists in the team, you'll be able to have a key influence and provide input into the technical direction of Anna.

, '\n',

ABOUT YOU

, '\n',

You're passionate, up to date on new technologies, laid-back and adaptable. You know when to obsess over details and when it's time to delivery. 
You're someone who wants to have an impact on the product you're working on and excited to join a creative and passionate team. 
You want variety & exposure to different data-sets & industries. From financial services, technology, professional services and government clients, no project or data set is ever the same.
Aside from your expertise in SQL/R/Python, you are fluent in the application and commercialisation of data analytics. 
Whether it's solving a new problem, reviewing code or sharing an approach with the team, you're an excellent communicator who takes pride in delivering the highest quality work.
You're hungry to learn and innovate working alongside world-class data scientists.

, '\n',

ABOUT US

, '\n',

We're a rapidly growing startup in the artificial intelligence space - we're poised for a huge year and we need to expand our team to help us reach our goals. We're casual and flexible and pride ourselves on our diverse, inclusive working culture.

, '\n',

SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS

, '\n',

Bachelor's degree in quantitative field with 3 plus years of relevant experience
Advanced experience in SQL/R/Python
Advanced analytical and problem solving skills
Ability to work independently or as part of a group
Ability to work in a fast paced and collaborative environment
Ability to exchange ideas and convey complex information clearly and concisely
Proven ability to lead and drive projects to completion

, '\n',

THE OFFER

, '\n',

Competitive salary on offer
Beautiful, centrally-located office
The opportunity to progress into a lead role
 

, '\n']

title: b'Data Scientist\r\n      '
jd:
["An opportunity has arisen looking for a Data Scientist to work with in of Sydney's fastest growing mobile app companies.",
, '\n',
, "\r\nMy client produces the most used app of it's type in the world. This means we they have some very interesting scalability challenges across the whole stack.",
, '\n',

Key Responsibilities
, '\n',
  • Understand and identify what data is available and relevant, including internal and external data sources, and leverage data collecting process.
  • Undertake advanced data analysis, algorithm design, hypotheses testing, and model building.
  • Develop production-level data products.
  • Innovate approaches to solve business problems and communicate results and methodologies.
  • Evaluate, validate and provide on-going tracking of performance of decision models.
  • Make improvements to methods and algorithms that lead to new findings and refined results.
  • Create analyses that tell a "story" focused on insights, not just data.
  
Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)
  
  • Demonstrated ability to quickly understand data and new concepts
  • Implemented enhancements of the algorithm and data collecting process as needed
  • Can independently work from start to end: structuring problem, dealing with data, architecting solution at optimized cost and suggesting improvements
  • Key findings are presented to all staff both from IT and the business perspectives such that they're educated, engaged and able to contribute meaningful ideas
  
Key Knowledge and Experience
  
  • Hands on experience with Machine Learning and Statistical Modelling
  • Strong scripting skills (SQL and at least one of R, Python, Scala, Java, C, etc.)
  • Natural Language Processing techniques
  • Experience with Big Data frameworks (Spark, Flink, Kafka, etc)
  • Experience with AWS services (EC2, Redshift, RDS, EMR, etc)
Please apply within if interested
, '\r\n\xa0',
, '\r\n\xa0',

title: b'Assistant Scientist - 12 month contract (2 roles available)\r\n    '
jd:
[' ',

At PepsiCo Australia & New Zealand, our people are the key to our success… We are committed to recruiting, training and retaining high quality people. We are the home to some of the world’s most recognised and respected brands including Pepsi Max, Gatorade, Doritos and Quaker, together with local favourites like Smith's Chips, Red Rock Deli, Bluebird Chips and Twisties. From beverages to snacks, we offer consumers a broad range of product choices from simple treats to healthier offerings. To continue our success we currently have an exciting opportunity to join our team as R&D Assistant Scientist - 12 month contract, to become proficient in the new Global Ingredient Specification System and provide technical support to the ANZ R&D Team to enable its implementation in Australia & New Zealand.

, ' ',

Key accountabilities of the role will include:

, ' ',
  • Understand the new PepsiCo Global Ingredient Standard and Supplier Standard, and become proficient in the new IT Applications associated with these.
  • Validate correct migration of data to the new Global Ingredient Specification system, includes proof reading.
  • Contacting suppliers for updated specification information.
  • Preparation and entering raw material specifications into the new Ingredient Specification System, requiring collaboration with varying functions (R&D PD, R&D QA, R&D Regulatory, Procurement, Vendor Assurance and the Supplier).
  • Complete monthly Global Scorecard associated with tracking new/existing raw material specifications. Also take part in weekly regional calls.
  • Writing, submitting and tracking of Change Requests for the new Ingredient Specification system, specific to ANZ.
  • Assist R&D team with tasks as required, including working on identifying suitable Analytical Test Methods.
, ' ',

Requirements for the role will include:

, ' ',
  • University degree in Food Technology or related discipline.
  • Ideally 1+ years’ experience in the food Industry and experience using the AFGC Product Information Form or experience developing raw material specifications.
  • Technical minded individual with attention to detail.
  • Strong communication, organisation and project management skills.
  • Competency in computer applications such as Word, Excel and PowerPoint and can adapt to new IT applications.
, ' ',

This is a great opportunity to join a truly global business that’s passionate about our people and products and growing sustainably & innovating into the future. Remember that there are 2 of these roles available!

, ' ',

Our Commitment is to deliver Sustained Growth through Empowered People acting with Responsibility and Trust.

, ' ']

title: b'Data Scientist\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

As a Data Scientist, you will work with different divisions to uncover their key business problems and implement data science solutions to create value for the organisation. You will work proactively on:

, ' ',
  • Identify where data science can create value or solve problems for the business and use your skills and experience to do so
  • Take responsibility for project delivery, communicate and develop relationships with all stakeholders
  • Be accountable for end-to-end predictive modelling from exploratory analysis to feature engineering to performance evaluation
  • Design and implement data science solutions that will deliver the expected business outcomes
  • Communicating data driven insights to stakeholders at all levels
  • Participate in regular training sessions to share best practices and develop knowledge of current and emerging technologies to constantly uplift the team's capabilities
, ' ',

Our Ideal Person

, ' ',

Postgraduate qualifications (PHD or Masters with a research component) in a relevant field with experience in data science working with large datasets. Extensive knowledge of varied machine learning models and analytical techniques.

, ' ',

SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

, ' ',
  • Strong experience in analytical tools, processes and practices
  • Worked with R, Python or other open source tools
  • Strong SQL skills Data modelling skills
  • Machine Learning programming capability
  • Software engineering background
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong problem solving and presentation skills
  • Passionate about analytics
, ' ',

If you have the relevant prerequisites above please e-mail Andreas Mead your CV at andreas.mead@hudson.com or call on 0282 332 346

, ' ',

, ' ']

jd:
[' ',

You will be able to engage and influence internal and external stakeholders from a variety of different internal business units, including marketing, risk and digital.

, ' ',

You must be able to understand business requirements and translate them into technical solutions through programming with tools like R, Python and SQL.

, ' ',

The ideal candidate will be passionate about analytics and have Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence capability. Attitude is a huge part of this role; a collaborative, creative person with leadership, technical and business facing skills is what we are looking for.

, ' ',

You must be able to build and develop strong relationships and be able to drive better outcomes to grow the Data Science team.

, ' ',

SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

, ' ',
  • Strong experience in analytical tools processes and practices
  • Worked with R, Python or other opensource tools
  • Strong SQL skills Data modelling skills Machine Learning programming capability
  • Software engineering background
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong problem solving and presentation skills
  • Passionate about analytics
, ' ',

If you have the relevant prerequisites above please e-mail Andreas Mead your CV at andreas.mead@hudson.com or call on 0282 332 346

title: b'Data Scientist\r\n      '
salary: b'Enjoy working  in a flexible environment!'
jd:
[' ',

Our Company

, ' ',

Tabcorp is one of the few integrated gambling and entertainment companies in the world. We deliver excitement and fun to our customers through our retail, digital and media platforms.

, ' ',

Our 3,000 strong team is as diverse as Australia itself. Our people drive leading brands and industry-first sustainability efforts, here and internationally. They’ve also made Tabcorp a top 100 ASX company.

, ' ',

This leadership is reflected in who we are. If, like us, you’re a passionate, positive playmaker and you want to use your talent to create amazing outcomes, we’d love to hear from you.

, ' ',

Role Summary

, ' ',

As part of the Chief Marketing Office, the Data Science and Analytics team engage with business stakeholders from all key business areas, including marketing promotions and customer relationship management, wagering and pricing, risk and compliance, and digital channels. We leverage analytics to provide advanced data-enabled initiatives, creating the best experience for our customers and delivering the maximum value for our company.

, ' ',

One major strength of our team is diversity: we have people with advanced degrees in computer science, machine learning, statistics, natural language processing, sport science, etc. We come to work with the excitement of learning something new every day from other team members.

, ' ',

How you will contribute

, ' ',

As a Data Scientist, you will work with different divisions to uncover their key business problems and implement data science solutions to create value for the organisation. You will work proactively on:

, ' ',
  • Identify where data science can create value or solve problems for the business and use your skills and experience to do so
  • Take responsibility for project delivery, communicate and develop relationships with all stakeholders
  • Be accountable for end-to-end predictive modelling from exploratory analysis to feature engineering to performance evaluation
  • Design and implement data science solutions that will deliver the expected business outcomes
  • Communicating data driven insights to stakeholders at all levels
  • Participate in regular training sessions to share best practices and develop knowledge of current and emerging technologies to constantly uplift the team's capabilities
, ' ',

Our Ideal Person

, ' ',

Postgraduate qualifications (PHD or Masters with a research component) in a relevant field with sound experience in data science working with large datasets. Extensive knowledge of varied machine learning models and analytical techniques. You will have strong knowledge in any of the following; data visualisation, D3, geo-spatial, Tableau. Practical experience in Python/R with expertise in Scala and expertise in big data systems like kafka, Hadoop and traditional RDBMS.

, ' ',

When you join our team you’ll be able to take advantage of a range of benefits including flexible working arrangements, leadership and development programs and community programs.

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ']

title: b'Data Analyst / Data Scientist\r\n        '
jd:
[
, ' Are you a creative Analytics professional looking for that opportunity where you can contribute to the strategic direction of the organisation?\xa0 This is a newly created group within their Strategic Intelligence team, where you will be applying your research and analytical skills to understand products and markets, identify trends and assess and evaluate risks. You will be able to provide solutions based on behavioural economics.',
, ' \xa0',
, ' As a Data Analyst / Data Scientist, you will contribute to the work of the Strategic Intelligence team by:',
, ' ',
, ' • Working in a team of data analysts / scientists to identify and assess evolving trends, emerging risks and systemic misconduct in financial services and markets',
, ' • Scoping, identifying and establishing data analysis methodologies to address research questions',
, ' • Designing and advising on processes to collect, manipulate, clean and explore data',
, ' • Analysing structured and unstructured data using statistical or machine learning approaches',
, ' • Communicating analytical findings, including through reports, briefings, presentations and data visualisation',
, ' • Contributing to the development of the group and expand its data analytics capabilities',
, ' • Providing expert support to stakeholder teams conducting operational data analysis, and',
, ' • Assisting other teams and working across multi-disciplinary team projects.',
, ' \xa0',
, ' To be considered for this role:',
, ' ',
, ' ', You must have Australian Citizenship and able to get National Security Clearance,
, ' ',
  • Experience using: R, SQL, SAS
  • Bachelor degree in Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or Economics.
  • Advantageous Skills / Experience: Python, Java, Scala, Apache Spark, Hadoop, NoSQL databases, various ML libraries, experience extracting data from Teradata, etc.
  • Experience in applying statistical or machine learning approaches to data analysis.
  • Ability to work independently with limited supervision and be accountable for outcomes.
, ' ']

title: b'Senior Data Scientist - Machine Learning\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist with an engineering and Machine Learning programming background for one of our end user clients based in Sydney CBD.

This is a 12 months fixed term contract that is highly likely to move into a permanent role.

The hiring manager is looking for an exceptional candidate and the salary on offer for this role reflects this.

This collaborative team serve stakeholders from a variety of different internal business units, including marketing, risk and digital.

You must be able to understand business requirements and translate them into technical solutions through programming with tools like R, Python and SQL. This is a diverse team that build predictive analytical models for the business.

The ideal candidate will be passionate about analytics. Attitude is a huge part of this role; a collaborative, creative person with technical and business facing skills is what we are looking for.

SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

, '\n',
  • Strong experience in analytical tools, processes and practices
  • Worked with R, Python or other opensource tools
  • Strong SQL skills
  • Data modelling skills
  • Machine Learning programming capability
  • Software engineering background
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong problem solving and presentation skills
  • Passionate about analytics
, '\n',

If the above sounds like you, please get in touch. We can wait for a notice period to be served and we are interviewing immediately.

International applicants will be considered and sponsorship is available for an outstanding candidate.



, '\n',

For further information on this role or to confidentially apply, please contact Rik English on 02 8227 9200 or apply directly via the Apply for this job button. Only WORD FORMAT resumes will be accepted.

, '\n']

title: b'Senior Data Scientist - Stats & Insights\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist with a statistics and insights background for one of our end user clients based in Sydney CBD.

The hiring manager is looking for an exceptional candidate and the salary on offer for this role reflects this.

This collaborative team serve stakeholders from a variety of different internal business units, including marketing, risk and digital.

You must be able to understand business requirements and translate them into technical solutions through programming with tools like R, Python and SQL. This is a diverse team that build predictive analytical models for the business.

The ideal candidate will be passionate about analytics. Attitude is a huge part of this role; a collaborative, creative person with technical and business facing skills is what we are looking for.

SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

, '\n',
  • Strong experience in analytical tools, processes and practices
  • Worked with R, Python or other opensource tools
  • Strong SQL skills
  • Data modelling, statistics and insights skills
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Passionate about analytics
, '\n',

If the above sounds like you, please get in touch. We can wait for a notice period to be served and we are interviewing immediately.

International applicants will be considered and sponsorship is available for an outstanding candidate.

, '\n',

For further information on this role or to confidentially apply, please contact Rik English on 02 8227 9200 or apply directly via the Apply for this job button. Only WORD FORMAT resumes will be accepted.

, '\n']

title: b'Senior Data Scientist - Statistics, Data Mining & Modelling\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist for one of our global end user clients based in Sydney CBD.

This is a newly created role in a global, prestigious organisation.

The hiring manager wants an experienced Data Scientist with strong technical and stakeholder management skills. You will be customer focused and be able to engage and influence internal and external stakeholders.

The right person for this role needs to have data and analytics experience with statistics, data mining and modelling. The tools are not as important as how the person has applied them. You will be exploring machine learning algorithms and developing analytical models.

It is an urgent need to fill this role and the hiring manager would ideally like to have an offer out to his preferred candidate before the end of next week. He can wait for a notice period to be served.

The ideal candidate will be passionate about analytics.

SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

, '\n',
  • Statistics, data mining & modelling skills
  • Worked with R, Python, SAS or other opensource and modelling tools
  • Desirable to have Big Data skills in tools like Hadoop
  • Machine Learning capability
  • Data Visualisation skills in tools like Tableau, Qlik or Power BI
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong stakeholder management skills
  • Able to manage analytical projects
  • Passionate about analytics and continue to develop skillset
  • Desirable to have worked in Consulting, Financial Services or Insurance industry
, '\n',

If the above sounds like you, please get in touch. We can wait for a notice period to be served and we are interviewing immediately.


, '\n',

For further information on this role or to confidentially apply, please contact Rik English on 02 8227 9200 or apply directly via the Apply for this job button. Only WORD FORMAT resumes will be accepted.

, '\n']

title: b'Data Scientist\r\n      '
jd:

,
, ' Konekt is the largest ASX-Listed private provider of Occupational Health and Risk Management services in Australia. title: b'Financial Services - Finance & Risk Data Scientist - Manager\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

About Accenture Financial Services practice

, '\n',

The Financial Services Operating Group serves all major industry segments in Banking, Insurance and Capital Markets - serving more than 700 unique clients in 24 countries. Among Accenture's clients are more than 86 percent of the Financial Services companies in the Fortune Global 500. The Financial Services operating group helps clients succeed in a dynamic and increasingly global market environment that includes cost and profitability pressures, industry consolidation, regulatory changes and the need to continually adapt to new technologies. The services offered are designed to help clients increase cost efficiency, grow their customer bases, manage risk and transform their operations.

, '\n',

About Accenture Finance & Risk

, '\n',

Banks, capital markets and insurance firms face extraordinary challenges related to profitability, complexity and new regulations in an uncertain economic environment, an environment we refer to as one of "permanent volatility."

, '\n',

Accenture Finance & Risk Services can help financial services firms focus upon the three key challenges of increasing profitability, reducing complexity and managing regulations. Accenture draws on its end-to-end transformation capabilities, as well as core strengths in management consulting, technology, analytics and outsourcing to help firms address complexity, volatility while creating sustainable competitive advantage.

, '\n',

Accenture Finance & Risk Services brings together Accenture's industry knowledge, consulting technology and outsourcing capabilities to develop solutions that can help clients strengthen their competitive position and enhance their profitability.

, '\n',

About the Role

, '\n',

The Finance & Risk Data Scientist Manager is accountable for assisting on execution of the strategy of data analysis, data quality, analytics and modelling offerings in the region. The successful individual will be an experienced data scientist, capable of supporting the go-to-market strategy, orchestrating and building data and analytics practice assets and capabilities, and creating thought leadership on data and analytics developments in the financial services market. The functional coverage of this consulting practice extends across financial services' risk and regulatory frameworks, finance processes, risk transformation, risk and regulatory remediation, optimising risk and regulation implementation and ongoing adherence and delivering the technology solutions required to enable insights through analytics.

, '\n',

This Manager will be able to define and deliver how Accenture will bring together all its data and analytics offerings (strategy, management consulting, technology solutions, systems integration, and operations) in an integrated way that provides a compelling value proposition to financial services institutions today.

, '\n',

Data Scientist that will help Acccenture's clients discover the information hidden in vast amounts of data, and help our clients make smarter decisions to deliver better finance and risk capabilities for our clients. The primary focus will be in applying data mining techniques, doing statistical analysis, and building high quality prediction systems whilst working with our existing capability in the Digital and Analytics teams. 

, '\n',

Another key role for this position is that of supporting Practice Development. In supporting this business area, the successful manager must not only be skilled at business planning but also in the operational activities that come with supporting a practice: managing consulting teams and supporting the culture in being leaders in compliance consulting. To achieve this, he/she must be able to work effectively in a global matrix of financial services sector heads and service line practice leaders who will contribute, follow and support the strategic roadmap for integrated business services.

, '\n',

Successful candidates for this position will be experienced in data and analytics services and/or consulting services for Financial Services or have moved on to relevant manager-level industry roles in Financial Services. The manager must demonstrate expertise in the following knowledge areas:

, '\n',

  • Selecting features, building and optimizing classifiers using machine learning techniques

, '\n',
  • Data mining using state-of-the-art methods
  • Extending clients' data with third party sources of information when needed
  • Enhancing data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic systems
  • Processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis
  • Doing ad-hoc analysis and presenting results in a clear manner
  • Creating automated anomaly detection systems and constant tracking of its performance
, '\n',

Skills and Qualifications

, '\n',
  • Excellent understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, etc.
  • Experience with common data science toolkits, such as R, Weka, NumPy, MatLab, etc. Excellence in at least one of these is highly desirable
  • Great communication skills
  • Experience with data visualisation tools, such as D3.js, GGplot, Tableau, Qlikview etc.
  • Proficiency in using query languages such as SQL, Hive etc.
  • Experience with NoSQL databases
  • Good applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc.
  • Good scripting and programming skills 
  • Data-oriented personality
  • Develops strong and effective working relationships based on mutual respect and trust.
  • Authentic in his/her leadership style. Projects confidence, optimism and energy to encourage people on what they can achieve.
  • Strives to help others succeed. Shows an active interest in others and cares about them
  • Team oriented and collaborative working style, both with clients and those within the internal organization
  • Shows character under pressure. Professional and ethical in all business dealings.
  • Ability to conceive and articulate an inspiring vision/ future direction using analytics and data
  • Ability to examine issues from a broad perspective; considering impact beyond immediate scope.
  • Ability to leverage synergy opportunities across functions and businesses.
  • Identification of key business opportunities and challenges.
  • Takes charge and makes tough decisions. Demonstrates a "can do attitude".
  • Proactive and fearless. Moves beyond his or her comfort zone in pursuit of Accenture's vision.
  • Effective communicator, good listener with strong inter-personal skills.
  • Role model who engenders loyalty and longevity among staff. 
, '\n',

Basic Qualifications:

, '\n',
  • Bachelor's degree in STEM
  • 8+ years of professional experience
  • 7+ years Financial Services/Banking experience
  • 6+ years' experience in analytics and data
, '\n',

 Preferred qualifications:

, '\n',
  • At least 6 years of experience in the sale and delivery of data analytics consulting services; with proven track record as an individual contributor and as a leader of a practice
  • Diverse background that includes working within different business models and markets.
  • Model development experience.
, '\n',

Accenture is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applications from all sections of society and does not discriminate on grounds of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other basis as protected by applicable law.

, '\n']

title: b'Senior Data Scientist\r\n    '
jd:
[
, ' ',

, ' ',

Your New Company & Team

, ' Enterprise Services (ES) is responsible for the world leading application of technology and operations across every aspect of CommBank, from innovative product platforms for our customers to essential tools within our business. ',

, ' ',

The Analytics & Information (A&I) team are accountable for the Group's key analytics capabilities including the GDW (Group Data Warehouse), Omnia (Hadoop Big Data Platform), Pega Decisioning, SAS, R, Tableau, Oracle BI, Ab Initio and Data Stage. We are focused on enhancing these to create world-leading capabilities for analytics, information management and decisioning.

, ' ',

Reporting into the Data Science Executive Manager, you'll be part of a broader Data Science team, working in consultation with:

, ' ',
  • Solution delivery managers
  • Project and Program teams
  • Data Science and Data Engineers teams
  • Resource Managers
  • Vendors and third party suppliers
, ' ',

The Challenge & Project Description
The Senior Data scientist will provide leadership and direction in implementing advance analytics and machine learning. This includes:

, ' ',

1- Thought leadership

, ' ',
  • Provide thought leadership to a broad team of architects in general areas of Data Mining and Machine Learning
  • Demonstrate leadership through concrete action and result-oriented approach
  • Apply state of the art statistical modelling/machine learning and data mining techniques to support business analytics teams across the Group
, ' ',

2- Project leadership

, ' ',
  • Take ownership (from inception to delivery) of two greenfield innovative projects in pricing / lending as well as, an early-stage project in Digital
  • Demonstrate business acumen in generating ROI (Return on Investment)
  • Engage with business stakeholders to clearly articulate findings as well as decompose business question into data science questions.
, ' ',

3- Drive innovation

, ' ',
  • Implement an experimentation data platform with associated tools and processes for quick prototyping and evaluation of novel approaches to modelling
  • Develop clear framework and guidelines for implementation of Data Mining solutions on large-scale production systems
  • An emphasis on coding or practice and on working closely with other teams to insure algorithms are delivered into production systems
, ' ',

Key Skills & Experience
Do you come from a large, complex, enterprise environment?

, ' ',

1- Soft skills:

, ' ',
  • Proven experience in business engagement on data science initiatives
  • Immaculate presentation, storytelling and business acumen
, ' ',

2- Hard skills:

, ' ',
  • Manipulate large datasets leveraging Spark, MapReduce and/or Hadoop
  • Data exploration (e.g. SQL, Pig, Hive, etc)
  • Data analysis (e.g. R, SAS, Python, etc)
  • Solve business problems by applying analysis, data mining and modelling (e.g. machine learning, Natural Language Processing, etc)
  • Data visualisation of complex relationships (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI, QlikView, MicroStrategy, etc)
  • NoSQL databases (e.g. HBASE, Cassandra, MongoDB, etc)
  • Comfortable working in a Linux environment
  • Programming /coding in R, Python, Ruby or Scala.
, ' ',

3- Academic background
Degree in computer science, statistics, mathematics or related disciplines

, ' ',

Highly regarded:

, ' ',
  • Agile (e.g. SCRUM, Kanban, Lean, etc)
  • Financial Services sector experience
, ' ',

People & Culture
The people, businesses and communities we serve are wonderfully diverse. To reflect this, we're committed to hiring a similarly diverse workforce. With a focus on inclusion, accessibility and flexibility, we'll support you at every stage of your career.

, ' ',
  • Data driven culture from top-down for A&I are considered as a Centre of Excellence
  • Academic research (publishing of scientific papers and securing patterns) is at the core of innovation and half of the team holds a PhD
  • There is room for experimentation in the Innovation Labs for Deep Learning
  • You'll be invited to participate into the quarterly Hackathon and Datathon
, ' ',

Impact

, ' ',

You will have the opportunity to directly impact at large scale the Australian economy. If you live the values and demonstrate the people capabilities we can offer great opportunities. Whether you want to move across the organisation or up into a leadership role, the way you live the values and demonstrate the people capabilities are key.

, ' ']

title: b'Data Scientist\r\n    '
jd:
['\n',

Join as a Data Scientist working on a large variety of projects and implementing the latest technologies

, '\n',

The Company

This leading consulting group located in Sydney CBD is currently expanding its Analytics division. Their work is focuused on AI implementation, machine learning and advanced analytics. They have a diverse team of data scientists, statisticians, developers and strategists who are focused on delivering unique customer solutions using the latest technologies

The Role

As a Data Scientist you will be designing, developing and implementing analytical solutions and focus on key areas of customers' business. You will closely work with the business stakeholders on factual problem formation, data identification and deriving answers that can solve business issues

Requirements

, '\n',
  • 3+ years experience in a hands on Data Scientist position.
  • Advanced data modelling and statistical analysis skills.
  • 2+ years experience in analytical tools such as ‘R’ and ability to develop multilevel models
  • Ability to build complex models using SQL, DAX, R or Python.
  • Create complex machine learning algorithms
  • Demonstrated strong conceptual and analytical skills, ability to translate complex business issues into well-structured analytics research projects
  • Relevant degree in Statistics, Mathematics or Computer Science
, '\n',

Career Opportunities

This is an excellent opportunity for a Data Scientist to advance the skills using the latest technologies and working in a high-performing team of some of the most talented people in Australia

, '\n',

To apply please click apply or call Kseniia Tkachenko on 02 8289 3139 for a confidential discussion.

, '\n']

  • Manipulate large datasets leveraging Spark, MapReduce and/or Hadoop
  • Data analysis (e.g. R, SAS, Python, etc)
  • Solve business problems by applying analysis, data mining and modelling (e.g. machine learning, Natural Language Processing, etc)
  • Data visualisation of complex relationships (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI, QlikView, MicroStrategy, etc)
  • NoSQL databases (e.g. HBASE, Cassandra, MongoDB, etc)
  • Comfortable working in a Linux environment
  • Programming /coding in R, Python, Ruby or Scala.
, '\n',

2- Soft skills:

, '\n',
  • Client facing and business engagement on data science initiatives
  • Ability to bridge the technical jargon, for storytelling and business acumen
, '\n',

3- Academic background
Degree in computer science, statistics, mathematics or related disciplines

, '\n',

Highly regarded:

, '\n',
  • Agile (e.g. SCRUM, Kanban, Lean, etc)
  • Financial Services sector experience
, '\n',

People & Culture
The people, businesses and communities we serve are wonderfully diverse. To reflect this, we're committed to hiring a similarly diverse workforce. With a focus on inclusion, accessibility and flexibility, we'll support you at every stage of your career.

, '\n',
  • Data driven culture from top-down for A&I are considered as a Centre of Excellence
  • Academic research (publishing of scientific papers and securing patterns) is at the core of innovation and half of the team holds a PhD
  • There is room for experimentation in the Innovation Labs for Deep Learning
  • You'll be invited to participate into the quarterly Hackathon and Datathon
, '\n',

Impact

, '\n',

You will have the opportunity to directly impact at large scale the Australian economy. If you live the values and demonstrate the people capabilities we can offer great opportunities. Whether you want to move across the organisation or up into a leadership role, the way you live the values and demonstrate the people capabilities are key.

, '\n',



, '\n']

title: b'Environmental Scientist - Impact Assessment and Permitting\r\n      '
jd:
[
, ' ',
  • Positive and collaborative work environment
  • AECOM offers flexible working arrangements (e.g. part time, working from home)
  • Join a team of world technical experts
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

The Role

, ' ',

We have an unique opportunity for an Environmental Planner/Scientist/Engineer to be a part of our Impact Assessment and Permitting Team based in the Sydney CBD and to take the next step in their career.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Reporting into the Work Group Leader, you will be part of a high performing and dynamic team renowned for delivering best practice environmental advisory services for all phases of our clients' infrastructure projects from planning to construction.  

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

This position will provide experience and a greater level of responsibility working on a diverse array of high profile, major infrastructure assessment projects across a range of sectors, including transport (road/rail/ports/air), water utilities, energy, sports and recreation, oil and gas, and urban renewal property sectors. You will work amongst a team of peers and alongside our clients, while learning first-hand from our in-house senior advisors and technical leaders. 

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

We are looking for an experienced environmental candidate who can prepare and step up to manage timely and high-quality environmental impact assessments, constraints analyses, strategic assessments and environmental management plans and assist in the organisation of resources, budgets and timelines for the management of these projects. 

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

You will develop your skills by working collaboratively to prepare advice, reports and proposals to clients, and develop effective relationships with our clients, in-house design teams and technical specialists to ensure projects are delivered successfully. You will also be responsible for key project related tasks as required, which may include studies and assessments, data analysis, technical writing, and presentations.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Our team here at AECOM is connected to our colleagues across Australia and New Zealand, and globally across the world, which allows our team to take up opportunities to work on exciting projects in a variety of regions on both a short term and long term basis.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

 About You

  • Bachelor's degree in appropriate discipline (e.g. B. Env Sc, Env Planning, Env Eng.)
  • 3 to 7 years relevant impact assessment experience
  • Experience working for a consultancy
  • Demonstrated commercial acumen and the ability to manage budgets 
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Benefits at AECOM

, ' ',

The Workplace Gender Equality Agency (WGEA) recognises AECOM as taking a sophisticated, holistic approach to supporting women and men's equal participation throughout our workplace.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

We provide a diverse and inclusive work environment and offer many benefits to ensure your professional development & wellbeing.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',
  • Flexible start and finish times, working from home, part time and job share options
  • State of the art, modern and contemporary offices
  • Paid Parental and Partner Leave
  • Purchased additional annual leave +  salary packaging
  • Corporate Employee discounts from up to 400 retailers

  • Study assistance
  • Professional and technical development

title: b'\r\n          Senior Data Scientist\r\n        '
jd:
[' ',

Nasdaq is recognized around the globe as a diversified worldwide financial technology, trading and information services provider to the capital markets, with more than 3,500 colleagues serving businesses and investors from over 50 offices in 26 countries across six continents – and in every capital market. 

, ' ',

Nasdaq has recently made a strategic decision to create an in-house Innovation lab as part of its business model to develop existing and new solutions based on deep data exploration, machine learning models, enhanced algorithm development, and innovative visualisation techniques.

, ' ',

Simply put, the Nasdaq Innovation Lab will be a Collaborative Practice Environment for engaging our staff, partners, clients and communities to create, test and prototype new product ideas using Data Science methods to reach our goals.

, ' ',

As part of this exciting Vision we are seeking a Data Scientist to join the team. This is a crucial role within the Innovation Lab as you will conceptualise the project problems and solution design, and work closely with the data handlers and visualisers in creating innovative data science solutions.

, ' ',

The use of machine learning and deep learning techniques will be key to creating innovation that is scalable, ethical and productive.

, ' ',

This role will be part of a larger picture responsible for helping transform Nasdaq into a business that truly innovates and competes on data and analytics.

, ' ',

To be considered for this key role your skills will include but not be limited to;

, ' ',
  • Extensive programming skills, preferably in different programming languages such as Python, R, Java, Ruby, Matlab, Pig or SQL.
  • Experience of Natural Language Processing; the interactions between computers and humans.
  • Machine learning: using computers to improve as well as develop algorithms.
  • Conceptual modelling: to be able to share and articulate modelling.
  • Statistical analysis: to understand and work around possible limitations in models.
  • Predictive modelling: most of the big data problems are towards being able to predict future outcomes.
  • Hypothesis testing: being able to develop hypothesis and test them with careful experiments.
, ' ',

Located in wonderful offices overlooking the Harbour Bridge and Opera House, Nasdaq offers an environment where you can truly make a difference. Yes, it is a challenging, dynamic international work environment which provides excellent career opportunities, a competitive salary, bonuses and a comprehensive benefits package.

, ' ',

Nasdaq is an equal opportunity employer. We positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of age, colour, disability, national origin, ancestry, race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, veteran status, genetic information or any other status protected by applicable law.

, ' ',

 

, ' ']

title: b'Junior Data Scientist (Modelling, Insights & Data Science)\r\n      '
jd:
["Our client is an Australian market leader in suppling Data Analytics and Insights based solutions to the countries leading consumer based based businesses. They boast the industry's largest and most comprehensive consumer 'Big Data' sets which are leveraged\r\n to deliver a range of Customer, Marketing and Credit Risk driven statistical models. Employing the industry's brightest analytical minds they offer a hot bed for innovation and guarantee unparalleled opportunities for career development and growth.",
, '\n',
, '\r\nFollowing the internal promotion of a valued team member a brand new position has been created for a Junior Analyst (Modelling, Insights & Data Science) to join the Sydney based team. With the key focus on leveraging strong SQL / SAS programming skills to manipulate\r\n data, uncover insights, and build statistical models the responsibilities of the role will include but not be limited to:\xa0',
, '\n',
  • Engaging with internal stakeholders to consult around analytical project requirements, discuss methodologies, and negotiate deliverables.
  • Providing support to variety exciting stakeholder driven projects that could include; marketing campaign execution & optimization, customer insights analysis, statistical modelling, credit analysis, credit risk / scorecard modelling, product & portfolio analysis, digital / web analytics, data visualization / dash boarding, sales reporting & insights.
  • Leveraging your strong SQL, SAS or R data management skills you will extract, manipulate and merge large volumes data from a variety of complex data sources. Delivering against ongoing requests from the business for timely and accurate SQL, SAS or R data sets to support their strategic initiatives.   
, '\r\nThe successful applicant will come with exposure to working in a data driven analytics environment, where analyzing and delivering insights from large data sets has been the key focus. You will be able to demonstrate:\xa0',
, '\n',
  • Strong technical skills and experience (1-2yrs) using SQL, SAS or R to extract, manipulate and merge large volumes of customer behavioral or transactional data from a variety of source systems (e.g. SQL Teradata, Oracle SQL, SQL Server, MYSQL, SAS Base or R) 
  • At least one year of experience working in a commercial environment with large volumes of data relating to; customer insights, marketing campaigns, customer reporting, risk reporting, risk analysis, statistical modelling, marketing mix modelling, credit analysis etc   
  • Strong attention to detail, work prioritization, and process improvement skills.
  • Educated to a minimum of degree level in a highly analytical discipline such as - Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, Actuarial Studies, Data Science, Computer Science etc. 
  • A genuine interest in pursuing a career in Data Analytics / Data Scientist, implementing analytical techniques and concepts such as; marketing campaign analytics, customer insights analysis, customer propensity modeling (churn / acquisition / cross sell / up sell), segmentation analysis (cluster / basket), credit risk analysis, credit scorecard development, price optimization, customer lifetime value analysis, next best offer analysis, significance testing, decision trees, neural networks etc
, "\r\nTo apply for this position please click on the 'Apply' button below or you're resume and cover note to ben@correlateresources.com\r\n "]

title: b'Data Scientist (Marketing Mix & Econometrics)\r\n      '
jd:
['My client is a leading global media agency with one of the Australian markets most sophisticated and forward thinking data analytics divisions. Leveraging a cutting edge technology platform consisting of Spark, Hive, R, Python, SQL and Tableau they apply\r\n a broad range of Statistical (Data Science) techniques to optimise and visualise their clients strategic decision making processes around Media and Marketing spend. Due to the pending departure of a senior member of the team unique opportunity for an experienced\r\n Media Data Scientist has become available.',
, '\r\n\xa0\xa0',
, '\r\nAs a Media Data Scientist (Marketing Mix & Econometric Modelling) the responsibilities of your role include but not be limited to;',
, '\n',
  • Leading client engagements through a series of sophisticated Media/Marketing optimisation projects. Scoping out and defining project requirements relating to media strategy and marketing ROI optimisation.
  • Provide thought leadership and coaching around advanced statistical modelling techniques to develop sophisticated solutions that will optimise the clients Media/Marketing strategy (i.e. econometric models, marketing mix models, predictive models, response rate models, attribution models etc).
  • Ensure time and quality assurance is achieved against all competencies in R, Python, SQL or SAS where used to create and manipulate large and complex datasets ready for analysis.
  • Lead the client engagements when presenting the key insights and strategic recommendations that will ensure future business opportunities are identified and secured. 
, '\r\nAs the successful applicant you will come with at least 3 years of relevant experience delivering complex statistical analysis and models in a commercial environment. With a passion for advanced analytics you will be able to demonstrate;',
, '\n',
  • Experience a range of building complex statistical models that may include Econometric Modelling, Marketing Mix Models (MMM), response rate models, attribution models, customer behaviour models, propensity models (acquisition & retention), customer scorecards, etc.
  • Strong programming skills in Python, R, SQL or SAS for creating and manipulating large and complex datasets.
  • Clear and confident communication skills with the ability to negotiate project deliverables and present data driven insights to a variety of stakeholder groups.
  • A strong academic qualification in a highly numerical discipline (i.e. Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering).
, '\r\nTo apply please click on the link below or send your resume direct to ben@correlateresources.com\r\n ']

title: b'Coastal Hazards Scientist/Engineer\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

NIWA is a dynamic research organisation whose purpose is to enhance the economic value and sustainable management of New Zealand's aquatic resources and environments, to provide understanding of climate and the atmosphere and increase resilience to weather and climate hazards.

, ' ',

We are seeking a scientist or research engineer to undertake research and consulting projects with a focus on coastal and estuarine hazards, sea-level rise, and coastal risk exposure to address the question of how to achieve adaptation to coastal climate change in the New Zealand context.

, ' ',

You will apply your analytical, modelling and data analysis skills to a broad range of coastal hazard and climate-change adaptation projects within NIWA and via external research collaborations. You will work closely with physical scientists, modellers, engineers, planners, social scientists and economists to translate science and climate change and sea-level rise projections into adaptive approaches to reduce future risks to coastal and estuarine communities and infrastructure. You also need to have the potential to develop and lead external collaborative research and consultancy projects.

, ' ',

You will have at least a PhD level qualification in coastal, ocean or earth sciences, physics or environmental/civil engineering, followed by several years' relevant applied or post-doc experience. Previous experience with hydrodynamic or climate-ocean modelling, sea-level gauge analysis, satellite altimetry, and familiarity with vulnerability and risk assessments and extremevalue analyses are preferable. Time-series and statistics data analysis skills, using Matlab, R or Python, along with an established science publication record, are essential.

, ' ',

Well-developed and proven writing skills for both scientific papers and applied consultancy reports along with clear verbal communication and presentation skills are also essential attributes.

, ' ',

Position description and online application can be found here: https://careers.sciencenewzealand.org/niwa/niwa-jobs

, ' ']

title: b'\r\n          Environmental Scientist \xe2\x80\x93 Contaminated Land\r\n        '
b'Data Scientist\r\n      '
jd:
[
, '\n',

Our Story

, '\n',

Hi. We're hipages. We're all about transforming the home improvement industry.

, '\n',

Founded in an Aussie garage 12 years ago by two great mates, we've continued to reinvent and refine what we do, becoming Australia's number 1 site to hire qualified, trusted and verified tradies.

, '\n',

We've developed innovative products using cutting edge technology, solving everyday problems that have plagued homeowners and tradespeople for years. This is a longstanding industry and we're excited to help reshape it!

, '\n',

Our talented, friendly and passionate team have many achievements to be proud of, including winning awards such as BRW's Best Places to Work, BRW's Fast 100, Deloitte's Tech Fast50, Australia's Most Innovative Company Awards and 2016 Smart50 Top Digital Innovator.

, '\n',

This is an exciting period of growth for us.  We are fast on our way to becoming a household name and are determined to make life easier for homeowners and tradies Australia wide. We need more great people to join the team and help us get there.

, '\n',

Does this sound like your kind of challenge?

, '\n',

Your Opportunity

, '\n',

As a Data Scientist you will be responsible for generating data driven insights and identify business opportunities for your cross-functional focus team! You will work closely with product managers, data scientists and the senior leadership team to plan, prioritise, and deliver immense value to the business.  

, '\n',

You will be influential in defining the direction of the hipages marketplace as we continue to evolve and apply your experience to find the best experience for our customers. But most importantly, you'll be joining a top-notch data science team!

, '\n',

Your key responsibilities will include -

, '\n',

  • Establishing and analysing the metrics that drive the business

  • Identifying, analysing and monitoring key metrics

  • Analysing complex data sets and uncovering business opportunities

  • Playing with massive, largely unmined, sets of data

  • Designing, implementing and launching experiments to test hypotheses

  • Extracting, preparing and querying large databases

  • Presenting insights to the product teams to inform product and design

  • Building the data science capability within hipages

, '\n',
  • Being a team player who is driven, respectful of others, passionate about what you do and determined to achieve results fast
, '\n',

What You Bring

, '\n',

In addition to a down-to-earth attitude, a desire to continually master your craft and a good sense of humour, you will also bring:-

, '\n',

  • SQL / NoSQL experience and programming in Python, R and/or Spark

  • Familiar with Linux terminal/command line and Git

  • Degree qualified in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics or a related qualification

  • A curious and inquisitive personality and passion for big data

  • Ability to communicate complex concepts and insights simply

  • Engineering or computer science background will be highly regarded 

  • Experience in mechanics of a two-sided marketing place

  • Accustomed to working in a fast paced environment 

  • Experience applying statistical / modelling techniques to real world data to drive insight

  • Familiar with the AWS stack such as AWS elastic search

  • Experience in machine learning covering NLP and recommendation engines
, '\n',

Who We Are

, '\n',

We are an eclectic, bright and curious bunch. We're tech-heads, thought-leaders and are driven to make a difference. Our success comes from focusing on innovation everyday (and via hackathons) and using our diverse and collective intelligence to solve problems quickly, creatively and effectively.

, '\n',

We're a medium sized start-up, meaning we have the financial backing to have leading edge systems and tools but small enough so that everyone is empowered to directly impact our product and customers. We work hard and move fast, free from bureaucracy and politics to 'make it happen' everyday.

, '\n',

We love celebrating - everything! Birthdays, babies, big wins, little wins and anything in between, and our company awards and events are legendary! Check out our Instagram #hipagesteam to get the picture.

, '\n',

Most importantly, all employees get to become owners of hipages (through our employee share program), which means we're united in our mission and everyone gets to have their say.  The energy and 'buzz' of our office is palpable and infectious.

, '\n',

Finally, hipages is proud of our 50/50 gender diversity (which is almost unheard of in our industry) and we appreciate and welcome all differences.

, '\n',

                          If this sounds like you, then welcome home.  

, '\n']

[DATA SCIENTIST CONTRACTOR – START-UP,
, ' ',
  • 6-month contract
  • Build a Big Data platform from scratch
  • Start-up work environment
  • Add value to a business
, ' ',
, ' My client, a start-up company of the Digital industry, is developing a new Big Data platform to understand better their business and add value to their customers. As such, you will be dealing with huge amounts of data. They are looking for someone able to manage complex situations and structure the data flow. Working with this company you will get the chance to work very autonomously and develop your skills.',
, ' ',
, ' If you are willing to take part to a challenging project, send me your CV asap.',
, ' ',
, ' ',
, ' ', Job Responsibilities – Data Scientist

,
, ' ',
  • Be in charge of the entire Big Data platform
  • Exposure with various stakeholders. You will have to understand their needs and provide them with tailored solutions
  • Bring your own vision of the business and deliver analyses and recommendations
, ' ',
, ' ',
, ' ',
, ' ', Requirements - Data Scientist,
, ' ',
, ' ',
, ' ',
  • Previous relevant experience in Data Science
  • Business acumen
  • Strong background in statistical modelling
  • Hadoop
, ' ',
, ' If you would like to hear more about this role, then don’t delay, get in touch with me today! Click on the APPLY button or call Jeremy Corbet on: 02 9238 42 01 ']

title: b'Data Scientist\r\n    '
jd:
['\n',

Are you a thinker who can ask the right questions? Are you curious and enjoy diving deep beneath the surface to find an answer to a yet unknown question?

, '\n',

, '\n',

Boral currently have an opportunity for a Data Scientist with the key focus of delivering mathematically rigorous analysis of sales and marketing data to provide insight and the basis for developing models to improve EBIT across all product lines, communication of findings to stakeholders and to educate the organisation in the benefits and practice of data science techniques.

, '\n',

, '\n',

The scope of the role will include support across a sales and marketing team of approximately 250 people and require collaboration in virtual and distributed teams driving outcomes across different geographies and time zones.

, '\n',

, '\n',

While keeping up-to-date with latest technology trends, objectives of the role include;

, '\n',
  • Research and develop statistical learning models for data analysis
  • Collaborate with product management and engineering departments to understand company needs and devise possible solutions
  • Implement new statistical or other mathematical methodologies as needed for specific models or analysis
  • Optimize joint development efforts through appropriate database use and project design
  • Create meaningful data visualizations that communicate your findings and relate them back to how your insights create business impact
, '\n',

, '\n',

To be considered, you will possess the below qualifications and attributes:

, '\n',
  • Master’s Degree in operations research, applied statistics, data mining, machine learning, physics or a related quantitative discipline (preferable)
  • Solid understanding and application of statistical and predictive modelling concepts, machine-learning approaches, clustering and classification techniques, and recommendation and optimization algorithms
  • Demonstrated analytical skills and commercial acumen
  • Knowledge of ETL, data processing, database programming and data analytics
  • Extensive background in data mining and statistical analysis
  • Experience with programming languages such as R and Python
  • Advanced skills with SQL and Tableau
  • Able to understand various data structures and common methods in data transformation
  • Excellent pattern recognition and predictive modelling skills
  • Collaborative and customer focused approach with advanced written and verbal communication
  • Demonstrated ability to train/coach
, '\n',

, '\n',

This position will be conveniently located next to North Ryde train station and based within a dynamic business campus. Boral is a great place to work, we value your abilities and reward results that drive business success, we share goals and celebrate individual and team success.

, '\n',

, '\n',

If you are interested in applying for this position, please click on the apply now button or visit http://careers.boral.com.au

, '\n']

title: b'Translational Data Scientist\r\n      '
jd:
[Brain and Mind Centre
, DVC Research Portfolio
, Reference no. 680/0417,
, '\n',
, '\n',
  • Be valued for your exceptional knowledge and experience in Data Science
  • Full time fixed term for 12 months with possibility of 12 month extension
  • Remuneration package: $106K p.a. which includes leave loading and up to 17% super
, '\n',  ,
, '\n',
, '\n', About the opportunity ,
, '\n',
, '\n', Reporting to the Brain and Mind Centre Academic Lead for Data Science, the Translational Data Scientist in brain and mind sciences (neuroscience and mental health) will help support research opportunities across all areas of basic, clinical and translational medicine and health.  The role will enhance and develop data science projects across Brain and Mind Centre; grow data science capacity to promote discovery; provide support with open-source and proprietary software for generating data visualisations and data understanding; and assist with data access and management.
,
, '\n',
, '\n', About you,
, '\n',
, '\n', The University values courage and creativity; openness and engagement; inclusion and diversity; and respect and integrity. As such, we see the importance in recruiting talent aligned to these values in the pursuit of research excellence. We are looking for a Translational Data Scientist who possesses demonstrated expertise in: ,
, '\n',
, '\n',
  • using complex data sets
  • modern data-centric programming languages including one of Python, R and developmental languages including one of C++ or Java
  • understanding of modern data software and tools, from cloud computing to the many existing commercial products used for data analytics
, '\n',
Further, this role relies on an aptitude for understanding and interpreting researchers’ needs, advising on and providing appropriate data science skills for the research objectives, and communicating and translating this back to the researchers, in an ongoing discussion, to progress and achieve successful outcomes.,
, '\n',
, '\n', The successful candidate will work closely with basic science, clinical research and academic staff working in brain and mind sciences both physically at Brain and Mind Centre and across The University and its affiliated teaching hospitals and research partners.  ,
, '\n',
, '\n',
, '\n', About us,
, '\n',
, '\n', Since our inception 160 years ago, the University of Sydney has led to improve the world around us. We believe in education for all and that effective leadership makes lives better. These same values are reflected in our approach to diversity and inclusion, and underpin our long-term strategy for growth. We’re Australias first university and have an outstanding global reputation for academic and research excellence. , Across 9 campuses, we employ over 7600 academic and non-academic staff who support over 47,000 students.

, We are undergoing significant transformative change which brings opportunity for innovation, progressive thinking, breaking with convention, challenging the status quo, and improving the world around us.


For more information on the position and University, please view the candidate information pack available from the job’s listing on the University of Sydney careers website.

All applications must be submitted via the University of Sydney careers website.  Visit sydney.edu.au/recruitment and search by the reference number to apply.

Closing date: 11.30pm 17 May 2017

The University of Sydney is committed to diversity and social inclusion. Applications from people of culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds; equity target groups including women, people with disabilities, people who identify as LGBTIQ; and people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander descent, are encouraged.

If we think your skills are needed in other areas of the University, we will be sure to contact you about other opportunities.

© The University of Sydney

The University reserves the right not to proceed with any appointment., '\n']
