title: b'Data Scientist\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

This an exciting opportunity for a talented Data Scientist to join a leading household name who are looking to enhance their analytical capabilities in the Digital space.

The successful candidate will have a proven track record and expert knowledge with Big Data analysis tools and infrastructure, exceptional statistical modelling capabilities and expert stakeholder management.

, ' ',

We are looking for someone who has firsthand experience in the Digital space especially in the creation of content recommendations based on large scale data analysis of customer behaviours.

, ' ',

If this sounds like you and you are looking for the chance to get a big name brand on your CV and want work for an organisation that is forward thinking then get in touch now!

, ' ',


The Role:

, ' ',
  • Analysis and modelling of large customer behaviour data sets using advanced analytical methods.
  • To form a key part in advising the senior leadership team about the analysis and use of data to drive decision making.
  • To analyse data generated from the Website and Applications. Perform A/B Testing.
  • Provide expert advice on cutting edge products available with the ability to transform various big data sets into valuable measureable information.
  • To be a subject matter expert across the entire organisation for Data.
  • Collaborate with other analytics professionals across the business to help define and drive analytical solutions that deliver definitive business value.
, ' ',

What we are looking for:

, ' ',
  • A Data Scientist specialised in the Digital space.
  • Experience working with AWS will be favourable.
  • Expert knowledge of languages such as R, PYTHON, HADOOP, SAS.
  • AB Testing experience
  • Google and Adobe Analytics experience will be favourable.
  • Ability to translate an analytic story into a non-technical narrative;
  • Experience using applied statistics or machine learning in intensive problem-solving environment with large and complex datasets;
  • Comprehensive knowledge of statistical learning methods;
  • Excellent communication skills;
, ' ',


If this sounds like a great opportunity for you then please click 'APPLY'. You can also call Adam on 0299931072 to find out more.

, ' ']

title: b'Data Scientist\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

Lorica Health provides advanced claims analytics solutions and services to the healthcare sector. Our specialist team of data scientists, domain experts, analysts and engineers develop industry specific solutions which target fraud, abuse and waste, while also making markets that improve the quality and safety of health care. Lorica software already analyses data from 30 of Australia's 33 private health insurers as well as a number of public sector agencies.

, '\n',

Lorica is a Best Practice Equal Opportunity Employer selecting candidates from a combination of soft and hard skills measured empirically wherever possible; be prepared to take state of the art online tests, interviews and questions.

, '\n',

Data Scientist

, '\n',

Description:
Lorica Health is seeking a data driven individual with a passion for applying statistics, machine learning, and analysis to unlock the insights available in datasets. You will be joining a growing team of data scientists working on some exciting healthcare analytics projects.

, '\n',

Responsibilities:

, '\n',

  • Explore large datasets, discover trends and patterns and extract insights

  • Apply Statistical/ Machine Learning techniques to build data product and features.

  • Develop scripts to extract and analyse large data sets and build statistical /machine learning models

  • Test and verify scripts and models to ensure accuracy of the results

  • Work with domain experts to validate and interpret findings

, '\n',

Required qualifications:

, '\n',

  • University Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Science or similar

  • Postgraduate qualifications in Statistics/Machine learning preferred

, '\n',

Required skills:

, '\n',

  • At least 5 years experience in a commercial advanced analytics environment

  • Solid skills in SQL for data extraction and manipulation

  • Hands-­‐on experience in R

  • High degree of skill in Natural Language Processing/text mining or network analysis

, '\n',

Role specific characteristics:

, '\n',

  • Previous experience in healthcare analytics will be highly regarded

  • Strong analytical skills coupled with great attention to detail

  • Inquisitive by nature

  • Passionate about data science

  • Ability to acquire in depth knowledge about healthcare data

  • Knowledge or experience with Health Insurance or Government Payments data

  • Ability to apply research skills and experience to solve real life problems in a fast paced commercial environment

  • Ability to work both independently and as part of a team

  • Must be an Australian citizen

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

Lorica Purpose:

, '\n',

To use data science to improve the quality of health care markets.

, '\n',

Lorica Vision:
To improve the fairness and efficiency of health care markets so they can in turn better improve the  health of the populations they serve.

, '\n',

Lorica Mission:

, '\n',

To be the foremost trusted intermediary providing health care data products and services that  demonstrably improve the performance of the Australian healthcare system.

, '\n',

Lorica Values:

, '\n',

Health, Respect, Integrity, Rigour, Improvement, Curiosity, Diversity, Courage

, '\n',

Lorica Personal Attributes:

, '\n',

Approachability, Collaboration, Enthusiasm, Expertise, Flexibility, Proactivity, Reliability

, '\n',

Working at Lorica:

, '\n',

Lorica respects family and flexible working requirements. We practices Agile throughout the company, promote continuous improvement and learning. Above all we want to make a difference and have fun.

, '\n',

We look forward to your application, please send your resume and cover letter to stephen.winnick@loricahealth.com

, '\n',

No recruitment agencies please.

, '\n']

title: b'Data Scientist - Customer Insights (Retail)\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

The team is a high performance data science and engineering unit that resides in a domestic, yet global organisation.

, ' ',

This function was set up in mid-2015 as an analytics centre of excellence, to only take on projects that are complex in nature (no reporting here), and that will ultimately add tangible value to the business. To date, they have successfully delivered a number of high profile projects, which have yielded high impact results and positive ROI.

, ' ',

They work across all areas of the organisation from marketing/customer, to fraud, pricing and supply chain, and they have just taken on a huge Retail Customer insights project – the first of its kind in the business. Due to this increasing workload and continuing success, they are now seeking a talented Data Scientist to grow the team. Ultimately – it's a great opportunity to develop your career alongside very talented scientists and engineers. 

, ' ',

Specific background is flexible, however those that have worked in Retail Customer analytics with a focus on consumer spending and basket (product) analysis will be highly regarded. Specifically supermarkets (FMCG).

, ' ',

You'll need to demonstrate high competency tackling problems using statistical modelling techniques, with machine learning experience being highly advantageous.

, ' ',

If you're interested in hearing more please contact me with your resume at jeremy.taylor@tomexecutive.com for a confidential discussion.

, ' ']

['\n',

The Organisation

, '\n',

One of the largest FMCG giants globaly, this company operates in six countries, and employs over 10,000 people across the Group and has access to over 200 million consumers world wide. They have an exciting project coming up and are looking for a strong R developer to hit the ground running.

, '\n',

The Opportunity

, '\n',
  •  Assist in identifying meaningful insights from large data and metadata sources and interpret and communicate insights and findings from analysis and experiments.
  • Quantitative research of large, complex data sets.
  • Identifying the required data from the data warehouse/data lake.
  • Extracting, loading and transforming the data for machine learning projects
  • Data Wrangling and enriching data
  • Feature generation and feature selection
  • Develop knowledge of current and emerging technologies to create machine intelligence models.
, '\n']

title: b'Principal Data Scientist\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

Our Client

, ' ',

Our client is a leading global data analytics agency that helps marketers improve customer journeys through the implementation of smart data-driven marketing strategies. Their team of marketing data specialists offer a wide range of skills suitable for any challenge and cover everything from web analytics to data engineering, data science and software development delivered through some of the most cutting-edge technology.

, ' ',

Due to growth, our client is looking to add a Principal Data Scientist to their team. This multi-faceted position encompasses team leadership, management and mentoring, working closely with C-level executives while providing detailed data-driven insights/Analytics across the company’s core competencies.

, ' ',

The Role

, ' ',
  • Lead a data team and construct their data management, attribution and visualisation strategies to maximise efficiency and accuracy.
  • Provid deep analysis on campaign performance across a wide variety of global brands.
  • Managing data science projects from start to finish
  • Derive insights from data and communicate those insights to a non-technical audience through presentations and documentation
, ' ',

Qualifications and experience required

, ' ',
  • Have passion for big data, technology and digital marketing
  • At least 5 years of experience in a commercial advanced analytics and insights environment
  • Data mining and modelling experience
  • Demonstrated experience in requirement gathering, functional scoping and documentation
  • Experience of SAS/R and/or Python is highly favourable
  • Work effectively as part of a team to deliver client outcomes
  • Ability to work independently and manage multiple work tasks
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Machine Learning capability
, ' ',

If you believe you have the required skills and experience and are interested in the position then please submit your CV for review

, ' ']

[' ',
  • Full-time, permanent position
  • Sydney, CBD
  • Unique opportunity in a specialist field
, ' ',

About the role

, ' ',

Copyright Agency is looking for a passionate and highly motivated Data Analyst or Data Scientist to help us support the Australian creative community by proactively undertaking analysis, and by developing and maintaining data-driven tools and workflows. In this role you will:

, ' ',
  • Consult with internal stakeholders to identify and deliver business-relevant information and analysis
  • Work on complex productionised data-pipelines in which statistical/machine-learning algorithms are integral
  • Identify, scope, plan and execute projects grounded in data that will help Copyright Agency support creators
  • Enhance and add to the existing ecosystem of bespoke R packages that underpin the analytics within Copyright Agency.
, ' ',

About you

, ' ',

You will hold tertiary qualifications in a relevant discipline (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or Econometrics) and have at least 2 years' professional experience in an analytical role. You will have excellent communication skills that allow you to liaise, explain and document complex technical processes and solutions to a variety of stakeholders with different levels of technical understanding.You will be a proactive individual keen to learn the business, optimise processes, solves problems and identify new business areas for our Australian creators. Your experience in R, SQL and Excel, sufficient experience allows you to:

, ' ',
  • Create, document and maintain bespoke R packages
  • Build interactive web applications in R Shiny
  • Manipulate structured and unstructured data from various sources
  • Create and evaluate statistical and machine learning models
  • Integrate R tools with other systems (e.g. SQL databases)
  • Generate clear and accurate reports in Excel for internal customers.
, ' ',

About Us

, ' ',

Copyright Agency l Viscopy collects and distributes fees for the use of copyright text and images. Copyright Agency is the declared society for the statutory schemes in education and government as well as the Resale Royalty Scheme for visual artists. Copyright Agency also licenses commercial organisations to copy and share information without risk of copyright infringement. Copyright Agency also manages the licensing activities of Viscopy Limited under a services agreement. Copyright Agency provides philanthropic support to Australia's cultural community through our grants program, the Cultural Fund. For more information visit www.copyright.com.au | www.viscopy.net.au

, ' ',

How to apply

, ' ',

Please forward your resume and a covering letter to recruitment@copyright.com.au

, ' ',

Copyright Agency | Viscopy encourages applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.

, ' ',

Applications close 28 April 2017.

, ' ',

Applications will be treated with the strictest of confidence. Only successful applicants will be contacted. To be eligible to apply you must have an appropriate Australian or New Zealand work visa.

, ' ']

title: b'Data Scientist\r\n    '
jd:
[' ',

, ' ',

About the business and the role

, ' ',

My client's cutting edge technology has begun to change the way the workplace will look at Data Analytics. A combination of Machine Learning, AI, Data Analytics, Visualisation and market-leading software has already wowed the Data Science community in Australia.

, ' ',

Lead the revolution!

, ' ',

apply through the link or contact me on 0430 327 094 for further details!

title: b'Junior - Mid Level Software Engineer\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

Lorica Health provides advanced claims analytics solutions and services to the healthcare sector. Our specialist team of data scientists, domain experts, analysts and engineers develop industry specific solutions which target fraud, abuse and waste, while also making markets that improve the quality and safety of health care. Lorica software already analyses data from 30 of Australia's 33 private health insurers as well as a number of public sector agencies.

, '\n',

Lorica is a Best Practice Equal Opportunity Employer selecting candidates from a combination of soft and hard skills measured empirically wherever possible; be prepared to take state of the art online tests, interviews and questions.

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

Junior - Mid Level Software Engineer

, '\n',

Responsibilities:

, '\n',

  • Design, code and automatically test applications in PHP and Java

  • Write scripts to build, test & deploy to AWS

  • Be a proactive and collaborative SCRUM team developer

  • Assist with verification when required

  • Assist with company growth activities as required (e.g. recruitment)

  • Share knowledge with others in a learning environment

, '\n',


Required qualifications:

, '\n',

  • University degree in Software Engineering or equivalent

, '\n',


Required skills/experience:

, '\n',

  • 1-5 years experience

  • Solid skills on core Java (Preferably on Java 8)

  • RESTful web service development (Spring Boot or PlayFramework)

  • Relational database, PL/SQL, ideally on PostgreSQL

  • PHP (Laravel 5.3, SQL and Javascript)

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

Desired skills/experience:

, '\n',

  • Agile

  • SCRUM

  • Healthcare

  • Data processing using Spark

  • AWS

  • Docker

  • Jira & Confluence

  • Bamboo

, '\n',


Role specific characteristics:

, '\n',

  • Inquisitive by nature

  • Ability to work both independently and as part of a team

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

Lorica Purpose:

, '\n',

To use data science to improve the quality of health care markets.

, '\n',

Lorica Vision:
To improve the fairness and efficiency of health care markets so they can in turn better improve the  health of the populations they serve.

, '\n',

Lorica Mission:

, '\n',

To be the foremost trusted intermediary providing health care data products and services that  demonstrably improve the performance of the Australian healthcare system.

, '\n',

Lorica Values:

, '\n',

Health,Respect,Integrity,Rigour,Improvement,Curiosity,Diversity,Courage

, '\n',

Lorica Personal Attributes:

, '\n',

Approachability,Collaboration,Enthusiasm,Expertise,Flexibility,Proactivity,Reliability

, '\n',

Working at Lorica:

, '\n',

Lorica respects family and  flexible working requirements. We practice Agile throughout the company,  promote continuous improvement and learning. Above all we want to make a difference and have fun.

, '\n',

We look forward to your application, please apply here or send your resume and cover letter to  stephen.winnick@loricahealth.com

, '\n',

No recruitment agencies please.

, '\n']

title: b'Candidate Manager | IT Recruitment | Flexible Hours | $140K package\r\n    '
salary: b'Excellent Salary Package plus Bonus: $140K package'
jd:
['We are currently seeking an experienced Candidate Relationship Manager for a role based in Sydney CBD. We are a fast growing & dynamic technology recruitment organisation with a growing brand in the marketplace. Further expansion sees the need for a Candidate\r\n Manager to join our team in a key role working across permanent and contract IT recruitment. The role would suit a someone who has strong experience in recruiting across all aspects of the Technology Industry.\xa0',
, '\n',
, This is an autonomous role and requires a motivated, tenacious and driven individual who can work with the minimum of supervision. We are offering a flexible work environment , that offers a genuine work-life balance opportunity.
,
What are we looking for?,
, '\n',
  • You will have at least 2-3 years experience in recruitment across the Technology recruitment industry. We are looking for a Candidate Manager with experience across the mid to senior levels IT sectors, to include; Developers, Project Managers, Solutions Architects, Consultants and Sales & Senior Management.
  • This is a busy and varied role which will include writing and placing ads on the on-line job boards, screening CVs and candidates, interviewing, liaising with candidates and clients, searching the database, report writing, reference checking.
  • An Interest in Data Analytics, Data Science is preferred as the role will involve recruiting Data Engineers, Data Scientist, Insights Manager, Data Analysts, however, this is not essential but you will have the desire to dive into the Data recruitment world.
  • You will be tasked in providing Candidate Management support from within and outside our database and proactively using Linkedin Recruiter tools for research and headhunting purposes.  Success in these areas will be offering critical support to the Recruitment Directors.
  • You will have an excellent knowledge of networking and recruiting across Linkedin. Preferably you will have working knowledge of Linkedin Recruiter and across its recruiting tools (however full training will be provided). 
  • You will have excellent candidate relationship skills and work ethic and strong interpersonal skills. This is a busy fast-paced environment and would appeal to someone who enjoys working within a flat management structure and taking responsibility for their day to day work.
, '\n',
If you have made a positive commitment to further your career and you possess the above attributes then please apply to this role. If you require further information, please contact please contact our 
Recruitment Director, Gino Lancaster 0401 735 235
,  , '\n']

title: b'Technical Business Consultant - Analytics/Big Data\r\n    '
jd:
['Also have a major input into\xa0', Product,  Development , 'as well as complementing the sales team.We are looking for someone\xa0who wants to be a part of our team, and work with us to further bolster\xa0the way in which we bridge the gap between business problems and the\xa0technology we can deliver to solve them.',
, ' \xa0\xa0',
, " As a Technical Business Consultant, you will serve as the primary technical contact between customers and their organisation. In this capacity you will be acting as the technology advisor to the business and IT as well as your customer's senior management and executive teams. You will be the client's technology champion and provide domain thought leadership and lead best practice discussions in the context of solutions and capabilities. You will have responsibility for driving successful business outcomes as well as the development of joint technology roadmaps and the support of business process change to support the continuous adoption of technologies and solutions by their customer.",
, ' \xa0\xa0',
, ' ', Desired Skills and Experience,
, ' Being successful in this role will require you to demonstrate your ability and experience in the following key areas:',
, ' ',
, ' ', Thought Leadership:,
, ' ',
  • Leadership in the development of large complex software solutions that are consumable by the client
  • Leadership in driving knowledge programs and thought leadership into a larger organisation, which should include best practice and methodologies programs
  • Leading technology and solution programs while managing key milestone activities and driving expected outcomes
  • Leading at the forefront of new capabilities or technologies while effectively disseminating that knowledge into both the customer as well as internal product teams
, ' ', Presales:,
, ' ',
  • Building and leveraging highly effective business relationships
  • Lead interactive customer discussions to develop complex solutions, based on vendor specific products and solutions
  • Developing and delivering compelling presentations & lead and manage high impact workshops
  • Effectively positioning of complex technologies, solutions and methodologies
  • Building and executing complex account and sales strategies
  • Leading successful continuity from the sales cycle into the delivery cycle
  • Aligning technology capabilities and conceptualise client needs into solution roadmaps and implementation strategies
, ' ',  Technical & Domain Focus:, ' ',
    • Background in advanced analyitcs and a high level understanding of a range of analytical techniques
    • 3-5 years of professional consulting experience in either analytics, marketing analytics, actuarial or pricing
    • Very strong written communication skills
    • Excellent verbal communicator, proven experience in managing senior executive stakeholders
    • Strategic thinker, able to see an opportunity within the client's business and bridge this gap with the available capabilities
, ' \xa0This is a role that does not come up that often, for a confidential chat call Pete on \xa002 8396 6800 or apply now! ']

title: b'\r\n          Assistant Accountant/Inventory\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',
  • Broad role, variety of duties
  • You love working with Excel
  • You would relish the opportunity to learn SQL and other data manipulation techniques
  • You have an interest in the procurement role of a business, including reviewing product mix and supplier deal reviews
  • You like the idea of working in a small finance team where you can make a difference
  • You like the idea of working local (keeps more cars off the M5)
, '\n',

DPO is a growing plasterboard distribution business. We supply major developers and builders with their internal lining needs from our multiple warehouses in 7 locations supported by our truck fleet. But as the business has grown, so has our product offering. To make sure we have the right information about our products, in the system, at the right price and with the right reports for our front line managers, we need a systems/inventory accountant.

, '\n',

This role will have a focus on inventory and product management, including improving the systems to update maintain and report on our product range. With recently refurbished showrooms, we need the data to make sure we are ranging the right products.

, '\n',

Based in Campbelltown NSW, you role will be the 'data scientist' of our business. If we want information out of our system, then you will become the go to person. In between all that you will assist with everyday finance matters. Your main responsibilities include:

, '\n',
  • Managing our inventory file of 15,000 products. This means you get to make decisions on category management, pricing models, buying decisions and more
  • Supporting DPO stores with transactional advice (we have 7 stores who rely on the finance team to assist them)
  • Assistance with journals entries
  • Assistance with end of month reporting
  • Contributing to monthly and annual reporting
  • Supporting the Finance team. There are 5 in the team and we cross-train so that we all get a broad understanding of the finance needs of the business.
, '\n',

The successful candidate will have the following attributes:

, '\n',
  • Previous experience in an Accounts Assistant or Systems Accountant role
  • Sound understanding of financial accounting processes and procedures
  • Comfortable with computers. You love working with CSV files, importing files and manipulating Excel files
  • Excellent attention to detail and sound written and verbal communication skills
  • A team focused, and proactive approach to work
, '\n',

If you have experience in finance, an interest in retail/wholesale and a passion for computers/databases/Excel then apply now. We don't expect you to know everything, but be prepared to come ready to learn.

, '\n',

To apply please submit a cover letter and resume.

, '\n',

Salary on offer $53k.

, '\n',

**Please note that only successfully short listed applicants will be contacted**

, '\n']

title: b'Marketing Analyst\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

About Deputy

, '\n',

As one of the fastest growing tech companies in Australia, we are passionate about what we do. Our software solution sees thousands of businesses scheduling their employees on a daily basis underpinned by smart, rich data and the aim of making lives easier. Employees clock in and out for work through beautiful intuitive apps for smart phone and iPad.

, '\n',

Deputy is a cloud-based work scheduling and people management platform with social mobile technologies at its core. We're continuously improving functionality and broadening our user base. Since we launched 2008, it's been quite a journey as we strive for world domination. That's where you come into the picture.

, '\n',

About The Job

, '\n',

We're looking for a creative data ninja to help us understand more about our customers: those we have and those we want. This is a great role for someone who loves finding patterns, turning data in to insight, and wants to see their work make a real contribution to our growth.

, '\n',

The Marketing Analyst role has two main focuses:

, '\n',
  1. Understand our customers: add insight and provide guidance on the effectiveness of our marketing efforts, identify new market niches, and aid in developing data-driven customer profiles.
  2. Understand our world: help us deliver great, data-rich content pieces. Deputy has millions of data points on how shift-work business run and we need your help in turning those in to insights that can help our client business run and grow effectively.
, '\n',

This role will play a pivotal role in our global marketing strategy and execution, and you'll have the opportunity to work with stakeholders from all over our business. Ultimately you'll be responsible for keeping our marketing honest, on track and knowing the best way forward. Specifically, the role will:

, '\n',
  • Work with our marketing team to uncover insights / trends in user behaviour and optimise signup rate across all web and app platforms.
  • Use our native analytics and BI platform to measure the effectiveness of CRO initiatives across all web and app platforms
  • Map marketing funnels for all channels including CAC:LTV metrics
  • Work with our in-house data scientist to build out and maintain our native BI platform
  • Perform data analysis to support our content strategy, creating insightful reports around product usage (e.g. most on time cities / employee retention etc)
, '\n',

About You

, '\n',
  • 3 years experience with data analysis.
  • Demonstrable mastery of SQL a must, R a bonus
  • Experience with data viz platforms like Chartio, Tableau, or similar.
  • Very strong investigative and problem solving skills. Ability to marry together different data sets and make reasonable assumptions to get to a conclusion.
  • Strong communicator who can turn data in to actionable insight
, '\n',

Benefits

, '\n',
  • A collaborative, supportive environment that gives you autonomy to explore new ideas, grow your skill set and create outstanding work
  • The chance to make a genuine impact on the company's strategy and growth
  • Plenty of challenging work and the opportunity to stretch yourself
, '\n',

Interested? Apply via the link: 
https://deputy.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=46

, '\n']

title: b'Translational Data Scientist\r\n      '
jd:
[Brain and Mind Centre
, DVC Research Portfolio
, Reference no. 680/0417,
, '\n',
, '\n',
  • Be valued for your exceptional knowledge and experience in Data Science
  • Full time fixed term for 12 months with possibility of 12 month extension
  • Remuneration package: $106K p.a. which includes leave loading and up to 17% super
, '\n',  ,
, '\n',
, '\n', About the opportunity ,
, '\n',
, '\n', Reporting to the Brain and Mind Centre Academic Lead for Data Science, the Translational Data Scientist in brain and mind sciences (neuroscience and mental health) will help support research opportunities across all areas of basic, clinical and translational medicine and health.  The role will enhance and develop data science projects across Brain and Mind Centre; grow data science capacity to promote discovery; provide support with open-source and proprietary software for generating data visualisations and data understanding; and assist with data access and management.
,
, '\n',
, '\n', About you,
, '\n',
, '\n', The University values courage and creativity; openness and engagement; inclusion and diversity; and respect and integrity. As such, we see the importance in recruiting talent aligned to these values in the pursuit of research excellence. We are looking for a Translational Data Scientist who possesses demonstrated expertise in: ,
, '\n',
, '\n',
  • using complex data sets
  • modern data-centric programming languages including one of Python, R and developmental languages including one of C++ or Java
  • understanding of modern data software and tools, from cloud computing to the many existing commercial products used for data analytics
, '\n',
Further, this role relies on an aptitude for understanding and interpreting researchers’ needs, advising on and providing appropriate data science skills for the research objectives, and communicating and translating this back to the researchers, in an ongoing discussion, to progress and achieve successful outcomes.,
, '\n',
, '\n', The successful candidate will work closely with basic science, clinical research and academic staff working in brain and mind sciences both physically at Brain and Mind Centre and across The University and its affiliated teaching hospitals and research partners.  ,
, '\n',
, '\n',
, '\n', About us,
, '\n',
, '\n', Since our inception 160 years ago, the University of Sydney has led to improve the world around us. We believe in education for all and that effective leadership makes lives better. These same values are reflected in our approach to diversity and inclusion, and underpin our long-term strategy for growth. We’re Australias first university and have an outstanding global reputation for academic and research excellence. , Across 9 campuses, we employ over 7600 academic and non-academic staff who support over 47,000 students.

, We are undergoing significant transformative change which brings opportunity for innovation, progressive thinking, breaking with convention, challenging the status quo, and improving the world around us.


For more information on the position and University, please view the candidate information pack available from the job’s listing on the University of Sydney careers website.

All applications must be submitted via the University of Sydney careers website.  Visit sydney.edu.au/recruitment and search by the reference number to apply.

Closing date: 11.30pm 17 May 2017

The University of Sydney is committed to diversity and social inclusion. Applications from people of culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds; equity target groups including women, people with disabilities, people who identify as LGBTIQ; and people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander descent, are encouraged.

If we think your skills are needed in other areas of the University, we will be sure to contact you about other opportunities.

© The University of Sydney

The University reserves the right not to proceed with any appointment., '\n']

title: b'Hadoop Big Data Platform Consultant / Engineer\r\n      '
salary: b'Above market rates are assured huge bonus & shares'
jd:
['Datasource Services has extensive, international experience placing skilled candidates within Business Intelligence, Data Warehouse and Data Science. Our network spans across Australia and New Zealand with a wide range of clients ranging from tier ones to start-ups. People and Data are at the heart of everything we do! Join the Datasource community today at\xa0www.datasourceservices.com.au\xa0',
, ' \xa0',
, ' We have a brand new requirement on the books to join a global Big Data and Data Science Consultancy who are working on some of the most cutting edge projects in Australia and across the globe. This role is for a high level Technical Engineer who has notable experience working on enterprise Hadoop / Big Data Platforms as an Engineer.\xa0',
, ' \xa0',
, ' ', The role: ,
, ' ',
  • Deliver a wide range of complex data engineering requirements as per customer requirements. Enterprise client list.
  • Engage with customers across a range of different industries to understand requirements and deliver technical solutions.
  • Development of POC and mock up data solutions for customers, assisting pre-sales teams with presentations.
  • Analysis of customer data, building effective data pipelines using Spark, HIVE, Kafka etc.
  • Build and support Hadoop data sets for a team of highly skilled Data Scientists.
  • Set up and implement Hadoop HDFS platforms for a range of customers, reviewing areas such as security, operating systems, integration with existing architecture etc.
  • Complex data streaming and data processing in Apache Spark & Kaftka.
  • Process improvement across the current software engineering methodologies.
  • Set up, run, install, implement and support enterprise side Hadoop clusters (200-300 nodes).
  • Maintain effective communication and documentation.
  • Work in an Agile development environment.
, ' ',
, ' ', Required skills and experience:,
, ' \xa0',
, ' ',
  • Outstanding programming skills across a range of languages such as Java (essential) and Scala, R, Pig, Python. Go etc.
  • Commercial experience of unstructured data sets and HDFS platforms, Hadoop, HBase, Cassandra etc.
  • Strong implementation skills, with the ability to understand complex installation issues such as Security, Cloud Install, CPU usage, Operating systems etc.
  • Any experience with Apache Spark or Kafka is highly regarded.
  • Excellent problem solving skills, structured and analytical approach.
  • Experience with visualizing large data sets is highly desirable.
  • Customer facing role, so experience in Consulting is highly beneficial but not essential.
  • Ability to guide and mentor customers through enterprise Hadoop implementations.
  • Outstanding communication skills are required.
, " This role requires a unique blend of high level communication and deep, broad technical knowledge. A true understanding for Data Warehouse, MPP and HDFS Architecture is required, alongside an appreciation for Infrastructure, Security and Cloud solutions. You will be rewarded with an award winning, culture, global thought leadership and exposure to Australia's largest Big Data programs. ", APPLY NOW!
,
, ' ', Please note:, '\xa0Due to the nature if this role, we can only accept applications from Australian Permanent Residents or Citizens, currently residing in Australia. ']

title: b'Big Data Engineer (Scala and Spark)\r\n    '
jd:
[' ',

Quantium Big Data Engineer

, ' ',

Since 2008, our data teams have wrung every bit of information they can from our clients' data in order to give them the insight they need to make a real difference to their business.

, ' ',

Times and technology have changed, but this remains our goal. Instead of wrangling single, SQL-based databases, our MapR Hadoop platform runs across 200 nodes with multiple clusters using the latest big data technology.

, ' ',

Our industry-leading partners' real-world data sets are growing along with their complexity so we need to bring more developers and engineers into our team. We're hoping that's you.

, ' ',

Working with Scala, Spark and the rest of the Hadoop ecosystem, you'll be building applications to work with unique data sets (some of the largest and most complex in Australia) to make a real difference to our clients.

, ' ',

FAQ:

, ' ',

Is your Scala fully FP?

, ' ',

Not always. We focus on building highly maintainable code so there's often a decision to make on what the best way to go is. We're not purists, but we love to use FP where it's the best solution

, ' ',

How do your teams work?

, ' ',

We work in multi-discipline teams so you'll be working alongside Data Scientists, Analysts, Testers and Devops

, ' ',

What are you looking for in the ideal candidate?

, ' ',

We're looking for Big Data technologists:

, ' ',

You've been working with Scala and love to play with it, you know your way around the Hadoop eco-system with Spark at the top of your go to frameworks

, ' ',

You're a pragmatist, a true engineer and love to solve complex issues

, ' ',

You can also have a conversation about Scalaz without alienating anyone!

, ' ',

Do you have a bullet point checklist for me to check off my suitability?

, ' ',

We know people are not bullet points but sure thing!

, ' ',

You have:

, ' ',
  • Experience developing applications using Apache Spark or similar Hadoop-based big data technologies
  • Experience building Scala applications, preferably in distributed contexts (if you have a real love of Scala and are itching to move from Java, we'll also consider it)
  • A solid foundation in functional and object-oriented programming with data structures
  • A passion for solving problems and writing efficient algorithms
  • An awareness of considerations around structuring data on distributed systems to support analytic use cases
  • A passion for delivering high-quality, peer-reviewed, well-tested code
  • A love for knowledge sharing, you know what works, but you're also happy to learn new methods and technology
, ' ',

Ok, that's great, but what's in it for me?

, ' ',

Quantium takes care of its biggest asset – our people. We believe there is more to a successful career than just hard work. To this end we provide a range of personal and professional benefits across six broad categories:

, ' ',

Career                  
Our exceptional growth means new and exciting career opportunities at Quantium. New clients, new projects or new roles – our growth plans power bigger and better career possibilities for our people.

, ' ',

Workplace
We work hard but we don't take ourselves too seriously – ask anyone who has been on one of our annual trips away! Our people have cited 'Fun place to work' as one of the top 5 attributes of working at Quantium. Our world-class offices are fitted out with office games and stocked with food and drink all year round.

, ' ',

Financial
We want our people to feel and act like owners of our business. Quantium's Employee Share Scheme applies to all permanent team members who want a greater share of our growth. We also offer a market leading range of financial and insurance benefits and entitlements.

, ' ',

Health and wellbeing
Healthy body, healthy mind. Quantium believes in promoting ways for you to maintain and improve your health and personal wellbeing. Our team enjoys a range of activities, including group fitness sessions, health advice and various team sports.

, ' ',

Lifestyle
We recognise the need to balance personal and family commitments with your work. At Quantium you have more control over how, when and where you work. We also recognise the importance of holidays and time to recharge so we always do our best to accommodate leave requests.

, ' ',

Family
Quantium understands that family is important. We support the needs and career aspirations of our colleagues with families. From the arrival of a newborn to your child's Christmas concert, we ensure you have the support to spend the time you need with your family.

, ' ']

title: b'Senior Customer Insights Analyst\r\n      '
jd:
['Our client is a high profile and instantly recognisable travel and tourism brand, who are relishing a sustained period of innovation in their approach to customer marketing through data driven insight and analytics. As the result of the departure of a\r\n valued member of the team they are looking for an experienced Customer Marketing Insights Analyst\xa0to join the business with the key focus on innovation and execution. \xa0',
, '\r\n\xa0\xa0',
, '\r\nWorking as a Senior Customer Marketing Insights Analyst the core responsibilities of this role will cover but not be limited to:\xa0',
, '\n',
  • Managing key relationships with with marketing stakeholders, consulting around customer marketing strategy, analytical project requirements, and the associated timelines and deliverables.
  • Deliver a range of bespoke analytical projects, leveraging techniques that may include but not be limited to; marketing campaign analytics, customer insights analysis, customer propensity modeling (churn / acquisition / cross sell / up sell), segmentation analysis (cluster / basket), customer lifetime value analysis, next best offer analysis, data visualisation, project story boarding.  
  • Ensure the ongoing support. delivery and operational fulfilment of all data initiatives.
, '\r\nThe successful applicant will come from a strong background working in a data analytics environment, where analysing and delivering key insights from large data sets has been the focus. You will be able to demonstrate',
, '\n',
  • Strong stakeholder engagement and relationship management skills with the ability to present compelling data driven stories (story boards) and gain buy-in on new concepts and roadmaps.
  • At least four years of commercial experience experience working in a commercial environment with large volumes of data relating to; customer insights, marketing campaigns, customer reporting, statistical modelling, marketing mix modelling etc.   
  • Strong technical skills and experience using SQL, SAS, R or Python to extract, manipulate and merge large volumes of customer behavioral or transactional data from a variety of source systems (e.g. SQL Teradata, Oracle SQL, SQL Server, MYSQL, SAS Base or R) 
  • Strong attention to detail, prioritization, & process improvement skills.
  • A genuine passion for building on your career in Data Analytics / Data Scientist, implementing analytical techniques and concepts such as; marketing campaign analytics, customer insights analysis, customer propensity modeling (churn / acquisition / cross sell / up sell), segmentation analysis (cluster / basket), credit risk analysis, credit scorecard development, price optimization, customer lifetime value analysis, next best offer analysis, significance testing, decision trees, neural networks etc
, "\r\nTo apply for this position please click on the 'Apply' button below or you're resume and cover note to ben@correlateresources.com\r\n "]

title: b'\r\n          Unix / Linux Platform Engineer - DevOps\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',


 

, '\n',
, '\n',

  • Located in Chatswood
  • 6 month contract with expected long extension
  • Obtain a federal government security clearance
, '\n',
, '\n',

Our client, a small, niche focused, federal government orgranisationm, is seeking a Unix / Linux System Administrator specialist to perform in the role of Platform Engineer within a DevOps project team.

, '\n',
, '\n',

As the Unix / Linux Platform Engineer you will help to build a modern DevOps practice including a container based approach toapplication development and continuous delivery.

The Unix / Linux Platform Engineer will be working in an agile cross functional team including delivery manager, engineers, data scientists, architects and platform engineers.

The Unix / Linux Platform Engineer will assist to build a high velocity application development platform and working with delivery teams to deploy and support proprietary applications.

, '\n',
, '\n',

To be suitable for consideration as the Unix / Linux Platform Engineer you will require:

, '\n',
, '\n',

  • Australian citizenship (in order to be eligible to obtain a federal government NV1 seurituy clearance)
  • Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or IT equivalent
  • Strong UNIX systems administration experience, particularly for Redhat and Centos distributions
  • Excellent automation scripting skills
  • Production Docker experience, preferably including Dockersh, Kitematic and Rancher
  • Proficient in one or more of following configuration management tools ; Ansible , Puppet, Chef or Saltstack
  • Broad experience with maintaining development infrastructure including source and resource repositories such as SVN, Nexus or Stash
  • Experience delivering devops and continuous delivery outcomes using continuous delivery/deployment (CD) tools such as GoCD, Jenkins or Bamboo
  • Exposure to cloud platforms such as AWS
, '\n',
, '\n',

 

, '\n',
, '\n',

To be considered for this long contract as the Platform Engineer pleas send your resume to Ben Ashman by clicking the Apply to this Job button.

, '\n']

title: b'Consulting - Analytics - Senior Con/Manager\r\n      '
jd:
[
, '\n',

About the Role
You’ve all heard the facts…more data has been created in the past few years than has existed throughout history. In five years there will be over 50 billion smart connected devices in the world, all developed to collect, analyse and share data. Research suggests that less than 1% of the data created is analysed and used.

Imagine the world of possibilities.

Across industries and both large and small clients, the appetite for analytical insight is growing. Our clients are increasingly looking to make sense of their data and for analytics to underpin their business decision making and deliver a tangible impact.

To meet this demand Deloitte’s Analytics practice is seeking talented people with demonstrable experience from strategy to execution in the Analytics domains.

We are looking for people who love data and want to solve problems with insight. Whether you call yourself a data scientist, analytics whiz or builder of predictive models. We want to hear from you if you are genuinely passionate about this area and have some applied experience.

This is an opportunity to harness emerging technologies and analytical methodologies to help our clients on their objectives. You will be part of a collaborative team that provides our clients with solutions that are practical as well as visionary and have an impact from the back office to the boardroom.

About You
You’ll bring experience in one or more of the following competencies and enabling technologies:

, '\n',
  • Strong programming background - scripting is essential as is prior experience developing an application using various software with dedicated modules/libraries/distinct sections in order to represent complex systems programmatically
  • Expert in a range of scripting languages - (e.g. Python, R etc.) and SQL is mandatory
  • Solid grounding in the fundamentals of APIs, data management and storage (e.g. DBA skills), basics of cloud computing, batch scripting and mathematical programming
  • A strong background in applying mathematical and analytics approaches and methodologies to identifying complex relationships in data
  • Ability to communicate technical requirements and outputs in a clear and concise manner
  • A structured, logical and solution-oriented design mindset
  • Ability to work autonomously and with minimal oversight
  • Ability to demonstrate initiative and ownership in the completion of tasks
  • Experience working in teams over extended project delivery periods (e.g. 2 - 6 months)
  • A demonstrable interest and passion for exploring new data/analytics concepts, applications and innovations (e.g. Cognitive, AI, RPA, IoT etc.)
, '\n',

About Us
We pride ourselves on our team of diverse, high performing professionals who are driven yet highly inclusive and social - our people are at the heart of our success. Our aim is to ensure that all our people feel comfortable to bring their whole selves to work, and as a result, create a workplace that encourages the true spirit of 'And different'.

Next Steps
If you have questions regarding this role, the Talent Acquisition Team is available to have a confidential discussion. Please contact Emily McBain via the Our Recruiters section on our careers website.

, '\n']

title: b'Platform Engineer\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

About Compas:

, ' ',

Compas Pty Ltd is a Canberra based wholly Australian owned, medium-sized Information Technology Services Company since 1987. We specialise in the provision of permanent, contract and temporary recruitment services.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

The role:

, ' ',

Client: Federal Government Agency 

, ' ',

Location: Chatswood, Sydney

, ' ',

Start date: ASAP

, ' ',

Compas is currently looking for a Negative Vetting 1 cleared Platform Engineer to join our federal government client in Sydney.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

About the role:

, ' ',

Our client is seeking a platform engineer to join our team to help build a modern DevOps practice including a container based approach to application development and continuous delivery.

, ' ',

You will be working in an agile cross functional team including delivery manager, engineers, data scientists, architects and platform engineers.

, ' ',

You will be helping build a high velocity application development platform and working with delivery teams to deploy and support proprietary applications

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Mandatory criteria:

, ' ',
  • Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or IT equivalent
  • Strong UNIX systems administration experience, particularly for Redhat and Centos distributions
  • Excellent automation scripting skills
  • Production Docker experience, preferably including Dockersh, Kitematic and Rancher
  • Proﬁcient in one or more of following conﬁguration management tools; Ansible, Puppet, Chef or Saltstack
  • Broad experience with maintaining development infrastructure including source and resource repositories such as SVN, Nexus or Stash
  • Experience delivering Devops and continuous delivery outcomes using continuous delivery/ deployment (CD) tools such as GoCD, Jenkins or Bamboo
  • Participate in distributed systems/application architecture design, development, deployment and ownership of our internal continuous deployment platform
  • Exposure to cloud platforms such as AWS
, ' ',

For more information, contact Compas Responses@compas.com.au

, ' ']

title: b'\r\n          Veterinary Research Assistant\r\n        '
jd:
[' ',

We are a multinational veterinary contract research organisation looking for a RESEARCH ASSISTANT to fill a full-time role in our R&D department.

, ' ',

Eurofins SCEC services the animal health industry, both in Australia and internationally, specialising in the design, management and execution of veterinary (equine, canine and feline) research projects. This role presents a fantastic opportunity to become involved in the animal health industry in a  unique and rarely offered position.

, ' ',

The successful applicant will support our R&D Team (consisting of veterinarians, research scientists and nursing and technical staff) in our office and field-based projects. We do not conduct bench-top research.

, ' ',

Our office is located on Sydney's North Shore and our field station is in Western Sydney. You will be required to work at both locations and on occasion you will be required to travel interstate.

, ' ',

The role includes, but is not limited to:

, ' ',
  • Assisting with the preparation of study protocols, data capture sheets, study kits, etc
  • Prepare and submit animal care/ethics applications and monitor licence renewals
  • Complete and monitor the accuracy of data capture sheets
  • Collate and review raw study data
  • Recruit, screen and enrol clinical cases based on study criteria
  • Assisting veterinarians and research scientists with field work
  • General office administration duties (including ordering & inventory management)
, ' ',

Essential criteria:

, ' ',
  • Science degree or similar tertiary training 
  • Excellent organisational skills and ability to multi-task
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • High level of attention to detail and accuracy, with regard to study reporting and documentation
  • Have a strong interest in working in the animal health industry
, ' ',

Desirable Criteria;

, ' ',
  • Previous animal-handling experience (cats, dogs, horses)
  • Previous experience running or participating in clinical trials, including a working knowledge of GCP/GLP
, ' ',

Salary is negotiable and commensurate with relevant experience.

, ' ',

Please forward your CV and a cover letter outlining your experience and availability to melissa@scec.net.au

, ' ']

title: b'Data Scientist\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

This an exciting opportunity for a talented Data Scientist to join a leading household name who are looking to enhance their analytical capabilities in the Digital space.

The successful candidate will have a proven track record and expert knowledge with Big Data analysis tools and infrastructure, exceptional statistical modelling capabilities and expert stakeholder management.

, ' ',

We are looking for someone who has firsthand experience in the Digital space especially in the creation of content recommendations based on large scale data analysis of customer behaviours.

, ' ',

If this sounds like you and you are looking for the chance to get a big name brand on your CV and want work for an organisation that is forward thinking then get in touch now!

, ' ',


The Role:

, ' ',
  • Analysis and modelling of large customer behaviour data sets using advanced analytical methods.
  • To form a key part in advising the senior leadership team about the analysis and use of data to drive decision making.
  • To analyse data generated from the Website and Applications. Perform A/B Testing.
  • Provide expert advice on cutting edge products available with the ability to transform various big data sets into valuable measureable information.
  • To be a subject matter expert across the entire organisation for Data.
  • Collaborate with other analytics professionals across the business to help define and drive analytical solutions that deliver definitive business value.
, ' ',

What we are looking for:

, ' ',
  • A Data Scientist specialised in the Digital space.
  • Experience working with AWS will be favourable.
  • Expert knowledge of languages such as R, PYTHON, HADOOP, SAS.
  • AB Testing experience
  • Google and Adobe Analytics experience will be favourable.
  • Ability to translate an analytic story into a non-technical narrative;
  • Experience using applied statistics or machine learning in intensive problem-solving environment with large and complex datasets;
  • Comprehensive knowledge of statistical learning methods;
  • Excellent communication skills;
, ' ',


If this sounds like a great opportunity for you then please click 'APPLY'. You can also call Adam on 0299931072 to find out more.

, ' ']

title: b'\r\n          Assistant Accountant/Inventory\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',
  • Broad role, variety of duties
  • You love working with Excel
  • You would relish the opportunity to learn SQL and other data manipulation techniques
  • You have an interest in the procurement role of a business, including reviewing product mix and supplier deal reviews
  • You like the idea of working in a small finance team where you can make a difference
  • You like the idea of working local (keeps more cars off the M5)
, '\n',

DPO is a growing plasterboard distribution business. We supply major developers and builders with their internal lining needs from our multiple warehouses in 7 locations supported by our truck fleet. But as the business has grown, so has our product offering. To make sure we have the right information about our products, in the system, at the right price and with the right reports for our front line managers, we need a systems/inventory accountant.

, '\n',

This role will have a focus on inventory and product management, including improving the systems to update maintain and report on our product range. With recently refurbished showrooms, we need the data to make sure we are ranging the right products.

, '\n',

Based in Campbelltown NSW, you role will be the 'data scientist' of our business. If we want information out of our system, then you will become the go to person. In between all that you will assist with everyday finance matters. Your main responsibilities include:

, '\n',
  • Managing our inventory file of 15,000 products. This means you get to make decisions on category management, pricing models, buying decisions and more
  • Supporting DPO stores with transactional advice (we have 7 stores who rely on the finance team to assist them)
  • Assistance with journals entries
  • Assistance with end of month reporting
  • Contributing to monthly and annual reporting
  • Supporting the Finance team. There are 5 in the team and we cross-train so that we all get a broad understanding of the finance needs of the business.
, '\n',

The successful candidate will have the following attributes:

, '\n',
  • Previous experience in an Accounts Assistant or Systems Accountant role
  • Sound understanding of financial accounting processes and procedures
  • Comfortable with computers. You love working with CSV files, importing files and manipulating Excel files
  • Excellent attention to detail and sound written and verbal communication skills
  • A team focused, and proactive approach to work
, '\n',

If you have experience in finance, an interest in retail/wholesale and a passion for computers/databases/Excel then apply now. We don't expect you to know everything, but be prepared to come ready to learn.

, '\n',

To apply please submit a cover letter and resume.

, '\n',

Salary on offer $53k.

, '\n',

**Please note that only successfully short listed applicants will be contacted**

, '\n']

title: b'Data Scientist\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

Lorica Health provides advanced claims analytics solutions and services to the healthcare sector. Our specialist team of data scientists, domain experts, analysts and engineers develop industry specific solutions which target fraud, abuse and waste, while also making markets that improve the quality and safety of health care. Lorica software already analyses data from 30 of Australia's 33 private health insurers as well as a number of public sector agencies.

, '\n',

Lorica is a Best Practice Equal Opportunity Employer selecting candidates from a combination of soft and hard skills measured empirically wherever possible; be prepared to take state of the art online tests, interviews and questions.

, '\n',

Data Scientist

, '\n',

Description:
Lorica Health is seeking a data driven individual with a passion for applying statistics, machine learning, and analysis to unlock the insights available in datasets. You will be joining a growing team of data scientists working on some exciting healthcare analytics projects.

, '\n',

Responsibilities:

, '\n',

  • Explore large datasets, discover trends and patterns and extract insights

  • Apply Statistical/ Machine Learning techniques to build data product and features.

  • Develop scripts to extract and analyse large data sets and build statistical /machine learning models

  • Test and verify scripts and models to ensure accuracy of the results

  • Work with domain experts to validate and interpret findings

, '\n',

Required qualifications:

, '\n',

  • University Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Science or similar

  • Postgraduate qualifications in Statistics/Machine learning preferred

, '\n',

Required skills:

, '\n',

  • At least 5 years experience in a commercial advanced analytics environment

  • Solid skills in SQL for data extraction and manipulation

  • Hands-­‐on experience in R

  • High degree of skill in Natural Language Processing/text mining or network analysis

, '\n',

Role specific characteristics:

, '\n',

  • Previous experience in healthcare analytics will be highly regarded

  • Strong analytical skills coupled with great attention to detail

  • Inquisitive by nature

  • Passionate about data science

  • Ability to acquire in depth knowledge about healthcare data

  • Knowledge or experience with Health Insurance or Government Payments data

  • Ability to apply research skills and experience to solve real life problems in a fast paced commercial environment

  • Ability to work both independently and as part of a team

  • Must be an Australian citizen

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

Lorica Purpose:

, '\n',

To use data science to improve the quality of health care markets.

, '\n',

Lorica Vision:
To improve the fairness and efficiency of health care markets so they can in turn better improve the  health of the populations they serve.

, '\n',

Lorica Mission:

, '\n',

To be the foremost trusted intermediary providing health care data products and services that  demonstrably improve the performance of the Australian healthcare system.

, '\n',

Lorica Values:

, '\n',

Health, Respect, Integrity, Rigour, Improvement, Curiosity, Diversity, Courage

, '\n',

Lorica Personal Attributes:

, '\n',

Approachability, Collaboration, Enthusiasm, Expertise, Flexibility, Proactivity, Reliability

, '\n',

Working at Lorica:

, '\n',

Lorica respects family and flexible working requirements. We practices Agile throughout the company, promote continuous improvement and learning. Above all we want to make a difference and have fun.

, '\n',

We look forward to your application, please send your resume and cover letter to stephen.winnick@loricahealth.com

, '\n',

No recruitment agencies please.

, '\n']

title: b'Marketing Analyst\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

About Deputy

, '\n',

As one of the fastest growing tech companies in Australia, we are passionate about what we do. Our software solution sees thousands of businesses scheduling their employees on a daily basis underpinned by smart, rich data and the aim of making lives easier. Employees clock in and out for work through beautiful intuitive apps for smart phone and iPad.

, '\n',

Deputy is a cloud-based work scheduling and people management platform with social mobile technologies at its core. We're continuously improving functionality and broadening our user base. Since we launched 2008, it's been quite a journey as we strive for world domination. That's where you come into the picture.

, '\n',

About The Job

, '\n',

We're looking for a creative data ninja to help us understand more about our customers: those we have and those we want. This is a great role for someone who loves finding patterns, turning data in to insight, and wants to see their work make a real contribution to our growth.

, '\n',

The Marketing Analyst role has two main focuses:

, '\n',
  1. Understand our customers: add insight and provide guidance on the effectiveness of our marketing efforts, identify new market niches, and aid in developing data-driven customer profiles.
  2. Understand our world: help us deliver great, data-rich content pieces. Deputy has millions of data points on how shift-work business run and we need your help in turning those in to insights that can help our client business run and grow effectively.
, '\n',

This role will play a pivotal role in our global marketing strategy and execution, and you'll have the opportunity to work with stakeholders from all over our business. Ultimately you'll be responsible for keeping our marketing honest, on track and knowing the best way forward. Specifically, the role will:

, '\n',
  • Work with our marketing team to uncover insights / trends in user behaviour and optimise signup rate across all web and app platforms.
  • Use our native analytics and BI platform to measure the effectiveness of CRO initiatives across all web and app platforms
  • Map marketing funnels for all channels including CAC:LTV metrics
  • Work with our in-house data scientist to build out and maintain our native BI platform
  • Perform data analysis to support our content strategy, creating insightful reports around product usage (e.g. most on time cities / employee retention etc)
, '\n',

About You

, '\n',
  • 3 years experience with data analysis.
  • Demonstrable mastery of SQL a must, R a bonus
  • Experience with data viz platforms like Chartio, Tableau, or similar.
  • Very strong investigative and problem solving skills. Ability to marry together different data sets and make reasonable assumptions to get to a conclusion.
  • Strong communicator who can turn data in to actionable insight
, '\n',

Benefits

, '\n',
  • A collaborative, supportive environment that gives you autonomy to explore new ideas, grow your skill set and create outstanding work
  • The chance to make a genuine impact on the company's strategy and growth
  • Plenty of challenging work and the opportunity to stretch yourself
, '\n',

Interested? Apply via the link: 
https://deputy.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=46

, '\n']

title: b'Data Scientist - Customer Insights (Retail)\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

The team is a high performance data science and engineering unit that resides in a domestic, yet global organisation.

, ' ',

This function was set up in mid-2015 as an analytics centre of excellence, to only take on projects that are complex in nature (no reporting here), and that will ultimately add tangible value to the business. To date, they have successfully delivered a number of high profile projects, which have yielded high impact results and positive ROI.

, ' ',

They work across all areas of the organisation from marketing/customer, to fraud, pricing and supply chain, and they have just taken on a huge Retail Customer insights project – the first of its kind in the business. Due to this increasing workload and continuing success, they are now seeking a talented Data Scientist to grow the team. Ultimately – it's a great opportunity to develop your career alongside very talented scientists and engineers. 

, ' ',

Specific background is flexible, however those that have worked in Retail Customer analytics with a focus on consumer spending and basket (product) analysis will be highly regarded. Specifically supermarkets (FMCG).

, ' ',

You'll need to demonstrate high competency tackling problems using statistical modelling techniques, with machine learning experience being highly advantageous.

, ' ',

If you're interested in hearing more please contact me with your resume at jeremy.taylor@tomexecutive.com for a confidential discussion.

, ' ']

title: b'Research Assistant\r\n    '
jd:
[' ',
  • One of Australia's leading research & teaching universities
  • Vibrant campus life with a strong sense of community & inclusion
  • Enjoy a career that makes a difference by collaborating & learning from the best
, ' ',

At UNSW, we pride ourselves on being a workplace where the best people come to do their best work.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

The 3D Visualisation Aesthetics Lab (#3DVAL) is an interdisciplinary research lab that explores arts-led approaches to visualising data. The team uses the creative methodologies and narrative approaches seen in the video games, film visual effects (VFX) and interaction design fields to challenge established aesthetics.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

The lab is a custom build facility at UNSW Art & Design consisting of 3D visualisation workstations, virtual reality (VR) suite and render farm. It brings together arts-led researchers, biomedical scientists, clinical imaging professionals, 3D CGI artists, real-time developers and health service researchers.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

About the role

, ' ',
  • $81,199 to $86,620 pro rata plus (9.5% Superannuation and annual leave loading)
  • 12 month Fixed Term
  • Part-time position. 0.8 FTE.
, ' ',

This is an exciting new research collaboration between UNSW Art & Design and the Garvan Institute of Medical Research.  The project aim is to create high quality 3D Virtual Reality (VR) outputs to increase understanding of concepts related to molecular structures and cellular genomics. These outputs will be designed for public engagement of scientific processes.

, ' ',

The primary goal of this role is to generate VR models from molecular data that users can experience on the HTC Vive platform.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

About the successful applicant

, ' ',

At UNSW, we pride ourselves on being a workplace where the best people come to do their best work.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

The 3D Visualisation Aesthetics Lab (#3DVAL) is an interdisciplinary research lab that explores arts-led approaches to visualising data. The team uses the creative methodologies and narrative approaches seen in the video games, film visual effects (VFX) and interaction design fields to challenge established aesthetics.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

The lab is a custom build facility at UNSW Art & Design consisting of 3D visualisation workstations, virtual reality (VR) suite and render farm. It brings together arts-led researchers, biomedical scientists, clinical imaging professionals, 3D CGI artists, real-time developers and health service researchers.

[' ',
  • Full-time, permanent position
  • Sydney, CBD
  • Unique opportunity in a specialist field
, ' ',

About the role

, ' ',

Copyright Agency is looking for a passionate and highly motivated Data Analyst or Data Scientist to help us support the Australian creative community by proactively undertaking analysis, and by developing and maintaining data-driven tools and workflows. In this role you will:

, ' ',
  • Consult with internal stakeholders to identify and deliver business-relevant information and analysis
  • Work on complex productionised data-pipelines in which statistical/machine-learning algorithms are integral
  • Identify, scope, plan and execute projects grounded in data that will help Copyright Agency support creators
  • Enhance and add to the existing ecosystem of bespoke R packages that underpin the analytics within Copyright Agency.
, ' ',

About you

, ' ',

You will hold tertiary qualifications in a relevant discipline (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or Econometrics) and have at least 2 years' professional experience in an analytical role. You will have excellent communication skills that allow you to liaise, explain and document complex technical processes and solutions to a variety of stakeholders with different levels of technical understanding.You will be a proactive individual keen to learn the business, optimise processes, solves problems and identify new business areas for our Australian creators. Your experience in R, SQL and Excel, sufficient experience allows you to:

, ' ',
  • Create, document and maintain bespoke R packages
  • Build interactive web applications in R Shiny
  • Manipulate structured and unstructured data from various sources
  • Create and evaluate statistical and machine learning models
  • Integrate R tools with other systems (e.g. SQL databases)
  • Generate clear and accurate reports in Excel for internal customers.
, ' ',

About Us

, ' ',

Copyright Agency l Viscopy collects and distributes fees for the use of copyright text and images. Copyright Agency is the declared society for the statutory schemes in education and government as well as the Resale Royalty Scheme for visual artists. Copyright Agency also licenses commercial organisations to copy and share information without risk of copyright infringement. Copyright Agency also manages the licensing activities of Viscopy Limited under a services agreement. Copyright Agency provides philanthropic support to Australia's cultural community through our grants program, the Cultural Fund. For more information visit www.copyright.com.au | www.viscopy.net.au

, ' ',

How to apply

, ' ',

Please forward your resume and a covering letter to recruitment@copyright.com.au

, ' ',

Copyright Agency | Viscopy encourages applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.

, ' ',

Applications close 28 April 2017.

, ' ',

Applications will be treated with the strictest of confidence. Only successful applicants will be contacted. To be eligible to apply you must have an appropriate Australian or New Zealand work visa.

, ' ']

The Company
Successful start up with a cool product/service based in the CBD in a fully refurbed office block. The company is an exciting place to work and they are backed and advised by some of the smartest and brightest minds in their respected industry, from all over the globe.
They've assembled a team of leaders who are some of the world's best strategists, designers, technologists and data scientists - and you can now join them in a Tech Lead type role
 
The Role
 
• Find and plan the implementation of technical solutions.

• Assist in sprint planning and task prioritisation.

Technical expertise
● Very strong programming skill across a broad range of languages.
● Web applications.
● Native apps. - ios/android
● Dev ops/system administration/AWS.
 
Background
You will have around 8 years of relevant experience and worked on a wide variety of technology
projects such as engineering of ​ systems, software or hardware, frontend development,
or product development and have a​ solid understanding of networks, operating systems
and programming fundamentals.
 
Keen interest in technology and has worked in a number of different technical roles.
Is programming language agnostic and are able to pick up new languages if required.

Proven track record to find, analyse and understand technical and functional problems
and delivering effective solutions with end-user as well as short and long term goals in

title: b'Product Manager\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

Freelancer.com is the world's leading freelancing and crowdsourcing marketplace. A career at Freelancer.com exposes you to the fast pace of a startup at the grass roots by a team who have built global technology companies before, designing and developing software and systems that drive our platform of over 23 million users. 

, '\n',

We are looking for Product Managers to work within our Growth Team. This is a multi-disciplinary team consisting of Data Scientists, Engineers, Mathematicians, Statisticians, Physicists and Product Managers. Freelancer Product Managers set strategy, track and own their numbers and build innovative products. They thrive on data, and love to push the boundaries of web products. It's all in a day's work growing the world's largest online freelancing and crowdsourcing marketplace.

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

Product Managers will:

, '\n',
  • Leverage data to isolate opportunities for us to optimise critical growth flows and user paths
  • Pair that deep data driven understanding with surveys, focus groups or whatever qualitative tools are most useful to understand those opportunities
  • Drive projects that that will directly increase conversion rates and overall Freelancer growth and revenue
  • Work on core Freelancer products like projects, crowdsourced contest and the digital goods marketplace
  • Understand Freelancer's strategic and competitive position and deliver products that are recognised best in the industry
, '\n',

 

, '\n',

Requirements:

, '\n',
  • Tertiary degree in Computer Science/Engineering (or related); MS or PhD a plus
  • SQL or scripting skills
  • Ability to process and analyse complex data sets, and interpret them to make business decisions
  • Deep understanding of the web user experience (e.g. pricing strategy, technology, user flow)
  • Understanding of the technical architecture of complex and highly scalable web applications
  • Experience designing simple and intuitive user interfaces – ability to create wireframes and mock ups
, '\n',

 

, '\n',

Freelancer.com has a vibrant and fun team atmosphere where you can enjoy many perks such as an amazing office, your choice of platform (Unix, Mac, Windows), social events, hackathons, poker tournaments, well-stocked kitchens and free gym membership.

, '\n',

This won't be your typical cog-in-the-machine type of job. You will be exposed to the fast pace of a rapidly growing global technology company. If you are a high achiever with talent who is looking for something more than a boring job in corporate, wants to work with the best and brightest, doesn't need to be hand held and wants to be in at ground zero with a company that has a shot at being one of the biggest sites on the internet then contact us.

, '\n']

,

, ' ',
, ' \xa0',
, ' ',

, ' \xa0',
, ' \xa0',

, ' ',
, ' \xa0',
, ' ',

, ' ',

, '\xa0',

Culture,

You'll have the satisfaction of knowing that your work has a real impact on people across Australia and internationally.",

Laboratory & technical services professional looking to further develop project management skills needed for exciting University wide project.

At UNSW, we pride ourselves on being a workplace where the best people come to do their best work.

, ' ',

UNSW aspires to be Australia's global university, improving and transforming lives through excellence in research, outstanding education and a commitment to advancing a just society.

, ' ',

The University has developed an exciting ten-year strategic plan that aims to see it ranked in the Top 50 universities in the world by 2025.

The 2025 Strategy Office has been established drive institution-wide change programs.  The Cold Storage Project is part of the World Class Environments portfolio.

The Technical Officer provides support for the effective operation of UNSW Research Laboratories within the World Class Environments portfolio.
