title: b'\r\n          Day Hospital Administration Team Leader\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',

Administrative Team Leader

, '\n',

 North Shore Specialist Day Hospital

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced and responsible Administrative Team Leader (Medical Receptionist) who is ready to take the next step in their career. We are seeking a candidate who is passionate and enjoys the challenges and responsibility of working within a very fast paced specialist clinical environment. 

, '\n',

North Shore Specialist Day Hospital is a well-established Day Hospital specialising in Gynaecology, Endoscopy , Urology, Plastic surgery and Paediatric Dental Surgery, while also providing day hospital services for IVF Australia.

, '\n',

The role is a full time position of 38 hours per week Monday to Friday, with a mix of early and late starts and finishes. The hospital is conveniently located in the heart of the medical precinct of  St Leonards, with good access to public transport by Train and  bus.  The day surgery operates a rotating 4 week theatre roster with opening hours from 6:00am to 6:00pm, with administrative shifts rostered accordingly.

, '\n',

The successful applicant will play an important role in the patients' overall experience and smooth functioning of the Day Hospital, ensuring that a high quality service is provided. The applicant will be primarily responsible for all administrative tasks in the Day Hospital, and in charge of the hospital's administrative team.

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

The duties and responsibilities:

, '\n',
  • Provide exceptional administrative services associated with North Shore Specialist Day Hospital admissions.
  • Ensure patients receive the highest standard of customer service, in particular, the prompt and courteous communication (whether by telephone, face to face, or written) of accurate information whilst remaining non-judgmental and maintaining strict patient confidentiality at all times.
  •  Maintain strong team working environment where workloads and shift coverage are equitably distributed and all administration staff is encouraged to exercise initiative, support strong functional relationships and open communication.
  •  Provide the best possible administrative support to doctors, anaesthetists, nurses, scientists and any other staff associated with the treatment of patients.
  • As the first point of contact for the business, provide an outstanding level of customer service both meeting and greeting patients and over the telephone. 
  • Front reception, secretarial and administrative duties, including: 
  • Supervising of the creation of theatre lists using SimDay
  • Heath fund eligibility checks and
  • Provision of accurate fee estimates to patients prior to surgery
  • Ensure the scanning of all medical documents and accurate data entry of patient details.
  • Develop a strong relationship with our Surgeons and their rooms, to ensure a smooth flow of hospital admissions and theatre bookings.
  • Be a valuable team member of the Day Hospital – living up to the day hospital's image, culture and core values.
  • Assist with the coordination of GP events

     

    To be successful in this position, you will have the following attributes:

  • Previous experience as a Medical Receptionist, within a private day hospital setting is essential.
  • Knowledge of Health Funds contracts and the ability to conduct eligibility checks for patients prior to surgery
  • Experience with booking systems, such as SimDay appointment system for all doctors, patients and surgical procedures
  • Experience in fee estimation and explaining outcomes to patients
  • Demonstrated ability to lead an administrative team, Experience in monitoring the level of customer service at the front desk and resolving customer complaints
  • Ability to liaise with health funds regarding patient admissions and specialists and anaesthetists regarding theatre lists
  • Excellent communication, and interpersonal skills to enable interaction with all levels of people
  • Ability to work both as a team and autonomously
  • Maintain financial administration of the reception desk (banking, daily reconciliation, financial consents and processing of refunds and payments)
  • Experienced in the scanning of electronic medical records and troubleshooting missing records
  • Ability to teach and support new staff members with proven leadership skills
  • Ability to thrive in a fast paced environment with a high level of attention to detail. 
  • Excellent time management and organisational skills.

    A competitive salary will be offered to the right candidate.

     

    To be considered for this position, please forward your resume by Friday 28th May 2017 to:

    Tori Ruello

    176 Pacific Highway Greenwich  NSW  2065

    Tori.ruello@ivf.com.au

, '\n']

Laboratory & technical services professional looking to further develop project management skills needed for exciting University wide project.

At UNSW, we pride ourselves on being a workplace where the best people come to do their best work.

title: b'Designer - UI/UX\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

About The Job:

, '\n',

Escrow.com, owned and operated by Freelancer.com, is the world's leading provider of secure online payments. We have handled over US$3 Billion in secured transactions, have been involved in some of the Internet's largest transactions, and are the recommended high-value settlement service of eBay, GoDaddy, AutoTrader, and the United States Government - just to name a few.

, '\n',

We are looking for a talented designer with a solid background in interface design to join the Freelancer team, yet work on Escrow. Someone who is passionate about building great experiences, and making a difference in how users interact with products. You have the ability to come up with a hypothesis based on user and business needs, wireframe it, prototype it, test it, and ultimately deliver beautiful interfaces.

, '\n',

You will be working in close partnership with Escrow's product managers, data scientists and engineers to validate the team's assumptions with quantitative and qualitative data, and be the driving force behind moving the Escrow.com experience to the next level.

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

Requirements:

, '\n',

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent in UI Design

  • 3-5 years of experience designing digital products

  • Know-how in building wireframe flow, interfaces and experiences

  • Design and pursuit for pixel-perfect interfaces

  • A passion for delivering amazing experiences to users

  • An empathetic mentality towards aligning this user's needs with business objectives

  • Ability to create clean, organised files as you work

  • An understanding of style guide driven design

  • Excellent verbal, written, and visual communication skills

  • An online portfolio showing all of the above

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

And we would love it if you had:

, '\n',

  • Knowledge in development languages like html, css, javascript

  • Knowledge setting up testing sessions

  • Graphic design skills (branding, emails, marketing materials)

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

About Freelancer.com:

, '\n',

Freelancer.com is the world's leading freelancing and crowdsourcing marketplace with over 23 million global users. We have a vibrant and fun team atmosphere where you can enjoy many perks like an amazing office, your choice of platform (Unix, Mac, Windows), social events, hackathons, poker tournaments, well-stocked kitchens and free gym membership.

, '\n',

This won't be your typical cog-in-the-machine type of job. You will be exposed to the fast pace of a rapidly growing global technology company. If you are looking for something more than a boring job in corporate, want to work with the best and brightest, doesn't need to be handheld, and want to be in at ground zero with a company that has a shot at being one of the biggest sites on the internet, then we want to hear from you!

, '\n']

title: b'Research Coordinator - Genomic Cancer Medicine\r\n      '
salary: b'14% super + NFP salary packaging benefits'
jd:
[
, '\n',

At Garvan our research is focused upon understanding the role of genes and molecular and cellular processes in health and disease as the basis for developing future preventions, treatments and cures. Our scientists are researchers who work towards making significant breakthroughs in scientific discovery to positively impact human health.

The Genomic Cancer Medicine Program (GCMP) comprises two arms: a Molecular Screening and Therapeutics study and a Cancer Risk study

, '\n',

The Opportunity

, '\n',

We currently have an opportunity for a Research Coordinator who will be responsible for co-ordinating the research requirements for the psychosocial projects associated with the GCMP. The Research Coordinator will be responsible for undertaking varied research activities mainly related to quantitative studies examining the psychosocial, behavioural and ethical issues in genomic cancer testing, funded by the NHMRC.

Responsibilities may include:

, '\n',
  • Provide research and administrative support to complete research projects
  • Entry of data into research databases
  • Liaise with study participants to supply questionnaires and ensure their completion
  • Assist with information/data collection and data quality control
  • Assist with preparation of study documents
  • Assist with preparation of ethics submissions and annual HREC reports
  • Conduct data analysis and literature searches, aid in preparing reports
, '\n',

To be considered for this position, you will possess the following key skills and attributes:

, '\n',
  • Degree in a health related or clinical discipline, science, psychology or similar
  • Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills
  • Well-developed organisational and multi-tasking skills and administrative abilities
  • Demonstrated understanding of research methodology and understanding of confidentiality issues of accessing patient records in research settings
  • Ability to work both independently and as part of a team
  • Excellent attention to detail
, '\n',

Desirable

Experience in a research-intensive environment and/or co-ordinating study participants

How to Apply

Please prepare and submit your application as per the directions below:

, '\n',
  • A Cover Letter addressing the Selection Criteria above
  • Your Resume including 3 Referees
  • Copies of relevant qualifications / Academic transcripts
, '\n',

Closing Date

14 May 2017

, '\n']

title: b'\r\n          Marketing Manager\r\n        '
jd:
[' ',

Please apply via https://morningstar.wd5.myworkdayjobs.com/americas/. Please note we will not review applications in Seek.

, ' ',

The Team:

, ' ',

Marketing and Communications creates integrated communications and campaigns that aim to make the Morningstar brand tribal. Consisting of marketing managers, designers, writers, corporate communications professionals, digital strategists, behavioral scientists, and more, this collaborative team serves our marketing needs across our business. We are data-driven experimenters who work to deliver the right messages to the right people at the right time. We also drive demand by developing go-to-market strategies for Morningstar products. The team works globally to maintain a consistent brand experience everywhere Morningstar serves investors.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

The Opportunity:

, ' ',

We are looking for a results-driven and hands-on Marketer with experience in managing cross channel end-to-end digital campaigns and communications to join our Australasia Marketing and Communications team, based in Sydney.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Reporting to the Head of Marketing – ANZ, you will have the opportunity to develop and execute acquisition, lead nurturing and ongoing communication strategies across all channels and customer touchpoints including events, direct communications, digital advertising and content (web, mobile, social), PR and other channels where relevant. 

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Your focus on measurement and ongoing optimization will ensure the Morningstar brand is elevated as a trusted and independent source of leading investment insights and solutions for investors, governments, asset managers, financial advisers and other industry participants.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

This role provides an excellent opportunity to be part of a great team culture, where you'll enjoy the support and opportunity to make your mark. 

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Attractive working conditions are also on offer, with generous staff entitlements, and a competitive salary including 10% superannuation. Relocation assistance will also be considered, if required. 

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Key Responsibilities:

, ' ',
  • Work with the Head of Marketing and Head of Communications to execute successful communication and content marketing programs, from planning to creative development and delivery.
  • Act as a primary liaison between the global teams, local teams, and agencies to execute optimized marketing campaigns, then analyse and articulate ROI to stakeholders to inform future planning.
  • Foster relationships with creative, media, and technology agencies and vendors to innovate and optimise the performance of all digital channels, such as owned, paid and organic search, social, and display.
  • Partner with key internal stakeholders including product owners and the sales teams to coordinate end to end lead generation.
  • Drive consistency across marketing creative and activities to leverage each other's activities.
  • Drive marketing optimisation initiatives to shift towards current digital solutions and improve our social media presence.
  • Proactively review the business processes and brand strategies, and take initiative to identify opportunities for enhancement.
  • Perform other duties as necessary from time to time.
, ' ',

Requirements:

, ' ',
  • A bachelor's degree in marketing, communications, or a related field.
  • Minimum 5 years of work experience in marketing, communications, or advertising, preferably within the financial services industry. Experience with financial advisor space is desirable.
  • Proven ability to design, develop and implement content-led marketing campaigns and activities.
  • Demonstrated knowledge, experience and passion for digital marketing (including Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, and YouTube) as well as an appreciation for traditional marketing.
  • Excellent communication skills both written and verbal, with the ability to address different audience needs using an innovative approach.
  • Exceptional project and time management skills with strong attention to detail, and a proactive approach and drive to meet required deadlines.
  • Proven ability to build effective internal and external relationships and to work both collaboratively in a cross-functional team environment and independently, when required.
  • Experience with Adobe Creative Suite, (including InDesign), Illustrator and Photoshop, MailChimp, WordPress, Google Analytics, Microsoft Office 365.
  • Ability to form strong working relationships with key stakeholders (globally and locally) to obtain insights and best practice examples to optimise local marketing effectiveness.
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Next Steps:

, ' ',

Please attach a resume and cover letter to your online application via https://morningstar.wd5.myworkdayjobs.com/americas/. Please note we will not review applications in Seek.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Morningstar is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

**Applicants from recruitment agencies will not be considered.**

, ' ',
, ' ']

title: b'Front-end Engineer - Microservices Architecture\r\n      '
jd:
[
, ' ',

Our Story

, ' ',

Hi. We're hipages. We're all about transforming the home improvement industry.

, ' ',

Founded in an Aussie garage 12 years ago by two great mates, we've continued to reinvent and refine what we do, becoming Australia's number 1 site to hire qualified, trusted and verified tradies.

, ' ',

We've developed innovative products using cutting edge technology, solving everyday problems that have plagued homeowners and tradespeople for years. This is a longstanding industry and we're excited to help reshape it!

, ' ',

Our talented, friendly and passionate team have many achievements to be proud of, including winning awards such as BRW's Best Places to Work, BRW's Fast 100, Deloitte's Tech Fast50, Australia's Most Innovative Company Awards and 2016 Smart50 Top Digital Innovator.

, ' ',

This is an exciting period of growth for us.  We are fast on our way to becoming a household name and are determined to make life easier for homeowners and tradies Australia wide. We need more great people to join the team and help us get there.

, ' ',

Does this sound like your kind of challenge?

, ' ',

Your Opportunity

, ' ',

We are currently in the process of building out our new microservices architecture and you will be instrumental in the success of this initiative.

, ' ',

Reporting to the Engineering Manager and working with a cross-functional team consisting of Product Managers, UX and UI Designers, Frontend Developers and Data Scientists, you will be responsible for the design, development, and delivery of our web applications. To be a success in the role, you will -

, ' ',

Key Responsibilities

, ' ',
  • Design, development, and delivery of frontend components
  • Creation of single-page applications (SPAs)
  • Writing clean, scalable, testable code to support and enable the growth of the company
  • Be a team player who is driven, respectful of others, passionate about what you do and determined to achieve results fast
, ' ',

What You Bring

, ' ',

In addition to a down-to-earth attitude, a desire to continually master your craft and a good sense of humour, you will also bring:-

, ' ',
    • A pragmatic and coachable attitude and good communication skills
    • A healthy respect for building and delivering great products
    • Self-motivation and capable of working autonomously
    • 3+ years of industry experience and a Computer Science/Software Engineering degree preferred
    • Demonstrable experience working with CSS preprocessors or postprocessors (LESS, SASS, PostCSS) - SASS preferred
    • Demonstrable experience working with modern Javascript frameworks (Angular, React, Ember) - React preferred
    • Experience with asset build pipelines using tools such as Grunt, Gulp, or Webpack
    • Bonus skills:
      • Experience with FLUX architecture, preferably Redux
      • Experience with writing automated tests, preferably Mocha
      • Experience working in an AWS environment and using AWS services
      • Experience with Node.js or PHP
      • Experience with relational databases and SQL, preferably MySQL
      • Experience with NoSQL data stores
      • Experience with Linux
      • Experience working in an agile team (Scrum or Kanban)
      • Understanding of microservices architecture
, ' ',

Who We Are

, ' ',

We are an eclectic, bright and curious bunch. We're tech-heads, thought-leaders and are driven to make a difference. Our success comes from focusing on innovation everyday (and via hackathons) and using our diverse and collective intelligence to solve problems quickly, creatively and effectively.

, ' ',

We're a medium sized start-up, meaning we have the financial backing to have leading edge systems and tools but small enough so that everyone is empowered to directly impact our product and customers. We work hard and move fast, free from bureaucracy and politics to 'make it happen' everyday.

, ' ',

We love celebrating - everything! Birthdays, babies, big wins, little wins and anything in between, and our company awards and events are legendary! Check out our Instagram #hipagesteam to get the picture.

, ' ',

Most importantly, all employees get to become owners of hipages (through our employee share program), which means we're united in our mission and everyone gets to have their say.  The energy and 'buzz' of our office is palpable and infectious.

, ' ',

Finally, hipages is proud of our 50/50 gender diversity (which is almost unheard of in our industry) and we appreciate and welcome all differences.

, ' ',

If this sounds like you, then welcome home.  

, ' ']

title: b'\r\n          Engineer/Programmer\r\n        '
jd:
[' ',

Engineer / Programmer

, ' ',

Neuroscience Research Australia (NeuRA), located in Sydney Australia, is an international leader in brain and nervous system research.  Through laboratory and clinical research its goal is to find the causes of and cures for neurological and psychiatric diseases.

, ' ',

We seek a talented engineer/programmer who is keen to get "hands-on" with medical research. The role offers opportunities to work across a variety of research areas, contributing towards breakthrough neuroscience research.

, ' ',

As a member of the IT Team at NeuRA, you will spend time working on specific research projects in conjunction with scientists in their laboratories and research groups. You'll be expected to manage hardware and software integrations and will need to have skill in developing novel solutions to difficult problems.

Essential criteria: Background in engineering; familiarity with data acquisition, instrumentation and signal processing; programming experience, particularly with C/C++, Python, Ruby; instrumentation software experience, in particular Matlab and LabVIEW/LabWindows; human computer interface design skills; highly developed problem solving abilities; excellent communication skills.

, ' ',

Desirable criteria: project management; issue tracking.

, ' ',

Enquiries and applications to: Andrew Cartwright a.cartwright@neura.edu.au.

, ' ',

Closing: Friday 5 May, 2017.

, ' ',

www.neura.edu.au

title: b'\r\n          Environmental Consultant\r\n        '
jd:
[' ',

MRA Consulting Group (MRA) is recognised nationally as Australia's leading boutique waste management consulting firm - specialising in all aspects of business and policy reform. MRA was named Australia's 'Best Small Consultancy' by Inside Waste readers in 2013, 2014 2015 and 2016. This year, the recognition was extended to the following categories:

, ' ',
  • Best overall consultant;
  • Best in strategy and policy, planning and grants;
  • Best in tender development and evaluation;
  • Best in reporting and compliance;
  • Best in community consultation; and
  • Best in education and training.
, ' ',

MRA's success has been built on the skills and experience of a multidisciplinary team of professionals, which includes engineers, scientists, economists, planners, lawyers, social scientists and educators. The team shares a common focus, delivering quality project outcomes for our clients. This focus has meant that MRA maintains a position at the forefront of Australian waste and recycling management practices, working on the largest and most innovative projects.

, ' ',

MRA seeks to recruit graduate engineers either nearing completion on their studies or recently graduated.

, ' ',

MRA will engage current students on an hourly rates contract until they have graduated –  to then start full time employment for the successful candidate.

, ' ',

Responsibilities

, ' ',

The main responsibilities of this role include, but are not limited to:

, ' ',
  • Assisting project managers in:
    • Research (e.g. legislation, technology types)
    • Business case development
    • Cost benefit analysis
    • Project finance
    • Data collection and Data analysis
    • Report writing
  • Managing small projects under the direction of company director or a principal consultant.
  • Assisting bid managers to compile tenders
  • Participating in waste audits
  • Maintain project databases, technology reviews etc.
, ' ',

Method of working

, ' ',

You will be required to undertake this work through:

, ' ',
  • Liaison with stakeholders
  • Summarising qualitative research in text documents
  • Collating quantitative research in excel documents
  • Active participation in waste audits
  • Attending meetings
, ' ',

Key capacities and skills:

, ' ',
  • Bachelor of Engineering or Masters in Engineering, Bachelor of Science (Environmental Sciences) Masters of Science
  • Excellent excel and analytical skills
  • Distinction average or above
  • Interest in sustainability and waste management
  • Interest/experience in carbon modelling and landfill gas
  • Data analysis and modelling experience
  • Communication skills
  • Report writing skills
  • Understanding of project finance beneficial
  • Previous work experience demonstrating experience in team work
  • Ability to think in an innovative manner
, ' ',

Application Deadline: Rolling until we find the right person so apply now!

, ' ',

Type: Sydney Office - Full time or part time while completing studies.

, ' ',

Current students would be expected to stay with MRA once studies have been completed.

, ' ',

Remuneration: up to $60,000 p.a. or equivalent to hourly rate for part time work while studying.

, ' ',

Applications: If you are interested in applying for a position with, please submit your CV, cover letter and transcripts to info@mraconsulting.com.au. If you have any questions about the role, please contact Kim Le, MRA Admin Assistant on 0404 753 465.

, ' ',

Read more about MRA Consulting Group and our experience at www.mraconsulting.com.au

, ' ']

title: b'Data Analyst\r\n    '
jd:
['\n',

The NRMA was born to keep people moving, and we have been doing this for nearly 100 years. Our vision is to create indispensable connections with our Members’ mobility through my car, my journey and my destination.

Our Members enjoy our legendary roadside assistance, car servicing and repairs, Thrifty car and truck rentals, the latest fuel prices and more via the mynrma app, discounted travel and accommodation at our Holiday parks, Travelodge and Hotel Kurrajong Canberra

Your opportunity

Are you analytical, highly driven and possess a “can-do” attitude? Then this is the role you have been waiting for. The NRMA are seeking an experienced Data Analyst to work as a valued member of the data team. You will be responsible for delivering data solutions, data-driven campaign execution, reporting, and business insights to our stakeholders in the Sales & Marketing division.

On a typical day, as our Data Analyst you should expect to:

, '\n',
  • Manage the campaign data design, build, delivery, and measurement of all Member and Customer communication
  • Hands on analysis and visualization of complex web based data utilizing a variety of tools
  • Clearly communicate actionable insights to inform marketing, sales, and product strategies
  • Own the entire reporting lifecycle for Enterprise and Operational dashboards
  • Work closely with Technology and stakeholders in expanding and improving data assets and capabilities
  • Understand data opportunities at the NRMA and how to unlock opportunities
  • Manage stakeholder relationships and promote a data driven decision culture
  • Grow data and business knowledge of Membership and Group Businesses
, '\n',

Your experience

You will have the customer experience at the heart of what you do and be able to demonstrate

, '\n',
  • A minimum of 7 years’ experience in an analyst role responsible for campaign, reporting, and analysis
  • Advanced SQL skills and experience dealing with large and complex data sets
  • Possess a positive “can-do” attitude coupled with excellent communication skills
  • Experience with reporting and visualization tools such as OBIEE, Google Analytics, Tableau
  • Advanced use of Microsoft Office Suite
, '\n',

Your benefits

We offer a competitive remuneration and our benefits include 50% discount on insurance, free NRMA Premium Care Membership , product and travel discounts, 50% discount on Village Roadshow Theme Parks, plus many more!

We have moved to a brand new office in Sydney Olympic Park. Here you will enjoy the convenience of free parking or being on the doorstep of the train station, plus the atmosphere of vibrant cafes and restaurants to appease your appetite.

Your journey with us starts here, so get in the driver’s seat and take control of your career. Apply now.

, '\n',
, '\n']

Company Overview:
A well established and growing financial services group. This is a highly professional organisation with a wealth of expertise and strong, loyal client base.

About the Role:
This role requires a Data Analyst to assist in a new regulatory project that will see you contribute to meeting data reporting requirements and transitioning data delivery from ad-hoc project into a smooth, BAU operational function.

Regulatory reporting requirements are driving this project, to standardise Claims data reporting making it possible to report on and access Claims data on demand and seamlessly.

Your Data Analysis background means you can work with technology and business teams to cleanse, review, test and compile Claims data. Your Analysis and stakeholder skills mean you'll be pivotal to transitioning Claims data reporting into a BAU function.
  • Previous experience with data cleansing and analysis.
  • Strong SQL experience.

  • Ability to communicate effectively with business and technology stakeholders.

This position will offer an immediate start and an excellent daily rate for the right candidate. If you're interested, please apply today or contact Jonny Jameson  02 9240 6351 for a confidential discussion.

title: b'Data Analyst - Data Analytics, Customer Insight, SQL Reporting\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',

In this role, you will develop a data plan for building a scaleable solution that arms the wider business with insights to make business decisions.  You will use your technical SQL skills to set it up, roll it out and empower people within the business derive their own insights.  You'll be the expert in how the business works, how the data is captured and stored, and how to wrangle it to draw out meaningful insights to better understand customers, improve conversion in the customer journey or efficiency in how we serve customers.  

, '\n',

Responsibilities

, '\n',

  • Develop a scaleable plan for setting up the right infrastructure to support business requirements around marketing, product and service performance, and customer insights.

  • Manage a roadmap of data projects, prioritise and provide transparency on delivery of data projects

  • Work directly with development team to build out the data solution, setting up a data reporting layer including data table structure and connecting disparate data sources to meet business reporting and analysis needs

  • Automate reporting using tableau reports and dashboards

, '\n',

  • Deeply understand the data structure, systems, schemer and maintain glossary of terms

  • Be the expert and owner of the reporting and analytics tools for the business, primarily SQL, Tableau, Segment, Service platform, but also Amplitude, Intercom, Google Analytics 

  • Work with key stakeholders to ensure reporting is set up for any new product development

  • Set up, train and educate the wider team on using reporting tools including Tableau

, '\n',

  • Provide service, product, marketing and business stakeholders with standardised reporting that delivers transparency into business performance

  • Set up dashboards and manage day to day reporting across the business including board reporting, weekly and daily reporting

  • Proactively identify gaps in reporting, set up, automate and visualise to aid comprehension, decision making and communication of information

, '\n',

  • Standardise a process for managing ad hoc data requests - develop a data briefing template, manage a roadmap of data requests, prioritise and provide transparency on timing and delivery of insights

  • Coach and challenge the requestor to ensure the right questions are being asked

  • Write SQL queries to extract the right data and visualise information to aid comprehension, decision making and communication of information

  • Proactively analyse customer quality, customer journey, event stages, pathways, channels, conversion, ROI, etc to identify gaps and opportunities in the business

  • Actively communicate insights to the wider organisation

, '\n',


Skills & experience

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

You need to have:

, '\n',

    • 2 years data analyst experience with a track record in setting up a customer data analysis solution working with postgres databases, running SQL queries and analysis for digital transactional or ecommerce businesses

    • SQL and Tableau gun

    • Relevant Bachelor Degree

    • Experience with Google Analytics, Segment, Amplitude, or similar will be highly regarded

    • Strong at understanding and building out the right data structure, SQL tables and linking disparate data sources

    • Analytical and curious by nature.  Proactive insights led decision maker who enjoys being hands-on with data to drive smarter business outcomes

    • Interest in and good at data visualisation

    • Self-starter – used to working in agile /nimble environments and can work autonomously

    • Passionate about understanding customers and their behaviour

    • Entrepreneurial mindset: adaptable, pragmatic, proactive, hands-on, strategic, analytical, and ambitious

    • Comfortable with complex data, analysis and insights. Must be very focused on measurement through data and fast iteration through learning

    • Strong understanding of digital technologies required to scale our data solution

    • Good at working within an ambiguous, fast paced environment – figuring it out and adapting as you go

    • A willingness to roll up sleeves to get it done

    • Good communication skills – verbal and written

    • Great at working within a team environment

, '\n']

title: b'\r\n          Business Data Analyst\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',

Primary purpose of the role
The primary purpose of the role is to maintain resource plans, information and data to ensure optimisation of available resources to support the Delivery Office in the achievement of all performance targets in an efficient and cost effective manner.
 
The role identifies trends, provides analysis of current and proposed resource management and performance, and makes recommendations and adjustments as required, to assist in placing the right resources enabling delivery teams to be successful in the short and longer term.
 
Key accountabilities

, '\n',
  • Coordinate and audit the collation of Resource information and create spreadsheets and personnel databases (to update and maintain employee data.
  • Manage, maintain and administer the Organisational Change request process including approvals, and maintain this in Objective to ensure capture of all approved changes to organisational structure and resource management
  • Monitor and track changes to the Delivery Office organisation chart to ensure accuracy and integrity of data from a people and infrastructure perspective
  • Monitor functional mailboxes and respond to internal staff on all queries in a timely and professional manner
  • Assist Resource Managers with the review and provision of data analytics on current and proposed resources and produce reporting to highlight trends and share insights to help support business decisions
  • Proactively identify business risks and opportunities to continually improve efficiency and effectiveness of resource, planning, utilisation and mobilisation.
  • Assist the Organisation Strategy team as needed with metrics and other adhoc requests to support team objectives
, '\n',

Key challenges

, '\n',
  • Ensuring data and information is kept up to date given a fast-paced change environment
  • Keeping abreast of current and emerging best practice, standards, government policy and statutory requirements
  • Working cooperatively and proactively with leadership teams and building solid working relationships and partnerships
, '\n',

Essential requirements

, '\n',
  • Tertiary qualifications in a relevant field, or equivalent experience
  • Strong systems, database and computing skills including use of spreadsheets, graphing, word processing and data manipulation
, '\n',

For more information and to apply, please send an updated CV to: andyt@charterhouse.com.au

, '\n']

title: b'Oracle Data Analyst\r\n    '
jd:
[' ',

Randstad is on the lookout for an Oracle Data Analyst to be responsible for performing full data lifecycle activities across multiple agencies, projects, and stakeholders including gathering data requirements, data profiling and data model design. The role will provide key support in the development, testing and maintenance of databases, data models, ETL, queries and related artefacts for various cluster-wide projects and initiatives.

, ' ',

The Analytics & Reporting Systems application portfolio includes, but is not limited to Tableau, SAS, SAP, and Oracle Exadata.

, ' ',

Responsibilities include;

, ' ',
  • Evaluate business data identifying different characteristics and locating similarities to enable integration for improved data analysis
  • Provide a key role in supporting and partnering the business in all data driven initiatives
  • Ensure alignment with the data governance policy of the government cluster.
  • Design and support data analyses to derive meaningful insights that assist business managers in making sound business decisions
  • Importing, cleaning, transforming, validating or modelling data with the purpose of understanding or making conclusions from the data for decision-making purposes
  • Design and develop data models, schemas, queries and supporting code to support analytics and reporting projects
  • Work closely with project, application and support teams in multiple locations and expected to work independently to plan and accomplish goals.
  • Working closely and effectively across the analytics and reporting team to deliver consistent integrated services and solutions which can be replicated and which contribute to improving processes and systems.
  • Identifying and balancing the needs of multiple stakeholders, multiple changes and work programs and a complex business environment undergoing significant change.
, ' ',

To succeed in this role you will have:

, ' ',
  • Experience working with Oracle Technology (11g or 12g) as a Data Analyst
  • Proven work experience as a database designer, data modeller and data analyst
  • Technical expertise in data models, database design development and data mining
  • At least 5 years experience designing, developing and delivering Business Analytics solutions using Oracle database
  • At least 5 years experience designing, developing and delivering Business Analytics solutions using ETL tools
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organise, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
  • Experience working in a Linux environment
  • Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings
  • Experience in data analysis and data mining techniques.
  • Exposure to data governance, data management and development processes
, ' ',

If you think you have the skills to be successful in this role, then don’t delay and hit the Apply button now! Alternatively, you can send your profile to Glenn on glenn.abadilla@randstad.com.au.

, ' ']

title: b'Senior Data Analyst (ECM)\r\n      '
jd:
[• Unique and exciting Permanent Full Time opportunity with Sydney Trains!
• Excellent pay and benefits
• Close to public transport and amenities

The opportunity
We have an exciting opportunity for a Senior Data Analyst to be a part of our Enterprise Asset Systems team within Sydney Trains. This position plays a critical role in the daily operation, support and development of Engineering Content Management capability and services, including the Virtual Planroom system, ensuring its reliability and operational effectiveness.

We are looking for a computing, engineering or science professional who has experience as an Engineering Document Management power user /administrator (experience in the configuration of the Bentley ProjectWise and Enterprise Bridge systems are preferable), including the maintenance of Engineering Content.

You will be highly conceptual and analytical with excellent problem solving and communication skills and the ability to build rapport with stakeholders at all levels.

About us
At Sydney Trains, our vision is to keep Sydney moving by delivering safe, customer-focused, reliable and clean rail services.
We contribute to the success of transport in NSW by running efficient rail services which exceed our customers’ expectations, support growth and contribute to the broader community and the economy.
Joining Sydney Trains will present an exciting opportunity to shape the future and make a genuine difference for the people of NSW by providing a world class rail system.

Benefits
Sydney Trains offers its employees challenging and rewarding work with opportunities for career progression, learning and development and work-life balance. Other benefits include:
• Free travel on Government trains, buses and ferries
• Flexible work practices

Join Sydney Trains for the opportunity to shape the future and make a genuine difference for the people of NSW by providing a world class rail system.

Our commitment to Diversity
TfNSW are committed to building a diverse and inclusive culture across the Transport cluster, planning for and promoting diversity. We welcome and encourage applications from diverse community groups and ages including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander, LGBTI, people with disabilities, women and other diversity groups. TfNSW recognises the benefits that such an approach brings for our staff and customers in delivering the future of NSW.

How to apply
Click on the APPLY button below. For more information on Sydney Trains or the position description, please click on links provided.

For any enquiries, please contact Jagadeesh Sethuraman on 02 8575 0450 and quote 000059FO.

Please note: successful candidate will need to undertake background checks and criminal record checks.

Applications close: 11:59pm Sunday 21st May 2017

For permanent positions in the NSW Public Sector, you need to be an Australian Citizen or Permanent Resident. For most Temporary jobs, you need a visa that gives you permission to work in Australia. To be considered for these roles you must be 18 years of age. Applicants will need to complete merit based selection activities and will be subject to satisfactory medical, drug & alcohol and criminal record checks as part of the selection process. Please note that an eligibility list may be created for this position, and position(s) of the same classification that subsequently become vacant may be filled using this eligibility list (where the vacancy is within 60 minutes travelling time). Transport for NSW is an equal opportunity employer. Women and people with a disability are encouraged to apply.

]

title: b'\r\n          Experience Optimisation Data Analyst\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',

To meet the demands of substantial growth in our CRO offering, New Republique is looking to expand our team. We are looking for a talented 'Experience Optimisation Data Analyst'. 

, '\n',


You would be working with new business across some of the biggest brands in the Banking, eTailer's, Finance, and Fashion. We have a dynamic team and fantastic creative offices in Darlinghurst, Sydney. Our work and methodology has been recognised and accredited by some of the biggest technologies in the world and we work closely with our partner Oracle, Google and Optimizely across a portfolio of top tier clients.


We are looking for someone with the following skills:
 

, '\n',
  • A degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Actuarial or Econometrics
  • Prior experience in data mining and/or predictive modelling within a business context
  • Capable of developing Regression Modelling, Decision Trees, Binomial simulation, Cluster Analysis and Markov Chains
  • An understanding of web analytics and user experience validated by data
  • Experience in Conversion Optimisation would be an advantage 
  • Customer segmentation by website conversion behaviour
  • eCommerce experience from a metrics and data background
  • Analyse conversion behaviour of websites to identify opportunities for testing
  • Use analytics to provide feedback to the testing team for the monitoring of testing as well as development of new tests
  • Collect and vet data from various external sources
  • Expertise with tools such as VBA, R, Python or other open source software
  • Experience in Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager
  • Experience with Machine Learning is also desirable
  • A self-starter with an entrepreneurial mindset
  • Curiosity and an eagerness to learn and improve status quo
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills
  • Preference for those familiar with Marketing, Web Analytics and UX Design, Tests/ Technical Questions to Ask
, '\n',


Must be located in Sydney and have a visa to work.

If this is you and you have a minimum of 2 - 5 years experience in conversion optimisation and data analysis we would love to talk to you. Please provide a CV and cover letter telling us why you believe you have what it takes.

, '\n']

['\n',

SBS has developed a coveted reputation for being one of the most distinctive and diverse media organisations in the world. Some may call this an understatement. After all, where else is dancing in Mardi Gras parades, spotting Lee Lin Chin in the café, or critiquing Eurovision performances all part of a days work?

, '\n',

We currently offer a rare opportunity within the newly created On Demand team for a User Experience Data Analyst. You will be taking a hypothesis-led approach to the analysis of user behavioural data from the On Demand platform to understand the user journey and how users are engaging with the player across all platforms. The output of your analysis will inform the prioritisation of both the backlog and the development and inclusion of new functionality and features. You will work as an integral part of the On Demand team bridging Qualitative UX research with existing behavioural data and A|B testing of new and existing features, driving a culture of experimentation and constant iteration.

, '\n',

What you will be doing

, '\n',
  • Master and analyse behavioural data flowing across all On Demand platforms to inform key decisions around digital product development, content curation and commercialisation
  • Support A|B testing with data analysis and insights
  • Innovate how we use behavioural data to engage more deeply with our audiences and drive loyalty and engagement with the platform.
  • Build user experience experiments and prototypes and validate these with data analysis
  • Independently perform data mining techniques and statistical analyses on large data sets to uncover critical patterns and predictive models.
, '\n',
  • Communicate effectively with small teams, formal presentations, and at business unit events with engaging storytelling.
, '\n',
  • Support the evolution of personalisation algorithms.
, '\n',
  • Build strong working relationships at all levels with internal clients and build problem-solving partnerships with clients and colleagues.
, '\n',

You'll be ready for your next big challenge and come equipped with:

, '\n',
  • Second to none analytical skills with an ability to transform data into plain English.
  • Hands-on experience working with a range of data sources and reporting formats.
, '\n',
  • Expertise in decomposing a problem and working through a technical approach and attacking a problem in a systematic way.
  • Experience working with digital product teams in an Agile environment.
  • Strong analysis and experimental design and prototyping skills with a keen sense for data gaps and inconsistencies.
  • Experience managing data-driven research from project inception to communication of insights and recommendations.
  • Experience in developing data visualisation independently or with tools.
  • Excellent oral, written and visual communication skills, particularly at explaining complex quantitative information to non-technical audiences.
  • Strong collaboration skills
  • Self-starter with the ability to work independently in a constantly changing environment as well as collaboratively with a broader team
  • Boundless enthusiasm
, '\n',

What are we looking for?

, '\n',

Our ideal person will possess an ability to distil the available first-party behavioural data to identify key opportunities to improve the user experience and deepen engagement with and consumption of On Demand content. You will have experience at taking a hypothesis-led approach to the prioritisation of your analysis, using a variety of analytical techniques to generate insights and recommendations, which will be captured in succinct reports that cut through to the key issues for technical and non-technical users alike. You will be a lateral thinker with an ability to take ownership to achieve a required outcome. You will be known for your attention to detail and structured approach to problem solving. Our ideal person will have worked in a similar role with exposure to similar digital products and services.

, '\n',

The successful candidate will be offered a competitive salary

, '\n',

SBS aims to inspire all Australias to explore and appreciate our diverse world and by doing so contribute to an inclusive and cohesive society. Its a purpose which drives and motivates our team and the reason we love doing what we do. Click Apply to take the first step in becoming a part of it.

, '\n',

, '\r\nTo apply online, please go to http://sbs.com.au/careers\r\n',

, '\n']

Who

• at least four years experience in market research specialising in data

title: b'\r\n          Survey Data Analyst\r\n        '
jd:
[' ',

, ' ',

About the business and the role

, ' ',

Austraffic has over 30 years' experience in the traffic and transport industry as data collection specialists. Austraffic's expertise is in survey design, execution, quality assurance, data processing and presentation of results.  Austraffic specialises in data collection and market research for local and state government, consultants and private clients

, ' ',
, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

Job tasks and responsibilities

, ' ',

Primary Responsibilities

, ' ',

Data Management

, ' ',
  1. Review client survey requirements in order to assist with providing accurate quotes and timelines for analysis tasks.
  2. Provide timely, accurate and detailed professionally presented project reports.
  3. Complete quality checks for data processed by others as required.
  4. Send formatted results to Clients with outage and observation details and reports (as required).
  5. Identify problems and improvements and raise Notices, assign tasks and follow up appropriately on the Austraffic Business Management Interface.
  6. Review instructions to the processing team to ensure timely and accurate traffic counts.
  7. Update work status and manage task priorities using the online project management tools.
, ' ',

Business Development

, ' ',
  1. Continually review Austraffic data management systems to ensure ease of use, fit for purpose design with a focus on automation for standardising data processing.
  2. Influence system design to assist with timely and accurate completion of data processing and reporting tasks.
  3. Continually review Austraffic analytic software for easy use & report presentations.
, ' ',

Office Management

, ' ',
  1. Ensure that a safe work place is provided for all workers and visitors.
  2. Ensure that the office complies with the requirements of the Business Management System and Business Management Interface (Austraffic intranet) usage requirement.
  3. Ensure the office is secured at the close of business and sufficient access provided to workers and suppliers, including access to the warehouse and car park facility as needed.
, ' ',

Secondary Activities

, ' ',

Project Delivery

, ' ',
  1. Undertake survey activities as required including but not limited to:
    • Survey Set Up
    • Site Supervision
    • Data Collection
    • Field Audits
  2. Escalate unresolved or incomplete activities as necessary to ensure timely closure of projects.
, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

Skills and experience

, ' ',

To be considered for a position you must have excellent English comprehension, written and verbal communication skills. You will be responsible for managing traffic data quality, interacting with the Survey Management Teams and working with client project briefs.  We are looking for individuals with a high level of attention to detail, an ability to work with numbers and in particular identify traffic patterns and apply logic to validate and test the outcomes. You will be expected to identify process improvements and enhance the business by proactively engaging with the team to develop system solutions to minimise repetition, ensure accuracy in results and deliver high quality client reports.

, ' ',

Core business tools include inhouse Traffic Survey software primarily producing excel based client reports, a Business Management System (Intranet) for project management and compliance and Microsoft suite for general administration and communications.  

, ' ',
, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

Job benefits and perks

, ' ',

The NSW office is located in Rydalmere, close to public transport. The hours of work will be between 8am-6pm, Monday-Friday or as otherwise required to meet project demand.  From time to time, there may be a requirement to travel to the Victorian office (located in Croydon South), for example to undertake training or provide project support.

, ' ',

Applications close: Monday, 8 May 2017.

, ' ',

Short listed applicants will be notified by email on Thursday, 11 May with first round interviews planned for Tuesday, 16 May 2017.

 

, ' ',

, ' ']

title: b'Data Analyst\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

Springer Nature is one of the world's leading global research, educational and professional publishers. Nature Research is a flagship portfolio of journals, products and services including Nature and the Nature-branded journals, dedicated to serving the scientific community.

, '\n',

We have an exciting opportunity for a Data Analyst to join our Nature Index team in Sydney.

, '\n',

The Nature Index is a database of high-quality research which tracks research output and collaboration by measuring the contribution of institutions using author affiliation information collated from primary research articles published in a select group of science journals. Providing a close to real-time indicator of high-quality research output and collaboration at the institutional, national and regional level, Nature Index tracks over 9,000 parent institutions and close to 50,000 child institutions worldwide. Data from over 58,000 natural science articles is added to the index each year, with a 12-month rolling window of data updated monthly and made openly available at the Nature Index website.

, '\n',

Reporting to the Data Product Manager and working within the global Nature Index team, the Data Analyst will be responsible for providing analytical support for all data-related aspects of Nature Index, including data development and enhancement, analyses for supplements and business development.

, '\n',

Key tasks include:

, '\n',
  • Data development – processing and optimizing data efficiency and quality, 'cleaning' raw data and employing efficient research and data mining strategies. Proposing solutions and strategies by troubleshooting.
  • Data Analysis - reviewing, analysing, interpreting and developing appropriate analyses to support data driven editorial projects, sales and marketing, and other related Springer Nature products.
  • Data Reporting - using various tools, including data visualisation to report results to a large variety of stakeholders.
, '\n',

You will need:

, '\n',
  • A postgraduate qualification in a scientific discipline, or experience related to large scale data analysis, or a degree in Computer Science or an equivalent discipline.
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
  • Technical expertise and knowledge in using analytical, data management and data visualisation tools (e.g. Tableau, Excel, Access, Gephi, R, etc.) to analyse large data sets.
  • Demonstrated knowledge of SQL or NoSQL data extraction and manipulation, and experience using JSON or XML data formats. Skills in one or more scripting languages would be beneficial (e.g. .net, Python, Visual Basic, R, etc.).
  • Ability to communicate and engage with a range of stakeholder groups and technical project teams and to break down and explain complex results.
  • Strong critical thinking skills, with the ability to see the "big picture" while also diving into the details where necessary.
  • Prior experience in manipulating and analysing large and complex data sets and/or working in research or the scientific community would be advantageous.
, '\n',

Applicants should include a CV, a covering letter explaining their interest in the position. 

, '\n',

Please note all applications must be submitted via the company website.

, '\n',

Closing date: midnight Wednesday 31 May.

, '\n',
, '\n']

title: b'Junior SQL Data Analyst\r\n      '
jd:
["Our client is an Australian market leader in the supply of Data Science & Data Analytics based services to Financial Service, Telecommunications, Retail and Utility sectors. They boast the industry' most comprehensive consumer 'Big Data' asset which they\r\n leverage to develop a broad range of Customer, Marketing and Credit Risk driven analytics solutions. Employing hundreds of the industry's brightest Analysts they offer a hot bed for innovation and guarantee exceptional opportunities for career progression.\xa0\xa0\xa0",
, '\r\n\xa0',
, '\r\nAs a result of the ongoing success of the business a brand new position has been created for a Junior SQL Customer Data Analyst to join the Sydney team and support the on going delivery of a range of complex data fulfilment requests. As a junior SQL Customer\r\n Data Analyst the core responsibilities of your role will cover, but will not be limited to:\xa0',
, '\n',
  • Engaging with stakeholders to consult around data fulfilment requirements, discuss approaches and negotiate timelines.
  • Leveraging your strong SQL, SAS or R data management skills you will extract, manipulate and merge large volumes data from a variety of complex data sources. Delivering against ongoing requests from the business for timely and accurate SQL, SAS or R data sets to support their strategic initiatives.
  • Provide support to variety of ongoing stakeholder driven initiatives that could include; marketing campaign execution & optimisation, customer insights analysis, statistical modelling, credit analysis, credit risk / scorecard modelling, product & portfolio analysis, digital / web analytics, data visualization / dashboards, sales reporting & insights.
, '\r\nThe successful applicant will come with exposure to working in a data driven analytics environment, where analyzing and delivering insights from large data sets has been the key focus. You will be able to demonstrate:\xa0',
, '\n',
  • Strong technical skills and experience (1-2yrs) using SQL, SAS or R to extract, manipulate and merge large volumes of customer behavioral or transactional data from a variety of source systems (e.g. SQL Teradata, Oracle SQL, SQL Server, MYSQL, SAS Base or R) 
  • At least one year of experience working in a commercial environment with large volumes of data relating to; customer insights, marketing campaigns, customer reporting, risk reporting, risk analysis, statistical modelling, marketing mix modelling, credit analysis etc   
  • Strong attention to detail, prioritization, & process improvement skills.
  • Educated to a minimum of degree level in a highly analytical discipline such as - Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, Actuarial Studies, Data Science, Computer Science etc. 
, "\r\nTo apply for this position please click on the 'Apply' button below or you're resume and cover note to ben@correlateresources.com\r\n "]

title: b'Data & Market Analyst\r\n      '
jd:
[
, '\n',

, '\n',

, '\n',
  • Contribute to the analysis of renewable and energy markets
  • Communicate market trends and insights
  • Outstanding opportunity to build on your technical skills
  • Location: Sydney, NSW
  • Application close date: 22nd May 2017
, '\n',

ORIGIN - AUSTRALIA’S LEADING INTEGRATED ENERGY COMPANY

, '\n',

An integral part of Australia’s energy future, we explore, produce, generate and sell energy to power millions of Australian homes and businesses every day, keeping them going and growing.
Origin is the largest energy retailer in Australia, and with 4.3 million customers we’re constantly evolving and changing to better suit their needs. Our activities include power generation, energy trading, the sale of LPG, electricity, natural gas and solar as well as the development of new and emerging technologies. Consider your possibilities with Australia’s leading integrated energy company.

The Role

The Portfolio Development team sits within the Future Energy and Business Development business function and is responsible for assisting the organisation in achieving its growth objectives by understanding and quantifying the markets in which Origin operates, and seeking out, evaluating and advising on energy market investments, acquisitions and other portfolio development activities, including the decarbonisation of energy markets.

As a key part of this team, you will contribute to the qualitative and quantitative analysis of a decarbonising energy market, including the markets they will create, the new technologies they will bring forward at the distributed and utility scale levels, and the impact and way forward for both energy markets and for Origin’s business.

The role involves operating and developing models, market research and data management which contribute to the analysis of renewable and energy markets and how they will impact Origin.

Your key accountabilities will include:

, '\n',
  • Modelling of carbon and renewable prices, supply and demand forecasts for Australian energy and carbon markets to be used throughout the business
  • Build internal databases to analyse and store key market and forecast data, using data visualisation tools to communicate key insights to internal stakeholders
  • Provide market research and analysis to a range of different stakeholders including the Portfolio Development team and other stakeholders primarily within Future Energy and Business Development
  • Operate and help develop financial and carbon pricing models to forecast mid to long term carbon and renewable markets pricing and supply/demand
  • Preparation of presentations and analysis for communication of findings to key internal stakeholders
, '\n',

Is This You?

You will be tertiary-qualified in Economics, Information Technology or a numerate or quantitative related discipline and have commercial experience in modelling and analysis of markets, technologies and commodities.

As the position also requires database management and data analysis and visualisation, you will have experience with SQL/Oracle, SAS and Tableau and can demonstrate expertise in data management and programming skills.

As a proactive, self-motivated and collaborative individual, you will have exceptional written communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to grasp, communicate and comment upon new, complex issues.

We embrace the diversity of our people and flexible working arrangements to ensure our workforce is representative of the communities that we serve.

, '\n',

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples are encouraged to apply.

MAKE AN IMPACT ON AUSTRALIA'S ENERGY FUTURE

, '\n',

If dynamic and challenging career opportunities and workplace flexibility are important to you, go with the employer that thinks differently.

For more information, please contact Iain Pratt on 03 8665 7325.

Job Requisition: 46522

, '\n']

['An outstanding and exclusive opportunity presented by the team at Alloc8 for an experienced Data and Governance professional. Supporting the design, implementation and on-going support of a business critical, greenfield Governance programme in Sydney with both the financial and business backing to really succeed.',

,
, ' As the Senior Data Analyst the role requires a blend of strong technical acumen when delivering Data Governance, Data Quality and Master Data Management solutions as well as outstanding communication, customer engagement and business facing capabilities',
, ' ',
, ' ', In order to be considered you will bring the following attributes to the role:,
, ' ',

  • Experience driving Data Governance implementation alongside broader Data Strategies within enterprise technology environments.

  • Comfortable when working with and driving vendors and technical delivery teams.

title: b'Data Analyst\r\n        '
jd:
['\xa0',
, '\n', Duties and Responsibilities,
, '\n',
  • Support all aspects of data creation and migration, including identifying, creating, cleaning and validating data extraction, transforming, and loading data into the SAP environment
  • Supports the activities of data partners. Review  detailed validation reports provided by data partners, providing feedback to the senior data analyst
  • Capture "as is" and "to be" data flows Assist business analysts in the definition of AS-IS and TO-BE processes and overlay with detailed data flows
  • Review cleansing and conversion rules and provide feedback to Senior Data Analyst
  • Gather data from non-system sources. Cleanse data from non-system sources and extracts from systems provided by data Partners
  • Collect and create new data as nominated by the Senior Data Analyst, as needed conducting data surveys
  • Provide gathered, cleansed and created data to data partners in agreed formats
  • Assist with trial migrations, review post migration validation reports and provide feedback to the Senior Data Analyst

title: b'Data Insights Analyst\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

Data Insights Analyst required to develop predictive models to identify talent solutions for the business.

Your new company
This Australian based company provide innovative business solutions for commercial organisations to retain ongoing profitability, ensure safety standards are upheld, and maximise service inefficiencies.

Your new role
Sitting within the HR function, a Data Insights Analyst is required to develop predictive models and scorecards using a wide range of descriptive and inferential statistics to identify talent solutions for the business. You will also be responsible for preparing proactive analytics and bench marking reports for HR teams, senior business leaders on trends associated with key human capital factors. As the SME you will be consulting on HR and business data to determine the proper approach for analysis, success measurement, and connection points based on desired outcomes.

What you'll need to succeed
This position would suit someone with around 3-4 years’ experience within data analytics who is very proficient with Excel and predictive modelling who can confidently present data back to the business to provide meaningful insights. Experience with programming languages such as Python or “R” would be advantageous but not essential.

What you'll get in return
You will be joining a dynamic team with an opportunity to bring new business insights to the organisation.

What you need to do now
Please contact Ross Haughton at Hays on 02 9249 2255 or email your latest CV to Ross.Haughton@hays.com.au for consideration.

, '\n']

Assetlink Group is an Australian owned integrated facilities services provider and global asset management technology company We provide both individual services and tailored integrated solutions through our two divisions, Assetlink Services and AssetFuture.

, ' ',

to http://www.pipint.com/en/careers/join-pip/apply-now

title: b'Data & Reporting Analyst \r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

The Company

, ' ',

News Corp Australia is the nation's largest media company operating over 150 household name brands across print, digital and multimedia including The Daily Telegraph, The Australian and news.com.au. We are proud to be a central part of News Corp, a leading global network of powerful brands in news and information services, sports programming in Australia, digital real estate services, book publishing, digital education and pay-tv distribution in Australia including Fox Sports, Dow Jones, Harper Collins, Realestate.com.au and The Wall Street Journal. This is a flexible contract role is based in our Surry Hills based Head Office.

, ' ',

The Role

Your role as our Data & Reporting Analyst will see you working with National Reporting and Analytics team, supporting major projects and initiatives to deliver reporting and automated insights for the business to make timely and fact-based decisions, as well as feeding into more advanced analytics and models. 

, ' ',

The ideal candidate will be technically minded with a high level of attention to detail and a passion for translating complex and raw datasets into actionable insights that add value and meet business requirements.

Your key responsibilities will include the following:

  • Design, develop and deliver regular reports to track and analyse customer behaviour and Key Performance Indicators

  • Ad hoc data extraction, manipulation & analysis for the purpose of insights and recommendations.

  • Experience working with BI reporting tools (e.g. Tableau _- Intermediate to Advances, Excel – Advanced, etc)

  • Proven ability to transform large, complex and raw datasets into clear and actionable insights
  • Proactive approach to developing regular reporting, tools and dashboards to support and enable stakeholders to access data driven insights independently
  • Experience partnering with stakeholders across technical and on-technical disciplines
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills

News Corp Australia is evolving in response to the expectations and challenges of the digital world in which we now live. For more information on careers at News Corp Australia visit:www.newscorpaustralia.com/careers

,
, ' ', Why work for this company?,

title: b'Analyst - Data Solutions\r\n    '
jd:
['\n',

Whichever way our customers choose to engage with us, our people are accountable, motivated and passionate about delivering an exceptional level of service and enhancing financial wellbeing

We can’t live without understanding the WHY factor

, '\n',

Do work that matters

, '\n',

You’re driving the future of our business. Helping make sure CommBank make data driven decisions. You will play a key role in the development and enhancement of information solutions that underpin self-service analytics and visualisation.

, '\n',

, '\n',

You’ll be in a sweet spot – working on highly visible projects that bring huge impact to the business. Knowing both data and the business needs so well means you’ll grow quickly into a data Subject Matter Expert who can be called upon to speak in layman’s terms.

, '\n',

, '\n',

See yourself in our team

, '\n',

In this role you’ll have the opportunity to focus on requirements gathering, data acquisition and development. We want you to bring your knowledge and experience to contribute and influence solution design. You’ll be working in close collaboration with Data visualization, Design and Operations teams. In this role you’ll help contribute to project planning by providing effort estimation, and gathering and documenting business and technical requirements.

, '\n',

, '\n',

With your fresh eyes, you’ll contribute and assist with agile processes, data asset solution design and outcomes, as well as continuous improvement for current practices and processes.

, '\n',

We want you to bring your fresh set of eyes and help us get better.

, '\n',

, '\n',

Your path looks like:

In such a visible role, the number of people, business units and teams you’ll get to know will be huge. You’ll have the ability to plot your course – tapping on shoulders who you’ve previously helped out. But we’ll empower you to get there, supporting you with on the job development and exposure.

Strong understanding of BI/Data visualisation tools and techniques

The people, businesses and communities we serve are wonderfully diverse. To reflect this, we’re committed to hiring a similarly diverse workforce. With a focus on inclusion, accessibility and flexibility, we’ll support you at every stage of your career.

title: b'\r\n          BUSINESS DATA & REPORTING ANALYST - Commercial Focus\r\n        '
advertiser: Partners in Performance International Pty Ltd -
jd:
[' ',

Special Note: Candidates should note before submitting their application that we are unable to accept applications from IT Business Analysts as this is not the skill set we are seeking.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',
  • Highly successful, global firm
  • Attractive Competitive Remuneration Package
  • Global Head Office Based - Sydney CBD
  • Permanent, Full-time Role
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Partners in Performance (PIP) is a fast-paced global management consultancy with its Head Office located in Sydney CBD.  As a Firm we are about Unleashing Potential in our clients and our people. We assist organisations to deliver rapid and sustainable improvements in performance. We take a pragmatic 'at the coal face' approach to performance improvement. Our work spans strategy to procurement, revenues to costs, organisational culture to production debottlenecking and safety.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

ABOUT THE ROLE

, ' ',

Due to an internal promotion we are currently recruiting for the position of commercial Business Data & Reporting Analyst (not financial).  You will assist with day-to-day analytical challenges across all of the business and with specific strategic initiatives.

, ' ',

The role has the key following activities: -

, ' ',

*Undertaking analysis of data (non-finance), producing meaningful insights for multiple areas of the business

, ' ',

*Preparing reports as required including:

, ' ',
  • Creating and updating KPI  documents for relevant Departments and individuals
  • Producing and maintaining the weekly "mass balance" staffing report
  • Support creation of weekly/monthly Director reports
, ' ',

* Assisting in measuring progress of ideas and regularly reviewing in consultation with the relevant Heads of Department and escalating quickly to ensure delays/bottlenecks are effectively managed

, ' ',

*Working with Department Heads to identify and implement process improvements

, ' ',

*Providing general support with any ad-hoc reports or analysis as required

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

THE CANDIDATE REQUIREMENTS

, ' ',

The role will appeal to a results-driven, commercially astute individual who possesses excellent analytical skills; sharp attention to detail and problem solving capabilities coupled with superior communication and interpersonal skills. Your other strengths include your strong relationship building with the ability to deal with ambiguity and changing priorities in a fast-paced environment.

, ' ',

In addition you will have the following;

, ' ',
  • The role will suit a recent graduate with between 3-5 years prior experience in a Business/Commercial Analyst role post Degree and are ready for that next step. 
  • Degree qualified in a Commerce/Finance related discipline with excellent academic results 
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Good relationship building/stakeholder management skills
  • Strong systems aptitude – able to grasp new systems and concepts quickly
  • Advanced Excel essential
  • Intermediate PowerPoint essential
  • Professional Services industry sector experience would be highly regarded 
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

JOIN US

, ' ',

PIP is committed to attracting, developing and retaining highly talented people and supports a rewarding and values-driven workplace culture. To attract talent we offer a competitive remuneration package.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

INTERESTED?

Application Process:  Please forward a cover letter, CV and academic transcripts to our Application Portal only addressing how to demonstrate "The Key Requirements" stated above. Closing date for applications 7/5/2017. 

, ' ',

to http://www.pipint.com/en/careers/join-pip/apply-now

, ' ',

Australian Citizen/Permanent Residents Only.

, ' ',

No calls or unsolicited applications from agencies please, including from existing suppliers. Thank you.
 

, ' ']

title: b'SQL Data & Insights Analyst - CONTRACT\r\n      '
jd:
['Our client is an innovative and forward thinking Market Research agency who have successfully develop and delivered a number of cutting edge startegic data driven products to the FMCG/Retail industry. As a result of the success of the business they are\r\n entering into an exciting phase of growth and are looking to recruit an experienced SQL Data and Insights specialist to join the team and support the fulfilment of one of their most successful product streams. This immediate start contract will offer the successful\r\n applicant a fun and vibrant work environment and a long term opportunity to support the development of this innovative arm of the business.\xa0',
, '\n',
, '\r\nAs a SQL Data and Insights specialist the responsibilities of this contract role will involve but not be limited to:',
, '\n',
  • Engaging with internal and external stakeholders to consult around incoming and outgoing dashboard requests. Defining project requirements, discuss methodologies, negotiating timelines/deliverables.
  • Leverage strong SQL programming (i.e. SQL Server, Oracle SQL, SQL Teradata) to extract, manage and manipulate large and complex datasets ready for analysis.
  • Perform a variety of statistical analysis techniques and develop compelling data visualizations (Tableau, Qlikview, Power BI etc) that will support client projects and highlight strategic recommendations.
  • Proactively identify and develop enhancements to existing processes and models that will improve data accuracy, integrity, reporting efficiency and facilitate business understanding.
, '\r\nThe successful applicant will come from a strong background working in a data driven insights environment and will be able to demonstrate:',
, '\n',
  • Strong SQL Programming skills for interrogating, managing and manipulating large and complex data sets (i.e. SQL Sever, Oracle SQL, SQL Teradata, MYSQL etc.)
  • Experience analysing large volumes of transactional data to identify key insights, patterns and trends that will support predefined strategic initiatives. (segmentation analysis, basket analysis, next best action analysis, store location & branch optimisation, customer profiling, customer lifetime value, hypothesis testing, campaign analytics etc) 
  • Experience working with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Qlikview or PowerBI will prove highly advantageous.
  • Any exposure to working in a marketing, media or research agency with exposure to Retail/FMCG data will prove highly advantageous. 
, "\r\nTo apply for this position please click on the 'Apply' button below or you're resume and cover note to ben@correlateresources.com\r\n "]
