Some of the products and services provided include deposit accounts, loan accounts, equity loans and electronic and internet banking facilities.

, ' ',

We are going through an exciting transformation period and are are now looking to bring on a Senior Business Analyst with strong Agile experience to own our data migration stream.

title: b'Reporting and Insight Analyst\r\n    '
jd:
['Based in our new North Sydney Offices, you’ll be reporting into the Demand Analytics and Reporting Manager working alongside a team of talented analysts who are based in Hobart. As an Insight Analyst your role is to create critical data sets and insights to support the Customer Care division’s delivery of business objectives. You will be responsible for producing regular operational reporting and developing key insights. ',

As an Insight Analyst, you’ll work cross-functionally with other teams to understand issues, trends and opportunities to improve the experience of our customers. To succeed you’ll need to be an exceptional relationship manager and have the technical ability to source, analyse and present data driven insight in a meaningful and engaging way while working to aggressive timeframes. We’re looking for someone who can not only create reports but can communicate the insights in a way that prompts stakeholders at all levels of the business to take action.

, ' ',

This is a perfect opportunity for someone early into their career as a data analyst to grow and develop. The successful candidate will possess:

, ' ',
  • a solid understanding of business reporting preferably with experience using Teradata in a position supporting a sales or service function
  • a degree in Mathematics, Statistics, IT or a related discipline (highly desirable but not mandatory)
  • Excel mastery with the ability query complex databases to create reports 
  • a problem solving and analytical nature
  • a demonstrated ability to prioritise and achieve strict deadlines
  • the ability to work autonomously and remotely whilst still retaining strong team engagement and collaborative approach
  • excellent communication and presentation skills 
, ' We offer an amazing workplace with a dynamic and cooperative culture empowering you to be the best you can be and to have fun while doing it. Enjoy working in a professional yet very relaxed environment with people who are at the top of their game. ',

If you’re passionate about data and the impact your insights can have on the success of the business, then we want to hear from you!

, ' ',

SK94630A

title: b'Data Analyst & Support Officer\r\n    '
jd:
['\n',

My client is looking for a Data Analyst & Support Officer for an initial 12 month contract working within a Government organisation.

, '\n',

 

, '\n',
  • Advanced Excel skills are a must for this position, you will need to be switched on in terms of data e.g. what is happening with the data and what it is applying to.
  • It is a very hectic and exciting fast paced work environment so you will need to be flexible and adapt well to change on both a daily basis and within the role.
, '\n',

 

, '\n',

Key Responsibilities:

, '\n',
  • Extract and manipulate routine to complex data, ensuring the accuracy, integrity and relevance of information pertaining to comparative and impact analysis activities to support efficient processes.
  • Comparative assessments, impact analysis, and verify data.
  • Schedule and prepare for meetings, briefings, pool assessments and interviews, preparing correspondence for impacted staff.
  • Contribute to and support the creation, and ongoing maintenance and analysis of complex data sources, and communicate identified risks promptly to the BP Implementation to support efficient processes across the program.
  • Draft templates and other documentation related to the consultation and implementation processes, including at the various stages of the placement process to support consistency and effectiveness across the program.
  • Manage communication channels efficiently and effectively, directing inquiries as appropriate to facilitate the effective operation of the change process across the relevant business area.
  • Gather, collate and provide background information to support informed decision making and planning.
  • Maintain appropriate and accurate HR and records management systems, to ensure the integrity of data and to support the efficient retrieval of information at all stages of the program.
  • Provide panels support during the pooled assessment processes to facilitate a consistent and effective process.
  • Work in collaboration and provide support in recruitment, assessment, placement, onboarding and related processes to enable the delivery of outcomes for the business.
, '\n',

 

, '\n',

Key Challenges:

, '\n',
  • Experience in facilitating and providing administration support for Human Resources and/or Recruitment within a high volume environment.
  • Excellent MS Office skills, particularly in word, Excel and PowerPoint. Advanced Excel skills are essential including skills in presenting, manipulating and analysing accurate data.
  • Working through a significant period of transformation where changes to structures, processes and cultures will be ongoing and it is critical to maintain confidentiality and deliver to strict deadlines and stakeholder expectations.
  • Keeping both outcome driven and strong customer focus in a complex environment with multiple work streams and high volume and often competing workloads that will challenge the delivery of timely outcomes.
  • Maintaining systems and processes to effectively coordinate the activities of BP Implementation and while providing high quality customer service to internal and external stakeholders.
  • Strong analytical and written communication skills
  • Experience working in a confidential environment with excellent organisation and coordination skills.
  • Preferably have Visio skills (Microsoft office for org. charts) would be advantageous.
  • Must have SAP experience.
, '\n']

jd:

, '\n',

title: b'Market Data Analyst - Tier 1 Bank - Market Rates\r\n    '
jd:
['Tier 1 Financial Bank is seeking an experienced Market Data Analyst for an initial short term contract. As part of a commodities remediation project, we are seeking a candidate with very strong technical skills.',
, '\n',
, '\n', You must have:
, '\n',
  • 5+ years of experience working in Financial markets with direct exposure to technology platforms
  • Market Data experience - Bloomberg, Reuters, Markit, Super Derivatives, ICE Data, etc. (highly desirable)
  • Proven hands-on experience in using Oracle 11g Database 
  • Undergraduate in a numerical discipline or business related discipline with significant numerical component
  • Strong SQL skills dealing with Big Data historical data sets
  • Good understanding of Desktop applications, Oracle tables and schemas 
  • Robust Communication and project management skills, liaising with Commodities project team and vendors and technical support teams
, '\n',
Preferred:
, '\n',
  • Post-graduate qualifications in a business discipline or professional designation in CFA, GARP, PRM 
, '\r\nClick the "Apply" button below or contact Karthik on (02) 8227 4510 for a confidential discussion.\r\n ']

[' ',

A great opportunity for a Market Data Analyst / Data Scientist to join Australia's leading developer of retail planning products and database segmentation solutions. RDA's unique web-services are used by some of Australia's largest and most successful corporations.

 

What we do…

RDA Research's web-based retail planning and segmentation solutions are supplied through our geoTribes branded segmentation products and geoTribes Explorer web service. We have partnerships with leading research companies and market our products in Australia, New Zealand and North America.

RDA is at the leading edge of applying market research data in retail planning, database enhancement and digital media targeting through our proprietary synthetic population and data fusion models.

 

About the role…

You will be responsible for delivering data analysis projects using client data and building statistical databases for our web portals.

You will develop your understanding of business problems and have a key role in the development & application of our products, working closely with our clients and data partners.

You will develop your technical skills in statistical analysis, modeling, geodemographics, retail network analysis, big data, SAS programming and other analytical disciplines.

 

Ideal qualifications…

  • Tertiary graduate in a relevant quantitative discipline, eg. statistics, science, economics or psychology.
  • Strong academic record.
  • An avid and continuous learner with strategic problem-solving skills.
  • Experience using statistical analysis tools, SAS preferred.

 

Key requirements…

  • An understanding of how statistical analysis works to solve business problems.
  • A proven track record in data analysis & experience in statistical database production.
  • Ability to take responsibility for running & prioritizing projects, with on-time delivery.
  • Experience in programming eg. R, SAS, Python, Visual Basic or SQL.
  • Excellent verbal & written communication skills.
  • Enjoy working as part of a small, professional team.
  • Strong graduate applicants will be considered.

For more details about RDA visit our website at www.rdaresearch.com


To apply for the above position, please use the Seek link and include your academic record. Please note that only short listed candidates will be contacted.

No recruitment agencies please.


]

Key Responsibilites Involve;

, ' ',
  • Data gathering, digitization and analysis using statistical techniques
  • Acquire data from primary and secondary data sources
  • Maintain databases
  • Identify, analyse and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
  • Filter and “clean” data and correct problemsYou will be a quality-focused individual with excellent attention to detail, have good communication skills and have the ability to work in fast-paced team. In addition you will adaptable, flexible and be a critical thinker.
, ' ',

To be considered for these roles you will need to have experience as a data analyst and possess technical knowledge in data mining and analysis.

, ' ',

Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analysing datasets is essential. Knowledge and experience programming (R) and GIS (ArcGIS) will be highly regarded.

, ' ']

title: b'SSIS Data Analyst, TSQL Analyst - SSIS ETL Data Warehous Business System Analyst'
salary: b'End User Company - Great Package, Bonuses + Agile'
jd:
[' ',

 

, ' ',

Your Benefits:

, ' ',
  • Great Remuneration Package;
  • Generous Bonuses;
  • End-user Organization;
  • Work within an Agile Environment;
  • Brand-new High Profile Projects;
  • Convenient Location + Parking;
  • Friendly & Flat Structure;
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

You will be joining a successful end-user organization with high retention rates and a proud culture in providing a vibrant environment for their employees to work, learn and develop their career.

, ' ',

You are a well-spoken, intelligent individual with experience across Microsoft Business Intelligence suit of products as a Data Analyst or Developer with hands-on experience in the use of TSQL across ETL / Data Warehouse applications.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

To be successful for this role, your CV will need to reflect on following skill-set:

, ' ',

 

, ' ',
  • Immaculate communications and strong command of English both written and verbal;
  • Hands-on design and development experience across T-SQL development / Stored procedures;
  • Some experience with SSIS ETL;
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Advantageous but not essential:

, ' ',
  • Any experience with SSAS cubes and/or SSRS reporting is highly advantageous but not essential;
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

You can either apply here or send your application directly to Sonia at Sonia@infinitypro.com.au quoting 0070DataAnalyst. We can be contacted on (02) 9687 1025 for a confidential discussion, however please send your resume prior to making contact.

, ' ',

Please ensure all documents are sent in Microsoft word format.

, ' ']

[' ',
  • Full-time, permanent position
  • Sydney, CBD
  • Unique opportunity in a specialist field
, ' ',

About the role

, ' ',

Copyright Agency is looking for a passionate and highly motivated Data Analyst or Data Scientist to help us support the Australian creative community by proactively undertaking analysis, and by developing and maintaining data-driven tools and workflows. In this role you will:

, ' ',
  • Consult with internal stakeholders to identify and deliver business-relevant information and analysis
  • Work on complex productionised data-pipelines in which statistical/machine-learning algorithms are integral
  • Identify, scope, plan and execute projects grounded in data that will help Copyright Agency support creators
  • Enhance and add to the existing ecosystem of bespoke R packages that underpin the analytics within Copyright Agency.
, ' ',

About you

, ' ',

You will hold tertiary qualifications in a relevant discipline (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or Econometrics) and have at least 2 years' professional experience in an analytical role. You will have excellent communication skills that allow you to liaise, explain and document complex technical processes and solutions to a variety of stakeholders with different levels of technical understanding.You will be a proactive individual keen to learn the business, optimise processes, solves problems and identify new business areas for our Australian creators. Your experience in R, SQL and Excel, sufficient experience allows you to:

, ' ',
  • Create, document and maintain bespoke R packages
  • Build interactive web applications in R Shiny
  • Manipulate structured and unstructured data from various sources
  • Create and evaluate statistical and machine learning models
  • Integrate R tools with other systems (e.g. SQL databases)
  • Generate clear and accurate reports in Excel for internal customers.
, ' ',

About Us

, ' ',

Copyright Agency l Viscopy collects and distributes fees for the use of copyright text and images. Copyright Agency is the declared society for the statutory schemes in education and government as well as the Resale Royalty Scheme for visual artists. Copyright Agency also licenses commercial organisations to copy and share information without risk of copyright infringement. Copyright Agency also manages the licensing activities of Viscopy Limited under a services agreement. Copyright Agency provides philanthropic support to Australia's cultural community through our grants program, the Cultural Fund. For more information visit www.copyright.com.au | www.viscopy.net.au

, ' ',

How to apply

, ' ',

Please forward your resume and a covering letter to recruitment@copyright.com.au

, ' ',

Copyright Agency | Viscopy encourages applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.

, ' ',

Applications close 28 April 2017.

, ' ',

Applications will be treated with the strictest of confidence. Only successful applicants will be contacted. To be eligible to apply you must have an appropriate Australian or New Zealand work visa.

, ' ']

title: b'Finance Systems & Data Analyst\r\n      '
jd:
[
, ' Finance Systems & Data Analyst required to sit in the finance team & ensure the integrity and accuracy of supplier and customer data maintaining high quality of internal data while maintaining compliance with data quality policies.',
, ' \xa0\xa0',
, ' Responsibilities:',
, ' \xa0\xa0',
, ' ',
  • Provide the CFO Team and other Business Units with on-going support in data reporting, data cleansing, data quality checks and SQL queries.
  • Ensure data is accurate, complete, appropriately maintained and provide on-ongoing assistance to the Finance team.
  • Supplier master data creation and maintenance for all business units in Oracle 12
  • Maintain Oracle iProcurement Delegation matrix, Cost Centres creation, Cost Centre and legal entity hierarchy, GL accounts, Product creation
  • Run GL Consolidation, perform period Open/Closure
, ' \xa0\xa0',
, ' Skills Required:\xa0\xa0',
, ' ',
  • Minimum of 3 years experience preferably in a similar role gained in a commercial environment
  • Experienced with ERP financial systems, must be Oracle R12 proficient 
  • Good SQL & MS Office (Word, Excel and PowerPoint) Skills 
  • Strong communicator (both oral and written) and able to manage relationships with a range of key stakeholders
, ' \xa0\xa0',
, ' For more information, please contact Maritn Fletcher on martin.fletcher@perigongroup.com.au Or to apply, hit the "apply" button. ']

title: b'Data Insights Analyst_Consultant\r\n      '
jd:
['Big Wave Digital is excited to be in partnership with this growing customer communication management solutions business and we are excited to be hiring the newest recruit for their busy data marketing & delivery team. We are on the hunt for an experienced\xa0', Data Analyst/Data Consultant, ', someone who is deeply passionate about working with big data, a commercial mind and first class communication skills.',
, ' ',
, ' This is a unique and hybrid data role, combining strong data analysis and consultative skills with the ability to contribute to the building of proof of concept solutions that show true value to the existing client base. ',
, ' ',
, ' The core focus of this role and skills required include ',
, ' • Working through large volumes of data to deliver customer insights, marketing campaigns, customer reporting, statistical and market mix modelling',
, ' • Putting together presentation decks, and presenting insights to key stakeholders, both internal and external',
, ' • Marketing analytics, and a familiarity with a range of analytical tools such as Tableau',
, ' • Sourcing and integrating data from a range of sources including Google Analytics, Adobe Site Catalyst, ERP Systems etc',
, ' • Demonstrated knowledge of data modelling techniques',
, ' • Working knowledge of SQL would be desirable',
, ' • Proficiency with development tools to allow self-sufficiency with the analysis and investigation of data sets to provide and communicate data driven insights and reports to clients',
, ' ',
, " This is a great opportunity for a consultative Data Analyst looking to move into a consulting role or, launch a data practice inside an established business. If you're innovative and want to experiment with new technologies and prototypes, you can't go by this role. \xa0Australian Citizens or Australian Permanent Residents can only be considered.",
, ' ',
, " So, if you're a talented and motivated analyst looking to further your career in Data Analytics and Insights generation, please send your application in confidence to Dayna Stewart | Head of Digital and Data Recruitment | Big Wave Digital| \xa0dayna@bigwavedigital.com.au| www.bigwavedigital.com.au "]

title: b'Business Data Analyst\r\n    '
jd:
[' ',
  • One of Australia's leading research & teaching universities
  • Vibrant campus life with a strong sense of community & inclusion
  • Enjoy a career that makes a difference by collaborating & learning from the best
, ' ',

At UNSW, we pride ourselves on being a workplace where the best people come to do their best work.

, ' ',

The Research Systems & Solutions Unit is one of four units reporting to the Executive Director (Research). The role of the Research Systems & Solutions Unit is to provide central systems support to a number of units within the Division of Research, ensuring all systems are functional to business operations. By working closely with other units in the Division of Research the Unit provides solutions to improve business process and increase efficiency.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

About the role

, ' ',
  • A$81K - A$96K per year (plus 17% superannuation and leave loading)
  • Continuing
  • Full-time (35 hours per week)
, ' ',

The Business Data Analyst monitors the quality and presentation of data and continuously reviews processes within the Division of Research to ensure the delivery of high quality customer focussed services to the University.

, ' ',

The Business Data Analyst assists the Team Leader Research Systems & Solutions by:

, ' ',
  • Providing ad-hoc reporting through business system tools.
  • Collecting, analysing, interpreting, and summarising data in preparation for the generation of statistical and analytical reports.
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

You should systematically address the selection criteria listed within the position description in your application.

, ' ',

Please apply online - applications will not be accepted if sent to the contact listed.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Contact:
Karthikeyan Ramanathan
Team Leader Research Systems & Solutions, Research
T: +61 (2) 9385 9913
E: k.ramanathan@unsw.edu.au

, ' ',
, ' ',
, ' ']

title: b'Senior Analyst - Big Data\r\n    '
jd:
[
, '\n',

Your New Company & Team
Retail Banking Services (RBS) is the public face of CommBank, delivering a seamless banking experience for the future, to our 10 million + personal and small business customers.

, '\n',

The Customer Decisioning (CD) team uses data-based quantitative techniques, in partnership with our colleagues in Marketing and Product, to identify and deliver relevant propositions to CBA customers and prospects.

, '\n',

Data, Enablement & Visualization (DEV) is one of the key areas within the CD function. In partnership with Enterprise Services (ES) and vendors, the DEV team is responsible for the Data and Infrastructure strategy and roadmap, developing, maintaining and optimising the data and system infrastructure and processes.

, '\n',

The Challenge & Project Description
The role will report into the Senior Manager Marketing Data Assets and work in consultation with Product Owners, Executive Mangers at ES.

, '\n',

What will success look like?
The breakdown of your role is to participate in the enhancement and implementation of all data and infrastructure development related to CD data, tools, technology and infrastructure. You'll contribute to by:

, '\n',

1- Driving enhancements on the Big Data platform

, '\n',
  • End to end project ownership
  • Remediate any data asset and infrastructure: run and refresh its data sources
  • Develop data assets in Hadoop
  • Perform hands on enhancement and changes to data assets
  • Implement changes
  • Productionise with Enterprise Services (ES) and document innovative changes
  • Perform Impact Analysis of data changes and developments, and reporting back to the team and customer of any impacts that may be significant to them
, '\n',

2- Team leadership

, '\n',
  • Role model the CBA vision and values that drives employee engagement
  • Train team members
  • Participate in building a strong team culture
, '\n',

3- Executing on the strategy

, '\n',
  • Drive the future capability
  • Develop a partnering relationship with customers and stakeholders and adopt a long-term perspective
  • Develop and deliver on your own business plan for you and your team
  • Ensure your business plan is reflective of the business priorities
  • Manage your own pipeline
, '\n',

Key Skills & Experience
1- Experience in:

, '\n',
  • Scala and one of the following (object oriented or functional) programming language (e.g. Java, C++, C#)
  • Big Data infrastructure (e.g. Hadoop, Spark)
  • SQL development and script automation, database design
  • Extract Transform and Load (ETL) process, data structures, algorithms, operating systems, and/or distributed systems
  • SDLC process and project lifecycle
  • Agile practices
  • Impact analysis
  • Enterprise Data Warehousing (EDW) and reporting platforms experience
, '\n',

2- Highly regarded:

, '\n',
  • Bachelors in Computer Science / Engineering
  • Industry certifications (e.g. Teradata, Microsoft, IBM, Oracle, etc)
, '\n',

FYI, the tech stack comprises of:

, '\n',
  • Hadoop and Spark for distributed data storage and processing
  • Teradata, Hbase and Cassandra to support OLAP and OLTP requirements
  • Scala and Java for our back-end applications and data integration tools
  • Tableau, d3 and Shiny for presentation of data insights
  • Python and R for data science, machine learning and rapid data profiling
  • Cloudera Search / Solr to support fast, flexible and familiar data exploration
, '\n',

People & Culture

, '\n',
  • The people, businesses and communities we serve are wonderfully diverse. To reflect this, we're committed to hiring a similarly diverse workforce. With a focus on inclusion, accessibility and flexibility, we'll support you at every stage of your career
  • Flexible working hours / work from home allowance
  • Energetic, delivery orientated team
, '\n',

Compensation & Benefits

, '\n',
  • Lucrative salary and bonus component
  • Have a meaningful impact one of the one of the top priorities in the bank
  • Opportunity to be a part of world class data analytics and infrastructure projects
  • On the job training provided with lots of room to grow
  • Opportunity to move across the business units of the bank or up into a management role
, '\n',

Don't Delay & Apply Now!

, '\n',

Tags
Hadoop, MapReduce, Lucene, HDFS, Hadoop Distributed File System, Pig, HIVE, HBase, Flume, Sqoop, ZooKeeper, HCatalog, Ambari, Oozie, Mahout, Drill, Avro, Whirr, Mrunit, Bigtop, YARN, Cloudera, Hortonworks, Yahoo!, Facebook, Stumbleupon, Google BigQuery, Amazon Redshift, Microsoft Azure, Spark SQL, Impala

, '\n']

title: b'Senior Analyst\r\n      '
jd:
[
, ' ', Senior Data Analyst,
, ' ', Clerk Grade 9/10,
, ' ', Department of Family & Community Services,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', Location: Ashfield,
, ' ', Salary range: 102,838 - $113,324 pa plus employer's contribution to superannuation and annual leave loading.,
, ' ', About the Opportunity,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', Note a Data Analyst role (Clerk Grade 7/8) is also being advertised concurrently. To view the advertisement and apply for this role see Job Reference Number 57UB.  ,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', There is an exciting opportunity to join the Statistical Analysis and Modelling team at NSW Family and Community Services (FACS) to shape future policy direction that impacts FACS? most vulnerable clients. ,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', The Statistical Analysis and Modelling team undertakes quantitative analysis and modelling, research and provides valuable insights and advice to policy makers and operational arms of the business to inform current reforms, planning and policy development.,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', As part of a small team, you will be responsible for,
, ' ',

  • Undertaking statistical analysis for research and evaluation of programs


  • Developing  quantitative models such as demand forecasting models


  • Leading data linkage projects


  • Providing governance support to FACS stakeholders around data sharing and usage 
, ' ', To be successful in this role appropriate tertiary qualifications and relevant professional experience in quantitative analysis and analytical software packages such as SAS or SPSS is required. ,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', Job Notes,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', This is a temporary role in accordance with the Government Sector Employment Act 2013 for a period of up to 12 months. ,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', A Recruitment Pool may be created to fill similar roles for both ongoing and temporary opportunities if and as they arise.,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', How to apply,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', Candidates must apply online and submit a covering letter (2 pages maximum) and an up-to-date resume which clearly details their skills and experience as relevant to this role.,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', Part of the assessment process may include additional online capability testing, skills testing or work samples in accordance with the new Government Sector Employment Act 2013, therefore you may be contacted to participate. You will also be asked to complete a Health Declaration Form in later stages of the assessment process. , ' ',
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', FACS is committed to building a workplace culture that values diversity and inclusion. We actively promote the employment of people with disability, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders, LGBTI and other diversity groups.,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', FACS encourages applications from people with disability and will provide reasonable adjustments in our recruitment processes and in the workplace. ,
, ' ', If you need an adjustment in the recruitment process, please call or email the contact person listed below, and also advise us of your preferred method of communication.,
, ' ', If you?re looking for general information about our reasonable adjustment process, you can email WorkforceAcquisition@facs.nsw.gov.au or phone (02) 8879 9115.,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', More Information,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', Click here to view the role description. ,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', For more information on how to apply for a role in the NSW Public Sector please click here,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', Please submit your application online including the information outlined above.,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', If you experience difficulties submitting your application, please contact FACS recruitment on 9765 3999.,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', Closing date: Monday 15^th May 2017 at 11:59pm,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', For enquiries: Please contact Shuling Chen on 02 9716 2566 or Shuling.Chen @facs.nsw.gov.au,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', Thank you for your interest in our role.,
, ' ', ,
, ' ',  , ' ',

, ' ']

, ' ', There is an exciting opportunity to join the Statistical Analysis and Modelling team at NSW Family and Community Services (FACS) to shape future policy direction that impacts FACS? most vulnerable clients. ,

title: b'Benefits and Data Analyst\r\n    '
jd:
[' ',

The Benefits & Data Analyst analyses, interprets and provides reliable, valid and easily understood reports in response to client requests or any ongoing requirements. The position develops, implements and refines methods of accessing and interrogating relevant data sets and converting data into useful information and advice. Designing and developing appropriate databases for recording relevant information to monitor and report comparative performance standards.

, ' ',

Client Details

, ' ',

The client is a government organisation, requiring an experienced data analyst to join an 8 month project, projects are usually (but not limited to) reform based, efficiency driven and service improvements.

, ' ',

Description

, ' ',

As the Benefits and Data Analyst you will:

, ' ',
  • Convert data into useful information and advice for a wide variety of users
  • Provide timely, accurate and up to date information from a variety of sources, databases and systems
  • Develop and refine report formats to present data in a concise, clear and easy to read format
  • Develop and maintain sound and complex records and documentation via quick and accurate sourcing
  • Building a sound relationship with the team and managers
  • Determine which information is relevant and to which stakeholders
  • Managing time and prioritising issues, given that work demands can flow from a number of sources
  • Undertake specific analytical tasks
  • Provide and manipulate data as requested
  • Establish and maintain detailed databases
  • Assist with statistical and trend analysis information
  • Develop content for executive briefings, ad-hoc reports and analyses
  • Assist with negotiations of issues relating to reporting
, ' ',

Profile

, ' ',

To be successful you will have:

, ' ',
  • Sound knowledge and experience in the design and development of relational databases and techniques for querying
  • Knowledge of statistical techniques including capacity to undertake trend analysis and modelling
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Sound time management, organisation and problem solving skills with proven capacity to meet deadlines
  • Proven capacity to undertake detailed work with a high degree of accuracy and thoroughness
  • Proven capacity to meet tight deadlines and manage conflicting priorities
  • Proven ability to work successfully in a team environment with excellent customer service skills
  • Experience using SharePoint is desirable
  • Experience using Microsoft Excel, Project, Word and Powerpoint
, ' ',

Job Offer

, ' ',

The client is looking for a data analyst with background in benefit realisation management in a PMO or project environment

, ' ',

To apply online please click the 'Apply' button below. For a confidential discussion about this role please contact Stephanie Alderton on 02 8292 2031.

, ' ']

title: b'Senior Data Analyst - Statistical modeling & Analytics\r\n    '
jd:
[' ',

, ' ',

About the business and the role

, ' ',

Leading Analytics agency going through a period of growth in their Data Analytics team in 2017. Work with a team who has a depth of technical & industry knowledge to help this company take the next step in their Analytics journey!

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

Job tasks and responsibilities

, ' ',
  • Working on end to end analytics projects including eliciting requirements, data mining & preparation
  • Statistical modeling & data science techniques to ensure their predictive modeling capacity is first-class
  • Being able to work with the business to create actionable insights out of your findings
, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

Skills and experience

, ' ',
  • Commercial experience with one or more of R, SAS, Python & SQL
  • Data visualisation tools exposure (Ideally Tableau or Qlikview) ideal
  • trong stakeholder engagement skills a must
  • Exposure or interest to the Financial services industry ideal
, ' ',

, ' ']

title: b'Multiple Data Analyst opportunities\r\n    '
jd:
[' ',

An excellent opportunity to join one of NSW's leading Government Departments as a Data Analyst and gain exposure to a major project of work aimed to significantly improve local services.

, ' ',

, ' ',

As the successful Data Analyst you will be exposed large sets of data from a variety of data sources and be required to develop and maintain complex reports. You will also be required to work closely with the business and key stakeholders to gain familiarity of the project and provide them with accurate analysis and interpretation of the data.

, ' ',

The Data Analyst will be responsible for the analysis of the data models, data definitions and data standards, and development of data transformations and common information models.

, ' ',

As the successful Data Analyst you will require:

, ' ',
  • Analytical disposition and thinking - ability to think logically as well as creatively, to develop data models and data definitions, standards, terminology and classifications that are representative of business domains.
  • Ability to design the full framework (inputs, model, outputs, implementation).
  • Experience in data and information modelling and usage of associated notations and tools, such as E-R diagrams, UML diagrams, Enterprise Architect, System Architect and XML tools.
  • Experience in office productivity tools such as Microsoft Office Word, Excel, Project, PowerPoint and Visio.
  • Experience with data integration concepts and extract, transform and load (ETL) tools, especially Informatica PowerCentre.
  • Experience in testing of data-related solution components, including data migration.
  • Build relationships with a diverse community across the organisation.
  • Demonstrated ability to apply data governance principles and resolve data set quality issues.
  • Demonstrated ability to communicate analysis and insights using a range of written and visual tools and techniques.
  • Provide expert advice on alternate or more efficient reporting strategies.
  • Demonstrated ability to engage and liaise with stakeholders to scope and complete work.
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently, solve problems in a structured and logical way, manage competing priorities and deliver on-time results.
  • Experience in case management, customer relationship management (CRM) or similar product configuration and/or custom development desirable.
, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

Robert Walters Australia is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy.

, ' ']

title: b'\r\n          Lead Data Architect & Analyst\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',

You will work with a small 12 man team of young motivated professional web developers, back end and app developers and marketers to achieve our goals of improving computer learning in schools. You will be responsible for data stored in AWS cloud data warehouses. You will be innovative and will ensure the right data is collected, is of high quality, is stored and maintained well, the right questions are asked of it, and data is visualised optimally. You will work with leaders in this new field, including academics at universities.

, '\n',

Reporting directly to the Software Team Leader, your duties will include:

, '\n',
  • Database design - maintain and build on existing DB design (RDS postgreSQL on AWS) as needed to support the large data set for classroom Learning Analytics product
  • Database programming: designing and modifying stored procedures for storing, verifying and reporting data
  • Implementing data warehouse (RedShift) and other up to date strategies to optimize reporting
  • Maintain database integrity, performance, reliability and security, implementing protocols to achieve these goals.
  • Specifically using latest Amazon tools for database optimization
  • Perform data analytical tasks in relation to educational big data including telemetry, recorded activity data, recorded educational websites.
  • Supervise and mentor one or two junior database programming staff
, '\n',

To be successful in this role, your skills will include:

, '\n',

Essential:

, '\n',
  • Extensive experience in design and development of database structures
  • Experienced in PostgreSQL, stored procedures, PL/pgSQL - SQL Procedural Language and Redshift
  • Alternatively extensive experience with other DB such as MySQL, Oracle, Microsoft SQL Server
  • Must have knowledge in least one programming language, e.g. C++, Python for building complex and efficient algorithms.
  • Educated to a minimum of degree level in a highly analytical discipline such as Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science or Mathematics.
, '\n',

We are looking for a person who:

, '\n',
  • Exhibits strong attention to detail.
  • Knowledge of data theory, both of empirical [test] design theory (scientific method) and Measurement theory (Link), categorical nature, missing data, outliers.
  • Critical thinking - to detect dependencies, inconsistencies, improbable data, corruption, outliers.
  • Is an excellent communicator with well-developed relationship management skills.
  • Has a clear focus on internal customer requirements, delivery and results with accurate and efficient working methods.
, '\n']

,
, ' This is a fantastic opportunity to join a great team and use your strong Teradata or SQL Server management skills to provide data driven consultation to key stakeholders within this major Australian FS firm.',
, ' ',
, " As a Strategic Planning analyst you'll have ", excellent communication skills, ' and will develop and generate regular ad-hoc reports/dashboards, conduct analysis using multiple systems and present the insights and recommendations to the business to improve the customer experience.',
, ' ',
, ' ', The Role, ' - ',
, ' ',
, ' • Data and Insights analysis',
, ' • Develop, maintain and improve solutions/data set for market opportunity data ',
, ' • Engaging with internal stakeholders to consult around data fulfilment requirements',

,

title: b'Junior Inventory Analyst / Data Analyst \r\n    '
jd:
[' ',

This established market leading organisation currently has an exciting opportunity for a Junior Analyst to join their finance team on a long term basis. Working within a fast paced environment this role will allow you to utilise your existing analytical and reconciliation skills to maximise your capability.

, ' ',

Your Responsibilities will include:

, ' ',
  • Audit, document and validate business processes and systems requirements
  • Analyse large quantity of data and produce specific reports highlighting relevant information
  • Reconcile various data across database as required
  • Research, identify and specify solutions to problems
  • Close liaison with internal and well as external stakeholders regarding data analysis and results
  • Ad-hoc tasks as required
, ' ',

, ' ',

To be considered for the role you will need to have

, ' ',
  • Previous experience in data manipulation or some exposure in accounts
  • Advanced level of excel knowledge
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
  • The ability to work independently as well as within a team
  • The ability to learn and adapt quickly
  • High level of accuracy
  • Degree qualified
, ' ',

, ' ',

To apply please forward your resume to Kate Cvetanoska by clicking on the apply button.

, ' ']

title: b'Business Analyst\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',

Our client is a leading name in the NSW Health Care Industry and we are supporting them with the search for two Business Analyst with a strong data analytics background. As the Business Analyst your primary responsibility is to support the business process design, system development and implementation. Manage the data integrity of the case management system. Develop reporting capability for the review and analysis of the organisation's current business needs and contribute to overall business improvement.

, '\n',

Key Responsibilities:

, '\n',
  • Research, analyse and prepare accurate information about business processes.
  • Analyse and consolidate information for the development of business requirements
  • Develop data analysis and reporting solutions
  • Oversight of data integrity and business system improvement projects.
  • Prepare technical documentation
  • Provide plain language advice and documentation on technical issues to non-technical audiences
  • Further activities arising from the Scheme Agent Transition Project include:
  • Mapping data migration requirements between Scheme Agents
  • Working closely with data migration teams to develop appropriate plans including identification of data, data testing and error rectification requirements
, '\n',

Key Requirements:

, '\n',
  • 3-5 years experience working in a Data Analyst/Business Analyst/Technical Analyst role within a complex enterprise environment
  • Exposure to the healthcare or insurance industries would be beneficial but not mandatory
  • Bachelors Degree in related field
  • A highly analytical skill set matched by an effective communication style
, '\n',

For more information you can call Kristen Mason in our Sydney office on 02 90876208 or alternatively, apply here to register your interest.

, '\n']

title: b'Pricing/Product Coordinator\r\n    '
jd:
['\n',

The Company:

Based in Sydney’s North, this global company is part of the Australasia arm of this multinational organisation. With over 50 000 products worldwide you probably will come across over 100 of this companies main products a day. With an opportunity opening up in their Master Data team this ongoing contract will suit someone who is highly driven and analytical. Onsite parking is provided.

The Role:

Working in a close knit team of 7, this role will directly report to the Business Service Manager. Throughout this contract the position will organically grow the more you allow it to. The role will initially allow someone the room to learn about the business working alongside the pricing team as they work through publications and system maintenance.

, '\n',

Some of the responsibilities will include:

, '\n',
  • Loading pricing from workflows and loading multipliers
  • Load & maintain pricing when required to meet business requirements
  • Work in conjunction with Master Data Analyst to support all tasks in the Publication Process
  • Assist in data cleanses ensuring 100% accuracy
  • Load customer specific and part number cross references to ensure smoothly order processing
, '\n',


The Candidate:

In order to be considered for this role, not only will you require excellent interpersonal skills but you will also need to be immediately available. The following experience and skills are essential:

, '\n',
  • Accurate/fast data entry skills.
  • Experience in pricing and data management
  • Tertiary qualifications in Business or IT related
  • Advanced MS Office Skills, specifically Excel, you will be required to conduct V-Look ups and Pivot Tables.
  • Strong oral and written skills.
  • Self-motivated with tenacity, persistence and drive.
  • Actively supports and helps others & contributes towards harmonious relationships.
, '\n',

The Application Process:

, '\n',

To be considered for this opportunity, please apply through the appropriate link with a resume and cover letter or call Rachel Fisher on 8270 9787 for a confidential discussion.

, '\n',

To apply please click on the appropriate link on this page, alternatively for more information or a confidential conversation please contact Rachel Fisher on +61282709787
( SK94516A )

, '\n']

title: b'Microsoft Business Intelligence Consultant / Designer \xe2\x80\x93 SSIS, SSRS, SSAS Guru'
salary: b'End User Company - Great Package, Bonuses + Agile'
jd:
[' ',

 

, ' ',

Your Benefits:

, ' ',
  • Great Remuneration Package;
  • Generous Bonuses;
  • End-user Organization;
  • Work within an Agile Environment;
  • Brand-new High Profile Projects;
  • Convenient Location + Parking;
  • Friendly & Flat Structure;
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

You will be joining a successful end-user organization with high retention rates and a proud culture in providing a vibrant environment for their employees to work, learn and develop their career.

, ' ',

You are a well-spoken, intelligent individual with experience across the entire Microsoft Business Intelligence suit of products as a Consultant Developer or Business Analyst with ability to gather requirement, propose scope of works and hands-on design and Development.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

You CV must reflect the following in a neat bullet point format under each role:

, ' ',

 

, ' ',
  • Immaculate communications and strong command of English both written and verbal;
  • Hands-on technical design and development with both SSIS ETL and SSRS Reporting;
  • As a minimum, support experience with SSAS cubes (development background is highly preferred);
  • CV must reflect, where and how you have been involved in requirement gathering and proposal of BI / DW solutions.
  • A demonstrated background in self-education and keeping up to date with general Business intelligence technologies in particular Microsoft stack
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

You can either apply here or send your application directly to Sonia at Sonia@infinitypro.com.au quoting 0090MicrosoftBI. We can be contacted on (02) 9687 1025 for a confidential discussion, however please send your resume prior to making contact.

, ' ',

Please ensure all documents are sent in Microsoft word format.

, ' ']

title: b'Oracle Data Specialist \r\n    '
jd:
[' ',

Randstad is on the lookout for an Oracle Data Analyst to be responsible for performing full data lifecycle activities across multiple agencies, projects, and stakeholders including gathering data requirements, data profiling and data model design. The role will provide key support in the development, testing and maintenance of databases, data models, ETL, queries and related artefacts for various cluster-wide projects and initiatives.

, ' ',

The Analytics & Reporting Systems application portfolio includes, but is not limited to Tableau, SAS, SAP, and Oracle Exadata.

, ' ',

Responsibilities include;

, ' ',
  • Evaluate business data identifying different characteristics and locating similarities to enable integration for improved data analysis
  • Provide a key role in supporting and partnering the business in all data driven initiatives
  • Ensure alignment with the data governance policy of the government cluster.
  • Design and support data analyses to derive meaningful insights that assist business managers in making sound business decisions
  • Importing, cleaning, transforming, validating or modelling data with the purpose of understanding or making conclusions from the data for decision-making purposes
  • Design and develop data models, schemas, queries and supporting code to support analytics and reporting projects
  • Work closely with project, application and support teams in multiple locations and expected to work independently to plan and accomplish goals.
  • Working closely and effectively across the analytics and reporting team to deliver consistent integrated services and solutions which can be replicated and which contribute to improving processes and systems.
  • Identifying and balancing the needs of multiple stakeholders, multiple changes and work programs and a complex business environment undergoing significant change.
, ' ',

To succeed in this role you will have:

, ' ',
  • Experience working with Oracle Technology (11g or 12g) as a Data Analyst
  • Proven work experience as a database designer, data modeller and data analyst
  • Technical expertise in data models, database design development and data mining
  • At least 5 years experience designing, developing and delivering Business Analytics solutions using Oracle database
  • At least 5 years experience designing, developing and delivering Business Analytics solutions using ETL tools
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organise, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
  • Experience working in a Linux environment
  • Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings
  • Experience in data analysis and data mining techniques.
  • Exposure to data governance, data management and development processes
, ' ',

If you think you have the skills to be successful in this role, then don’t delay and hit the Apply button now! Alternatively, you can send your profile to Glenn on glenn.abadilla@randstad.com.au.

, ' ']

title: b'Data Migration Engineer\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',
Primary Health Care is one of Australia's leading listed healthcare companies, servicing medical and allied health professionals. We offer a broad range of medical and related services through our network of Pathology, Radiology and Medical Centres across Australia.

Within our Medical Centres Division we have a current opening for a Data Migration Lead Engineer to join our Project Team. 

The  Data Migration Lead Engineer will be responsible for analysing the scope of the requirements for data migration design and document the data migration plan and deliver migration services for our network of Medical Centres. The successful candidate for this role will likely posses:

  • Bachelors Degree in ICT or relation discipline or equally skilled through experience.
  • A minimum of 5 years experience as a system integration engineer, data analyst implementation engineer
  • Strong experience in MS SQL including a good knowledge of MS SQL Database design, implementation and administration
  • Excellent written and verbal communications skills
  • Experience in application development methods and tools
  • Previous medical industry experience including experience in Medtech32, MedicalDirector / Pracsoft, sapphire applications and e-health would be high regarded butnot mandatory.

title: b'Junior - Mid Level Software Engineer\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

Lorica Health provides advanced claims analytics solutions and services to the healthcare sector. Our specialist team of data scientists, domain experts, analysts and engineers develop industry specific solutions which target fraud, abuse and waste, while also making markets that improve the quality and safety of health care. Lorica software already analyses data from 30 of Australia's 33 private health insurers as well as a number of public sector agencies.

, '\n',

Lorica is a Best Practice Equal Opportunity Employer selecting candidates from a combination of soft and hard skills measured empirically wherever possible; be prepared to take state of the art online tests, interviews and questions.

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

Junior - Mid Level Software Engineer

, '\n',

Responsibilities:

, '\n',

  • Design, code and automatically test applications in PHP and Java

  • Write scripts to build, test & deploy to AWS

  • Be a proactive and collaborative SCRUM team developer

  • Assist with verification when required

  • Assist with company growth activities as required (e.g. recruitment)

  • Share knowledge with others in a learning environment

, '\n',


Required qualifications:

, '\n',

  • University degree in Software Engineering or equivalent

, '\n',


Required skills/experience:

, '\n',

  • 1-5 years experience

  • Solid skills on core Java (Preferably on Java 8)

  • RESTful web service development (Spring Boot or PlayFramework)

  • Relational database, PL/SQL, ideally on PostgreSQL

  • PHP (Laravel 5.3, SQL and Javascript)

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

Desired skills/experience:

, '\n',

  • Agile

  • SCRUM

  • Healthcare

  • Data processing using Spark

  • AWS

  • Docker

  • Jira & Confluence

  • Bamboo

, '\n',


Role specific characteristics:

, '\n',

  • Inquisitive by nature

  • Ability to work both independently and as part of a team

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

Lorica Purpose:

, '\n',

To use data science to improve the quality of health care markets.

, '\n',

Lorica Vision:
To improve the fairness and efficiency of health care markets so they can in turn better improve the  health of the populations they serve.

, '\n',

Lorica Mission:

, '\n',

To be the foremost trusted intermediary providing health care data products and services that  demonstrably improve the performance of the Australian healthcare system.

, '\n',

Lorica Values:

, '\n',

Health,Respect,Integrity,Rigour,Improvement,Curiosity,Diversity,Courage

, '\n',

Lorica Personal Attributes:

, '\n',

Working at Lorica:

Lorica respects family and  flexible working requirements. We practice Agile throughout the company,  promote continuous improvement and learning. Above all we want to make a difference and have fun.

We look forward to your application, please apply here or send your resume and cover letter to  stephen.winnick@loricahealth.com

No recruitment agencies please.

title: b'SQL Analyst\r\n        '

To secure the role you will be a self-starter who will need minimal time to get up to speed . title: b'Customer Insights Analyst'
jd:
[
, ' ',

 

, ' ',
, ' ',

 

, ' ',
, ' ',

Thomson Reuters is a truly unique business. We are a global enterprise and leading provider of news, information services and technology. Here, your work matters and has the potential to change the world. Every day, Thomson Reuters news, information, technology, and expertise help make great things happen.

, ' ',
, ' ',


We are proud to have been recognized globally as a leading employer based on our commitment to diversity, focus on company culture, work life balance and for acts to promote socio-economic progress worldwide through the Thomson Reuters foundation.

, ' ',
, ' ',

 

, ' ',
, ' ',

About the role

, ' ',
, ' ',

, ' ',
, ' ',

This role is part of the Thomson Reuters Customer Insights and Data Analytics team, which strives to to monitor market trends to provide direction for business decisions.  drive sustainable revenue growth from products designed to meet customer need.  It is essential to develop and communicate key messages in support of Thomson strategies; and

, ' ',
, ' ',

, ' ',
, ' ',

The Customer Insights Analyst reports directly to the Senior Manager, Customer Insights and Data Analytics. The primary objectives of the Customer Insights Analyst are to:

, ' ',
, ' ',
  • Provide customer insights through analysis and data mining.
  • • Conduct customer segmentation and profiling marketing and sales lists for customer buy-in.
  • Evaluate, monitor and improve effectiveness of existing campaign and program segments.
  • Evaluate, monitor and improve effectiveness of existing databases, tools and services used by the Customer Insights and Data Analytics team.
  • Responsible for ensuring data integrity, quality, security and accuracy in data provided to stakeholders, as well as ensuring all data complies with legal regulations for optimal customer experience.
  • Key to the success of this position is the analytical ability to translate the unique needs of each marketing and sales campaign or program and to develop targeted segments to lift returns.
  • This role requires a breadth of knowledge in marketing and sales automation, strong commercial “know how”, focusing on excellent understanding of data, data structure and segmentation as well as strong stakeholder management and communication skills.
, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

 

, ' ',
, ' ',

To be successful in the role you will be a passionate and commercially minded data analyst with the drive to innovate and enthusiasm to learn. You will have experience, ideally, gained in a professional services or related industries. The ideal candidate will have:

, ' ',
, ' ',

 

, ' ',
, ' ',
  • Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing, mathematics, statistics or science (or equivalent)
  • 3+ years hands-on experience in direct marketing and segmentation using marketing automation (e.g. Eloqua, Marketo, Pardot)
  • 5+ years hands-on experience in data manipulation, reporting, and mail file generation using Access, Excel, Crystal Reports or equivalent.
  • 5+ years experience in database management – direct marketing field preferred
  • Understanding of legal regulatory markets an advantage
  • Understanding of publishing industry an advantage
  • Previous primary job experience in database management, data mining and marketing data manipulation and superior analytical skills with a solid business and marketing backgound
  • Working knowledge of data extraction tools and techniques from such sources as IBM Infoview/Business Objects, MS SQL Server and/or similar databases.
  • Strong computer skills with  Access, Excel, Project and/or other common database platforms
  • Experience in analyzing data to develop and deliver reports, recommendations and presentations to management (data-driven decision approach)
  • Working knowledge of creating segmentation strategies, using marketing automation software and creating customer profiles using traditional methodologies and digital behavior.
  • Desirable: experience in data modelling and predictive analytics.
, ' ',

As an employer we strive to provide every employee with a positive working environment, continued professional development, a commitment to work-life balance, and equal opportunities. As a diverse, global leader, we actively encourage career advancement through internal promotions and segment opportunities.

, ' ',
, ' ',

If you are a talented professional, passionate about what you do, and want to work in a company that can support your growth, we want to hear from you.

, ' ',
, ' ',

If you would like to find out more about Thomson Reuters please download our App here http://thomsonreuters.com/en/careers/what-we-do/our-story-app.html or visit our careers site, https://www.thomsonreuters.com/en/careers.html.

, ' ',
, ' ',

 

, ' ',
, ' ',


, ' ',

 

, ' ',
, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ']

title: b'Senior Commercial Analyst\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

Role Title

, ' ',

, ' ',

Senior Commercial Analyst

, ' ',

, ' ',

Location

, ' ',

, ' ',

North Ryde, Macquarie Park

, ' ',

, ' ',

Rewards

, ' ',

, ' ',

Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits on offer

, ' ',

, ' ',

About Us

, ' ',

, ' ',

Smith & Nephew is a diversified advanced medical technology business that supports healthcare professionals in more than 100 countries to improve the quality of life for their patients.

, ' ',

, ' ',

We have leadership positions in Orthopaedic Reconstruction, Advanced Wound Management, Sports Medicine and Trauma:

, ' ',
  • Orthopedics Reconstruction - joint replacement systems for knees, hips and shoulders
  • Advanced Wound Management - wound care treatment and prevention products used to treat hard to heal wounds
  • Sports Medicine - minimally invasive surgery of the joint
  • Trauma & Extremities - products that help repair broken bones
, ' ',

, ' ',

We have over 15,000 employees around the world. Annual sales in 2016 were more than $4.6 billion.
We are a constituent of the UK's FTSE100 and our shares are traded on the London Stock Exchange and through American Depository Receipts on the New York Stock Exchange (LSE: SN, NYSE: SNN) .

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

Summary

, ' ',

, ' ',

Commercially astute, analytically focused and able to communicate with a wide range of stakeholders, the Senior Commercial Analyst plays a key role in data analysis, management and dissemination to support strategic decision-making, particularly related to assessment of our market and potential commercial opportunities.

, ' ',

, ' ',

Essential Job Functions

, ' ',
  • Strategic and Business planning: Work with Commercial Finance to prepare ANZ submissions for Regional/Global Strategic Plans and Budgets
  • Commercial Analysis: Provide accurate and timely analyses to support commercial decision making and evaluation of business opportunities related to tenders and contracts, business development, new product introductions and other strategic decisions
  • Build and maintain Strategic Intelligence capability:
    • Identify, collect and analyse data related to our business and our market to generate insights and support commercial, decision-making. This includes working with third party data vendors and analysts
    • Create and maintain market models for all business units
    • Create and maintain relevant platforms, forums and materials to disseminate information on the business and the market to relevant Internal stakeholders
    • Develop decision-support tools e.g. return on investment calculators etc. as required
, ' ',

, ' ',

Requirements

, ' ',

, ' ',

Education:

, ' ',
  • Tertiary qualification in a quantitative discipline e.g. Accounting, Finance, Business or Commerce is preferred
, ' ',

, ' ',

Experience:

, ' ',
  • A minimum of 3 years experience in an Analyst role in the healthcare sector, preferably in the Medical Technology or Pharmaceutical Industries
  • Demonstrated market and financial modelling skills
  • Proven ability to work with complex and large datasets
, ' ',

, ' ',

Competencies:

, ' ',
  • Well-developed stakeholder management skills
  • Strong commercial/business acumen and ability to comprehend and critically evaluate data to identify and communicate key insights to relevant stakeholders
  • Highly numerate with strong analytical skills
  • Excellent attention to detail
  • Driven and self-motivated with a high level of initiative
  • Excellent communication, presentation and interpersonal skills
, ' ',

, ' ',

Technical knowledge:

, ' ',
  • Advanced level Microsoft Excel
  • Experience generating analyses using Business Intelligence tools (COGNOS or similar)
, ' ',

, ' ',

Scope

, ' ',

, ' ',

This role reports to the Market Access & Competitive Intelligence Manager. Key internal stakeholders include the Managing Director and Leadership team, Sales and Marketing, Commercial Finance, Corporate Accounts and Regional/Global Business Intelligence and Strategic Planning functions. Key external stakeholders include 3rd party data vendors and Analysts.

, ' ',

, ' ',

Applications

, ' ',

, ' ',

Smith & Nephew is committed to helping people regain their lives by repairing and healing the human body. We believe that this can only be achieved by establishing mutually beneficial relationships with all of our stakeholders including patients, healthcare professionals, investors ad employees. If you share our passion for innovation and can demonstrate how you meet the criteria outlined, we would love to hear from you.

, ' ',

, ' ',

We continue to actively build an environment where every individual can fulfill their potential and be proud ambassadors for Smith & Nephew, our customers and their patients. We value the diversity of our people and welcome applications from everyone.

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ']

title: b'Manager Strategic Analytics - Group Investigations\r\n    '
jd:
[' ',

The Group Investigations team investigate internal fraud and serious misconduct related matters involving employees, contractors and suppliers, as well as external financial crime that is complex, systemic or involves organised crime where the Group has been exposed to, or suffered a loss.

, ' ',

, ' ',

About the role

, ' ',

This is an exciting role that will see you working with investigators to extract, prepare, manipulate and creatively analyse data from the Group Data Warehouse (Teradata) and other CBA Group databases and external sources, in order to develop insights for fraud and serious misconduct investigations.

, ' ',

, ' ',

Reporting to the Senior Manager of Group Investigations, the primary purpose of this role will be to support Group Investigations team by enhancing our ability to use analytical insights in support of investigations and to predict internal fraud related activities.

, ' ',

, ' ',

You will also play a key role in:

, ' ',
  • Running and enhancing the Group Investigations' team Tableau dashboard, in order to clearly demonstrate our impact to stakeholders and to manage our work effectively.
  • Working with the Senior Analyst and Data Analytics team to develop methods of enhancing our proactive internal fraud detection capability.
  • Creating and documenting standard operating procedures, as necessary.
  • Preparing and presenting data on our investigations.
, ' ',

, ' ',

What does success look like?

, ' ',

We are looking for candidates that can think outside the box and show creativity to solve business problems with the use of sound experience in extracting, manipulating and analysing complex financial data.

, ' ',

, ' ',

Expert knowledge in Tableau is essential, coupled with experience with Teradata, Oracle, SQL, SAS and VBA.

, ' ',

, ' ',

In addition, you will possess:

, ' ',
  • Experience in maintaining Sharepoint sites.
  • Ideally, exposure to and working knowledge of predictive modelling.
  • Sound communication skills and commercial acumen.
  • Tertiary qualifications in a relevant discipline such as mathematics, statistics, finance, economics, engineering, information technology or sciences
, ' ',

, ' ',

An interest in detecting fraud and enhancing integrity within the financial services industry will see you excel in this role.

, ' ',

, ' ',

The people, businesses and communities we serve are wonderfully diverse. To reflect this, we're committed to hiring a similarly diverse workforce. With a focus on inclusion, accessibility and flexibility, we'll support you at every stage of your career.

, ' ',

, ' ']

title: b'Senior Consultant, Analytics\r\n    '
jd:
['\n',

Unisys is a global management consulting and information technology company. We work with the world's leading companies and government organizations to solve their most business and technology challenges. We specialize in providing integrated, leading-edge solutions government, financial services and commercial markets. Our offerings include cloud and infrastructure services, application development, security solutions and high-end server technology.  Unisys brings more than 20,000 associates serving clients around the world.

, '\n',

We are looking for a passionate certified Senior Data Analyst. The successful candidate will turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions. Within Unisys Services, Senior Consultants use our analytic methodology to collaborate with other associates to deliver analytic solutions on an engagement. Consultants bring broad understanding across quantitative techniques, and analytic software and data center infrastructure.  A Senior Consultant will help with:

, '\n',
  • Interpreting data, analysing results using statistical techniques and providing ongoing reports
  • Developing and implementing databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
  • Acquiring data from primary or secondary data sources and maintaining databases/data analysis systems
, '\n',

Responsibilities:

, '\n',
  • Interpret data, analyse results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
  • Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimise statistical efficiency and quality independently
  • Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
  • Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
  • Filter and "clean" data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems
  • Locate and define new process improvement opportunities
  • Use statistical methods to analyse data and generate useful business reports
  • Identify and recommend new ways to save money by streamlining business processes
  • Use data to create models that depict trends in the customer base and the consumer population as a whole
, '\n',

Skills, Experience & Qualifications

, '\n',
  • Proven working experience as a Senior Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst
  • Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
  • Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages      (Business Objects etc), databases (SQL etc), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks)
  • Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analysing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc)
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
  • Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings
  • BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information      Management or Statistics
  • Experience with AWS and Azure highly desirable.
, '\n']

title: b'Candidate Manager | IT Recruitment | Flexible Hours | $140K package\r\n    '
salary: b'Excellent Salary Package plus Bonus: $140K package'
jd:
['We are currently seeking an experienced Candidate Relationship Manager for a role based in Sydney CBD. We are a fast growing & dynamic technology recruitment organisation with a growing brand in the marketplace. Further expansion sees the need for a Candidate\r\n Manager to join our team in a key role working across permanent and contract IT recruitment. The role would suit a someone who has strong experience in recruiting across all aspects of the Technology Industry.\xa0',
, '\n',
, This is an autonomous role and requires a motivated, tenacious and driven individual who can work with the minimum of supervision. We are offering a flexible work environment , that offers a genuine work-life balance opportunity.
,
What are we looking for?,
, '\n',
  • You will have at least 2-3 years experience in recruitment across the Technology recruitment industry. We are looking for a Candidate Manager with experience across the mid to senior levels IT sectors, to include; Developers, Project Managers, Solutions Architects, Consultants and Sales & Senior Management.
  • This is a busy and varied role which will include writing and placing ads on the on-line job boards, screening CVs and candidates, interviewing, liaising with candidates and clients, searching the database, report writing, reference checking.
  • An Interest in Data Analytics, Data Science is preferred as the role will involve recruiting Data Engineers, Data Scientist, Insights Manager, Data Analysts, however, this is not essential but you will have the desire to dive into the Data recruitment world.
  • You will be tasked in providing Candidate Management support from within and outside our database and proactively using Linkedin Recruiter tools for research and headhunting purposes.  Success in these areas will be offering critical support to the Recruitment Directors.
  • You will have an excellent knowledge of networking and recruiting across Linkedin. Preferably you will have working knowledge of Linkedin Recruiter and across its recruiting tools (however full training will be provided). 
  • You will have excellent candidate relationship skills and work ethic and strong interpersonal skills. This is a busy fast-paced environment and would appeal to someone who enjoys working within a flat management structure and taking responsibility for their day to day work.
, '\n',
If you have made a positive commitment to further your career and you possess the above attributes then please apply to this role. If you require further information, please contact please contact our 
Recruitment Director, Gino Lancaster 0401 735 235
,  , '\n']

title: b'Sr. Data Scientist - Perm -Sydney\r\n    '
