title: b'Group Data & Reporting Analyst\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

Role: Group Data & Reporting Analyst

, ' ',

Location: Sydney, CBD

, ' ',

Term: Full Time

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

QBE is one of the top 20 global general insurers and is recognised as Australia's largest international insurance and Reinsurance Company, with operations in 37 countries around the world. As well as being a leading insurer in Australia and New Zealand, QBE has major operating divisions in North America, Europe, Asia and Latin America.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

The Opportunity:

, ' ',

You will be supporting the Group Investments Manager of Data & Reporting with monitoring and validating key investment data. . This is a unique opportunity to work for a Sydney headquartered financial services company that has a truly global footprint.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

About the Role:

, ' ',

Your role will be to monitor a range of investment metrics, report on data quality and assist the manager with data governance frameworks, setting up of policies and processes to ensure clear roles and responsibilities are established. Your role will also include the following:

, ' ',

 

, ' ',
  • Fully comprehending the impact of investment data on business decisions and responding accordingly.
  • Managing deadlines and taking responsibility for deliverables and independently prioritising accordingly.
  • Identifying key risk areas for Group Investments through incomplete, inaccurate, inconsistent or ambiguous data.
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Experience required:

, ' ',

Candidates will have a number of years of experience delivering high quality data and reporting to stakeholders at an executive level. Specialised knowledge of investment metrics is required along with a strong understanding of investment markets (post graduate qualification preferred e.g. CFA, FINSIA, FRM - achieved or in progress). Technical experience with SQL\BI tools will be well regarded.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

You will be provided with a competitive salary package and benefits, in an environment that offers support, and encourages career development and learning.

, ' ',

QBE recognises and supports a range of flexible work arrangements to promote a better family/life/work balance.

Applicants will be required to provide evidence of their eligibility to work in Australia, and at a minimum be required to undertake police and basic credit checks as a condition of employment.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

If you are a QBE employee, please inform your Manager before applying.

, ' ',

For more information, click the APPLY button to submit your details.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Applications close Friday 21st April 2017

, ' ']

[' ',

About the Role
As a Junior Market Data Analyst or Administrator, you will work across market data compliance, governance, invoicing and licensing. You will provide administration of the market data system including support, reporting, budgets and vendor management.

, ' ',

Responsibilities

, ' ',
  • Process Market Data invoices in NAB’s accounts payable system, ensuring accuracy of cost allocations
  • Assistance with maintenance of all elements of the Market Data Inventory System - FITS (including contracts, pricing, currencies, user profiles, vendor uploads and tracking spare licenses for re-allocation or cancellation)
  • Assist the Market Data team and businesses on Market Data licenses, invoices and inventory queries
  • Work closely with accounts payable, finance and vendors to ensure timely payments of invoices
  • Build and maintain relationships with Market Data vendors and internal stakeholders
  • Production of monthly business reports to show data usage, number of users and costs
  • Assistance with Market Data reviews for specific business areas as and when required
  • Assistance with provision of Market Data services for new joiners
  • License management for leavers and transfers
  • Assistance with the production of headcount figures for Finance
  • Work alongside Senior Business Administrator providing continuity of service
, ' ',

Experience

, ' ',
  • Experience as a Junior Market Data Analyst or Administrator
  • Experience in an enterprise business environment
  • Experience in market data administration
  • Strong Market data financial awareness and control systems
  • Experienced in processing invoices and cost allocations
  • Understand payment process
  • Strong reporting skills
, ' ',

Please APPLY NOW to Vanessa Knispel for consideration for this role

, ' ']

title: b'Data Analytics Consultant\r\n    '
jd:
[' ',

Join an exciting Data transformation from traditional BI reporting to Advanced Analytics. Looking for open minded and forward thinking individuals.

, ' ',

, ' ',

Role:

, ' ',

Working for a leading Australian Insurer you will be working as part of a newly structured Analytics and Data team. Responsible for data management and insights across all business units you will accountable for assisting the firms transition from traditional BI reporting to Advanced Analytics across the next 2-3 years. As an experienced Analyst or Engineer you’re intensely curious and continually exploring new ideas to understand business trends.

, ' ',

Look for candidates with a strong understanding of Business Intelligence and some exposure to new technologies such as Big Data or Machine Learning. Passion for data science is key!

, ' ',

Responsibilities:

, ' ',
  • Responsible for the entire data pipeline from warehousing to visualisation, our team is trusted to provide insight into all aspects of business performance as well as analysing strategic opportunities.
  • Build relationships with internal customers to understand requirements, identify patterns/behaviours using complex data models and communicate their findings through interactive reports and presentations.
  • Design complex and enriched data models
  • Explore hypotheses/trends by applying statistical analysis methods
  • Share knowledge and coach other team members
  • Develop new dashboards and self-service reporting
  • Maintain periodic performance reports
  • Maintain data warehouse integrity and performance
  • SQL development to design stored procedures, functions, tables, views and triggers
, ' ',

Requirements:

, ' ',
  • Minimum 3-5 Years experience as Data Analyst, BI Analyst or Analytics Analyst/Consultant
  • Strong proficiency with SQL, R, Python and Tableau
  • Experience building statistical analysis and predictive models
  • Tertiary qualification in a quantitative discipline such as economics, statistics or maths.
  • Innovative and open mindset
  • Want and lust to work in Data science is key!
, ' ',

, ' ',

To apply please click apply or call Stefan Kovacevic on 02 8289 3100 for a confidential discussion.

, ' ']

title: b'Stress Testing Analyst - Data/Finance Combined Role\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

An excellent opportunity has opened up for a bright ambitious junior to join this banking clients stress testing team.  The team sit within Finance and work closely with Treasury & Risk, they are looking for someone to straddle the middle ground of a data and finance position.  This is a high profile position with big exposure to many senior stakeholders and a wide ranging role perfect for an ambitious junior candidate. 

, ' ',

Stress testing is responsible for providing insights to management and the board on the impact of APRA sanctioned stress scenarios.  You will be responsible for developing scenarios and identifying potential weaknesses in the groups business and business units.  This will in turn help set the capital targets and buffers. 

, ' ',

You will have:

, ' ',
  • Knowledge of Finance – A financial qualification or experience in working within a finance department
  • Knowledge of Data – Basic SQL, or Tableau or Data Warehouse work
  • The ability to communicate effectively and concisely to senior management
  • Outstanding thirst for learning and expanding your skills
, ' ',

If this sounds like your next opportunity then please apply via seek and a member of our team will be in contact with all relevant candidates.

title: b'SAP Business Analyst\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',


SAP Business Analyst - Data Migration

  • 6 month rolling contract @ $600 per day
  • Immediate start
  • Mutiple roles
, '\n',


One of our well known client's has 6 month contract opportunity for a highly experienced SAP Business Analyst with Data Migration experience.

To be successful in this role you will have;

, '\n',
  • A minimum of 3-5 years’ experience as a Business Analyst in a SAP environment
  • Experience in Data Migration is a MUST!
  • Strong business requirements gathering abilities
  • Superb communication skills, both written & verbal
  • Ability to liaise with all levels of the business
  • Must be flexible and adaptable

, '\n',


This is great opportunity to join a leading consulting company. Please email your cv to wendyl@halcyonknights.com.au

[' ',

Company Description

, ' ',

DT is the largest and fastest-growing digital agency in Australia, with a client list that includes many of Australia's and the world's most famous brands.

, ' ',

Our expertise spans a range of practice areas – including Design, Engineering,User Experience, Strategy, Social Media,Ecommerce, Mobile, Search, Advertising Creative, Content and Data & Analytics.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Job Description

, ' ',

The strategy lead is focused on driving the performance of the client's digital presence through insights, management and strategy. The Strategy lead works in partnership with Account Service to grow the value of their accounts for DT.

, ' ',

The strategy lead is expected to be a thought leader in the digital space. This should be reflected by participation in activities such as blogging, speaking at conferences, performing client workshops and building the agency's profile.

, ' ',

Responsibilities 

, ' ',
  • The strategy lead is responsible for educating clients and agency staff on emerging trends and technology.
  • Drive strategic direction of client's digital ecosystem, ensuring an integrated strategy across all digital touchpoints
  • Work along side respective Client Partner to continue growing and improving accounts.
  • Understand and execute against existing and emerging digital platforms, technology and behavior.
  • Maintain awareness of all activity across client's marketing channels to ensure consistency across brand messaging.
  • Be perceived as adding significant value to client's business via thought leadership
  • They will build and maintain relationships with suppliers and influential industry contacts
  • Monitor, analyse, manage and report on digital developments using different analytical tools, such as Google Analytics, Radian6 and others.
  • Work closely with Data Analysts, Client Partners, UX, Tech and Creative departments to ensure best practice and regularly provide clients with recommendations for channel improvement.
, ' ',

Qualifications...

, ' ',
  • Leadership skills, ability to positively influence others
  • Strategic skills, ideally with digital transformation experience
  • Capability leading complex conversations
  • Excellent client service ability and relationship building skills
  • Competent framing the value DT create
  • Thought leader in digital capacity


     
  •  
, ' ',

Additional Information

, ' ',

Outstanding opportunity for a seasoned and passionate account services professional to join an award wining agency to work across prestigious clients

, ' ']

title: b'Data Management - ETL Development Lead\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',
  • Data Management Lead
  • Financial Services
  • Sydney CBD Based
, ' ',

Medium sized Wealth Management organisation based in the Sydney CBD is seeking a Data Management Lead to provide leadership and guidance to a small team of Data Analysts and Database Administrators.

, ' ',

The Data Management Lead is accountable and responsible for ongoing data governance and best practice for data extraction, transforming and loading (ETL) for system integration and reporting.

, ' ',

Strong hands on development experience with Microsoft BI tools (SSIS, SSRS, SSAS) are essential for this role, as are strong understanding of Master Data Management (MDM) principles, data governance and "source of truth", and industry best practice data modelling.

, ' ',

You will be responsible for leading the data integration and BI reporting team with designing and maintaining ETL and ESB frameworks, as well as understanding and designing the data model to industry best practice.

, ' ',

In order to succeed in this role you will be able to demonstrate:

, ' ',
  • Experience leading small teams
  • Experience as a Data Management lead on a high profile, time critical project
  • Experience developing and implementing data migration/integration strategies and plans.
  • Strong knowledge and understanding of relational databases, ETL frameworks and tools - SQL Server, SSIS / SSRS
  • Proven experience with BI reporting packages
  • Technical understanding of data modelling, data mining and interrogation techniques
  • Excellent analytical skills with the ability to collect and disseminate large amounts of data with strong attention to detail
  • Proven research and analytical skills
  • Good working knowledge of, and experience working with third party vendors and systems
  • Strong planning, prioritisation and organisational skills
  • Ability to articulate technical issues to non-technical audiences
, ' ',

, ' ',

Experience in medium sized organisations within Superannuation, Insurance or Funds Management highly desirable.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

To apply for this role, please provide your resume in our preferred Word or PDF format no larger than 1MB and quote Job Reference: 15153.

title: b'Head of Data Science &amp; Products\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

Our Company

, '\n',

Tabcorp is one of the few integrated gambling and entertainment companies in the world. We deliver excitement and fun to our customers through our retail, digital and media platforms.

, '\n',

Our 3,000 strong team is as diverse as Australia itself. Our people drive leading brands and industry-first sustainability efforts, here and internationally. They’ve also made Tabcorp a top 100 ASX company.

, '\n',

This leadership is reflected in who we are. If, like us, you’re a passionate, positive playmaker and you want to use your talent to create amazing outcomes, we’d love to hear from you.

, '\n',

Role Summary

, '\n',

With the General manager, Data and Analytics as your leader, the Head of Data Science and products will be responsible for leading a team of Data Analysts that work across our diversified business units. You will see yourself partnering with senior stakeholders, developing insights on the customer and the business, applying science to optimize customer experience and support the creation of data products to support internal stakeholders and our customers.

, '\n',

Working with your team

, '\n',

You will have direct accountability for the following, however not limited to:

, '\n',
  • Provide leadership, mentoring and development to the team
  • Engage with various senior stakeholders within the business as the Data Science champion, applying science to optimize business outcomes
  • Drive creation of data products to support internal stakeholders and customers
  • Oversee the construction and maintenance of financial models to assess the impacts of business pricing strategies
  • Develop and design new business models to inform business of better future outcomes (prediction, algorithmic, machine learning)
  • Proactively understand and provide insights to improve products, channels, customer experience
, '\n',

, '\n',

Our Ideal Person

, '\n',

The successful candidate will have a quantitative, advanced degree in Math, Economics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, or other quantitative fields. You will be an expert in leveraging analysis tools such as SQL, Spark, R, and Python.It is essential that you have extensive experience in building and leading a team focused on quantitative analysis and automating decisions.

, '\n',

When you join our team you’ll be able to take advantage of a range of benefits including flexible working arrangements, leadership and development programs and community programs.

, '\n']

title: b'Data Scientist - Perm - Sydney\r\n    '
jd:
['My client is seeking a Data Scientist with at least 2-3 years of commercial hands on advanced analytics experience to be part of a very high performing team of analysts, data scientists, and consultants.\xa0',
, '\n',
, '\r\nIn this role, you will apply machine learning, statistics and advanced analytics concepts and models to extract insights from large datasets. You will be part of a growing team and contribute towards some really exciting projects.',
, '\n',
, '\n', Your responsibilities:
, '\n',
  • Explore large datasets, discover trends and patterns and extract insights  
  • Apply Statistical/Machine Learning techniques to build data product and features.
  • Develop scripts to extract and analyze large data sets and build statistical models
  • Test and verify scripts and models to ensure accuracy of the results
  • Work with domain experts to validate and interpret findings
, '\n',
, '\n', Your skills and experience:, '\n',
  • Australian citizenship - Very highly regarded, due to the nature of the job and clients. If you are an Australian citizen, please mention in your resume.
  • Post graduate qualification in either of the following: Statistics/ML/Mathematics
  • At least 2-3 years of experience in a commercial advanced analytics and insights environment
  • Solid skills in SQL and R for data extraction and manipulation and to create reports and dashboards.
  • Skills in NLP, text mining, or network analysis - Highly Preferred
  • Passionate about Data science and what it can do
  • Great team player
  • Loads of enthusiasm!
, '\n']

title: b'Data Entry\r\n    '
jd:
[' ',

Here lies an exciting opportunity for an experienced data processor to join one of Sydney's leading investment banks.

, ' ',

Client Details

, ' ',

Our client is a market leading and global investment bank looking to expand their administrative team. Due to company growth and expansion, they require experienced data processors and analysts to join their fast paced and dynamic team. Priding themselves on placing exceptional customer outcomes at the forefront of all activities, our client promotes the self development of all staff.

, ' ',

, ' ',

Description

, ' ',
  • Verifying data documents and sources with confidentiality and aligned with relevant policy;
  • Maintain effective relationships internally to ensure all issues are resolved in a timely manner;
  • Prepare correspondence;
  • Capture and maintain data to ensure accurate Records;
  • Coordinate the locating and collating of documents in accord with all relevant legislation; and
  • Provide ad hoc administrative support to all business units required.
, ' ',

Profile

, ' ',

The successful applicant will have a proven background in compiling accurate and compliant briefings and correspondence. You will have exceptional written and verbal communication skills with a strong knowledge of the MS office. In saying so you will need to have a strong knowledge of Excel including pivot tables and v look ups. You also must have an extensive knowledge of Salesforce and SAP. Furthermore, you will be able to exercise judgement to critically analyze information and will thrive working within tight time frames. Finally, given the importance of teamwork within this organization, you will be able to work both independently and as a part of a high performing team.

, ' ',

Job Offer

, ' ',
  • Immediate start for a three month contract
  • Highly competitive hourly rate
  • Sydney CBD Location
, ' ',

To apply online please click the 'Apply' button below. For a confidential discussion about this role please contact Carla Parish on +61 2 8292 2205.

, ' ']

title: b'AUDIENCE IQ SPECIALIST\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

We are trailblazers, innovators, free thinkers. But most of all, we are connectors. Adshel connects brands to people by using the power of emotion, interactive content and the environment around us. We live and breathe our purpose ‘to create the smartest connections for communities’ day in and day out in everything we do.

We’re looking for an exceptional Audience Intelligence Specialist to join our awesome National Marketing team in Sydney. If this sounds like you, read on. We want to hear from anyone with the following experience.

As an Audience IQ Specialist, you will champion all aspects of our audience insights strategy including market research and ownership of our first, second and third-party data sources with the aim of ensuring Adshel continue to lead in their knowledge of audience attitudes and behaviors, enabling our advertisers and commercial partners to better engage and connect with their target audience(s).

You will be responsible for:

• Development of insight and audience research studies, development and maintenance of the research library to support the sales, commercial and infrastructure departments.

• Own and manage all of Adshel’s research and insights sources

• Responsible for Adshel IQ, our audience and geo-location management platform.

• Driving insights which will cement Adshel’s position as thought-leaders in marketing and advertising.

To be successful in this role you will:

• Have a minimum 5 years' experience in bespoke market research, insight management and data analyst roles, with a track-record of success, preferably in a media based environment.

• Be an expert is trawling through reams on data to uncover untapped opportunities that create meaningful stories.

• Be a strategic thinker with a sound understanding of marketing processes.

• Have a passion for all things ‘people’, bordering on obsessed.

• Managing large scale bespoke research projects from concept to output.

• Budget and expense management and ability to take a broad and long term view of the business.

• Exceptional interpersonal skills, particularly the ability to build strong, ongoing professional relationships with internal sales teams

• Outstanding writing skills gained by producing marketing communication for a variety of audiences

If you love mining data to create insightful stories, are obsessed by all things ‘people’ and you have knowledge of research methodologies and data on both consumer and/or media research AND you want to be part of a growing media business, then this role is for you. If autonomous and creative with an acute attention to detail best describes you we want to hear from you.

This is a truly varied and exciting position where you will be part of an organisation that is committed to providing an environment where people enjoy coming to work and where your input and active participation will be highly valued.

, '\n']

[' ',

Can you take on high-end consulting and have established skills in both Qual and Quant? Looking for a collaborative researcher who can make their mark on this cutting-edge Market Research Agency

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Who

, ' ',

We are looking for:

, ' ',

• seven years' experience in a market research working with both qualitative and quantitative methodologies

, ' ',

• ideally experience in Telcos, insurance and financial services along with exposure to tracking studies

, ' ',

• ability to be hands on with data, SPSS or Q

, ' ',

• an agile researcher who can think on their feet and continually focus on best project outcomes for our clients

, ' ',

• brilliant project management skills and attention to detail

, ' ',

• a strategist who understands the agency's capabilities and can bring the best out of our team

, ' ',

• an ingenious person who can communicate with audiences at any level

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Role

, ' ',

You will report to the MD of the Sydney office. You will be required to:

, ' ',

• look to continually build relationships with our clients and stretch their thinking

, ' ',

• take briefs and provide input into proposals, choice of methodologies and approach

, ' ',

• effectively run projects, both qual/quant or combined, including ad-hoc and tracking projects from start-to-finish

, ' ',

• develop discussion guides, questionnaires and stimulus along with moderating focus groups and workshops

, ' ',

• get deeply involved with the data along with managing analyst teams and field liaison

, ' ',

• mentor our junior team members and play a role in our fun and challenging work environment

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

The Agency

, ' ',

Established just over ten years ago, this high-end market research and consultancy business uniquely combines scientific discipline, a wide range of quantitative and qualitative research approaches and strategic consulting.  Our collaborative methods and substantial expertise has produced long term relationships with an extensive group of top Global and Australian service brands; Microsoft, Australia Post, Westpac, NRMA and Telstra to name a few.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Our team is an exceptional combination of experts who can identify, understand and leverage opportunities in predicting future market movements and developing strategies that are game changing for our clients.  We specialist in Market Structure and Segmentation, Consumer Decision Making and Journey Mapping, Satisfaction, Loyalty & Retention Measurement along with Employee Engagement studies.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Contact Us

, ' ',

If this sounds like you, please contact Holly on  (+61) 2 9144 2171, or send your resume in Word Doc format to holly.brocklehurst@cci-recruit.com

, ' ',

 

, ' ']

title: b'Business Process Analyst - Salesforce or CRM exp\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

This role is accountable for end to end business process analysis and design for the customer insight and feedback applications and systems used by the customer service division.

This includes end to end process analysis and design, working closely with technical and data analysts to define existing and new data sets, developing process maps and user documentation to improve the customer feedback analysis and service. The business is using Salesforce and any experience on Salesforce and digital transformation projects is highly regarded.

Skills and Experience required:

, '\n',
  • Solid experience in end to end Business Process Analysis and design within digital and customer service improvement projects
  • Experience with Salesforce is highly preferred
  • Experience in process analysis, re/design, and development of processmaps
  • Sound practical knowledge of business process analysis tools and methodologies - BPM Aris etc.
  • Good understanding of data analytics
  • Strong analytical and conceptual skills Outstanding interpersonal skills together with verbal and written documentation
  • Relevant tertiary qualifications and/or professional certification preferred
, '\n',

, '\n',

For further information on this role or to confidentially apply, please contact Ulrike Levy on 02 8227 9200 or apply directly via the Apply for this job button. Only WORD FORMAT resumes will be accepted.

, '\n']

title: b'Data Lead\r\n        '
jd:
['\xa0',
, '\n', Duties and Responsibilities,
, '\n',
  • Support all aspects of data creation and migration, including identifying, creating, cleaning and validating data extraction, transforming, and loading data into the SAP environment
  • Supports the activities of data partners. Review  detailed validation reports provided by data partners, providing feedback to the senior data analyst
  • Capture "as is" and "to be" data flows Assist business analysts in the definition of AS-IS and TO-BE processes and overlay with detailed data flows
  • Review cleansing and conversion rules and provide feedback to Senior Data Analyst
  • Gather data from non-system sources. Cleanse data from non-system sources and extracts from systems provided by data Partners
  • Collect and create new data as nominated by the Senior Data Analyst, as needed conducting data surveys
  • Provide gathered, cleansed and created data to data partners in agreed formats
  • Assist with trial migrations, review post migration validation reports and provide feedback to the Senior Data Analyst
  • Review Production System cutover and review post migration validation reports prepared by data partners and provide feedback to the Senior Data Analyst Ensure compliance to data governance processes for all data change requests
  • Participate in workshops with end users to identify business needs
  • Work within regulatory and organisational policies, systems and procedures
  • Work with business representative's to facilitate agreement and signoff of business processes and corresponding data requirements.
  • Work with the test team to develop test scenarios to represent to be processes.
  • Collaborate with contractors and suppliers to ensure the best possible solution is delivered
, '\n', Selection Criteria,
, '\r\n\xa0',
, '\n',
  • Previous experience as a Data Lead with SAP Pant Maintenance Module
  • Experience in data cleansing, gathering and creation cleansing
  • Ability to write/tune SQL (PL SQL).
  • Previous experience on medium to large complex projects involving SAP 
  • Capacity to work independently with minimal day to day supervision
  • The ability to work according to the project plan in order to meet deliverable and milestones
  • Excellent communication skills - both verbal and written.
  • Effective team player capabilities.
  • Computer proficient.
  • Ability to operate within the values of impartiality; integrity; trust; service; accountability and safety.
  • To carry out responsibilities with professionalism, fairness and commitment and to do so in order to place the customer at the center of all that is produced and delivered.
, '\n']

title: b'Agile Senior Business Analyst\r\n      '
jd:
[
, ' ',

Fantastic opportunity for a seasoned Senior Business Analyst to join a high performing team on an award winning project.

, ' ',

One of the leading banks in the Sydney CBD is looking for a strong Senior Business Analyst to join a high profile project. This is a 3 year project which has been running for about a year and a half already and received 4/5 awards with the business last year. They have a fantastic team culture and this role sits within a high performing team.

, ' ',

My client is looking for a seasoned Agile Senior Business Analyst who can come in and hit the ground running. This person will have the opportunity to help lead the team by mentoring whilst also having the potential to act as a scrum master.

, ' ',

This is a hybrid position where you will need to act as a conduit between the business and IT. A technical background is not essential, however, being able to translate requirements into business and technical documentation is required.

, ' ',

Essential Experience

, ' ',
  • 5+ years of business analyst experience/ process improvement/ re-engineering, data analysis, system functional and non-function analysis experience.
  • Previous Business Banking experience highly desired
  • Lending domain experience highly desired
  • Strong agile experience (Scrum Master certifications highly desired)
  • End to end project delivery experience in a complex environment
  • Strong understanding of system integration and data mapping
  • Business Analyst team member in an end-to-end business process re-engineering or business transformation initiative;
  • Business Analyst team member in information technology delivery projects ensuring solution enables business processes.
, ' ',

If this sounds like you, please don't hesitate to apply online. Alternatively, you can reach us directly on jbarrett@morganmckinley.com.au

, ' ',

, ' ',

Morgan McKinley is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy.

, ' ']

title: b'Commercial Reporting Analyst\r\n    '
jd:
["This is a genuine career development opportunity with one of Australia's largest online media publishers where you will constantly learn and improve your knowledge of revenue management. This role is a great launchpad for someone with", 1-2 years experience looking to build a career, ' in the rapidly growing online advertising industry where you will have an opportunity to leave your mark at a company at the forefront of the industry.',
, ' ',
, ' Reporting to the Commercial Manager, you will be responsible for managing a wide range of reporting and analysis functions, providing analytical support to the sales and commercial teams through insightful and timely reporting of business performance. This is a strategic role with an opportunity to influence and work closely with senior members of sales leadership to help drive revenue across our network of online brands.\xa0',
, ' \xa0\xa0',
, ' \xa0\xa0',
, ' ', As the Commercial Reporting Analyst, your key responsibilities will be to:,
, ' ',
  • Prepare weekly sales reports summarising performance by revenue stream, sales team, agency and client.
  • Collate and manage all regular reporting requirements for the companies Agency Group deals, partnering with Group Sales Managers for customised agency reporting to help drive revenue from key agency groups
  • Produce scheduled revenue reports summarising performance to budget for a wide range of products and sites including Nine.com.au, 9Now, Skype and other well-known titles
  • Help support an extensive reporting improvement project being undertaken to upgrade our business intelligence reporting systems and platforms.
  • Assisting with yearly revenue budgeting and weekly forecasting processes
  • Timely completion of pre-billing and margin analysis for Network Performance team clients and publishers
  • Respond to ad-hoc queries /requests as they relate to revenue analysis and commercial queries from varying stakeholders across the business
  • Reconciliation & verification of revenue for quarterly commission calculations for the sales team
  • Work closely with the Business Applications team on continuous improvement activities to streamline and improve reporting systems and processes
, ' ', To be considered for this role, you must demonstrate the following experience, knowledge and behaviours:,
, ' ',
  • Graduate to 2 years experience in a data, business or sales analyst. (Salary dependant on experience)
  • Demonstrated ability in data and revenue analysis, extracting insights and working with or building excel models would be highly regarded
  • Highly proficient in using Microsoft Excel (vlookups, pivot tables)
  • Experience with integrating data from various data sources would be highly regarded but not essential
  • Degree qualified in a numeric discipline. E.g. Accounting, Economics, Business Management
  • Problem-solving abilities with limited information/context
, ' ', Behaviours,
, ' ',
  • You will be ambitious and driven to succeed in a genuinely fast-paced and constantly changing environment
  • Ability to interact and form effective working relationships across multiple functional groups
  • Drive for results, anticipates and overcomes problems and take steps to ensure delivery of high-quality output
  • Ability to juggle multiple priorities and stakeholders
  • Solutions focused in order to solve complex and difficult problems
  • Customer-centric mindset to be the business partner of choice
  • Take pride in your work and be curious - want to understand the broader process/business to improve their ability to perform their role & support our stakeholders.
, ' \xa0',
, ' ', About Us,
, ' ',
, " When it comes to connecting with the passions of Australians, there's no other media company like Nine. As the home of Australia's most trusted and loved brands spanning news, lifestyle, entertainment and sport, we strive to reimagine how Australia is entertained and informed through content each and every day. ",
, ' ',
, ' With investments spanning digital and broadcast, our assets include the Nine Network, Nine.com.au, 9Now, a 50% stake in subscription video-on-demand provider Stan, as well as interests in RateCity, CarAdvice, Pedestrian.tv and ASX-listed financial services company, Yellow Brick Road. ',
, ' ',
, ' Nine also has a long-running strategic relationship with Microsoft, selling their suite of advertising products. Nine - where passion meets imagination + intelligence. ']

title: b'Analytics Consultant\r\n    '
jd:
['\n',

Unisys is a global management consulting and information technology company. We work with the world's leading companies and government organizations to solve their most business and technology challenges. We specialize in providing integrated, leading-edge solutions government, financial services and commercial markets. Our offerings include cloud and infrastructure services, application development, security solutions and high-end server technology.  Unisys brings more than 20,000 associates serving clients around the world.

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

We are looking for a passionate certified Data Analyst. The successful candidate will turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions. Within Unisys Services, Consultants use our analytic methodology to collaborate with other associates to deliver analytic solutions on an engagement. Consultants bring broad understanding across quantitative techniques, and analytic software and data center infrastructure. 

, '\n',

A Consultant will help:

, '\n',
  • Interpreting data, analysing results using statistical techniques and providing ongoing reports
  • Developing and implementing databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
  • Acquiring data from primary or secondary data sources and maintaining databases/data analysis systems
, '\n',

Responsibilities:

, '\n',
  • Interpret data, analyse results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
  • Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality independently
  • Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
  • Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
  • Filter and "clean" data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems
  • Locate and define new process improvement opportunities
  • Use statistical methods to analyse data and generate useful business reports
  • Identify and recommend new ways to save money by streamlining business processes
  • Use data to create models that depict trends in the customer base and the consumer population as a whole
, '\n',

Skills, Experience & Qualifications

, '\n',
  • Proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst
  • Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
  • Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc), databases (SQL etc), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks)
  • Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc)
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
  • Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings
  • BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information      Management or Statistics
  • Experience with AWS and Azure highly desirable.
  • 2+ years' Data mining experience
  • 2+ years in a data analyst role
  • Strong attention to detail
, '\n']

title: b'Customer Service Officer\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',
We are actively recruiting 2 customer service consultants for an immediate start to be based out of Sydney.  The purpose of this role is to engage with customer and financial advisers to request information from them, arrange appointments and gather whatever information is provided and hand it over to the data analysts. This person will be working as part of a broader team that is concerned with assessing a number of historical customer files for customers that have received financial advice from our financial advisers. The purpose of the assessment is to ensure compliance with internal and statutory standards.
, '\n',
Key Duties:
, '\n',

, '\n',
, '\n',
  • Engage with customers and financial advisers via email, letters and telephone to:
  • Retrieve missing information
  • Arrange for customer appointments with advisers
  • Respond to customer or adviser queries
  • Ensure that all communication complies with our internal standards and templates
  • Where needed, draft customer communication in liaison with the project manager and other team members to an agreed standard
  • All customer and adviser communication will be channelled through the customer concierge team
  • Work to the overall team priorities in executing customer interactions


Ideally you will have worked in a similar position before in an outbound customer services environment, ideally within financial services.  Due to the requirements of the role you will have a high command of both written and verbal English and able to use both Microsoft Word and Excel.

If you are interested in the role please do not hesitate to apply.

, '\n',
, '\n']

title: b'\r\n          Test Manager (Business Intelligence)\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',

We are looking for an experienced Test Manager for one the Government Department. This would be a contract role based in Sydney CBD.

, '\n',

Responsibilities:

, '\n',
  • Manage the  Test Strategy - encompassing functional and non-functional testing across business and technology
  • Lead, deliver and iterate Test Management "Best Practices", including the incorporation of externally sourced improvements to the program testing approach and strategy
  • Should have 3+ years of  experience in leading Test Teams, developing Data Warehouse and Business Intelligence test cases
  • Actively seek ways to uplift the testing capability, through thought leadership, influence and perseverance 
  • Integrate test strategy, approach and plans with overarching approach, goals and plans
  • Coach and mentor test leads and test analysts across all testing disciplines 
  • Provide the overarching framework for the test team in the creation of Test Plans & Schedules, Scenarios, Cases, Test Matrices and associated risk tracking and mitigation plans
  • Guide and assist with the development of re-runnable test cases in SQL, SSIS and PowerBI
  • Essential experience working as a Test Manager on complex Business Intelligence projects
  • Proven hands-on testing experience involving Business Intelligence (BI) domains - ETL and Data Warehouse. 
  • Provide framework and practices that clearly articulate testing accountability across deliveries
  • Must Have  exposure to BI Tools: MS BI, SSIS, Power BI.
  • Conduct root cause analysis and defect triage in an agile environment
  • Build and manage code releases for cloud deployment using
  • Ensure Change and Configuration Management adheres to defined processes and standards
  • Should be strong in SQL
  • Support technical interdependent testing, by providing frameworks and appropriate Agile ceremonies to allow for successful execution
  • Work with Test Leads, and Project Managers to integrate Test plans with delivery plans.
  • Define the program test execution and tracking framework, including the management of test issues, defect tracking and defect reporting for all test phases
, '\n',

If you satisfy the above criteria kindly apply by clicking the apply tab else you can share your CV with hr@adactin.com

title: b'Release/Test Manager - Business Intelligence Program\r\n        '
jd:
[' ',

My client is looking for a Business Intelligence Release/Test Manager, to start immediately for an initial working period of six months with the possibility of extension.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Background and job description:

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

The Business Intelligence Release/Test Manager plays a critical role in the successful development and delivery of Business Intelligence (BI). They develop and execute tests for all layers of the Business Intelligence solution using re-runnable testing as much as possible.  They will also be responsible for packaging and release of code from to different environments within the system.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Key accountabilities include:

, ' ',
  • Understand the Business Context and Requirement
  • Work with a team of Developers and BA’s to develop and execute appropriate test strategies
  • Demonstrate expertise in test management for Business Intelligence
  • Guide and assist with the development of re-runnable test cases in SQL, SSIS and PowerBI
  • Conduct root cause analysis and defect triage in an agile environment
  • Build and manage code releases for cloud deployment using
  • Coordinate with Operations and Support Teams
  • Ensure Change and Configuration Management adheres to defined processes and standards
, ' ',

Selection Criteria:

, ' ',
  • >3 years leading test teams
  • >3 years developing Data Warehouse and Business Intelligence test cases
  • >3 experience with TFS or VSTS
  • Good SQL knowledge
  • Experience in working with large, complex Data Warehouses
, ' ',

Apply now or call Eden Medway on 02-8296-9801 

, ' ']

['\n',

Our client is a well known Australian ompany who is looking for an experienced Senior Business Intelligence Developer with exposure across a variety of BI and Data Visualisation tools to manage the ongoing design, development and support for the company’s data warehouse and business intelligence platform.

, '\n',

This role will suit candidates with a strong technical competency in the design, development, implementation and ongoing support of ETL processes, data warehouses and business intelligence platforms. Experience within the retail industry is highly desirable along with strong interpersonal and stakeholder management skills. The candidate must have strong data analysis and reporting skills and enjoy solving business challenges through working with stakeholders at all levels.

, '\n',

Responsibilities and Requirements

, '\n',
  • Own the design and development of BI solutions in accordance with the requirements of the business
  • Work directly with Business Analyst/Deliveries Manager to define requirements and estimate time to delivery for complex reports and BI requirements and with business stakeholders for noncomplex reporting requirements
  • Design, build, test and enhance existing and new data warehouse applications based on SQL database and OLAP technologies
  • Competent ETL developer responsible for the hands-on coding of all stages of the ETL processes using appropriate tools
  • Responsible for the scheduling and monitoring of the operational ETL processes and for resolving any issues with those processes
  • Awareness of data warehouse design and dimensional modeling techniques such that you can implement processes to deliver these designs and articulate any issue or ideas in the context of the overall design
  • A self-start driven by both quality and timescales
  • Provide BI Technical/Development Support
, '\n',

Essential Skills/Behaviour:

, '\n',
  • Degree educated or equivalent industry experience
  • Extensive experience in the development of Business Intelligence & Reports using the Microsoft BI stack (MSSQL, SSRS, SSIS, SSAS)
  • Very strong analytical skills and experience of writing highly complex SQL queries
  • Functional & technical understanding of ERP systems
  • Extensive experience using MDX to query and manipulate multidimensional data stores in OLAP cubes
  • Solid knowledge of data warehousing and ETL development process
  • Extensive experience in development of reports using Microsoft SQL Server Reporting and associated services
, '\n',

Desirable:

, '\n',
  • Experience with ZAP BI
, '\n',

For more information and to apply, please send your CV in WORD format to lisa@progressivepeople.com.au quoting 8886 or apply to this ad.

, ' ']

title: b'Snr Business Intelligence Developer \r\n    '
jd:

Permanent position available for a Snr Business intelligence Developer based in Western Sydney.

, ' ',

Client Details

, ' ',

Our Client is a leading Australian furniture retailer and manufacturer is looking for an experienced Senior Business Intelligence Developer with exposure across a variety of BI and Data Visualisation tools to manage the ongoing design, development and support for the company’s data warehouse and business intelligence platform.

, ' ',

Description

, ' ',

This role will suit candidates with a strong technical competency in the design, development, implementation and ongoing support of ETL processes, data warehouses and business intelligence platforms. Experience within the retail industry is highly desirable along with strong interpersonal and stakeholder management skills. The candidate must have strong data analysis and reporting skills and enjoy solving business challenges through working with stakeholders at all levels.

Responsibilities and Requirements

  • Own the design and development of BI solutions in accordance with the requirements of the business
  • Work directly with Business Analyst/Deliveries Manager to define requirements and estimate time to delivery for complex reports and BI requirements and with business stakeholders for noncomplex reporting requirements
  • Design, build, test and enhance existing and new data warehouse applications based on SQL database and OLAP technologies

Profile

Job Offer

Western Sydney | Permanent Position | Business Intelligence Developer

To apply online please click the 'Apply' button below. For a confidential discussion about this role please contact Paul Chapman on +61 2 8292 2011.

title: b'Junior Business Analyst- Business Intelligence\r\n    '
jd:
[' ',

We have an opportunity in our Business Finance team for a Junior Business Analyst - Business Intelligence to assist with maintenance and development of financial systems, metrics and reporting, and technical solutions. Interested applicants who meet the above criteria can apply by clicking on the 'Apply' link below. We appreciate the effort and time invested in compiling your application. title: b'Business Intelligence Consultant\r\n    '
jd:
[About Us:,
, ' Panalysis is an internationally respected analytics consultancy. Founded in 2011, we provide services to high profile clients from the telecommunications, e-commerce, automotive, insurance, education, government and the non-profit sectors.\xa0',
, ' ',
, ' We provide strategic measurement and insights for our clients to improve their online performance. Our clients understand that data and effective analytical processes are important factors in achieving their goals.',
, ' ',
, " Due to our continued success, we're now searching for an experienced Business Intelligence Consultant to join our close-knit team of experts who live and breathe analytics and who will stop at nothing to help our clients succeed.",
, ' ',
, ' ', The Role: ,
, ' What do you get when you bring together a group of highly trained people with backgrounds as diverse as pure mathematics, scientific research, finance, humanities, fine arts and marketing? The answer is the Panalysis team. \xa0',
, ' This broad and varied role will see you work within the consulting team and directly with our clients, using your expert knowledge and skills to:\xa0',
, ' ',
  • Design and implement reporting solutions using a range of business intelligence tools.
  • Extract data from a range of sources including Google Analytics and prepare reports based on this.
  • Use data to generate meaningful and actionable insights for our clients.
  • Help our clients instill a data driven mindset for their teams.
  • Visualise and manipulate data.
, ' ', What you'll need:  ,
, " As an experienced consultant in our team you'll obviously need highly developed written and verbal communication skills, with proven influencing and stakeholder management abilities.\xa0",
, ' ',
, " In addition, we'd like to see advanced expertise across the following: \xa0",
, ' ',
  • Data modelling (ER, star and snowflake models).
  • ETL, data cleansing.
  • Databases management: SQL, database optimisation.
  • Data visualisation concepts and experience with one or more BI tools (Tableau, Qlik, Domo, Pentaho).
  • Programming skills, Python experience is preferred.
  • Experience in executing BI projects full lifecycle: requirements elicitation, design, implementation, testing, training.
  • It would be a bonus if you also had: 
  • Experience in a consulting role
  • Experience with Google Analytics
  • Expertise in extracting data from a range of APIs
, " At Panalysis we're proud of our team and the work we do. We have a varied client base who let us do amazing things. The briefs we get provide great scope for variety, complexity and creativity - exactly what any great analyst will relish.",
, ' ',
, " The most important thing we're proud of is the quality of our work and the supportive, flexible culture. Quality is our absolute priority, but we can only achieve this by being a team who share knowledge, ideas and skills openly. Our values emphasise integrity, honesty and humility in what we do.",
, ' ',
, " \xa0If this sounds like you, then we'd love to talk to you - \xa0Apply now (including a short note introducing yourself) to Rebecca via the link provided. If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to give me a call on 02 8005 8667. "]

title: b'Business Intelligence Developer - SSRS / SSIS\r\n      '
advertiser: Smalls, GWS & JHA trading as Spinifex Recruiting -
jd:
[' ',
  • Business Intelligence Developer - SSRS / SSIS
  • Duration: 8 Months or until 31 December 2017
  • Location: Chatswood.
, ' ',

This is an excellent opportunity for SSIS/SSRS Developers to work for a fast paced Government entity for 8 months contract at Chatswood. This entity is one of the largest of its kinds employing more than 25,000 people and working on game changing projects with $41.5 Billion of investment. The team is currently developing an integration solution between a project management tool and SAP. The role requires someone to assist with building the integration pieces for this joint solution. The role is also required to enhance the current delivery system reporting capability.

, ' ',

, ' ',

Methodology

, ' ',
  • Agile - Proven ability to work in a scrum, Agile methodology
, ' ',

, ' ',

Key Responsibilities and Duties

, ' ',
  • The individual will apply proven communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills to help maximize the benefit of IT system investments by designing, developing, managing and delivering robust and scalable database platforms and solutions.
  • Assist with the definition of the overall data warehouse architecture (e.g., ETL process, Enterprise Data Warehouse, Data Marts) with guidance from the key functional requirements
  • Design and monitor construction of user-facing presentation tools, such as Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) reports and Tableau
  • Assist in the definition of data models (logical and physical)
  • Define technical requirements, technical and data architectures for the data warehouse
  • Establish and implement standards and strategies for data management, lifecycle, and quality.
  • Defining common data definitions and information workflow
  • Design, develop & test scalable ETL application for data warehouses
  • Define and direct the implementation of security requirements for the data warehouse
  • Direct the data warehouse meta data capture and access effort
  • Define production release requirements and sustainment architecture
  • Ensure accuracy & integrity of data & applications through analysis, coding, writing clear documentation & problem resolution.
  • Analyse & translate functional specifications & change requests into technical specifications.
  • Demonstrates self-reliance in researching technical solutions and product functionality
  • Continuously improve upon existing approaches by seeking opportunity to creatively transform current business practices into fresh alternative solutions.
  • Identify critical integration issues and develop corrective solutions
  • Perform maintenance and administration of the database and related server platforms
, ' ',

, ' ',

Skills / Requirements

, ' ',
  • Strong experience working in Microsoft SQL Server and the Microsoft Business Intelligence Stack (SSRS, SSAS and SSIS)
  • Strong experience designing relational and multi-dimensional models
  • Knowledge of administration of SQL Server for transactional and analysis systems
  • Strong cube design expertise
  • Strong SSRS reporting off cubes (multidimensional MDX experience preferred)
  • Third normal and Star Schema design
  • Microsoft SQL Integration Services
  • Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services
  • Microsoft SQL Server Administration including Replication Management
  • RDBMS, ODBC, and Web Services
  • TABLEAU
  • Expert level with T-SQL (Transact\SQL)
  • Strong business and process skills
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills
  • Work closely with agile team to understand, assess and estimate user stories
, ' ',

, ' ',

Qualifications

, ' ',

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Sciences or Computer Engineering or associated discipline or the equivalent experience. Requires three (3) to five (5) years’ relevant experience with SSRIS, SSAS, and SSIS, SQL, drill down reports, and query optimisation

, ' ',

This role is to start ASAP before end of May to allow for onboarding procedures. Hence, you will be currently available or approaching the end of your current contract with a proven track record in this area. Alternatively, reach out to Ruchi Giri at 02 9290 3733 for a confidential discussion.

, ' ']

title: b'Business Intelligence (BI) Developer\r\n    '
jd:
[' ',

Financial Crime includes money laundering, fraud, corruption or market abuse.

, ' ',

The Financial Crime Services team is accountable for the development, implementation and ongoing leadership of the Group's financial crimes shared service, focusing on the systems, people and processes to effectively counter origination and transaction fraud, sanctions and money laundering through effective detection, assessment and escalation of financial crime matters.

, ' ',

, ' ',

The team

, ' ',

This role sits within the strategic and reporting data analytics team. The main function is to develop, build, and maintain reports as well as improving current reporting solutions to provide information and insights around financial fraud to stakeholders and the business.

, ' ',

, ' ',

The role

, ' ',

The key responsibility specific to this role includes:

, ' ',

, ' ',
  • Develop reports using the various tools such as SAS visual analytics, Tableau and Microsoft Office.
  • Automate tasks using schedulers and scripting language.
  • Understand the key priorities and requirements of our customers and demonstrate value add.
  • Ability to problem solve complex business and technical problems.

  • Demonstrating knowledge and professional experience in software development within a multidisciplinary environment.
, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

The candidate

, ' ',

Tertiary qualifications in a numerate, engineering and / or IT based discipline. Experience in software development using SAS, SQL, or scripting languages (Python, R, Perl) is essential. Knowledge in Tableau or SAS Visual Analytics will be an advantage.

, ' ',

Previous banking/finance industry experience is not essential, however knowledge in anti-financial fraud, AML (Anti money laundering) and Sanctions will be beneficial.

, ' ',

Advanced verbal, written and numeracy skills and demonstrable ability to take initiative and work with business stakeholder to resolve issues is critical to the success of this role.

, ' ',

, ' ',

We are committed to building a respectful and inclusive workplace, appointing the best person for the role, supporting diversity.

, ' ',

, ' ']

title: b'Business Intelligence Specialist\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

Avant Mutual Group is Australia's leading doctors’ mutual. We are an organisation created by doctors, for doctors.

, ' ',

We support over 72,000 healthcare professionals and students with a range of products and services, including medical defence and indemnity insurance. Our products are designed to protect our members both professionally and personally, to safeguard their career and reputation and protect them and their families.

, ' ',

Our mutual structure, heritage and ethos ensure that our members are at the centre of everything we do.

, ' ',

We are seeking a permanent, full time Business Intelligence Specialist for our Sydney team. This role will report into the Head of Enterprise Information Management and will join a team who is responsible to provide reliable and timely information and data to the Avant business.

, ' ',

This is a technical role tasked to design and implement data solutions with Microsoft SQL Server and other Business Intelligence tools as per the Avant’s standards and guidelines.

, ' ',

The key responsibilities include:

, ' ',
  • Design, develop and implement data warehouse and data mart solutions to meet the requirements of business stakeholders;
  • Develop and implement data and ETL solutions in Microsoft SQL server and related technologies;
  • Build strong relationships with business stakeholders to understand business requirements;
  • Translate business requirements into data models and other design artefacts;
  • Ensure data quality in Enterprise Information Management systems
  • Contribute to Business Intelligence & Analytics Community of Practice
, ' ',

To be successful in this role you will have:

, ' ',
  • Previous demonstrated experience in a business intelligence role within a corporate environment
  • Advanced understanding of Microsoft SQL Server, OLAP and ETL
  • Previous experience in BI and analytics tools such as Qlik, Tableau would be advantageous
  • Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel
  • Strong problem solving, innovative thinking and drive to succeed
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills, both written and verbal
  • Relevant tertiary qualifications in a Computing Science degree, or similar
, ' ',

For further information, please contact Paul Shipton (Talent Acquisition Manager) on (02) 9260 9107.

, ' ']

title: b'Microsoft Business Intelligence Lead\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

Company overview

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Operating across Management Consulting and IT Consulting we offer a truly unique and tailored approach to project delivery. Our close relationship with Microsoft as a Gold Partner ensures we are involved in new and innovative projects which provides us with the opportunity to use new technologies in creative ways.

, ' ',

We value our team and therefore ensure as part of our recruitment process we choose the right people who will contribute positively to our emerging culture that wants you and those around you to be the best you can be.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

What we are looking for:

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Microsoft Business Intelligence Technical Architect/Lead with strong experience across SSRS, SSIS, SSAS, Azure, Power BI and solid data warehousing skills to join our BI Team as the Technical MS BI Lead for our business in Sydney. This role will require this individual to be a major part of the practice going forward in Pre-Sales, Workshops, client facing/management, delivery, deployment and maintaining vendor and customer relations.

, ' ',

We are looking for a driven and proven individual who can leverage existing relationships with Microsoft to build a team in NSW and support our ongoing growth. You will be supported both in Sydney and through a National Network of peers who have a vested interest in your success.

, ' ',

This opportunity will suit those willing to be part of a very successful growth story and understand that being part of that story will require hard work and dedication.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

What you will do:

, ' ',
  • Project delivery, development and implementation Microsoft Business Intelligence stack for all of our NSW business using your experience in MS SQL 2012/14/16 and Azure utilising knowledge in stored procedures, high availability, indexing strategies, security, back-up and recovery etc.
  • You will organise and run Workshops, Client meetings, POC’s and build/maintain client relationships
  • Working with customers on new deployments, demonstrations and POC’s of Power BI and Azure PaaS services
  • Showcasing your experience as a Technical or Solutions Architect for high level solutions and designs as well as operating in a very hands-on capacity
  • Using your passion for technology and extremely high level of communication to discuss technical solutions to non-technical stakeholders/clients
  • You will also ideally have proven experience in building a consultancy team, leading, mentoring and managing them.
, ' ',

What we want:

, ' ',

  • Full Australian work rights
, ' ',

This role will be based from the Sydney CBD with some travel, this will be a Permanent position in a senior capacity. Salary will be very competitive and based on experience. 

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Next steps

If you want to be part of a growing team where you are appreciated, work with like-minded peers and continue to advance your skills and learn then please do get in touch for a confidential discussion.

title: b'Business Intelligence Analyst | Tableau | $95,000 + | Career Progression\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',
  • Stunning State of the Art Office Space
  • $95,000 + super + Excellent Staff incentives and Facilities
  • Exciting and varied Project work – Career Progression and Development
, '\r\nThis globally recognised healthcare company is currently at the forefront of their market and have continued to grow from strength to strength. With the recent expansion of several offices overseas as well as an increase in headcount, the need for a skilled\r\n business intelligence analyst has emerged to join their highly qualified and professional team.\xa0 In this role you will play a pivotal part in providing guidance on the potential business value and complexity of development works to the business in order to\r\n assist in prioritising the demands of multiple stakeholders.',
, '\n',
, '\n', Responsibilities will include:, '\n',
  • Specifies and applies appropriate analytical techniques to create information which supports business decision-making.
  • Formats and communicates results, using textual, numeric, graphical and other visualisation methods appropriate to the target audience using appropriate tools.
  • Maintains an in-depth knowledge of Tableau and the Microsoft B.I. stack, and provides expert advice regarding their application. Can supervise specialist consultancy.
  • Contributes to selection of the most appropriate means of representing business requirements in the context of Business Intelligence, ensuring traceability back to source. Discovers and analyses requirements for fitness for purpose as well as adherence to business objectives and consistency, challenging positively as appropriate. Obtains formal agreement by stakeholders and recipients to scope and requirements and establishes a base-line on which delivery of a solution can commence. Manages requests for and the application of changes to base-lined requirements.
  • Investigates corporate data requirements, and applies data analysis, data modelling and quality assurance techniques, to establish, modify or maintain data structures and their associated components (entity descriptions, relationship descriptions, attribute definitions). Provides advice and guidance to database designers and others using the data structures and associated components.
  • Plans and schedules the delivery of learning activities, based on learning objectives. Manages the delivery of programmes of learning. Customises formal and informal learning activities, incorporating relevant business scenarios and case studies. Designs appropriate environments, and delivers learning activities to specialist audiences. Advises/coaches others in learning delivery techniques and options.  
, '\n', To be successful for this position you will need to display:, '\n',
  • Proficient with Microsoft business intelligence suite (2008-2014), Tableau Desktop and Server (9-10)
  • Experience analysing, designing and developing Business Intelligence solutions
  • Demonstrates excellent communication/interpersonal skills with a consultative acumen
  • Work with Project Management and Data Warehouse teams to translate requirements into project scope, and deliver on scope; a well-defined
  • Python experience is a plus.  
, '\r\nIf you have the above experience and want to join a fun, fast paced passionate team please forward your resume to julians@charterhouse.com.au or call me on 9641 2453.\r\n ']

title: b'Business Development Manager - Business Intelligence / Information Services\r\n    '
jd:

, ' \xa0',

, ' ',
, ' Key responsibilities:\xa0',
, ' ',
  • Selling information subscription services as well as insights/analytics solutions into existing and new accounts
  • Achievement of revenue targets

  • Development of strategic business development plans
  • Commercial and legal contractual negotiations
, ' Key skills required:\xa0',

Please send through your CV to chris.irwin@jenkinbeattie.com ']

title: b'Business Intelligence Analytics Manager\r\n    '
jd:
[' ',

As the BI Analytics Manager role you will provide BI and Analytics leadership for Alinta Energy. You will establish and execute a vision for the delivery of information and analytics processes, platforms and solutions that will support Alinta Energy achieving its business strategy.

, ' ',

Reporting to the CIO, you will be managing a team of 6, provide strong leadership and engage with key stakeholders across the business to make data available and transform the company into a business that truly utilises information and analytics to drive business value. Operationally you will provide the structure and management to efficiently and cost effectively plan, prioritise and deliver the businesses reporting and analytics needs.

, ' ',

What you'll be doing;

, ' ',
  • Facilitate the development of Alinta's BI Analytics vision and the strategy to deliver
  • Leadership of Alinta's BI Analytics functions in IT and across business units
  • Prioritise and deliver the businesses reporting and analytics needs
  • Provide IT leadership across Alinta as a member of the IT leadership team
  • Develop Alinta's data, reporting and analytics architecture
, ' ',

What we're looking for:

, ' ',
  • Extensive expertise with BI and analytics
  • Knowledge of key BI trends and the BI vendor landscape
  • Strong interpersonal skill and the ability to develop and engage cross functional teams
  • A constructive and collaborative leadership style
  • IT leadership and senior executive engagement experience
  • Excellent written, verbal and presentation skills.
  • Proven ability to manage vendor, supplier, sub-contractor relationships
  • Experience in building and supporting BI/analytics/big data business cases
, ' ',

Join a more rewarding culture at Alinta Energy.

, ' ',

Applications close Friday 13th, May 2017.

, ' ',

A bit about us:

, ' ',

Alinta Energy is a leading Australian utility with an owned and contracted generation portfolio of ~2,000 MW, approximately 800,000 electricity and gas retail customers and over 370 employees across Australia and New Zealand.

, ' ',

Operating Australia's largest contracted gas generation portfolio, Alinta is the only truly national electricity and gas company spanning the South West Interconnected System (SWIS), North West Interconnected System (NWIS) and South East Pilbara region of Western Australia (WA) as well as the National Electricity Market (NEM). Alinta operates in five of Australia's six states as well as New Zealand.

, ' ',




, ' ']

title: b'Business Intelligence Analyst\r\n      '
jd:
[Business Intelligence Analyst,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', About Us,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', Our business is a division of the Ardent Leisure group across Australia and NZ and includes the entertainment brands Kingpin Bowling, AMF Bowling and Playtime.,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', We have more than 50 venues across Australia and New Zealand and a team of 1,800+. Our team are passionate about creating memorable experiences for our guests and being champions of fun. We are on a journey of change and transformation and our vision is to grow and strengthen our business by investing in our people, creating trust with our guests, being authentic and having fun.,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', The Role,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', We are currently seeking a talented Business Intelligence Analyst to join our friendly IT team based in our Support Office, on a full-time basis.,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', Reporting to the Head of IT (AMF) and BI Lead, this role will be pivotal in driving BI and the reporting suite within the business. You will work closely with business stakeholders, and constantly look for ways to improve reporting and reconciliation efficiency with a strong focus on automation. ,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', The role will use Business Intelligence knowledge and principles to assist in delivering front end data visualisation to key stakeholders including executives and management using tools such as Tableau and Power BI.,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', You will have:,
, ' ',
  • Ability to communicate with key business stakeholders and create basic requirements documents. This is extremely critical and a huge part of this role.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to communicate with BI Developers.
  • Work closely with the BI Lead and Head of IT to ensure that the end to end designs meet the business and data requirements
  • Experience with front end visualisation tool (e.g. Tableau/Power BI)
  • Understand core business processes, business rules pertaining to data transformations and understand/enhance legacy processes.
  • Understand data structures and how the lifecycle/state changes as a result of the above processes and application of business rules.
  • An understanding of the data lifecycle from source to actionable reporting
  • Basic SQL skills for data exploration
, ' ', Highly Desirable but not mandatory: ,
, ' ',
  • A working knowledge of star schema data warehousing to troubleshoot
  • Administrating Reporting Tool Server (e.g. Tableau/Power BI)\
, ' ', We will offer:,
, ' ',
  • Professional development opportunities
  • Generous salary
