title: b'Entry Level Business Intelligence Developer\r\n      '
jd:
["Due to Datacom's ongoing success and growth we are currently seeking a highly driven Business Intelligence Developer\xa0to join our innovative Business Intelligence and Reporting team.\xa0",
, ' ',
, ' As a\xa0', Business Intelligence Developer, , 'you will be responsible for designing, developing and troubleshooting reporting solutions and databases within our exciting Contact Centre business.\xa0',
, ' ',
, ' ', Who are Datacom Connect? 
,
, ' We provide customers with world class end to end contact centre solutions ranging from complete technology solutions to skilled customer service representatives.',
, ' ',
, " Datacom has over 4,700 talented professionals in 27 offices across Australia, New Zealand, Malaysia and the Philippines, we have extensive expertise in the operation of data centres, the provision of IT services, cloud, software engineering and application management, payroll and customer service design and operations. Privately owned, our culture is shaped by autonomy, collaboration, agility and speed. And because we're continually sharpening our skills at the leading edge of technology, our future looks bright.",
, ' ',
, ' ', The Datacom Connect benefits;, ' ',
  • Social activities and themed events
  • Corporate Reward and Recognition Program "Bounce"
  • Professional Leadership Development
  • Corporate Wellness Program, which includes a FitBit!
  • Fresh Fruit supplied weekly
, ' ', Key responsibilities include:, '\xa0',
, ' ',
, ' ',
  • Define and clarify requirements, propose and develop appropriate solutions, and provide feedback to the reporting team and internal customers
  • Work with the team to design and implement ETL procedures for intake of data from both internal and outside sources; as well as ensure data is verified and quality is checked
  • Serves as the subject matter expert for business intelligence related tools
  • Ensure that issues encountered in production environments are resolved in a timely manner.
  • Perform performance tuning / query optimisation
  • Prepare, deliver and update reports to support contractual obligations and the performance of our business to both internal and external customers in a timely manner
  • Conduct regular maintainence and improvements to reporting to support  data visualisation & analytics solutions.
  • Working closely with key Stakeholders to clearly define and understand reporting and data requirements
  • Adapt quickly and effectively to changes in departmental or strategic priorities by responding to requests for additional adhoc reporting
  • Participate in code and design reviews 
  • Create and maintain required documentation
, ' ', We are looking for individuals who have;
,
, ' ',
  • Knowledge of call centre telephony and systems
  • Some experience working in a BI, analytics, reporting role
  • Experience in use of SQL Databases and or BI systems
  • Tertiary IT-related degree qualification 
  • Strong computer skills
  • Strong analytical skills and experience of writing complex SQL queries
  • Working knowledge of SQL Server including SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), SQL Server 2008 R2/2008/2005, SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)
  • Database schema and table design
  • Good understanding of ETL development
  • Strong verbal and numerical skills (complex calculations, data analysis and reconciliation, numerical and verbal logical reasoning)
  • Statistical analysis skills
  • Ability to develop strong relationships with key contacts 
  • Strong problem solving skills
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Time management & ability to work under pressure
  • Due to Security Clearance purposes, this role does require Australian Citizenship and ability to pass a criminal history check. 
, ' This is a highly rewarding opportunity to join a dynamic organisation.\xa0 In return we offer an innovative and progressive culture, onsite parking, excellent facilities and on-going training and development. \xa0\xa0',
, ' ',
, ' ', Our future looks bright now. And so can yours. If you're ready to make a move, we're ready to talk. 

Please send your application to Georgia Browning, Recruitment Manager by clicking APPLY NOW, alternatively for more information please call 9023 5136., ' ']

title: b'Reporting Analyst - Business Intelligence\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',
  • Parramatta Location
  • 6 months contract
  • $45-50 + per hour
, '\n',

The Reporting Analyst will work as a member of the Strategy and Performance team to design and develop appropriate reporting and forecasting frameworks and tools to estimate and quantify costs, benefits and risk associated with the Program as well as to identify efficiency saving opportunities. Initial focus will be required on the redesign of a reporting and forecasting framework for the inspections phase of the Program to ensure objectives and timeframes are met. Additionally the role will be required to develop reports and tools to support tracking and benefits measurement as follows:

  • Provide plain language advice on reporting and forecasting to non-specialist audiences

To be successful in this role you will need the following skills and experience:

  • Advanced Excel skills - mandatory, MS Access - highly desirable
  • Relevant tertiary qualifications or equivalent industry experience - mandatory.
  • Experience in BI reporting software such as Tableau or PowerBI - highly desirable
  • Experience in SAP Accounts reporting - highly desirable
  • Any experience working in the NSW Government sector would be highly desirable
, '\n',

Call Wendy on 02 82523120 for more information or APPLY NOW online

['\n',

About us:

, '\n',

KinCare Group is a privately owned Australian business that is at the forefront of the provision of in-home care services across Australia. A highly regarded and innovative organisation, we hold a wealth of expertise and experience in aged care, disability and allied health services.

, '\n',

KinCare is going through a significant transformation agenda as we move into a retail environment with the deregulation of the in-home care market and as such is now entering into another exciting period of growth. We currently have approximately 2,000 passionate employees whose skills, knowledge and expertise creates a high performing team that ensures KinCare remains a successful, national leader within the industry.

, '\n',

The role:

, '\n',

The role will require you to develop and successfully implement a national reporting framework that enhances business performance and provides transparency of results to senior stakeholders.

, '\n',

You will be required to proactively deliver accurate analysis reporting through evaluating information gathered from multiple sources, reconciling conflicts, decomposing high-level information into details and abstract up from low-level information to factual clear information.

, '\n',

In order to be successful you will need to drive, consult and challenge business units on their performance and assumptions of how they will successfully execute their plans to achieve KPI’s and business outcomes. You will also:

, '\n',
  • Full review of reporting and dashboards including decommissioning, automating & introducing standards/cycles
  • Data integrity and cleansing
  • Develop BI & Reporting maturity road map
  • Produce insights to inform business decisions and SLT/Board updates
  • Direct reports up to 2
, '\n',

Your background will have:

['\n',


, '\n',

About the role

, '\n',

Macquarie Leasing is a leading provider of asset finance and has been growing year-on-year. As a successful Business Intelligence Analyst/Senior Analyst within this team, you will take ownership and accountability for independently developing solutions for our data and analytics capability.

, '\n',

In this exciting opportunity, you will be responsible for the following:

, '\n',
  • independently applying superior problem solving ability to identify meaningful insights that drive business decisions
  • create visibility of the customer experience journey across our portfolio by identifying gaps and work with a wide range of stakeholders to close data gaps
  • developing automated reporting solutions with the use of tools such as VBA, R Studio etc. Experience with Salesforce is also advantageous
  • developing and maintaining sales financial reporting in a structured manner applying knowledge around financial modelling and budgeting
  • applying statistical concepts and models to develop sales forecasting capabilities and market/customer segmentation to drive business decisions
  • owning and driving continuous improvement in the data and analytics capabilities of the business channel.
, '\n',

Working closely with the management team and within our projects, reporting and analytics function, you will take ownership and become accountable for our reporting and insights capability. Exceptional performance will be rewarded through excellent opportunities for career progression within a high performance culture.

, '\n',

About you

, '\n',

To be considered for this role, you are comfortable solving problems end to end, using the right tools and asking the right questions. Your commercial acumen is developed and you have the passion and the enthusiasm to help drive the team to succeed by independently providing insights.

, '\n',
  • you will also able to demonstrate the following:
  • you are an achievement driven, self-motivated individual who is able to compliment a people-based culture focused on accountability, integrity and opportunity
  • you have an innovative and curious mind, with a passion for using tools and concepts to draw insights from data that drives decision making
  • the ability to manage business pressures and stakeholder expectations while maintaining a high degree of motivation and professionalism whilst managing multiple work streams
  • the ability to think from an commercial perspective and communicate with stakeholders to ensure model inputs and outputs match business/customer needs
  • solutions and result driven with a track record of achievements in a data-led environment
  • relevant tertiary qualifications and experience in an analytical discipline (e.g. statistics, finance, computer science) as well as sound proficiency with VBA, R Studio etc is advantageous.
, '\n',

At Macquarie, we offer you the experience and freedom to own your career whilst making your mark within a highly successful organisation. To apply please follow the link to submit an application online. If you may require further information please contact Tracey Callaghan on tracey.callaghan@macquarie.com

, '\n',

If you are interested in this opportunity please click on the appropriate link to apply.

, '\n',

About us

, '\n',

Corporate and Asset Finance Group provides innovative and traditional capital, finance and related services to clients operating in selected international markets. With offices in Australia, New Zealand, Asia, North America and Europe, Corporate and Asset Finance specialises in:

, '\n',
  • leasing and asset finance
  • tailored debt and finance solutions
  • asset remarketing, sourcing and trading.
, '\n',

Find out more about Macquarie careers at www.macquarie.com/careers.

, '\n']

title: b'Business Intelligence Reports Analyst - Wealth Banking\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

We are looking for a Business Analyst with BI reporting skills for one of our industry leading banking clients based in Sydney CBD.

This role sits in the Wealth Analytics team and the main function is work on projects to carry out business analysis and provide reporting and insights for different business units in product and finance. There will also be a small part of BAU reporting involved.

There are four others in the team and you will be expected to work independently and be open minded as well as embrace the opportunity to learn and innovate.

You will essentially bridge the gap between technology and the business in this role. The hiring manager needs somebody with a business analysis background that can tell a story from the data.

There are opportunities to progress your career in the business and develop technical and business skills in the wealth banking space.

SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

title: b'Business Development Manager - Pharma Intelligence\r\n      '
jd:
['Our client is a premium business information company specialising in industry analysis and arguably one of the fastest growing business intelligence companies in the world. Their leading business intelligence provides advanced analytics to help clients make better, more informed decisions on a global scale. With solutions covering a broad range of professional industries, including pharmaceuticals and medical, alternative energy, clean technology, oil and gas, and many more, they are well placed to deliver in-depth primary and secondary research, proprietary databases and high quality analysis from expert teams at company, country and/or industry level. Due to continued growth within the pharmaceuticals and medical device teams, they now have an exciting opening for an experienced Business Development Manager to join one of their successful Sydney based teams. ',
, ' ',
, ' As a\xa0Pharmaceutical Business Development Manager, you will: ',
, ' ',
, ' Join a performing and fast growing team based in London where the focus is on selling business intelligence platforms to C-level executives in the\xa0Pharma sector ',
, ' Deliver consistent research to understand the relevant issues in the market and communicate those issues effectively ',
, ' Present and network solutions to C-level executives in person and over the telephone ',
, ' Develop and grow a strong comprehension of the sales skills required in this role and negotiate deals up to $1m in value ',
, ' Achieve and exceed quarterly sales revenue targets, negotiate subscriptions with new clients and contribute to the larger initiatives of the company ',
, ' The ideal candidate will: ',
, ' ',
, ' Be intelligent, inquisitive and possess a minimum of\xa02 years’ previous consultative sales experience',
, ' Have a Medical background (Degree or experience)',
, ' Be able to demonstrate business acumen, motivation and a dynamic yet professional approach to new business sales and account development ',
, ' Have first class communication and presentation skills and the ability to liaise with customers at all levels across a large geographical territory ',
, ' Be free to travel as this role comes with travel requirements ']

['\n',
My client offers research and data connected to Mine sites and Oil and Gas fields across the Globe. In the past year they have capitalized on their strong name in the market and are now looking for an experienced BDM with strong exposure to the Oil and Gas industry.

With a team of Engineers and Geologists producing detailed data predicting present and future Operational costs and production levels, this is a Company that offers real value to both financiers as well as producers.

Reporting to a Group Manager, this role will be targeting the leading players in the industry and will see you develop relationships both locally and in SE Asia. As a stand-alone role you will be given plenty of autonomy as you look to grow a brand that has already made major inroads into the Mining and Metals space and has a strong name in the Australian Banking sector.

To be successful you must demonstrate a sales track record showing strong relationships with major Oil and Gas producers. An understanding of M and A in this space is also essential as is a willingness to develop and hunt for new business.

With more than 80 staff in Sydney alone, this is a Company on the rise that has come from a solid foundation. You will have the opportunity to be a pioneer in this division and as such will have the career growth that accompanies this.
, '\n']

title: b'Business Intelligence Lead Developer\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

You will be leading a team in the Analytics function of an iconic Australian retailer where you will drive the delivery out of a strategic data asset for the group.  These initiatives aim to provide world class BI reporting solutions to the end clients which will evolve into more predictive analytics through time. Your audience and stakeholders will be broad and diverse, giving you an unrivalled profile and the platform from which to build your career.

, ' ',

Responsibilities include:

, ' ',
  • Lead an immediate team of three developers with a matrix of additional resources you can utilise
  • Provide technical thought leadership around the development of BI solutions
  • Manage technical resources, vendors and offshore providers
  • Execute the system strategies and work closely with IT around delivery
  • Liaise with project managers, technology, finance and the business to deliver shared goals
, ' ',

This is an exciting and demanding role that requires a strong technical skill set in BI development (SQL Server / BI Stack/Teradata and Tableau), coupled with an ability to lead a team in delivering key goals. Strong communication skills are essential.

, ' ',

If this sounds like a role you would excel in and you wish to join an iconic business that can support you in your future career goals, please apply via seek. 

, ' ']

title: b'\r\n          Microsoft Business Intelligence / Analytics Consultants\r\n        '
jd:
[' ',

Company Details: We are AgileBI, a rapidly growing data and analytics consultancy and Microsoft Gold Partner. We are growing fast and need more smart, innovative minded consultants to help deliver great results to our customers. This year we have been leading the charge for Microsoft Power BI and created some great customer outcomes and established ourselves as Australian Leaders. Our team is small, tight knit and made up of some very smart and able people.

, ' ',

Description: The role will include, but definitely not be limited to:

, ' ',
  • Technical consulting 
  • Business Analysis
  • Career Development
  • Thought Leadership
, ' ',

Plus we need your help with marketing, sales, growing the company and if you have any special talents then we'd like to use those too!

, ' ',

Profile: The sort of person who will enjoy this role will be above all focused on delivering great results for our customers and supporting our team in doing so. An excitement for the new technologies in the Cortana Analytics suite is also key, with an appetite for applying these new technologies to create genuine customer value. You need to have the passion for what you do and a dedication to doing it well. If you are looking for just a paycheque, this is the wrong company for you. We want to be known for being great people doing great things for great customers.

, ' ',

A strong background in Microsoft's on premise and cloud BI technologies is essential – and we expect you to be an expert in at least one of them, backed up by MCSE certification - though we will give you the tools to plug any remaining gaps in your knowledge. Key technologies are:

, ' ',
  • SQL Server Database Engine
  • SQL Server Cubes – OLAP + Tabular, MDX + DAX
  • SQL Server Data Management – SSIS / MDS / DQS
  • Power BI
  • Cortana Intelligence Suite
  • R or Python
  • Azure SQL / DW / Data Factory
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Job Offer: This role is offering a competitive salary, a career position in a growing company with a genuine chance to shape both your role and our business – plus a great team to work with.

, ' ',

If you want to know more please send us your CV, desired salary and availability to jobs@agilebi.com.au or click APPLY.

, ' ',

*** STRICTLY NO AGENCIES ***

, ' ',

Please note that our Company Policy dictates direct recruitment only.

, ' ',
, ' ']

title: b'Project Consultant - Business Intelligence - Banking\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

A new technical hybrid Business Analyst/Business Intelligence opportunity has been created in a leading domestic bank.  The role is a second in command to the product owner of a newly created front line performance reporting solution encompassing Analytics, Insights, Data Warehousing and Visualisation.  This role will suit someone with either line BI experience or Technical Business Analyst experience.

, '\n',

You will be:

, '\n',
  • Able to communicate with and manage stakeholders effectively in a project environment
  • Used to working in an agile environment
  • An expert in executing requirements within the Data, Analytics and Insight space
  • From a technical BI or DW background
, '\n',

Key Responsibilities:

, '\n',
  • Build and maintain effective relationships across Finance, Business units and technical teams involved in the program build across the organization.
  • Supporting the product owner by delivering high quality and accurate input into design and analysis
  • Maintain an effective service provider relationship
  • Apply good team member behaviours, providing a positive contribution to culture and environment

 If this sounds like your next opportunity then please send your CV via seek and if successful our team will be in contact with you.

title: b'Business Intelligence Reporting Analyst\r\n    '
jd:
['\n',

We are committed to a culture where how we deliver is as critical as what we deliver. Surrounded by talented people that share your passion and direction, you know you will have the support to make a difference and your contribution will be valued at Alinta Energy.

, '\n',

This exciting role is responsible for the development of processes and systems to support commercial decision making within the Wholesale & Trading team. The role will be required to develop and implement Business Intelligence and other tools to automate and improve the delivery of key reporting and analysis; and to manage risk within the business.

, '\n',

You will work with all members of the Wholesale & Trading team as well as other areas within Alinta to deliver end-to-end reporting and analytical solutions. You will gather business requirements and work proactively with key stakeholders to ensure delivery of new projects and initiatives.

, '\n',

What you'll be doing:

, '\n',

, '\n',
  • Play a key role in delivering complex business intelligence solutions.
  • Be responsible for the design, development, documentation and maintenance of dashboards and custom reporting.
  • Understand and capture reporting and analysis requirements.
  • Work closely with the System Team and Information Technology team to deliver end-to-end reporting and analytics solutions.
  • Provide specialist technical support to users using report design techniques and solutions.
  • Ensure the integrity of the change process throughout the development life cycle and help establish and drive standard methodologies, and adhere to them.
  • Stay abreast of current and emerging BI reporting technologies and standards.
  • Energy trading analysis and reporting across multiple markets and commodities;
  • Energy markets monitoring and analysis including modelling of risk and valuations of financial instruments;
  • Maintaining and enhancing portfolio position reporting across multiple markets and commodities;
  • Monitoring trading data and information to access the relevance and accuracy to support effective decision making;
, '\n',

, '\n',

What we're looking for:

, '\n',

Essential

, '\n',
  • Qualification in relevant technical or financial discipline.
  • Logical with structured analytical thinking.
  • Problem solving skills and experience.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.
  • Effective interpersonal skills and ability to engage with people at all levels.
  • Proven experience in the development of analytical and reporting tools.
  • Experience in the development of Business Intelligence dashboards and reports.
  • An advanced user of Excel/VBA/SQL//Tableau/ETL platforms for data processing and visualizations.
, '\n',

Desirable

, '\n',
  • Experience in relevant energy markets.
  • Prior experience in business / process improvement and optimisation.
  • Experience in market and portfolio monitoring, commercial planning and budgeting.
  • Understanding of financial instruments and their role in managing risk.
  • Prophet capability or other similar structural modelling capability.
  • Understanding of quantitative financial modelling.
, '\n',

, '\n',

Join a more rewarding culture at Alinta Energy.

, '\n',

Applications close Monday 24th, April 2017.

, '\n',

, '\n',

A bit about us:

, '\n',

Alinta Energy is a leading Australian utility with an owned and contracted generation portfolio of ~2,000 MW, approximately 800,000 electricity and gas retail customers and over 370 employees across Australia and New Zealand.

, '\n',

Operating Australia's largest contracted gas generation portfolio, Alinta is the only truly national electricity and gas company spanning the South West Interconnected System (SWIS), North West Interconnected System (NWIS) and South East Pilbara region of Western Australia (WA) as well as the National Electricity Market (NEM). Alinta operates in five of Australia's six states as well as New Zealand.

, '\n',

, '\n']

title: b'Retail Business Intelligence Analyst - Esprit\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

Esprit is an international lifestyle brand operating in more than 40 countries with over 1000 points of sale. Our continued success depends on the abilities, commitment, enthusiasm and energy of our teams around the world.

, ' ',

We are looking for an experienced Retail Business Intelligence Analyst to join our head office team based in Pyrmont.

, ' ',

Reporting to the Head of Retail, you will be responsible for gathering data, analysing and proposing solutions to drive productivity and profitability in the ANZ business

, ' ',

Your key responsibilities will include:

, ' ',
  • Generating and analysing regional KPI reports including payroll, profit and loss, productivity analysis, regional sales analysis
  • Providing data driven analysis and solutions to support business decisions
  • Workshop solutions to support operational efficiency with Regional Managers and provide implementation support
  • Supporting internal audit process ensuring compliance with corporate guidelines around cash management, stock organisation and loyalty program usage.
, ' ',

To be successful in this Retail Business Intelligence Analyst position you must have:

, ' ',
  • Experience analysing retail data and reports
  • Good analytical and problem solving skills
  • Advanced Excel skills and prior exposure to SAP and BW
  • Be an excellent communicator 
, ' ',

Some of the perks and benefits of working at Esprit include:

, ' ',
  • Generous clothing discount and incentives
  • Career progression opportunities
  • Dynamic and inspirational culture
, ' ',

To join a lifestyle brand that creates the future, apply now!

, ' ',

Visit our careers site Esprit.com/careers to find out more

, ' ']

[' ',

Role : Business Intelligence Solution Architect ; Location : Redfern
Contract Duration : 6 months; Availability : Immediate

, ' ',

Purpose of the role :

, ' ',

The BI Solution Architect’s primary purpose is to deliver the technical solution for the Program. The role will help acquire, organise, structure, and label information in an effective and sustainable way that supports the needs of Operational Systems and its stakeholders. The role is responsible for maintaining the domain data models, establishing interface contracts and architecting the end-to-end information flows. It is expected that the role has a good understanding of DAMA’s DMBoK and is preferably CDMP certified. The technology landscape includes Embarcadero, SAP Data Services, Oracle Exadata, SAP Business Objects and Tableau Server.

, ' ',

An incremental approach will be used to deploy business capability over the remaining 18 month timeframe for the Program.

, ' ',

Key accountabilities :

, ' ',
  • Demonstrate good leadership to inspire direction and delivery, develop people, and drive change.
, ' ',
  • Live the NSW Public Sector and organisational values to achieve outstanding outcomes for the organisation and customers.
, ' ',
  • Contribute to the development of the information/data architecture within the Operational Systems domain with a view to establishing Business Intelligence, Data Integration and Data Modeling as significant capabilities.
, ' ',
  • Engage with the business to understand their tactical and strategic demands to ensure a culture of quality customer service.
, ' ',
  • Identify the emerging information management and architecture capability required to ensure the business goals are achieved.
, ' ',
  • Develop the architectural roadmap relating to information and data to ensure business expectations and current and future needs are met.
, ' ',
  • Play an active role in the establishment of ‘best practice’ in relation to all aspects of data and information management.
, ' ',
  • Ensure methods and standards are in place to assist with the organisation’s development of information/data architecture.
, ' ',
    • Team with other internal BI and Data Architects to develop a set of design principles and standards that guide the usage of technologies in the following areas:
, ' ',
  • Operational Data Store and business intelligence
, ' ',
  • Operational Master and Reference Data Management
, ' ',
  • Data Quality, Cleansing and Profiling
, ' ',
  • Data Integration & Meta Data Management
, ' ',
  • Enterprise Data Model, including canonical data models and external reference models
, ' ',
  • Transport Standards based Operational Data Exchange
, ' ',
  • Actively support the Program with definition, guidance, leadership and mentoring during design and delivery to ensure implementations aligned to the Target Architecture
, ' ',

Key challenges

, ' ',
  • Drive innovation and share visions with the team and business
, ' ',
  • Interact with other Architects internally and externally to drive constant improvements
, ' ',
  • Interact and engage with other internal business cluster stakeholders, which includes agencies and external operators.
, ' ',

If you feel this role is for you apply immediately, you can call at (02)9246 6781 to understand more on the role.

, ' ']

title: b'Senior Reporting and Information Analyst\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',
  • Ref 644/17  
  • Penrith (Werrington North) Campus
  • Full Time, Ongoing Position
, ' ',

Western Sydney University is a major urban university spread over six campuses in Greater Western Sydney, a region of great opportunity, diversity, challenge and growth. The University has a strong connection to Greater Western Sydney, working with its communities and businesses to contribute to the region's growth. The University is culturally diverse, over 2,500 staff and 40,000 students drawn from Australia and around the world.

, ' ',

The Senior Reporting and Information Analyst is part of the Information and Analysis Unit, which is responsible for:

, ' ',
  • Institutional research, analysis and review
  • Management information and reporting
  • Provision of Institutional Surveys; and
  • Student load data management
, ' ',

The Senior Reporting and Information Analyst reports to the Senior Manager, Information and Analysis Unit and is responsible for the provision of high level data analysis and developing and disseminating reports to support the University in its planning, policy, review and reporting functions. This role provides multiple source data analysis and report design and development for the business intelligence/data analysis teams within the Office of Quality and Performance. The position works with staff across the University to understand their data requirements, source the data and present it in an easily accessible format. The role is required to solve high-level analytical and complex reporting problems independently and in direct consultation with University staff at all levels. The role is expected to manage multiple priorities and to provide high level technical expertise as well as client liaison. This is an exciting opportunity for a position of responsibility and variety. A creative and flexible approach and the ability to focus on and work to deadlines will be required, as well as a strong commitment to customer service. The University offers flexible work arrangements including flex leave and flexible working hours, and provides a supportive team work environment and promotes a healthy work/life balance. The position is full-time continuing and will be based at the University's Werrington North campus near Penrith. Applicants will be shortlisted based on their responses to the selection criteria.

, ' ',

Remuneration Package: Higher Education Worker Level 9 $129,108 to $137,876 p.a. (Salary $109,098 to $116,507 p.a. plus 17% Superannuation and Leave Loading).

, ' ',

Position Enquiries: Stephen Butcher on (02) 9678 7450 or by email at s.butcher@westernsydney.edu.au

, ' ',

Closing Date: 14 May 2017

, ' ']

title: b'Head of Category Management\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

Sephora, a division of LVMH – Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton, an international luxury leader.

, '\n',
, '\n',

Founded in 1969, Sephora is a global leader in beauty retailing and operates successfully in more than two thousand points of sale across the Americas, Europe, Middle East and Asia. With a vision of making Sephora the most loved beauty community in the world, it aims to transform the beauty shopping experience through strong relationships with customers, brands and products, unexpected concepts, and a non-conformist attitude.

, '\n',
, '\n',

Sephora Australia is looking to recruit an experienced Head of Category Management to reinforce its capabilities and establish Sephora as a Best in Class retailer via its merchant initiatives. The role reports to the Country Manager with a functional reporting through to the Regional Category Director. The role will partner strategically with the local and regional leadership team on developing and executing transformative consumer experiences in both digital and traditional retail landscapes.  This role will have direct accountability for product assortment and variable strategies across the brands categories with the ability to utilise consumer and competitive intelligence to deliver product lines that achieve strategic brand equity, and assist to meet financial targets.  

, '\n',
, '\n',

 

, '\n',
, '\n',

Job Responsibilities

, '\n',
, '\n',

  • Utilize business intelligence and company strategic objectives to implement an optimal product assortment across all segments of the business
  • Collaborate with internal stakeholders including Supply Chain, Marketing and Retail to deliver on integrated consumer-focused strategy that will drive growth, profitability, and brand equity
  • Drive strategic expectations within the category team by communicating effectively, in relation to leading and managing the successful execution of brand launches
  • Work in partnership with the internal Supply Chain team to ensure effective planning and forecasting. Including the ability to achieve healthy stock conditions including the monitoring of slow moving lines and depreciation costs
  • Manage and inspire the Category Team to ensure a strong focus on objectives and provide strategic ability to assist in driving company growth
  • Oversee Supplier Management to ensure strong relationships are built and maintained
  • Deliver on set KPI’s and internal benchmarking improvement on brand partner relationships in regards to commercial terms and fixed income investments
  • Work collaboratively with the Finance Manager to have ultimate responsibility for the Category P+L.
  • Understand the consumer drive to ultimately deliver optimal floor plans within our Retail Stores
  • Managing a growing Australia Category team
, '\n',
, '\n',

Key competencies

, '\n',
, '\n',

  • Entrepreneurial and able to work in a fast paced environment with numerous stakeholders
  • Good planning and organizational skills to balance and prioritize work
  • Hands-on and solution-oriented with the ability to manage some operational areas if required on an ad-hoc basis
  • Excellent Communication Skills (Verbal, Written Email)
  • Strong interpersonal skills (listening, negotiation, influencing, and conflict management)
  • The ability to lead, motivate and inspire in a rapidly changing environment
  • Places customer satisfaction as his/her core value
  • Demonstrate strategic thinking and agility
  • Demonstrates leadership to achieve targets
  • Strong analytical and decision making skills set
, '\n',
, '\n',

Profile

, '\n',
, '\n',

  • At least 10+ years of professional experience in the retail industry, ideally in retail or in environments with many brands
  • Degree in Business or related field preferred
  • Strong commercial skills, good attention to detail and customer eye
  • Comfortable with financial aspects (budget, daily stores figures...)
  • Strong management skills
  • Strategic thinking
  • Strong negotiations and influencing skills
  • International exposure
  • Aligns the team in the mission and vision
  • Understands the importance of team culture and dynamics
, '\n',
, '\n',

If your personality profile & work experience matches the description above and you are ready to Sephorize the world then apply now by sending your resume and a cover letter that tells us why we consider you for this opportunity of a lifetime.

, '\n']

About the company
My client represents the connected world, offering innovative and customer-centric information technology services and solutions, enabling Enterprises, Associates and the Society to Rise. They are a very well respected USD 4.0 billion company with 100,000+ professionals across 90 countries, helping over 800 global customers including Fortune 500 companies. They pride themselves to be amongst the Fab 50 companies in Asia as per the Forbes 2014 List.
About the role
Because of their immense growth in client portfolio, an exciting opportunity have come up in one of their tier 1 client in Sydney. They are urgently looking for an experienced Data Modeller/Designer to support their client’s critical business. Please note that the role is based in Sydney CBD. The successful candidates would need to have the following skill sets
Skills and Requirements

, '\n',
  • Worked as Technical Lead in Data Warehousing/Business Intelligence area for 3 years
  • Must have experience working as a DWH Modeller, developer or analyst for 5+ years
  • Must have hands on experience on technologies like Netezza (primary), Teradata, Oracle, DB2 with BI skills like Cognos, Tableau etc. with an exposure to Infrastructure side of data warehousing as well
  • Working in an Insurance environment will be highly advantageous
, '\n',


Culture and Benefits
It is an urgent position and my client is interviewing candidates at the moment. It is an exceptional opportunity for someone who has Data Modeller/Designer experience and has worked in a Insurance sector. If you are after a good work life balance and flexibility at work, and possess all the skills mentioned above, we would love to hear from you. Only Australian Permanent Residents and Citizens required for this role.
For more information on the role, please either apply or contact Nathan Sabherwal on 02 9431 6525. En world is a specialist recruitment agency specializing in IT, Accounting and Corporate Services, Engineering and Sales & Marketing. We can always help you in finding the right permanent or contract role.

, '\n']

title: b'Manager Marketing & Communications\r\n    '
jd:
['\n',
  • Manager Marketing& Communications
  • Government Department
  • Contract role until 31st October 2017!!!!
  • Bankstown
  • Immediate start!!!!
, '\n',

PRIMARY PURPOSE OF POSITION

, '\n',

Develop, lead and manage the Institute marketing, promotions and communications strategies in local, national and international markets to attract and retain students and industry customers.

, '\n',

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES

, '\n',
  • Provide leadership and strategic advice to institute managers and staff on the development of marketing, communication and promotional activities and materials that are aligned to the Institute Strategy and that respond to and influence consumer behaviour.
  • Lead and manage all public relations activities and promotional campaigns for the Institute to ensure that customer information is timely, accurate and meets Australian Quality Training Framework (ASQA - Australian Skills Quality Authority) requirements.
  • Ensure that the institute brand is well positioned in markets relevant to the institute business strategy.
  • Provide strategic marketing and communications advice to the Institute to ensure to ensure the Institute is positioned to maintain current customers and secure future business opportunities.
  • Develop and lead a comprehensive website and social media strategy that utilises a range communication tools to effectively engage with customers and stakeholders.
  • Develop and implement Institute wide standards, protocols and guidelines for branding, marketing and promotional material that ensure compliance to policies and Australian Quality Training Framework (ASQA - Australian Skills Quality Authority) requirements.
  • Lead and manage relationships with relevant key external stakeholders and media outlets to ensure the Institute's capabilities and positioning in the Vocational Education and Training (VET) and tertiary marketplace.
  • Lead the development, of clear, concise and consistent course and Institute information in consultation with Faculties, Business Units and Colleges for dissemination both nationally and internationally.
  • Promote an awareness and ownership amongst Institute staff of the material and activities used to create a consistent Institute image.
  • Use the Customer Relationship Management (CRM) tool to effectively record all business intelligence and customer interactions.
, '\n',

KEY CHALLENGES & INFLUENCES

, '\n',
  • Creating an Institute brand and image that engages clients in a national and international market.
  • Working within a Smart & Skilled Vocational Education and Training environment
  • Maximising opportunities for the marketing and promotion of the institute products and services across a wide variety of industry areas and a large client base.
  • Using technology to support the Institute image and dissemination of promotional materials
  • Keeping abreast of and influencing the changing public perception of TAFE and the Institute.
  • Developing relationships with media outlets and key stakeholders and managing the impact both positively and negatively these may have on the Institute image.
  • Ensuring compliance with Institute policy and procedures regarding the use of the Institute branding to communicate a consistent message to the public.
, '\n',

SELECTION CRITERIA

, '\n',
  • Relevant tertiary qualifications in marketing, advertising or public relations with at least 3-5 years' experience at management level in a complex and diverse organisation.
  • Demonstrated ability to research, identify and present complex concepts (both written and oral).
  • Demonstrated ability to employ a range of complex negotiating and influencing strategies to engage key internal and external stakeholders.
  • Demonstrated ability to establish a creative environment which seeks innovative ways to successfully promote the organisation's brand and identity.
  • Demonstrated capacity to conceptualise and align marketing strategies and techniques with organisational strategy.
  • Demonstrated use of expert knowledge of current marketing trends and consumer behaviour to inform innovative marketing and promotional campaigns through the use of multiple touch points.
  • Capacity to lead the Institute in implementing the Department's Aboriginal education and training policies and to ensure quality outcomes for Aboriginal people.
, '\n',

To be successful in this role the successful candidate will need to fulfil the following requirements:-

, '\n',
  • Have a valid WWCC (Working with Children's check clearance)
  • Willing to undertake a National Criminal Background clearance
  • Strong administration/presentation skills
  • Strong communications skills – both written and verbal
  • Extensive and proficient use of MS Office – Word, Excel, PowerPoint & Outlook
  • Ability to work unsupervised and show initiative
  • Sense of urgency and flexibility
  • Ability to respond to situations as they arise
  • Strong organisational and time management skills
, '\n',

If you feel you have the qualifications and experience to perform this role and are able to address the Selection Criteria by  giving relevant examples of when you have performed these duties in a previous position, please contact Dolores on 0418 554 959 for an immediate interview. Please email your Resume to dolores.herrera@talentoptions.com.au at your earliest convenience.

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

 

, '\n']

title: b'Corporate Sales Executive - Marcus Evans\r\n    '
jd:

About us:

Marcus Evans is a global leader in business intelligence and the market leader in its field. jd:

, '\n',


My client is a market leading Software Vendor focused on IM, Analytical and BI Software and is looking to hire a Project Manager for an upcoming client project in the financial sector. This project will be an end to end implementation of the company's software integrated with the current IT landscape in the client.

As the successful Project Manager you will be responsible for managing a small to medium project team which is part of a larger program of work. You will also be looking after a number of smaller spin off projects, making sure they are completed on time, within budget and exceeding client expectations. 

Position responsibilities:

, '\n',
  • Assessing requirements and defining project scope
  • Managing resources (10 to 20 people) to ensure effective delivery of the project
  • Managing project cost and deliverables
  • Managing the quality control of the project
  • Working closely with Stakeholders and managing client expectations
, '\n',

To be selected for this position you must have the following requirements:

, '\n',
  • Experience working as a Project Manager for a consulting company or 3rd party supplier organisations
  • Proven experience running software implementation projects (preferably in the Financial sector)
  • Experience managing project teams of up to 20 people
  • Experience in Big Data, Analytics, or Business Intelligence software will be highly regarded
  • Experience managing project budgets of around $5 million 
  • Experience with Scrum
  • Excellent stakeholder management experience
  • Exceptional communication skills
, '\n',

If you are interested in this fantastic opportunity do not hesitate to apply by clicking on the link below. Alternatively please call Matt Garvey on 02 82498381 for a confidential discussion. 

, '\n']

title: b'Data Solutions Designer - Big Data\r\n    '
jd:
[
, ' ', Data Solution Designer,
, ' \xa0',
, ' • Are you a Data solutions expert? ',
, ' • Do you want to work for a market leader?',
, ' • Do you want more then just a Job?',
, ' \xa0',
, ' This iconic and respected household name is growing fast. To meet with the ever-expanding data needs the Head of the Data needs a talented data solutions designer to be her go and right hand man/woman.',
, ' In this key role, you will be part of a close knit dedicated small team of industry professionals. This role is both technical and business facing. So, it is essential that you are a confident communicator who can easily understand business needs and talk in techie in non-techie language.',
, ' Your role will include:',
, ' ',
  • Assess business functional and non-functional requirements and seeing these through to becoming fully technical solutions.
  • Insure that Solution Architecture, design the detailed solution design are suitably documented (High Level Design, Interface specs, Detailed design, Data flow diagrams, mapping documentation)
  • You will be involved implementing Data Model, and  developing impact assessment, integrating internal and external data sources and making the data available for analytics and Business Intelligence reporting.
  • Work with the Architects to define design standards and drive continuous improvement of the solutions by finding innovative ways to ensure data quality and increase efficiency
  • Define and maintain overall quality of the code base framework.
  • Work with data developers for successful delivery of projects. 
  • Perform code review and test solution outputs to ensure the build is as per the solution defined
  • Coordinate deployment and release planning activities
, ' \xa0',
, ' ', Core skills required:,
, ' ',
  • 5+ years of data warehouse experience designing and building data solutions using Core RDBMS technology such as Teradata, Oracle, etc and Big Data technologies such as Hadoop.
  • Extensive experience in ETL development and design. Should be technology agnostic and able to pick up a new toolset relatively quickly but expert-level proficiency in at least one- ELT tool - preferably Talend or Informatica.
  • Bachelor's degree in computer science, computer engineering or other technical discipline is essential
  • Knowledge of data modeling and understanding of different data structures - their benefits and limitations under particular use cases
  • Strong requirement analysis and communication skills and ability to act as technical point of contact interacting with Data developers, vendors, internal and external stakeholders
  • Experience in working within a Solution Delivery Life Cycle framework.
  • Familiar with version control systems like Git
, ' \xa0',
, ' \xa0',
, ' ', Considered advantageous but not essential,
, ' \xa0',
, ' ',
  • Experience with AWS S3 and EC2 computing environment is a plus
  • Experience in agile development and continuous delivery processes.
  • Media experience highly desirable
, ' Offering a highly competitive salary and other industry advantages, this dynamic and fast paced role will challenge and delight you, as well as see you finely hone and expand your skills.',
, ' \xa0',
, " So, if it's a time for you to showcase your skills and you want to work for a company that is constantly evolving and that values its staff, this has to be your next career move!",
, ' \xa0To apply in total confidence, send your cv in', WORD, ' format together with your cover letter, to me Ann Mansard on ann.mansard@ibitsolutions.com.au today!',
, ' \xa0',
, ' \xa0',

title: b'Metadata & Analytics Analyst\r\n        '
jd:
[' ',

At Foxtel, our purpose is to effortlessly connect Australians to all the stories they love. We offer a better entertainment experience every day through exclusive and diverse television across all genres, the world’s most popular channel brands, and investment in high quality local content.

, ' ',

, ' ',

Our Playbook is what we call the way that we like to do things around here, and we’re looking for people who can bring this to life. We’re customer heroes, we challenge the norm, we make it easy and we make it fun.

, ' ',

, ' ',

Your purpose

, ' ',
  • Owning and solving viewing and behavioural data issues raised by Foxtel’s internal data customers (Business Intelligence, Broadcast Operations, Advertising and Product Owners)
  • Owning data quality and manipulation of this data for its delivery to other internal and external systems.
  • Lead Technical focused vendor management meetings and direction.
  • Highlight, escalate and address data quality concerns to appropriate stakeholders
  • Generating and providing regular status reports on data quality
  • Maintaining a close relationship with application delivery groups maintaining a view on schedule delivery vehicles for Foxtel applications and device updates that impact on data availability and/or quality.
  • Audit acceptance test cases and the teams that write them
  • Audit and create and/or modify analytic tracking plans
, ' ',

, ' ',

Your capability

, ' ',
  • A capacity to recognise trends in data
  • Education of a minimum Degree level required, ideally in an analytical discipline such as mathematics, statistics, econometrics, actuarial studies, computer science etc.
  • Minimum of 1 year experience actively working with JSON, HTTP, AWS S3, AWS Redshift, SQL, XML based technologies Viso, MS Project (and other Office apps) expertise mandatory
  • Familiarity with JIRA and Confluence preferred
  • Exposure and understanding of Audience Measurement (ie Nielsen/OzTam), and ratings preferred
  • Understanding of VAST, IAB standards, DASH video technologies is desirable
  • Familiarity with tools such as SQL, R and SAS to provide ad hoc support.
  • Previous exposure to Data Warehouse processes will be advantageous
, ' ',

, ' ',

What’s in it for you?

, ' ',

As well as a meaningful role working with a company that effortlessly connects Australians to all the stories they love, the Foxtel team has access to a great range of benefits including a free Foxtel subscription, discounts and cash-back offers from a long list of retailers, competitions and giveaways, and our health and wellbeing program.

, ' ',

We are customer heroes, we challenge the norm, we make it easy, and we make it fun!

, ' ']

title: b'Head of Financial Planning & BI Analytics\r\n    '
jd:
[At Vodafone, we put our customers at the heart of everything we do to give Australians more choice and freedom to connect the way they want.

As the “Head of Financial Planning & BI Analytics” you will be directly reporting to the CFO and will be leading a world class team of 15 persons to deliver the financial planning, financial reporting, BI demand and BI analytics within VHA. You will seek to understand the business/industry from multiple perspectives and will serve as they key bridge that aligns and unites VHA business objectives, technology and financial interests through data, analysis, planning & reporting. You will be responsible for providing Financial and BI solutions, tools and training to the entire business so that data is utilized as a strategic asset which in turn will enable us to exceed targets, identify opportunities and drive/exceed customer experience.

With this in mind you will set the overall financial roadmap (annual planning & 5 year plan), strategic roadmap for BI (enabling VHA to become a data-driven business for insights, differentiation and competitive advantage) as well as have full ownership of the BI platform and data visualization strategy.

In addition you will ensure the Executive team and Shareholders have all the necessary information in a timely and accurate manner to develop a clear understanding of the business direction and financial & operational performance versus the long range plan and Australian Telco market.

Skills & Requirements:

]

title: b'Senior Insights Analyst - Sydney CBD - Permanent\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

Senior Insights Analyst - Sydney CBD - Permanent

, '\n',

As the Senior Insights Analyst, you will be responsible for delivering insights for the Direct business by identify opportunities, presenting findings to senior stakeholders and work as a team to execute and deliver solutions to achieve profitable growth. With the focus on execution, campaign and analysis experience is essential as well as strong data manipulation and problem solving abilities. This role is a Full Time Permanent role based in the Sydney CBD.

, '\n',

 Responsibilities in this role include:

, '\n',
  • Work with Sales and Distribution in Direct to support growth opportunities for acquisition and retention
  • Extract and manipulate internal and external data for analysis, modelling and reporting
  • Analyse and mine customer data to address business issues, identifying opportunities and recommend actionable solutions
  • Proactively seek opportunities to improve business processes to optimise sales conversion
  • Be involved in the end to end campaign execution process, working with Marketing, Product, Data Warehouse, Sales and Distribution
  • Ensure campaigns are setup correctly for test and learn, measure sales performance and feedback learnings
  • Setup post-campaign reports to track and monitor performance
  • Overseeing the delivery of solutions to our stakeholders, ensuring objectives are met and project delivery addresses their needs
  • Summarise findings and present recommendations to the business
, '\n',

It is expected that you will possess the following skills and experience:

, '\n',
  • 5+ years' experience in data analytics, campaign analytics, business intelligence, or related area
  • Advanced knowledge of end-to-end process of campaign execution
  • Strong SAS & SQL skills
  • Ability to query complex data warehouses and aggregate data for insight analysis
  • Ability to work independently on complex projects
  • Ability to prioritise work, keeping business objectives at the forefront of the decision making process
  • Strong project management and problem-solving skills;
  • Strong Stakeholder management skill;
  • A willingness to learn new applications and systems;
  • Strong written and verbal communication skill;
  • Commercial experience using Tableau and Google Analytics would be advantageous
  • Degree qualified in at least one of the following: Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, or Finance
, '\n']

title: b'Senior Commercial Analyst\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

Role Title

, ' ',

, ' ',

Senior Commercial Analyst

, ' ',

, ' ',

Location

, ' ',

, ' ',

North Ryde, Macquarie Park

, ' ',

, ' ',

Rewards

, ' ',

, ' ',

Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits on offer

, ' ',

, ' ',

About Us

, ' ',

, ' ',

Smith & Nephew is a diversified advanced medical technology business that supports healthcare professionals in more than 100 countries to improve the quality of life for their patients.

, ' ',

, ' ',

We have leadership positions in Orthopaedic Reconstruction, Advanced Wound Management, Sports Medicine and Trauma:

, ' ',
  • Orthopedics Reconstruction - joint replacement systems for knees, hips and shoulders
  • Advanced Wound Management - wound care treatment and prevention products used to treat hard to heal wounds
  • Sports Medicine - minimally invasive surgery of the joint
  • Trauma & Extremities - products that help repair broken bones
, ' ',

, ' ',

We have over 15,000 employees around the world. Annual sales in 2016 were more than $4.6 billion.
We are a constituent of the UK's FTSE100 and our shares are traded on the London Stock Exchange and through American Depository Receipts on the New York Stock Exchange (LSE: SN, NYSE: SNN) .

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

Summary

, ' ',

, ' ',

Commercially astute, analytically focused and able to communicate with a wide range of stakeholders, the Senior Commercial Analyst plays a key role in data analysis, management and dissemination to support strategic decision-making, particularly related to assessment of our market and potential commercial opportunities.

, ' ',

, ' ',

Essential Job Functions

, ' ',
  • Strategic and Business planning: Work with Commercial Finance to prepare ANZ submissions for Regional/Global Strategic Plans and Budgets
  • Commercial Analysis: Provide accurate and timely analyses to support commercial decision making and evaluation of business opportunities related to tenders and contracts, business development, new product introductions and other strategic decisions
  • Build and maintain Strategic Intelligence capability:
    • Identify, collect and analyse data related to our business and our market to generate insights and support commercial, decision-making. This includes working with third party data vendors and analysts
    • Create and maintain market models for all business units
    • Create and maintain relevant platforms, forums and materials to disseminate information on the business and the market to relevant Internal stakeholders
    • Develop decision-support tools e.g. return on investment calculators etc. as required
, ' ',

, ' ',

Requirements

, ' ',

, ' ',

Education:

, ' ',
  • Tertiary qualification in a quantitative discipline e.g. Accounting, Finance, Business or Commerce is preferred
, ' ',

, ' ',

Experience:

, ' ',
  • A minimum of 3 years experience in an Analyst role in the healthcare sector, preferably in the Medical Technology or Pharmaceutical Industries
  • Demonstrated market and financial modelling skills
  • Proven ability to work with complex and large datasets
, ' ',

, ' ',

Competencies:

, ' ',
  • Well-developed stakeholder management skills
  • Strong commercial/business acumen and ability to comprehend and critically evaluate data to identify and communicate key insights to relevant stakeholders
  • Highly numerate with strong analytical skills
  • Excellent attention to detail
  • Driven and self-motivated with a high level of initiative
  • Excellent communication, presentation and interpersonal skills
, ' ',

, ' ',

Technical knowledge:

, ' ',
  • Advanced level Microsoft Excel
  • Experience generating analyses using Business Intelligence tools (COGNOS or similar)
, ' ',

, ' ',

Scope

, ' ',

, ' ',

This role reports to the Market Access & Competitive Intelligence Manager. Key internal stakeholders include the Managing Director and Leadership team, Sales and Marketing, Commercial Finance, Corporate Accounts and Regional/Global Business Intelligence and Strategic Planning functions. Key external stakeholders include 3rd party data vendors and Analysts.

, ' ',

, ' ',

Applications

, ' ',

, ' ',

Smith & Nephew is committed to helping people regain their lives by repairing and healing the human body. We believe that this can only be achieved by establishing mutually beneficial relationships with all of our stakeholders including patients, healthcare professionals, investors ad employees. If you share our passion for innovation and can demonstrate how you meet the criteria outlined, we would love to hear from you.

, ' ',

, ' ',

We continue to actively build an environment where every individual can fulfill their potential and be proud ambassadors for Smith & Nephew, our customers and their patients. We value the diversity of our people and welcome applications from everyone.

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ']

title: b'Data Engineer/Scientist/Analytics Consultant\r\n    '
jd:
[A leading IM Professional Services consultancy is looking for a Mid to Senior Analytics consultant who possesses a Data Engineering/Scientist background and wants to move to the next level in their career.,
, ' ',
, ' This leading Australian Professional services company has an excellent track record in the Business Intelligence and Datawarehousing arena and as times & technology develop and change, so do they. Their Advanced Analytics division explores the science of data whether from traditional analytics to Big Data and they need new staff.\xa0',
, ' ',
, ' They are looking for a mid level to senior candidate with good analytics skills ideally in the consulting space.You will be a confident & effective communicator with an ability to deal with executives, project team members and end user staff.',
, ' ',
, ' Ideally, you will have the capability to qualify user requirements and have a commercial edge to your skillset that has yet to be utilised fully as their is scope for pre-sales & client engagement development work within this role\xa0',
, ' ',
, ' Some ideal technical skills for this role would include:',
, ' ',
  • Experience with Hadoop & Spark and related cloud environments 
  • Python and/or Scala for general purpose programming
  • Common analytics skills such as R, SAS, SPSS, Angoss, Alteryx
  • Familiarity with common BI tools such as Qlik, Microstrategy, Tableau, Shiny, gg-plot
, ' Please note this role may require interstate travel and visa sponsorship can only be offered to overseas candidates who fit this profile perfectly. ']

title: b'\r\n          Business Development Manager \xe2\x80\x93 Events\r\n        '
jd:
[' ',

RFi Group is a global intelligence and digital media provider focusing exclusively on financial services. We specialise in data and information gathering, customer based insight generation and business decision support for the world's leading financial service providers.

, ' ',

RFi Group produces events, in Australia, Asia, the Americas and the UK. Our aim is to produce quality interactive forums with insightful and relevant debate. Our events are aimed at senior level industry leaders and include many major conferences, awards evenings and Thought Leader Dinners.

, ' ',

In 2015 RFi Group acquired AB&F magazine and now holds 5 major events in Australia each year, plus several smaller events. 

, ' ',

We are looking for a business development manager to grow our delegate sales business.  

, ' ',

About the role:

, ' ',

Reporting to the Sales Director for Australia & New Zealand, your role will involve:

, ' ',
  • Retaining past delegates to our annual events
  • Growing the delegate attendance and revenue on our annual events through effective leads research, cold calling and sales process
  • Developing a delegate client base for new events drawing on RFi's client network and building new networks
  • Adhering to sales campaign timelines with effective time management and a "can do" attitude
  • Being the first point of call for leads coming into the business through RFi Group marketing and lead generation activities
  • Attending events to network and represent RFi Group
  • Effective record keeping and pipeline management in Salesforce CRM.
, ' ',

As the successful candidate, you must have:

, ' ',
  • Achieved success in an events-based sales role
  • Experience of phone based sales
  • A desire to work in a fast-moving environment, with an entrepreneurial focus
  • Excellent written and spoken English
  • Expertise in Microsoft Office (Word, PowerPoint, Excel)
     
, ' ',

We are a lively, close-knit, sales-focussed organisation, committed to maintaining a work environment that is rich in opportunities, resources and rewards. RFi's culture is one of encouragement and support enabling people to achieve their personal and professional goals.

, ' ',

Social and work/life benefits include Monthly Breakfasts, Monthly Drinks, Team Sports, "4pm Fridays", Company Events, Company Backed Charity Work.

, ' ',

Personal Development benefits include highly relevant and desirable service offerings, access to financial services and banking Subject Matter Experts.

, ' ',

Application procedure:

, ' ',

If this opportunity sounds like you and you feel you would succeed in this role, please apply by clicking on the "Apply" button below. 

Thank you for your interest in working with RFi Group – www.rfigroup.com

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. 

, ' ',

 

, ' ']

title: b'\r\n          SQL Database Developer + Administrator\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',

SQL Database Developer/Manager - People Analytics, Business Intelligence

, '\n',

Perception engineers solutions to address opportunities in enterprise recruiting and talent management utilising predictive analytics. Our cloud platform delivers actionable insights to medium and large enterprise clients in Asia-Pacific, enabling smarter and better business decisions about their investments in people.

, '\n',

The Database Developer/Manager will join a small entrepreneurial team to manage a critical component of our data infrastructure, and develop/manage SQL applications technology.

, '\n',

You have advanced SQL skills and experience dealing with large and complex data sets, including:

, '\n',
  • capabilities to navigate and manage complex systems whilst thinking critically and retaining a high attention to detail
  • an understanding of fundamental design principles behind scalable applications
  • ability to manage administrative processes associated with business applications (such as user creation, resolution of application issues)
  • skills to write, test, maintain and debug SQL code; and manipulate and extract data from SQL databases
  • an understanding of database-driven design and development techniques, system integration and testing/deployment principles
, '\n',

You must have experience with....

, '\n',
  • SQL and the Microsoft tech stack
  • ASP.NET MVC, C#, JavaScript/JQuery, web services (SOAP/RESTful)
  • web servers (IIS or Apache) and DNS
  • agile project development and management
  • complex web applications and systems that store, manage and process data
  • managing complex relational database environments
  • multiple database integrations and/or migrations
  • back-end administration platform
, '\n',

What you'll be doing....

, '\n',
  • developing and managing SQL applications that capture, store and process workforce and performance data to help client understand the drivers of high performance
  • developing, implementing and managing databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimise data efficiency and quality
  • acquiring data from primary or secondary data sources and maintaining databases/data analysis systems
  • designing and developing applications in a .net/SQL environment for recruiting, HR and business leaders to make better informed people decisions
, '\n',

Please send us details of your background, then we'll ask you to send us samples of your work!

, '\n']

title: b'Analyst\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',
  • Flexible work
    arrangements and continual learning and development opportunities
  • Transport Service Grade
    6 ($84,237 – $92,660), plus employers contribution to superannuation and annual
    leave loading
  • Permanent Full Time
    Opportunity
  • Chippendale Location
, '\n',  ,
, '\n', The Opportunity,
, '\n',  ,
, '\n',

We have an
exciting opportunity for an Analyst to be a part of our Innovation Research
& Reform team within the Freight Strategy & Planning Branch of
Transport for NSW.

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

Reporting to
the Manager Data Integration and Analytics the position plays a key role in supporting
the other members of the Data Integration Unit in collecting, maintaining and
analysing travel demand, customer feedback and operational performance data
from the transport networks in New South Wales.

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

In conjunction
with other unit positions, the position provides expert analysis and advice for
the development of the public transport strategies and to facilitate
improvement in the delivery of public transport services.

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

You’ll work
with other Transport Performance & Analytics (TPA) staff to ensure large
requests for data/information are provided to clients in a timely, efficient,
cost-effective and accurate manner and converting transport data into useful
information and advice for a wide variety of users.

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

We are
looking for an Analyst who can work collaboratively to deliver results. Apply
practical skills in the use of relevant technology, and support the
implementation of systems improvement initiatives and the introduction and
roll-out of new technologies.

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

For more information on
this position, view the role description
here.

, '\n',

 
About us
 

, '\n',

At Transport, our vision is for a truly integrated
transport system that will meet the needs of our customers now and into the
future. The Transport portfolio includes Transport for NSW as principal agency
with Sydney Trains, NSW Trains, State Transit Authority and Roads and Maritime
Services as our key operating agencies.

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

We are a values based organisation and 
employ the most talented people to work together to deliver services for
our customers and make NSW a better place to live, do business and visit.

, '\n',

 
Benefits
 

, '\n',

At Transport we offer employees challenging and
rewarding work with opportunities for career progression, learning and
development and flexibility.

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

We provide comprehensive staff training through
structured programs and provide study assistance to staff pursuing work related
courses.

, '\n',

 
Our commitment to Diversity  
 

, '\n',

TfNSW
are committed to building a diverse and inclusive culture across the Transport
cluster, planning for and promoting diversity. We welcome and encourage
applications from diverse community groups and ages including Aboriginal and
Torres Strait Islander, LGBTI, people with disabilities, women and other
diversity groups. TfNSW recognises the benefits that such an approach brings
for our staff and customers in delivering the future of NSW.

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

Essential
requirements

, '\n',

, '\n',
  • Tertiary qualification in a relevant discipline or
    equivalent experience
  • Experience in the use of computerised databases,
    such as MS Access or Oracle
  • Experience with using analytical / statistical
    software packages, such as R, SAS or ArcGIS
  • Experience with Business Intelligence or
    visualisation tools, such as Tableau
, '\n',  ,
, '\n',

Please note: The
successful candidate will need to undertake background checks and criminal
record checks.

, '\n',

 
For more information on how to apply for a role in
the NSW Public Sector please click here or
for more information on Transport for NSW please click on
link provided.
 

, '\n',

For any enquiries, please contact Danielle
McDonald on (02) 8574 3537 and quote 000058U5.

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

Applications close: 11:59pm Sunday,
21 May 2017.

, '\n',

, '\n']

['\n',

I am currently looking for a Senior Manager of Data Science to join a growing Data Science Management consulting team.

, '\n',

I am interested in talking to Senior Professionals who are looking for their next big career challenge & move to an award winning global innovator.

, '\n',

You career experience will include offering enterprise solutions & strategy across one or more of the following; Data Science, Business Intelligence, Data Governance, Data Analytics & Insights, Big Data Engineering & Data Science.

, '\n',

Requirements:

, '\n',
  • You will possess a strong background in: Statistics, Predictive Analytics, Python, SAS/SPSS/R
  • You will also have a mix of high level technical and functional skills, solution design, build and transition management.
  • Solution skills will include knowledge across, Architecture, Development, to include the evolving data engineering landscapes and eco-systems
  • Ideally, you will have experience working within a tier one consulting environment
  • With a proven track record of successful assignment delivery and client relationship management
  • A team focussed style with strong organisational and project management skills. The ability to analyse business performance is essential and offer the right outcomes for the business
  • An ability to present solutions in a clear and articulate manner
  • Strong interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills
, '\n',

If you have made a positive commitment to further your career and you possess ALL of the above attributes then please apply to this role or send me your resums and a supporting email highlighting your suitablity for the outstanding opportunity.

, '\n']

title: b'Data Warehouse Developer - BI/DW\r\n    '
jd:
['\n',

My client is an Australian Government Department seeking an experienced Business Intelligence / Data Warehouse Specialist to be a key player in a business critical transformation project. This is an initial 12 month contract based in Sydney, CBD area, working in a team of 8 developers.

, '\n',

As the Business Intelligence / Data Warehouse Specialist, you will be responsible for;

, '\n',
  • Incident analysis, design, development and testing, prod deployment life cycles and bug fixes
  • Creating star schema data models, performing ETLs and validating results with business representatives.
  • Supporting implemented BAU BI solutions by: monitoring and tuning queries and data loads, addressing user questions concerning data integrity, monitoring performance and communicating functional and technical issues.
, '\n',

Skills/Experience:

, '\n',
  • Solid understanding of BI best practices, relational structures and dimensional data modelling
  • Sound structured query language (SQL) skills
  • Proven data warehouse and reporting techniques.
  • Experience with SSIS (SQL Server Integration Services), SQL performance tuning, Root Cause Analysis, T-SQL
  • Proven experience in Azure DW
  • Experience with Visual Studio Team Services
, '\n',

Benefits:

, '\n',
  • Great career development and progression opportunity
  • Exposure to the latest technologies and projects
  • Great working culture and work life balance
, '\n',

- Business Intelligence / Data Warehouse Specialist, Business Intelligence, BI, Data Warehouse, DW, Development, Best Practices, MDX, DMX, SQL, SSIS, SSRS, SSAS, ETL, Azure, T-SQL, Performance Tuning, Visual Studio -

, '\n',

Please apply via ‘apply now’ link or send your CV to rheanna.lawrey@randstad.com

, '\n']
