title: b'Group Management Accountant\r\n    '
jd:
[' ',

Voyages Indigenous Tourism Australia is a unique Australian travel and tourism company encompassing Ayers Rock Resort in the iconic Red Centre, Home Valley Station in the Kimberley region of Western Australia, and tourism facilities at Mossman Gorge in Tropical North Queensland.

, ' ',
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', The Criteria,
, ' ', Reporting to the Finance Director, and a dotted line to the Finance & Accounting Manager, we have a tremendous opportunity for a technically competent Group Management Accountant to join the centralised Finance team in our Sydney Corporate Office.,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', With tertiary qualifications in Finance/Accounting, and CPA/CIMA qualified, this busy role will be best suited to a driven individual who can work autonomously, take ownership of finance function for two business units, and also be able to provide insightful financial and performance analysis for the overall Voyages group. ,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', We are looking for a team player who have experience in month end processes, and possess an extraordinary flair for financial planning & analysis work. You will have excellent communication skills and strong attention to detail. Relevant experience in the hospitality industry is preferred although not an essential prerequisite.,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', The Role,
, ' ', Your new role will require as part of the finance function for the two business units end to end preparation of monthly management accounting reports, including P&L month end journals, P&L analysis and monthly balance sheet reconciliations, with the assistance of the Assistant Management Accountant. You will also be responsible for the production of holistic board commentary and annual budgets and forecasts for your business units . Your critical analysis and accompanying recommendations and support of the respective General Managers will be pivotal to your success.,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', In addition through use of the business intelligence tools and management reports combined with site visits provide insightful financial and performance analysis for the overall Voyages group., ' ',

What’s on Offer?
A cohesive and innovative team who pride ourselves on quality, excellent employee benefits and an opportunity to utilise your skillset and grow your career in the hospitality industry. A National Police and Criminal History check will be a mandatory part of this process.
 
Voyages vision is to offer our visitors a genuine Indigenous Experience while making a real difference for Indigenous communities through employment, development and business opportunities in tourism. 
 
Only candidates short-listed will be contacted, thank you for your understanding.

, ' ',

, ' ']

title: b'Tech Lead\r\n    '
jd:
['\n',


This is an exciting opportunity to join their Agile development team in a key new role working on full bespoke business management system (unimaginatively christened "Dashboard"). This bespoke application suite is at the heart of their business and covers key business functions including ecommerce, customer relationship management, purchasing, warehousing, logistics, and business intelligence.
This role is suited to a talented individual keen to move into a Technical Team Lead position who is keen to support our development operations by analyzing and converting business requirements into product deliverables and working hands-on with the team.
The role will require a wide range of skills from technical leadership & product design through to research & analysis.
Every person in the team counts and if you are a great team player whilst extremely committed to achieving the best then this role is for you.
 
Skills & Experience

, '\n',
  • 10 years software development experience
  • 5 years’ experience in .NET
  • Experience working in agile product development teams
  • Experience with any of the following technologies: Angular 2, ASP.NET MVC, Web API 2 ,MySQL , WinForms, PostgreSQL, AWS
  • Active involvement in .NET development communities
  • A team player with a passion for excellence
, '\n',

 
 
 
 

, '\n',

, '\n',

Send CV to darren.ruane@2xmtechnology.com.au

, '\n',

, '\n']

['Great long term opportunity for a Salesforce Integration Developer to join one a leading Australian National Organisation. You will need to be an experienced in system integration and developing customised solutions, while also being responsible for development, maintenance and support of the Salesforce platform across the organisation.',
, ' ',  ,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', Day-To-Day,
, ' ',
  • Custom solution design and form effective project plans & BAU initiatives
  • Custom Salesforce solution development, leveraging Force.com sites, including Apex coding, Visual Force and other technologies
  • Play a technical role in evaluating add-ons to the existing CRM application and develop plans for implementation

title: b'Principal Consultant - Analytics\r\n    '
jd:
['\n',

Unisys is a leading provider of high-value services, software and solutions that deliver sustainable value to many of the world's largest companies and governmental agencies. Unisys provides secure, consultative, industry-specific solutions and services for government, financial services, travel and transportation, life sciences and commercial organizations. With Unisys as a partner, clients can secure the trust of their own customers – and deliver today on the demands of tomorrow. 

, '\n',

Within Unisys Enterprise Services, a Principal in the Analytics Services practice brings significant business domain and/or technical depth in a specific area. Principals take responsibility to deliver client impact applying their distinct area of domain and technical mastery. Principals bring advanced expertise in topics including consumer insight, digital marketing, fraud and risk, cybersecurity or operations data science. Principals are hands-on player/coaches who create client deliverables and coach team members in performing their roles. Principals understand the regulatory context and compliance mandates for their domain areas and geographic regions. Principals bring a broad network of relationships and actively contribute to practice development. Principals play a lead role within a practice synthesizing Unisys points of view that build our brand and contribute practically to implementation methodology.

, '\n',

Responsibilities:

, '\n',
  • Take responsibility for achieving client impact by providing specialized, deep, and differentiated expertise. Serve as a senior expert building trust with clients.
  • Create and deepen client relationships particularly within a principal's area of domain expertise.
  • Actively manage and mitigate implementation risk. Develop an intuitive sense of how to deliver complex, multi-stakeholder projects in highly regulated industries. Navigate client organizations to ensure support, transparency, and results.
  • Hands-on leadership creating Analytics deliverables including implementing data integration and quality, selecting and configuring algorithms, translating models into code, quality assurance, and guiding business implementation of model results, application, or business processes.
  • Understand practice level financial performance drivers and contribute to achieving results.
  • Actively seek to position Unisys for follow-on engagements and continued, deepened client relationships.
  • Cultivate relationships across the full spectrum of Unisys and Enterprise Services capabilities and offerings, and proactively build partnership and joint client teams.
  • Take lead generating new ideas and lead development of thought leadership offering a Unisys point of view on key industry and technical topics.
  • Develop high quality and resuable IP and sales materials which are available in appropriate repositories.
  • Constantly stay current in a principal's designated area of expertise.
  • Assist in the recruitment, development, and mentoring of new associates in the Analytics practice.
  • Maintain appropriate senior-level professional certifications such as CPA, CFA, CISSP, or similar. 
, '\n',

Skills, Experience & Qualifications

, '\n',
  • 7-15 years as an expert contributor.
  • Strong understanding of the Analytics Services business context and market trends, as well as how to communicate these offerings to clients – all levels of the organization from developers to ITDMs:
    • Significant experience delivering analytics and/or business intelligence projects
    • Prefer hands-on experience with ETL, database management, BI dashboards, or application development.
    • Data warehouse strategy implementation experience
    • Data governance and master data management practices
    • Machine learning and predictive analytics algorithm understanding implementing using analytics tools such as Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Kafka
    • Cloud based Analytics design & delivery including - IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS
    • Digital engagement solutions – mobile, social and web channel integration
    • Experience with visualization tools such as Tableau, Zoomdata, PowerBI, Qlik, etc.
  • Significant experience in Analytics Consulting, BI/ Visualization Governance & Strategy, Information Management Roadmap, Data Platforming, Alliance & eco-system management, Large scale Program Governance Experienced Program or Project leadership skills leading technical teams with large implementation projects
  • Evidence of thought leadership such as peer-reviewed papers, articles in industry journal, patents, or speaking engagements.
  • Many directors bring academic expertise including experience on faculties of prominent universities.
  • Technical strength centered on but not limited to Information Strategy, Data Governance & Architecture, Big Data &  Analytics, Information Lifecycle Management, Business intelligence, and Performance Management.
  • Understanding of Agile Custom Analytics modeling and support across multiple industries.
  • Broad experience in data modeling and implementation projects utilizing a global delivery model.
  • Experience working with Sales and Pre-Sales Solution Architecture teams.
  • Master's degree in a quantitative field, MBA from a leading school, or PhD strongly preferred. Many leaders within the Analytics practice hold PhDs in quantitative subjects.
  • Security clearances are welcome and encouraged.
, '\n',

The Analytics practice systematically targets specific domain expertise and geographic locations. The practice seeks people with experience from leading organizations in travel, transportation, and logistics; life sciences and health care; public sector including military, intelligence community, and law enforcement; retail; banking, insurance, and wealth management. We actively develop expertise in Spark, AWS, Azure and open source machine learning packages

, '\n']

title: b'Training Sales Lead Generator\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

PM-Partners group are a specialist Project Management Consultancy.  We have a unique way of running projects and providing training and advice, so our clients get the best results with less cost and risk.  Each year we deliver over $2B of projects, train over 9000 people, and help some of Australia’s leading brands improve their PMOs.

, '\n',

Due to extensive growth, the newly carved role for a Training Sales Lead Specialist has become available with a high performing training sales team. This is an exciting opportunity for the right person to be able to use their sales skills to work across the business to build and maintain relationships & gathering business intelligence in order to generate new training sales leads and opportunities from internal and external sources.

, '\n',

Your day to day responsibilities will include, but not be limited to:

, '\n',
  • Working across the business to identify new training Leads and Opportunities for PM-Partners group services and products.
  • Employ carefully designed sales campaigns depending on current offers.
  • Follow-up and maintain contact with prospects and transform into qualified opportunities.
  • Working across the business (Internal and external) building awareness of our service offering and helping others to identify leads and opportunities.
  • Build and cultivate prospect relationships by initiating communications and conducting follow-up communications to move opportunities through the sales funnel.
  • Manage data for new and prospective clients in Sales Force, ensuring all communications are logged, information is accurate and documents are attached.
, '\n',

To be considered for this position you will be able to demonstrate that you possess the following qualities and skills:

, '\n',
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Excellent client service skills
  • 1-3 years telemarketing and/or sales experience is an advantage
  • Demonstrated ability to meet and/or exceed determined sales and activity quotas
  • A proven track record of strong client relationships
  • Strong attention to detail, including data entry
  • Previous experience with Sales Force is an advantage
, '\n',

Why PM-Partners Group?

, '\n',
  • Career Development – Proactive support in your development pathway is what you can expect at PM-Partners group. This includes completing any of our 27 training courses – for free!
  • Belong to Something Big – PM-Partners group manage over $2 billion of projects and train over 9000 people each year, whilst working alongside some of Australia’s biggest and most recognisable brands, making us a market leader in our field.
  • Company Culture - We believe our company culture is what sets us apart from our competitors. Despite large growth we have managed to maintain a “family’ feel, and we are proud of our can-do environment.
  • Teamwork – We strongly believe that none of the above could be achieved without the collaborative environment that PM-Partners group offer especially in the vibrant, fun loving Training Team in which the position is available.
, '\n',

If you feel you meet our selection criteria and are looking to join a leading Project Management Consultancy, please apply for the role by submitting your resume.

, '\n',

Reference number: HW LG

, '\n']

title: b'Senior BI Consultant - Finance Background Essential\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',


POSITION SUMMARY

Manage, collaboratively, the administration, development and deployment of the Finance Management Information Systems and provide high-level strategic and expert advice to key stakeholders across the University’s primary financial management information system and related databases are delivering services aligned with stakeholder expectations and contributing to the achievement of business objectives.

, '\n',



KEY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

Service Delivery and Improvement

, '\n',
  • Provide expert knowledge and operational and technical support to Finance and other staff regarding the administration of the Finance Management Information System to ensure advice provided and recommended solutions delivered are conveyed in a way that maximises comprehension, usability and supportability.
  • Proactively manage solutions to minimise issues and outages and ensure stability, reliability and integrity of solutions whilst leveraging existing package solutions and vendor recommendations
  • Maintain an in-depth, expert understanding of sustainable, risk management work practices to ensure the Finance Management Information Systems are developed, deployed and administered in a manner that maintains stability and confidence in the underlying integrity of the systems operations and data, raising issues, risks, and compliance breaches with management upon identification.
  • Contribute to and manage allocated projects for the management and administration of the underlying relational databases to ensure the strategic capabilities of the Finance MIS are optimised
  • Translate business requirements into specifications that will be used in design, development, implementation and maintenance of BI Solutions
  • Provide high level innovative advice and solutions, including recommended requirements gathering, solution analysis, testing, process documentation and delivery, to ensure business needs and objectives are met and supportable
  • Conduct analyses of finance data and produce timely and accurate financial and non-financial reports to proactively identify opportunities to enhance database design and develop the University’s reporting infrastructure as well as contribute to strategic planning and policy-making processes
  • Assess the tools & systems used to complete tasks with the goal of improving the accuracy, granularity and efficiency of processes and to foster a culture of continual process improvement
  • Document formal guidelines, policies and procedures, by liaising with Information Technology Services and other parties, to enhance access and delivery of information resources and facilitate system understanding and use by stakeholders across the University
  • Provide expert Finance Business Intelligence consultancy to senior management, business units and users, by designing developing and deploying finance management reports, to ensure business objectives are achieved
, '\n',


Stakeholder Management

, '\n',
  • Build and maintain collaborative working relationships with senior management, business units and users to foster a customer focused finance function and ensure tailored solutions are developed and implemented that meet stakeholder needs and expectations
  • Liaise with system users across the University, collecting feedback on ease of system use as well as business needs, to foster both a client-focused service delivery culture and a culture of continual process improvement
  • Engage with key service providers within the University to ensure Finance MIS is deployed efficiently to all users
, '\n',

SELECTION CRITERIA

, '\n',
  • Tertiary qualifications in a relevant area, including commerce, business, or IT
  • Substantial experience supporting MIS Finance systems in large complex organisations covering both management reporting and budget and forecasting capabilities
  • Experience developing and implementing technical change with MIS systems to meet business requirements
  • Technical expertise and a firm grasp of BI implementation methodologies, including in-depth experience with the Microsoft BI Stack (SSIS, SSRS and SSAS) and, if possible, exposure to other technologies (Calumo, Oracle, SAP BW, SAP Business Objects, etc.)
  • Highly proficient in Microsoft Excel and query languages (SQL)
  • Demonstrated ability to convey complex and technical concepts succinctly to non-technical and non-specialist audiences
  • Well-developed analysis and communication skills with experience in data gathering, research and analytical abilities so as to develop insightful conclusions and generate solutions to address user needs and create written communication materials that effectively summarise findings and support recommendations
  • Other desirable technical skills include:
    • Solid understanding of accounting concepts and principles
    • Extraction, Transformation and Loading (ETL) (Microsoft SSIS)
    • Data Warehouse / Solution Design
    • Dimensional Modelling (e.g. Kimball Methodology)
    • Analytics / OLAP Cube Development (Microsoft SSAS and MDX)
    • Report Development (Microsoft SSRS)
, '\n',

, '\n',

To learn more about this opening, please contact Matthew on 02 9270 2620.

, '\n',

( SK913119A )

, '\n',

IMPORTANT: By submitting your email address and any other personal information when you APPLY to a job, you consent to such information being collected, held, used and disclosed in accordance with our COLLECTIONS NOTICE and PRIVACY POLICY.

, '\n',

http://www.bluefinresources.com.au/privacy-policy

, '\n']

title: b'\r\n          Data Solution Architect\r\n        '
jd:
[' ',

EXCITING DATA SOLUTION ARCHITECT POSITION FOR A MICROSOFT TRUSTED PARTNER WHO ARE BUILDING AN ELITE TECH TEAM!

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

BCS Technology (BCS) is an award-winning Australian based Professional Services organisation focusing on the provision of quality consulting in the area of Business Intelligence, Data warehouse and Application Development. We are trusted partners of Cloudera and Microsoft and recently, BCS has been accepted as part of the Microsoft Practice Development Initiative to further develop our Analytics practice on Microsoft Azure.  

, ' ',

We are transforming into a digital provider for the entire world. Founded in 2001, Sydney Australia, BCS has emerged as a leading Professional Services provider, delivering tailored solutions and services to clients throughout the world. With offices now in Sydney, Melbourne, Jakarta, Manila and Delhi, BCS is currently on track to reinvent itself to be one of the world's most reliable data analytics solutions provider. If you are looking to learn and grow, we also sponsor training programs. Come join our team and be a part of this exciting opportunity.

, ' ',

What will you be doing?

, ' ',
  • You will be responsible for the architecture of new Data Analytics platforms on Azure that will allow senior stakeholders to analyse and generate business critical insight for the purpose of business decision making.
  • We prefer those with hands on experience in Azure data but it is not necessary.
  • Experience in databases and analytics, including relational databases, AWS, Data Warehousing, Big Data , NoSQL, Machine Learning, Stream Analytics, Data Factory, Event Hubs , Notification Hubs and business analytics.
  • Understanding of big data use-cases.
  • Understanding of Hadoop-based design patterns knowledge of real time/stream analytics.
, ' ',

Essentials:

, ' ',
  • Bachelor Degree or higher in IT or relevant discipline
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills.
  • Keen eye for detail.
  • Excellent time management.
  • Excellent problem solving and analytical skills.
  • Flexibility to travel - this position requires the person to travel to our international offices for short term assignments when required.
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

If you are interested in pursuing a rewarding career by being a part of an organisation committed to the growth of its customers and employees equally, please don't hesitate to APPLY NOW.

, ' ',

Please send your Resume in Word and we will get in touch with the shortlisted candidates ASAP.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

To be considered, you must be a Permanent Resident or an Australian Citizen.

title: b'BI Solutions Architect\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

Our client, NSW Government is seeking to appoint a BI Solutions Architect to join the team for an exciting project underway.
This contract role is to commence immediately for a 6 month period.

, '\n',

The Primary purpose of this role is to consolidate the data for 25+ sources and disseminate data and information.

, '\n',


Reporting to the Program Manager, the BI Solution Architect’s primary purpose is to deliver the technical solution for the Program. The role will help acquire, organise, structure, and label information in an effective and sustainable way that supports the needs of Operational Systems and its stakeholders.

, '\n',

The role is responsible for maintaining the domain data models, establishing interface contracts and architecting the end-to-end information flows. It is expected that the role has a good understanding of DAMA’s DMBoK and is preferably CDMP certified. The technology landscape includes Embarcadero, SAP Data Services, Oracle Exadata, SAP Business Objects and Tableau Server.
An incremental approach will be used to deploy business capability over the remaining 18 month timeframe for the Program.

, '\n',

Key accountabilities

, '\n',

• Demonstrate good leadership to inspire direction and delivery, develop people, and drive change.
• Contribute to the development of the information/data architecture within the Operational Systems domain with a view to establishing Business Intelligence, Data Integration and Data Modeling as significant capabilities.
• Engage with the business to understand their tactical and strategic demands to ensure a culture of quality customer service.
• Identify the emerging information management and architecture capability required to ensure the business goals are achieved.
• Develop the architectural roadmap relating to information and data to ensure business expectations and current and future needs are met.
• Play an active role in the establishment of ‘best practice’ in relation to all aspects of data and information management.
• Ensure methods and standards are in place to assist with the organisation’s development of information/data architecture.
• Team with other BI and Data Architects to develop a set of design principles and standards that guide the usage of technologies in the following areas:
o Operational Data Store and business intelligence
o Operational Master and Reference Data Management
o Data Quality, Cleansing and Profiling
o Data Integration & Meta Data Management
o Enterprise Data Model, including canonical data models and external reference models
• Actively support the Program with definition, guidance, leadership and mentoring during design and delivery to ensure implementations aligned to the Target Architecture.

, '\n',


Key challenges

, '\n',

• Drive innovation and share visions with the team and business
• Interact with other Architects internally and externally to drive constant improvements
• Interact and engage with Transport cluster stakeholders, which includes agencies and external operators

, '\n',

Key relationships

, '\n',

• Program Manager - Escalate issues, keep informed and advise and receive instructions
• Program Team - Work cooperatively within the team, exchange information and assist other team members to achieve team objectives and work outcomes
• Analytics centre - Ensure alignment with broader Analytics framework and data governance practices
• Operating Agencies and Program Stakeholders - Work cooperatively and proactively with operating agencies and program stakeholders
• Externally - Participate in forums, groups to represent agency and share information

, '\n',

Essential selection criteria

, '\n',

• Good understanding of DAMA’s DMBoK
• Preferably CDMP certified.
• Working knoweldge of technology landscape includes Embarcadero, SAP Data Services, Oracle Exadata, SAP Business Objects and Tableau Server
• Previous Government experienced preferred although not essential
• Strong communicator both verbal and written
• Australian citizenship or Permanent residency status required

, '\n']

title: b'\r\n          Database Administrator\r\n        '
jd:
[' ',

Database Administrator for fast growing global consulting services provider

, ' ',

The Role

, ' ',

Cubane Consulting has established itself over the last 7 years as the world's leading provider of benchmarking services to the education sector. It now has operations in Australia, New Zealand, the United Kingdom and Canada and is pursuing further strong growth opportunities in other regions. Our growth across multiple regions, growth in services provided, and our implementation of leading edge analysis and data visualisation tools has increased Cubane's data management complexities and needs.

, ' ',

We are looking for an experienced, highly motivated and self-directed Database Administrator wanting to join our fast-paced and highly professional team. The role will be to support our current database administration needs as well as support our needs for designing, implementing and maintaining future databases across the regions in which we operate.

, ' ',

Responsibilities

, ' ',
  • Play a key role in creating a global database to merge existing data from across a range of countries
  • Implement database source and version control
  • Implement consistency across existing databases (including field name changes, adding foreign key constraints, indexes etc.)
  • Help the web development team with database design using best practice design processes and techniques
  • Help with data maintenance and updates as required
  • Write technical database documentation for distribution to regional offices
  • Provide suitable solutions in a timely fashion where inadequacies and gaps exist in our current database structures
  • Direct the monitoring, administration and performance management of the database systems
  • Maintain and improve data security and implement data integrity checking processes
  • Contribute to the Business Intelligence data design strategy
, ' ',

Key relationships

, ' ',

The Database Administrator will report to the General Manager, Data Management & Insights Team

, ' ',

Experience and Capabilities

, ' ',

To be successful in this role, the DBA will need to have:

, ' ',
  • 5+ years' experience as a Database Administrator
  • Experience in designing, implementing and maintaining Databases using MySQL (or similar)
  • Experience writing technical documentation
  • Development of design specifications for solutions
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Show initiative and take responsibility
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Mandatory Cover Letter

, ' ',

If this role interests you and you think you would be a good fit, please include a cover letter in your application explaining

, ' ',

1) a difficult or technical challenge you have faced as a DBA (in your current or previous role)  

, ' ',

2) how you managed to resolve this issue.

, ' ',

Please note, if this is not included in the cover letter, your application will not be considered.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

**Australian PR or Citizens Only**Principals only. Recruiters, please don't contact this job poster.

, ' ']

['We currently have an opportunity available for an accomplished\xa0', BI Developer , 'who has a background and understanding working across the Star Schema model and Data Vault philosophy aligned to the enterprise data-warehouse (EDW) transformation program of work currently underway within the organisation.\xa0',
, ' \xa0',
, ' You will possess strengths across business intelligence (BI) strategy and solution development with strong hands-on capability in terms of technical design and architecture. To be successful in this position you must have strong skills across the ', Microsoft BI stack, ', ', SSIS, ', ', SSRS, ' along with ', SQL, ' ', server 2012, ' and ', C#, '.\xa0',
, ' \xa0',
, ' ', Daily responsibilities include: ,
, ' ',
  • Provide support and guidance for new builds, new design architecture and testing of BI related project activities.
  • Delivering solution design expertise for BI design patterns and architecture.
  • Data warehouse deployment processes including the promotion of code through test environments into production.
  • Identify opportunities to re-align legacy BI and DWH solutions to the strategic technical reference architecture.
  • Identify opportunities to align the data warehouse to new strategic physical architecture.
  • Release management and coordination tasks.
  • Support enhancement requests through the design, build and test of BI and data warehouse solutions.
, ' \xa0',
, ' ', Skills & experience required:,
, ' ',
  • A University Degree in technical, business or I.T disciplines or equivalent.
  • A strong background working on Data warehouse projects in Business Intelligence domains
  • Strong knowledge of the Microsoft BI technology stack i.e SSIS, Microsoft TFS source code.
  • Experience with Power BI.
  • Must have experience with SQL server 2012.
  • Strong communication skills with the ability to engage project staff and business stakeholders.
  • An understanding of DW methodologies such as Kimball, Star Schema, Data Vault etc.
, ' This is your chance to take your career to the next level and make a real difference with a premier organization so ', APPLY TODAY, ' for immediate consideration. ']

title: b'Senior Business Analyst - Commercial \r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

Sibelco mines and manufactures a wide range of mineral products for both local and international markets. Founded in 1872, Sibelco began in Europe and has grown into one of the largest industrial minerals companies in the world - privately owned and multinational, our vision is to be the best Global Material Solutions Company. We are market driven, operationally excellent and offer a compelling culture.

, '\n',

To support our ‘Customer at the Centre' strategy, a newly created, permanent full time position exists for a Business Analyst to support our Commercial team. Based in our North Sydney office, this exciting opportunity will report to the Senior Finance Manager - Financial Planning and Analysis, and will partner with the commercial leadership team to provide analysis and advice on markets, sales and prices, as well as complete relevant financial reporting and forecasting.

, '\n',

This appointment will be a key business partner role; attending key Commercial and Marketing meetings and participate in projects and tactics to truly enable business segment growth activities and decision making, and constructively challenge the business' on key decisions based upon analysis of data to facilitate best in class commercial outcomes.

, '\n',

Key Responsibilities Include;

, '\n',
  • Provide analytical support including preparation of reports, data and PowerPoint presentations.
  • Coordinating commercial inputs for all Financial Planning & Analysis.
  • Jointly review and analyse the Sales Forecast with the Commercial and Marketing team- using facts, data and logical arguments, challenge assumptions, providing alternative points of view and identify risks and opportunities.
  • Assist the commercial and marketing team in planning budgeting and forecasting and provide support, reports and analysis to the commercial team, business partners, the finance team and stakeholders.
  • Assist the commercial and marketing team to develop and implement automated reporting and analysis in the Sibelco Business Intelligence System. 
  • Manage pricing data, in cooperation and guidance from Marketing, and work with Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) team to facilitate the input of adjustments.
  • Manage the Sibelco freight system. A key short-term deliverable will include optimising the existing system to enable transactional input activities to be delegated.
, '\n',

Key Requirements Include;

, '\n',
  • A tertiary qualification in accounting or business administration that is supported by proven experience in a top tier organisation. 
  • CA, CPA or CIMA qualified, or, equivalent overseas qualification that is convertible to an Australian equivalent qualification.
  • Advanced user in MS Excel (essential) as well as experience with a large Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system (preferably Pronto), Online Analytical Processing (OLAP), Business Information (BI) tools (Infor preferably), and Customer Relationship Management (CRM) experience (preferably Salesforce), all highly desired.
  • Expertise in financial modelling with the ability to prepare and present complex data in a simple and understandable manner.
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to effectively with numerous functions to understand competing requirements, influence outcomes and deliver effective services.
  • Complex problem solving and analytical skills, with the ability to challenge the status quo, influence cross functional and global counterparts with sound decision making and recommendations.
, '\n',

With our Customers at the Centre, Sibelco's culture is built on the core behaviours of building positive relationships, explore possibilities, speak up and deliver on promise. The successful candidate will model and foster this great culture and help to shape this agile business that believes ‘Materials Solutions, Advancing Life'.

, '\n',

For further information please contact Eliza O'Brien on (07) 3370 8685. Applications (cover letter & CV) can be sent via the careers page on our web site at www.sibelco.com.au no later than Thursday 18th May 2017.

, '\n']

title: b'ETL Developer | SSIS \r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

FIRESOFT Consulting is a multi-award winning consultancy having been recognised across Australia for excellence in small business and one of Australia's coolest places to work. Our people love working here and that passion really shines through when working with you. We're obsessed with shaking things up a bit to make working with a consultancy enjoyable, valuable and specifically tailored to YOU! We understand it can be stressful and challenging while trying to find a new job or build a team so we're here to be open, honest and transparent through the process; to educate you and support you as much as possible to ensure you're kicking goals - whatever those may be!

Our team plays in the following verticals (contract and permanent) : DevOps | Business Intelligence | Big Data | Analytics | Infrastructure | Engineering | Digital; iOS, Android, Front End Development, Back End Development, UX, UI, Research | Project Management | Change Management | AdOps | Service Delivery |

, '\n',

Get Social with Us! | firesoft.com.au | facebook.com/firesoftconsulting |twitter.com/Firesoft_IT | linkedin.com/company/2596181/

, '\n',

We're on the hunt for a strong SSIS ETL Developer to work as a lead on a National Enterprise Data Warehouse Integration Project. 6+ month initial contract with 24 month pipeline of work.

, '\n',


Role Responsibilities:

, '\n',
  • Design and implement ETL procedures for intake of data from both internal and outside sources; as well as ensure data is verified and quality is checked
  • Requirements analysis, design and implement ETL processes and data architecture to ensure proper functioning of analytics, as well as client’s or third-party’s reporting environments and dashboard
  • Collaborate with business and technology stakeholders in ensuring data warehouse architecture development and utilization
  • Carry out monitoring, tuning, and database performance analysis
  • Thorough documentation of all process and procedures associated with design and implementation
  • Perform the design and extension of data marts, meta data, and data models
, '\n',


Essential Requirements:

, '\n',
  • Minimum 5 years working in a Data Warehouse Development role
  • Demonstrated SQL 2012 experience
  • Good exposure to Power BI suite
  • Exceptional ETL experience - SSIS
  • Experience across SSRS and SSAS
  • Demonstrated experience building ETL processes that map data from source systems to target systems utilizing SSIS in an automated manner.
  • Experience translating database design and diagnosing database performance issues.
  • Strong data modelling experience
  • Prior experience as a SQL DBA an asset
, '\n',


Apply Now; we have already engaged our headhunt campaign!
To Your Success...!

, '\n']

title: b'MS BI Developer\r\n    '
jd:
[' ',

An excellent opportunity to join one of Australia’s Government Organisations to gain exposure to major greenfield Business Intelligence project. This exciting opportunity will allow you to work on a market leading project and upscale your skills within a data warehouse and reporting environment with a focus on SQL Server and MS BI stacks.

, ' ',

An excellent opportunity to join one of Australia’s Government Organisations to gain exposure to major greenfield Business Intelligence project. This exciting opportunity will allow you to work on a market leading project and upscale your skills within a data warehouse and reporting environment with a focus on SQL Server and MS BI stacks.

, ' ',

The MS BI Developer will be responsible for the design, development, optimisation and ongoing maintenance of SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) ETL packages, complex SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS) cubes, SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) reports, and PowerBI dashboards.

, ' ',

As the successful MS BI Developer you will require:

, ' ',

Responsibilities:

, ' ',
  • Document source to target mappings as specification for ETL package development.
  • Design, develop, optimise, and implement ETL packages in SQL Server Integration Services.
  • Design, develop, optimise, and implement OLAP cubes using SQL Server Analysis Services.
  • Design, develop, optimise, and implement reports using SQL Server Reporting Services.
  • Design, develop, optimise, and implement dashboards using PowerBI.
  • Contribute to solution design workshops as subject matter expert.
  • Develop and publish SSIS/SSAS patterns’ for use and reuse within the environment.
, ' ',

Skills/Requirements:

, ' ',
  • Experience in documenting functional and design specifications for ETL development
  • 5+ years experience and certification in SSIS, SSAS, SSRS.
  • Excellent understanding of MS BI and MS SQL Server architecture. Experience with Azure is highly desirable.
  • Data warehouse architecture knowledge including star schemas, operational data stores and extract strategies and methods.
  • Extensive experience with SQL and other standard database query tools.
  • Prior experience in an end to end greenfield BI Implementation project is required.
  • Experience in agile development methodology.
  • Experience through the analysis, design, build and test phases of an SDLC.
  • Self-initiative and attention to detail.
  • Ability to communicate effectively with both technical and business users.
, ' ',

, ' ',

To apply please click apply or call Sara Burns on +61 2 8289 3105 for a confidential discussion.

, ' ']

title: b'Data Warehouse Manager | NRL Digital\r\n    '
jd:
["NRL Digital is embarking on a period of major transformation and growth with many of the Game's key digital properties coming back in house from early 2018.\xa0",
, ' ',
, ' As a result, we are currently recruiting a Data Warehouse Manager.',
, ' ',
, ' The Data Warehouse Manager is responsible for maintaining and supporting the NRL Warehouse and all associated integrations.\xa0 Working alongside the Solution Architect this role will be responsible for building out a platform that will create a single customer view, match, merge and cleanse data.\xa0 This solution will support the Business Intelligence solutions across the NRL, States and Clubs. ',
, ' \xa0',
, ' This role is responsible for supporting and building out the data warehouse.\xa0 This is an SQL environment built on Azure in combination with Master Data Management tools such as Maestro.\xa0 The key goal of the data warehouse is to combine a large number of disparate data sources using a golden record approach. The Data Warehouse Manager is responsible for this suite of technologies and the quality of the data produced.',
, ' \xa0',
, ' Required:',
, ' ',
, ' ',
  • Tertiary qualifications in relevant fields
  • Minimum 5 years in Data Warehouse, ETL, MDM and Integrations
  • Experience architecting/implementing solutions.
  • Strong SQL experience
  • Knowledge of Azure and associated technologies
  • Experience background in installation, setup, configuration, implementation, integration and testing of Data warehouses and Governance programs
  • Strong implementation methodology
  • Experience and good understanding of the architecture of Cloud based services and systems 
  • Experience and good understanding of integrations between multiple systems (on premise and cloud based systems).
  • Deep Understanding of SDLC (System Development Life Cycles) - Agile and Waterfall processes for future development.
  • Demonstrated background with following implementation, configuration and testing tasks within project schedules
  • Excellent time management skills
  • High level of integrity 
  • Ability to manage time and deliver to tight deadlines
, ' ',
, " If you believe you meet the above criteria and demonstrate the NRL's values of Excellence, Inclusiveness, Courage and Teamwork, then please apply.",
, ' ',
, ' Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples are encouraged to apply.\xa0',
, ' The National Rugby League is an Equal Opportunity Employer. ']

title: b'\r\n          Recruitment Specialist - Rail Industry\r\n        '
jd:
[' ',

Alstom Transport\Recruitment Specialist

, ' ',

Sydney – North Ryde

, ' ',

12 Month Fixed Term Contract

, ' ',

The Role:

, ' ',

The candidate will be primarily responsible for providing recruitment support to the Alstom business. The focus will be on advertising, shortlisting, interviewing, selecting and managing the on-boarding of all new staff.  Must be able to benchmark candidates against the technical and behavioural competencies required for each position and work in partnership with hiring managers to identify quality candidates. The Job will also involve other general HR duties.

, ' ',

Key Responsibilities:

, ' ',

Staffing & Recruitment

, ' ',
  • Manage the recruitment process in partnership with Hiring Manager
  • Prepare job advertisements for open positions
  • Create and post open jobs using internal recruitment tool (ALPS), coordinate scheduling of interviews with Hiring Manager(s) & HR team, liaise with outsourced reference check provider to ensure timely completion.
  • Respond to applicants advising short listing or unsuccessful application.
  • Liaise with various external bodies such as recruitment agencies and ad agencies
  • Organise and follow up on pre-employment medical checks and background checks before offers are made
  • Provide the business with market intelligence when it comes to salary surveys.
  • Candidate mapping and headhunting as required.
, ' ',

HR Administration

, ' ',
  • Administer agreed Alstom processes on the following aspects: New starters, contractor agreements, employee transfers
  • Manage recruitment tracking sheets and have regular meetings with line managers and the wider HR team to provide visibility on ongoing recruitment actions.
, ' ',

HRIS Management

, ' ',
  • Ensure candidate records are maintained in ALPS to allow for effective on-boarding and to meet organisational and statutory requirements.
, ' ',

HR Projects 

, ' ',
  • Support HR team in the development and implementation of HR/IR projects according to the needs of the Alstom Business.
, ' ',

Key Requirements:

, ' ',
  • Tertiary qualifications in HR or related area
, ' ',
  • Five years' experience either as a Recruitment Specialist or HR generalist role with focus on recruitment
  • Bulk recruitment experience managing up to 30+ roles at a time is essential
  • Technical Engineering or rail industry recruitment experience is desirable
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills are essential.
  • Excellent attention to detail
  • Ability to communicate to all levels of the organisation and to external contacts including overseas stakeholders
, ' ',

To be considered for this or other Alstom vacancies please visit our website at:

, ' ',

https://jobsearch.alstom.com/search/?q=&locationsearch=australia

, ' ',

 

, ' ']

An innovative & rapidly growing SaaS financial software company, is looking for a Sales Executive with prior experience selling enterprise software solutions to CFOs and Financial Controllers in Mid Market customers and large corporations. title: b'Sydney - Open Source Data Consultant - Cloud, Big Data and Analytics.\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',
The Company:

We're proud to call this company a client and have supported them for a number of years in Australia. They continue to challenge the status quo around technology, drive both delivery and product build and have been involved in some of APAC's most complex and high profile Data programmes.

Unlike other Data companies these guys focus on technical quality, premium design concepts and the ability to develop highly complex and innovative technical solutions.

They don't mind calling them selves "geeks with flair" and love to work with the latest tech available. They build solutions from the ground up and have some of the smartest technical minds across APAC working for them.

The role:

2017 is shaping up to be one of the biggest yet with partnerships being created at a global level, customers empowering them to manage entire Data programmes and organic growth and progression internally. 

They require a number of technical gifted problem solvers who have the following attributes:
  • At least 12 months experience developing technical solutions in a Data, Analytics and Business Intelligence capacity.
  • Outstanding - and I do mean outstanding - core SQL skills with a track record of coding with SQL when building solutions. Stored Proc, Scripting, Coding, Indexes, Triggers etc.
  • Solid command of Open Source and Applications orientated languages within a Data focused environment - Java, Scala, R, Python, Spark etc.
  • Experience in the design of Data solutions using various source systems within RDBMs and Cloud based technical environments.
  • Great communication skills with a passion for solving business problems through the use of technology.
  • Passionate about technology and the build of solutions through the use of it.
  • A real geek at heart who loves to learn and educate others.
  • Understanding of mainstream Data and Reporting Technologies with traditional RDBMS and Cloud / Open Source Environments - Oracle, SQL Server, Teradata, AWS, Hadoop, Cassandra, Tableau, QlikView, Power BI.
What's in this for me?

Training, training and more training - seriously.....weekly training and education! Not to mention the chance to work on some of the best and most high profile programmes in Australia. Oh, and dont forget you will be working with a team that is unrivaled technically! Think the Google of Data or the Atlassian of Analytics!

What next?

Apply now via Seek and speak with Alloc8 to learn more. Alternatively send your resume to tom.sharp@alloc8.com.au today or contact Tom on (02) 9090 2761
Sponsorship available for candidates based in Australia.






, '\n']

title: b'Corporate Sales Analyst\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

Mantra Group is a leading Australian accommodation provider, with more than 120 properties in the portfolio under three distinct brands – Peppers, Mantra and BreakFree and over 20,000 rooms across Australia, New Zealand, Indonesia and Hawaii it is never a dull day working with us.

, '\n',

Based in our Corporate Office in Sydney, as our new Corporate Sales Analyst you will provide comprehensive analysis of the various key indicators that drive sales and revenue into our hotel portfolio. In particular, you will work closely with our Director of Corporate Sales to provide support in line with our strategy of Corporate, Government, Sports & Entertainment and Consortia market segments. 

, '\n',

Reporting to our Systems and Reporting Manager, on a day-to-day basis you will:

, '\n',
  • Provide support to the sales team by compiling and providing key reporting functions to assist in sales and revenue analysis
  • Assist with weekly, monthly and annual forecasting reviews as required
  • Analysis of Sales & Marketing campaign ROI and their impacts across our various revenue channels
  • Work with the Director of Corporate Sales to prepare the annual Corporate Sales & Marketing plan
  • Management of our data warehouse, CRM and other key reporting tools ensuring accuracy and best practices are followed through & ongoing training of Mantra Group Team Members
, '\n',

To be successful in this role you will possess;

, '\n',
  • Proven ability to communicate and build effective relationships across a business
  • Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel 
  • Exposure to Business Intelligence systems desired
  • Experience using a CRM system preferable 
  • A passion for problem solving and an analytical mindset
, '\n',

Want to know what it's like to work at Mantra Group? Follow us on Instagram @CheckInWithMG or mantragroup.com.au/careers/ 

, '\n']

title: b'Risk Analyst: salary $80k + Super + Car\r\n        '
jd:
[' ',

Salary: salary $80k + Super + Car

, ' ',

Location: Norwest

, ' ',

Role: new role created to identify and shape operational risk across the business and shape commercial discussions to drive business growth

, ' ',

Role Overview

, ' ',

Reporting to a Commercial Manager, this Risk Analyst takes the lead on establishing a culture of risk assessment and leveraging business intelligence tools to identify trends that support operational outcomes. A key focus of this role is to shape continuous improvement oppportunities in the way the business works with an overarching aim of supporting growth.

, ' ',

The Risk Analyst has primary day-to-day responsibility for developing an approach for risk assessment across the business through data analysis and building close working relationships with key stakeholders across the organisation.

, ' ',

The key success factor will be your strength in identifying insights from data and engaging the business around continuous improvement.

, ' ',

Responsibilities

, ' ',
  • Help shape the business' approach to operational risk assessment.
  • Use data to deliver insights to your business partners, with a focus on idenfiying continuous improvement opportunities across financial, commercial and operational aspects.
  • Collaboratively shape initiatives that take advantage of continuous improvement opportunities identified, manage risk and deliver business growth.
  • Connect with a broad range of commercial and operational stakeholders to embed a continuous improvement, compliance and risk mitigation framework, including ongoing follow up of recommendations.
  • Support broader team and business wellbeing and engagement through a positive mindset and as part of a high performance culture.
, ' ',

Candidate Profile

, ' ',

You are CA/CPA qualified and have prior experience working in an operational or commercially oriented role that helps support a positive risk mindset. Ideally with strong experience in leveraging data to drive insights, you have a passion in shaping the story behind the numbers and a natural curiosity to ask "Why?".

, ' ',

Culture & Benefits

, ' ',

The organisation is a highly regarded brand in the consumer goods import and distribution industry with a history for innovation that puts customers first.

, ' ',

The spirit of this business is to create an incredible customer experience aligned to its key values.

, ' ',
  • Share a passion - be part of a high performing team and culture
  • Support growth - leverage your commercial acumen to drive insight led analysis
  • Be rewarded - salary $80k + Super + Car
, ' ',

Apply

, ' ',

If this sounds like you, please send your resume by clicking the “apply” link below addressing Tom Nisevic quoting reference number TNRA3322 in the subject line. For a confidential chat, please contact REO on 02 8211 3488.

, ' ']

title: b'SAP BW/BI Senior Consultant\r\n      '
jd:
['SAP BW/BI Senior Consultant wanted for Greenfield reporting solution, this contract role is based in Sydney CBD.',
, ' ',
, ' Our client is an extremely well branded BI, Data and Analytics Consultancy. \xa0',
, ' ',
, ' ', Project Scope & Some Job Functions:
,
, ' The project itself is a green field reporting solution. There are two initiatives they are looking to deliver in the next 4 months.\xa0',
, ' \xa0\xa0',
, ' For both projects, the consultant will be expected to perform both ETL and reporting duties in a BW context, mostly indepedently. Working from a recently established solution blue-print to essentially surface these first two subject areas of information out to the business.\xa0',
, ' ',
, ' ',
, ' ', To be eligible for the role you will have the following skills / experience:,
, ' ',
  • Minimum of 7 years experience in the area of SAP BI/BW; showing experience implementing end to end BW projects - BW System design, Expert in Data-Modeling, Data Extraction, Scheduling and Monitoring
  • Expert in SAP BW components, for example: InfoObjects, InfoCubes, ODS, Multiproviders, InfoSources, Hierarchies, transformations, InfoPackages, Queries, Process chains
  • Must also be consultative, business minded and be adaptable to highly customized SAP systems.
  • ABAP knowledge preferable (required for BW routines, transformations, function modules etc.)
  • Proven Data modeling experience (InfoObjects, InfoCubes, DSO's, Multiproviders etc.)
  • Data extraction experience from multiple data sources, SAP and non-SAP.
  • Proficient in developing complex BEx queries
  • Good to have - modeling and report development experience in various modules of SAP like FICO, HR, PS and Logistics etc based on standard and custom data flows.
  • Desirable to have have HANA Experience on SAP BW Design & development on large implementation projects.
  • Excellent troubleshooting and problem solving skills.
  • Great interpersonal and communication skills with particular emphasis in the areas of team collaboration, stakeholder consultation and negotiation in order to resolve issues and meet changing customer needs relevant to the provision of Business Intelligence services.
, ' ',
, ' ', Full Australian work rights are expected by client for this role.

, 'My client is in a position to move quickly in order to secure the right candidate.',
, ' ',
, ' ', All Resume's received are held in absolute trust; we do not submit any profiles to clients without discussions, full role disclosure and your written consent to represent.
,
, ' Please submit your CV in\xa0MS.Word\xa0using the APPLY link below. \xa0',
, ' ',
, ' Yann Guillaume',
, ' General Manager\xa0',
, ' Talent Acquisition & Services',
, ' ',
, ' BTPeople is an ITCRA Certified recruitment organisation.',
, ' ',
, ' Apply now if you meet the above criteria!!',
, ' ',
, ' Follow us on LinkedIn for all career opportunities and news updates on',
, ' ', http://www.linkedin.com/company/bt-people-pty-ltd, ' ']

title: b'Commercial Analyst: salary $100k + Super + Car\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',

Salary: salary $100k + Super + Car

Location: Norwest
Role: enhance the business' use of BI tools to drive insight led commercial analytics and support business growth.

Role Overview

Reporting to the Head of Rporting & Analytics, this Commercial Analyst takes ownership for leveraging internal and external data to shape actionable insights that help drive improved performance for the business. You will use this information to engage a broad range of stakeholders and shape the story behind the numbers.

The Commercial Analyst has primary day-to-day responsibility for delivering critical business reporting, outline key drivers for performance compared to expectations and help shape thinking around forward looking scenarios. The key success factor will be your ability to engage the broader business to align commercial analysis and reporting to business needs.

Demonstrated competence in analytics, strong system skills and an ability to align commercial reporting to business needs will set you apart in being successful for this role.

Responsibilities

, '\n',
  • Identify key opportunities to enhance the business' commercial reporting and analysis.
  • Build strong relationships with key business partners to shape business performance metrics and financial KPI reporting.
  • Enhance the business’ commercial reporting and analytics that help articulate key drivers of performance compared to plan.
  • Deliver ongoing weekly, monthly and ad hoc commercial reporting, and shape commentary and insights through collaborative engagement with your stakeholders.
  • Contribute to review of potential risks and opportunities.
  • Support the development of commercial targets and perform related calculations and reconciliations of actual performance v target.
  • Own your wellbeing, development and contribute to broader team engagement plans.
, '\n',

Candidate Profile

You are CA/CPA qualified commercial analyst that is passionate about leveraging technology to help deliver analytics.

Bring natural curiosity in your thinking and an engaging style that allows you to build strong relationships with your business partners, you are focussed on driving continuous improvement to help a business succeed. You also have a natural ability to cut through data and information to shape a story that is easy for your stakeholders to understand.

, '\n',

Previous experience in data analytics with business intelligence tools and SAP is highly desirable.

Culture & Benefits

The organisation is a highly regarded FMCG business that is focussed on elevating the best talent. This provides a unique opportunity to join a high performance culture that prides itself on strong engagement and a passion for their business.

, '\n',
  • Share a passion - be part of a strong team culture
  • Add value - be instrumental in shaping enhanced analysis around business performance
  • Be rewarded - salary $100k + Super + Car
, '\n',

Apply

If this sounds like you, please send your resume by clicking the “apply” link below addressing Tom Nisevic quoting reference number TNCA3321 in the subject line. For a confidential chat, please contact REO on 02 8211 3488.

, '\n']

title: b'Business Performance Analyst\r\n    '
jd:
['\n',
  • Work for one of Australia's Leading General Insurers
  • 12 month fixed term contract
  • Competitive salary package including 13% Superannuatuin
, '\n',

About Us

, '\n',

IAG is the largest general insurance group in Australia and New Zealand, with a growing presence in Asia. IAG owns some of the region's most trusted brands, including NRMA Insurance, CGU, SGIO, SGIC, WFI and Swann Insurance.

, '\n',

At IAG, we believe that everyone has a unique point of view to share, shaped by their life experiences, cultures & passions. We celebrate and commit to:

, '\n',
  • #Proud to be me – we value difference, not sameness
  • #Together – harnessing our collective wisdom enables us to bring our best for our customers & each other
  • #No boxes – it's not about labels, boxes or categories, rather it's about building a diversity, inclusion & belonging mindset into everything we do
, '\n',

In addition to a diverse and inclusive culture, some of our benefits include 13% superannuation, 50% insurance discounts, flexible work and leave options, generous parental leave and return to work program, recognition and reward program, and various corporate partner discounts.

, '\n',

The Role

, '\n',

Working in the Property Business Performance Team, the Business Performance Analyst will focus on supporting business leaders to understand performance, opportunities and challenges via analysis and insights

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

Responsibilities:

, '\n',
  • Produce and / or receive regular business reporting and analysis for key stakeholders
  • Support business managers to understand business issues and opportunities to improve decision making effectiveness
  • Undertake ad hoc analysis and modelling as required to support business initiatives
  • Automate and streamline BAU reporting / analytical processes
  • Look for new/unique approaches to how work is done and strive to continuously improve analysis, process and quality
  • Monitor efficiency and work practices, and modify procedures to provide a more efficient and effective analytics service to the functional units
  • Develop good working relationships with key stakeholders to assist in meeting business objectives
  • Address issues promptly and provide transparency in priorities
  • Deliver on customer service excellence objectives
  • Liaise with Business Intelligence to initiate opportunities to industrialise reporting
  • In partnership with R&P community, coordinate the completion of business budget / forecasts in accordance with Personal Insurance timetables and requirements
  • Review business assumptions to ensure budget / forecasts quality and accuracy
  • Coordinate issues management for consistency across business units / products
  • Prepare appropriate documentation for business review showing key assumptions and the output of forecasts and budgets for the purpose of management review
, '\n',

Keys skills and experience required

, '\n',
  • Advanced Microsoft Excel skills
  • Effectively uses technical capabilities to monitor and evaluate performance
  • Advanced ability to interpret numerical data and clearly communicate the analysis to stakeholders
  • Strong understanding of business / statistical modelling
  • Understanding of business drivers and resulting impact of organisational performance
, '\n',

Culture & Benefits

, '\n',
  • Be empowered to drive innovation through early adoption of bleeding edge communication technology
  • Charged with experimentation to lead and drive changes to the way the greater IAG work
  • Agile working environment inclusive of non-fixed seating arrangements, lockers and tool boxes.
  • Dress for your day with smart casual the norm
  • Communication and collaboration is a key focus and everyone encouraged to come up with ideas
  • 100% open floor plan (even the CEO finds a new desk each morning)
  • Many of the extra mile perks including a barista daily making free coffee, treadmill work stations, adjustable heights for workstations
  • Extremely relaxed culture with a space themed environment adding to the fun in the day
  • Monthly awards to employees - including the “best idea of the month”
, '\n',

In addition to a diverse and inclusive culture, some of our benefits include 13% superannuation, 50% insurance discounts, flexible work and leave options. Visit our website to find out more.

, '\n',

How to Apply

, '\n',

To submit your interest in this role, please click the ‘Apply' button below.

, '\n']

jd:
['\n',

This is a fantastic opportunity to join one of the big four banks wealth divisions as a Business Intelligence analyst. This a pivotal role within the business where you will use your business intelligence skills to work with large data warehouses that support the performance and analytics team.

title: b'\r\n          Senior BI Cognos Consultant - Contract - Immediate - Great Day Rates\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',
We are looking for a Senior BI Cognos consultant/developer to join a passionate team working on a tier one project based in the CBD. This is a contract opportunity with highly competitive rates for the right person 

, '\n',
 
, '\n',
You will be working with a leading business performance consultancy with a highly experienced team on a greenfield project. You will be proficient with the Cognos 10 toolset, having a solid understanding of relational and dimensional reporting models. The person will be responsible for implementing BI reporting solutions and framework /cube modelling to business requirement specifications.
, '\n',
 
, '\n',
Since this is a Senior Consultant appointment, accordingly you will display a demonstrable aptitude for business intelligence solutions and be responsible for the analysis, design, development and delivery of solutions that meet and exceed client expectations.  This is a genuine opportunity to be part of a team that willingly shares ideas and skills and deliver outstanding results.


Job Description:
  • Develop simple and complex reports including list, crosstabs and charts with drill\-thru capabilities
  • Build dashboards using traditional and active reporting techniques
  • Update and enhance existing framework manager & OLAP models
  • Enhance existing reports based on new requirements
  • Performance tuning of reports, models and infrastructure
  • Assist in gathering requirements and author supporting documentation
  • Interact with business sponsors to plan scope and timescales for project
Technical Skill:
  • Minimum 5 years experience in a Cognos development role
  • Proficient with reporting toolsets such as Report Studio, Query Studio, Analysis Studio, Event Studio and Business Insights Advanced
  • Understand metadata modelling techniques \(Framework and OLAP\)
  • Proficient in SQL and relational databases such as Oracle
  • Understand data warehouse design theory
  • Experience with Cognos best practices & methodologies
  • Experience with Rave Engine highly desireable but not essential
, '\n',
Personal Skills:
, '\n',
  • Proven ability to work well in a fast-paced and challenging technical environment, with ability to multitask whilst delivering high-quality solutions
  • Ability to quickly understand issues and think through solutions
  • Highly motivated with an ability to work independently
  • Ability to perform data analysis and troubleshoot data integrity issues
  • Able to communicate effectively with other team members and business stakeholders
Desirable Skills:
  • Agile methodologies \- Jira, Kanban, Scrum
  • Understand Cognos server architecture and environment administration
  • Knowledge in TM1, Cognos SDK using Java or \.Net
This is an immediate need and an opportunity to join a great team in the CBD working on a great project with highly competitive rates on offer. Please click apply to submit your resume and a consultant will be in touch shortly.
, '\n']

title: b'Chief Financial Officer\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

Our client is a newly established technology business that has developed an innovative technology platform supporting key elements of the real property market. The company aspires to transform the sector, with the offering having the potential to ‘disrupt’ market outcomes. The company will forge its own unique identity as it takes this technology solution to world markets.

, ' ',

, ' ',

The vacant position below will require proactive, forward-thinking candidates with ‘can do’ attitudes. Individuals must also display the energy and stamina to execute an aggressive, multi-faceted agenda across jurisdictions. The opportunities are predominantly Sydney based with the ability to travel to and from Perth.

, ' ',

, ' ',

Chief Operating Officer/Chief Financial Officer

, ' ',

The Chief Operating Officer/Chief Financial Officer is a member of the senior executive management team and heavily involved in strategic planning and the implementation of business drivers and policies to increase the net worth of the organisation.

, ' ',

This position is primarily responsible for:

, ' ',
  • Ensuring financial operations and management platforms are effective in servicing business objectives and supporting anticipated growth.

  • experience with Cloud orientated IT services and outsourcing.

, ' ',

Should you have enquiries about the role, please contact Sally Langer at Derwent Executive Perth on 08 9282 5250.

title: b'\r\n          Conference Producer/Manager\r\n        '
jd:

Are you looking to take the next step in your career progression?

, ' ',

Are you looking for the opportunity to grow within the dynamic business intelligence industry?

The role:

Conference production is often described as the 'marriage' of journalism, communications, and events. With your finger always on the pulse and ear to the ground, good producers research, produce timely, relevant industry events based on current affairs and industry needs.

, ' ',

title: b'Senior Commercial Accountant\r\n    '
jd:
['\n',

Accountabilities/Key Responsibilities

, '\n',
  • Delivering comprehensive monthly management reporting to stakeholders with key focus on insight, timeliness, accuracy and high-quality visual & verbal presentations.
  • Completing complex revenue calculations & analysis to support ongoing monthly revenue reporting.
  • CAPEX reporting and forecasting, monthly and ad-hoc.
  • Prioritising & managing substantial levels of ad-hoc queries from all stakeholders.
  • Industrialisation of business intelligence reporting and metrics through Tableau Dashboards (including comprehensive understanding of underlying data and mechanics).
  • Supporting the co-ordination of the annual budgeting & monthly forecasting processes.
  • Developing simple & complex financial models to support management reporting and business initiatives.
  • Supporting the development of strategies to improve the effectiveness of the management accounting/ reporting, budgeting & forecasting frameworks.
, '\n',

Quality and Safety

, '\n',

GenesisCare strives to continuously improve the quality and safety of our workers and services provided to our patients and their carers in line with our vision and values.

, '\n',

Accountabilities

, '\n',
  • Be aware and understand Safety and Quality accountabilities relevant to the role
  • Lead and be accountable for sustainable Safety and Quality programs (including external review processes) and communicate outcomes
  • Mitigate risks and hazards; proactively develop and implement risk reduction strategies and record outcomes
  • Monitor compliance with the policies and procedures of the Safety & Quality Management System
  • Be accountable for own actions and seek assistance when necessary
  • Demonstrate knowledge/competency in performance of skills relevant to the role, including completion of mandatory training
, '\n',

Legislated individual Work Health & Safety Duties for all workers:

, '\n',
  • Take reasonable care for your own and others' health and safety
  • Take reasonable care that any of your acts or omissions do not adversely affect the health and safety of others
  • Participate in safety training, tasks and other activities as required or instructed
, '\n',

Key Result Areas

, '\n',

Key Result Areas / Key Performance Indicators for the role will be discussed and agreed with the job holder and their leader during the on-boarding and annually as part of the performance review process.

, '\n',
  • Technically first class and forward thinking
  • Hands-on yet able to interpret the big picture
  • Developing a high performing Finance team through coaching & mentoring
  • Attention to detail and pride in delivering consistently accurate work
  • Ability to organise/prioritise work in and around deadlines, workloads and conflicting priorities
  • Bring a positive, enthusiastic and 'can-do' attitude to work
  • Develop and maintain professional working relationships
  • Resonate with the high performance GenesisCare culture
  • Take a partnering approach with managers and stakeholders
, '\n',

Key Working Relationships

The Senior Commercial Accountant will need to develop strong relationships with the following internal parties:

, '\n',

  • CancerCare Executive General Manager, General Managers & Operational Staff

, '\n',

In addition the Senior Commercial Accountant will need to develop strong external relationships with various individuals/agencies/key stakeholders including the External Auditors.          

, '\n',

Required skills, qualifications and experience

, '\n',

Qualifications and Experience

, '\n',
  • Qualified CA, CPA or CIMA (or equivalent) with +5 years of relevant work experience.
  • Advanced Microsoft Office capability – Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook & Word.
  • Experience with Microsoft AX Dynamics, Tableau, SAP and Adaptive Insights (beneficial but not essential).

  • Ability to occasionally travel interstate to engage key stakeholders.
, '\n',

Only successful applicants will be contacted.

, ' This represents an outstanding opportunity to develop your career within a leading software business that is growing rapidly across Australia. This company offers genuine career progression and development for the successful applicant. Please send through your CV to chris.irwin@jenkinbeattie.com ']
