title: b'Senior Data Engineer/Report Specialist\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

My client is a major software provider and is on the search for a Senior Data Engineer to join their ranks within a critical area of the business. With a North Sydney location, they are on the look out for technically minded individuals who are passionate about data and want to take their career to knew heights. This is an excellent opportunity for a senior individual looking to cement their mark and solidify their future within a fantastic organisation looking to grow at an exponential rate. 

, '\n',

This role will be situated within the Research and Development Team, with its main focus on initially updating and enhancing the reporting solutions within the team. My client is expanding constantly, with a view of on-boarding new technologies such as AWS and Cloud processes, offering the potential candidate great exposure to these fast developing platforms in the long run. 

, '\n',

To be considered in this position you must possess the following skills; 

, '\n',
  • 5-8 yearsof SQL Server development experience, including knowledge of T-SQL and experience writing queries and stored procedures.
  • Experience optimising and troubleshooting SQL queries for large data sets.
  • 4+ years in performing dimensional data modelling
  • 4+ years Microsoft SSRS experience in building reports, including:
  • Expertise in PowerBI, SSIS abd SSRS
  • Ablility to benchmark systems, analyse system bottlenecks and propose solutions to eliminate them.
  • Ability to clearly articulate pros and cons of various technologies and platforms.
  • Ability to perform detailed analysis of business problems and technical environments and use this in designing the solution.  
, '\n',
Desirable skills include; 
, '\n',
  • Microsoft Certified (Business Intelligence)
  • Proficiency in designing and implementing efficient and robust cloud (AWS or Azure) ETL workflows.
  • Experience with the major big data solutions like Hadoop, MapReduce, Hive, HBase, MongoDB, Cassandra. Any experience with big data solutions like Impala, Oozie, Mahout, Flume, ZooKeeper and/or Sqoop would be an advantage.  You are able to tune Hadoop solutions to improve performance and end-user experience.
  • Experience in designing solutions for multiple large data warehouses with a good understanding of cluster and parallel architecture as well as high-scale or distributed RDBMS (Azure SQL Data Warehouse and/or AWS Redshift).
  • Expert knowledge of different (NoSQL or RDBMS) databases such as MongoDB, PostgreSQL or SQL Server.
, '\n',
You must be able to work within a team, with your performance linked with your ability to communicate effectively and understand your responsibility within the teams performance. 
, '\n',
 
, '\n',
This is an amazing opportunity and we are considering interviews immediately- If this sounds like you please contact Daniel at daniel.p@interpropeople.com or get in contact at (02) 8294 4002 
, '\n']

title: b'Senior Business Analyst'
jd:
['• Exciting opportunity for a ', Senior Business Analyst , 'to work for the world’s Co-leader in the Wine and Spirits Industry\r\n',
, '\r\n• ', Great team and culture, ' ',
, '\r\n• ', Generous product allowance, ' ',
, '\r\n• Full time position\r\n',

An exciting opportunity has become available for an experienced and dynamic Senior Business Analyst to join a leading winemaking organisation, to showcase their commercial and financial expertise with the world’s most notable wine brands.

, '\n',

Pernod Ricard Australia is part of the Global Pernod Ricard Group – the World’s Co-leader in the Wine and Spirits Industry with an unrivalled collection of iconic brands, including Absolut® Vodka, Chivas Regal®, Jameson®, Jacob’s Creek® and more

, '\n',


Position Summary:
Reporting to the Finance Controller, the Senior Business Analyst is act as a strong commercially minded business partner to our key channel teams in providing financial analysis and support to ensure the commercial and financial obligations are met in accordance with budget and forecast targets.
As such, this role is responsible for analyzing and challenging the channel teams and provide insights and recommendations to drive positive commercial outcomes.

, '\n',

This role will also be responsible for managing trade spend and assisting in the development and implementation of national commercial analysis processes, guidelines and templates to strengthen the understanding of the key drivers of business performance and improve decision making through insightful and timely information.

, '\n',

The Senior Business Analyst will also contribute significantly to the development of financially robust business improvement strategies and value added insights to maximize profit delivery, protect and grow brand market share and drive strategic brand growth.

, '\n',

This role will also be responsible for leading and developing one direct report.

, '\n',

Candidate Profile: 
As the successful, you will have:
• Tertiary qualifications in Business/Commerce and in the disciplines of Accounting and/or Finance
• Minimum 6 years commercial finance experience in a large corporate organisation or FMCG (preferably Liquor Industry)
• Proven business partnering experience, preferably with sales teams
• Strong ability to analyse information and draw meaningful conclusions and providing recommendations as required
• Strong commercial acumen and an ability to build relationships with all levels of seniority
• Strong influencing and stakeholder management skills
• Demonstrate an ability to make decisions autonomously and be proactive.
• Strong organisation and prioritisation skills to manage a demanding workload.
• Advanced computer skills (Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint and Business Intelligence tools)
• CPA/CA certified or post-graduate qualification in Accounting/Commerce

, '\n',

If you believe you are ready for your next challenge, apply now by submitting your covering letter and resume. For further information, please visit our career website: http://www.pernod-ricard-winemakers.com/.

Early applications are encouraged.

, '\n',

]

title: b'Solution Architect with a focus on Integration\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

FIRESOFT Consulting is a multi-award winning consultancy having been recognised across Australia for excellence in small business and one of Australia's coolest places to work. Our people love working here and that passion really shines through when working with you. We're obsessed with shaking things up a bit to make working with a consultancy enjoyable, valuable and specifically tailored to YOU! title: b'Senior BI Developer\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',
  • Growing and successful market leader
  • Newly created role
  • Collaborative and dynamic culture
, '\n',

RCG Corporation Limited (ASX: RCG) is an investment holding company which owns and operates a large number of footwear and apparel businesses in the performance and active lifestyle sectors. In 2015, RCG acquired the Accent Group Limited (AGL) – a New Zealand company with operating subsidiaries in Australia and New Zealand and in 2016 RCG acquired Hype DC.

, '\n',

RCG's acquisition of AGL & Hype DC has resulted in the creation of a regional leader in the retail and distribution sectors of branded footwear, with over 350 stores across different retail chains and exclusive distribution rights for 13 international brands across Australia and New Zealand. The combined group's brands now include The Athlete's Foot, Platypus Shoes, Hype DC, Podium Sports, Skechers, Merrell, CAT, Vans, Dr. Martens, Saucony, Timberland, Sperry Top-Sider, K-Swiss, InStride, Palladium, Stance and Cushe. The group will open a further 40 stores in 2017.

, '\n',

Reporting to the Head of IT, your role will be to drive and lead the Business Intelligence solutions and reporting within RCG Corporation, and manage all aspects around growth, development and support of this platform for the multiple business divisions. 

, '\n',

Your responsibilities will include:

, '\n',
  • Consulting with management, sales , buying, operations and Inventory Analysts to determine information needs, data flows and system definitions and requirements
  • Taking ownership of BI projects assigned and supporting other developers in completing tasks. 
  • Ensuring reporting runs within timeframes and is aligned to company required deadlines.
  • Working with all levels of development from analysis through to implementation and support.
  • Interpreting business needs of stakeholders and develop analytical solutions
  • Carrying out quality assessment of data, data reports and the accompanying decisions.
  • Working in partnership with the Data Warehouse team and other stakeholders concerning the accuracy of data and efficiency of processes.
  • Resolving end user reporting problems through collaboration with IT and Operations.
  • Create technical and maintenance documentation for reports and end user training as needed.
  • Using reporting expertise to identify varying ways to analyze data to help drive to root cause of issues.  Strong analytical skills and knowledge of statistical tools, ability to identify trends and create reports as required by business needs.
  • Maintaining a solid understanding of what is new and innovative in the market with Business Intelligence, and utilize to drive improvements and positive change
  • Ensuring backups are conducted on a regular and cyclical pattern so that records can be restored should the system fail or data become corrupted by operator error
  • Assisting in training users to take advantage of relatively simple reporting and enquiry features of the database
, '\n',

To succeed in this role, you will need to have:

, '\n',
  • Formal qualifications in IT
  • 5+ years BI Database Analyst experience
  • Strong Data Warehousing experience utilizing SSAS and SSIS
  • QlikView Design and Developer experience
  • A working knowledge of SQL and ETL automations  including experience with Microsoft SQL Server database engine and an understanding of database concepts and the ability to create and maintain complex SQL queries
  • Experience in ERP systems – Erply, Pronto, AP21 (preferable)
  • A working knowledge of retail processes and terminology is essential
  • Proven ability to interpret business requirements into technical and analytical solutions
, '\n',

RCG Group is committed to excellence. The company culture is one of collaboration to drive commercial outcomes. The team are enthusiastic with a great interest in achieving personal and professional goals.

, '\n',

If this exciting opportunity is what you have been looking for, please follow the link below to apply.

, '\n',

Only applicants shortlisted will be contacted.

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

 

, '\n']

title: b'\r\n          Client Support - Not your average Support Team\r\n        '
jd:
[' ',
  • Open & transparent culture, focused on providing excellent customer service.
  • Work with a Global team.
  • High performing team where professional development encouraged.
, ' ',

About Us

, ' ',

We are one of Australia's genuine start-up success stories. Having originally started in Sydney, the company has grown into a global business, headquartered in New York.  For 10 years we've been the leading business intelligence technology company utilizing smart sensors to enhance the efficiency and profitability of parking facilities across the world.

, ' ',

Empowered by our proprietary portfolio of intelligent cloud-based software solutions, our camera based smart-sensors system has the core business intelligence to deliver multiple benefits for our customers, ranging from increased revenues, improved efficiencies and an unparalleled experience for the driver utilizing the parking service.

, ' ',

The Role
We're now looking for a customer-centered professional to join the team here in Sydney helping us deliver exceptional support to our clients using this software solution. You will build relationships with our clients through your friendly and approachable manner, and ability to assist them in resolving their queries or concerns.

, ' ',

As the first point of contact for customers calling or logging a support ticket, you will triage the request, diagnose the issues and drive the request to resolution. Where an issue requires advanced technical support, you have a supportive team of senior agents around you who will assist.

, ' ',

In addition, your role will gradually include:

, ' ',
  • Generating & distributing Monthly Client Reports.
  • Coordinate onsite rectification jobs with our Field Services teams
  • Improve and develop existing documentation.
, ' ',

To be considered, you will need to demonstrate:

, ' ',
  • A passion for solving technical problems for clients
  • An eagerness to learn new technologies
  • A detail orientated approach.
  • A keen interest in ensuring the smooth running of the team.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Troubleshooting skills.
  • A strong teamwork ethic with the confidence to work autonomously when required. 
, ' ',

Any experience scheduling technical, mechanical or engineering staff would be a bonus (but is not essential).

, ' ',

This a varied role which would suit an individual with a passion for exceeding client's expectations, troubleshooting a wide variety of incidents and liaising with escalation teams both here and overseas.

, ' ',

Why join us?

, ' ',
  • Highly innovative, dynamic business who's sustainably growing
  • Supportive, collaborative culture.
  • Continued learning and professional development are actively encouraged.
  • An opportunity to define how we provide support to our customers.
  • Our team prides itself on our close knit, high performing culture. 
  • We're constantly learning from each other and are proud of our open and transparent communication culture with exceptionally high levels of customer service.
, ' ',

If you'd like to join our team, please drop your CV and a note introducing yourself. 

, ' ',

Please note, we are unable to accept applications from anyone who is not currently located in Australia or does not have full, unrestricted work rights.

, ' ',

*Interviewing this week: Apply now. 

, ' ']

title: b'Team Leader Customer Experience\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

Company

, '\n',

In a world of "no", Pepper was founded on saying "yes".  Since 2001 Pepper has transformed itself from a small company in Sydney to a 1700-strong force across Australia, Asia and Europe.   We offer a unique, diversified, global portfolio of financial services.  We provide specialist experience in our core disciplines of Lending, Advisory and Asset Servicing across the residential and commercial property sectors – as well as in consumer, auto and equipment finance.  We are one of the top 500 companies listed on the ASX (ASX:PEP).  With the continued growth of our brand and the ongoing expansion of our business, we are currently seeking an experienced Team Leader – Customer Experience to join our growing workforce. 

, '\n',

Pepper Australia is a one of Australia's leading non-bank lenders currently operating in the financial service space. We pride ourselves on our exceptional first class service and with that in mind we are currently recruiting for someone who is driven with a passion for customer service to join our team.

, '\n',

The purpose of the Customer Experience Team Leader is to lead and mentor a team of Customer Experience Officers (Case Officers)who are focused on delivering customer improvement activities that lower customer effort as well as provide specialist subject matter expertise in the areas of internal and external dispute management.

, '\n',

Responsibilities for the role include but are not limited to;

, '\n',

Complaints Management

, '\n',
  • Assist with the initial and ongoing  management of the Customer Disputes 
  • Ensure all legislation and industry requirements are adhered to and polices related to EDR (External Dispute Resolutions)  schemes are actively managed
  • Assist and liaise with internal  teams and leaders in   an understanding  customer disputes with a view to find a suitable resolution  
  • Handle  complex complaints (level 3 matters) and actively seeking advice as required on all Legal matters
  • Schedule, prepare for timely and effective conciliations and negotiations on applicable disputes, in a manner consistent with CIO (Credit and Investment Ombudsman)  requirements
  • Review  all submissions  and correspondence to Customers and or regulators
  • Identify themes or trends in conciliations conducted and propose strategies to improve early resolution
, '\n',

Leadership and Team Development

, '\n',
  • To create and maintain a positive culture within the group
  • To ensure "living the values" of the organization is the status quo
  • Successfully lead the Customer Experience Resolutions officers towards achieving the goals of the team and the broader Customer Service Group
  • To ensure the ongoing and appropriate development of staff to enable them to achieve their full potential
  • Pepper to be recognised as providing the best customer service within the financial services industry, in line with our corporate vision.
  • Gather and provide insights and learnings from all complaints to Senior stakeholders
  • Ability  to drive high performance and implement performance management plans as required (eg conduct meaningful one  on ones)
, '\n',

Customer Experience Responsibilities/ Business Intelligence & Continuous process improvement

, '\n',
  • To ensure peak performance in the front line service teams by provision of critical support analytics and initiatives
  • Complete all required reporting for the team and management 
  • Assist with the development of new reports that match the needs of internal and external stakeholders – Intermediate to advanced excel skills required
  • Provide ongoing monitoring of related Customer experience initiatives within the dispute resolution domain and manage improvements as required
  • Provide a streamlined approach to disputes management processes as well as building sustainable processes for the future
  • Ability to implement strong processes, controls, awareness and training of front line staff on complaints management
, '\n',

Risk / Compliance  Management

, '\n',
  • To minimise fraud, credit and operational losses in the organisation to below industry norms. Identify broker behaviour not consistent with Peppers Corporate Objectives
  • Work in conjunction with Risk Assurance and Regulatory Compliance to minimise potential risk and implement controls
  • Have a deep understanding of NCCP as well as other financial services legislation.
  • Identify and report on any issues requiring Risk & Compliance oversight
, '\n',

Deliver Customer Experience initiatives under the Customer Service Strategy

, '\n',
  • To drive customer experience change and improvement.
  • To lift department capability in line with the "Super Agent" methodology implement within Service
  • Customers include all internal and external group
, '\n',

To be successful in the role you will have;

, '\n',
  • Demonstrated experience in a similar position.
  • Well-developed stakeholder management and leadership skills and with experience working with a regulator or industry body.
  • At least 5 years' experience working in a Financial Services Resolutions / Complaints area (preferably Mortgages)  and have a mix of commercial acumen, strong analytical thinking as well as attention to detail.
  • Knowledge and experience with FOS/CIO and RG165 regulations will be highly advantageous
, '\n',

If you are seeking a challenging role with a key focus on the customer than this is the perfect role for you. As a rapidly growing business the future opportunities are endless. Take the first step and apply now today.

, '\n',

 

, '\n',
, '\n']

title: b'BI Consultant - Large Datawarehouse and Big Data Environments\r\n        '
jd:
["Our client is seeking a well-rounded, BI consultant (multiple Business Intelligence tools) to join their team in Sydney on a permanent basis. They carry out big and complex technical projects for some of Australia's largest companies in a diverse range of industries from banking to retail to telecommunications. If you are interested in adding more exposure to big data (Hadoop, Spark, AI) and analytics to your personal skillset - this could be the perfect opportunity for you!",
, ' ',
, ' ',
, ' For this hire, we are seeking someone with a hands-on skill set in various Business Intelligence and Data Warehousing stacks (e.g. SAS / Power BI / Cognos / Tableau / Alteryx / Microsoft SQL / Oracle / Teradata environments) who is capable of working on large complex enterprise data projects.',
, ' ',
, ' ',
, ' Since the nature of projects will vary - it is essential you are comfortable working on relational / SQL-based databases, ', but be ready to train and get involved in new big data deployments, ' ', and some analytics work as required, '. If you have been learning skills with technology such as; Apache Spark, Hadoop, Hive, Linux, Scala, NoSQL, D3.js, React.js, Apache Zeppelin, etc. in your own time or in recent roles, we would love to hear about it! \xa0',
, ' ',
, ' \xa0',
, ' ', Requirements / skills you will bring to the table:
,
, ' ',
  • Strong SQL / RDBMS skills - understanding database concepts, joins, ETL, data structures, etc.
  • Business Intelligence, Reporting or Analytics work with the likes of; SAS, SSIS, SSAS, SSRS,  PowerBI, Qlikview, Tableau, Alteryx, etc.
  • Quick learner with new technologies and concepts - ideally an interest in big data or data science
  • Strong team-player mentality 
  • Outstanding communication & stakeholder management skills 
  • Please note - prior consulting experience is not mandatory, but we would be looking for a high degree of fit - such as some BA experience or 'internal consultancy' where you have done requirement gathering and direct management of stakeholders, etc.
, ' ',
, ' Please Apply with your CV and a Cover Letter through the links below. ']

title: b'BUSINESS ANALYST, CORPORATE DEVELOPMENT & STRATEGY (BA1503)\r\n    '

Spring into a permanent full-time career with Interflow and be part of this leading company in the water industry.

We are currently seeking a professional and experienced Business Analyst to join our growing team based in Girraween, Western Sydney.

Reporting to the Executive Manager, Corporate Strategy, the main objectives of this role are, corporate development and strategic account management. Key Responsibilities include:

Corporate Development

What We're Offering

About Interflow

With a long history dating back to 1936 Interflow Pty Ltd is Australia's leading pipeline renewal company and one of the largest in the world. These are the foundations of our operating principles which encourage our employees to be innovative, out of the box thinkers who are able to deliver outstanding results for our clients. title: b'BI/DW/Big Data Consultants\r\n      '

title: b'Senior Test Analyst/Lead\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

Prestigious Global Organisation is looking for a Senior Test Lead/Analyst responsible for the quality assurance and testing of new and existing Microsoft based applications across both BAU and key regional and/or global firm-wide projects. 

, '\n',
  • Contribution across various stages of testing - SIT, UAT, Regression, Performance, Post Verification Testing
  • Analyse business requirements and specifications to create detailed manual or automated test scenarios and scripts
  • Ownership for creating and documenting Test Plans, Test Scripts, Test reporting, Test Design (Test Cases & Data) in consultation with the Manager, Development & Testing as well as other Testing team members
  • Own and create traceability matrix and test cases using Microsoft Test Manager or other test tools (e.g. ALM)
  • Own and manage defect lifecycle – defect triage, retest and defect reporting
  • Manage and co-ordinate releases into the test environments with the Development team
  • Maintain regression test cases and scripts, and assist with creation of automated regression test scripts
  • Liaise with Manager, Development and Testing and Test Lead to provide input into delivery function and test automation strategies.
, '\n',

To be successful in this role you will have;

, '\n',
  • Sound communication skills
  • Ability to engage and manage expectations with stakeholders across broader IT teams and other business users
  • 5+ years’ relevant experience in testing web applications
  • 5+ years’ relevant experience in testing third party applications
  • 2+ years’ relevant experience in testing Business Intelligence solutions
  • Experience or knowledge in testing Microsoft Office application add-ins for Word, PowerPoint
  • End to end life cycle experience –SIT, UAT, Regression, Post Verification Testing
  • Experience with writing test plans, test cases, and reporting
  • Experience with Performance, Load, Scalability and Stress testing of applications
  • Experience with test automation
  • Strong understanding and experience working in traditional Waterfall plus Agile testing environment (or working with cross functional teams and acceptance criteria)
  • Graduate qualification or demonstrated equivalent experience in Information Technology, Computer Science, Programming or related qualifications.
, '\n']

title: b'\r\n          MarkLogic Workflow Developer\r\n        '
jd:
[' ',

We are looking for a MarkLogic Workflow Developer to lead the design, development, and maintenance of the department's data repositories, content models, and information retrieval and search solutions.

, ' ',

Responsibilities:

, ' ',
  • Develops and maintains content ingestion, validation and transformation workflows that populate the department's MarkLogic XML repository
  • Develops and deploys XQuery modules and Rest APIs to support complex searches and queries against the MarkLogic content repository
  • Develops and maintains data ingestion, validation and transformation workflows that populate the department's Cloudera Big Data repository
  • Develops and deploys usage and other data reports aggregating all available data sources through custom web applications or the Tableau business intelligence portal
  • Researches and develops POCs that demonstrate cutting-edge solutions employing established data science and search methods, such as Machine Learning, Semantic Enrichment, NLP, RDFs and Semantic Search, Recommender Algorithms, etc, and optimize these for integration with production systems

Essentials:

  • Advanced Data modeling skills and experience working with relational and/or NoSQL databases required

  • Good interpersonal and communication skills required
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

If you are interested in pursuing a rewarding career by being a part of an organization committed to the growth of its customers and employees equally, please don't hesitate to APPLY NOW.

title: b'Cognos Developer\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',


Join a company dedicated to your career development.

The Consumer Commercial Team is responsible for developing performance management solutions and delivering reporting and commercial insights and analysis on the drivers of the Optus Consumer Australia business to enable business leaders to make decisions and drive performance.

A rewarding opportunity has risen for a motivated and tech savvy Cognos Developer to join the Consumer Commercial Team on a 12 month fixed term contract. Your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:

, '\n',
  • Participating in projects to architect design, build, standardize, optimize, test, implement and maintain the insights and visualisation assets and solutions required for reporting, planning, forecasting and analytics
  • Interacting with non-technical people and translate their financial models into a workable solution within TM1
  • Developing new or enhanced code changes and maintenance of the internally supported Cognos Anlaytics
  • Working closely with the Commercial team, to manage key relationships within the business, in particular partnering with managers and business representatives to understand business processes, improve the reports, analysis cubes and TM1 model development and enhancements and developing new reporting as needed to meet business requirements
  • Troubleshooting, technical problem solving and server capacity planning
  • Supporting and developing the Cognos servers and ensuring they are optimised to support Cognos Analytics development operations
  • Working in the Systems Team and Commercial Finance specialists to deliver reporting solutions utilising TM1 Web, TM1 Applications, Perspectives, including Cognos Reporting solution via Tablets (iPad) and smart phones
  • Supporting the design, build, testing, implementation and delivery of agreed reporting solutions, ensuring they meet quality and timeliness standards
, '\n',

This position requires experience in using purposely designed business intelligence, planning and forecasting and visualisation softwares (eg. Cognos, TM1, Qlikview or Tableau) to deliver reporting and analytical capability to the business. A passion for continuous improvement, team player, ability to work to tight deadlines and manage competing demands is an essential component of the role.

Optus offers a working experience like none other at our Macquarie Park Campus, including on-site gym, childcare, eateries, bars, coffee shops and more. We have a variety of benefits including discounts on Optus products and services, salary packaging, sustainable transport options, career development tools and lifestyle benefits. For more information on what Optus can offer you, please visit optus.com.au/careers and click on "Working at Optus". #LI-JT1

Heads Up!!
Due to the fast paced nature of the Optus business, our vacancy close dates may be subject to change. Don’t delay, make sure you apply as soon as possible. We will assess applications as they are received.
One last thing, Optus operates a direct sourcing model so no agency introductions, sorry folks.


, '\n']

If you are looking for new opportunity and love to dictate your own pay cheque monthly, please get in touch and I will be happy to discuss the role in more detail.

, ' ',

Please apply by sending your CV through by clicking APPLY NOW or by email to pohf@marcusevansau.com

, ' ']

title: b'\r\n          Group Revenue Manager\r\n        '
jd:
[' ',

About our tribe.

, ' ',

Recreational Tourism Group is known for creating extraordinary travel experiences for youth travellers visiting Australia and New Zealand.

, ' ',

With multiple brands across all aspects of youth travel RTG is the third largest youth hotel brand in the World and one of the fastest growing tourism companies in Australia & New Zealand.

, ' ',

RTG owns both Base & Nomads Youth Hotel brands and operates 28 properties across Australia & New Zealand. This is in addition to a growing number of licensed venues including well-known bars like Scary Canary and Down Under Bar.

, ' ',

RTG has also  expanded their product offering to deliver live events like Full Moon and a host of others on Magnetic Island.

, ' ',

Day to day you will be responsible for:

, ' ',
  • Working with key stakeholders to develop annual budgets, KPIs & target sets for each property across revenue performance, pricing strategies and tracking of results.
  • Compile competitive market share analyses of hotels to determine if the hotels receive their fair market share and determine how they perform against comp sets.
  • Provide weekly dynamic forecast of expected results, variance and budget comparisons.
  • Undertake daily pick up analysis, strategies etc. then track and communicate findings.
  • Actively review hotel inventory and identify opportunities for tactical campaign rates as indicated by the weekly forecast.
  • Oversee and analyse the performance of distribution partners and contracted rates, (OTA's, corporate and FIT etc).
  • Determine the type, format and frequency of reports required for General Management, Senior Management and Executive.
  • Develop and maintain strong relationships with key distribution partners.
  • Professional development of a small but committed team of 4.
  • Contribute to the Technology & Innovations team to identify platforms that will automate the Revenue & Sales teams' business processes with the view to create efficiencies, maximise productivity and revenue performance.
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

About you.

, ' ',

The business is undergoing transformation so we are looking for extraordinary people to deliver unique customer experiences for our guests to enjoy. The right person will;

, ' ',
  • be someone who pushes the boundaries to find new, efficient and exciting propositions that drives revenue growth, but has the ability to balance insight with customer expectations by keeping on the pulse of purchase behaviours that trigger the youth market.
  • be a creative problem solver with strong commercial aptitude, outstanding leadership and engagement skills, with demonstrated experience in the field of yield and revenue management.
  • provide leadership to the Group's revenue management function and its distribution strategies.
  • develop pricing strategies in conjunction with the general management team to maximise revenue and profit, and maintain strong relationships with all distribution partners.
  • have the ability to review in detail and then articulate the information to key stakeholders.
, ' ',

Skills & Experience

, ' ',
  • have 5-10 years of experience in a Revenue Management role working for a multi-site hotel group.
  • experience using Business Intelligence tool Calumo and tertiary education will be highly regarded
, ' ',

Domestic and international travel will be a requirement of this role so candidates must hold a valid passport, candidates who are not Australian Citizens must hold a valid Australian Work Visa.

, ' ',

If you are a passionate revenue strategist with a strong business acumen and have a desire to join a fun, dynamic and growing tourism group with a big vision and great culture, apply to join the crew today!

, ' ']

title: b'Data Insights Project Manager | Microsoft Australia\r\n      '
jd:
[Are you ready to seize an opportunity to drive leading edge technology solutions with the customer? Do you value deploying  and working on the latest solutions with real world impact? Do you thrive by mentoring and leading by example? Would you love to help us accelerate the transformation towards data-driven organizations? Do you want to join an elite and distinguished team?
, '\xa0',
, "\r\nThe Project Manager is responsible for leading delivery of profitable and sustained high-quality Advanced Data Analytics and Data Platform related projects to Microsoft's enterprise customers in Australia. This position reports into the Data Insights practice\r\n lead - Asia Pacific and Japan.",
, '\n',
, "\r\nMicrosoft's Enterprise Services Delivery - Data Insights Domain is a global delivery practice of 1000 professionals who are exceptional services delivery professionals including engineers, consultants, project managers, architects and data scientists and it\r\n is the fastest growing practice within Enterprise Services. The Data Insights Domain helps customers realize their full potential through accelerated adoption and productive use of Microsoft Advanced Analytics technologies.\r\n",
, '\n',
, '\n', Key Duties & Responsibilities:,
, '\n',
  • Responsible for leading delivery of data insights related projects in Australia and accountable for project profitability, revenue recognition and other delivery related financial metrics, customer satisfaction
  • Support pursuit lead(s), and at times lead, statement of work (SOW) writing during bidding.
  • Play key role in reviewing of effort estimation, delivery resource assignment, vetting of delivery resource capabilities according to SOW and commitment, reviewing key reusable IP if deemed fit, set up project governance structure and rhythm according to services delivery methodology. 
  • Vet and review subcontractors and India offshore delivery capabilities. Manage subcontractors and offshore delivery resource during project delivery.
  • Responsible for customers satisfaction of projects delivery.
  • As this is a senior position, the candidate is expected to play a leading role of Australia delivery resource and bench management, deal structure and profitable delivery supervision, customer satisfaction
  • Engages with customers presales / business development situations where needed by sales and bidding team, representing Data Insights domain and capabilities and sponsoring our key Enterprise Services activities
  • For high profile data insights engagements, he/she will work closely with field sales, Australia local management and lead the shaping, packaging and delivery of innovative value propositions 
, '\r\n\xa0',
, '\n', Education & Experience:,
, '\n',
  • Preferably Master's degree (e. g. MBA, engineering, Information Technology, Information Systems management or Computer Science) or equivalent education
  • PMI certification is required.
  • Proven related experience (> 15 years) as IT Project Manager/Director or Consulting Practice Manager with very international large software or technology firms
  • Sound experience with different type of services contracts (especially fixed price contracts)
  • Proven track record of managing and delivery of very large consulting related projects and thorough knowledge and experience in managing Project Profit & Loss
  • Proven experience in managing very large consulting delivery projects in Australia
  • Sound Knowledge of IT related project management methodology (e.g. Agile, CRISP) 
  • Solid background (> 5 years) of leading technology/solution/consulting presales from enterprise strategy, technology consulting, and large project implementations (> US$5M+ projects)
  • Proven experience in managing very large complex projects/client solutions delivery. Deep understanding of the latest technology offerings in the market (for example: mission critical applications development, ERP/CRM/HRM, database platform, business intelligence, enterprise data warehouse, technology stack migration, public cloud, machine learning, chatbots, artificial intelligence, predictive analytics)
, '\n',
, '\n', Management Skills and Competencies:,
, '\n',
  • Confidence, Impact and Influence, Interpersonal Awareness, Developing People, Optimizing Resources & Budgets, Setting Goals & Expectations
  • C-level interactions with customers 
  • Capable of articulating Microsoft Consulting Services value proposition and business cases around IT trends and Microsoft solutions and technology stack.
  • Building and maintaining relationships with key customers and delivery partners
  • Analytical and thorough problem solving
  • High energy with a strong desire to aspire a team of delivery professionals. Strong in motivating and developing talents.
  • Risk management, ability to develop the insights foreseeing the risks of bids, project deliveries, and leading mitigation plans and landing them.
  • Strategic insight of the consulting business, what drives the growth initiatives, creates a compelling and actionable growth plan in business/people, landing the plan and delivers measurable progress and quantifiable business results that are aligned with the overall subsidiary growth plan and annual P&L budget.
  • Very strong in cross-team and virtual team collaboration: with other subsidiary departments, across Australia, Hong Kong and Taiwan, India and also with Asia Pacific and Japan teams.
  • Demonstrated ability to make timely, sound decisions based upon a mixture of analysis, acumen, experience and judgment. Ability to make decisions with potentially incomplete data and conflicting views under tight deadlines. 
  • A dynamic "get-it-done," results-oriented perspective with large initiative/project-based leadership experience 
  • Key agent of driving change 
  • Value selling
  • Very strong English (oral and written) and confident to handle C-level communications: presentations, proposals, and project steering committee meetings
, '\n',
, '\n', This role is hired as a 12 month contract. We can offer a flexible working day based in our award winning offices, using state of the art activity based working facilities., '\n']

title: b'\r\n          Growth marketer\r\n        '
jd:
[' ',

, ' ',

About the business and the role

, ' ',

Airtasker is a fast growing online and mobile marketplace for local services and temporary labour. We're revolutionising the way people and businesses get more done by connecting real time labour requirements with one of the world's most under utilised assets - people power.

, ' ',

Recently passing one million members, we are continuing our rapid growth trajectory, Airtasker is looking to hire a talented team player with strong analytical skills in the position of Growth Analyst. This position will be responsible for analysing marketing activity, campaign results, solving problems, taking actions based upon analysis and will be an integral part of Airtasker's growth team. You will have an analytical mindset and a passion for storytelling and modeling, always with the consumer and data at the heart.  

, ' ',

As part of an agile startup team, you'll be part of our core data team and work closely with our engineering and product teams as well as other growth specialists.  You will be accountable for supporting various analytics projects across the business to provide actionable insights and recommendations that support the growth teams.

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

Job tasks and responsibilities

, ' ',
  • Developing reporting framework and dashboards of core metrics, flows and funnels for growth team.
  • Reporting existing campaigns and  activity, continually developing hypotheses, for testing and learning to drive better results
  • Working with growth team to help identify the best acquisition channels and setting targets based on consumer value and CPA's. 
  • Conducting competitive market research on a regular basis
  • Monitoring and analysing key metrics and web related data "across the board"
  • Real-time, daily and weekly campaign performance reporting. Presentation of key data and conclusions to management
  • Developing new and innovative digital marketing plans and contributing to the team' overall growth strategy with an emphasis on a "test and fail fast" strategy. 
, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

Skills and experience

, ' ',

Essential:

, ' ',
  • A minimum of two years as an analyst with demonstrated experience drawing insights and recommendations efficiently, using your strong skills in SQL, EXCEL and data visualisation tools to assist you. 
  • 2-3 years experience in working across web or marketing analytics with strong technical skills in SQL and web analytics in an environment with an abundance of data.
  • Firm understanding of Google Analytics or other web analytics platforms
  • Advanced Microsoft Excel skills: Pivot tables, charts, and advanced functions.
  • Previous experience with business intelligence software (Tableau, Power BI, Looker.io, Domo, etc)
  • Experience some of the following tools: Appsflyer, AppAnnie, Adjust, Flurry, Fabric, Google Analytics, Google Search Console, SEMrush, Criteo, Adwords, Facebook Ads, ExactTarget, 
, ' ',

Desirable:

, ' ',
  • Knowledge of PPC management platforms (Marin, Kenshoo etc)
  • Experience working with marketing automation tools (Vero, ExactTarget).
  • Experience working with conversion optimisation tools (VWO, Optimizely, Google Experiments)
  • Working knowledge of statistical analysis and modelling (especially around cross channel attribution)
  • Experience with attribution modelling to ensure the most efficient marketing spends.
  • Programming skills in Python, Scala, R, Javascript or statistical libraries
  • Experience with database programming: SQL, Postgres & Redshift
  • Understanding of machine learning practices or machine learning packages like Predicition.io would be advantageous
, ' ',

, ' ']

title: b'Senior Cognos BI Consultants \r\n      '
salary: b'Attractive $$ for High Calibre Exp Consultants'
jd:
['\n',
  • Permanent roles
  • Located in Sydney and Brisbane
, '\n',

We are looking for a Senior BI Cognos consultants in Brisbane and Sydney to work for niche EPM Partners

You will be working with a leading business performance consultancy with a highly experienced team on a greenfield project. You will be proficient with the Cognos 10 toolset, having a solid understanding of relational and dimensional reporting models. The person will be responsible for implementing BI reporting solutions and framework / cube modelling to business requirement specifications.

Since this is a Senior Consultant appointment, accordingly you will display a demonstrable aptitude for business intelligence solutions and be responsible for the analysis, design, development and delivery of solutions that meet and exceed client expectations. This is a genuine opportunity to be part of a team that willingly shares ideas and skills and deliver outstanding results.

Job Description:

, '\n',
  • Develop simple and complex reports including list, crosstabs and charts with drill\-thru capabilities
  • Build dashboards using traditional and active reporting techniques
  • Update and enhance existing framework manager & OLAP models
  • Enhance existing reports based on new requirements
  • Performance tuning of reports, models and infrastructure
  • Assist in gathering requirements and author supporting documentation
  • Interact with business sponsors to plan scope and timescales for project
, '\n',

Technical Skills:

, '\n',
  • Minimum 5 years experience in a Cognos development role
  • Cognos TM1 experience
  • Proficient with reporting toolsets such as Report Studio, Query Studio, Analysis Studio, Event Studio and Business Insights Advanced
  • Understand metadata modelling techniques \(Framework and OLAP\)
  • Proficient in SQL and relational databases such as Oracle
  • Understand data warehouse design theory
  • Experience with Cognos best practices & methodologies
  • Experience with Rave Engine highly desirable but not essential
, '\n',

Personal Skills:

, '\n',
  • Proven ability to work well in a fast-paced and challenging technical environment, with ability to multitask whilst delivering high-quality solutions
  • Ability to quickly understand issues and think through solutions
  • Highly motivated with an ability to work independently
  • Ability to perform data analysis and troubleshoot data integrity issues
  • Able to communicate effectively with other team members and business stakeholders
, '\n',

Desirable Skills:

, '\n',
  • Agile methodologies \- Jira, Kanban, Scrum
  • Understand Cognos server architecture and environment administration
  • Knowledge in TM1, Cognos SDK using Java or \.Net


, '\n',

Please apply directly via the Apply for this job button. Only suitable candidates matching client criteria will be contacted.

, '\n']

  • Develop and maintain the project schedule to identify the duration of the project, dependencies, key milestones and deliverables and critical paths to ensure an effective and timely project delivery

  • Good stakeholder management skills
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Excellent problem solving skills
  • Proactive and dynamic personality
  • Effective organisational and time management skills
  • Ability to multi-task
  • Highly developed IT project management skills from project initiation to project closure
  • Strong communication, reporting and financial management skills
  • Stakeholder management skills to facilitate cross divisional collaboration
  • Follow prescribed project methodologies and communication standards
, ' ',

Desirable:

, ' ',
  • Formal project management certification such as Prince 2 Practitioner or Project Management Professional (PMP)
  • Customer application / CRM experience
  • Experience working with SharePoint, Customer technologies or Business intelligence platforms
, ' ',

To indicate your interest please apply via the link

title: b'NAV DEVELOPER / TECHNICAL CONSULTANT\r\n    '
jd:
['\n',
DYNAMICS NAV TECHNICAL CONSULTANT / DEVELOPER
, '\n',
CUSTOMER FACING ROLE
, '\n',
SYDNEY BASED, PERMANENT POSITION
, '\n',
 
, '\n',
Large Australian owned company looked to hire an experienced NAV TECHNICAL CONSULTANT / DEVELOPER to join their established in house NAV team based in Sydney.
, '\n',
 
, '\n',

To qualify for the role you must have : 

 

MANDATORY - 

  • Bachelor Degree in computer science, business administration or relevant experience.
  • Minimum of 5 years consulting experience on ERP projects - NAV 
  • Minimum of 7 years’ experience using Dynamics NAV.
  • Minimum of 3 years’ experience technical development of Dynamics NAV
  • Minimum of 3 years’ functional experience with MS SQL
  • Minimum of 2 years’ experience with Advanced Warehouse Management Systems and Warehouse layout and design.
  • Experience in all levels of help desk product support.

  • Strong Coding skills
DESIRABLE -
  • Experience with all modules of Microsoft Dynamics NAV.

title: b'Junior ETL Developer | SSIS \r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

FIRESOFT Consulting is a multi-award winning consultancy having been recognised across Australia for excellence in small business and one of Australia's coolest places to work. Our people love working here and that passion really shines through when working with you. We're obsessed with shaking things up a bit to make working with a consultancy enjoyable, valuable and specifically tailored to YOU! We understand it can be stressful and challenging while trying to find a new job or build a team so we're here to be open, honest and transparent through the process; to educate you and support you as much as possible to ensure you're kicking goals - whatever those may be!

, '\n',

Our team plays in the following verticals (contract and permanent) : DevOps | Business Intelligence | Big Data | Analytics | Infrastructure | Engineering | Digital; iOS, Android, Front End Development, Back End Development, UX, UI, Research | Project Management | Change Management | AdOps | Service Delivery |

, '\n',

Get Social with Us! | firesoft.com.au | facebook.com/firesoftconsulting |twitter.com/Firesoft_IT | linkedin.com/company/2596181/

, '\n',

We're on the hunt for a strong SSIS ETL Developer to work as an associate developer on a National Enterprise Data Warehouse Integration Project. 6+ month initial contract with 24 month pipeline of work.

, '\n',


Role Responsibilities:

, '\n',
  • Work with the team to design and implement ETL procedures for intake of data from both internal and outside sources; as well as ensure data is verified and quality is checked
  • Requirements analysis, design and implement ETL processes and data architecture to ensure proper functioning of analytics, as well as client’s or third-party’s reporting environments and dashboard
  • Collaborate with business and technology stakeholders in ensuring data warehouse architecture development and utilization
  • Carry out monitoring, tuning, and database performance analysis
  • Thorough documentation of all process and procedures associated with design and implementation
  • Perform the design and extension of data marts, meta data, and data models
, '\n',


Essential Requirements:

, '\n',
  • Minimum 2 years working in a Data Warehouse Development role
  • Demonstrated SQL 2012 experience
  • Exceptional ETL experience - SSIS
  • Demonstrated experience building ETL processes that map data from source systems to target systems utilizing SSIS in an automated manner.
  • Experience translating database design and diagnosing database performance issues.
  • Prior experience as a SQL DBA an asset
, '\n',


Apply Now; we have already engaged our headhunt campaign!
To Your Success...!

, '\n']

title: b'Account Manager - Healthcare Portfolio\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

Account Manager - Healthcare Portfolio

, '\n',



The Company:

, '\n',

We are seeking to appoint a key position of Account Manager with a global organisation covering the APAC Region. We are seeking an experienced candidate in the healthcare vertical with a minimum of two years prior experience.

Our Client offers valuable research and consulting solutions ensuring their clients stay at the forefront of their industry by integrating accurate market forecasts and healthcare analytics on the most up to date trends and developments. Their informed healthcare industry perspectives have assisted businesses across pharmaceuticals, biotechnology and medical equipment make informed decisions that effect critical decisions.

, '\n',


The Opportunity

, '\n',

As a result of an aggressive expansion to their APAC sales division, our client is seeking to appoint a self-motivated and ambitious Account Manager to manage a portfolio of existing accounts at senior executives in top global companies across Australia and Asia.

, '\n',
  • Minimum on target earnings of $120-150K (achievable and realistic)
  • Premium global leader in Business Intelligence/Services
  • Top-Tier training from accomplished CEO's & Managers
  • Professional and ethical team that is focused on real career development for every team member
  • Network and liaise with key decision makers and executive from all across Asia Pacific
, '\n',


The Role

, '\n',
  • Manage accounts through the existing client portfolio and correct decision makers
  • Initiate outbound calls to prospective clients at Senior Management and Executive levels
  • Consistently move the customer towards a positive buying decision or commitment
, '\n',


Requirements:

, '\n',
  • Account Management /Sales experience minimum 2 years within Healthcare
  • Mandarin Language Skills
  • Solution Sales experience
  • Highly ambitious, with the drive and motivation to achieve the best
  • Demonstrate drive, persistence, and strive to achieve KPI’s and targets
  • Exceptional communication skills - written and verbal
  • Ability to build rapport easily
, '\n',

, '\n',

How to apply:

, '\n',

To apply please email your resume to emmy@salessourcenational.com.au

, '\n',

, '\n']

title: b'Senior Project Officer, Change and Communications - Clerk Grade 9/10 - 194478\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

  • Full time ongoing appointment.

  • Location: Bridge Street, Sydney CBD
, ' ',

 

, ' ',
, ' ',

The NSW Department of Education serves the community by leading the provision of world-class education. The department protects young children by regulating preschool and long day care providers. Once children move into school, we provide them with a world-class primary and secondary education. We also work to advance the wellbeing of Aboriginal people.

, ' ',
, ' ',

 

, ' ',
, ' ',

 

, ' ',
, ' ', The Centre for Education Statistics and Evaluation (CESE), undertakes in depth analysis of education programs and outcomes across early childhood, school, training and higher education to inform whole-of- government, evidence based decision making. A core responsibility of CESE is to provide information management, data collections, strategic analysis and evaluation that improve effectiveness, efficiency and accountability of education programs and strategies. CESE also delivers an enterprise Business Intelligence (BI) program that supports the department’s strategic analysis and reporting. More information about the Centre and the BI program can be found at: (http://www.dec.nsw.gov.au/cese).,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', The Senior Project Officer, Change and Communications provides change and communications services to support the Information Management program of work, including the BI program. The role is responsible for the analysis, planning and delivery of organisational change activities; identifying, assessing the impact of change and supporting stakeholders and end users; developing audience appropriate communication artefacts and ensure the use of appropriate communication mediums to support organizational change.,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', Talent Pool,
, ' ', If the selection panel identifies more than one suitable candidate for the role, a talent pool may be created from which these suitable candidates may be chosen and directly offered employment in other similar roles (ongoing or temporary) in the near future.,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', How to apply,
, ' ', If you are interested in this role please apply online and include, a covering letter (maximum of 2 pages) and your resume (maximum 5 pages)  which clearly details how your capabilities, knowledge and experience can contribute to the success of the Directorate. Please also include the name and contact details of two referees.,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', For the application process, you must also answer the pre-screening questions and any essential requirements as listed below. We are looking for you to demonstrate your competence in the focus capabilities as outlined in the role description in your answer, so please develop your response with this in mind.,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', Note: it is a requirement that all candidates submit their applications online via iworkfor.nsw No paper based, email based or late applications will be accepted.,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', Note: the selection process will include a range of assessment techniques to assist in determining your suitability for the role.,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', Please click to access the following:,
, ' ', Role description
Aboriginal Education Review – Information ,
, ' ', Proof of Identity information,
, ' ',
Informed Consent Form to be included with your application
Declaration for non-child related position to be included with your application,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', Closing date:  9 May 2017, ' ',

, ' ']

Informed Consent Form to be included with your application
Declaration for non-child related position to be included with your application,

title: b'Data Engineer, Data Modelling / Analytics, Exciting New Role, CBD, Flexible Hrs\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',
Are you an experienced Data Engineer, looking for a role you can utilise your expertise and influence the methods of data modelling within an exciting organisation? 
, ' ',
 
, ' ',
  
, ' ',
Looking for a role you can really drive decisions on data tools, with the opportunity to work towards growing your own team?
, ' ',

, ' ',
 
, ' ',
  
, ' ',
If this sounds like you, hit APPLY NOW
, ' ',

, ' ',
 
, ' ',
  
, ' ',
Who they are
, ' ',
An exciting CBD based firm with a focus on rich, 3D visual analytics. Working on an innovative product using cutting-edge technology, this team is rapidly growing both in Sydney and internationally.
, ' ',

, ' ',
The Data Analytics team enables their business to turn data into action. Using big data platforms, data warehousing and business intelligence technology, 3D data, advanced analytics, data science and visualisation, this team supports company efforts to transform how their customers conduct their business, driving efficiency at the forefront of their projects.
, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',
  
, ' ',
Who you are
, ' ',
You are an experienced Data Engineer with a strong passion for data and extensive experience of data tools. You'll be able to recognise business requirements and define and implement the correct tool to remodel data from the Data Warehouse. 
, ' ',

, ' ',
You have previous experience connecting data sources to Amazon Redshift (Fivetran preferred). You will join the team at transformer stage and will work closely with the Data Scientist dissect the middle layer of data and provide data to the BI team.
, ' ',

, ' ',
Once the model is set up, your role will transition to engage with the machine learning team and you will have the opportunity to grow your team. 
, ' ',

, ' ',
This role requires strong technical and communication skills, creativity and attention to detail, and experience managing data science projects from end-to-end (from use case definition to final product delivery).
, ' ',

, ' ',
The Data Engineer will be an innovative forward-thinker who will help lead end-to-end execution of data initiatives, mentor and direct junior data engineers, and contribute toward the end goal of the project. Communication and ability to work in a collaborative team environment are essential.
, ' ',

, ' ',
  
, ' ',
How to get this role
, ' ',
  • 3+ Years' Experience in Database heavy roles
  • Experience connecting data sources to Amazon Redshift (Fivetran preferred)
  • Experience cleansing and preparing large, complex datasets for analysis
  • Excellent communication skills and stakeholder management - ability to present complex information in a concise and compelling manner
  • Expertise applying statistics or machine learning in a professional or other intensive problem-solving environment with large, complex datasets
  • Familiarity with data visualisation tools, like Tableau
  • Self-starter with analytical thinking and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to work autonomously, using own initiative
  • Experience across a range of data tools
  • Degree in related field beneficial
  • Ability to shift priorities effectively as business requirements change
, ' ',
   
, ' ',
To apply, please submit your CV via the portal by clicking the APPLY NOW button below. 
, ' ',
    
, ' ',
Kat Thow
, ' ',
kat@nbridgeit.com
, ' ',
0427 975 476
, ' ',

, ' ',
  
, ' ',
   
, ' ',
(Only applicants who are shortlisted will be contacted)

title: b'Data Analytics Consultant\r\n    '
jd:
[' ',

Join an exciting Data transformation from traditional BI reporting to Advanced Analytics. Looking for open minded and forward thinking individuals.

, ' ',

, ' ',

Role:

, ' ',

Working for a leading Australian Insurer you will be working as part of a newly structured Analytics and Data team. Responsible for data management and insights across all business units you will accountable for assisting the firms transition from traditional BI reporting to Advanced Analytics across the next 2-3 years. As an experienced Analyst or Engineer you’re intensely curious and continually exploring new ideas to understand business trends.

, ' ',

Look for candidates with a strong understanding of Business Intelligence and some exposure to new technologies such as Big Data or Machine Learning. Passion for data science is key!

, ' ',

Responsibilities:

, ' ',
  • Responsible for the entire data pipeline from warehousing to visualisation, our team is trusted to provide insight into all aspects of business performance as well as analysing strategic opportunities.
  • Build relationships with internal customers to understand requirements, identify patterns/behaviours using complex data models and communicate their findings through interactive reports and presentations.
  • Design complex and enriched data models
  • Explore hypotheses/trends by applying statistical analysis methods
  • Share knowledge and coach other team members
  • Develop new dashboards and self-service reporting
  • Maintain periodic performance reports
  • Maintain data warehouse integrity and performance
  • SQL development to design stored procedures, functions, tables, views and triggers
, ' ',

Requirements:

, ' ',
  • Minimum 3-5 Years experience as Data Analyst, BI Analyst or Analytics Analyst/Consultant
  • Strong proficiency with SQL, R, Python and Tableau
  • Experience building statistical analysis and predictive models
  • Tertiary qualification in a quantitative discipline such as economics, statistics or maths.
  • Innovative and open mindset
  • Want and lust to work in Data science is key!
, ' ',

, ' ',

To apply please click apply or call Stefan Kovacevic on 02 8289 3100 for a confidential discussion.

, ' ']

title: b'\r\n          Technical Business Analyst\r\n        '
salary: b'$NEG - All agent client fees disclosed'
jd:
['\n',

 

, '\n',
, '\n',

  • 6 Month Contract Opportunity
  • No Security Clearance Required
  • Excellent rates
  • Sydney CBD
, '\n',
, '\n',

Our client, an Australian media and news corporation, is Seeking an experienced Technical Business Analyst for a 6 month contract located in Sydney CBD.

, '\n',
, '\n',

The primary duties of the Technical Business Analyst will include but not be limited to:

, '\n',
, '\n',

  • Analyse stated business requirements to determine appropriate solutions, in accordance with the clients technology standards;
  • Build up strong business knowledge of key areas of the client's core business;
  • Advise on key solutions to business problems;
  • Manage the analysis components of projects for the Divisions to meet clients' needs and time frames;
  • Analyse and document business requirements in the context of the technical designs as well as the specifications;
  • Evaluate the information gathered through standups, Jira tickets and meetings with the business stakeholders.
, '\n',
, '\n',

To be considered for this Technical Business Analyst contract opportunity you must have:

, '\n',
, '\n',

  • Proven experience in the business analysis;
  • Excellent presentation, communication and technical writing skills;
  • Demonstrated relationship management skills including facilitation, listening and assessment ;
  • Understanding of business process management and business requirements of the customers and translating them to specific software requirements;
  • Strong technical skills coupled with business intelligence and a deep understanding of customer's needs so that they can be transformed into application and operational requirements;
  • Ability to explain simple and complex ideas to all levels of the business;
  • Working knowledge of Content Management applications
, '\n',
, '\n',

To apply for this Technical Business Analyst contract opportunity please forward your resume to Ben Cousins at The Recruitment Hive by clicking the Apply for this Job button, or email your resume to Info at RecruitmentHive.com.au citing Job ID: 1671.

, '\n']

title: b'Microstrategy Developer - Sydney\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',
Another outstanding opportunity presented to you exclusively by the team at Alloc8. 

Working for an organisation with a multi national presence, award winning technology and an environment some can only dream off; this role will see you form part of a crack team of Business Intelligence Consultants delivering BI across the Microstrategy suite.

About You:

As a Consultant / Developer we are looking for a mid - senior level professional who can offer at least 5 experience working with the Microstrategy tools as well as the following:
  • Outstanding Analysis, Business Analysis and Documentation skills.
  • Strong communication, presentation and customer engagement capabilities.
  • RDBMs / Data Warehouse capabilities with proven experience working across enterprise wide Data Warehouse, ETL and Modeling environments.
  • A real passion for delivering insights, reporting and information via Business Intelligence and the Microstrategy suite.
  • Microstrategy certification would be a plus.
  • The ability to work autonomously with a keen eye for detail and the ability to develop and learn quickly.
As part of this company you will be rewarded with on-going training and personal development, exposure to some of the best projects within BI, an opportunity to work with top talent and realistic / fair remuneration.

If you have the Microstrategy skills, are looking for step up in to a quick paced and complex environment then get in touch.

Send your resume to tom.sharp@alloc8.com.au or contact Tom on (02) 9090 2761 today.

Please note that due to the nature of this role only Permanent Residents and Citizens based in Australia can be considered.
, '\n']

title: b'Data Analyst\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

Here at Crawford & Company we are renowned for our Claims Management expertise.  We work on behalf of our insurer clients to provide a world class claims service that delivers in technical excellence.

, ' ',

With increased demand for our services, we are looking for a talented Data Analyst that can work closely with the Executive team to provide insightful analysis to assist in effective decision making to support our growth strategy.

, ' ',

This is a unique opportunity - it's a new role, whereby you will work autonomously and be given the freedom to make the role your own. 

, ' ',

Duties and Responsibilities include:

, ' ',
  • Designing the right methodologies to tackle different business and research objectives
  • Continuously developing  business metadata to support built and adhoc reporting in Tableau

  • Delivering insightful solutions and outputs based on new and existing key data sources, metrics,
  • Providing recommendations on data validity, potential risks or opportunities to the business.
, ' ',

Skills, Experience and Attributes

, ' ',
  • Prior experience in analytics, business analysis or comparable process improvement or financial analysis
  • Proficiency in using business intelligence reporting tools (Tableau & Cognos)
  • Experience working in data warehousing projects
  • Proven ability to manipulate and extract data sources
  • Ability to work with the business, elicit requirements,  write documentation, process analysis etc
  • Excellent communication skills
, ' ',

In return for your expertise, we offer a competitive remuneration package with the opportunity to further develop your career in a market leading, innovative, customer centric organisation.

Applicants must have Australian working rights to be considered.

, ' ',

title: b'\r\n          Senior SAP BW/HANA Consultant\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',

Icon Integration is a growing, energetic and entrepreneurial place to work. We are based in North Sydney and deliver outstanding results to an increasing number of clients across ANZ. We are growing the SAP BI practice and have need of a 'gun' BW/HANA consultant to join the team.

, '\n',

You will be an integral member of the team that provide project delivery expertise and consulting to a variety of corporate clients across a range of industries. 

, '\n',

As a Senior Consultant you will be responsible for:

, '\n',
  • Engaging with key clients, advising on SAP BW/HANA Solution Architecture alongside our BI solutions team.
  • Reviewing customer Solution Design documentation and advising on changes by way of best practice.
  • Define, Analyse and Design the SAP BW/HANA solutions
  • Develop and Configure BW/HANA Backend objects
  • Develop Technical and Functional Specifications
  • Take a senior role on projects such as upgrades, installations and migrations across the SAP BI suite of products
  • Assist in pre-sales bids from a technical perspective; manage customer expectations on time and delivery standards.
  • Engage as a strategic member of the consulting team across a key client sites.
, '\n',

Required skills and experience:

, '\n',
  • Extensive experience using SAP BW and HANA, a true 'master' level of skills.
  • Ability to work closely with senior level executives at customers, building effective relationships.
  • Excellent planning and documentation skills, with a strategic approach to customers needs with Business Intelligence.
  • Consultative approach with the ability to guide, mentor and influence both business and technical minded people.
  • Outstanding communication skills at both a technical and non technical level.
  • Experience in working for a Professional Services or Consulting organisation is highly regarded.
, '\n',

You will work across a variety of projects and be part of high-calibre group of peers who deliver world-class solutions.  You will need excellent communication and client relationship building skills and have at least 8 years SAP experience in a multi user environment, preferably consulting projects.

, '\n',

We enjoy what we do, are energetic and have strong core values.

, '\n',

Send your resume via email in the first instance.

Sorry, no agencies at this time.

, '\n']

title: b'Marketing Manager - Medical Devices\r\n      '
advertiser: Pettit Pharma & Device Search Pty Ltd -
jd:
['Boston Scientific is a leading, global innovator of medical devices and technologies that improve patient lives. Their mission is to improve the quality of patient care and the productivity of health care delivery through the development and advocacy of less-invasive medical devices and procedures.',
, ' \xa0',
, " They are currently looking for someone to join their team in the role of Marketing Manager, Peripheral Interventions.\xa0 This position will support and build relevant brands to achieve the division's strategic goals and objectives and will drive the achievement of business growth through market intelligence, focused market/competitive analysis, product positioning, development of marketing plans, product launches and training in coordination with the sales team nationally.",
, ' \xa0',
, ' This exciting role will be responsible for creating and executing initiatives that continue to build the Boston Scientific brand with ANZ Vascular Surgeons, Interventional Radiologists and other key stakeholders along with Individual Brand Leadership which will involve planning and executing new product launches that set Boston Scientific products apart from the competition and drive profitable growth.\xa0 You will work closely with the Business Unit Manager to complete annual strategic and operating plans and you will identify and/or create new market opportunities across ANZ, spending a high percentage of time in the field with territory managers to understand customer needs and provide clinical guidance.',
, ' \xa0\xa0',
, ' If you have current or recent previous experience in a Senior Product Manager role in the medical device industry and are ready for that next step into marketing management you are encouraged to apply.\xa0 Business, Marketing or related tertiary qualifications are a distinct advantage as are exceptional written and verbal communication skills and advanced knowledge of Excel and PowerPoint.',
, ' \xa0\xa0',
, ' Interested?\xa0 Please apply now or call Elizabeth Pettit on 02.9817.0599 quoting reference number 2121.\xa0 Please note, your details/resume will not be sent anywhere without a formal interview and, if successful, your subsequent prior permission. Personal information provided will be used for recruitment purposes only and be treated in the strictest confidence. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. ']

['\n',
