Business Analyst is required for a major CMS Development Project. This role will be the gateway of translating business needs into requirements as part of the CMS project.

, ' ',

, ' ',

Accountabilities

, ' ',
  • Business requirements analysis to determine suitable solutions
  • Management of the analysis components of projects
  • Documentation of business requirements - technical design and technical specifications context
  • Evaluation of information gathered from JIRA, standups
  • Communication with stakeholders - internal or external
, ' ',

, ' ',

Competencies

, ' ',
  • 7 years+ experience as a Business Analyst
  • Working knowledge of CONTENT MANAGEMENT SYSTEMS
  • Strong technical skills coupled with business intelligence
  • Agile delivery and governance
  • Excellent presentation, communication and technical writing professional experience
  • Business process management, business requirements experience
  • JIRA experience will be highly regarded
  • Documentation of business requirements - technical design and technical specifications
, ' ',

, ' ',

Australian Citizenship is highly regarded for this role + please include a cover letter addressing your suitability for this opportunity.

, ' ',

, ' ',

Please be reminded that Business Analysis experience, coupled with CONTENT Management System project experience are the two core skills for this role.

, ' ',

, ' ',

Please hit APPLY and send a copy of your CV to Ellen - Ellenor.terrado@ajilon.com.au. Thanks.

, ' ',

, ' ',

I will get back to you as soon as possible with more information.

, ' ',

, ' ',

Ajilon is a national professional services company with global capability. Our committed and talented professionals have delivered world class IT and business consulting services across a wide range of industries. As a member of global professional services group Adecco, we offer world-class employment opportunities.

, ' ',

, ' ',

Talented, committed, can-do individuals have always been the cornerstone of this dynamic business. It is expected that the successful candidate will bring energetic dynamics and a strong Security and Network engineering skill set to this organisation.

, ' ',

, ' ',

Ajilon is committed to all forms of workforce diversity and we invite and encourage applications from women and indigenous Australians.

, ' ']

title: b'Master Data Management Solution Architect\r\n    '
jd:
[' ',

Join one of Australia’s largest government organisations as a Master Data Management (MDM) Solution Architect and gain exposure to a significant modernisation project.

, ' ',

The successful Master Data Management (MDM) Solution Architect will be required to develop the Master Data Management (MDM) solution in line with business’s Enterprise, Application, Data Warehouse and Business Intelligence Architectures.

, ' ',

Join one of Australia’s largest government organisations as a Master Data Management (MDM) Solution Architect and gain exposure to a significant modernisation project.

, ' ',

As the successful Master Data Management (MDM) Solution Architect you will require:

, ' ',
  • Extensive Architectural and Solution delivery experience within information, data and analytics, ideally with Microsoft database technology.
  • Minimum 5 years Master Data Management (MDM) Solution Design experience.
  • Demonstrated expertise and experience in end to end MDM Tools and delivery methods.
  • Extensive expertise and experience in the Microsoft Master Data Services (MDS) platform.
  • Relevant tertiary qualifications, preferably in an IT discipline, or equivalent successful experience.
  • A strong understanding and background in application architecture.
, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

To apply please click apply or call Sara Burns on +61 2 8289 3105 for a confidential discussion.

, ' ']

[Benefits,
, ' ',
, ' This is a great opportunity for someone looking to fast-track their career in a client facing, consultative sales role within the financial sector. There is the option to fly to Hong Kong for 8 weeks intensive training where you will learn what it takes to rub shoulders with key decision makers of APACs largest commercial lenders and insurers. Their targets are very achievable for a candidate that is eager to learn and they provide lengthy ramp-up period to get you to the point where you can take advantage of their lucrative commission structure.',
, ' ',
Requirements,
, ' ',
, ' 1-3 years B2B experience',
, ' Solid financial acumen',
, ' Great presentation skills',
, ' High levels of emotional intelligence',
, ' Positive mental attitude',
, ' Ability to manage multiple projects',
, ' ',
, ' ', Role,
, ' ',
, ' This role will involve following up leads that come through via marketing, referrals, account managers therefore there is a level of comfort however you will also be responsible for identifying and prospecting potential clients. Most deals will have a level of packaging involved so you will be responsible for liaising across multiple departments.',
, ' ',
, ' ', Company,
, ' ',
, ' This global organisation are listed on the New York stock exchange and can trace their roots to the 19th century. They are well and truly a global leader and innovator within the financial intelligence space. However, recent attentions have been turned towards the APAC region with Australian market being the primary focus for 2017.',
, ' ',
, ' ',
If you meet the requirements and would like to know more then please apply accordingly.
, ' ',
, ' ',
Only successful applicants will be contacted.
, ' ']

title: b'Senior Tableau Developer/Consultant | Long term contract | Finance\r\n    '
jd:

, ' ',
, ' Billigence Pty Ltd is a specialist in the delivery of market-leading Business Intelligence and CRM solutions. Headquartered in Sydney, Australia and with offices in Prague, USA and Singapore our passion is data and our focus is the delivery of end-to-end solutions via a talented team of skilled professionals. \xa0',
, ' \xa0\xa0',

title: b'Data Analyst and Data Modelling Specialist - Orange\r\n    '
jd:
['Are you looking for a challenging role in the Data Analytics and Information Modelling space and\xa0keen to work for an organisation that’s aim is to deliver innovative and effective services to the community? If so, please read on!',
, ' ',
, ' Our high-profile healthcare\xa0client based in Orange, is urgently seeking an experienced Data Analytics and Information Modelling specialists who has worked in large scale data driven project environments. The project you will be working on is directly related to healthcare data reporting and management. You will need great communication skills and the ability to deal with all levels of a dispersed organisation including technical and non-technical staff, director level and hands on operational staff.',
, ' ',
, ' The key skills required to be successful in this role will be: ',
  • Strong Data Analytics and/ or Data Modelling background with ideally (but not mandatory) some experience working in large scale Healthcare related environments.
  • Strong experience within Business Intelligence and technologies such as SharePoint 2016, PowerBI, SQL, SSAS (Analysis Services) and Azure
  • Strong knowledge and experience in Information Architecture, Data Modelling/ Quality and Data Mart Models
  • Experience developing and implementing governance policies, standards and processes.
  • Experience working with a variety of methodologies such as Agile
  • Experience with testing
  • The ability to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical staff and great stakeholder management skills.
, ' If you are up for the challenge and are available to work in either Orange\xa0at short notice for a contract to 30th of June, please don’t hesitate to get in contact as the client will interview ASAP. ',

If you are interested in having a confidential discussion about this role, please click the link provided and send your word version resume to tony.twohill@2xmtechnology.com.au

, ' ']

title: b'Senior Project Manager\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',


Leading superannuation organisation building brand new data management environment including the building of a new data warehouse. They are looking for a Senior Project Manager to work with a vendor and internal resources to build the data warehouse, migrate product date and possibly implement business intelligence capabilities. You will own the delivery responsibilities as well as the senior relationships with the business, the PMO Director and the Head of Data, Analytics and Performance.

To be a success in this role you will ideally bring:

, '\n',
  • 7-10 years experience in Project Management with a data focus.
  • Experience delivering projects in an Agile environment desirable.
  • Superannuation experience with corporate super preferred but not essential.
  • Significant data warehousing/data management/business intelligence solution delivery absolutely critical.
  • Very confident, senior stakeholder engagement capabilities.
  • Able to juggle a number of co-dependent deliverables across multiple projects.
  • Sounds project financial management skills for medium size projects.
  • Ability to develop strong, dependable, realistic project plans to execute against.
  • A "lead from the front" manager with a willingness to roll your sleeves up.
  • A positive, can-do Project Manager who builds great teams.
, '\n',


This is a contract position with a daily rate c.$900-1000 per day.


, '\n',

For further information on this role or to confidentially apply, please contact Mark Wood on 02 8227 9200 or apply directly via the Apply for this job button. Only WORD FORMAT resumes will be accepted.

, '\n']

title: b'National Key Account Manager \xe2\x80\x93 O.P.I\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

Coty is a global leader within the beauty industry and its unrivalled portfolio includes some of the most coveted brands in the categories of Fragrances, Colour Cosmetics and Skin & Body Care including adidas, Balenciaga, Bottega Veneta, Bourjois, Calvin Klein, Chloé, Covergirl, Davidoff, Marc Jacobs, Maxfactor, Miu Miu, O.P.I, philosophy, Playboy, Rimmel, Sally Hansen, Clairol Nice 'n' Easy, Wella and many more.

Reporting to the Commercial Director - O.P.I, this role will see you become the leader of assigned key accounts and for the delivery of sales objectives and the development of core strategies to achieve sustainable growth for both Coty and your accounts.

, '\n',

Key responsibilities include:

, '\n',
  • Responsible for developing and maintaining strategic business relationships with major national retail accounts to promote brand awareness and maximise sales
  • Achieve and exceed assigned sales targets, KPI's, budgets and business goals
  • Manage the implementation of sales and promotional plans at store level
  • Work closely with the merchandisers to ensure alignment and effective execution of sales and promotional plans in stores
  • Develop and maintain good working relationships with the Commercial team to promote brand success in the market
  • Gather and evaluate business intelligence and monitor competitor activity
  • Analyse sales performance and promotional effectiveness of assigned accounts by regularly reviewing and reporting on sales performance, sales forecasts and market trends
  • Understand, develop and implement the key brand messages and marketing strategies.
  • Manage the sales component of Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP) to deliver key business objectives
  • Develop key account annual sales plans to feed into the Coty Professional Beauty Australia annual business planning and quarterly review process
  • Manage administrative duties efficiently and effectively
, '\n',

The successful candidate will have the following:

, '\n',
  • 4 + years' experience as National Key Account Manager within retail department stores, preferably managing Myer &/or David Jones.
  • Excellent computer skills in MS Office including Excel & Power point skills at an intermediate to advanced level
  • A background in beauty products will be highly regarded
  • Relevant tertiary qualifications in Sales/Marketing or a related discipline
, '\n',

Further to this you will be able to demonstrate the following qualities:

, '\n',
  • High level interpersonal skills with ability to work collaboratively with sales and other functional teams
  • Excellent presentation and strong communication skills.
  • Strong analytical, thinking and problem solving skills
  • High level ability to set priorities and manage competing demands
, '\n',

This is an amazing opportunity to join a growing global organisation with an innovative fast paced culture. In return, we offer an attractive remuneration package plus generous product allowance and a successful team-focused environment which encapsulates our values below.

, '\n',

Coty Values

, '\n',

Own it. Drive it I'm accountable, relentless and tenacious

, '\n',

Live beauty; breathe beauty I love beauty, know beauty and want to reinvent beauty for my consumers

, '\n',

Think like a start-up I'll beat the big guys by acting fast with new ideas executed superbly

, '\n',

Be brave & go beyond I go the extra mile, because targets are there to be beaten

, '\n',

Win for the team Coty is my work family and a win is only a win if it is for the entire team

, '\n',

Please note only short-listed candidates will be contacted.

, '\n']

title: b'Hadoop Big Data Platform Consultant / Engineer\r\n      '
salary: b'Above market rates are assured huge bonus & shares'
jd:
['Datasource Services has extensive, international experience placing skilled candidates within Business Intelligence, Data Warehouse and Data Science. Our network spans across Australia and New Zealand with a wide range of clients ranging from tier ones to start-ups. People and Data are at the heart of everything we do! Join the Datasource community today at\xa0www.datasourceservices.com.au\xa0',
, ' \xa0',
, ' We have a brand new requirement on the books to join a global Big Data and Data Science Consultancy who are working on some of the most cutting edge projects in Australia and across the globe. This role is for a high level Technical Engineer who has notable experience working on enterprise Hadoop / Big Data Platforms as an Engineer.\xa0',
, ' \xa0',
, ' ', The role: ,
, ' ',
  • Deliver a wide range of complex data engineering requirements as per customer requirements. Enterprise client list.
  • Engage with customers across a range of different industries to understand requirements and deliver technical solutions.
  • Development of POC and mock up data solutions for customers, assisting pre-sales teams with presentations.
  • Analysis of customer data, building effective data pipelines using Spark, HIVE, Kafka etc.
  • Build and support Hadoop data sets for a team of highly skilled Data Scientists.
  • Set up and implement Hadoop HDFS platforms for a range of customers, reviewing areas such as security, operating systems, integration with existing architecture etc.
  • Complex data streaming and data processing in Apache Spark & Kaftka.
  • Process improvement across the current software engineering methodologies.
  • Set up, run, install, implement and support enterprise side Hadoop clusters (200-300 nodes).
  • Maintain effective communication and documentation.
  • Work in an Agile development environment.
, ' ',
, ' ', Required skills and experience:,
, ' \xa0',
, ' ',
  • Outstanding programming skills across a range of languages such as Java (essential) and Scala, R, Pig, Python. Go etc.
  • Commercial experience of unstructured data sets and HDFS platforms, Hadoop, HBase, Cassandra etc.
  • Strong implementation skills, with the ability to understand complex installation issues such as Security, Cloud Install, CPU usage, Operating systems etc.
  • Any experience with Apache Spark or Kafka is highly regarded.
  • Excellent problem solving skills, structured and analytical approach.
  • Experience with visualizing large data sets is highly desirable.
  • Customer facing role, so experience in Consulting is highly beneficial but not essential.
  • Ability to guide and mentor customers through enterprise Hadoop implementations.
  • Outstanding communication skills are required.
, " This role requires a unique blend of high level communication and deep, broad technical knowledge. A true understanding for Data Warehouse, MPP and HDFS Architecture is required, alongside an appreciation for Infrastructure, Security and Cloud solutions. You will be rewarded with an award winning, culture, global thought leadership and exposure to Australia's largest Big Data programs. ", APPLY NOW!
,
, ' ', Please note:, '\xa0Due to the nature if this role, we can only accept applications from Australian Permanent Residents or Citizens, currently residing in Australia. ']

title: b'Business Insights Analyst | Greenfields Role\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

THE ROLE

, '\n',
  • Be instrumental  in the development of business intelligence solutions and analytics capabilities for a specialised line of business  (consumer and corporate) assisting the business to formulate strategic vision and direction
  • Work closely with local senior managers and the internal actuarial team as you work toward automating and refining business reporting to ensure that it is a meaningful & reliable business planning tool
  • Ongoing review of portfolios and data looking for patterns and trends to provide early warning, sales and pricing commentary  around fact based cause and effect analysis
  • Foster resilient & positive relationships both internally and externally to improve business profitability through the use of analytics
  • Based on your analysis of data highlight exceptions, trends and variances in a user friendly and meaningful manner
  • Lead and deliver on projects
  • Be the key driver enabling business units to better understand and manage their businesses leveraging off business intelligence tools
, '\n',

THE COMPANY

, '\n',
  • Internationally renowned general insurer and reinsurer who operate extensively in multiple insurance lines across multiple international hubs
  • Excellent work culture – they truly recognise and reward their staff
, '\n',

YOU

, '\n',
  • A background in business analysis or analytics. You are probably  2- 5 years into your career and would relish the idea of being able to set up a new analytics function and being able to make a real difference to the business. You're ready for more and want to be in a role where you can make a difference
  • Prior experience in general insurance would be ideal but is not essential. Candidates from analytics, actuarial and business intelligence backgrounds are welcome to apply.
  • A problem solver who thinks outside the square and loves to provide insight gained from data
, '\n',

 

, '\n',

T- Glenys Chidzero on 02 92626999 or 0408121511
E- gchidzero@alexandergrey.com.au

, '\n']

title: b'Mid Level DevOps - Windows, AWS & PowerShell\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

FIRESOFT Consulting is a multi-award winning consultancy having been recognised across Australia for excellence in small business and one of Australia's coolest places to work. Our people love working here and that passion really shines through when working with you. We're obsessed with shaking things up a bit to make working with a consultancy enjoyable, valuable and specifically tailored to YOU! We understand it can be stressful and challenging while trying to find a new job or build a team so we're here to be open, honest and transparent through the process; to educate you and support you as much as possible to ensure you're kicking goals - whatever those may be!

, '\n',

Our team plays in the following verticals (contract and permanent) : DevOps | Business Intelligence | Big Data | Analytics | Infrastructure | Engineering | Digital; iOS, Android, Front End Development, Back End Development, UX, UI, Research | Project Management | Change Management | AdOps | Service Delivery |

, '\n',

Get Social with Us! | firesoft.com.au | facebook.com/firesoftconsulting |twitter.com/Firesoft_IT | linkedin.com/company/2596181/

, '\n',

, '\n',
  • Global Software Company
  • Opportunity to improve a DevOps environment
  • Good salary and bonus structure
, '\n',


A newly created opportunity has arisen from a software organisation that is improving and scaling its environment. You will be expected to support the technology backbone but create exciting new concepts using the latest and greatest products.

We are looking for mid level candidates with a solid infrastructure and devops style background that will hit the ground running and will not require immediate training from day one. That said, this Company will provide external training from leading vendors where necessary to ensure you are ahead of the game.

, '\n',

Role:

, '\n',
  • Automate and deploy
  • Senior technical support and providing pro-active ideas, looking at continuous improvement and delivery.
  • Maintain, administrate, and troubleshoot server & cloud technologies.
  • Take responsibility for the installation and configuration of the Cloud Platform and its related components and integration points
  • Participate technically in Local and Global initiatives
, '\n',


Technology and Experience:

, '\n',
  • Solid experience support and administrating Microsoft Windows 2008R2 and 2012 (essential)
  • PowerShell development (essential)
  • AWS - Troubleshooting and 3rd Level Support in (CloudFormation, EC2, S3, etc) (Essential)
  • Build and continuous delivery tools like TeamCity and Octopus Deploy (highly sought after)
  • Understanding of managing Load Balancing
, '\n']

title: b'Continuous Improvement and Innovation Lead\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

Our Infrastructure Services division operates three business units: Road Services; Infrastructure Projects and Utilities. As we continue our evolution of growth and innovation, the best people are critical to our success in supporting our customers and catering to market demands.

, '\n',

Downer is currently recruiting a Continuous Improvement & Innovation Lead to be based in Gladesville

, '\n',

Reporting to the Operations Manager Support Services – Network Construction and Maintenance, the role is accountable for;

, '\n',
  • Implementing and embedding lean principles and methodologies with in the business.
  • Lead initiatives and develop a network of Lean practitioners and business units that will drive and deliver optimal business and customer outcomes.
  • Create a sustainable and profitable business by implementing Lean principles and methodologies that eliminate; waste, rework, non-value add and creates an environment of innovation that enables optimal outcomes and competitive advantage.
, '\n',

ABOUT YOU

, '\n',
  • Certified in Lean, Lean Six Sigma with a good understanding of the methodology
  • Demonstrated experience in managing and implementing Lean, Lean Six Sigma at least 3 years
  • Proven experience to lead the implementation of Lean in the Network Construction Business and with our construction partners
  • Ability to create and drive a culture that thrives on innovation and recognises the achievements through measurement
  • Capability to establish and maintain the required reporting metrics and measures to establish baselines and improvements
  • Contribute to the improvement and implementation of tools and systems that support Lean
  • Active engagement in process and business improvement to improve cost efficiency, maximise gain share & margin as well as optimising performance
  • Capability to build a network of Lean practitioners across all business units
  • Working knowledge of advanced Business Intelligence (BI) Tools
  • Minimum of 3 years' experience in managing and driving change
, '\n',

WHAT WE OFFER

, '\n',
  • The unique opportunity to work in an organisation where the safety of our people and the environment is at the forefront of all that we do
  • An opportunity to work for a major ASX listed company.
  • The ability to build your professional career in a multi-disciplined business environment.
  • A supportive and dynamic team
, '\n',

HOW TO APPLY

, '\n',

To apply, please click the apply now button.

, '\n',

For more information contact: Soumya Venkataramanan

, '\n',

E: soumya.venkataramanan@downergroup.com (Please note that applications will not be accepted via email).

, '\n',

, '\n']

['\n',


, '\n',
 
,
BI Analyst/Developer
, '\n',
  • Top 200 ASX-listed Company
  • 5 years MSBI Experience Required
  • Long Term Opportunities Available
, '\n',
The Role
You will be joining an existing BI team within a greenfield site, contributing to the growth of their new Information & Data Analytics Hub.

Responsibilities will include, but are not limited to, report migration, cube development, dashboard development, report maintenance and enhancement as well as consolidation and bringing upcoming products to market.

With a large degree of work in the pipeline and the need for quality resources, there is a strong likelihood that there will be extensions beyond the initial 6 month period or conversion to permanent employment.

The Person
You will be a vastly experience Business Intelligence professional with exposure across a variety of different BI and Data Visualisation tools.

In addition your strong technical competency you will have a great business understanding with the ability to get in under the covers and understand the scripts in context with the business requirements. Strong interpersonal and stakeholder management skills are paramount.

Experience/Skills Required
  • Minimum 5 years development experience across the full Microsoft BI suite - SSIS/RS/AS
  • Skills across Power BI and/or Tableau
  • Open communicator and strong problem solving skills
  • Proven stakeholder management capability
  • Highly motivated and strong drive to succeed
  • Leasing background would be ideal but not necessary

This is a fantastic opportunity with a top 200 ASX-listed company which has a terrific professional development and career progression opportunities. Despite it being an initial 6 month contract, these guys have a need for someone in the long term, having recently converted a contract to a permanent hire after 4 months and extended 2 more.

If this sounds like an opportunity for you, please apply below. If you have any further questions, feel free to get in touch with Nick Wilkinson via nick.wilkinson@hcmaustralia.com.au or 02 8088 1814.
, '\n',
 
,
Nick Wilkinson
02 8088 1814
Email: Please click the 'Apply Now' button below.
,

]

,
Qlikview Developer
, '\n',
  • Contract Opportunity - Competitive Rates
  • Minimum 4 years Qlikview Experience
  • Strong Qliksense & NPrinting Capability
, '\n',
The Role
You will be responsible for working directly with Business Analysts and the Project Team to develop and deliver Business Intelligence solutions which will satisfy the business goals and strategic direction of the organisation.

Additionally, you will be responsible for maintaining and enhancing existing Qlikview applications as well as any other support-related activities.

The Person
You will be a highly experienced Qlikview Consultant/Developer who has a track record of success, delivering end to end Qlikview solutions for a variety of clients.

In addition to strong technical competency, you will have a good appreciation of business-focused stakeholders and the ability to understand requirements from their perspective.

Experience/Skills Required
  • Minimum 4 years Qlikview Dashboard development experience
  • Strong capability across Qliksense & NPrinting
  • Experience across Qlikview administration and support
  • Expertise in data modelling and relational databases
  • Open communication and strong problem solving skills
  • Relevant tertiary qualifications

If this sounds like something you would be interested in, please apply below. If you have any further questions, don't hesitate in getting in touch with Nick Wilkinson via nick.wilkinson@hcmaustralia.com.au or 02 8088 1814.

title: b'Principal Consultant - Analytics\r\n    '
jd:
['\n',

Unisys is a leading provider of high-value services, software and solutions that deliver sustainable value to many of the world's largest companies and governmental agencies. Unisys provides secure, consultative, industry-specific solutions and services for government, financial services, travel and transportation, life sciences and commercial organizations. With Unisys as a partner, clients can secure the trust of their own customers – and deliver today on the demands of tomorrow. 

, '\n',

Within Unisys Enterprise Services, a Principal in the Analytics Services practice brings significant business domain and/or technical depth in a specific area. Principals take responsibility to deliver client impact applying their distinct area of domain and technical mastery. Principals bring advanced expertise in topics including consumer insight, digital marketing, fraud and risk, cybersecurity or operations data science. Principals are hands-on player/coaches who create client deliverables and coach team members in performing their roles. Principals understand the regulatory context and compliance mandates for their domain areas and geographic regions. Principals bring a broad network of relationships and actively contribute to practice development. Principals play a lead role within a practice synthesizing Unisys points of view that build our brand and contribute practically to implementation methodology.

, '\n',

Responsibilities:

, '\n',
  • Take responsibility for achieving client impact by providing specialized, deep, and differentiated expertise. Serve as a senior expert building trust with clients.
  • Create and deepen client relationships particularly within a principal's area of domain expertise.
  • Actively manage and mitigate implementation risk. Develop an intuitive sense of how to deliver complex, multi-stakeholder projects in highly regulated industries. Navigate client organizations to ensure support, transparency, and results.
  • Hands-on leadership creating Analytics deliverables including implementing data integration and quality, selecting and configuring algorithms, translating models into code, quality assurance, and guiding business implementation of model results, application, or business processes.
  • Understand practice level financial performance drivers and contribute to achieving results.
  • Actively seek to position Unisys for follow-on engagements and continued, deepened client relationships.
  • Cultivate relationships across the full spectrum of Unisys and Enterprise Services capabilities and offerings, and proactively build partnership and joint client teams.
  • Take lead generating new ideas and lead development of thought leadership offering a Unisys point of view on key industry and technical topics.
  • Develop high quality and resuable IP and sales materials which are available in appropriate repositories.
  • Constantly stay current in a principal's designated area of expertise.
  • Assist in the recruitment, development, and mentoring of new associates in the Analytics practice.
  • Maintain appropriate senior-level professional certifications such as CPA, CFA, CISSP, or similar.
, '\n',

Skills, Experience & Qualifications

, '\n',
  • 7-15 years as an expert contributor.
  • Strong understanding of the Analytics Services business context and market trends, as well as how to communicate these offerings to clients – all levels of the organization from developers to ITDMs:
    • Significant experience delivering analytics and/or business intelligence projects
    • Prefer hands-on experience with ETL, database management, BI dashboards, or application development.
    • Data warehouse strategy implementation experience
    • Data governance and master data management practices
    • Machine learning and predictive analytics algorithm understanding implementing using analytics tools such as Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Kafka
    • Cloud based Analytics design & delivery including - IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS
    • Digital engagement solutions – mobile, social and web channel integration
    • Experience with visualization tools such as Tableau, Zoomdata, PowerBI, Qlik, etc.
  • Significant experience in Analytics Consulting, BI/ Visualization Governance & Strategy, Information Management Roadmap, Data Platforming, Alliance & eco-system management, Large scale Program Governance Experienced Program or Project leadership skills leading technical teams with large implementation projects
  • Evidence of thought leadership such as peer-reviewed papers, articles in industry journal, patents, or speaking engagements.
  • Many directors bring academic expertise including experience on faculties of prominent universities.
  • Technical strength centered on but not limited to Information Strategy, Data Governance & Architecture, Big Data &  Analytics, Information Lifecycle Management, Business intelligence, and Performance Management.
  • Understanding of Agile Custom Analytics modeling and support across multiple industries.
  • Broad experience in data modeling and implementation projects utilizing a global delivery model.
  • Experience working with Sales and Pre-Sales Solution Architecture teams.
  • Master's degree in a quantitative field, MBA from a leading school, or PhD strongly preferred. Many leaders within the Analytics practice hold PhDs in quantitative subjects.
  • Security clearances are welcome and encouraged.
, '\n',

The Analytics practice systematically targets specific domain expertise and geographic locations. The practice seeks people with experience from leading organizations in travel, transportation, and logistics; life sciences and health care; public sector including military, intelligence community, and law enforcement; retail; banking, insurance, and wealth management. We actively develop expertise in Spark, AWS, Azure and open source machine learning packages

, '\n']

title: b'Demand Analysis Manager- Rail\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',
Our client are a state government organisation within the Transport sector who have identified an urgent requirement for a Demand Analysis Manager to work on a long term contract basis Sydney's most iconic infrastructure projects.
, '\n',
 
, '\n',
The primary purpose of the role is to provide expert advice, analysis and research in relation to demand forecasting as a key input to a variety of Sydney Metro activities and functions, and to support informed decision making on the development and delivery of the Sydney Metro projects.
, '\n',
 
, '\n',
The successful candidate will support in the analysis, management and coordination of all demand modelling activities across Sydney Metro, and in reviewing the accuracy of all inputs, assumptions and outputs of demand modelling, as well as ensuring that the modelling requirements of various stakeholders are gathered, documented and completed in due time to inform customer and product outcomes.
, '\n',
 
, '\n',
Key Responsibilities: 
, '\n',
 
, '\n',
  • To support in the interpretation, analysis, and inputs provision into the demand modelling activities
  • The candidate will also assist in the project management of the demand modelling work for all current and future projects.
  • The demand modelling will be undertaken using several strategic and project specific transport modelling tools owned by TfNSW.
  • The demand modelling outputs will support/inform various functions across Sydney metro and TfNSW including stations design, operational plans, transport integration,  customer products and solutions among others

 

Key Requirments: 

  • Strong project management experience and ability to manage cross function projects & stakeholders
  • Strong analytical skills and ability to present outcomes to a broad range of audience, technical & non-technical
  • Strong experience in demand forecasting, modelling and traffic analysis. While it is an added value, demand forecasting doesn’t have to be in transport
  • Knowledge of business intelligence tools and data visualization
  • Transport experience is a plus
For further information please contact Rory Todd on 0428 026 703 or email rory.todd@cgcrecruitment.com.au
, '\n']

Send your CV in for an immediate interview

title: b'Junior Media Role: Inventory & Pricing Co-ordinator\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

MCN is Australia's leading multi-screen media network, responsible for the advertising interests of Foxtel, Ten Network and FOX SPORTS. We deliver extraordinary and highly innovative insight-driven campaigns for our advertisers that are more targeted, more accountable and more powerful than ever before. Our extensive range of integrated advertising platforms allows our advertisers to reach audiences across 71 Foxtel channels, 15 Network Ten Channels, 117 Digital Publishers and Qantas' Inflight Entertainment Network - a collection of THE most watched channels in Australia! 

, ' ',

A Bit About Us

, ' ',

MCN's "Data Solutions" department is responsible for managing all areas of data operation, including driving MCN's data innovation initiatives, responding to advertiser brief responses, supporting sales activities, providing business intelligence & inventory management recommendations to senior management, forecasting ratings across all commercial broadcast channels and conducting yield management and pricing analysis.

, ' ',

More About You

, ' ',

MCN currently has a vacancy for a "Inventory & Pricing Coordinator" within the Data Solutions Department, based in the Sydney. We are looking for a career driven analytically minded individual who has a genuine interest in media & advertising and enjoys working in a fast-paced environment. You will be responsible for forecasting commercial TV ratings and managing pricing across 86 Foxtel & 15 Network Ten commercial broadcast stations.

, ' ',

This exciting opportunity is perfect for someone with a strong technical understanding of Television & Media Buying, Television Ratings & Price Modelling. While relevant experience is not mandatory, the role would suit someone with prior media experience, who understands the principals of buying advertising media. You must be confident when communicating with internal and external stake holders. You must enjoy working with data, numbers & systems. Experience with Excel is mandatory.

, ' ',

This is a fantastic opportunity to put your organisational skills, problem solving ability and attention to detail to good use!

, ' ',
  • Are you familiar with Television &/or digital audience trading?
  • Have you worked with Media Platforms before?
  • Are you familiar with TV and/or digital audience measurement?
  • Fantastic opportunity to work across Australia's most viewed TV Networks
  • Join the leading company in Media and Advertising!
, ' ',

What You'll Get Up to

, ' ',
  • Work closely with Sales, Partnerships & the Contracts & Trading teams on delivering accurate ratings predictions across thousands of TV commercial breaks.
  • Work collaboratively with key internal stakeholders to ensure that sales expectations are aligned
  • Monitor & adjust commercial television pricing in accordance with stakeholder guidelines
  • Provide data solutions & innovative forecasting methods
, ' ',
, ' ']

title: b'Senior Case Officer\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

Company

, ' ',

In a world of "no", Pepper was founded on saying "yes".  Since 2001 Pepper has transformed itself from a small company in Sydney to a 1700-strong force across Australia, Asia and Europe.   We offer a unique, diversified, global portfolio of financial services.  We provide specialist experience in our core disciplines of Lending, Advisory and Asset Servicing across the residential and commercial property sectors – as well as in consumer, auto and equipment finance.  We are one of the top 500 companies listed on the ASX (ASX:PEP).  With the continued growth of our brand and the ongoing expansion of our business, we are currently seeking an experienced Senior Case Officer to join our growing workforce. 

, ' ',

Pepper Australia is a one of Australia's leading non-bank lenders currently operating in the financial service space. We pride ourselves on our exceptional first class service and with that in mind we are currently recruiting for someone who is driven with a passion for customer service to join our team.

, ' ',

The purpose of the Senior Case Officer is to assist the Customer Resolutions Manager through the handling of complex matters whilst assisting in providing an insightful feedback program to the operations departments.

, ' ',

Responsibilities for the role include but are not limited to;

, ' ',

Complaint Management

, ' ',
  • Assist with the initial and ongoing maintenance of the program
  • To assist other teams and leaders in training and understanding of the program in an ongoing basis
  • Handle all complex complaints (level 3 matters)
  • Provide a layer of review for all legal matters
, ' ',

Business Intelligence & Continuous process improvement

, ' ',
  • Complete all required reporting for the team and management 
  • Assist with the development of new reports that match the needs of internal and external stakeholders
  • Assist with the development and implementation of the program 
  • Assist with ongoing monitoring of the program, review and make suggestions for improvements to the program. 
  • Conduct monthly reviews of existing processes and areas identified through complaint management looking for process improvement.  
  • Conduct feedback sessions with teams  and leaders with the aim of providing in-depth insights 
, ' ',

Risk & Compliance

, ' ',
  • Assist with the handling of risks identified during the course of complaints
  • Carry out sampling associated with risks
  • Assist with the development of a risk register and reporting system 
  • Assist with the handling of matters referred through the CMP process.
, ' ',

Customer Service

, ' ',
  • Ensure that all internal and external relationships are maintained at high standards whilst exhibiting a high level of customer service.
, ' ',

To be successful in the role you will have;

, ' ',
  • Knowledge of relevant legislative and industry requirements. e.g. NCCP & Privacy Act
  • Dispute Resolution experience.
  • Experience in dealing with EDR agencies.
  • Credit Experience will be highly regarded
, ' ',

If you are seeking a challenging role with a key focus on the customer than this is the perfect role for you. As a rapidly growing business the future opportunities are endless. Take the first step and apply now today.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',
, ' ']

['\n',

Pacific Magazines is transforming from a magazines company to a content powerhouse. We have gone from publishing in months with print, to publishing in moments across print, social, digital, apps and events.

, '\n',

We’re on the hunt for an experienced sales analyst to join a fast paced media sales team. Based in Eveleigh and reporting to the Commercial Operations Director, you will be responsible for:

, '\n',
  • Collection, analysis, evaluation and reporting of advertising revenue data in order to increase sales performance and productivity
  • Evaluation of sales performance in light of sales goals and identify areas of opportunity and risk
  • Collection and analysis of trends and data providing key insights and recommendations
  • Coordination and support of sales forecasting, pipeline management and business planning
  • Providing ad-hoc reporting and analysis at territory, customer, product and platform level
  • Leading the sales incentive compensation administration in accordance with incentive program policies and procedures
  • Provide support to projects and other requests issued by commercial leadership team
  • Be pro-active in the identification, qualification and implementation of process improvement opportunities in the business
, '\n',

To be successful in this role you will have:

, '\n',
  • Prior experience working in a sales and/or media environment
  • Highly developed written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong attention to detail
  • The ability to interpret, manipulate and visualise complex data
  • Sound knowledge of Salesforce
  • Experience with business intelligence tools such as microstrategy would be viewed favourably
  • Strong stakeholder management skills and the ability to collaborate, influence, negotiate and think innovatively to deliver outcomes
  • Relevant tertiary qualifications
, '\n',

This is an exciting, critical role in our business that will suit someone with an analytical mindset and the drive to succeed. If you are ready for the opportunity apply now via the link below:

, '\n',

Visit Seven West Media’s corporate website: http://sevenwestmedia.com.au/careers to apply online. Applications close Tuesday 2nd May, 2017.

At Pacific Magazines our mantra is ‘we build the brands people love’ and we pride ourselves on being Australia’s most innovative publisher across mass women’s, men’s, lifestyle and youth titles, and associated products in the print and digital spaces. Be part of our journey.

title: b'\r\n          Head of Financial Planning and Analysis\r\n        '
jd:
[' ',

, ' ',

About the business and the role

, ' ',

Our organisation employees over 5000 people across a number of business units and finance is centralised.  This critical role will lead a team of 15-20 FP&A professionals and is one of the key direct reports to the CFO.  

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

Job tasks and responsibilities

, ' ',

The role will be responsible for the strategy, planning, analysis and reporting for the overall business and will have accountability for the production of budgets, forecasts and financial reports for the group executives and the board.  In addition business intelligence will form a key portion of the responsibilities for the role and the implementation of a new BI system is imminent.  The organisation has an ongoing focus on continuous improvement and the review and further development of all FP&A processes will be vital.

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

Skills and experience

, ' ',

The successful candidate will have extensive leadership experience in a complex business from a finance and FP&A perspective.  CA or CPA (or equivalent) qualification is expected to go with a strong academic set of qualifications.

, ' ',

Highly developed analytical skills are essential and will be enhanced by top notch stakeholder engagement and communications skills. 

, ' ',

, ' ']

title: b'Senior Talent Acquisition Manager\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

We wouldn’t be where we are today without the collective skill, dedication and sheer brilliance of our people. People who take ownership and accountability for their work, who want to do things smarter and better – and deliver the best outcomes for our clients.

, ' ',

Due to continued growth we are seeking experienced recruiters to be based onsite working closely with our clients.

, ' ',

Your specialist experience finding and recruiting top talent will be highly regarded as will your demonstrated ability to deliver proactive sourcing strategies in a talent short environment, including headhunting, market mapping and leveraging social media. Possessing strong candidate management skills and the expertise to leverage new sourcing channels and technology you are someone who aspires to deliver quality, innovative and smart solutions to your hiring managers.

, ' ',

This is a great opportunity for a Recruitment professional looking to further develop their career in an internal RPO environment. You will be working closely with an experienced team in a fast-paced environment, with an abundance of variety in your role including contribution to the delivery of strategic recruitment projects, talent pipelining and business intelligence research.

, ' ',

 

, ' ']

title: b'Snr MS Power BI Consultant - upto $125,000\r\n    '
advertiser: Absolute IT - 98.9%* of placed candidate will recommend us to others -
jd:
[' ',
  • Project related work
  • Auckland City 
  • Salary Package $125,000
, ' ', , '\xa0',
, ' We are urgently seeking a solid and senior level, technically minded Business Intelligence specialist to join our client and act as a major point of contact between the organisation and its multiple stakeholders within the Data Warehouse / Business Intelligence domain. The specialist area essentially being MS Power BI.',
, ' \xa0',
, ' Within these roles, you will work very closely with an existing team of BI / DW specialists to deliver high level solutions and implementations across a number of Central Auckland client sites using your current expertise with ETL, analysis and Reporting tools. ',
, ' \xa0',
, ' We are extremely keen to commence the interview process immediately and will happily bring the successful applicant aboard either immediately or within a week if required. ',
, ' \xa0',
, ' ', The essential skill base that we see includes:, ' ',
, ' ',
  • Business Intelligence - 8yrs as a minimum commercially and developing BI / ETL solutions and applications.
  • Power BI - a minimum of 4yrs experience to include very recent project work. This should be prominent within your CV.
  • DW ETL Tools - Microsoft SSIS (Essential).
  • Methodologies - exposure to Kimball is essential for high level Star Schema Designs and Dimensional Modelling.
, ' Please do not hesitate to forward your details via this website - we really are keen to commence the interview procedure immediately. ',
, ' \xa0',
, ' ** It is essential that you are legally entitled to work within NZ at the time you apply. (New Zealand Work Permit, Resident and Citizens or Australian Residents / Citizens). ',
, ' \xa0',
, ' For further information, please call Carl Robinson at absoluteIT on 09 302 7024, or apply directly right now by clicking below. ',
, ' \xa0',
, ' NOTE for Overseas Enquiries and Non NZ Residents: Whereas we welcome international enquiries, only applicants that are legally entitled to work in New Zealand and can make themselves available for interviews in New Zealand will be considered for advertised positions. Others may not necessarily be responded to.',
, ' ']

jd:

Your chance is now available to head over to the beautiful region of Port Macquarie on an initial 9 month engagement to work on an exciting project with a huge utilities organisation.

  • Working with your internal customers to provide ad Hoch
  • Daily, Weekly and Monthly reports.  
  • Development and enhancement of all reporting

Skill Requirements:

, ' ',
  • Must have experience in at least one of these for reports
  • VB6
  • Proficient with Microsoft Sway
  • Proficient with Microsoft O365
  • Proficient with Microsoft Business Intelligence
  • Experience with COGNOS Dashboard
  • Experience with corporate reporting 
, ' ',

This is a fantastic opportunity to build your reporting skills in a business intelligence environment!

title: b'Commercial Reporting Analyst\r\n    '
jd:
["This is a genuine career development opportunity with one of Australia's largest online media publishers where you will constantly learn and improve your knowledge of revenue management. This role is a great launchpad for someone with", 1-2 years experience looking to build a career, ' in the rapidly growing online advertising industry where you will have an opportunity to leave your mark at a company at the forefront of the industry.',
, ' ',
, ' Reporting to the Commercial Manager, you will be responsible for managing a wide range of reporting and analysis functions, providing analytical support to the sales and commercial teams through insightful and timely reporting of business performance. This is a strategic role with an opportunity to influence and work closely with senior members of sales leadership to help drive revenue across our network of online brands.\xa0',
, ' \xa0\xa0',
, ' \xa0\xa0',
, ' ', As the Commercial Reporting Analyst, your key responsibilities will be to:,
, ' ',
  • Prepare weekly sales reports summarising performance by revenue stream, sales team, agency and client.
  • Collate and manage all regular reporting requirements for the companies Agency Group deals, partnering with Group Sales Managers for customised agency reporting to help drive revenue from key agency groups
  • Produce scheduled revenue reports summarising performance to budget for a wide range of products and sites including Nine.com.au, 9Now, Skype and other well-known titles
  • Help support an extensive reporting improvement project being undertaken to upgrade our business intelligence reporting systems and platforms.
  • Assisting with yearly revenue budgeting and weekly forecasting processes
  • Timely completion of pre-billing and margin analysis for Network Performance team clients and publishers
  • Respond to ad-hoc queries /requests as they relate to revenue analysis and commercial queries from varying stakeholders across the business
  • Reconciliation & verification of revenue for quarterly commission calculations for the sales team
  • Work closely with the Business Applications team on continuous improvement activities to streamline and improve reporting systems and processes
, ' ', To be considered for this role, you must demonstrate the following experience, knowledge and behaviours:,
, ' ',
  • Graduate to 2 years experience in a data, business or sales analyst. (Salary dependant on experience)
  • Demonstrated ability in data and revenue analysis, extracting insights and working with or building excel models would be highly regarded
  • Highly proficient in using Microsoft Excel (vlookups, pivot tables)
  • Experience with integrating data from various data sources would be highly regarded but not essential
  • Degree qualified in a numeric discipline. E.g. Accounting, Economics, Business Management
  • Problem-solving abilities with limited information/context
, ' ', Behaviours,
, ' ',
  • You will be ambitious and driven to succeed in a genuinely fast-paced and constantly changing environment
  • Ability to interact and form effective working relationships across multiple functional groups
  • Drive for results, anticipates and overcomes problems and take steps to ensure delivery of high-quality output
  • Ability to juggle multiple priorities and stakeholders
  • Solutions focused in order to solve complex and difficult problems
  • Customer-centric mindset to be the business partner of choice
  • Take pride in your work and be curious - want to understand the broader process/business to improve their ability to perform their role & support our stakeholders.
, ' \xa0',
, ' ', About Us,
, ' ',
, " When it comes to connecting with the passions of Australians, there's no other media company like Nine. As the home of Australia's most trusted and loved brands spanning news, lifestyle, entertainment and sport, we strive to reimagine how Australia is entertained and informed through content each and every day. ",
, ' ',
, ' With investments spanning digital and broadcast, our assets include the Nine Network, Nine.com.au, 9Now, a 50% stake in subscription video-on-demand provider Stan, as well as interests in RateCity, CarAdvice, Pedestrian.tv and ASX-listed financial services company, Yellow Brick Road. ',
, ' ',
, ' Nine also has a long-running strategic relationship with Microsoft, selling their suite of advertising products. Nine - where passion meets imagination + intelligence. ']

title: b'Information Technology - Platform Development Manager\r\n      '
salary: b'Annual Salary, Annual Bonus and great benefits!'
jd:
[' ',

The Star Entertainment Group is a leading owner and operator of integrated resorts and entertainment facilities in Sydney, Brisbane and the Gold Coast. Our Group is experiencing an exciting time of growth and targeted investment across all our properties. Our industry is fast paced, highly competitive and our operations are broad and dynamic. We celebrate the energy of our cities, operating across culturally diverse segments within local and international markets.

, ' ',

The IT division plays a significant role in delivering the technology master plan to the business and is currently preparing to enter an unprecedented phase of change. The technology division has now been structured with specialist areas to be able to achieve these deliverables. We are seeking an energetic and innovative team that can work within these areas to deliver the master plan, and can positively influence the broader group on this journey of change.

, ' ',

A unique opportunity to deliver and innovate IT services and infrastructure

, ' ',

In light of The Star’s strategic direction and growth plans in becoming Australia’s leading integrated resort company, we now have a vacancy for a Platform Development Manager. Our company’s IT model is customer centric and underpinned by a shared services structure with a strong IT governance framework, thus ensuring:

, ' ',
  • Greater business alignment and partnership;
  • Greater innovation, transparency and governance;
  • Scalable delivery model;
  • Service excellence; and
  • Robust, efficient operations
, ' ',

The Platform Development Manager reports to the General Manger Queensland Technology and is responsible for creating a centre of excellence within our Data Warehouse/Business Intelligence platform. Responsible for the requirements, design and build of applications for projects associated with one or more assigned platforms and managing all the development activities related to those platforms, including supply and demand of human resources as well as the full lifecycle management of these systems.

, ' ',

This is a strategic role, that considers the IT development masterplan to ensure the business has the technological mobility that will support future growth of applications that relate to our Hospitality and Property Services line of Business. With a team of specialists reporting to this role strong leadership is required to ensure their ongoing support and development.

, ' ',

Key Responsibilities will include:

, ' ',
  • Manages the cost, time and quality of the team in relation to a project’s budget and outcomes, providing a delivery service to the Project
  • Identification and escalation of resource conflicts, customer demands and support issues
  • Providing estimations for new projects and preparation of project and quality plans
  • Managing application vendors for quality, time and budget as well as roadmap.
  • Manage small to medium project changes, end to end, as required
  • Complies with platform-based standards for programming tools and techniques, advises on their application and ensures compliance.
  • Ensure compliance with IT risk and security processes, policies and controls
  • Experience working with Hospitality systems is advantageous
, ' ',

The successful candidate will be based in Sydney; however, some travel is required for this position.

, ' ',

Come and grow with us

, ' ',

Having necessary qualifications in Information Technology or similar associated degree, you have extensive application development experience and proven success in the delivery of high value corporate portfolios.

, ' ',

Experienced in in the delivery of end to end project life cycle planning you have delivered:

, ' ',
  • Hospitality and other related technologies, and
  • Data & Analytical technologies
, ' ',

Customer service is paramount in our Company, as an effective leader of project delivery you will be able to interact with all levels of the workforce and leadership teams.

, ' ',

It's your move

, ' ',

The Star Entertainment group is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are building a diverse workforce that reflects our community.

, ' ',

If you've got the drive to influence change, grow with our business and inspire a team to achieve greater things, come and play with us at The Star Entertainment Group. Make your next move by clicking the link below.

, ' ']

title: b'\r\n          IT Assistant\r\n        '
jd:
[' ',

Your role will include (but not limited to) the following:

, ' ',
  • Troubleshooting issues with teleradiology interfaces and performing necessary maintenance and programming
  • Administration of the PACS system, and its user base
  • Implementation of strategic plans including but not limited to, increasing referrer and patient engagement and satisfaction through a technology platform.
, ' ',

This position will suit someone who can think outside the box, is innovative and driven.

, ' ',

This position specifically excludes what would be considered day to day IT issues, fixing printers and the like. Instead it will be focused outwards and towards specific verticals within the business.

, ' ',

Key Deliverables:

, ' ',

TeleRadiology  Interfaces

, ' ',
  • Troubleshoot issues with teleradiology interfaces. Be the primary contact in the event of an issue.
  • Develop, maintain and support interface software.
, ' ',

Referrer Experience Improvements

, ' ',
  • Develop relationships with public health to ensure access of referred imaging in public health centres.
  • Implement strategic goals in order to drive uptake of a particular system by referrers.
, ' ',

Patient Experience Improvements

, ' ',
  • Implement strategies designed to improve a patient's digital experience as an Alpenglow patient.
  • Workflow Development
  • Look for IT workflows that could be improved.
, ' ',

PACS Admin

, ' ',

Business Intelligence / Analytics

, ' ',

Essential Criteria:

, ' ',
  • Experience in IT and Systems Administration (in Healthcare a plus)
  • Experience in programming, desired languages PHP, Lua, Python; desired frameworks, AngularJS, Laravel.
  • Experience in BI (Tableau experience a plus)
  • Programming 
, ' ',

Desirable Criteria:

, ' ',
  • Self-motivated
  • Able to effectively communicate in both written and verbal formats.
, ' ',

About our Company:

, ' ',

Alpenglow Australia Pty Ltd - We are a Company offering medical imaging services equivalent and if not, better than in metropolitan areas.  Our mission is offering world leading technologies to rural communities and referrers throughout Australia.  Our team are highly motivated and are passionate and dedicated to patient care.

, ' ']

[About the role 
,
, ' Focusing on channel growth, this exciting opportunity will work closely with the operations, marketing, sales and procurement teams to develop RTM strategy and ultimately promote business growth, ensuring channel profitability. You will work closely with the Sales Manager and the VP of Marketing to review and improve sales processes through gathering business intelligence and increasing the sales conversion rate. You will saturate your channel through an extensive marketing strategy, taking a push and pull approach and utilising other business units to deliver a full business solution.\xa0\xa0',
, ' ',
Key Responsibilities
, ' ',
  • Working with the VP of Marketing to implement a solid RTM strategy
  • Create and implement a channel growth action plan
  • Saturate your channel through gathering business intelligence, implementing marketing strategy and leveraging internal relationships to deliver a full business solution 
  • Responsibility for price positioning and consolidated margin optimisation within your channel
  • Monitor, analyse and report on monthly channel profitability
  • Manage, create and implement customer retention and customer acquisition business plans
  • Utilise the CRM to implement an account management strategy
, ' ', Skills and Experience ,
, ' ',
  • A degree in Business or similar
  • Specific Channel Management experience
  • A solid foundation in sales & marketing strategy development
  • The capability to identify market trends, gather in-depth business intelligence and the ability to predict market movement
  • A strong commercial acumen with a clear understanding of pricing and commercial policy
  • The ability to build strong internal and external relationships across different divisions
  • You will be well presented with an extremely high level of attention to detail
, ' ', Benefits ,
, ' ',
  • Opportunity to join a global market leader 
  • Attractive salary package and flexible working hours
  • High performing and diverse culture
, ' ', About the company 

, 'Our client is a global market leader in management technology. Publicly listed and with a presence in over 100 countries around the globe, they are currently experiencing major growth across their core business lines. Regarded in the market as a true leader in innovation, they are also a \xa0business that facilitates personal and professional growth of their employees. ',
, ' ',
Culture 

, 'Culture is probably one of the most important parts of any business, and for our client, it is at the forefront of their success and why their employees love going to work.\xa0With a keen eye for talent and a major focus on diversity, our client has extremely high standards when it comes to employment, which translates to a high performing culture that promotes innovation and excellence. Within this business you will have the opportunity to work alongside a high performing team that will push you to develop both professionally and personally.\xa0Importantly, the organisation embraces flexible working hours and a true family culture. ',
, ' ',
, ' ', How to Apply 
,
, ' Click APPLY or contact Giorgio Xindaras, on 0415786332 for a confidential discussion. ']

['We currently have an opportunity available for an accomplished\xa0', BI Developer , 'who has a background and understanding working across the Star Schema model and Data Vault philosophy aligned to the enterprise data-warehouse (EDW) transformation program of work currently underway within the organisation.\xa0',
, ' \xa0',
, ' You will possess strengths across business intelligence (BI) strategy and solution development with strong hands-on capability in terms of technical design and architecture. To be successful in this position you must have strong skills across the Microsoft BI stack, ', SSIS, ', ', SSRS, ' along with ', SQL, ' ', server 2012, ' and ', C#, '.\xa0',
, ' \xa0',
, ' ', Daily responsibilities include: ,
, ' ',
  • Provide support and guidance for new builds, new design architecture and testing of BI related project activities.
  • Delivering solution design expertise for BI design patterns and architecture.
  • Data warehouse deployment processes including the promotion of code through test environments into production.
  • Identify opportunities to re-align legacy BI and DWH solutions to the strategic technical reference architecture.
  • Identify opportunities to align the data warehouse to new strategic physical architecture.
  • Release management and coordination tasks.
  • Support enhancement requests through the design, build and test of BI and data warehouse solutions.
, ' \xa0',
, ' ', Skills & experience required:,
, ' ',
  • A University Degree in technical, business or I.T disciplines or equivalent.
  • A strong background working on Data warehouse projects in Business Intelligence domains
  • Strong knowledge of the Microsoft BI technology stack i.e SSIS, Microsoft TFS source code.
  • Proven experience with T-SQL, Cognos, ideally with exposure to DB2 databases / platforms.
  • Must have experience with SQL server 2012.
  • Strong communication skills with the ability to engage project staff and business stakeholders.
  • Proven understanding of DW methodologies such as Kimball, Star Schema, Data Vault etc.
, ' This is your chance to take your career to the next level and make a real difference with a premier organization so ', APPLY TODAY, ' for immediate consideration. ']

title: b'Consultant (BI, Data Warehousing, Analytics, Digital, Big Data) - Sydney\r\n    '
jd:
[' ',

Big Data Consultant

, ' ',

About the company and role:

, ' ',
  • Work for a rapidly expanding niche consultancy specialising in delivering Big Data & Analytics, Business Intelligence, Digital and Cloud solutions for a varied client base across Australia  and New Zealand.
  • My client has a fun and collaborative team environment where you are encouraged to learn and certification and studies are funded by the company.
  • As a Consultant the role will involve you in a diverse range of customer engagements covering Big Data, Digital, customer Customer Engagement and cloud projects and therefore we are seeking strong IT generalists across all these domains. 
  • You will enjoy solving problems, have strong business acumen and excellent presentation and communication skills.
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Skills and experience sought:

, ' ',
  • Strong background in developing proof of concepts, solution design through to development and testing
  • Background in Programming and Development with strengths in SQL
  • Some infrastructure and cloud based platforms knowledge is required
, ' ',

Ideally looking for strengths in 3 or more of the following Data and Analytics areas:

, ' ',
  • ETL: Talend, SSIS, Alteryx, Informatica
  • Database: SQL Server, Oracle, Teradata, PostgreSQL, Greenplum
  • Reporting: PowerBI, Tableau, Qlikview, Datameer
  • Big data: Cloudera, Hortonworks, MapR, Kafka, NiFi, Elasticsearch
