  • Programming Languages: Python, SQL, Java, Scala, PHP, .NET, Javascript
  • Frameworks and Architectures: Lambda, ReactJS, AngularJS, EmberJS, NodeJS
, ' ',

If you are passionate about IT and looking for a customer focused consulting role, please "apply now" or for a confidential discussion please call Luke Radford on 02 8089 1406.

, ' ']

title: b'Senior Demand Planner\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

Senior Demand Planner

, '\n',

  • Leading utility organisation

  • Supply Chain Transformation environment

  • S&OP implementation

  • Progress your career development

, '\n',

Our client is a market leading consumer utility with an extensive portfolio and exceptional reputation located in Western Sydney. The business is undertaking a major supply chain transformation and been very successful in building its capability and delivering to its goals in this transformation.

, '\n',

Reporting to the Supply Chain Manager, the Senior Demand Planner’s critical purpose is the leadership of all forecasting activities with cross functional stakeholders, and acting as a key integration point across these functions in the business SOP / IBP process.  Additionally, you will create and maintain forecast models, incorporating business intelligence and forecast information gained across internal and external sources.  Other key activities of this role include;

, '\n',

  • Ownership of the demand function which supports supply chain to meet market demand;

  • Review and refine forecast models taking into account Sales & Marketing assumptions; and understanding of demand forecast drivers;

  • Development of the demand plan and it’s validation from various sources;

  • Review trends in forecast accuracy / forecast bias and DIFOT with a goal of progressive continuous improvement.

, '\n',

As the successful candidate, you are a passionate and experienced Demand Planner with 5 + years supply chain planning experience gained in fast paced FMCG or consumer goods based environments complemented with exceptional ‘people’  and communication skills with ability to engage and influence across an organisation. Previous expertise in managing SOP / IBP is desirable and understanding of Oliver Wight principles highly regarded.  Tertiary qualifications are required and APICS certifications are highly desirable which complement your career development.   Experience with various information systems in planning is advantageous and underpinned by your superior analytical thinking and strive for continuous improvement.  Previous experience in a supply chain transformation environment is highly regarded, as will equip you with skills to support in your next phase of exciting challenges and great opportunities to be recognised for your role.

, '\n',

For a confidential discussion on this exciting opportunity, please call Brogane Clayton on 9273 0536; or alternatively please apply using the APPLY NOW link. 

, '\n']

title: b'MS BI Developer\r\n    '
jd:
[' ',

An excellent opportunity to join one of Australia’s Government Organisations to gain exposure to major greenfield Business Intelligence project. This exciting opportunity will allow you to work on a market leading project and upscale your skills within a data warehouse and reporting environment with a focus on SQL Server and MS BI stacks.

, ' ',

An excellent opportunity to join one of Australia’s Government Organisations to gain exposure to major greenfield Business Intelligence project. This exciting opportunity will allow you to work on a market leading project and upscale your skills within a data warehouse and reporting environment with a focus on SQL Server and MS BI stacks.

, ' ',

The MS BI Developer will be responsible for the design, development, optimisation and ongoing maintenance of SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) ETL packages, complex SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS) cubes, SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) reports, and PowerBI dashboards.

, ' ',

As the successful MS BI Developer you will require:

, ' ',

Responsibilities:

, ' ',
  • Document source to target mappings as specification for ETL package development.
  • Design, develop, optimise, and implement ETL packages in SQL Server Integration Services.
  • Design, develop, optimise, and implement OLAP cubes using SQL Server Analysis Services.
  • Design, develop, optimise, and implement reports using SQL Server Reporting Services.
  • Design, develop, optimise, and implement dashboards using PowerBI.
  • Contribute to solution design workshops as subject matter expert.
  • Develop and publish SSIS/SSAS patterns’ for use and reuse within the environment.
, ' ',

Skills/Requirements:

, ' ',
  • Experience in documenting functional and design specifications for ETL development
  • 5+ years experience and certification in SSIS, SSAS, SSRS.
  • Excellent understanding of MS BI and MS SQL Server architecture. Experience with Azure is highly desirable.
  • Data warehouse architecture knowledge including star schemas, operational data stores and extract strategies and methods.
  • Extensive experience with SQL and other standard database query tools.
  • Prior experience in an end to end greenfield BI Implementation project is required.
  • Experience in agile development methodology.
  • Experience through the analysis, design, build and test phases of an SDLC.
  • Self-initiative and attention to detail.
  • Ability to communicate effectively with both technical and business users.
, ' ',

, ' ',

To apply please click apply or call Sara Burns on +61 2 8289 3105 for a confidential discussion.

, ' ']

title: b'\r\n          Senior TM1 Consultant / Developer - Contract Role - Immediate - CBD\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',
We are looking for an experienced COGNOS TM1 Developer to work on a huge transformation project. You will be working for leading consultancy based in the CBD with a highly skilled team of consultants. This is a long-term contract offering highly competitive rates.

This is a high profile project which will see you working very closely with the C-Suite to transition key reporting frameworks over to the Cognos TM1 platform. As the TM1 Developer, you will support the Business Intelligence team with the design, architect, development and support of the TM1 environment utilising practice techniques to ensure sustainable solutions.
, '\n',

 

Your responsibilities will include:

  • Providing user support/training including attending to support requests
  • Providing technical support and maintenance of existing applications
  • Assisting in design and testing of new applications and enhancement of existing TM1 solutions, ensuring the system works in an integrated and uniform way
  • Proactively look for system and process improvements
  • Support the implementation of BI projects and deliver high-value analytic capabilities

Your core capabilities:

  • Exposure to TM1 maintenance and modelling, TurboIntegrator, Rules.
  • Exposure to coding, mark-up and query languages e.g. VBA, SQL, MDX, HTML
  • Exposure to ERP systems like SAP and Oracle
  • Strong problem solving and analytical skills
  • Ability to grasp business and operational concepts and translate into technical specifications
  • Strong communication skills.
This is an immediate need to work with a great team in the CBD on a high profile greenfield project. Highly competitive rates and a quick interview process. Please send your resume in word format and a consultant will be in touch to discuss the role in more detail.
, '\n']

title: b'\r\n          Digital Marketing Executive\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',

We're searching for an ambitious and driven Digital Campaign Executive to provide seamless digital campaign execution while maintaining a high level of client service support. You will need to understand the importance of client relationships and have a passion for all things digital. If you have experience working with cross-channel digital media solutions, marketing departments, digital teams or ad-tech, that would be an advantage, but it's not a must.

, '\n',

Responsibilities

, '\n',
  • Manage client relationships, ensuring a successful partnership and overall positive experience with Lighthouse8 service and products
  • Assist with the design, estimate and presentation of consulting activities and projects
  • Develop digital marketing execution strategies
  • Analyse performance data and optimise campaigns across multiple digital channels in multiple markets along with resolving challenges as they arise
  • Strong project management skills and high attention to detail
  • Experience in the digital/online space with a passion for social media, technology and emerging channels
  • Day to day management of campaigns across paid search, video and display advertising.
  • Evaluate emerging technologies. Provide thought leadership and perspective for adoption where appropriate
  • Become an expert on Lighthouse8's strengths and capabilities
  • Using project management software such as Basecamp and Harvest (no experience necessary)
  • Spot opportunities to educate partners about our core technology
, '\n',

What we need

, '\n',
  • You will have at least 1-3 years experience in digital, marketing or media
  • Experience and success in a digital marketing, account management or media planning/buying role
  • Ambitious, hungry, smart and quick to learn
  • Excellent client service & communication skills
  • Team player, highly collaborative
  • Passionate about the digital media, marketing and online advertising space
  • Familiarity across Google Analytics, AdWords, social media and the MS Office suite
  • Ideally, have experience working with performance marketing solutions
  • Extremely detail-oriented, have the ability to prioritise and manage time efficiently among multiple client campaigns and daily tasks and be able to work effectively under pressure
  • Analytical and data-driven with strong reporting skills with some creative flair and a strategic touch to add value
  • Have the ability to provide timely feedback to colleagues, superiors, and partners
  • Have the ability to act as a proactive part of the lighthouse8 team and to act as a self-starter in an environment that encourages accountability, performance & autonomy.
, '\n',

We are an international engineering company specialising in business intelligence, business technology, digital strategy development and marketing automation. We're in the business of performance marketing; delivering to audiences what they actually want and need whilst driving strong results for our clients. 

, '\n',

Lighthouse8 was named one of Australia's fastest growing SME's by Smart Company in 2014 and is a certified Google partner company.

, '\n',

This role is based at our Manly office and you must have the right to work in Australia to apply.

, '\n']

title: b'Sales Operations Analyst\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

There’s a whole lot more to Staples than you probably ever imagined. In fact, once you lift the lid on our business, you’ll discover that we have many opportunities for your career. As the world’s largest office products company and a trusted source of office solutions, we’re a recognised name across more than 26 countries.

, '\n',

, '\n',

, '\n',

, '\n',

We have an opportunity for a Sales Operations and CRM Analyst to assist in the development, planning and implementation of business initiatives to support the delivery of Staples’ Sales strategy and objectives. This role provides analytical and functional support to business stakeholders to improve the effectiveness of the Sales organisation by enhancing both the technology and operations of the Sales organisation.

, '\n',

, '\n',

, '\n',

, '\n',

Working in conjunction with the Head of Sales Operations and/or Sales Leadership team, the Sales Operations and CRM Analyst will be responsible for:

, '\n',

, '\n',

, '\n',

, '\n',
  • Analysis of existing sales teams, including team structures, sales performance metrics, KPI’s and compensation, to identify potential key areas of focus for Sales Leaders

  • Designing, planning and executing Sales Operations initiatives related to Sales Processes, Sales Analytics, Sales Compensation, and Sales Reporting




  • Collaboration with business stakeholders to prepare and implement initiatives, including systems enhancements, projects, marketing campaigns, pricing initiatives, and budgets




  • Working with business stakeholders to identify, evaluate and qualify any potential enhancements to the Salesforce.com CRM System, to prepare functional requirements documents, and to prioritize and plan their implementation




  • Providing thought leadership and functional knowledge in the preparation and execution of CRM-related business initiatives



, '\n',

Essential Skills and Experience:

, '\n',

, '\n',

, '\n',

, '\n',

  • Strong data analysis and management skills (intermediate to advanced MS excel; intermediate to advanced OLAP)




  • Strong written and verbal communication skills




  • Strong experience utilizing enterprise-class CRM, ERP and Business Intelligence solutions in a sales or marketing related role




  • Strong familiarity with enterprise-class IT change management processes, including functional requirements documentation




  • Strong experience developing Sales-related reporting, analysis and compensation systems




  • Graduate degree in engineering, commerce, economics, business administration or a related field



  • Experience in customer-facing roles in Sales or Marketing
, '\n',

This is a rare opportunity to join a global, industry leading brand in a highly visible role. Apply online by clicking on the ‘Apply’ button below.

, '\n',

, '\n']

title: b'Salesforce Administrator\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

FIRESOFT Consulting is a multi-award winning consultancy having been recognised across Australia for excellence in small business and one of Australia's coolest places to work. Our people love working here and that passion really shines through when working with you. We're obsessed with shaking things up a bit to make working with a consultancy enjoyable, valuable and specifically tailored to YOU! We understand it can be stressful and challenging while trying to find a new job or build a team so we're here to be open, honest and transparent through the process; to educate you and support you as much as possible to ensure you're kicking goals - whatever those may be!

, '\n',

Our team plays in the following verticals (contract and permanent) : DevOps | Business Intelligence | Big Data | Analytics | Infrastructure | Engineering | Digital; iOS, Android, Front End Development, Back End Development, UX, UI, Research | Project Management | Change Management | AdOps | Service Delivery |

, '\n',

Get Social with Us! | firesoft.com.au | facebook.com/firesoftconsulting |twitter.com/Firesoft_IT | linkedin.com/company/2596181/

, '\n',


Part of the Salesforce administration team and responsible for the Salesforce implementation including Sales, Marketing, Service and Community Clouds.

A leading financial organisation is looking for an experienced Salesforce Administrator / Developer to join their growing team. As a Senior Salesforce Engineer, you will help shape the existing and expanding Salesforce implementation, building out new solutions on the Salesforce platform and ensure the continual development of the existing Salesforce implementation. You will be encouraging the increase of Salesforce adoption through various channels and will champion new solutions. You will have a desire to learn and to grow within the business. You will be working alongside management and Salesforce.com implementation partners, be heavily involved in project work, and exposed to full scale project deployments.

Salesforce is Embedded right across the business; Marketing (ExactTarget/Marketing Cloud), HR (Employee Community) and Finance, so Salesforce is a key part of this fast-paced and dynamic company and you will gain broad exposure to most facets of the Salesforce cloud platform.

Key Responsibilities:

, '\n',
  • Translating business requirements into deliverable solutions
  • Taking the lead on new projects involving Salesforce deployments, liaising with relevant teams and business stakeholders to define requirements and make recommendations.
  • Maximising the use of the business data through Salesforce to provide greater Business Intelligence, helping the team to provide comprehensive metrics through reporting and dashboards
  • Liaising with management to implement creative solutions to best support the wider initiatives
  • Maintaining a transparent communication Channel with the wider business and regular updates of future work
  • Producing comprehensive documentation of team processes and maintenance of these processes
  • Researching of new Salesforce features at each release and understanding business impact
    Capable of understanding Business Analysis and Project Work

    Senior Salesforce Administrator

    Essential Skills:
  • 8 years of experience as a Salesforce Administrator / Developer
  • Comfortable championing Salesforce throughout the larger organisation
  • Marketing Cloud Knowledge

    Desired Skills and Experience:
    Experience working with Salesforce Community Cloud
    Exposure to Lightning Experience

, '\n']

title: b'Graduate Conference Producer\r\n    '
jd:
[' ',

The International Quality and Productivity Centre (IQPC) is Australia's leading conference and events company.

, ' ',

What sets us apart is our ability to launch conference topics that are on the very forefront of the changes that are taking place in the Australian economy, such as how businesses are using Artificial Intelligence to improve their operations, or how Blockchain is changing the nature of global finance markets.

, ' ',

In this context, the role of the producer is to develop conference programs that help businesses to tap into the potential of these game changing innovations.

, ' ',

During the month long production cycle of each conference, you will conduct research with senior executives to familiarize yourself with the often hidden and critical inner workings of what drives the industry you are focusing on, and in the process, help them solve the problems that keep them up at night.

, ' ',

While this might sound like a daunting prospect, we are not looking for anyone with prior conference experience. Instead, we are looking for young, enthusiastic graduates (ideally with a year's corporate experience) who are keen to develop their business acumen in a fun and fast paced environment.

, ' ',

Main Duties and Responsibilities

, ' ',
  • Researching conference topics with business executives, primarily over the phone
  • Developing growth strategies for each of your events
  • Briefing and project managing the other departments (marketing, operations, delegates sales and sponsorship)
  • Inviting and securing speakers
  • Writing copy for the conference agenda, website and marketing collateral
  • Managing the budgets for your events, and controlling the costs
  • Running the event on site
, ' ',

What we are looking for candidates with the following attributes:

, ' ',
  • Outgoing and good with people
  • Interested in business, and have a broad understanding of the Australian economy
  • Able to express your thoughts clearly, be it through written or verbal communication
  • Solution rather than problem focused
  • Experience in a corporate environment
  • Successful conference producers typically have a degree in Business, Economics, Law, Journalism or Teaching
, ' ',

What's in it for you:

, ' ',
  • Development of communication, sales, marketing and project management skills
  • Networking with senior business leaders in Australia's largest industries
  • A young, vibrant corporate culture
  • The ability to travel internationally (we have offices in London, New York, Berlin, Dubai and Singapore)
, ' ',

Apply directly to doug.power@iqpc.com.au

, ' ',

Please view our careers page http://careers.iqpc.com   and website on www.iqpc.com.au  to learn more about our business.

, ' ',

Strictly no recruitment agencies

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

 

, ' ']

  • Uses BI opens source tools to pull data sets and input information into SAS forecast or equivalent tool

  • Advanced-level Excel capability

Please submit CV in WORD format ONLY.

Our client is a market leading consumer utility with an extensive portfolio and exceptional reputation located in Western Sydney. The business is undertaking a major supply chain transformation and been very successful in building its capability and delivering to its goals in this transformation.

Previous expertise in managing SOP / IBP is desirable and understanding of Oliver Wight principles highly regarded.  Tertiary qualifications are required and APICS certifications are highly desirable which complement your career development.   Experience with various information systems in planning is advantageous and underpinned by your superior analytical thinking and strive for continuous improvement.  Previous experience in a supply chain transformation environment is highly regarded, as will equip you with skills to support in your next phase of exciting challenges and great opportunities to be recognised for your role.

['\n',

FIRESOFT Consulting is a multi-award winning consultancy having been recognised across Australia for excellence in small business and one of Australia's coolest places to work. Our people love working here and that passion really shines through when working with you. We're obsessed with shaking things up a bit to make working with a consultancy enjoyable, valuable and specifically tailored to YOU! We understand it can be stressful and challenging while trying to find a new job or build a team so we're here to be open, honest and transparent through the process; to educate you and support you as much as possible to ensure you're kicking goals - whatever those may be!

, '\n',

Our team plays in the following verticals (contract and permanent) : DevOps | Business Intelligence | Big Data | Analytics | Infrastructure | Engineering | Digital; iOS, Android, Front End Development, Back End Development, UX, UI, Research | Project Management | Change Management | AdOps | Service Delivery |

, '\n',

Get Social with Us! | firesoft.com.au | facebook.com/firesoftconsulting |twitter.com/Firesoft_IT | linkedin.com/company/2596181/

, '\n',

We're on the hunt for a strong SSIS ETL Developer to work as an associate developer on a National Enterprise Data Warehouse Integration Project. 6+ month initial contract with 24 month pipeline of work.

, '\n',


Role Responsibilities:

, '\n',
  • Work with the team to design and implement ETL procedures for intake of data from both internal and outside sources; as well as ensure data is verified and quality is checked
  • Requirements analysis, design and implement ETL processes and data architecture to ensure proper functioning of analytics, as well as client’s or third-party’s reporting environments and dashboard
  • Collaborate with business and technology stakeholders in ensuring data warehouse architecture development and utilization
  • Carry out monitoring, tuning, and database performance analysis
  • Thorough documentation of all process and procedures associated with design and implementation
  • Perform the design and extension of data marts, meta data, and data models
, '\n',


Essential Requirements:

, '\n',
  • Minimum 2 years working in a Data Warehouse Development role
  • Demonstrated SQL 2012 experience
  • Exceptional ETL experience - SSIS
  • Demonstrated experience building ETL processes that map data from source systems to target systems utilizing SSIS in an automated manner.
  • Experience translating database design and diagnosing database performance issues.
  • Prior experience as a SQL DBA an asset
, '\n',


Apply Now; we have already engaged our headhunt campaign!
To Your Success...!

, '\n']

title: b'Graduate Recruitment Consultant \r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

FIRESOFT Consulting is a multi-award winning consultancy having been recognised across Australia for excellence in small business and one of Australia's coolest places to work. Our people love working here and that passion really shines through when working with you. We're obsessed with shaking things up a bit to make working with a consultancy enjoyable, valuable and specifically tailored to YOU! We understand it can be stressful and challenging while trying to find a new job or build a team so we're here to be open, honest and transparent through the process; to educate you and support you as much as possible to ensure you're kicking goals - whatever those may be!

, ' ',

Our team plays in the following verticals (contract and permanent) : DevOps | Business Intelligence | Big Data | Analytics | Infrastructure | Engineering | Digital; iOS, Android, Front End Development, Back End Development, UX, UI, Research | Project Management | Change Management | AdOps | Service Delivery |

, ' ',

Get Social with Us! | firesoft.com.au | facebook.com/firesoftconsulting |twitter.com/Firesoft_IT | linkedin.com/company/2596181/

, ' ',

Our mission is to Impact a National Paradigm shift in the Recruiment industry through serving as educators, advisors and trusted partners...!

, ' ',
  • Beautiful, Waterfront Offices on King Street Wharf
  • Relaxed, autonomous and professional working environment with flexibility
  • Multiple Award Winning Business!
, ' ',

FIRESOFT was built on the idea that there are too many recruitment companies out there who run on the same old processes and principles; we've all been there and done that. We have created an environment that promotes ingenuity, flexibility, passion and creative thinking. We have a team of energized, forward thinking and high achieving consultants and are looking to add to that culture with like-minded individuals who have demonstrated success in the IT recruitment realm.

, ' ',

What You'll Bring

, ' ',
  • Demonstrated creative thinking an ingenuity
  • Desire to run your own show and an entrepreneurial spirit
  • Clear goals, aspirations and the ability to TELL US what you want out of your career so we can help you get there!
  • Strong history of building lasting relationships, and offering a consultative approach through the recruitment process
, ' ',

Perks of Working with FIRESOFT:

, ' ',
  • Fresh Fruit Delivered to the office weekly
  • Beautiful, waterfront offices, large lounging balcony with a fully stocked beer fridge and BBQ
  • Casual attire Monday-Friday - you choose whether to dress it up or dress it down.
  • Monthly, Quarterly and Yearly Incentives - Our current Top Biller Award is a Trip for two to New York City or all expenses Paid luxury Bali holiday for two - you choose!
  • Strong base salary; we value your experience and demonstrated success
  • One of the most competitive commission structures on the market!
  • Brand new laptop; with entire business access in the cloud for mobility
  • Flexible working culture; we're all adults here
  • Excellent training and development opportunities - Professional training every Tuesday Morning with a team Breakfast supplied!
  • Steadily growing team with leadership opportunities in the near future
  • Only a stones throw (literally...) from all the entertainment, pubs, shopping etc. you could ask for!
, ' ',

If you're thinking this just might be the fresh and inspiring change you're looking for and are ready to kick some goals, get in touch or send across a CV!

, ' ',

, ' ']

['\n',


Our client is a well-known organisation with offices in Sydney’s CBD.

, '\n',


They are currently undertaking a large SAP implementation and are seeking a SAP HR Business Analyst with SAP BW experience.

, '\n',


The successful candidate will have demonstrated experience performing a business analysis role pertaining to the design and maintenance of Business Intelligence (BI) applications (primarily but not limited to SAP BW) in the Human Resources Area.

, '\n',


The responsibilities of the role will include:

, '\n',

, '\n',
  • Driving the process of defining new processes and prototypes and simulating the new process in order to produce a reporting solution that is consistent with the requirements specified by the users
  • Taking responsibility for developing and executing test scenarios and documenting test results
  • Developing report functional specifications and assisting the SAP BI Team with testing functionality of the report.
  • Implementing and maintaining required documentation, including, but not limited to business procedures and training documentation.
  • Act as the key liaison between HR / Payroll and SAP Program Team
  • Work alongside the business to guide, coach and mentor the SME's so that they can analyse & resolve any business process/system issues
  • Provide functional expertise to various team members
  • Business analysis and business design
  • Requirements gathering and facilitating workshops
  • Collaborate with appropriate business units and developers on requirements gathering, solution design, and creation of functional specifications
  • Knowledge and experience in recording and collecting detailed business rules and documentation
, '\n',


To be considered for the role you will need

, '\n',

, '\n',
  • Extensive demonstrated experience in BW HR Functional Business Analyst roles
  • Good Business Analyst skills and experience
  • Extensive demonstrated experience in SAP HR functional consulting roles
  • Strong understanding of SAP ERP integration points and best practice processes
  • Recent successes in multi-faceted, fast paced project delivery roles
  • Demonstrated experience in supporting multiple senior stakeholder groups
  • Analytical thinker who has shown an ability to leverage lessons learned, and implement continuous improvement initiatives
  • Proven track record of making effective decisions at senior levels whilst working in a rapidly changing environment
  • A good understand of the SAP Human Capital Management (HCM) road-map
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Experience in continuous improvement and process re-engineering
  • Excellent business process knowledge
, '\n']

title: b'\r\n          CRM & Digital Marketing Coordinator\r\n        '
jd:
[' ',

About us:

, ' ',

Visionary Investment Group (VIG) is a leading innovative and diversified Australian investment, hotelier and property group. The group's core capabilities are end-to-end funds management and investment, property developments, hotel operations, property sales and marketing, and assets management.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Founded in Sydney, VIG was born from a vision to create a company that could successfully combine its core capabilities, while continuing to offer proven integrated solutions for its stakeholders.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Principally located in Australia, VIG has since expanded its reach to mainland China, with offices in Beijing, Shanghai, Xiamen, Zhengzhou and Shenzhen.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

An integrated approach gives VIG a competitive advantage in the creation of high quality assets across the entire lifecycle of a project; from funds management and investment, through to planning and design, construction and development, marketing, hotel operations, leasing, property management and long-term ownership.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

With a strong focus on the end result for our stakeholders, VIG continually looks at redefining the landscape of our core capabilities to create stable outcomes.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

A spirit of innovation and a relentless pursuit for the extraordinary is what drives VIG's bespoke investment and property solutions.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

About the role:

, ' ',

Working with the marketing team to coordinate and execute effective tactical marketing activities and plans in order to support business growth, as well as to assist in the day-to-day marketing activities of the company's various brands and projects. This role will maximise the use of the business data through Salesforce to provide greater business intelligence, across the company's brands, helping the team to provide comprehensive metrics through reporting and dashboards.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

The role will research new Salesforce features, as well as EDM and social media trends, to solve business needs or issues. Facilitating new database features or tool demonstrations in order to support the decision-making process will also be required. Database de-duping and clean up, the development or reports and dashboards, as well as planning, integrating and managing the deployment of approved applications into their Salesforce environment will also be required.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Database training for users, the communication of future database releases and enhancements, and ongoing relationships with Salesforce employees are also part of the role.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

The role will also create, execute and optimise website content creation and blog posts, so this role also requires copywriting and image selection skills, as well as analytical skills to track and optimise digital communications.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Developing and posting content to Social media platforms across the company's brands and projects with appropriate messaging and content, while staying within brand guidelines, is also part of the role.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Responsibilities of the role:

, ' ',

 

, ' ',
  • Drive CRM strategy, including customer segmentation to support targeted marketing strategies and testing
  • Track the progress and results of customer campaigns
  • Monitoring and optimisation of corporate and project digital communications
  • Create and organise reports and data from internal company's CRM system
  • Email marketing including weekly email creation, execution and analysis
  • Social media marketing including coordination and content development for our social platforms (Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn) and reporting
  • Website content creation and execution
  • Blog content coordination and execution
  • Keeping up-to-date by actively researching industry activity
  • Working with marketing team to deliver campaigns and other ad hoc marketing duties as needed
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

To be a successful applicant; you must:

, ' ',

 

, ' ',
  • Be extremely methodical, analytical motivated, organised, thorough and have an eye for detail
  • Be able to meet tight and last minute deadlines
  • Have some Salesforce Sales Cloud experience
  • Be proficient with MS Office Products
  • Have highly developed interpersonal and communication skills
  • Be an energetic self-starter who works well within varied business teams
  • Embrace challenges and change
  • Have marketing campaign experience
  • Have some Social Media experience across Facebook, LinkedIn and Twitter
  • Have some experience using CMS systems and tracking the customer journey, creating blog posts, and reading and interpreting data
  • Experience with Pardot, or additional Salesforce products would be advantageous, but is not required
, ' ']

title: b'Software Developer - C/C++\r\n      '

['\n',

FIRESOFT Consulting is a multi-award winning consultancy having been recognised across Australia for excellence in small business and one of Australia's coolest places to work. Our people love working here and that passion really shines through when working with you. We're obsessed with shaking things up a bit to make working with a consultancy enjoyable, valuable and specifically tailored to YOU! Client
This client is a global software house in the security space based in Sydney’s eastern suburbs. They have approx. 500 users and have a mixed technology stack, but it’s mainly developed in low level c and assembly, they also use a lot of iOS and Android technologies. They are a young and social Company so want this candidate to have a similar outlook. They have an on-site bar and are regular XFIT goers.

  • Knowledge of x86, x86_64, ARM or ARM64 assembly strongly desired
  • Knowledge of Cryptography highly sought after
  • Experience with the Atlassian software stack
  • Android & iOS development highly sought after
, '\n']

title: b'SAP BW Analyst\r\n    '
jd:
[' ',

You will have the opportunity to make this role your own, providing the experience to enhance and support the Business Intelligence applications (primarily but not limited to SAP-BW). You will have a strong functional background; however will utilize your strong stakeholder management skills in this client facing role.

, ' ',

, ' ',

In this exiting opportunity you will gain phenomenal exposure, acting as an advisor to the CFO and being solely responsible for the implementation of business applications and the reporting structure. This opportunity is ideal for an ambitious functional SAP BW Analyst who wants to be the driving force behind the build and implementation of a CRM system and mapping data streams.

, ' ',

You will join an office of circa 50 employees, and thus you will be the go to individual for IT issues on site. You will be comfortable supplying general IT support functions and this should account for around 20% of the job description.

, ' ',

, ' ',

As the SAP BW Analyst you will be involved with:

, ' ',
  • Working with the Data & Analytics Team and end-users to map new business processes in the SAP system
  • Driving the process of defining new processes and prototypes and simulating the new process in order to produce a functional system which is consistent with the requirements specified by the users
  • Taking responsibility for developing and executing test scenarios and documenting test results
  • Developing program specifications and assisting the Data & Analytics Team with testing functionality of the program
  • Implementing and maintaining required documentation, including, but not limited to business procedures and training documentation.
, ' ',

As the SAP BW Analyst you will have:

, ' ',
  • 4 + years experience working within a similar position with strong knowledge of SAP BW/BI
  • Strong experience working with SAP business functions and Business Applications (CRM, Financial forecasting tools)
  • Functional knowledge of SAP Netweaver Portal and ABAP
  • Experience in a customer service environment is desirable
  • Excellent stakeholder management, necessary to communicate with non-technical clients, IT professionals, and management.
, ' ',

, ' ',

This is a 9 month fixed term contract.

, ' ',

To apply please click apply or call Tal Gardiner on 02 84231033 for a confidential discussion.

, ' ']

['\n',

A leading Financial Services institution is seeking a Business Intelligence Solutions Designer, to join them in their highly complex enterprise environment.  This role will be pivotal for the success of a reporting solution on a two year program of work.

, '\n',

A legacy reporting system was used by the organisation for many years and recently they have implemented a custom built reporting solution.  The custom solution that has been built is very complex and challenging.

, '\n',

This role involves a review and extension of the in-house built reporting solution. The sucessful applicant will be responsible for the entire system design.

, '\n',

This designer role will influence technology direction and lead the technical delivery capabilities.  It is necessary to look at the whole solution end to end and assess what’s possible and what’s not.

, '\n',

The project team is in place to provide a road map and transition across to the new end to end solution.  You will also be asked to provide guidance on architecture and infrastructure.

, '\n',

Successful applicants will have similar experience in large, highly complex enterprise environments.  It is also important to have a passion for solving business problems and exceeding expectations.

, '\n',

Requirements:

, '\n',
  • Proven experience designing and leading complex Microsoft BI Reporting implementations
  • Extensive knowledge across the full MS BI Stack including SSIS, SSRS, SSAS & Power BI
  • Solid experience of designing databases for optimal performance
  • Agile Methodology
  • Experience integrating SSRS with Custom applications
  • Experience using the MS BI Portal framework
  • Experience in large Data Warehouse environments
  • Excellent Report Design and Visualisation expertise
  • Strong work ethic, positive attitude and articulate with great communication
, '\n',

If this sounds like your ideal next role please submit your resume for immediate consideration.

, '\n']

title: b'National Account Manager | Agri Commercial Insurance\r\n      '
jd:
['Our client is\xa0a\xa0', Global Specialist Insurance Company, ', the business has gone from strength to strength as they continue to win new clients and build a\xa0', positive and competitive brand name, '\xa0in their market.\xa0',
, ' ',
, ' As the National Account Manager', ,, "\xa0you will be responsible for enhancing and developing the business's capabilities and offerings within the Australian Agricultural community. You will collaboratively work with the regional managers to establish strong networks with relevant associations & major clients and drive new business to the specialist team. \xa0You will report into the Commercial Director and will spend most of the first 6 months travelling interstate growing the network, distribution channels and meeting with people face to face.",
, ' \xa0',
, ' This is a rare role that has a unique blend of account management / business development and business intelligence analysis.\xa0 ',
, ' ',
, ' ', Key duties and responsibilities will include:,
, ' ',
  • Manage and develop relationships with federations and associations, and key major clients within Australian Agriculture.
  • Provide tailored insurance solutions to the Australian agriculture networks.
  • Business intelligence analysis and reporting to the management team and head office.
  • Enhance risk management capabilities and offerings.
, ' ', To be considered you must have:,
, ' ',
  • A minimum of 5 years' proven experience in a senior Account Manager / Business Development Manager role from Commercial Insurance.
  • Your experience will ideally be within the Agricultural community, alternatively you will have excellent agri networks from your connection to the land.
  • Exceptional communication skills and ability to build trusted relationships both internally and externally. 
  • The ability to work in a small and very fast paced and entrepreneurial environment. 
, ' This is a unique and exciting opportunity to join an already successful business with ambitious growth plans where you will make', a genuine contribution, '\xa0to future successes.',
, ' ',
, " This is a company that prides itself on their working environment. You will be challenged to deliver excellent results in a fast-paced environment, which still manages to maintain their 'family style' company culture and a genuine work life balance.",
, ' ',
I am meeting with suitable candidates immediately , "therefore please send your details through to Sophie Monaghan via the 'APPLY' link below or contact me on 02 9216 6709 to arrange an interview. "]

title: b'Business Analyst - Customer Surveys & Insights - Salesforce\r\n    '
jd:
[' ',

Our client, a technology organisation with global operations, is currently engaged in a customer data analysis project now requires a Business Analyst to engage with the business across its offices in Australia and overseas, gather business requirements, select a customer survey tool and establish customer intelligence data analysis processes to derive key insights for the business. This survey toll will pull customer data from data, so salesforce experience is advantageous, but not essential. 

With first class outcome customer experience, business intelligence, data quality, business insights and sales development high on the agenda, this is an excellent opportunity to apply your business analysis, process and customer intelligence and engagement expertise in an important project for the organisation.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Skills and experience required:

, ' ',

 

, ' ',
  • Business Analysis
  • Customer Data
  • Customer Survey Tools – Vison Critical etc.
  • Customer Intelligence Platforms
  • Data Analysis/Insights
  • Data Modelling
  • Business Case Development
  • Gap Analysis,  As-Is, To-Be
  • Vendor Management/Selection
  • Stakeholder Engagement
  • Oracle/Salesforce etc
  • Workshop Facilitation
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

If you have previous business analysis experience on customer survey and intelligence projects with advanced stakeholder engagement, vendor management, team working and communication skills then we want to hear from you.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Please click on the apply button to send your resume or call Nikhil Banerji on 02 9460 8699 for a confidential discussion.        

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

title: b'Project Manager - ICT Client Systems\r\n        '
jd:
['\xa0',
, '\n', Project Manager - ICT Client Systems

Major Government Department is looking for a hands on Project Manager for an initial 6 month contract based in the CBD. 

In this role you will be responsible for:,
, '\n',
  • Requirements gathering and development of business specifications for SAP system improvements, enhancements and reports.
  • Development of complex process maps, flow charts, procedures and process documentation
  • Ensure that all applications align with the adopted management systems and other applications and business processes and that the various applications are available to a level that meets user needs, and operating effectively at all times adhering to set business rules and policies.
  • Assist with the development and creation of project deliverables to support the achievement of project benefits.
  • Undertake business process mapping in a complex environment to clarify and streamline functions.
  • Contribute to transitioning project deliverables into business as usual functions, via supporting change management initiatives and business readiness reviews.
  • Develop test cases for unit testing, integration testing, and user acceptance testing, and ensure that test cases map to the requirements traceability matrices and work closely with the business
  • Assist in Change Management, documenting Impact Analysis
  • Provide high-quality support, guidance, training and advice to staff as required.
  • Ensure ongoing monitoring of end user skills and requirements and initiating actions to identify, maintain and enhance their skills
, '\n', Key Accountabilities:,
, '\r\n\xa0\xa0',
, '\r\nManaging the systems for all applications to meet critical and diverse business needs in a commercial and complex environment with rapidly changing technologies.',
, '\n',
  • Experience and excellent knowledge of SAP Systems including Project Systems, Material Management, Finance, Sales Orders,  Purchase Orders, Data Warehousing and Business Intelligence modules.
  • Experience in project management methodology and SAP project financial accounting.
  • Experience working with executive management to develop continuous improvement and transformational strategies
  • Extensive experience in developing test cases for User Acceptance Testing and participating in testing
  • Experience defining and documenting business requirements and functional specifications ensuring that business requirements are traceable throughout the program/project lifecycle.
  • Ability to work with complex problems and have the ability to explain these simply and clearly.
, '\r\nThis role is to commence around the 24th of April and will be until the end of the year so please apply now if you meet the above criteria and would like to know more!\r\n ']

[' ',

Company Background

, ' ',

Tramada Systems is the leading provider of Travel Management Systems for corporate, leisure and home based travel agents in US, Australia and New Zealand.

, ' ',

We are a growing company looking to expand further overseas.

, ' ',

Key Responsibilities

, ' ',

This position is responsible for the business analysis and specification of new features and enhancements to tramada's innovative and market leading travel technology solution.

, ' ',
  • Business Analysis of new features and projects, gathering business and system requirements and liaising with third parties as required (end users and/or providers)
  • Analysis of requirements and dependencies for new features and enhancements
  • Work closely with Developers and QA team members during development and testing of new features
  • Assisting with implementation and testing of the new functionality
  • Handover of new features to Support and Training
  • Input to best practices for requirement gathering and management
, ' ',

Core Key Requirements

, ' ',
  • 4+ years' experience in a similar or related role
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills including the ability to liaise internally and externally at all levels
  • Comfortable taking on variety of tasks and be able to thrive in a dynamic environment
  • A high level of analytical and problem solving skills
  • A methodical and organised approach to work with excellent attention to details
  • Drive and determination to learn and grow
, ' ',

Advantageous skills

, ' ',
  • Knowledge of travel agency practices and mid office technology
  • Knowledge of Business Intelligence systems and principles
  • GDS knowledge
, ' ',

What we offer

, ' ',
  • Work for a private established stable and growing company that has been in the market place for over 15 years
  • A small, friendly and closely knit team environment where your work contribution can make a real difference
, ' ']

title: b'\r\n          Microsoft Dynamics (CRM) and/or Microsoft SQL Contract Trainers\r\n        '
advertiser: ACTE Pty Ltd trading as DDLS -
jd:
[' ',

Microsoft Dynamics (CRM) and/or Microsoft SQL Contract Trainers

, ' ',

As Australia's largest Learning Solutions Provider in the three key areas of technology, process and people, DDLS possesses extensive experience providing training programs to corporate and government organisations. DDLS provides a range of delivery options to meet the needs of the different groups within the client organisation, including one on one, and one to many deliveries via a number of modalities including instructor lead, virtual, remote and seminar style training events. 

, ' ',

We have a large pool of contract trainers, who we collaborate with on an ad-hoc basis. Do you want to extend your CRM or SQL training portfolio, and be a part of the DDLS Team?

, ' ',

In Sydney, we currently have a requirement for two instructors with the following skills:

, ' ',
  • Individuals experienced in delivering training in administering, customizing, and extending Microsoft Dynamics (CRM), and
  • Individuals experienced in delivering training in Microsoft SQL Server.
, ' ',


Microsoft Dynamics (CRM) Contract Trainer
Ideally we would be looking for Microsoft Dynamics skills of:

, ' ',
  • Administration, customisation and extending Microsoft Dynamics CRM/ERP
  • Office 365 Microsoft Dynamics CRM
  • CRM End User Productivity
, ' ',

It would be an added bonus if you had some courseware development experience, and PowerShell experience would be advantageous too.

, ' ',

Microsoft SQL Server Contract Trainer
Ideally we are looking for Microsoft SQL Server 2016 delivery skills in any of the following areas:

, ' ',
  • SQL Administration
  • TSQL
  • Business Intelligence
, ' ',

It is assumed you are a current MCT

, ' ',

To be successful in these roles, you will possess expert knowledge and extensive training experience in a corporate environment.  Skills and experience in CRM or SQL are training required. You will be dedicated, professional, and have a determination to deliver superior training. You will possess:

, ' ',
  •  Extensive, 'hands on' experience in your field of expertise
  •  Preferably a qualification in your field of expertise
  •  Accreditation as a trainer
  •  A proven record of course facilitation
  •  A Certificate IV in Workplace Training and Assessment
  •  Excellent interpersonal skills
  •  Strong written and verbal communication skills
, ' ',

DDLS offers competitive contractor rates and there are always opportunities to grow and develop your skills. Course materials and train-the-trainer sessions will be provided.

, ' ',

If you are at the top of your game and would relish the opportunity that this job offers, we look forward to hearing from you. Please send your applications (cover letter and CV) to careers@didata.com.au.

, ' ']

title: b'\r\n          Senior BI Cognos Consultant - Contract - Immediate - Great Day Rates\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',
We are looking for a Senior BI Cognos consultant/developer to join a passionate team working on a tier one project based in the CBD. This is a contract opportunity with highly competitive rates for the right person 

, '\n',
 
, '\n',
You will be working with a leading business performance consultancy with a highly experienced team on a greenfield project. You will be proficient with the Cognos 10 toolset, having a solid understanding of relational and dimensional reporting models. The person will be responsible for implementing BI reporting solutions and framework /cube modelling to business requirement specifications.
, '\n',
 
, '\n',
Since this is a Senior Consultant appointment, accordingly you will display a demonstrable aptitude for business intelligence solutions and be responsible for the analysis, design, development and delivery of solutions that meet and exceed client expectations.  This is a genuine opportunity to be part of a team that willingly shares ideas and skills and deliver outstanding results.


Job Description:
  • Develop simple and complex reports including list, crosstabs and charts with drill\-thru capabilities
  • Build dashboards using traditional and active reporting techniques
  • Update and enhance existing framework manager & OLAP models
  • Enhance existing reports based on new requirements
  • Performance tuning of reports, models and infrastructure
  • Assist in gathering requirements and author supporting documentation
  • Interact with business sponsors to plan scope and timescales for project
Technical Skill:
  • Minimum 5 years experience in a Cognos development role
  • Proficient with reporting toolsets such as Report Studio, Query Studio, Analysis Studio, Event Studio and Business Insights Advanced
  • Understand metadata modelling techniques \(Framework and OLAP\)
  • Proficient in SQL and relational databases such as Oracle
  • Understand data warehouse design theory
  • Experience with Cognos best practices & methodologies
  • Experience with Rave Engine highly desireable but not essential
, '\n',
Personal Skills:
, '\n',
  • Proven ability to work well in a fast-paced and challenging technical environment, with ability to multitask whilst delivering high-quality solutions
  • Ability to quickly understand issues and think through solutions
  • Highly motivated with an ability to work independently
  • Ability to perform data analysis and troubleshoot data integrity issues
  • Able to communicate effectively with other team members and business stakeholders
Desirable Skills:
  • Agile methodologies \- Jira, Kanban, Scrum
  • Understand Cognos server architecture and environment administration
  • Knowledge in TM1, Cognos SDK using Java or \.Net
This is an immediate need and an opportunity to join a great team in the CBD working on a great project with highly competitive rates on offer. Please click apply to submit your resume and a consultant will be in touch shortly.
, '\n']

title: b'SAP Systems Manager\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

Job for a SAP Systems Manager based in Sydney CBD with a Government Organisation on a contract basis.

Your new company
A Government organisation is seeking a SAP Systems Manager to start on a contract basis for 6 months.

Your new role
Your job as a SAP Systems Manager will involve requirements gathering and development of business specifications for SAP system improvements, enhancements and reports. This will include development of complex process maps, flow charts, procedures and process documentation and you will ensure that all applications align with the adopted management systems. You will also contribute to transitioning project deliverables into business as usual functions, via supporting change management initiatives and business readiness reviews as well as develop test cases for unit testing, integration testing, and user acceptance testing, and ensure that test cases map to the requirements traceability matrices and work closely with the business
Key Accountabilities

, '\n',
  • Managing the systems for all applications to meet critical and diverse business needs in a commercial and complex environment with rapidly changing technologies.
  • Keeping up-to-date with the technology underlying the system and the environment relevant to the system, given the frequency of changes and its complex and technical nature.
  • Eliminating redundant or uneconomic systems in the face of user or stakeholder inertia
, '\n',


What you'll need to succeed

, '\n',
  • Appropriate Degree and/or equivalent experience in Information Communication & Technology or a business related field.
  • Experience and excellent knowledge of SAP Systems including Project Systems, Material Management, Finance, Sales Orders, Purchase Orders, Data Warehousing and Business Intelligence modules.
  • Experience in project management methodology and SAP project financial accounting.
  • Experience working with executive management to develop continuous improvement and transformational strategies
  • Extensive experience in developing test cases for User Acceptance Testing and participating in testing
, '\n',
  • Experience defining and documenting business requirements and functional specifications ensuring that business requirements are traceable throughout the program/project lifecycle.
, '\n',
  • Ability to work with complex problems and have the ability to explain these simply and clearly.
, '\n',


What you'll get in return
This is a Government role based in the CBD offering a 6 month contract.

What you need to do now
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.
If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.

, '\n']

title: b'Data Administrator - Performance Management\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

Performance Management Data Administrator

, ' ',

International Health and Medical Services Pty Ltd

, ' ',

International Health & Medical Services (IHMS) is contracted by the Commonwealth of Australia, represented by the Department of Immigration and Border Protection, to provide primary and mental health care to people in immigration detention in Australia, and to asylum seekers and refugees residing in Manus Island, Papua New Guinea and Nauru. IHMS also manages the health care of people in community detention through its network of community providers.

, ' ',

­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­

, ' ',

IHMS needs accurate and timely data entry to facilitate accurate reporting and analysis. This in turn allows IHMS to better manage its contractual obligations. The Data Administrator will perform data entry and other administrative tasks to support the Centralised Reporting function as well as the broader IHMS business. 

, ' ',

B. Key Responsibilities

, ' ',
  • Interpreting notifications from IHMS's customer about the requirement to provide certain types of health services.  This will involve applying procedures that have being developed solely for this purpose.  In some cases, there will be a need to document interpretations so that there is an auditable trail of decision-making.
  • Where necessary, asking the customer to provide additional information and/or to clarify information that has been provided.
  • Inputting notification times into IHMS's health information system.  The notifications are used to determine whether IHMS has complied with KPIs that are based on deadlines.
  • Where necessary, alerting managers to instances where the customer has not followed the agreed method of notifying IHMS of a requirement to provide health services.
  • Maintaining accurate, manual records of specific types of notifications and providing IHMS's sites with those records each day.
  • Working with Business Analysts to identify, investigate and potentially correct non-compliances by IHMS's staff at sites.  This would include, for example, identifying appointments that could cause IHMS to be non-compliant with a particular KPI. 
  • Developing trackers for capturing new data as required by the Manager – Compliance, Reporting & Business Applications.
  • Identifying data entry and analysis errors to improve quality of business intelligence. Suggesting improvements to procedures. Developing new procedures to automate and improve accuracy of IHMS' client location management.
  • Helping to gather information needed to demonstrate that IHMS is complying with its contractual obligations.
  • Ad hoc tasks aimed at assisting staff at sites.
, ' ',

Required Skills and Knowledge

, ' ',
  • Strong attention to detail with a high level of data entry accuracy.
  • Proficient with Excel, Word and Outlook.
, ' ',

Required Competencies

, ' ',
  • Able to work autonomously.
  • Able to take initiative.
  • Close attention to detail.
  • Able to apply original thinking in order to create tailored solutions.
  • Able to apply commonsense and good judgment when confronted by ambiguity.
  • Customer-friendly manner.
  • Able to meet deadlines.
  • Good team player.
, ' ',

If you feel you possess the suitable background; apply today! 

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

 

, ' ']

title: b'Graduate Recruitment Consultant \r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

FIRESOFT Consulting is a multi-award winning consultancy having been recognised across Australia for excellence in small business and one of Australia's coolest places to work. Our people love working here and that passion really shines through when working with you. We're obsessed with shaking things up a bit to make working with a consultancy enjoyable, valuable and specifically tailored to YOU! We understand it can be stressful and challenging while trying to find a new job or build a team so we're here to be open, honest and transparent through the process; to educate you and support you as much as possible to ensure you're kicking goals - whatever those may be!

, ' ',

Our team plays in the following verticals (contract and permanent) : DevOps | Business Intelligence | Big Data | Analytics | Infrastructure | Engineering | Digital; iOS, Android, Front End Development, Back End Development, UX, UI, Research | Project Management | Change Management | AdOps | Service Delivery |

, ' ',

Get Social with Us! | firesoft.com.au | facebook.com/firesoftconsulting |twitter.com/Firesoft_IT | linkedin.com/company/2596181/

, ' ',

Our mission is to Impact a National Paradigm shift in the Recruiment industry through serving as educators, advisors and trusted partners...!

, ' ',
  • Beautiful, Waterfront Offices on King Street Wharf
  • Relaxed, autonomous and professional working environment with flexibility
  • Multiple Award Winning Business!
, ' ',

FIRESOFT was built on the idea that there are too many recruitment companies out there who run on the same old processes and principles; we've all been there and done that. We have created an environment that promotes ingenuity, flexibility, passion and creative thinking. We have a team of energized, forward thinking and high achieving consultants and are looking to add to that culture with like-minded individuals who have demonstrated success in the IT recruitment realm.

, ' ',

What You'll Bring

, ' ',
  • Demonstrated creative thinking an ingenuity
  • Desire to run your own show and an entrepreneurial spirit
  • Clear goals, aspirations and the ability to TELL US what you want out of your career so we can help you get there!
  • Strong history of building lasting relationships, and offering a consultative approach through the recruitment process
, ' ',

Perks of Working with FIRESOFT:

, ' ',
  • Fresh Fruit Delivered to the office weekly
  • Beautiful, waterfront offices, large lounging balcony with a fully stocked beer fridge and BBQ
  • Casual attire Monday-Friday - you choose whether to dress it up or dress it down.
  • Monthly, Quarterly and Yearly Incentives - Our current Top Biller Award is a Trip for two to New York City or all expenses Paid luxury Bali holiday for two - you choose!
  • Strong base salary; we value your experience and demonstrated success
  • One of the most competitive commission structures on the market!
  • Brand new laptop; with entire business access in the cloud for mobility
  • Flexible working culture; we're all adults here
  • Excellent training and development opportunities - Professional training every Tuesday Morning with a team Breakfast supplied!
  • Steadily growing team with leadership opportunities in the near future
  • Only a stones throw (literally...) from all the entertainment, pubs, shopping etc. you could ask for!
, ' ',

If you're thinking this just might be the fresh and inspiring change you're looking for and are ready to kick some goals, get in touch or send across a CV!

, ' ',

, ' ']

title: b'Data Scientist\r\n    '
jd:
['\n',

The NRMA was born to keep people moving, and we have been doing this for nearly 100 years. Our vision is to create indispensable connections with our Members’ mobility through my car, my journey and my destination.

Our Members enjoy our legendary roadside assistance, car servicing and repairs, Thrifty car and truck rentals, the latest fuel prices and more via the mynrma app, discounted travel and accommodation at our Holiday parks, Travelodge and Hotel Kurrajong Canberra

Your opportunity

Data is an incredibly important area of growth for the NRMA. This year we have made a significant investment in our people and technology and have already had a fantastic response for the real-time Fuel and Parking features which we launched in the MyNRMA app late last year. But this is just the beginning.

The Data Scientist will have a stronger focus on expanding and enriching our member-customer data assets & capability, through close collaboration with Technology and Product Management.

Here is where you come in!

, '\n',
  • Support the continuous expansion and enrichment of Data Assets and Capabilities
  • Perform predictive analytics and build models for customer engagement, retention, lifetime value
  • Grow data and business knowledge of Membership and Group Businesses
  • Ensure timely and accurate delivery of reports for designated stakeholder groups
  • Hands on analysis and visualization of complex web based data utilizing a variety of tools
  • Manage the campaign data design, build, delivery, and measurement of all Member and Customer communications
, '\n',

Your experience

You will have the customer experience at the heart of what you do and be able to demonstrate:

, '\n',
  • Tertiary related qualification in computer science, statistics, marketing, or IT related discipline
  • Minimum 7 years’ experience in an analyst role responsible for campaign, reporting, and analysis
  • Advanced SQL skills and experience dealing with large and complex data sets
  • Ability to adapt and navigate through complex systems
  • Strong analytical, business acumen, and problem solving skills
  • Possess a positive “can-do” attitude couples with excellent communication skills
  • Experience in data warehousing, data modeling, propensity modeling and scoring, statistical inference and validation, segmentation, clustering, regression and response modeling
, '\n',

Your benefits

We offer a competitive remuneration and our benefits include 50% discount on insurance, free NRMA Premium Care Membership , product and travel discounts, 50% discount on Village Roadshow Theme Parks, plus many more!

We moved to a brand new office in Sydney Olympic Park. Here you will enjoy the convenience of free parking or being on the doorstep of the train station, plus the atmosphere of vibrant cafes and restaurants to appease your appetite.

Your journey with us starts here, so get in the driver’s seat and take control of your career. Apply now.

, '\n',
, '\n']

title: b'\r\n          Project Scientist Chemical Reference Methods\r\n        '
advertiser: DEPARTMENT OF INDUSTRY, INNOVATION AND SCIENCE -
jd:
[' ',

We require an enthusiastic and expert measurement scientist with the ability to apply reference measurement procedures to trace analyses in complex biological or environmental matrices. You will be happy working with limited direction to deliver scientific research projects. Projects over the next few years employ gas and liquid chromatography, coupled with high-accuracy isotope dilution mass spectrometry (IDMS), so expertise in these techniques is required/essential).

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

For further information and to apply to this role please go to http://careers.industry.gov.au/cw/en/listing/

, ' ']

title: b'\r\n          Senior Environmental Scientist, planner or Engineer\r\n        '
jd:
[' ',

EMM Consulting Pty Limited (EMM) is a leading employee-owned planning and environment consultancy, working throughout Australia and internationally from offices in Sydney, Newcastle and Brisbane.

, ' ',

Our team is led by highly experienced professionals who are leaders in their fields, with a number having held senior national or international positions. They are supported by a talented team from a range of disciplines. Our skills are combined to help clients achieve their objectives in ways that contribute to sustainable outcomes.

, ' ',

Due to strong growth and a commitment to service our clients we have an opportunity for a Senior Environmental Scientist, Planner or Engineer to join our Environmental Assessment and Management team.

, ' ',

In this role you will have the opportunity to work with and be mentored by industry leaders. You will be part of a team working on a range of projects including environmental impact assessments, preparation of environmental management plans and compliance audits. You will have the opportunity to work within different sectors including transport, energy, mining and extractive industries, infrastructure, land development and agriculture. 

, ' ',

This role can be based in either our Sydney or Newcastle office.

, ' ',

The successful candidate will be an enthusiastic individual who can demonstrate the following:

, ' ',
  • a degree in environmental science, planning, engineering or related discipline;
  • five years or more of technical experience (within a consultancy would be an advantage);
  • project management experience within the approvals area;
  • a strong level of knowledge and commitment to the principles of environmental assessment and/or planning assessment;
  • high level of clear written and oral communication skills;
  • ability to research, prepare documentation and draw conclusions to support recommendations for review.
  • an appreciation of relevant NSW and Commonwealth legislation;
  • be able to show initiative and be proactive;
  • a highly organised approach and the ability to handle multiple projects;
  • good interpersonal skills including the ability to liaise with the team, clients and all relevant stakeholders;
  • sound judgement and initiative;
  • a willingness to learn and be mentored;
  • the ability to be an enthusiastic team player; and
  • a strong work ethic.
, ' ',

You must have a current valid unrestricted drivers licence.

, ' ',

EMM is highly committed to our staff, clients and the community. We offer an opportunity to work with passionate people in a very positive culture.

, ' ',

If you believe that you meet the requirements as stated above please submit your application via email to careers@emmconsulting.com.au. Please quote reference "EA&M SC SYD/NTL 0517". To have your application considered it must include a tailored covering letter addressing key criteria, full professional CV and a copy of your qualifications. Applications close Monday, 22 May 2017.

, ' ',

EMM is an equal opportunity employer. Only those with a legal right to work in Australia may apply.

, ' ',

Unsolicited resumes from recruitment consultants will not be accepted.

, ' ']

title: b'\r\n          Veterinary Research Assistant\r\n        '
jd:
[' ',

We are a multinational veterinary contract research organisation looking for a RESEARCH ASSISTANT to fill a full-time role in our R&D department.

, ' ',

Eurofins SCEC services the animal health industry, both in Australia and internationally, specialising in the design, management and execution of veterinary (equine, canine and feline) research projects. This role presents a fantastic opportunity to become involved in the animal health industry in a  unique and rarely offered position.

, ' ',

The successful applicant will support our R&D Team (consisting of veterinarians, research scientists and nursing and technical staff) in our office and field-based projects. We do not conduct bench-top research.

, ' ',

Our office is located on Sydney's North Shore and our field station is in Western Sydney. You will be required to work at both locations and on occasion you will be required to travel interstate.

, ' ',

The role includes, but is not limited to:

, ' ',
  • Assisting with the preparation of study protocols, data capture sheets, study kits, etc
  • Prepare and submit animal care/ethics applications and monitor licence renewals
  • Complete and monitor the accuracy of data capture sheets
  • Collate and review raw study data
  • Recruit, screen and enrol clinical cases based on study criteria
  • Assisting veterinarians and research scientists with field work
  • General office administration duties (including ordering & inventory management)
, ' ',

Essential criteria:

, ' ',
  • Science degree or similar tertiary training 
  • Excellent organisational skills and ability to multi-task
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • High level of attention to detail and accuracy, with regard to study reporting and documentation
  • Have a strong interest in working in the animal health industry
, ' ',

Desirable Criteria;

, ' ',
  • Previous animal-handling experience (cats, dogs, horses)
  • Previous experience running or participating in clinical trials, including a working knowledge of GCP/GLP
, ' ',

Salary is negotiable and commensurate with relevant experience.

, ' ',

Please forward your CV and a cover letter outlining your experience and availability to melissa@scec.net.au

, ' ']

title: b'\r\n          Project Scientist Chemical Reference Methods\r\n        '
advertiser: DEPARTMENT OF INDUSTRY, INNOVATION AND SCIENCE -
jd:
[' ',

We require an enthusiastic and expert measurement scientist with the ability to apply reference measurement procedures to trace analyses in complex biological or environmental matrices. You will be happy working with limited direction to deliver scientific research projects. Projects over the next few years employ gas and liquid chromatography, coupled with high-accuracy isotope dilution mass spectrometry (IDMS), so expertise in these techniques is required/essential).

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

For further information and to apply to this role please go to http://careers.industry.gov.au/cw/en/listing/

title: b'Coastal Hazards Scientist/Engineer\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

NIWA is a dynamic research organisation whose purpose is to enhance the economic value and sustainable management of New Zealand's aquatic resources and environments, to provide understanding of climate and the atmosphere and increase resilience to weather and climate hazards.

, ' ',

We are seeking a scientist or research engineer to undertake research and consulting projects with a focus on coastal and estuarine hazards, sea-level rise, and coastal risk exposure to address the question of how to achieve adaptation to coastal climate change in the New Zealand context.

, ' ',

You will apply your analytical, modelling and data analysis skills to a broad range of coastal hazard and climate-change adaptation projects within NIWA and via external research collaborations. You will work closely with physical scientists, modellers, engineers, planners, social scientists and economists to translate science and climate change and sea-level rise projections into adaptive approaches to reduce future risks to coastal and estuarine communities and infrastructure. You also need to have the potential to develop and lead external collaborative research and consultancy projects.

, ' ',

You will have at least a PhD level qualification in coastal, ocean or earth sciences, physics or environmental/civil engineering, followed by several years' relevant applied or post-doc experience. Previous experience with hydrodynamic or climate-ocean modelling, sea-level gauge analysis, satellite altimetry, and familiarity with vulnerability and risk assessments and extremevalue analyses are preferable. Time-series and statistics data analysis skills, using Matlab, R or Python, along with an established science publication record, are essential.

, ' ',

Well-developed and proven writing skills for both scientific papers and applied consultancy reports along with clear verbal communication and presentation skills are also essential attributes.

, ' ',

Position description and online application can be found here: https://careers.sciencenewzealand.org/niwa/niwa-jobs

, ' ']
