title: b'Data Scientist\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

As a Data Scientist, you will work with different divisions to uncover their key business problems and implement data science solutions to create value for the organisation. You will work proactively on:

, ' ',
  • Identify where data science can create value or solve problems for the business and use your skills and experience to do so
  • Take responsibility for project delivery, communicate and develop relationships with all stakeholders
  • Be accountable for end-to-end predictive modelling from exploratory analysis to feature engineering to performance evaluation
  • Design and implement data science solutions that will deliver the expected business outcomes
  • Communicating data driven insights to stakeholders at all levels
  • Participate in regular training sessions to share best practices and develop knowledge of current and emerging technologies to constantly uplift the team's capabilities
, ' ',

Our Ideal Person

, ' ',

Postgraduate qualifications (PHD or Masters with a research component) in a relevant field with experience in data science working with large datasets. Extensive knowledge of varied machine learning models and analytical techniques.

, ' ',

SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

, ' ',
  • Strong experience in analytical tools, processes and practices
  • Worked with R, Python or other open source tools
  • Strong SQL skills Data modelling skills
  • Machine Learning programming capability
  • Software engineering background
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong problem solving and presentation skills
  • Passionate about analytics
, ' ',

If you have the relevant prerequisites above please e-mail Andreas Mead your CV at andreas.mead@hudson.com or call on 0282 332 346

, ' ',

, ' ']

title: b'Data Scientist\r\n      '
salary: b'Enjoy working  in a flexible environment!'
jd:
[' ',

Our Company

, ' ',

Tabcorp is one of the few integrated gambling and entertainment companies in the world. We deliver excitement and fun to our customers through our retail, digital and media platforms.

, ' ',

Our 3,000 strong team is as diverse as Australia itself. Our people drive leading brands and industry-first sustainability efforts, here and internationally. They’ve also made Tabcorp a top 100 ASX company.

, ' ',

This leadership is reflected in who we are. If, like us, you’re a passionate, positive playmaker and you want to use your talent to create amazing outcomes, we’d love to hear from you.

, ' ',

Role Summary

, ' ',

As part of the Chief Marketing Office, the Data Science and Analytics team engage with business stakeholders from all key business areas, including marketing promotions and customer relationship management, wagering and pricing, risk and compliance, and digital channels. We leverage analytics to provide advanced data-enabled initiatives, creating the best experience for our customers and delivering the maximum value for our company.

, ' ',

One major strength of our team is diversity: we have people with advanced degrees in computer science, machine learning, statistics, natural language processing, sport science, etc. We come to work with the excitement of learning something new every day from other team members.

, ' ',

How you will contribute

, ' ',

As a Data Scientist, you will work with different divisions to uncover their key business problems and implement data science solutions to create value for the organisation. You will work proactively on:

, ' ',
  • Identify where data science can create value or solve problems for the business and use your skills and experience to do so
  • Take responsibility for project delivery, communicate and develop relationships with all stakeholders
  • Be accountable for end-to-end predictive modelling from exploratory analysis to feature engineering to performance evaluation
  • Design and implement data science solutions that will deliver the expected business outcomes
  • Communicating data driven insights to stakeholders at all levels
  • Participate in regular training sessions to share best practices and develop knowledge of current and emerging technologies to constantly uplift the team's capabilities
, ' ',

Our Ideal Person

, ' ',

Postgraduate qualifications (PHD or Masters with a research component) in a relevant field with sound experience in data science working with large datasets. Extensive knowledge of varied machine learning models and analytical techniques. You will have strong knowledge in any of the following; data visualisation, D3, geo-spatial, Tableau. Practical experience in Python/R with expertise in Scala and expertise in big data systems like kafka, Hadoop and traditional RDBMS.

, ' ',

When you join our team you’ll be able to take advantage of a range of benefits including flexible working arrangements, leadership and development programs and community programs.

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ']

title: b'Data Analyst / Data Scientist\r\n        '
jd:
[
, ' Are you a creative Analytics professional looking for that opportunity where you can contribute to the strategic direction of the organisation?\xa0 This is a newly created group within their Strategic Intelligence team, where you will be applying your research and analytical skills to understand products and markets, identify trends and assess and evaluate risks. You will be able to provide solutions based on behavioural economics.',
, ' \xa0',
, ' As a Data Analyst / Data Scientist, you will contribute to the work of the Strategic Intelligence team by:',
, ' ',
, ' • Working in a team of data analysts / scientists to identify and assess evolving trends, emerging risks and systemic misconduct in financial services and markets',
, ' • Scoping, identifying and establishing data analysis methodologies to address research questions',
, ' • Designing and advising on processes to collect, manipulate, clean and explore data',
, ' • Analysing structured and unstructured data using statistical or machine learning approaches',
, ' • Communicating analytical findings, including through reports, briefings, presentations and data visualisation',
, ' • Contributing to the development of the group and expand its data analytics capabilities',
, ' • Providing expert support to stakeholder teams conducting operational data analysis, and',
, ' • Assisting other teams and working across multi-disciplinary team projects.',
, ' \xa0',
, ' To be considered for this role:',
, ' ',
, ' ', You must have Australian Citizenship and able to get National Security Clearance,
, ' ',
  • Experience using: R, SQL, SAS
  • Bachelor degree in Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or Economics.
  • Advantageous Skills / Experience: Python, Java, Scala, Apache Spark, Hadoop, NoSQL databases, various ML libraries, experience extracting data from Teradata, etc.
  • Experience in applying statistical or machine learning approaches to data analysis.
  • Ability to work independently with limited supervision and be accountable for outcomes.
, ' ']

,

,

title: b'Data Scientist\r\n    '
jd:
['\n',

Join as a Data Scientist working on a large variety of projects and implementing the latest technologies

, '\n',

The Company

This leading consulting group located in Sydney CBD is currently expanding its Analytics division. Their work is focuused on AI implementation, machine learning and advanced analytics. They have a diverse team of data scientists, statisticians, developers and strategists who are focused on delivering unique customer solutions using the latest technologies

The Role

As a Data Scientist you will be designing, developing and implementing analytical solutions and focus on key areas of customers' business. You will closely work with the business stakeholders on factual problem formation, data identification and deriving answers that can solve business issues

Requirements

, '\n',
  • 3+ years experience in a hands on Data Scientist position.
  • Advanced data modelling and statistical analysis skills.
  • 2+ years experience in analytical tools such as ‘R’ and ability to develop multilevel models
  • Ability to build complex models using SQL, DAX, R or Python.
  • Create complex machine learning algorithms
  • Demonstrated strong conceptual and analytical skills, ability to translate complex business issues into well-structured analytics research projects
  • Relevant degree in Statistics, Mathematics or Computer Science
, '\n',

Career Opportunities

This is an excellent opportunity for a Data Scientist to advance the skills using the latest technologies and working in a high-performing team of some of the most talented people in Australia

, '\n',

To apply please click apply or call Kseniia Tkachenko on 02 8289 3139 for a confidential discussion.

, '\n']

title: b'Data Scientist\r\n    '
jd:
[
, '\n',

Your New Company & Team
Enterprise Services (ES) is responsible for the world leading application of technology and operations across every aspect of CommBank, from innovative product platforms for our customers to essential tools within our business.

, '\n',

The Analytics & Information (A&I) team are accountable for the Group's key analytics capabilities including the GDW (Group Data Warehouse), Omnia (Hadoop Big Data Platform), Pega Decisioning, SAS, R, Tableau, Oracle BI, Ab Initio and Data Stage. We are focused on enhancing these to create world-leading capabilities for analytics, information management and decisioning

, '\n',

Reporting into the Data Science Executive Manager, you'll be part of a broader Data Science team.

, '\n',
, '\n',

The Challenge & Project Description
The Senior Data scientist will provide leadership and direction in implementing advance analytics and machine learning. This includes:

, '\n',

1- Project delivery

, '\n',
  • Take ownership (from inception to delivery) of two greenfield innovative projects in pricing / lending as well as, an early-stage project in Digital
  • Demonstrate business acumen in generating ROI (Return on Investment)
  • Engage with business stakeholders to clearly articulate findings as well as decompose business question into data science questions.
, '\n',

2- Drive innovation

, '\n',
  • Apply state of the art statistical modelling/machine learning and data mining techniques to support business analytics teams across the Group
  • Implement an experimentation data platform with associated tools and processes for quick prototyping and evaluation of novel approaches to modelling
  • Develop prototypes
  • Develop clear framework and guidelines for implementation of Data Mining solutions on large-scale production systems
  • An emphasis on coding or practice and on working closely with other teams to insure algorithms are delivered into production systems
  • Demonstrate diligence through concrete action and result-oriented approach
, '\n',

Key Skills & Experience
Do you come from a large, complex, enterprise environment and you possess the following?

, '\n',

1- Hard skills:

, '\n',
  • End to end data science initiatives
  • Large datasets, ideally leveraging Spark, MapReduce and Hadoop
  • Manipulate large datasets leveraging Spark, MapReduce and/or Hadoop
  • Data analysis (e.g. R, SAS, Python, etc)
  • Solve business problems by applying analysis, data mining and modelling (e.g. machine learning, Natural Language Processing, etc)
  • Data visualisation of complex relationships (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI, QlikView, MicroStrategy, etc)
  • NoSQL databases (e.g. HBASE, Cassandra, MongoDB, etc)
  • Comfortable working in a Linux environment
  • Programming /coding in R, Python, Ruby or Scala.
, '\n',

2- Soft skills:

, '\n',
  • Client facing and business engagement on data science initiatives
  • Ability to bridge the technical jargon, for storytelling and business acumen
, '\n',

3- Academic background
Degree in computer science, statistics, mathematics or related disciplines

, '\n',

Highly regarded:

, '\n',
  • Agile (e.g. SCRUM, Kanban, Lean, etc)
  • Financial Services sector experience
, '\n',

People & Culture
The people, businesses and communities we serve are wonderfully diverse. To reflect this, we're committed to hiring a similarly diverse workforce. With a focus on inclusion, accessibility and flexibility, we'll support you at every stage of your career.

, '\n',
  • Data driven culture from top-down for A&I are considered as a Centre of Excellence
  • Academic research (publishing of scientific papers and securing patterns) is at the core of innovation and half of the team holds a PhD
  • There is room for experimentation in the Innovation Labs for Deep Learning
  • You'll be invited to participate into the quarterly Hackathon and Datathon
, '\n',

Impact

, '\n',

You will have the opportunity to directly impact at large scale the Australian economy. If you live the values and demonstrate the people capabilities we can offer great opportunities. Whether you want to move across the organisation or up into a leadership role, the way you live the values and demonstrate the people capabilities are key.

, '\n',



, '\n']

title: b'Senior Data Scientist\r\n    '
jd:
[
, ' ',

, ' ',

Your New Company & Team

, ' Enterprise Services (ES) is responsible for the world leading application of technology and operations across every aspect of CommBank, from innovative product platforms for our customers to essential tools within our business. ',

, ' ',

The Analytics & Information (A&I) team are accountable for the Group's key analytics capabilities including the GDW (Group Data Warehouse), Omnia (Hadoop Big Data Platform), Pega Decisioning, SAS, R, Tableau, Oracle BI, Ab Initio and Data Stage. We are focused on enhancing these to create world-leading capabilities for analytics, information management and decisioning.

, ' ',

Reporting into the Data Science Executive Manager, you'll be part of a broader Data Science team, working in consultation with:

, ' ',
  • Solution delivery managers
  • Project and Program teams
  • Data Science and Data Engineers teams
  • Resource Managers
  • Vendors and third party suppliers
, ' ',

The Challenge & Project Description
The Senior Data scientist will provide leadership and direction in implementing advance analytics and machine learning. This includes:

, ' ',

1- Thought leadership

, ' ',
  • Provide thought leadership to a broad team of architects in general areas of Data Mining and Machine Learning
  • Demonstrate leadership through concrete action and result-oriented approach
  • Apply state of the art statistical modelling/machine learning and data mining techniques to support business analytics teams across the Group
, ' ',

2- Project leadership

, ' ',
  • Take ownership (from inception to delivery) of two greenfield innovative projects in pricing / lending as well as, an early-stage project in Digital
  • Demonstrate business acumen in generating ROI (Return on Investment)
  • Engage with business stakeholders to clearly articulate findings as well as decompose business question into data science questions.
, ' ',

3- Drive innovation

, ' ',
  • Implement an experimentation data platform with associated tools and processes for quick prototyping and evaluation of novel approaches to modelling
  • Develop clear framework and guidelines for implementation of Data Mining solutions on large-scale production systems
  • An emphasis on coding or practice and on working closely with other teams to insure algorithms are delivered into production systems
, ' ',

Key Skills & Experience
Do you come from a large, complex, enterprise environment?

, ' ',

1- Soft skills:

, ' ',
  • Proven experience in business engagement on data science initiatives
  • Immaculate presentation, storytelling and business acumen
, ' ',

2- Hard skills:

, ' ',
  • Manipulate large datasets leveraging Spark, MapReduce and/or Hadoop
  • Data exploration (e.g. SQL, Pig, Hive, etc)
  • Data analysis (e.g. R, SAS, Python, etc)
  • Solve business problems by applying analysis, data mining and modelling (e.g. machine learning, Natural Language Processing, etc)
  • Data visualisation of complex relationships (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI, QlikView, MicroStrategy, etc)
  • NoSQL databases (e.g. HBASE, Cassandra, MongoDB, etc)
  • Comfortable working in a Linux environment
  • Programming /coding in R, Python, Ruby or Scala.
, ' ',

3- Academic background
Degree in computer science, statistics, mathematics or related disciplines

, ' ',

Highly regarded:

, ' ',
  • Agile (e.g. SCRUM, Kanban, Lean, etc)
  • Financial Services sector experience
, ' ',

People & Culture
The people, businesses and communities we serve are wonderfully diverse. To reflect this, we're committed to hiring a similarly diverse workforce. With a focus on inclusion, accessibility and flexibility, we'll support you at every stage of your career.

, ' ',
  • Data driven culture from top-down for A&I are considered as a Centre of Excellence
  • Academic research (publishing of scientific papers and securing patterns) is at the core of innovation and half of the team holds a PhD
  • There is room for experimentation in the Innovation Labs for Deep Learning
  • You'll be invited to participate into the quarterly Hackathon and Datathon
, ' ',

Impact

, ' ',

You will have the opportunity to directly impact at large scale the Australian economy. If you live the values and demonstrate the people capabilities we can offer great opportunities. Whether you want to move across the organisation or up into a leadership role, the way you live the values and demonstrate the people capabilities are key.

, ' ']

title: b'\r\n          Senior Development Scientists and Development Scientist\r\n        '

About the business and the role

BST Biologics is seeking experienced scientists to join its R&D team in process and product development in the field of biological separations. The responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

title: b'Data Architect\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

Our award-winning client is seeking an experienced Data Architect to assess the existing landscape, making key recommendations into the business with a view to implementing Big Data Technologies.

, ' ',

Reporting into the Solution Architect Manager; the initial objective of this role is to clearly understand & document how data is architected across the business and own the vision for future data architecture.

, ' ',

Understanding current state data architecture, technology, data model, & helping to define the future state. The key aspect will involve understanding the different ways in which data is captured and stored, and then looking at solutions to unify including how the data is mastered across the company.

, ' ',

Data is currently stored across a multitude of disparate sources making the current environment challenging. It’s believed the implementation of Big Data Technologies will have a significant impact upon the business; the outcome of this project will determine the next phase.

, ' ',

Your skills, knowledge and experience:

, ' ',
  • At least 5 years’ data architecture experience
  • Strong knowledge of SQL & ETL processes.
  • Excellent working knowledge of Master Data Management
  • Strong Commercial Experience in Data Warehousing
  • Strong knowledge of data modelling
  • Exposure to Big Data Platforms (Hadoop, Scale, Pig, Hive etc)
, ' ',

If this sounds like the ideal opportunity for you then click the APPLY NOW button below or give Steffan Rees a call on 0299931023. *Please note CV’s should be in MS Word format only.

, ' ']

title: b'Data Engineer\r\n    '
jd:
[' ',
  • One of Australia's leading general insurers
  • Full-time or contract positions available
  • Career development opportunities
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

About Us

, ' ',

IAG is the largest general insurance group in Australia and New Zealand, with a growing presence in Asia. IAG owns some of the region's most trusted brands, including NRMA Insurance, CGU, SGIO, SGIC, WFI and Swann Insurance.

, ' ',

At IAG, we believe that everyone has a unique point of view to share, shaped by their life experiences, cultures & passions. We celebrate and commit to:

, ' ',
  • #Proud to be me – we value difference, not sameness
  • #Together – harnessing our collective wisdom enables us to bring our best for our customers & each other
  • #No boxes – it's not about labels, boxes or categories, rather it's about building a diversity, inclusion & belonging mindset into everything we do
, ' ',

In addition to a diverse and inclusive culture, some of our benefits include 13% superannuation, 50% insurance discounts, flexible work and leave options, generous parental leave and return to work program, recognition and reward program, and various corporate partner discounts.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

The Role

, ' ',

The Data Engineer position reports in to our Data & Product Engineering Director and is based in our Sydney CBD Head office.

, ' ',

This role plays a critical role in ensuring that data pipelines are scalable, repeatable, and secure, and can serve 1000's of users.

, ' ',

This role will include developing prototypes and proof of concepts for the selected solutions, and implementing complex data projects with a focus on collecting, parsing, managing, analysing and visualising large sets of data using multiple platforms. You will also have the capability to architect highly scalable distributed systems, using open source tools.

, ' ',

The Data Engineer role is a technical job that requires substantial expertise in a broad range of software development and programming skills. The Data Engineer will have knowledge of data analysis, end user requirements analysis, and business requirements analysis to develop a clear understanding of the business needs and to incorporate these needs into technical solutions. In addition you will have a solid understanding of physical database design principles, and the software development life cycle.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Role Responsibilities

, ' ',
  • Selecting and integrating tools and frameworks required to provide requested capabilities, with a focus on open source
  • Implementing ELT process
  • Monitoring performance and advising any necessary infrastructure changes
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Keys skills and experience required

, ' ',
  • Proficient understanding of distributed computing principles
  • Extensive coding and programming in a range of languages such as Python, Scala, Java, R, etc.
  • Proficiency with open source data storage platforms such as Hadoop
  • Experience with building stream-processing systems, using solutions such as Storm or Spark-Streaming
  • Experience with NoSQL databases, such as Cassandra
  • Knowledge of various ELT techniques and frameworks, such as Flume
  • Experience with various messaging systems, such as Kafka
  • Good understanding of Lambda Architecture, along with its advantages and drawbacks
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

How to Apply

, ' ',

To submit your interest in this role, please click the ‘Apply' button below.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

 

, ' ']

title: b'Enterprise Architect \r\n    '
jd:
[' ',

The Enterprise Architect will help build an IT road map. The role will focus on digital architecture, incorporating both infrastructure and applications for our rapidly expanding business; demonstrating core competencies of strategic systems development, business change implementation and resource management.

, ' ',

Projects are centred around cloud-based solutions, such as building a CRM, expanding our current product offerings and additional services to clients, such as risk management tools and aclient portal.

, ' ',

A very successful Property management company.

, ' ',

Role Purpose:

, ' ',
  • Developing and maintaining the high-level design plan (“roadmap”) for the overall enterprise architecture (incorporating both infrastructure and applications).
  • Develop a target Enterprise Architecture (EA) as a guide to drive consistent business processes, rationalisation of systems, access to accurate and timely information and the delivery of a reliable and efficient technical infrastructure.
  • Initiating projects which evaluate technologies and methodologies to establish and evolve the enterprise architecture.
, ' ',

Responsibilities:

, ' ',

, ' ',

Information Technology Leadership

, ' ',
  • In conjunction with the IT leadership team, develop, communicate and maintain the IT Strategy (vision, objectives and priorities) ensuring alignment with the business strategy.
  • Understand, advocate and augment the business and IT strategies and, more specifically, Enterprise Architecture development and service delivery.
  • Maintaining up to date knowledge of the organisation’s strategic business plans and possible impacts on Enterprise Architecture.
  • Reviewing new and existing Information Technology projects to ensure compliance and integration with Enterprise Architecture by developing, documenting and communicating strategies and standards.
  • Ensure the alignment of stakeholder groups’ technology projects and infrastructure with IT architecture standards and policies.
  • Lead in the research, evaluation and selection of hardware and software technology and product standards, as well as the design of standard configurations.
  • Providing advanced technical consulting in multiplatform IT environments.
  • Identifying and investigating opportunities to utilise and integrate emerging technologies to provide cost effective, flexible solutions.
, ' ',

IT Operations and processes

, ' ',
  • Participate in the analysis of the current technology environment to detect critical deficiencies and recommend solutions for improvement. In addition, lead the analysis of technology industry and market trends to determine their potential impact on the enterprise as well as on the Enterprise Architecture.
  • Developing, maintaining and communicating high-level plans for investing in IT environment/ applications/ infrastructure, including identification and management of cost reduction opportunities.
  • Documenting the strategic direction for business systems planning and architectures, IT infrastructure, voice and data network planning and architecture.
  • Working with users and other IT practitioners to define the requirements of an application and specifying an optimum design for subsequent development.
  • Developing, managing, and undertaking Solution Architecture, either IT infrastructure or applications, typically within project constraints and address any issues considering existing solutions, components and standards. Investigating pragmatic alternatives if they better meet the need and undertake to develop and provide estimates, involving other key stakeholders in the process.
, ' ',

People Leadership

, ' ',
  • Lead, coach, direct, evaluate and develop direct reports within your team to ensure that the organisations plans are implemented effectively, consistently, and according to established guidelines and budgets.
  • Manage and review performance of employees to agreed goals, discuss developmental goals and career aspirations to retain key talent and enhance business performance. Implement plans, developed with the management team to lift performance to necessary levels and act to address unsatisfactory performance.
  • Demonstrate and promote our Values with the aim to facilitate greater internal communication between various teams and promote a positive, high-performance culture.
, ' ',

, ' ',

To apply please click apply or call Sean Canning on +61 2 82893170 for a confidential discussion.

, ' ']

title: b'Data Architect - Information Management\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

My client is looking for an exceptional information architect with strong experience across information management and architecture. Strong technical skill is essential for this role but in addition to this the ideal candidate will possess strong communication skills and have experience influencing senior stakeholders. This is an exciting time to join this market leader as they have established an environment where data is truly valued.

, ' ',

Open to both Perm and Contract candidates

, ' ',

The role

, ' ',
  • Provide leadership on all matters related to information management and architecture
  • Working with the business to define and document information models
  • Developing standards, tools and best practices to enhance Enterprise Data\information Governance and Data Management
  • Providing technical oversight to application architecture and solution development teams in creating business driven solutions adhering to the enterprise architecture and data governance standards
  • Move data into a data lake
  • Creating data models, data definitions, information model and data flow diagrams (Information Architecture) for the data warehouse
, ' ',

, ' ',

Required Skills & Knowledge

, ' ',
  • Extensive experience in creating data and information architecture solutions
  • Financial services experience will be highly favourable
  • Excellent information management and data modelling skills
  • Experience with data lakes is essential
  • Strong communication skills and ability to build senior level relationships
  • Experience building conformed dimensions and understand the principles of reusable components and one version of the truth.

If this sounds like the opportunity for you please apply now or contact Leon Young on 0289863147 or lyoung@morganmckinley.com.au

Morgan McKinley is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy.

title: b'\r\n          Data Solution Architect\r\n        '
jd:
[' ',

EXCITING DATA SOLUTION ARCHITECT POSITION FOR A MICROSOFT TRUSTED PARTNER WHO ARE BUILDING AN ELITE TECH TEAM!

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

BCS Technology (BCS) is an award-winning Australian based Professional Services organisation focusing on the provision of quality consulting in the area of Business Intelligence, Data warehouse and Application Development. We are trusted partners of Cloudera and Microsoft and recently, BCS has been accepted as part of the Microsoft Practice Development Initiative to further develop our Analytics practice on Microsoft Azure.  

, ' ',

We are transforming into a digital provider for the entire world. Founded in 2001, Sydney Australia, BCS has emerged as a leading Professional Services provider, delivering tailored solutions and services to clients throughout the world. With offices now in Sydney, Melbourne, Jakarta, Manila and Delhi, BCS is currently on track to reinvent itself to be one of the world's most reliable data analytics solutions provider. If you are looking to learn and grow, we also sponsor training programs. Come join our team and be a part of this exciting opportunity.

, ' ',

What will you be doing?

, ' ',
  • You will be responsible for the architecture of new Data Analytics platforms on Azure that will allow senior stakeholders to analyse and generate business critical insight for the purpose of business decision making.
  • We prefer those with hands on experience in Azure data but it is not necessary.
  • Experience in databases and analytics, including relational databases, AWS, Data Warehousing, Big Data , NoSQL, Machine Learning, Stream Analytics, Data Factory, Event Hubs , Notification Hubs and business analytics.
  • Understanding of big data use-cases.
  • Understanding of Hadoop-based design patterns knowledge of real time/stream analytics.
, ' ',

Essentials:

, ' ',
  • Bachelor Degree or higher in IT or relevant discipline
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills.
  • Keen eye for detail.
  • Excellent time management.
  • Excellent problem solving and analytical skills.
  • Flexibility to travel - this position requires the person to travel to our international offices for short term assignments when required.
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

If you are interested in pursuing a rewarding career by being a part of an organisation committed to the growth of its customers and employees equally, please don't hesitate to APPLY NOW.

, ' ',

Please send your Resume in Word and we will get in touch with the shortlisted candidates ASAP.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

To be considered, you must be a Permanent Resident or an Australian Citizen.

, ' ']

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

  • Lead communication of technology architecture and provide continuous improvement of broader architecture practice.

, '\n',

, '\n',

title: b'Data Solutions Designer - Big Data\r\n    '
jd:
[
, ' ', Data Solution Designer,
, ' \xa0',
, ' • Are you a Data solutions expert? ',
, ' • Do you want to work for a market leader?',
, ' • Do you want more then just a Job?',
, ' \xa0',
, ' This iconic and respected household name is growing fast. To meet with the ever-expanding data needs the Head of the Data needs a talented data solutions designer to be her go and right hand man/woman.',
, ' In this key role, you will be part of a close knit dedicated small team of industry professionals. This role is both technical and business facing. So, it is essential that you are a confident communicator who can easily understand business needs and talk in techie in non-techie language.',
, ' Your role will include:',
, ' ',
  • Assess business functional and non-functional requirements and seeing these through to becoming fully technical solutions.
  • Insure that Solution Architecture, design the detailed solution design are suitably documented (High Level Design, Interface specs, Detailed design, Data flow diagrams, mapping documentation)
  • You will be involved implementing Data Model, and  developing impact assessment, integrating internal and external data sources and making the data available for analytics and Business Intelligence reporting.
  • Work with the Architects to define design standards and drive continuous improvement of the solutions by finding innovative ways to ensure data quality and increase efficiency
  • Define and maintain overall quality of the code base framework.
  • Work with data developers for successful delivery of projects. 
  • Perform code review and test solution outputs to ensure the build is as per the solution defined
  • Coordinate deployment and release planning activities
, ' \xa0',
, ' ', Core skills required:,
, ' ',
  • 5+ years of data warehouse experience designing and building data solutions using Core RDBMS technology such as Teradata, Oracle, etc and Big Data technologies such as Hadoop.
  • Extensive experience in ETL development and design. Should be technology agnostic and able to pick up a new toolset relatively quickly but expert-level proficiency in at least one- ELT tool - preferably Talend or Informatica.
  • Bachelor's degree in computer science, computer engineering or other technical discipline is essential
  • Knowledge of data modeling and understanding of different data structures - their benefits and limitations under particular use cases
  • Strong requirement analysis and communication skills and ability to act as technical point of contact interacting with Data developers, vendors, internal and external stakeholders
  • Experience in working within a Solution Delivery Life Cycle framework.
  • Familiar with version control systems like Git
, ' \xa0',
, ' \xa0',

title: b'Hands on Architect - C#/SQL - Big Data Flavour\r\n      '
jd:
['This global giant of big data needs to bring another application architect into the local team.',
, ' ',
, ' The role will focus on the ongoing development of their core big data platform, the layers that feed into it, and the backend logic that handles the analysis.',
, ' ',
, ' C# and SQL are the key languages involved. The platform is built around Hadoop, but much of the integration layer and backend is built within C# and SQL respectively.',
, ' ',
, ' Data integration and data integrity are two ongoing challenges for the business. Speed of integration and analysis are also going to be a focus moving forward.',
, ' ',
, " The successful candidate will be a proven architect (this isn't a role for a dev looking to step up), with strong skills around C# and SQL. You would still be expected to cut some code.\xa0A background in data warehousing & analytics would be a bonus.\xa0",
, ' ',
, " You'll also have strong communication skills and be a great influence and be able to win people over.",
, ' ',
, " Your reward? A very interesting & challenging role working with some the big names of Australian business, a great salary package, a great workplace environment (plenty of opportunities for technical development, a staff gym onsite, and an active social club) and a location that cuts 15 minutes each way off the CBD commute (And what's that add up to a year? Actually I'll tell you: the equivalent of 15 days a year!!!) "]

title: b'Data Architect\r\n    '
jd:
[' ',

We are a global technology company, recognised and awarded for powering the world's best multiscreen video experiences. Our product, Massive AXIS is the industry's premier multiscreen video application solution for streamlined apps, flexible UIs and centralised control.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

The Opportunity

, ' ',
  • Lead the way for data architecture and management within our global organisation, implementing end-to-end data solutions to address business requirements
  • Drive the direction of a product that reaches millions of users worldwide through accurate and effective data architecture
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Core Responsibilities

, ' ',
  • Define vision, strategy and principles for data management across the business
  • Identify data needs and relevance to hypothesis testing
  • Define data standards, patterns, technology, governance
  • Collaborate with subject matter experts and IT teams to explore and evaluate technology and solutions, making strategic recommendations that drive business values
  • Present and depict recommendations in order for stakeholders to make data-informed decisions
  • Suggest metrics on business outcomes that are clear, accurate, relevant, logical and honest
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

About You

, ' ',

With 5+ years of data management and architecture experience under your belt, you're looking to take on the next challenge.

, ' ',

You are a naturally driven and ambitious person, who has a keen understanding of business needs and strong communication skills, both written and verbal.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

To be successful, you must have:

, ' ',
  • At least 5 years of data architecture experience, with a proven track record of designing, developing and implementing data systems from scratch
  • Ability to develop a deep understanding of business needs and strategic goals and align data architecture with these
  • Experience with multi-platform data sources and multi-language data sets
  • Demonstrated ability to collaborate and problem solve with business stakeholders and subject matter experts
  • Excellent problem solving and strategic planning skills
  • Confident communication skills – able to convey complex solutions in easy to understand terms
  • An active and driven attitude – leading the organization to test and buy-in to novel solutions to important problems
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Please only apply if you are eligible to work in Australia, permanently, with our team in Redfern.

, ' ']

[' ',

What is this client and role about?

, ' ',

My client is one of the most successful software fintech’s in Australia. Their success comes from building the first and only sophisticated cloud solution to automate highly complicated financial services funds management functions. Their products have transformed an industry.

, ' ',

As part of their ongoing expansion, they are now looking to hire a technical leader for the build of a greenfield automated and AI driven Data Feeds product. In this role, leading a Scrum team you will oversee the transition from the existing data feeds solution to the new solution which will be designed and built by your team. This is a genuinely diverse role (designer, coder, leader and BA) which will include:

, ' ',
  • Team and technical leadership
  • Circa 50% coding (mostly complicated back-end C# and SQL)
  • Be heavily involved in the design of the new product
  • Leading the build and integration of the new product
  • Overseeing modification and enhanced features for the existing data feeds solution.
, ' ',

The right culture and fit?

, ' ',

The developers at our client are passionate, committed, logical, considered, calm, thoughtful, curious and analytical. They know they are good and this is reflected in quiet confidence, completely devoid of smugness or ego. They are not extroverted but are skilled communicators who can both explain and constructively debate complex ideas and logic, as well as engage effectively in product and domain conversations (their senior developers are pseudo BA’s). Your design thinking and ability to look at complex problems from different perspectives is outstanding, as is your ability to then articulate the reasoning behind your solutions and views. You will be someone capable of applying independent critical thinking and helpings others around you solve problems and become better at what they do.

, ' ',

Why would you want this role?

, ' ',

You and your team will engage with product daily, and have direct influence over product direction. You will always know why you are building what you are building and have a voice in deciding how to deliver the highest user value through what you and your team build (they do not hire ‘code monkeys’).

, ' ',

You will be attempting to build a solution which has never been built before, and if successful would be transformational for the Australian financial services industry - build something which could have an industry wide user impact

, ' ',

You will have an interest in building products, making complex things run fast, working with high volume real time data, and having the chance to apply AI and automation to these areas.

, ' ',

You will be working with committed and skilled developers all pulling in the same direction

, ' ',

You will be working with proven developers who have built, and build, ‘first of its kind’ solutions which make incredibly complicated finance functions, simple and intuitive for users for the first time

, ' ',

You will be involved in ‘ever evolving technical and domain challenges’.

, ' ',

You will have a genuine interest in learning a lot about financial services, and how the ‘guts’ of the finance, funds management and wealth management industries work

, ' ',

We do not equate capability with years’ experience, though it is likely you will have 10+ years development experience. You will definitely have worked in successful product environments and from your experience will be able to guide your team on what works and what doesn’t.

, ' ',

A different recruitment experience?

, ' ',

Please apply or call if the above resonates with you, but please note you must have Australian work rights. We will look at all applications. If we do not contact you, it means we have not seen enough direct relevance to our client’s particular requirements. If you do not hear from us, and feel we may have missed something regarding your suitability, then please call to discuss.

, ' ',

This role is being managed by Account Director Dan Gordon on 02 9409 4805. Dan is a certified Scrum Master and Product Owner, and from face-to-face interviews with the clients Head of Development, Lead Architect and Tech Leaders, will provide suitable candidates with a clear account of all aspects of this opportunity.

, ' ']

title: b'Senior Consultant - Data migration - SAS VA\r\n    '
jd:
['Do you want to be the person who exceeds your potential?',
, ' ',
, ' If you have a desire to succeed and drive your own career, Dimension Data offers you the opportunity to make that happen.',
, ' ',
, ' We’re positioned to lead the change in the biggest transformation that the IT industry has seen in decades — and we need your talent, skill, and ambitious ideas. As a Global Top Employer to over 28,000 great people in more than 58 countries, you’ll be working with teams across the world. You’ll be doing great things for our clients and helping them achieve their business ambitions.',
, ' ',
, ' ',
, ' We are looking for a Senior SAS VA Consultant\xa0to deliver solution architectures for complex data & integration projects.',
, ' ',
, ' ',
, ' ',
, ' You will be responsible for:\xa0',
, ' ',
, ' ',
  • Offer solution to architects and development team on their data strategies and data migration solutions
  • Bring in knowledge on enterprise data model, reference data, system of records, system of view and data governance best practices
  • Bring in knowledge, experience and thought leadership in data architecture and data management solution implementation principles, multiple systems into single system consolidation, data migration, transition approach, methodology, business process standardization.
  • Mapping business requirements to solutions
  • Developing integration approach with enterprise systems and security
, ' ',
, ' ',
, ' Experience required:\xa0',

, ' ',
  • Experience working with vendors on migration strategy
  • Experience with Commvault - Archiving
  • Strong analytical ability
  • Experience using Hyper-V and VM Ware 
  • Data centre relocation and migration experience is highly desirable 
  • SAS VA Experience is a must 
, ' ',
, ' ',
, ' \xa0',
, ' ',
, ' \xa0Join our growing global team and accelerate your career with Dimension Data. Apply today',
, ' ',
, ' \xa0',
, ' ',
, ' ',
, ' ', Diversity in Dimension Data,
, ' ',
, ' Dimension Data is an equal opportunity employer with a global culture that embraces diversity.\xa0 All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be unfairly discriminated against on any arbitrary ground including race, colour, sex, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, or other protected category.',

title: b'\r\n          Solution Architect\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',

Equifax powers the financial future of individuals and organisations around the world, using its strength of unique trusted data, technology and innovative analytics. Equifax offer their customers world leading insights and knowledge to help them make informed decisions. 

, '\n',

The Solution Architect is responsible for the production of feasible and effective solution designs in support of Equifax's strategic technical and business objectives. 

, '\n',

It will also essential to develop a deep understanding of business objectives; work closely with other project team members to develop a solution design that meets business requirements and positions Equifax for the future, and ensure that the solution is implemented in accordance with the solution design.

, '\n',

Day to day requirements of this role will include:

, '\n',
  • Develop and resolve the IT solution design to minimise developmental and business risk.
  • Identify software components, infrastructure needs and other key design elements, in order to achieve project goals and deliverables.
  • Work closely with project manager to determine optimal sequence of delivery.
  • Collaborate with the rest of the architecture team to ensure that solution designs are consistent and aligned.
  • In partnership with the development lead for the project, act as the Design Authority to ensure that all project-related technical decisions are aligned to the target state architecture whilst mitigating technical delivery risk.
  • Lead by example in the 'hands-on' tackling of specific challenges as and when they arise.
  • Responsible for ensuring alignment between business requirements and the technical design.
  • Act as the conduit of effective communication between the business owners, business analysts and the development teams.
  • Resolve project issues caused by conflicting priorities, cost efficiency, and other project issues.
  • Advises and contributes to Enterprise Architecture and Strategy development within Equifax.
  • Communicates the technology direction to business stakeholders, project team members and third party suppliers, to ensure alignment and consistency
, '\n',

Simply put, the required skills are:

, '\n',
  • Outstanding written and verbal communication in clarity and articulation. Ability to work with all levels and manner of people.
  • Extensive commercial architecture design skills and experience. Including experience as an architect, senior business analyst, consultant or a team lead in development projects.
  • Demonstrable experience working on enterprise application integration projects.
  • Specific experience in working in a matrix management environment. Be able to clearly explain the challenges and solutions to performance and management issues that are a result of matrix management.
  • Experience working with large data volumes and data marts/warehouses.
  • Experience with data security technologies including; identity and access management systems, multifactor authentication and single sign on, encryption and tokenization.
  • Experience with agile methodologies, preferably Scrum and SAFe.
  • Detail orientated with the ability to see the 'big picture'.
  • Ability to analyse complex systems and document into simple, concise information for easy retrieval by people seeking information.
, '\n',

Every role has its challenges and this roles challenges include:

, '\n',
  • The ability to effectively deal with change
  • Dealing with high need stakeholders
  • Managing short timeframes for delivery
  • Leading the technology teams through reskilling when required.
, '\n',

Why apply for this role and join Equifax?

, '\n',
  • Continuous growth and training
  • Global platforms exposure
  • Be the centrepiece of change
  • Highly respected role within the organisation
  • Autonomous role with solid team support
  • Globally connected role
, '\n',

This really is a great opportunity to join an industry leader not only in the local market but the global market.

, '\n',

If you feel you have the required competencies to fulfil our needs we invite you to apply.

, '\n']

title: b'\r\n          Solution Architect\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',

With so many exciting new DaaS teams out there, it's hard to know who's having the most fun!  Nothing beats one of Australia's fastest growing businesses who are transforming the design industry with their passion for complex projects. If it's new, they're doing it.  With more than 300% growth since their days began, this well positioned leader is ready to take their strategy to the next level. 

If it's all about the team/project and of course the $$, I think we have your match... Still with its start up culture, this is a fantastic opportunity to learn & develop, especially if you're an aspiring technical leader. This is an ideal role for someone looking to utilise their specialist skills, along with their passion for business growth. 

Reporting directly to the Director of Innovation, this position will sit within a medium sized technical team who bring ideas to life....This business works with serious clients with serious strategies for innovation.

, '\n',

If you didn't guess it, we're on the hunt for a truly talented Consultant/Solutions Architect to take on a leadership role as the team expands. 

, '\n',

Key responsibilities:

, '\n',
  • Design and develop innovative technological solutions with specific focus on web and app development.
  • Collaborate with design and development teams to create market-leading solutions.
  • Participate in project design, architecture design, scoping and requirements analysis.
  • Translate business requirements into technical specifications.
  • Assist with implementation throughout the project lifecycle. 
  • Liaise with off-shore development teams to ensure projects meet time, budget and quality objectives.
  • Conduct formal code reviews to ensure consistent quality
  • Contribute to new business activities including pitch presentations.
  • Hands-on coding where required to support development teams.
, '\n',

Key Attributes

, '\n',
  • Comprehensive understanding of web architecture and infrastructure.
  • Extensive experience designing and delivering high quality software solutions.
  • Solid understanding of networks, systems and cloud technologies (AWS).
  • Experience across multiple platforms and frameworks.
  • Excellent programming skills with a deep understanding of software engineering principles. 
  • Deep expertise in software development within a web environment; PHP, server and client side Javascript (JQuery, Node.js, React.js), relational databases (SQL) and NoSQL data stores (MongoDB)
  • Experience in app design and development (Cross-platform and Native)
  • Experience in API design and development
  • High level interpersonal and communication skills with a strong client focus
  • Practical experience in formal project management, including Agile
  • Formal qualifications in Computer Science or equivalent..
, '\n',

This is a great opportunity to work within a dynamic company with a great team culture.  They are committed to work/life balance, creative, and leaders in their field.  

, '\n']

[' ',

Role : Business Intelligence Solution Architect ; Location : Redfern
Contract Duration : 6 months; Availability : Immediate

, ' ',

Purpose of the role :

, ' ',

The BI Solution Architect’s primary purpose is to deliver the technical solution for the Program. The role will help acquire, organise, structure, and label information in an effective and sustainable way that supports the needs of Operational Systems and its stakeholders. The role is responsible for maintaining the domain data models, establishing interface contracts and architecting the end-to-end information flows. It is expected that the role has a good understanding of DAMA’s DMBoK and is preferably CDMP certified. The technology landscape includes Embarcadero, SAP Data Services, Oracle Exadata, SAP Business Objects and Tableau Server.

, ' ',

An incremental approach will be used to deploy business capability over the remaining 18 month timeframe for the Program.

, ' ',

Key accountabilities :

, ' ',
  • Demonstrate good leadership to inspire direction and delivery, develop people, and drive change.
, ' ',
  • Live the NSW Public Sector and organisational values to achieve outstanding outcomes for the organisation and customers.
, ' ',
  • Contribute to the development of the information/data architecture within the Operational Systems domain with a view to establishing Business Intelligence, Data Integration and Data Modeling as significant capabilities.
, ' ',
  • Engage with the business to understand their tactical and strategic demands to ensure a culture of quality customer service.
, ' ',
  • Identify the emerging information management and architecture capability required to ensure the business goals are achieved.
, ' ',
  • Develop the architectural roadmap relating to information and data to ensure business expectations and current and future needs are met.
, ' ',
  • Play an active role in the establishment of ‘best practice’ in relation to all aspects of data and information management.
, ' ',
  • Ensure methods and standards are in place to assist with the organisation’s development of information/data architecture.
, ' ',
    • Team with other internal BI and Data Architects to develop a set of design principles and standards that guide the usage of technologies in the following areas:
, ' ',
  • Operational Data Store and business intelligence
, ' ',
  • Operational Master and Reference Data Management
, ' ',
  • Data Quality, Cleansing and Profiling
, ' ',
  • Data Integration & Meta Data Management
, ' ',
  • Enterprise Data Model, including canonical data models and external reference models
, ' ',
  • Transport Standards based Operational Data Exchange
, ' ',
  • Actively support the Program with definition, guidance, leadership and mentoring during design and delivery to ensure implementations aligned to the Target Architecture
, ' ',

Key challenges

, ' ',
  • Drive innovation and share visions with the team and business
, ' ',
  • Interact with other Architects internally and externally to drive constant improvements
, ' ',
  • Interact and engage with other internal business cluster stakeholders, which includes agencies and external operators.
, ' ',

If you feel this role is for you apply immediately, you can call at (02)9246 6781 to understand more on the role.

, ' ']

title: b'SENIOR DESIGN ARCHITECT\r\n      '

Not only is this company at the forefront of the home building industry in regards to their sales, service and quality but also in regards to their employment policies designed to ensure staff  satisfaction and retention

title: b'Network Architect\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

Primary Purpose of the position

, '\n',

To develop Network Infrastructure Solutions Designs that meets the requirements of clients - This includes network designs that provide high availability/redundancy and geographical resilience (including designing Network Security).

, '\n',

To work with customers, internal and external stakeholders to assist in defining and translating business requirements into costed, working technical network infrastructure solutions designs that are fit for purpose.

, '\n',
  • Designing large Network infrastructure solutions/architectures and associated technologies/software (including hardware/software related costs).
  • Design and documentation of end state solutions for applications (new or migrated) where F5 technologies are used.
  • Assist where required with implementation scheduling.
  • Work with various internal stakeholders providing expertise around Network Design.
  • Provide design guidance and expertise around F5 architecture and migration approaches.
  • Provide Design Consultancy and Governance where required for internal & project work.
  • Consult with business and client stakeholders in the development of network solution designs.
  • Maintain an awareness of technologies within the industry to assist in the development and where appropriate endorsement of solution designs.
  • Provide Presales Network Consultancy for where required for customers.
  • Provide Project Consultancy and Governance where required.
  • Participate in ensuring the viability of the Disaster Recovery and Business Continuity Plans
  • Proactively developing effective working relationships with users and senior management
  • Contributing to operational infrastructure standards. (including ongoing governance)
  • Supervise network design senior systems officers to ensure continuous effective service delivery.
, '\n',

Key Challenges

, '\n',
  • Ensuring Network solutions designs align with operational standards.
  • Work closely with Infrastructure Architects, providing network architecture where required that aligns with strategic initiatives of the organisation.
  • Analysing customer requirements and providing strategies and network solutions that meet business requirements.
  • To role model strong, effective leadership that is based on the organisation's values, driving operational priorities, achieving performance and meeting all legislative and policy requirements,
  • Maintaining current knowledge of contemporary practices, trends, technologies and developments in Information Services and Technology (specifically network infrastructure and associated software).
  • Respond promptly to work and project deliverables.
  • Work closely with customers, vendors and other technical services groups in the delivery of technical solutions designs
  • Communicate openly and clearly on issues as they are identified.
, '\n',

 

, '\n',

The successful candidate will have:

, '\n',
  • Extensive demonstrated experience planning, designing, and implementing highly available/resilient network design solutions, leveraging LTM, GTM, APM and ASM services utilising F5 hardware and software in a complex and multi tenanted enterprise environment.
  • Extensive demonstrated Network Design experience within a Cisco Environment (including core Cisco Data Centre routing and switching technologies, i.e. NEXUS, BGP, OSPF). Additionally, exposure to the following would be advantageous: Wireless, Bluecoat, Avaya, Iron Port, Firewalls – Juniper/ASA/Palo Alto
  • Extensive demonstrated experience in requirements gathering and analysis of network infrastructure and associated devices. Additionally, assist with maintaining design architecture standards and documentation.
  • Extensive demonstrated experience in the design of LAN, WAN and converged network infrastructure within a complex environment, working where required with third party vendors and Telco's (including experience designing Network Security.
  • Excellent organisational skills and experience working in a high volume and demanding professional environment with a capacity to prioritise, multi-task, achieve business goals, perform and always work with a customer focused approach.
  • Demonstrated experience leading a team, always fostering a performance based and customer focused work culture.
  • Demonstrated commitment to ITIL and IT service delivery principles
  • Capacity and willingness, including current NSW driver's license, to travel to business and service locations throughout NSW, which may include overnight stay in regional / remote areas on occasion.
, '\n',

If you feel you have the necessary skills and experience mentioned above then please 'Apply Now' for a confidential discussion

, '\n']

title: b'Network Architect - Routing & Switching\r\n    '
jd:
['\n',

Do you want to be the person who exceeds your potential?If you have a desire to succeed and drive your own career, Dimension Data offers you the opportunity to make that happen.

We’re positioned to lead the change in the biggest transformation that the IT industry has seen in decades — and we need your talent, skill, and ambitious ideas. As a Global Top Employer to over 28,000 great people in more than 58 countries, you’ll be working with teams across the world.

You’ll be doing great things for our clients and helping them achieve their business ambitions. We are seeking a Technical Consultant specialising in Enterprise level Routing & Switching Solutions to join our highly successful NSW Networking business.

Our Technical Consultants are SME’s, working closely with our Solution Architects to design cutting edge solutions in their area of expertise, then leading our technical teams through build and implementation. It's the best of both worlds, a fantastic mix of pre and post sales!

To successfully take on this position, you’ll need proven design, technical architecture and delivery expertise and you will focus on:

, '\n',
  • leading technical teams in project delivery.
  • Acting as the QA point for your team, and enjoy mentoring others.
  • Presenting and leading workshops.
  • Analysing and translating client requirements to technical solutions.
  • Contribute to presales by providing Low Level Design input and technical advisory
  • Oversee the delivery of a project
  • Be the trusted advisor for our clients
  • Working on fixed price projects or milestone based engagements.
, '\n',

Key Selection Criteria

, '\n',
  • CCIE Routing and Switching (Or equivalent knowledge and experience)
  • Enterprise Network routing and switching experience
  • Experienced with Enterprise Virtual Routing
  • LAN, WAN Design, Architecture and Engineering
  • Layer 2, Layer 3 Networking
  • VRF Routing
  • vPC
  • VDC
  • UCS
  • ACI, NSX
  • VXLAN
  • Nexus
  • F5 or Cisco Loadbalancing
  • WAN Optimisation
, '\n',
, '\n', Desirable / Bonus ,
, '\n',
  • Wireless Networking (Cisco, Meraki or Aruba)
  • BYOD
  • MDM
  • Cisco WLC
  • PRIME
  • ISE
, '\n',
, '\n',

The most important thing we look for is a great attitude and someone motivated by career growth - we want to help you succeed!!

Next Step?

To join our high-performance team, apply below or contact Daniel Farrell for a confidential discussion.

We would like to take this opportunity to thank you in advance for your application and advise that due to the tight turnaround time frames we work to for assessment and on-boarding, only candidates that meet the experience requirements and who hold valid Australian work rights will be contacted.


, '\n',
, '\n',
, "\r\nTo be considered for the role click the 'Apply' button or for more information about this and other opportunities please contact Daniel Farrell on 1800 456 122. Please quote our job reference number: 225931.\r\n "]

title: b'Solution Architect- Cloud Solutions\r\n      '
jd:
['Seeking an experienced Solutions Architect with experience with in Azure and Citrix technologies to join a leading managed services company in Data Centre and Cloud.',
, '\n',
, '\n', Responsibilities: ,
, '\n',
  • Prepare tender responses and presentations
  • Validation of the solution with the customer
  • Preparation and facilitation of design workshops
  • Diagnosis and documentation of the technical architecture solution
  • Presentation of relevant technologies to the customer's needs
  • Statement of work preparation - pricing estimates

  • Support the Practice Manager in creating Sales and Marketing material
  • Ensure accurate and quality handover of the technical solution with team members
  • Provide mentoring, training and coaching to team members
  • Pro-actively share knowledge, skills and experiences with colleagues
  • Keep abreast and up to date with current and emerging technology

, '\n',
  • 5+ years experience in new business development in to medium-large organisations across a range of industries.
  • Proven ability to develop solutions for the customer requirements
  • Strong knowledge of networking, operating systems, storage, back-up, databases is essential
  • Knowledge of emerging industry trends with the ability to articulate this into customer solutions
