[' ',

This century old global financial services organisation is the envy of its rivals. They have a fantastic culture and are striving to employ motivated, talented individuals to support their IT environment. Beautiful offices and exciting projects await the successful individual.

, ' ',

We currently require a Pega Lead System Architect who will manage the technical implementation Pega Program for the bank, recommending solutions which meet the needs of strategic objectives and business needs.

, ' ',

The role holder will ensure that Pega implementation is done according to best practice to ensure future extensibility of the platform. They will also provide direction to technical teams, work closely with Program teams, product owners and vendors to ensure that the system meets business vision and strategy for customer service.

, ' ',

This program of work is a transformation program of work to refresh front-to-back systems within the bank. A new business suite platform will be developed in Pega, it will be single interface which internal staff will access in order to manage processes involving clients

, ' ',

Technical Knowledge:

, ' ',
  • Designing solutions to ensure future extensibility of the system
  • Ability to share technical knowledge based on experience with integrating with other systems, data stacks, and security platforms.
  • Manage technical sprint delivery, velocity of technical resources.
  • Mentor team in Pega technical knowledge.
  • Participate workshops and solution review sessions with business stakeholders, ensuring solutions fit business needs and long-term architecture.
  • Participate in DEVOPS project to ensure Pega can be successfully implemented.
  • Manage vendors and other third parties involved in the delivery of project components. Investigate and find resolution of issues escalated during the development process.
  • Ensure solutions are built in accordance to specifications and to a high standard.
  • Ensure support and resolution of issues and questions to the business as required.
  • Represent the business with vendor and other IT teams on Pega related matters.
, ' ',

You must have strong stakeholder management skills, people leadership skills, governance and control and change management experience.

, ' ',

It is expected that you will have:

, ' ',
  • Min of 10 years’ development experience with Java and Object Oriented technologies using open source frameworks
  • Min of 5 years’ experience working in a technical leadership capacity with Pega systems implementation, preferably with experience in 7.2,
  • Ability to direct/make recommendations to business and teams with how Pega systems are designed and implemented;
  • Experience in leading and motivating IT teams;
  • Proficiency in integration concepts such as PRPC with JMS and REST
  • Proficiency in Pega Architecture concepts
  • Strong vendor management skills;
  • Experienced with project management methodologies particularly Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) and Agile.
, ' ',

This is an urgent requirement so apply now!

, ' ']

title: b'Solution Architect/Consultant\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

Intelligent Pathways is an Australian owned technology company. We specialise in strategy, architecture, integration and application development. We work with the latest technologies to solve business problems and help our clients be great at what they do.

, '\n',

We have a successful track record in the delivery of large enterprise, mission critical systems for medium-to-large organisations across the Aviation, Travel, Government, Construction and Education sectors.

, '\n',

We are seeking an experienced and passionate Solution Architect /Consultant to join our market leading team. Based in Sydney, you will have experience in business consulting and be able to conceptualize solutions, build a product roadmap and in turn a technical architecture to solve the customers' business issue.

, '\n',

You will be able to lead a team of people and be able to layout an approach including being able to accurately scope and work with a project manager to cost and manage resourcing for the given project within a client. We are looking for a team player who will be a strong example of our organisation's core values – Dedicated, Engaged, Adaptable, Proud and Aspirational.

, '\n',

This is a key role in our Sydney Services business. You will work closely with the Lead Architect and Delivery Manager across our clients. 

, '\n',

Your mission

, '\n',
  • Understand the client's business context and the challenges they face
  • Conceptualize and document technology solution architectures
  • Produce API specs through Swagger file definition, RAML 1.0 spec, JSON Schema etc.
  • Produce SOAP Service contract definition through WSDL, XSD definition and corresponding BPMN (Business Process Model and Notation)
  • Provide technical leadership and thought leadership on the proposed solution to ensure a quality outcome for our clients
  • Assist and lead the development of applications
  • Continuously improve on standards and enable best practice in the day to day activities and deliverables of the team
  • Establish creditability with the client with the objective of becoming a strategic trusted advisor to guide them through challenges that they face
  • Provide thought leadership and promote the sharing of knowledge across clients and internal teams
  • Help promote and instil a culture of innovation
  • Work with new and existing clients to uncover service opportunities to grow opportunity pipeline
  • Comfortable to present to clients and at industry conferences and events
  • Promote your ideas through blogs
  • Strong DevOps capability around building CI/CD pipelines and managing cloud infrastructure
  • Infrastructure architecture inclusive of firewalls, networking, data storage, data center etc. is essential
  • Security architecture inclusive of infrastructure security, API security, physical location security
  • Security paradigms like JWT, OAuth2.0, CAS Server integration, SAML etc. using spring security framework or equivalent.
, '\n',

Your background

, '\n',
  • Strong technology background with the ability to get into the detail where needed
  • Flexible mindset with an adaptive approach in working with multiple client environments
  • Demonstrated experience in using a service orientated approach to architecting technology solutions
  • Experience in technologies
    • Java7/8 
    • JavaScript, Node.js
    • Experience with Scalability, High Availability, and Microservices
    • Unix/Linux
    • Experience building Web Services and API's using REST
    • Solid software engineering best practices (coding standards, code reviews and test driven development)
    • Exposure with OAuth, SAML
    • Scrum and Agile Development methodologies is a must
    • Spring Boot and Hibernate
    • Exposure to ElasticSearch
    • Solid experience with AWS and NoSQL
    • Docker
    • Experience in software architecture modelling
    • Conceptual, logical and physical software architectures
    • BPMN modelling
  • A strong written and verbal communicator
  • Demonstrated ability to lead a team
, '\n',

If you are looking for an organisation that values your skills and experience, please, apply now!

, '\n',

Whilst we thank all applicants for their time and interest, due to the high volume of applications received, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

, '\n',

*All candidates must have the right to work in Australia*  

, '\n',

A little more about us: http://intelligentpathways.com.au/

, '\n',

Intelligent Pathways will not be utilising recruitment agencies for this role or our recruitment activities in general. We kindly ask agencies to not make any unsolicited calls. 

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

 

, '\n',
, '\n']

title: b'Project Manager - Data Centre Transition\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',

- Sydney Lower North Shore Location

, '\n',

- $800-850 (neg)

, '\n',

- 4 months

, '\n',

The primary objective of this position is to deliver the day to day management of project work, preparing project baseline in terms of scope, time, budget and quality and managing the delivery of the project as per approved baseline. Accountable for ensuring that projects are delivered based on sound architecture, established methodology, timeliness of deliverables within an agreed budget. This role must understand the business objectives for the project to form the basis for day to day management and responsibility of the project liaising with key stakeholders of the progress and risks of each project managed. To be successful in this role, you must have the following skills and experience:

, '\n',
  • Extensive experience in managing IT infrastructure projects and mission critical systems.
  • Proven experience in moving core and critical production servers to alternate Data Centres.
  • Proven ability to liaise with technical teams to facilitate smooth migration/transformation to alternate Data Centres.
  • Proven engagement, facilitation, negotiation and communication skills with a demonstrated ability to build, maintain and use relationships with infrastructure manager, technical team and stakeholders.
  • Demonstrated organisational skills and experience working in a high volume and demanding professional environment with a capacity to prioritise competing demands and deliver in tight timeframes.
  • Extensive experience in project management practises in a large and complex/diverse service industry organisation, including relevant qualifications or equivalent.
  • A minimum level qualification of PRINCE2 Practitioner, or equivalent.
  • Strong knowledge and practical experience in working with project management methodologies and tools, including the ability to scope, plan, resource and monitor project outcomes.
  • Strong analytical skills including the ability to analyse and interpret information, prepare written reports, deal with challenges creatively and achieve business focused solutions.
, '\n',

For more information, call Wendy on 02 82523120 or APPLY NOW to be considered


, '\n',




, '\n',






, '\n']

['\n',

About Superloop

, '\n',

Superloop Limited (ASX:SLC) is a leading provider of digital services in the Asia Pacific region. We design, construct, and operate fibre networks throughout Australia, Singapore and Hong Kong. We have recently acquired BigAir (ASX:BGL) and expanded our capabilities to include Cloud & Managed Services, Fixed Wireless Networks, Campus Connectivity Solutions and Cybersecurity.

, '\n',

The role

, '\n',

Solution Architects - Network are trusted advisors who work closely with the National Corporate Sales Team, they collaborate with clients to understand business requirements, design architectures and deliver professional proposals.

, '\n',

The Solutions Architect will also have responsibility for solution design and in conjunction with the direct sales team will drive new business and cultivate relationships with clients and key decision makers to create new sales opportunities in Networks.

, '\n',

Must have talents

, '\n',

  • Resourceful and self-motivated with a proactive approach to problem solving and process improvement

  • Desire to learn and continue to develop your technical and customer service skills

  • Strong focus on detail and quality

, '\n',

What you'll be doing

, '\n',

  • Work with the sales team to define solutions to customer opportunities, including participating or leading scope of work determination

  • Proactively build relationships with clients to be become a trusted advisor

  • Present ideas in a language to suit the target audience

  • Qualify requests from sales to certify solution proposals are in line with existing product and service offerings

  • Attend requirements gathering meetings with the customer and the sales representative

  • Develop, design, document and deliver scope of works, hour/cost estimates, professional proposals that meets the customer's requirements

  • Provide assistance on BigAir network solutions, product plans and roadmaps.

  • Work with the sales representative to finalise and present sales proposals

  • Manage the pre-sales cases assigned to you in the queue and update as appropriate

  • Build and maintain a thorough and up-to-date understanding of the BigAir / Superloop range of product offerings including their functions and applicability

  • Understand our clients' environments, business needs and provide expertise and consulting on the relevant solutions

  • Coordinate hardware and software bills of material with account teams.  

  • Ensure the the design is properly handed over to the provisioning team at the point of sale

  • Conduct research into emerging technologies and trends, standards, and products

, '\n',

About you

, '\n',

  • Undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Telecommunication and/or related fields

  • Possesses ICT business sales background

  • Strong experience with gathering client requirements and analysis

  • Strong knowledge of systems design principles, requirements specifications, standards development and practices

  • Ability to understand customer problems and apply logic to define potential outcomes

  • The highest level of professionalism, customer service and relationship building skills when interacting with clients, vendors and internal staff

  • Excellent written and oral communication skills, with the ability to empathise and tailor language to the audience

  • Exceptional analytical, conceptual, and problem-solving abilities

  • Able to prioritise and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment

  • Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment

  • Motivated and capable of mentors other team members, particularly at a technical level

  • Extensive experience as a network architect or a similar roles including routing, switching and in particular wifi

  • Experience in designing large scale campus or data centre networks

  • Cisco certified required - CCNP or CCDP - CCIE would be preferred

  • Experience designing and scoping WiFi networks required

  • Ruckus Certification advantageous

  • Juniper Certification advantageous

  • Watchguard advantageous

  • IP WAN Design

, '\n']

title: b'Senior Data Analyst\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

My client is seeking an experienced Senior Business Analyst with knowledge across data warehousing, data modelling and database technologies.

, ' ',

To be successful in the role;

, ' ',
  • Able to work closely with data & solutions architects, developers and testers.
  • Data Warehousing (preferably KIMBLE Data Warehousing or similar)
  • Data modelling (e.g. Erwin, Oracle SQL developer)
  • Database technologies (Oracle, Redshift, SQL Server)
  • Cloud technologies (AWS, Hadoop)
  • Exposure to ETL methodologies
  • Exposure to structured language programming (Hive, Python, VB or Java)
  • SAP
  • Exposure to data visualisation (Qlikview, Lumira, Tableau)
  • 8+ years of data warehouse and/or data visualisation experience
, ' ',

Unfortunately due to the large number of applicants only successful candidates will be contacted.

, ' ']

[' ',

What is this client and role about?

, ' ',

My client is one of the most successful software fintech’s in Australia. Their success comes from building the first and only sophisticated cloud solution to automate highly complicated financial services funds management functions. Their products have transformed an industry.

, ' ',

As part of their ongoing expansion, they are now looking to hire a senior developer who and part of a cohesive Scrum team will help build a greenfield automated and AI driven Data Feeds product. In this role, as an experienced developer, you will assist in transition from the existing data feeds solution to the new solution which will be designed and built by this Scrum team. This is a genuinely diverse role (coder, designer and BA) which will include:

, ' ',
  • Circa 70% coding (mostly complicated back-end C# and SQL)
  • Be heavily involved in the design and development of the new product
  • Play a key role in the integration of the new product
  • Building modifications and enhanced features for the existing data feeds solution.
, ' ',

You & the right culture and fit?

, ' ',

The developers at our client are passionate, committed, logical, considered, calm, thoughtful, curious and analytical. They know they are good and this is reflected in quiet confidence, completely devoid of smugness or ego. They are not extroverted but are skilled communicators who can both explain and constructively debate complex ideas and logic, as well as engage effectively in product and domain conversations (their senior developers are pseudo BA’s). Your design thinking and ability to look at complex problems from different perspectives is outstanding, as is your ability to then articulate the reasoning behind your solutions and views. You will be someone capable of applying independent critical thinking and helpings others around you solve problems and become better at what they do.

, ' ',

Why would you want this role?

, ' ',

This team will engage with product daily, and have direct influence over product direction. You will always know why you are building what you are building and have a voice in deciding how to deliver the highest user value through what you build (they do not hire ‘code monkeys’).

, ' ',

You will have an interest in building products, making complex things run fast, working with high volume real time data, and having the chance to apply AI and automation to these areas.

, ' ',

You will be involved in ‘ever evolving technical and domain challenges’

, ' ',

You will be working with committed and skilled developers all pulling in the same direction

, ' ',

You will be attempting to build a solution which has never been built before, and if successful would be transformational for the Australian financial services industry - build something which could have an industry wide user impact

, ' ',

You will be working with proven developers who have built, and build, ‘first of its kind’ solutions which make incredibly complicated finance functions, simple and intuitive for users for the first time

, ' ',

You will have a genuine interest in learning a lot about financial services, and how the ‘guts’ of the funds management and wealth management industries work

, ' ',

We do not equate capability with years’ experience, though it is likely you will have 8+ years development experience. You will definitely have worked in successful product environments and from your experience know what works and what doesn’t when building high quality software.

, ' ',

A different recruitment experience?

, ' ',

Please apply or call if the above resonates with you, but please note you must have Australian work rights. We will look at all applications. If we do not contact you, it means we have not seen enough direct relevance to our client’s particular requirements. If you do not hear from us, and feel we may have missed something regarding your suitability, then please call to discuss.

, ' ',

This role is being managed by Account Director Dan Gordon on 02 9409 4805. Dan is a certified Scrum Master and Product Owner, and from face-to-face interviews with the clients Head of Development, Lead Architect and Tech Leaders, will provide suitable candidates with a clear account of all aspects of this opportunity.

, ' ']

['\n',

Verser is Australia's recognised premier provider of IT asset handling and remarketing services. We are an independent entity capable of delivering IT services globally working with large and small corporations, Government, Education and equipment vendors to deliver services through the IT asset lifecycle across Australia / New Zealand. From configuration to end of life or refresh and asset purchase, we coordinate all services throughout the asset lifecycles, with emphasis on a smooth transition, businesses to focus on their priorities.

, '\n',

Due to the ongoing growth and innovation taking place within the Sales Team, we require an experienced Service Solutions Architect to join the team to look after the solutioning for all general IT services opportunities and be the primary point of contact for SFDC management and reporting (projections/opportunity management).

, '\n',

Ideally, you will have experience in pricing services in Australia and understand the requirements of collections and deployments, be a fast learner and capable of producing consistently good results in a fast paced environment.

, '\n',

You will be technically minded to be able to deliver the appropriate solution to the customers needs.

, '\n',

Your duties will involve, but will not be limited to:

, '\n',
  • Providing responsive solutions and pricing to our Sales Team to  assist them with developing and closing sales opportunities  
  • You will be the go to person for our Sales Team to as assist them with the companies' capabilities and application to customers/opportunities
  • Liaise with the Sales teams to ensure an understanding of the tender requirements and establish competitive and cost and pricing data for the development of cost proposals in accordance with relevant tender specifications.
  • You will also coordinate with relevant teams and senior staff in developing pricing strategies and making cost decisions. 
  • Acting as liaison with clients to fully understand their requirements
  • Developing and agreeing scope of works, preparing statements of work aligned with the scope and pricing
  • Tracking and updating sales opportunity management via Salesforce or other CRM
  • Ensuring  accurate and quality handover of the solution between sales and service delivery
, '\n',

 We are looking for someone who has the following capabilities:

, '\n',
  • You have impeccable attention to detail and accuracy- need we ask?
  • Happy to work in an exiting and busy environment
  • Be an excel expert; you need to be able to do V Look ups and pivot tables to access the information
  • Strong interpersonal skills and ability to communicate professionally both verbally and in writing
  •  Enthusiastic and engaging personality with excellent personal presentation
  • Team player with the ability to work autonomously and unsupervised (once trained to be proficient with current tool suite)
  • Creative flair with a willingness to share innovative ideas for improvement
  • Have passion, be innovative, self-motivated, focused, proactive and goal-orientated
  • Background in IT would be preferable; sales, costing and pricing of products would be highly regarded however not essential
, '\n',

About Us

, '\n',

Verser is a forward thinking, innovative and diverse company that offers its employees fantastic benefits and is genuinely committed to staff progression and development. You will have the opportunity to learn, opportunity to be recognised, and opportunity for career progression. This is an excellent opportunity for you to make your mark in an innovative Technology group who are fast growing in Australia and New Zealand and work with industry leaders with a demonstrated passion for what they do.

, '\n',

A competitive salary and an immediate start is on offer.

, '\n',

Sounds awesome? Apply now, we have been waiting for you!

, '\n',

If you feel you have what it takes to excel at this role and you share our passion for sales we want to hear from you!  Due to the overwhelming response for this position, only shortlisted candidates will be responded to.

, '\n',

*Only shortlisted candidate will be contacted and you must have Australian Working Experience 

, '\n',

 

, '\n']

title: b'Salesforce Technical Architect\r\n    '

title: b'Cloud Applications Solutions Architect\r\n      '

title: b'Data Scientist\r\n      '
jd:
["An opportunity has arisen looking for a Data Scientist to work with in of Sydney's fastest growing mobile app companies.",
, '\n',
, "\r\nMy client produces the most used app of it's type in the world. This means we they have some very interesting scalability challenges across the whole stack.",
, '\n',

Key Responsibilities
, '\n',
  • Understand and identify what data is available and relevant, including internal and external data sources, and leverage data collecting process.
  • Undertake advanced data analysis, algorithm design, hypotheses testing, and model building.
  • Develop production-level data products.
  • Innovate approaches to solve business problems and communicate results and methodologies.
  • Evaluate, validate and provide on-going tracking of performance of decision models.
  • Make improvements to methods and algorithms that lead to new findings and refined results.
  • Create analyses that tell a "story" focused on insights, not just data.
  
Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)
  
  • Demonstrated ability to quickly understand data and new concepts
  • Implemented enhancements of the algorithm and data collecting process as needed
  • Can independently work from start to end: structuring problem, dealing with data, architecting solution at optimized cost and suggesting improvements
  • Key findings are presented to all staff both from IT and the business perspectives such that they're educated, engaged and able to contribute meaningful ideas
  
Key Knowledge and Experience
  
  • Hands on experience with Machine Learning and Statistical Modelling
  • Strong scripting skills (SQL and at least one of R, Python, Scala, Java, C, etc.)
  • Natural Language Processing techniques
  • Experience with Big Data frameworks (Spark, Flink, Kafka, etc)
  • Experience with AWS services (EC2, Redshift, RDS, EMR, etc)
Please apply within if interested

title: b'BI Solutions Architect\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

Our client, NSW Government is seeking to appoint a BI Solutions Architect to join the team for an exciting project underway.
This contract role is to commence immediately for a 6 month period.

, '\n',

The Primary purpose of this role is to consolidate the data for 25+ sources and disseminate data and information.

, '\n',


Reporting to the Program Manager, the BI Solution Architect’s primary purpose is to deliver the technical solution for the Program. The role will help acquire, organise, structure, and label information in an effective and sustainable way that supports the needs of Operational Systems and its stakeholders.

, '\n',

The role is responsible for maintaining the domain data models, establishing interface contracts and architecting the end-to-end information flows. It is expected that the role has a good understanding of DAMA’s DMBoK and is preferably CDMP certified. The technology landscape includes Embarcadero, SAP Data Services, Oracle Exadata, SAP Business Objects and Tableau Server.
An incremental approach will be used to deploy business capability over the remaining 18 month timeframe for the Program.

, '\n',

Key accountabilities

, '\n',

• Demonstrate good leadership to inspire direction and delivery, develop people, and drive change.
• Contribute to the development of the information/data architecture within the Operational Systems domain with a view to establishing Business Intelligence, Data Integration and Data Modeling as significant capabilities.
• Engage with the business to understand their tactical and strategic demands to ensure a culture of quality customer service.
• Identify the emerging information management and architecture capability required to ensure the business goals are achieved.
• Develop the architectural roadmap relating to information and data to ensure business expectations and current and future needs are met.
• Play an active role in the establishment of ‘best practice’ in relation to all aspects of data and information management.
• Ensure methods and standards are in place to assist with the organisation’s development of information/data architecture.
• Team with other BI and Data Architects to develop a set of design principles and standards that guide the usage of technologies in the following areas:
o Operational Data Store and business intelligence
o Operational Master and Reference Data Management
o Data Quality, Cleansing and Profiling
o Data Integration & Meta Data Management
o Enterprise Data Model, including canonical data models and external reference models
• Actively support the Program with definition, guidance, leadership and mentoring during design and delivery to ensure implementations aligned to the Target Architecture.

, '\n',


Key challenges

, '\n',

• Drive innovation and share visions with the team and business
• Interact with other Architects internally and externally to drive constant improvements
• Interact and engage with Transport cluster stakeholders, which includes agencies and external operators

, '\n',

Key relationships

, '\n',

• Program Manager - Escalate issues, keep informed and advise and receive instructions
• Program Team - Work cooperatively within the team, exchange information and assist other team members to achieve team objectives and work outcomes
• Analytics centre - Ensure alignment with broader Analytics framework and data governance practices
• Operating Agencies and Program Stakeholders - Work cooperatively and proactively with operating agencies and program stakeholders
• Externally - Participate in forums, groups to represent agency and share information

, '\n',

Essential selection criteria

, '\n',

• Good understanding of DAMA’s DMBoK
• Preferably CDMP certified.
• Working knoweldge of technology landscape includes Embarcadero, SAP Data Services, Oracle Exadata, SAP Business Objects and Tableau Server
• Previous Government experienced preferred although not essential
• Strong communicator both verbal and written
• Australian citizenship or Permanent residency status required

, '\n']

title: b'Solution Architect | Big Data Engineering | Strategic role |\r\n    '
jd:
['Seeking a dynamic Solution Architect to join a leading Australian Enterprise client and become an integral player in the Data Engineering team. The Solution Architect / Designer will play a critical role in defining the future state data management capability being built on Big Data capabilities like Hadoop & NoSQL databases as well as by leveraging traditional DW technologies where applicable.\xa0\xa0',
, ' ',
, ' The candidate filling this role is expected to take the lead in gaining a technical understanding of Big Data technologies and in particular, gain working technical knowledge of managing massive volumes of data leveraging Hadoop, Spark and Talend.',
, ' ',
, ' This role is a strategic role and will be working closely with senior management and business stakeholders. This role offers an excellent salary package along with an excellent investment into the chosen candidates long term career.',
, ' ',
, ' ',
, ' ', Key Career experience:, '\xa0',
, ' ',
  • Minimum 5 years of experience creating Data Marts / DW architectures,
  • Hands-on experience working in across Big Data Engineering platforms.
  • Experience delivering against long-term, strategic technology roadmaps
  • Success leading multiple projects using the Agile methodology
  • High accountability with a demonstrated ability to deliver
  • Demonstrated ability to communicate clearly and concisely ideas (both verbally and in writing) to executives and technologists
  • Relevant Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience
, ' ', Primary Responsibilities:,
, ' ',
  • Architect solutions for key business initiatives ensuring alignment with future state analytics architecture vision.
  • Work closely with the project teams as outlined in the Agile methodology  providing guidance in implementing solutions at various stages of projects
  • Roll up your sleeves and work with project teams to support project objectives through the application of sound architectural principles
  • Develop and validate that the proposed solution architecture supports the stated & implied business requirements of the project
  • Review technical team deliverables for compliance with architecture standards and guidelines
  • Adopt innovative architectural approaches to leverage in-house data integration capabilities consistent with architectural goals of the enterprise
  • Create architectural designs for different stakeholders that provide a conceptual definition of the information processing needs for the delivery project
, ' ', If this role is of interest then please contact Gino Lancaster on 0401 735 235 for a confidential chat. ,
, ' ',
Data Talent Australia is one of the leading Data Engineering recruitment partners working with a range of Innovative Organisations across Australia
,
, ' ', If you are currently looking for a new opportunity across Data Engineering and Insights & Analytics in Australia then visit www.datatalent.com.au 
, ' ']

title: b'Technology Engagement Manager\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

Fast Paced Australian based organisation are looking for a Delivery focused Technology Engagement Manager. In this role you will build strong mutual advocacy for technology with business needs within IT, ensuring appropriate business and technology engagement. You will be required to shape and manage all business demand from assigned business units including facilitation of accurate and comprehensive business cases and compliance with all IT processes, policies and governance. You will also provide a high degree of insight and accuracy in the translation of business strategy, business problems and business opportunities into valuable information technology investments.

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

Responsibilities;

, '\n',
  • Provide strong leadership to IT and assigned business units to enable greater business/IT alignment and partnership
  • Build an effective and mutually beneficial 'trusted partner' relationship between the designated business units and IT ensuring appropriate business/IT engagement
  • Provide input into strategic planning initiatives based on intimate knowledge of the business strategy, problem or opportunity
  • Advise business on  the benefits and  risks of  using technology to  build competitive advantage and improve business performance
  • Respond to tactical needs and emergent priorities actively working to re-plan and coordinate the right response.
  • Work with business stakeholders to define outcomes and business benefits for initiatives
  • Lead the project initiation process by working collaboratively with IT Business Change, the aligned Enterprise Architect and delivery colleagues (PM/PDM/Infra) to define the scope and provide high-level estimates for initiatives.
  • Influence assigned business units to ensure that the ongoing service delivery and support meet agreed on customer requirements
  • Participate in service review meetings (with the business and Platform Services Managers)
  • If appropriate, manage any discretionary budget allocated to explore small business innovation ideas.
, '\n',

Experience Required;

, '\n',
  • At least 10 years of experience in IT, with at least 3 years’ experience in a business environment, coupled with tertiary level qualifications in Business, Science, Engineering or Economics
  • Minimum 7 years’ experience working in an IT environment
  • Tertiary qualification in the field of Business Studies, Information Systems, or Engineering(Desirable)
  • Familiar with the Software Development Lifecycle
  • Ability to present to C-Suite and Senior Stakeholders
  • Able to develop technology capability needs and solutions based on business requirements
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Experience liaising and influencing at Executive level
  • Outcome focused with demonstrated ability to meet deadlines
  • Collaborative approach to problem-solving
, '\n',

, '\n']

[' ',

Enterprise Architect

, ' ',

Company:

, ' ',

This energy services business operates the largest electricity network in Australia. They deliver a safe and reliable electricity supply to more than 1.7 million homes and businesses in parts of
Sydney, the Central Coast and the Hunter regions of New South Wales. Their electricity network connects communities across more than 22,000 square kilometres. It includes
almost 50,000 kilometres of powerlines, more than 230 major substations and 31,000 distribution substations.

, ' ',

, ' ',

The Role:

, ' ',

This energy provider is undertaking major transformation initiatives to implement programs which would enable them to build a sustainable future, improve safety, provide value to customers, communities and stakeholders, reduce costs and explore ways to become more efficient.

To ensure the success of the program, they are seeking highly capable, performance driven and solutions focussed professionals to work with them to deliver the program.
The ICT Transformation Enterprise Architect will be responsible for developing, communicating and maintaining transformation strategies, architecture, roadmaps and standards, and will work with all program initiatives with the ICT Transformation Program.

, ' ',

Key Accountabilities for the role will be:

, ' ',
  • Design all interfacing and data relationships for strategic ICT projects and interfacing systems
  • Operate as the conduit and single point of contact between the ICT Transformation Program and the existing ICT landscape and incumbent experts
  • Prepare the detailed system interface testing design and troubleshoot issues
  • Develop, communicate and implement ICT transformation application strategies
  • Broad experience in a wide range of information systems technologies and technical architectures
  • Develop and implement end-state application architectures
, ' ',

, ' ',

Skills & Experience:

, ' ',
  • Tertiary level qualification in business or an IT related discipline; or related industry qualification
  • Extensive experience in the design and deployment of large scale cloud-based solutions and migrations
  • Demonstrated experience in developing, communicating and maintaining technology architectures, roadmaps, policies and standards
  • Broad experience in a wide range of information systems technologies and technical architectures
  • Demonstrated ability to lead senior technical staff in matrix management teams
  • Advanced written and oral communication skills
  • Ability to negotiate, consult and persuade in a business and technical environment
  • Proven technical and interpersonal skills are required to develop sound communications options
  • Ability to affect change through technical leadership
  • Flexibility to work in a dynamic environment
  • Well-developed solution architect and technical skills across a broad range of transformation technologies
  • Well-developed infrastructure architecture, solution design and technical skills across a broad range of infrastructure technologies as they relate to the environment such as (but not limited to):
    • Cloud technologies such as Azure, AWS, etc
    • Customer platform/CRM technologies
    • Office 365
    • SAP (including HR)
, ' ']

title: b'Big Data Principal Technical Lead\r\n      '
jd:
['Due to our long standing partnership with this Financial Services heavy weight possessing an extensive product offering across retail and consumer, institutional investment and business banking we are now seeking to add a highly skilled and Big Data\xa0Principal\r\n Technical\xa0Architect/Lead\xa0to the\xa0organisation on a permanent\xa0basis.',

, '\xa0',
, "\r\nRenowned for their innovation\xa0 this is the time to join a high performing team within an industry leader where you join like minded individuals in an organisation committed to investing not only in its people but it's technology!",
, '\r\n\xa0',
, '\r\nYou will work directly with the Senior Solutions Architects, Business Stakeholders, Suppliers\xa0and any other key decision maker where you will be called upon to provide expert advice on\xa0 the best technical practices to ensure a smooth and successful implementation\r\n within this large scale and highly complex environment.',
, '\r\n\xa0',
, '\r\nYou must have worked on multiple projects, hopefully from an array of environments or sites.',
, '\r\n\xa0',
, '\r\nWe would expect that one or more of the implementations you contributed to directly is now operational.',
, '\r\n\xa0',
, '\r\nMore details are outlined directly below:',
, '\r\n\xa0',
, '\n',
  • Provide high level technical solution definition and design oversight  with the goal of providing an agile, lower cost, reliable, stable and operationally sound platform that meet business requirements.
  • Apply Big Data expertise and knowledge to inform multiple Solution Architects and ensure design are optimized to ensure high quality solutions are delivered to the business
  • Source and manage solution design outcomes, develop design documentation and obtain approval from key stakeholders for projects to ensure that solutions are 'fit for purpose' and also take into account the requirements of stakeholders, the Enterprise Information Architecture and the strategic objectives
  • Evaluate and provide expert diagnosis and resolution of complex service (cross infrastructure/application) issues that may arise during the  life cycle to ensure effective development, maintenance and support of the platform
  • Review and recommend development techniques, strategies and vendor products, and make recommendations on the acquisition of advanced technology to ensure Big Data solutions meet the Technology and Business requirements
, '\r\nIf this is you then please read on for the few points to ensure your success',
, '\r\nThe role will require evidence of the following:',
, '\n',
  • Enterprise level Technical Lead demonstrating full productionised systems in many instances - Ideally Hortonworks Implementations
  • Big data technical environments gained either locally or internationally.
  • Skilled in advising, recommending and providing expert advice across multiple technical domains
  • Ability to work with a range of stakeholders including those listed above as well as technical  platform owners and external providers.
  • Skilled at managing competing priorities
  • Ability to overcome roadblocks and positively influence to achieve buy in from stakeholders whilst fostering long term positive relationships both technical and non technical.
  • Extensive IT industry experience with many of them in a highly technical role
  • Many years implementation experience on enterprise level platforms with strong knowledge in the Big Data domain, including:
    • Enterprise DataWarehouse / Data Lake architectures
    • ETL processes and tools
    • Data modelling techniques
    • Data load frameworks
    • Master data and metadata experience
  • Solid design experience as part of major information management programs with responsibility for solution design and detailed technical design
  • Demonstrated ability to work in cross-functional teams to evaluate and implement designs working from POC through to presenting solutions in an easy to understand manner for non technical stakeholders and Executives. 
  • Experience working in Agile projects particularly within Java highly advantageous
, '\r\nThis an exception opportunity for a highly experienced Big Data Technical Lead/Architect who would like to commence a meaningful long term career with an employer of choice.Plus there is nothing more exciting on seeing you designs and all your hard work come\r\n to life!',
, '\r\nFor any queries please do not hesitate to contact Rebecca Ward on (02) 92498041 with any questions or to register your interest.',
, '\r\n\xa0',
, '\r\n\xa0',
, '\n']

title: b'Technology Engagement Manager-Property\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

Top ASX Property/Asset Management organisation are looking for a Technology Business Engagement Manager to provide strong mutual advocacy for technology within assigned business units and for business needs within IT, ensuring appropriate business and technology engagement. You will be required to shape and manage all business demand from assigned business units including facilitation of accurate and comprehensive business cases and compliance with all IT processes, policies and governance. You will also provide a high degree of insight and accuracy in the translation of business strategy, business problems and business opportunities into valuable information technology investments.

, '\n',

Responsibilities;

, '\n',
  • Provide strong leadership to IT and assigned business units to enable greater business/IT alignment and partnership
  • Build an effective and mutually beneficial 'trusted partner' relationship between the designated business units and IT ensuring appropriate business/IT engagement
  • Provide input into strategic planning initiatives based on intimate knowledge of the business strategy, problem or opportunity
  • Advise business on  the benefits and  risks of  using technology to  build competitive advantage and improve business performance
  • Respond to tactical needs  and emergent  priorities actively  working to  re-plan and coordinate the right response.
  • Work with business stakeholders to define outcomes and business benefits for initiatives
  • Lead the project initiation process by working collaboratively with IT Business Change, the aligned Enterprise Architect and delivery colleagues (PM/PDM/Infra) to define the scope and provide high-level estimates for initiatives.
  • Influence assigned business units to ensure that the ongoing service delivery and support meet agreed on customer requirements
  • Participate in service review meetings (with the business and Platform Services Managers)
  • If appropriate, manage any discretionary budget allocated to explore small business innovation ideas.
, '\n',

Experience Required;

, '\n',
  • At least 10 years of experience in IT, with at least 3 years’ experience in a business environment, coupled with tertiary level qualifications in Business, Science, Engineering or Economics
  • Minimum 7 years’ experience working in an IT environment
  • Tertiary qualification in the field of Business Studies, Information Systems, or Engineering(Desirable)
  • Familiar with the Software Development Lifecycle
  • Ability to present to C-Suite and Senior Stakeholders
  • Able to develop technology capability needs and solutions based on business requirements
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Experience liaising and influencing at Executive level
  • Outcome focused with demonstrated ability to meet deadlines
  • Collaborative approach to problem-solving
, '\n']

title: b'Senior Business Analyst - Finance\r\n      '
advertiser: Cognizant Technology Solutions Australia Pty Ltd -
jd:
['\n',

About Cognizant

, '\n',

Cognizant (NASDAQ: CTSH) is a leading provider of information technology, consulting, and business process services, dedicated to helping the world's leading companies build stronger businesses. Headquartered in Teaneck, New Jersey (U.S.), Cognizant combines a passion for client satisfaction, technology innovation, deep industry and business process expertise, and a global, collaborative workforce that embodies the future of work. With over 100 development and delivery centers worldwide, Cognizant is a member of the NASDAQ-100, the S&P 500, the Forbes Global 2000, and the Fortune 500 and is ranked among the top performing and fastest growing companies in the world. 

, '\n',

Our Culture

, '\n',

Your passion, integrity and experience are integral to Cognizant's success. You will be welcomed into a dynamic and expanding global leader in IT and Business consultancy where you will be valued for who you are. We take pride in our partnership with our clients, so your ability to add value and provide exceptional service to our clients are fundamental to your success. In return, you will be empowered with opportunities and support to develop your career and collaborate with people focused on innovation and ideas.

, '\n',

About the Role

, '\n',

Cognizant is seeking an experienced Senior Business Analyst for this Sydney based opportunity. In this role you will be involved in enterprise wide engagements to elicit business, system and operational requirements. Your key responsibilities will include but not be limited to:-

, '\n',
  • Strong collaboration with project assigned Subject Matter Experts for articulation and definition of Business Requirements Documents (BRD).
  • Generation and review of Functional Specifications to ensure business requirement alignment.
  • Preparation of Business Impact Analysis documentation and workshop facilitation with each impacted business unit.
  • Review and contribution to the Test Strategy.
  • Liaise with IT solution providers (internal & external) on project progress and problem resolution.
  • Consultation with operational business units regarding deployment of system change, system functionality, system configuration and associated processes.
, '\n',

Skills and Qualifications

, '\n',
  • At least 8-10+ years overall experience in similar banking / financial industries with extensive Business Analysis experience.
  • Strong communication, facilitation, influencing and negotiation skills. Is able to collaborate with stakeholders across all seniority levels ranging from Graduate to CxO.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills and native command of the English language.
  • Financial services background with knowledge of full trade lifecycle gained through industry experience.
  • Strong knowledge in equities post trade operations including trade registration, netting, allocations and settlement.
  • Excellent use of business process modelling and system design languages such as BPMN and UML.
  • Previous experience in large scale, transformative projects.
  • Enjoys working in a fast-paced, ambiguous and continuously changing environment.
  • Work both independently and as part of a team.
  • Ability to look at big picture and at the same time, dive into the details.
  • Easy to get along and establish rapport with team members very quickly.
  • Effective problem solving skills, welcomes change and is adaptable within a very dynamic environment.
, '\n',

Desirable / Useful Skills

, '\n',
  • Tertiary education or other relevant industry certification.
  • Knowledge in ISO 20022 securities messaging standards or other standards such as FIX or FpML.
  • Experience using Altova XMLSpy.
  • Be comfortable working within a matrix structure.
  • Continuous improvement mindset.
  • Experience working in 'follow-the-sun' or other onsite / offsite client or vendor arrangement.
  • Worked on Agile, Lean and Waterfall projects.
  • Experience using Atlassian tool suite (JIRA, Agile, Confluence).
  • Experience using MS Visio, Lucid Charts, Enterprise Architect or other process modelling solutions.
  • Previous experience in other domains such as Custody, Securities Lending, Asset Management or Prime Brokerage.
, '\n',

Next Steps

, '\n',

If you would like to express interest in role, please click on the APPLY button now. Due to a high number of applicants, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for a further discussion within 3-5 business days. We thank you for taking interest in this opportunity with us. For a complete list of opportunities with Cognizant visit http://www.cognizant.com/careers 
 

, '\n',

Cognizant is committed to providing Equal Employment Opportunities. Successful candidate will be required to undergo a background check.

, '\n']

title: b'Business Engagement Manager NSW\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

The Star Entertainment Group is a leading owner and operator of integrated resorts and entertainment facilities in Sydney, Brisbane and the Gold Coast. Our Group is experiencing an exciting time of growth and targeted investment across all our properties. Our industry is fast paced, highly competitive and our operations are broad and dynamic. We celebrate the energy of our cities, operating across culturally diverse segments within local and international markets.

, '\n',

The IT division plays a significant role in delivering the technology master plan to the business and is currently preparing to enter an unprecedented phase of change. The technology division has now been structured with specialist areas to be able to achieve these deliverables. We are seeking an energetic and innovative team that can work within these areas to deliver the master plan, and can positively influence the broader group on this journey of change.

, '\n',

A unique opportunity to deliver and innovate IT services and infrastructure

, '\n',

In light of The Star’s strategic direction and growth plans in becoming Australia’s leading integrated resort company, we now have a vacancy for a Business Engagement Manager. Our company’s IT model is customer centric and underpinned by a shared services structure with a strong IT governance framework, thus ensuring:

, '\n',
  • Greater business alignment and partnership;
  • Greater innovation, transparency and governance;
  • Scalable delivery model;
  • Service excellence; and
  • Robust, efficient operations
, '\n',

The Business Engagement Manager is responsible for strong advocacy and engagement across our organisation with a focus on Property Development and infrastructure. Providing strong mutual promotion for technology within assigned business units and for business needs within IT. This is a great opportunity to shape the way we do things and manage business demand from assigned business areas including facilitation of accurate and comprehensive business cases. You will be a strategic partner and deliver a high degree of insight and accuracy in the translation of business strategies, identifying problems and creating opportunities into valuable information technology investments.

, '\n',

High level responsibilities include:

, '\n',

, '\n',
  • Build an effective and mutually beneficial 'trusted partner' relationship between the designated business unit(s) and IT ensuring appropriate business/IT engagement
  • Advise business on the benefits and risks of using technology to build competitive advantage and improve business performance
  • Participate in service review meetings (with the business and Platform Services Managers)
  • Partner with the business to define outcomes and business benefits for initiatives.
  • If appropriate, manage any discretionary budget allocated to explore small business innovation ideas
  • Lead the project initiation process by working collaboratively with IT Business Change, the aligned Enterprise Architect and delivery colleagues (PM/PDM/Infra) to define scope and provide high level estimates for initiatives
, '\n',

, '\n',

Come and grow with us

, '\n',

You will possess demonstrated experience in the IT industry working within a fast paced Corporate environment ideally with Property Development and infrastructure portfolio experience, and relevant Tertiary qualification in the field of Business Studies, IT or Engineering (desirable). The ideal candidate will be familiar with the Software Development Lifecycle. You will have proven ability to develop technology capability needs and solutions based on business requirements.

, '\n',

The candidate we seek is a strong influencer and able to build relationships across all levels of customers within the organisation. You will possess strong written and verbal communication skills and have presentation experience. You will enjoy displaying your business analytical skills to design, plan, assess risk and evaluate time, cost and quality targets as well as having a strong focus on continuous improvement. A role where you can be your best self and make decisions which impact on the success of assigned projects. An opportunity to make your mark and lead and mentor others to deliver exceptional service to the business.

, '\n',

It's your move

, '\n',

The Star Entertainment group is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are building a diverse workforce that reflects our community.

, '\n',

If you've got the drive to influence change, grow with our business and inspire a team to achieve greater things, come and play with us at The Star Entertainment Group. Make your next move by clicking the link below.

, '\n',

, '\n']

  • Demonstrated experience utilising mainstream messaging systems including Java Message Service (JMS) and Websphere MQ
  • Demonstrated experience in developing robust and future-proof application interface solutions, technical specifications and systems designs in the relevant technologies;
  • Demonstrated extensive experience using a relevant (Agile, Waterfall or Rational Unified Process) software development lifecycle;
  • Demonstrated experience in high level analytical and technical problem solving skills demonstrated by a track record of developing innovative cost effective IT solutions for programs / projects in relevant technologies;
  • Demonstrated well developed written and verbal communication skills including negotiation, consultation, facilitation and relationship management skills;
  • Demonstrated ability to deal professionally, tactfully and effectively with various stakeholders (both internally and externally) at all organisational levels.
, '\n',

How to apply:
Please apply using the link below or call on 03 8506 6546 for further details. Applications closes based on the volume of applications received. Only short-listed candidates will be contacted.

title: b'Technical Lead/Architect\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

The role, what's it all about?

, ' ',

High level summary, "To provide the business with technical expertise and tactical guidance that enables the successful implementation of effective IT Solution Architecture". Basically we're after a tech guru who can help drive application development transformation regionally and run a bunch of interesting innovative initiatives.

, ' ',

Ideally, this will sound like you!

, ' ',

You'll have Senior IT experience as an Analyst Programmer/Systems analyst/Technical lead or similar type of roles within the Financial Services/Insurance industry. APRA compliance and Australian reporting requirement won't be foreign language for you and you will be well versed in sourcing, vendor management and AMS models.

, ' ',

Technically, they play with .Net, C#, VB.Net, SQL Server, Cloud, Big Data, SSIS, VBA and Data Stage, SSIS, Azure, Hadoop, SAS, HANA & Java (I know, it's a long list but they'll look to you for guidance on the topic)

Some of the other 'nice to have things' to have:

  • Expertise in using Design Patterns to create Technical Architecture

If this is something which interest you, please apply directly or send your CV for review. Alternatively, feel free to get in touch with me directly on 0478 129 450

, ' ',

Thanks,
Ivan

title: b'\r\n          Head of Technology Advisory\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',

Blackdot is a global management consultancy situated in The Rocks in Sydney. The business is on an exciting growth trajectory with expansion in both APAC and EMEA, and was recently named in Westpac's Top 200 Businesses of Tomorrow and awarded Best IT and Digital Experience in the Kentico Site of The Year Awards.

, '\n',

We're focused around the common goal of helping our tier-one clients to transform their marketing and sales. We deliver integrated people, process and technology solutions that help our client transform the customer experience and accelerate growth.

About the Role:
As we enter this exciting next phase of growth, we are looking for a dynamic and experienced individual to establish our technology practice, build an IT advisory team and support our clients with technology and digital transformations.  

About you:
If you're a business leader with commercial savvy and an interest in building and driving a practice, this is the ideal role for you! The successful candidate will have an entrepreneurial mindset with IT consulting and first principles problem solving experience.

Duties and responsibilities:

, '\n',
  • Establish and lead a customer centric commercial technology advisory practice
  • Build a growth strategy for our technology advisory practice
  • Build and lead a team of technology consultants in line with client demand and business growth
  • Sponsor and lead the technology component of enterprise consulting engagements
  • Undertake current state assessments on client technology architecture
  • Define future state technology architecture and functional requirements
  • Define technology roadmaps aligned to business roadmaps
  • Develop, lead and nurture relationships with preferred system integrator(s)
  • Build and manage strategic partnerships with complementary tech vendors
  • Contribute to technology-related IP development and thought leadership materials (whitepapers, blogs, roadshows, webinars etc.)
  • Run RFIs and RFPs on behalf of clients
, '\n',

Skills and Experience required:

, '\n',
  • 5-10+ years' experience as an enterprise architect or IT consultant with strong business acumen and deep technology expertise
  • Degree qualified in a Business or Technology related discipline 
  • Solid Enterprise Architect tools and methodologies
  • Deep expertise in CRMs especially Salesforce
  • Broader knowledge and experience of technology supporting customer functions - digital, data, cx, workflow etc.
  • Experience working on large scale system implementations for enterprise clients including vendor selection and vendor management
  • Experience and knowledge of SaaS solutions
  • Understanding of technology commercials and trade-offs with the ability to contribute to high-level business cases, strategic and operating plans (without specifying detailed requirements)
  • Ability to assess enterprise technology solutions for health and fit for purpose and identify and recommend options for remediation / improvement with supporting rationale.
  • Expertise in technology operating model design and implication of technology decisions on business operating models and economics
, '\n',


Why Blackdot?

, '\n',
  • Dynamic high performance workplace and culture
  • Collaborative, entrepreneurial and team-focused environment
  • Industry-leading culture of individual development and success recognition
  • High levels of autonomy and ownership
  • Competitive remuneration and bonus scheme
  • Enterprise Tier 1 clients and transformation projects
  • Access to best practice marketing and sales thought leadership to scale the practice
  • Glassdoor 5 Star rated
  • Funky loft-style offices in The Rocks (Sydney CBD)
, '\n']

title: b'Business Engagement Manager Corporate\r\n      '
salary: b'Excellent career progression and staff benefits'
jd:
['\n',

The Star Entertainment Group is a leading owner and operator of integrated resorts and entertainment facilities in Sydney, Brisbane and the Gold Coast. Our Group is experiencing an exciting time of growth and targeted investment across all our properties. Our industry is fast paced, highly competitive and our operations are broad and dynamic. We celebrate the energy of our cities, operating across culturally diverse segments within local and international markets.

, '\n',

The IT division plays a significant role in delivering the technology master plan to the business and is currently preparing to enter an unprecedented phase of change. The technology division has now been structured with specialist areas to be able to achieve these deliverables. We are seeking an energetic and innovative team that can work within these areas to deliver the master plan, and can positively influence the broader group on this journey of change.

, '\n',

A unique opportunity to deliver and innovate IT services and infrastructure

, '\n',

In light of The Star’s strategic direction and growth plans in becoming Australia’s leading integrated resort company, we now have a vacancy for a Business Engagement Manager. Our company’s IT model is customer centric and underpinned by a shared services structure with a strong IT governance framework, thus ensuring:

, '\n',
  • Greater business alignment and partnership;
  • Greater innovation, transparency and governance;
  • Scalable delivery model;
  • Service excellence; and
  • Robust, efficient operations
, '\n',

The Business Engagement Manager is responsible for strong advocacy and engagement across our organisation. Providing strong mutual promotion for technology within assigned business units and for business needs within IT. This is a great opportunity to shape the way we do things and manage business demand from assigned business areas including facilitation of accurate and comprehensive business cases. You will be a strategic partner and deliver a high degree of insight and accuracy in the translation of business strategies, identifying problems and creating opportunities into valuable information technology investments.

, '\n',

High level responsibilities include:

, '\n',

, '\n',
  • Build an effective and mutually beneficial 'trusted partner' relationship between the designated business unit(s) and IT ensuring appropriate business/IT engagement
  • Advise business on the benefits and risks of using technology to build competitive advantage and improve business performance
  • Participate in service review meetings (with the business and Platform Services Managers)
  • Partner with the business to define outcomes and business benefits for initiatives.
  • If appropriate, manage any discretionary budget allocated to explore small business innovation ideas
  • Lead the project initiation process by working collaboratively with IT Business Change, the aligned Enterprise Architect and delivery colleagues (PM/PDM/Infra) to define scope and provide high level estimates for initiatives
, '\n',

, '\n',

Come and grow with us

, '\n',

, '\n',

You will possess demonstrated experience in the IT industry working within a fast paced Corporate environment, and relevant Tertiary qualification in the field of Business Studies, IT or Engineering (desirable). The ideal candidate will be familiar with the Software Development Lifecycle. You will have proven ability to develop technology capability needs and solutions based on business requirements.

, '\n',

The candidate we seek is a strong influencer and able to build relationships across all levels of customers within the organisation. You will possess strong written and verbal communication skills and have presentation experience. You will enjoy displaying your business analytical skills to design, plan, assess risk and evaluate time, cost and quality targets as well as having a strong focus on continuous improvement. A role where you can be your best self and make decisions which impact on the success of assigned projects. An opportunity to make your mark and lead and mentor others to deliver exceptional service to the business.

, '\n',

It's your move

, '\n',

The Star Entertainment group is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are building a diverse workforce that reflects our community.

, '\n',

If you've got the drive to influence change, grow with our business and inspire a team to achieve greater things, come and play with us at The Star Entertainment Group. Make your next move by clicking the link below.

, '\n',

, '\n']

title: b'Business Technology Engagement Manager\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

ASX Listed organisation are looking for a Technology Business Engagement Manager to provide strong mutual advocacy for technology within assigned business units and for business needs within IT, ensuring appropriate business and technology engagement. You will be required to shape and manage all business demand from assigned business units including facilitation of accurate and comprehensive business cases and compliance with all IT processes, policies and governance. You will also provide a high degree of insight and accuracy in the translation of business strategy, business problems and business opportunities into valuable information technology investments.

, '\n',

Responsibilities;

, '\n',
  • Provide strong leadership to IT and assigned business units to enable greater business/IT alignment and partnership
  • Build an effective and mutually beneficial 'trusted partner' relationship between the designated business units and IT ensuring appropriate business/IT engagement
  • Provide input into strategic planning initiatives based on intimate knowledge of the business strategy, problem or opportunity
  • Advise business on  the benefits and  risks of  using technology to  build competitive advantage and improve business performance
  • Respond to tactical needs and emergent priorities actively working to re-plan and coordinate the right response.
  • Work with business stakeholders to define outcomes and business benefits for initiatives
  • Lead the project initiation process by working collaboratively with IT Business Change, the aligned Enterprise Architect and delivery colleagues (PM/PDM/Infra) to define the scope and provide high-level estimates for initiatives.
  • Influence assigned business units to ensure that the ongoing service delivery and support meet agreed on customer requirements
  • Participate in service review meetings (with the business and Platform Services Managers)
  • If appropriate, manage any discretionary budget allocated to explore small business innovation ideas.
, '\n',

Experience Required;

, '\n',
  • At least 10 years of experience in IT, with at least 3 years’ experience in a business environment, coupled with tertiary level qualifications in Business, Science, Engineering or Economics
  • Minimum 7 years’ experience working in an IT environment
  • Tertiary qualification in the field of Business Studies, Information Systems, or Engineering(Desirable)
  • Familiar with the Software Development Lifecycle
  • Ability to present to C-Suite and Senior Stakeholders
  • Able to develop technology capability needs and solutions based on business requirements
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Experience liaising and influencing at Executive level
  • Outcome focused with demonstrated ability to meet deadlines
  • Collaborative approach to problem-solving
, '\n',
If you're interested in hearing more about this opportunity, apply now! Reece.richardson@perigongroup.com.au

, '\n']

title: b'Multiple Data Analyst opportunities\r\n    '
jd:
[' ',

An excellent opportunity to join one of NSW's leading Government Departments as a Data Analyst and gain exposure to a major project of work aimed to significantly improve local services.

, ' ',

, ' ',

As the successful Data Analyst you will be exposed large sets of data from a variety of data sources and be required to develop and maintain complex reports. You will also be required to work closely with the business and key stakeholders to gain familiarity of the project and provide them with accurate analysis and interpretation of the data.

, ' ',

The Data Analyst will be responsible for the analysis of the data models, data definitions and data standards, and development of data transformations and common information models.

, ' ',

As the successful Data Analyst you will require:

, ' ',
  • Analytical disposition and thinking - ability to think logically as well as creatively, to develop data models and data definitions, standards, terminology and classifications that are representative of business domains.
  • Ability to design the full framework (inputs, model, outputs, implementation).
  • Experience in data and information modelling and usage of associated notations and tools, such as E-R diagrams, UML diagrams, Enterprise Architect, System Architect and XML tools.
  • Experience in office productivity tools such as Microsoft Office Word, Excel, Project, PowerPoint and Visio.
  • Experience with data integration concepts and extract, transform and load (ETL) tools, especially Informatica PowerCentre.
  • Experience in testing of data-related solution components, including data migration.
  • Build relationships with a diverse community across the organisation.
  • Demonstrated ability to apply data governance principles and resolve data set quality issues.
  • Demonstrated ability to communicate analysis and insights using a range of written and visual tools and techniques.
  • Provide expert advice on alternate or more efficient reporting strategies.
  • Demonstrated ability to engage and liaise with stakeholders to scope and complete work.
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently, solve problems in a structured and logical way, manage competing priorities and deliver on-time results.
  • Experience in case management, customer relationship management (CRM) or similar product configuration and/or custom development desirable.
, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

Robert Walters Australia is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy.

, ' ']

We are currently recruiting a Risk Analyst / Data Scientist role for a mid sized financial services business going through growth.

, ' This is an opportunity that is highly rewarding, interviews are taking place immediately.\xa0 On offer is a competitive salary, a highly talented team and a great working environment.',

  • Experience implementing advanced statistical techniques with Python
  • Experience with SQL

  • Experience with Oracle big data systems an advantage.

title: b'Method Development Scientist\r\n        '
jd:
[' ',

About the company:

, ' ',

Our Client is a boutique Pharmaceutical Company dedicated to developing generic topical pharmaceutical products globally mainly in Australia, US and Europe.

, ' ',

They are currently undergoing substantial growth. Located not far from Melbourne CBD, our client is seeking an experienced Method Development Scientist to join their Analytical Team to start ASAP.

, ' ',

About the role :

, ' ',

We are currently seeking an experienced Method Development Scientist who displays initiative and is self motivated. Reporting to the Analytical Laboratory Manager, your role will involve the development and validation of analytical methods for drug product stability studies.

, ' ',

Your role will also see you perform duties such as:

, ' ',
  • Undertake QC testing of products
  • Perform stability testing for shelf life analysis
  • Prepare and update QC and Analytical documentation for raw materials and finished products.
  • Assist in R&D studies
  • Undertake laboratory investigation reports, deviations and CAPA documents.
, ' ',

Experience in a highly regulated GMP environment is essential.

, ' ',

Skills & experience:

, ' ',
  • Testing finished products by HPLC & a variety of wet chemical techniques
  • Stabilty Studies
  • STRONG Experience in method development & validation
  • experience in training new analysts
  • Calibrating instruments
  • Data entry
  • General housekeeping.
, ' ',

To be successful in this position you will have a Bachelor of Science majoring in Chemistry, or a related discipline. You will be a quality-focused individual with excellent attention to detail, have good communication skills and have the ability to work in a fast-paced environment.

, ' ',

How to apply:

, ' ',

Click on the "Apply Now" button with a cover letter addressing the selection criteria above AND a detailed resume.

Please call Dr Aphrodite Anastasiadis-Pool, Clare Kavanagh or Cathy Mercuri on 9556 5600.

, ' ',

Why Evolve Scientific Recruitment?

Evolve specialises in scientific/technical recruitment in:

  • Pharmaceutical, Food, Biotechnology, Chemical, Petrochemical, Environmental, Health Services, Life Sciences, Mining and more.

melbourne@evolvescientific.com.au
