title: b'Data Scientist\r\n    '
jd:
['\n',

This leading online brand is looking to add to their Data Science team who provide pivotal analytical insights for the business. You will be working with one of the most prestigious data science teams in Melbourne, therefore on offer is an incredible opportunity where you will learn and develop your analytical skills from the most knowledgeable hiring managers in the city.

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

This is a key role within the team, therefore the right candidate will have a highly numerical degree, advanced skills in R and Python and the ability to draw key insights from complex data.

, '\n',
  • Through the use of advanced analytical methodologies (machine learning, predictive modelling) you will perform deep-dive analytics and data mining to provide complex analytical insights
  • You will present insights and findings back to stakeholders that have a limited analytical knowledge, therefore you must be confident 'telling the story' and driving outcomes from insights.
  • Introduce complex analytics to senior stakeholders across the business and create actionable insights to support strategic decisions
, '\n',

Your Background:

, '\n',
  • Exceptional Python and R/SAS skills
  • Ability to build statistical models from scratch and experience developing machine learning algorithms
  • You must be analytically minded with the ability to work with large volumes of data
  • Exceptional communication skills and the ability to engage with challenging stakeholders
  • Experience working directly for an organisation, rather than within a consultancy is preferred in this role.
, '\n',
If this seems in line with your career aspirations please apply with your CV. For further questions please contact Rosie on 99828462
, '\n']

['\n',

, '\n',
  • Convenient CBD location
  • Full time, Continuing position
  • $91,086 - $102,580 p.a + super
, '\n',

Our Organisation

RMIT is a global university of technology, design and enterprise. Our mission is to help shape the world through research, innovation, teaching and engagement, and to create transformative experiences for our students, getting them ready for life and work.

The Education Portfolio is headed by the Deputy Vice-Chancellor Education and Vice President who leads the planning and implementation of the University's strategies related to RMIT's academic programs and the RMIT student experience. The Portfolio is responsible for services to support the quality of RMIT programs, including the professional development of academic staff, continuous improvement of the student experience, learning and teaching outcomes and the management of learning and research information sources. The Education Portfolio plays a key role in empowering students to access education, participate actively in the life of the University and achieve successful and fulfilling lives beyond graduation. The provision of a stimulating and satisfying experience for students is a priority for the University.

The Role and Your Responsibilities

The Data Scientist undertakes research, analysis, design and data-driven visualization to create models and assets that informs RMIT on actions and opportunities that emerge through data analysis and interpretation. The role applies a blend of business analysis, statistics, computer science and education sector experience to draft success stories out of data sets that are diverse and distributed. The role supports RMIT Studios by identifying and proactively implementing the use of data from a variety of sources. The Data Scientist is responsible for designing approaches to sampling, experimentation, advanced (modern) statistical analysis, triangulation, data base-design, applying ethical standards and evaluating the impact and success of data analysis. This role works closely with other analytic team members for the coordination of the development, management, analysis, interpretation and preparation of data sets, databases, reports, papers, presentations, visualizations and briefings related to the analysis and reporting of learning and teaching data. The Data Scientist will act as a change agent, working with client environments to leverage, mature, and incorporate data products, services, and new capabilities.

Skills & Experience Required

You will have proven experience working with multiple data sets and distributed computing tools coupled with a track record of solving analytical problems using quantitative approaches that include programming logic. Your demonstrated experience in the implementation of data analytics and/or evaluation methods for business improvement will be essential to your success in this role. Furthermore, your strong and proven understanding of data science practice particularly in sampling, experimentation, advanced (modern) statistical analysis, triangulation and database-design along with your ability to collaborate effectively in an inter-disciplinary team, in data analytics, to produce actionable recommendations to various stakeholders is important to this role.

To Apply

For further information please contact Pablo Munguia on +61 3 9925 2085 or visit our website at http://yourcareer.rmit.edu.au and search using job ref # 555954.

Applications close on Sunday 14 May 2017.

Applicants are requested to separately address the key selection criteria as outlined in the Position Description.

RMIT is committed to being a Child Safe organisation and is an equal opportunity employer. Applications are encouraged from all sectors of the community.

, '\n']

['\n',
Forethought is an international award winning growth consultancy that uses advanced analytics of primary and secondary data to understand and predict consumer behaviour. Data is at the core of our work; capturing data, using state of the art technology, analysing data, using world leading advanced analytical methods and transforming that data and insight into persuasive, engaging and innovative communications to inspire our clients' management action.
, '\n',

 

, '\n',

We are now seeking ambitious, inquisitive professionals who share our commitment to being an informant to our clients’ growth agendas, to join our high-performing team and initiate their careers in Analytics.

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

Analysts are the data scientists behind our brands.  Conducting advanced analytics using state-of-the-art methodology, Analysts interrogate data to reveal the truths lying untapped in the consumer psyche.  Working with Consultants, our Analysts transform data into insight for management action.  As an Analyst at Forethought, you will be responsible for:

, '\n',
  • Research design: defining objectives and hypothesis;
  • Sampling considerations, data collection, data management, data preparation;
  • Analysis of primary survey data and/or client behavioural data,;
  • Building and evaluating models and simulations;
  • Providing high quality, rigorously accurate analytical services;
  • Interpreting analytical findings and implications against the clients commercial context, in a clear and compelling manner to key stakeholders;
  • Contributing to draft proposals, reports and presentations for clients;
  • Providing thought leadership to the team.
, '\n',

You possess an outstanding academic record, with honours or post graduate qualifications in Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, Marketing, Science, Engineering, or Psychology.  A PhD, with a strong statistical or econometrics background would be an advantage. You are seeking to apply your skills in a fast paced, commercial environment with the opportunity to provide data-driven insights to inform our clients’ growth strategies. To be considered for this opportunity, you will demonstrate:

, '\n',
  • Analytical thinking, using data to inform decision making;
  • Intellectual curiosity, critical thinking and a passion for problem solving;
  • Exposure to research projects, planning projects and working to deadlines;
  • An ability to manage, analyse and model a variety of data;
  • Experience using  SPSS, R, SAS, SQL or other statistical packages;
  • A strong customer service focus , building both internal and external relationships;
  • The ability to work autonomously but also within a team environment managing different stakeholder expectations;
  • Ability to anticipate needs and exceed firm standards to get the job done;
  • Well-developed written and verbal communication skills, translating complex quantitative information in to logical and meaningful recommendations.
, '\n',

At Forethought, we're committed to:

, '\n',
  • Our culture - We will support you and connect you to build meaningful and authentic relationships with Colleagues.
  • Our people - We will challenge you, we support you in your goals, we offer the opportunity to work with like-minded Colleagues who are the leaders in their fields.
  • Our work - You'll be stretched, and know you've made a valuable difference. Your work has purpose in changing the landscape of our clients' businesses.
  • Our recognition - We accelerate your career, if you want to progress quickly, we will make it happen. We pay fairly based on your performance, and above market standards. Want 6 - 12 additional days leave per year?  You can have that. Want to work in New York? You can do that. Drinks on Friday? We do that. Like to attend industry events? We offer that. Want to become a thought leader and be invited as a key note at an industry conference? You will do that.
  • Your development - we are a learning environment. Every day we learn and grow. We will give you all the coaching, mentoring and training you need to develop and progress your career.
, '\n',

Visit our website for more information www.forethought.com.au/careers or email careers@forethought.com.au. If this description fits you, let's talk. Please call Tess Morgan, Talent Manager on 8199 3526.

, '\n']

title: b'\r\n          Data Scientist\r\n        '
advertiser: Sirius Technology Melbourne part of Sirius People Pty Ltd -
jd:
['\n',

Our client is a specialist consultancy with a ‘can do’ attitude and is known to delivery exceptional solutions for their clients. They are currently working on an Analytical project and are seeking a Data Scientist to assist them with delivery.
 
We are looking for a Data Scientist that will help them discover the information hidden in vast amounts of data, and help them make smarter decisions to deliver even better solutions. Your primary focus will be in applying data mining techniques, doing statistical analysis, and building high quality prediction systems integrated with their products primarily using R.
 

, '\n',

Role Highlights

, '\n',
  • 3 month contract
  • Immediate start
  • Excellent daily rate
  • CBD Location
, '\n',

Your responsibilities:

, '\n',
  • Develop functional procedures to transform data for use as inputs to various modelling functions, and to transform model outputs into required products/outcomes .
  • Develop/enhance analytical models, using a range of econometric and statistical modelling techniques such as regression, stochastic analysis, probabilistic analysis, data mining and machine learning techniques such as classification, clustering, outlier detection, association rules and time series analysis.
  • Automate the production of forecasts by using the parameters of existing or enhanced models to transform input data into outputs in accordance with a modelling operational process.
  • Design and code functional processes used to monitor and evaluate the performance of models and forecasts.
  • Test different data analytics techniques to develop the analytic models/solutions.
  • Prepare documentation of analytic models/solutions for approval by business stakeholders (collaborate with BAs).
  • Participate in the Testing Phase of the project, such as data preparation, analyses of test results and defect resolutions.
, '\n',

 
Your key requirements:

, '\n',
  • Excellent ability to express and communicate technical and business concepts, opinions and conclusions both orally and in writing.
  • Employ original thinking to methods and processes; explore potential solutions and evaluate them while maintaining the balance between innovation, pragmatism and within the project constraints and guiding principles (such as, optimise leverage/use of platform capabilities).
  • Good problem solver and solution focused
  • Collaborate well with other team members (project & BAU).
  • Tertiary qualifications in computational science, economics, econometrics, mathematics, statistics or related field.
  • Demonstrated commercial experience.
  • Strong skills in statistical or economic modelling and regression analysis with excellent understanding of a range of predictive and descriptive modelling techniques, and good working knowledge machine learning approaches and techniques.
  • Well-developed skills in R/R Package for statistical analysis and predictive modelling; SQL for data manipulation and query of large data sets is optional.
  • Experience with a range of software and statistical development platforms such as SAS, Java, C/C++, MatLab and Plexos, would be optional.
  • Knowledge and experience in big data platforms, private, public or hybrid cloud models and architecture, including IaaS and PaaS and other cloud services. Preference would be experience in Azure cloud platform.
  • Demonstrated experience with large IT programs, systems integration and technical architecture.
  • Knowledge of the utilities industry and its regulatory environment would be advantageous.
, '\n',

If you meet the above requirements please APPLY NOW and then call Donna on 03 9020 1994.
 

, '\n']

title: b'Data scientist\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

The world around us is changing, and hopefully you've noticed that Telstra is changing too. We're putting the customer at the centre of everything we do, and we need your help to do that.

, '\n',

We want people who are driven to succeed and have a hunger to achieve their goals. What we really want are people who take pride in the job they do, as well as the desire to step into the future with us.

, '\n',

We have an exciting opportunity for a Data Scientist to join the Telstra Service Operations team. As a data scientist you will have hands-on responsibility for identifying, prioritizing and undertaking a range of research and analytical activities leveraging all available data assets. This will enable answering questions to help solve complex business problems, delivering tangible benefits for the business through the development and application of advanced statistical modelling techniques. Some key responsibilities will include:

, '\n',

  • Lead AI and cognitive capability.

  • Identify scope and prioritize the related Business Use Cases, based on the value they will potentially deliver to the business

  • Presenting results in a simple and easy to understand way that directly answers the question/problem

  • Work with large data sets from multiple sources utilizing Big Data tools and techniques for the purposes of analysing, providing insight and validating hypotheses

  • Perform deep dive analyses of experiments through reliable modelling methods that include numerous explanatory variables and covariates

  • Translate analytic insights into concrete, actionable recommendations for business, process or product improvements

  • Lead / participate in the scoping and implementation of programs of work to deliver full lifecycle Data modelling and solutions to improve customer experience, increase operational efficiency and optimize the Telstra network.

  • Contribute to the design, development and curation of key Data assets

, '\n',

To be considered for this opportunity, you will have extensive experience solving analytical problems end to end using a variety of quantitative approaches. You will be able to demonstrate an ability to communicate complex quantitative analysis in a clear, precise, and actionable manner, and a key strength is engaging and influencing stakeholders at all levels. Ideally, you will have experience working with large data sets and experience working with distributed computing tools will be a plus (e.g. Map/reduce, Hadoop, Hive etc). Additionally, you're a quick learner with the attitude and aptitude to learn quickly in a self-directed fashion.

, '\n',

If you're looking to take the next step in your career, then please connect with what you love and apply today!

, '\n',

We work flexibly at Telstra. Talk to us about how this job could be flexible for you.

, '\n']

title: b'Senior Scientist (Pilot Scale Operations)\r\n    '
jd:
['\n',

The Company

, '\n',

Starting a century ago, CSL made a promise to save lives and protect the health of people stricken with a range of serious and chronic medical conditions. Today that same promise has never been stronger.

, '\n',

With operations in more than 30 nations and over 14,000 employees worldwide, we develop and deliver biotherapies to prevent and treat people with life-threatening medical conditions. Our broad-range of therapies include those to treat disorders such as haemophilia and primary immune deficiencies, and vaccines to prevent influenza.

, '\n',

We collaborate with patient and biomedical communities to improve access to therapies, advance scientific knowledge, and support future medical research. Our world-class commercial operation, combined with a large and focused R&D team and operational excellence, enable us to accurately identify, successfully develop, and dependably deliver innovations that patients and providers want.

, '\n',

For a century, CSL has earned a reputation as a passionate yet responsible organization, driven to care for patients and deliver on its commitments.

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

The Opportunity

, '\n',

The role of Senior Scientist in the Pilot Scale Operations department requires a high level of technical expertise in cell culture processes. Working closely in a hands on capacity with your fellow team members, you will apply your strong technical skills to develop and optimise cell culture and/ or purification processes suitable for manufacture of recombinant proteins.

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

The Role

, '\n',

In your role as Senior Scientist in the Pilot Scale team you will be required to:

, '\n',
  • Design and conduct manufacturing campaigns using large (ranging 10- 500 L single use and stainless steel)scale bioreactors in fed batch mode including harvesting procedures and/or purification procedures
  • Proficient in Siemens or MFCS-Win bioreactor software's and/or Unicorn chromatography programming
  • Coordinate activities relating to the planning and careful execution of manufacturing protocols
  • Ensure accurate and timely data collection including documentation of manufacturing campaigns
  • Actively participate in the analysis of data in conjunction with the Project Expert teams
  • Represent the group on cross functional teams for developing target molecules
  • Author documents including standard operating procedures, manufacturing protocols and reports
  • Communicate ideas and results succinctly to the broader product development team in reports and powerpoint presentations
  • Ensure high safety standards

     

, '\n',

To be successful

, '\n',

We're looking for a dynamic applicant who demonstrates the following qualifications and skills:

, '\n',
  • Bachelor of Science or Chemical Engineering with at least 4 years' experience in a process development field.PhD qualifications are highly regarded
  • Specific experience is required relating to fed batch bioreactor operations at various scales including stainless steel and single use systems and/or AKTA chromatography
  • Skills and experience in scale up of bioreactor and/or purification processes to manufacturing facilities is valued 
  • Skills and experience from related process development disciplines including purification, application of bioreactor analytical techniques or pilot scale operations are also valued
, '\n',
  • Ability to exhibit an independent and self-motivated approach will allow flexibility to flourish in a fast paced and dynamic environment
  • Proven ability to be both team and task orientated
  • Strong mechanical aptitude and problem solving skills
  • Strong leadership skills and ability to collaborate effectively on cross functional teams
  • Strong understanding of new scientific concepts and ideas
  • Excellent grasp of sterile techniques
  • Proficient in Microsoft Excel
, '\n',

If this sounds like you, we look forward to receiving your application.

, '\n',

Applications must address the selection criteria above and include a current CV and covering letter. 

, '\n',

Applications close 5.00PM AEST 26th of May 2017.

, '\n',

Employment screening, including criminal history, medical assessment, confirmation of experience and stated qualifications, Australian working rights and other relevant checks form part of the candidate suitability evaluation process.

, '\n']

title: b'Scientist (GMP Stability)\r\n    '
jd:
[' ',

The Company  

, ' ',

Starting a century ago, CSL made a promise to save lives and protect the health of people stricken with a range of serious and chronic medical conditions. Today that same promise has never been stronger.

, ' ',

With operations in more than 30 nations and over 14,000 employees worldwide, we develop and deliver biotherapies to prevent and treat people with life-threatening medical conditions. Our broad-range of therapies include those to treat disorders such as haemophilia and primary immune deficiencies, and vaccines to prevent influenza.

, ' ',

We collaborate with patient and biomedical communities to improve access to therapies, advance scientific knowledge, and support future medical research. Our world-class commercial operation, combined with a large and focused R&D team and operational excellence, enable us to accurately identify, successfully develop, and dependably deliver innovations that patients and providers want.

, ' ',

For a century, CSL has earned a reputation as a passionate yet responsible organization, driven to care for patients and deliver on its commitments.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

The Opportunity

, ' ',

As a qualified scientist you will be joining the Formulation Development department to conduct GMP stability trials within the Bioprocess Development group of R&D located at Parkville. The Bioprocess Development group develop new investigational biotherapies for use in preclinical and human clinical trials.

, ' ',

Working within a small team, you will be responsible for the planning and progression of GMP stability trials for biopharmaceutical intermediates and products being used for human clinical trials. Your hands-on approach to GMP stability operations, quality systems and facility management will generate stability data to a standard suitable for successful regulatory submissions. You will also be responsible for the generation of GMP stability protocols and reports.
 

, ' ',

To be successful  

, ' ',
  • Tertiary Qualification (honours degree or higher) in relevant field (Chemistry, Biochemistry, Pharmaceutical Sciences)
  • Motivated individual with a strong commitment to quality and time management
  • Strong aptitude for data analysis
  • Proactive, well organized and have strong interpersonal skills
  • Proven hands-on experience with GMP stability trials in the pharmaceutical industry will be highly regarded
, ' ',

Your organizational skills will ensure timely completion of stability sample dispensing and testing across several projects. Your reporting and verbal presentation will be used to communicate key stability data and recommendations to senior managers and colleagues within the business.

, ' ',

Applications close 5pm AEST 19th of May.

, ' ',

Employment screening, including criminal history, medical assessment, confirmation of experience and stated qualifications, Australian working rights and other relevant checks form part of the candidate suitability evaluation process.

, ' ']

title: b'Data Scientist (CRM & Digital)\r\n    '
jd:
['\n',

The Just Group is an established, progressive and growing multinational organisation with seven iconic retail brands, currently with over 1000 stores across Australia, New Zealand, Singapore, Malaysia, Hong Kong and the United Kingdom.

, '\n',

An exciting opportunity exists for a Data Scientist (CRM & Digital) to join the Just Group team.

, '\n',


Play a key role in identifying high value customers and formulate customer segmentations across our portfolio of brands; Just Jeans, Jacqui E, Jay Jays, Portmans, Peter Alexander, Dotti and Smiggle to support personalisation and optimisation strategies. Build data models to project the business benefit from new digital initiatives, and establish performance measures and KPIs.

, '\n',


This role offers a significant level of scope in influencing CRM and Digital channel strategies for The Just Group with opportunity for growth and progression within the business

, '\n',

In this role you will be responsible for, but not limited to;

, '\n',
  • Customer analytics projects that may include; Customer propensity/regression modelling (churn, acquisition, cross sell), segmentation analysis, marketing campaign analytics, customer lifetime value analysis, next best offer analysis etc.
  • Conduct end to end analysis including mining, preparation and building of data resulting in delivery of actionable insights presented in a digestible format for business stakeholders that clearly articulate the business value
  • Conduct deep-dive analysis of customer purchase journey (from completion of order online through to successful delivery to customer) and provide recommendations on enhancements based on effort/outcome
  • Extract value from analytics platforms associated with The Just Group's data to formulate insights, taking into account historical performance, web analytics, digital channel platforms, promotional calendars, Just Group financial reporting systems
  • Build data models to project sales, establish KPI's, online metrics and ROI for new proposed digital initiatives to support business case developme
  • 3+ years' experience with CRM campaign measurement and reporting
, '\n',

To be successful in this role you will possess;

, '\n',
  • Proven digital analytics experience in Coremetrics, Adobe Marketing Cloud or similar
  • Strong technical skills in extracting, manipulating and merging large customer data sets (e.g. SQL, Tableau)
  • Tertiary qualifications in Data Science, Analytics or related discipline
  • Knowledge of retail industry and relevant KPI's
  • Strong Excel skills
  • A passion for data and extensive experience mining and interpreting large data sets to produce actionable insights
, '\n',

We are seeking interest from both local and international specialists, with experience in commercially-focused retail environments.

, '\n',

To register your interest in this exciting opportunity, apply today.

, '\n',

Due to the fast paced nature of our business, the application close date may be subject to change. Don't delay and apply as soon as possible as we will assess applications as they are received.

, '\n']

title: b'Data Scientist - Biomedical Behavioural Focus\r\n    '
jd:
['\xa0',
, ' Are you a Data scientist who wants their work to truly make a difference to the world?',
, ' Here your skills will make a difference and touch the lives of millions!',
, ' This leading biomedical company is seeking a talented Data scientist to work on one of largest dataset of physiologic data. As their next senior Data Scientist, you will be assisting in the discovery, and development of biomarkers related to classification of mental health disorders. You will be working with clinical and ambulatory sensed data related to physiologic signals and behaviour patterns, which will assist in the further development of ground breaking advances in this field.',
, ' \xa0',
, ' \xa0',
, ' Qualifications:',
, ' • Prior experience in the Bio medical domain',
, ' • Hold a PHD degree in Biomedical engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or other scientific fields (or equivalent experience',
, ' • Commercial Senior-level experience developing models and insights from physiologic time-series data',
, ' • Proven experience in signal processing, feature engineering, statistics and machine learning',
, ' • Excellent written and verbal scientific communication and time management skills',
, ' • Well-rounded technical skills using Python and associated tools including pandas, sklearn and visualization packages',
, ' • Experience working with large datasets and database architectures',
, ' • Experience with JavaScript',
, ' Considered beneficial but not essential:',
, ' • Experience working with ECG (or other cardiac signals), EEG, and/or clinical PSG data',
, ' • Familiarity with health and medical regulatory processes',
, ' If this is the Data science that you have been seeking then this is your opportunity to grab the challenge on offer. Simply send your WORD formatted cv and cover letter to me Ann Mansard today on ann.mansard@ibitsolutions.com.au - all applicants treated in the strictest confidence ']

['\n',

, '\n',
  • Convenient CBD location
  • Full time, Continuing position
  • $91,086 - $102,580 p.a + super
, '\n',

Our Organisation

RMIT is a global university of technology, design and enterprise. Our mission is to help shape the world through research, innovation, teaching and engagement, and to create transformative experiences for our students, getting them ready for life and work.

The Education Portfolio is headed by the Deputy Vice-Chancellor Education and Vice President who leads the planning and implementation of the University's strategies related to RMIT's academic programs and the RMIT student experience. The Portfolio is responsible for services to support the quality of RMIT programs, including the professional development of academic staff, continuous improvement of the student experience, learning and teaching outcomes and the management of learning and research information sources. The Education Portfolio plays a key role in empowering students to access education, participate actively in the life of the University and achieve successful and fulfilling lives beyond graduation. The provision of a stimulating and satisfying experience for students is a priority for the University.

The Role and Your Responsibilities

The Data Scientist undertakes research, analysis, design and data-driven visualization to create models and assets that informs RMIT on actions and opportunities that emerge through data analysis and interpretation. The role applies a blend of business analysis, statistics, computer science and education sector experience to draft success stories out of data sets that are diverse and distributed. The role supports RMIT Studios by identifying and proactively implementing the use of data from a variety of sources. The Data Scientist is responsible for designing approaches to sampling, experimentation, advanced (modern) statistical analysis, triangulation, data base-design, applying ethical standards and evaluating the impact and success of data analysis. This role works closely with other analytic team members for the coordination of the development, management, analysis, interpretation and preparation of data sets, databases, reports, papers, presentations, visualizations and briefings related to the analysis and reporting of learning and teaching data. The Data Scientist will act as a change agent, working with client environments to leverage, mature, and incorporate data products, services, and new capabilities.

Skills & Experience Required

You will have proven experience working with multiple data sets and distributed computing tools coupled with a track record of solving analytical problems using quantitative approaches that include programming logic. Your demonstrated experience in the implementation of data analytics and/or evaluation methods for business improvement will be essential to your success in this role. Furthermore, your strong and proven understanding of data science practice particularly in sampling, experimentation, advanced (modern) statistical analysis, triangulation and database-design along with your ability to collaborate effectively in an inter-disciplinary team, in data analytics, to produce actionable recommendations to various stakeholders is important to this role.

To Apply

For further information please contact Pablo Munguia on +61 3 9925 2085 or visit our website at http://yourcareer.rmit.edu.au and search using job ref # 555954.

Applications close on Sunday 14 May 2017.

Applicants are requested to separately address the key selection criteria as outlined in the Position Description.

RMIT is committed to being a Child Safe organisation and is an equal opportunity employer. Applications are encouraged from all sectors of the community.

, '\n']

title: b'Scientist\r\n    '
jd:
[' ',

The Company  

, ' ',

Starting a century ago, CSL made a promise to save lives and protect the health of people stricken with a range of serious and chronic medical conditions. Today that same promise has never been stronger.

, ' ',

With operations in more than 30 nations and over 14,000 employees worldwide, we develop and deliver biotherapies to prevent and treat people with life-threatening medical conditions. Our broad-range of therapies include those to treat disorders such as haemophilia and primary immune deficiencies, and vaccines to prevent influenza.

, ' ',

We collaborate with patient and biomedical communities to improve access to therapies, advance scientific knowledge, and support future medical research. Our world-class commercial operation, combined with a large and focused R&D team and operational excellence, enable us to accurately identify, successfully develop, and dependably deliver innovations that patients and providers want.

, ' ',

For a century, CSL has earned a reputation as a passionate yet responsible organization, driven to care for patients and deliver on its commitments.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

The Opportunity

, ' ',

This is an opportunity to join the Bioanalytical team, working alongside other scientists you will qualify analytical methods and perform routine analysis to support the development of recombinant proteins and other biopharmaceuticals.

, ' ',

Duties Include:

, ' ',
  • Perform routine assays in support of process development activities
  • Maintain laboratory quality systems and records of analytical results
  • Perform release tests, where required, and report results into database systems
  • Present experimental data at departmental or project meetings
  • Transfer assays into the QC department, where required
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

To be successful  

, ' ',
  • Tertiary Qualification in relevant field ( Chemistry, Biochemistry, Pharmaceutical)
  • Proven hands-on experience working with assays such as (but not constrained to) HPLC, ELISA, chromogenic assays, glycan analysis, SDS-PAGE, CE-SDS and UV spectrophotometer
  • Experience working in a GMP/ GSP environment
  • Motivated individual with a strong commitment to quality and time management
  • Proactive, well organized and have strong interpersonal skills
  • Ability to develop methods and test procedures will be highly regarded
     
, ' ',

Applications close 5pm AEST 26th of May.

, ' ',

Employment screening, including criminal history, medical assessment, confirmation of experience and stated qualifications, Australian working rights and other relevant checks form part of the candidate suitability evaluation process.

, ' ']

title: b'Data Scientists | Looking for Fun & Challanging Role | Leading Edge Projects\r\n    '
jd:
['\xa0Our client is\xa0looking for two Data Scientists that will help them discover the information hidden in vast amounts of data, and help them make smarter decisions to deliver even better products. The primary focus will be in applying data mining techniques,\r\n doing statistical analysis, and building high-quality prediction systems integrated with their products.\xa0',
, '\n',
, '\n', Skills & Career experience,
, '\n',
, '\n',
  • Ideally, you will have a minimum of 3-5 year experience working in Enterprise Data Science project environment.
  • Master's Degree in applied statistics or mathematics or Computer science. We also interested in candidates who have a strong skills set around Software Engineering.
  • Excellent understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, etc. 
  • Experience with common data science toolkits, such as R, SAS, MatLab, etc. Excellence in at least one of these is highly desirable. 
  • Excellent communication skills with a proven experience engaging with stakeholders.
  • Experience with data visualization tools, such as Tableau, Qlick etc. 
  • Proficiency in using query languages such as SQL, Hive, Pig 
  • Good scripting and programming skills like Python, Perl, etc. 
  • Good applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression
, '\n', Responsibilities ,
, '\n',
  • Selecting features, building and optimizing classifiers using machine learning techniques 
  • Data mining using state-of-the-art methods 
  • Extending company's data with third party sources of information when needed 
  • Enhancing data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic systems 
  • Processing, cleansing and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis 
  • Doing ad-hoc analysis and presenting results in a clear manner 
  • Creating automated anomaly detection systems and constant tracking of its performance. 
, '\n',
If you have made a positive commitment to further your career and you possess the above attributes then please apply to this role, if you require further information on this then please contact 
DATA TALENT on 1300 763 895 for a confidential chat.    
,

,
Data Talent is exclusively focused on Data Science, Data Engineering and Data Analytics Recruitment across Australia. We are committed to your personal and professional career development. Please view www.datatalent.com.au/  for all our current opportunities.
, '\n']

['\n',
Forethought is an international award winning growth consultancy that uses advanced analytics of primary and secondary data to understand and predict consumer behaviour. Data is at the core of our work; capturing data, using state of the art technology, analysing data, using world leading advanced analytical methods and transforming that data and insight into persuasive, engaging and innovative communications to inspire our clients' management action.
, '\n',

 

, '\n',

We are now seeking ambitious, inquisitive professionals who share our commitment to being an informant to our clients’ growth agendas, to join our high-performing team and initiate their careers in Analytics.

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

Analysts are the data scientists behind our brands.  Conducting advanced analytics using state-of-the-art methodology, Analysts interrogate data to reveal the truths lying untapped in the consumer psyche.  Working with Consultants, our Analysts transform data into insight for management action.  As an Analyst at Forethought, you will be responsible for:

, '\n',
  • Research design: defining objectives and hypothesis;
  • Sampling considerations, data collection, data management, data preparation;
  • Analysis of primary survey data and/or client behavioural data,;
  • Building and evaluating models and simulations;
  • Providing high quality, rigorously accurate analytical services;
  • Interpreting analytical findings and implications against the clients commercial context, in a clear and compelling manner to key stakeholders;
  • Contributing to draft proposals, reports and presentations for clients;
  • Providing thought leadership to the team.
, '\n',

You possess an outstanding academic record, with honours or post graduate qualifications in Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, Marketing, Science, Engineering, or Psychology.  A PhD, with a strong statistical or econometrics background would be an advantage. You are seeking to apply your skills in a fast paced, commercial environment with the opportunity to provide data-driven insights to inform our clients’ growth strategies. To be considered for this opportunity, you will demonstrate:

, '\n',
  • Analytical thinking, using data to inform decision making;
  • Intellectual curiosity, critical thinking and a passion for problem solving;
  • Exposure to research projects, planning projects and working to deadlines;
  • An ability to manage, analyse and model a variety of data;
  • Experience using  SPSS, R, SAS, SQL or other statistical packages;
  • A strong customer service focus , building both internal and external relationships;
  • The ability to work autonomously but also within a team environment managing different stakeholder expectations;
  • Ability to anticipate needs and exceed firm standards to get the job done;
  • Well-developed written and verbal communication skills, translating complex quantitative information in to logical and meaningful recommendations.
, '\n',

At Forethought, we're committed to:

, '\n',
  • Our culture - We will support you and connect you to build meaningful and authentic relationships with Colleagues.
  • Our people - We will challenge you, we support you in your goals, we offer the opportunity to work with like-minded Colleagues who are the leaders in their fields.
  • Our work - You'll be stretched, and know you've made a valuable difference. Your work has purpose in changing the landscape of our clients' businesses.
  • Our recognition - We accelerate your career, if you want to progress quickly, we will make it happen. We pay fairly based on your performance, and above market standards. Want 6 - 12 additional days leave per year?  You can have that. Want to work in New York? You can do that. Drinks on Friday? We do that. Like to attend industry events? We offer that. Want to become a thought leader and be invited as a key note at an industry conference? You will do that.
  • Your development - we are a learning environment. Every day we learn and grow. We will give you all the coaching, mentoring and training you need to develop and progress your career.
, '\n',

Visit our website for more information www.forethought.com.au/careers or email careers@forethought.com.au. If this description fits you, let's talk. Please call Tess Morgan, Talent Manager on 8199 3526.

, '\n']

title: b'Consulting - Analytics - Senior Con/Manager\r\n      '
jd:
[
, '\n',

About the Role
You’ve all heard the facts…more data has been created in the past few years than has existed throughout history. In five years there will be over 50 billion smart connected devices in the world, all developed to collect, analyse and share data. Research suggests that less than 1% of the data created is analysed and used.

Imagine the world of possibilities.

Across industries and both large and small clients, the appetite for analytical insight is growing. Our clients are increasingly looking to make sense of their data and for analytics to underpin their business decision making and deliver a tangible impact.

To meet this demand Deloitte’s Analytics practice is seeking talented people with demonstrable experience from strategy to execution in the Analytics domains.

We are looking for people who love data and want to solve problems with insight. Whether you call yourself a data scientist, analytics whiz or builder of predictive models. We want to hear from you if you are genuinely passionate about this area and have some applied experience.

This is an opportunity to harness emerging technologies and analytical methodologies to help our clients on their objectives. You will be part of a collaborative team that provides our clients with solutions that are practical as well as visionary and have an impact from the back office to the boardroom.

About You
You’ll bring experience in one or more of the following competencies and enabling technologies:

, '\n',
  • Strong programming background - scripting is essential as is prior experience developing an application using various software with dedicated modules/libraries/distinct sections in order to represent complex systems programmatically
  • Expert in a range of scripting languages - (e.g. Python, R etc.) and SQL is mandatory
  • Solid grounding in the fundamentals of APIs, data management and storage (e.g. DBA skills), basics of cloud computing, batch scripting and mathematical programming
  • A strong background in applying mathematical and analytics approaches and methodologies to identifying complex relationships in data
  • Ability to communicate technical requirements and outputs in a clear and concise manner
  • A structured, logical and solution-oriented design mindset
  • Ability to work autonomously and with minimal oversight
  • Ability to demonstrate initiative and ownership in the completion of tasks
  • Experience working in teams over extended project delivery periods (e.g. 2 - 6 months)
  • A demonstrable interest and passion for exploring new data/analytics concepts, applications and innovations (e.g. Cognitive, AI, RPA, IoT etc.)
, '\n',

About Us
We pride ourselves on our team of diverse, high performing professionals who are driven yet highly inclusive and social - our people are at the heart of our success. Our aim is to ensure that all our people feel comfortable to bring their whole selves to work, and as a result, create a workplace that encourages the true spirit of 'And different'.

Next Steps
If you have questions regarding this role, the Talent Acquisition Team is available to have a confidential discussion. Please contact Emily McBain via the Our Recruiters section on our careers website.

, '\n']

title: b'Senior Product Manager - Commercial and Innovation Focus\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

Intelematics operate in the telematics industry designing and developing innovative IoT and BigData based products and services revolutionising the world of the connected car.

, '\n',

The Opportunity

, '\n',

Reporting to Group Product and Innovation Manager, this role focuses on Telematics Platform as a Service (PaaS) product management in the global marketplace to ensure market positioning, continued growth and profitability. You will work directly with our key client base such as OEMs, automobile clubs and transport fleet service providers, as well as other key stakeholders within the business and the marketplace. You will play a pivotal role in supporting Intelematics's vision as the preferred brand and lead the global telematics market.

, '\n',

In this role you will…

, '\n',
  • Bring together your entrepreneurial and strategic thinking to shape the future of the product portfolio from the concept through to launch
  • Convert market trends and consumer needs into brilliant new products that deliver long term commercial and strategic value
  • Optimise your structured and analytical thinking to derive innovative solutions by evaluating the market, competition and consumer needs
  • Present scalable, sustainable and commercially viable product strategies including well researched market positioning and competitive pricing strategy
  • Collaborate with the Senior Management and key stakeholders within the business to enhance Intelematics's brand positioning to maximise the global market potential
  • Assist with the profit and loss of the product portfolio by focusing on strengthening the existing and generating new revenue streams
  • Present the analysis and data using your creative flair to give meaningful insights and be able to generate detailed product performance reporting
  • Work closely with the Solutions Architects, Data Scientists, Product Development, Commercial and Operations teams to successfully manage the product portfolio
, '\n',

You will be a great value addition to our team if you have…

, '\n',
  • At least 6-8 years' demonstrated experience managing product portfolio and developing new product strategies
  • Strong commercial experience managing sustainable and profitable products
  • Influential communication and presentation skills with natural flair to lead senior stakeholder engagement
  • Demonstrated negotiation and sound decision making skills
  • Tenacity to embrace challenging deadlines, change and complex problem solving
  • Flair for mentoring the product team on best practices by sharing knowledge and experience
  • Strong integrity, commitment and focus to achieve excellence
  • Experience working with vehicle OEM operations, mobile application development, SaaS/PaaS, telematics or similar industry desirable
, '\n',

About Intelematics

, '\n',

Intelematics is Australia's leading provider of vehicle-related connected mobility services – traffic and telematics are our core competencies. We work across large automotive industries and car clubs to enhance the driving experience, giving motorists access to motoring content, telematics and smart dashboard services; making every drive safer, more efficient and more enjoyable.

, '\n',

A part of RACV, Intelematics Australia is our global development hub. This includes a range of specialised functions including R&D, architecture, security, vehicle hardware and integration, and the global operations centre for Intelematics North America and Europe.

, '\n',

Intelematics is growing fast, and so could you! It's an exciting time to be part of a dynamic, successful team working on some of the most innovative automotive telematics programs and products in the market today.

, '\n',

Some of the perks of being part of Intelematics 

, '\n',
  •  Agile focused development hub
  • Autonomous and growth focused environment
  • Flexible working arrangements
  • Commitment to your learning & development
  • Collaborative and fun teams full of passionate members
  • Competitive remuneration
  • Generous discounts off our parent company's products and services – RACV Insurance products, Roadside Assist, Club Membership, Accommodation, Movie Tickets, Airport Parking and Car Hire
  • New Vehicle discounts via our client partners
  • Professional Educational Assistance
  • Paid Parental Leave
, '\n',

Like the sound of it? We would love to hear from you, please apply with your latest resume.

, '\n']

title: b'Director, Analytics\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',
  • High impact predictive modelling & insights projects
  • Leading edge technology
  • Mentor analysts & develop IP
  • Salary package + incentive
, '\n',

Working across a range of business related issues, you will be part of a team of leading professionals assisting organisations with insights, advice and recommendations using analytics based solutions.  Clients typically include blue chip multinational corporates and leading Australian companies, operating across a broad range of industry verticals.

, '\n',

Capitalising on the surge of analytics initiatives, the firm seeks an experienced Data Scientist to join the team and contribute to the design of analytic solutions that address business issues.  You will work closely with clients on major projects including marketing insights and optimisation, operational effectiveness, asset management and business planning.  Your ability to lead the analysis and interpretation of data and apply analytic techniques, combined with exceptional communication to achieve project outcomes is vital.  With access to world leading technology, you will be responsible for project management, presenting outcomes/insights, and developing a team of Analysts.

, '\n',

Degree qualified you will have several years' experience using data modelling, mining and manipulation applications (eg. SQL, SAS or VBA).  Demonstrated experience in segmentation, propensity modelling, regression analysis and RCA will ensure your success, especially if it's been in a consulting environment.  Vertical experience in financial services, energy, telco, retail or government is also highly regarded.  It is likely you have a flair for working with people and building business relationships, and have worked in a client facing role.

, '\n',

 

, '\n']

title: b'Senior Objective C Developer - macOS X - SWIFT - Enterprise Customers'
jd:
['\n',

A Data Science focused security company are building a solution that is innovative and led by a team that has in-depth international experience within Security and Data Science.

Be part of the strategic direction and design of this solution using your "out of box " style thinking to come up with large enterprise solutions.

This solution is aimed at large scale enterprises and as such needs creative and innovative coders and problem solvers to become an integral part of the core team.

The Senior Developer will be enthusiastic about building a completely new and innovative approach to improving the security of enterprises and individuals. You’ll be working closely with the data science team, building applications and services that will be deployed directly into corporate networks

On a day to day basis you will;

• Design, architect, develop, test and release complex, macOS system services
 • Assist in definition of product architecture and design and implementation of scalable, performance distributed cloud services
• Collaborate with and assist other developers and data scientists
• Provide operational assistance to achieve continuous, high quality product deployments

Ideally you will be an excellent programmer building extremely robust code in Objective C/ Swift.
 • Proven experience developing low-level macOS system services and/or drivers
 • Expert knowledge of concurrent programming and threading principles
 • Experience developing networked client/server applications
 • Experience architecting, building & deploying scalable, high-performance services in cloud environments such as Azure or AWS
 • A firm understanding of software design, fundamental design patterns, development and testing best practices
 • Excellent written and oral communication skills

This is growing team and you have an opportunity to join at the right time. Opportunity to be part of an attractive employee share scheme and work in a highly skilled environment in 2 of the fasted growing areas of tech - security and data science.

To discuss in detail please call Jeremy on 02 8299 7301.

, '\n']

['\n',

We are looking for new talent to work with our high-performing Analytics and Information Management team. As a progressive-thinking and innovative technologist in the area of data and analytics, you will work with new, market leading solutions and soak in KPMG's deep industry / sector experience and thought-leadership to deliver high-trust / high-value outcomes for our Tier 1 clients across Australia.

, '\n',

This is an excellent opportunity to make a significant difference to KPMG as a firm by helping to drive leading analytics and information management initiatives across our business.

, '\n',

Your new role:

, '\n',
  • An opportunity to demonstrate your deep problem solving skills to address complex enterprise data and analytics challenges faced by our clients across a range of industries and sectors – Banking, Insurance, Superannuation, Health, Utilities, Telco, Retail, Logistics and Public Sector.
  • Establish a vision for information delivery and management for our clients and help drive the execution of the roadmap; including the enterprise data warehouse, big data, BI & analytics, content and data management.
  • Work with our data architects, analysts, scientists and engineers to deliver the solutions that fulfill our client's business information needs and align their information vision, strategy and execution.
  • Engage in the end-to-end data and analytics lifecycle by connecting all the pieces of data to deliver high value insights and tangible solution outcomes.
  • Engage with clients across both the technology and business implications of analytics and information decision-making and help shape the future direction of their analytics and information agenda.
, '\n',

The capabilities we are looking for:

, '\n',
  • A minimum of 5+ years of work experience working across data or analytics focused roles utilising a consulting mindset to solving problem
  • Independent and motivated technologist with a passion for solving business problems through data and an eagerness to learn new skills and techniques, including new technologies, software and tools
  • Proven ability to develop and manage enduring client relationships, engendering a sense of trust and respect
  • Excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills with experience in engaging senior business stakeholders to communicate complex data and analytics concepts and ideas
  • The ability to exercise judgment on how to derive insight from ambiguous requirements, test your assumptions and results, and present the same to stakeholders at all levels of the organization
  • Experience with SQL databases and data warehousing applications such as Oracle, SQL Server, Teradata, AWS Redshift, Netezza
  • Demonstrated capability in statistical concepts, hypothesis testing, probability modelling and machine learning concepts with skills in R, Python, Spark ML and/or Julia is desirable
  • Advanced skills in interactive data visualisation, presentation and reporting across visualisation toolsets and libraries such as Tableau, Qlik, Datameer, D3.js
  • Experience in distributed computing and streaming technologies using toolsets such as Apache HDFS, Pig, Hive, Solr, ElasticSearch, Kafka, Spark, Storm and NiFi
  • Experience with graph / network database concepts and technologies such as Neo4j, GraphX and HBase
  • Experience in cloud-enabled analytical services such as Azure and/or AWS ecosystems is a plus
  • Degree in a quantitative discipline, such as mathematics/statistics, computer science, engineering, actuarial sciences or life sciences
, '\n',

What we offer

, '\n',

We offer rewarding careers for outstanding professionals, ongoing learning and development opportunities, a collaborative and inclusive culture, and flexible and agile work practices that focus on our people's wellbeing to drive innovation and entrepreneurship. We also believe that our business plays a distinct and vital role in helping solve important social and environmental issues; and use our unique skills and expertise to help create positive and lasting impacts for our communities.

We believe diversity of thought, background and experience strengthens relationships and delivers meaningful benefits to our people, our clients and communities. We are consistently recognised as an employer of choice for women, and our inclusive culture promotes the development of our people irrespective of gender, ethnicity, generation, flexible work status, family circumstances, sexual orientation or disability.

This is an exciting opportunity to be a part of KPMG and its ongoing success. So if you want a career where you can use your deep expertise to deliver real results, talk to us first.

Please apply for this position by submitting your confidential application online.

, '\n',


, '\n']

title: b'Senior Software Engineer - Enterprise Software - .Net Core - Golang'
jd:
['\n',
A Data Science focused security company are building a solution that is innovative and led by a team that has in-depth international experience within Security and Data Science.

This solution is aimed at large scale enterprises and as such needs a creative and innovative Senior Software Engineer who can help control the strategic view, direction and design of large scale complex software solutions. About to embark on a framework change and massive potential to effect this change. Thus any experience on .Net core or Golang will be extremely advantageous.

On a day to day basis you will;

• Design, architect, develop, test and release complex enterprise solutions.
 • Assist in definition of product architecture and design and implementation of scalable, performance distributed cloud services 
• Collaborate with and assist other developers and data scientists and have had experience running production environments
, '\n',

Ideally you will be an excellent Senior Software Engineer/ Architect
 • Proven experience developing solutions from the ground up across a variety of frameworks - macOS and Windows environments at the operating system level.
 • Expert knowledge of concurrent programming and threading principles
 • Experience architecting, building & deploying scalable, high-performance services in cloud environments such as Azure or AWS 
 • A firm understanding of software design, fundamental design patterns, development and testing best practices 
 • Excellent written and oral communication skills 

This is growing team and you have an opportunity to join at the right time. Opportunity to be part of an attractive employee share scheme and work in a highly skilled environment in 2 of the fasted growing areas of tech - security and data science.

To discuss in detail please call Jeremy on 02 8299 7301.
, '\n']

title: b'Business Consultant - Big Data\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

CONNECT WITH TELSTRA

, '\n',

We're Australia's leading telecommunication and technology company, and one of the country's largest and most iconic organisations. We're putting the customer at the heart of everything we do and finding ways to help people connect in new and different ways. That's where you come in, we want people who are driven to succeed and have a hunger to achieve their goals. What we really want are people who take pride in the job they do, as well as the desire to step into the future with us.

, '\n',

THE TEAM & ROLE

, '\n',

The Big Data Analytics team acts as a catalyst for the implementation of significant business impact Telstra-wide programs using Big Data techniques including machine learning and predictive analytics. We are a multi-functional team of data scientists, data engineers and business specialists, working together in close collaboration on projects with Telstra's business units. We have an exciting opportunity for a Business Analytics Consultant to join our team. In this role, you will be a key point of contact for our relationship with these business units. The role is to bring business experience and judgement, problem solving and project management skills to our team.

, '\n',

SOME OF THE SPECIFICS AND KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES

, '\n',

  • Work with Analytics Domain Leaders and other team members to effectively target our overall analytic activity on areas of maximum benefit

  • Identifying opportunities where big data analytics could be valuable and exploring these with business unit staff

  • Articulating in business language the 'art of the possible' to encourage businesses to use predictive analytics and big data solutions to commercial advantage

  • Apply a mix of commercial insight and data / analytical expertise to define the right problem and solve it well

  • Maximise the benefits of applying the team's range of technical skills in a coordinated way to analytical problems

  • Contribute to thought leadership, and demonstrate personal excellence in the business application of advanced analytics techniques

, '\n',

WHAT YOU'LL BRING

, '\n',

Degree qualified in a mathematical, statistical or other numerical discipline, you will have Big data analytics experience (ie large-scale big data, machine learning and predictive analytics). You will be able to demonstrate an ability to communicate complex quantitative analysis in a clear, precise, and actionable manner for technical and non-technical audiences, and are experienced in engaging and influencing stakeholders at all levels. You will also have the ability to network, work collaboratively and win the trust of peers and senior leaders. You will be a quick learner with the attitude and aptitude to learn quickly in a self-directed fashion.

, '\n',

SOUNDS LIKE YOU?

, '\n',

If you are dedicated to developing yourself and have a desire to always achieve more then we want to hear from you! Above all, you will bring enthusiasm and dedication to your job, are not afraid of hard work, and thrive off the satisfaction gained from achieving success in addressing and successfully overcoming challenges.

, '\n',

We work flexibly at Telstra. Talk to us about how this job could be flexible for you.

, '\n']

advertiser: SPELLER INTERNATIONAL - SAP Resourcing and Recruitment -

jd:
['\n',
Forethought is an international award winning growth consultancy that uses advanced analytics of primary and secondary data to understand and predict consumer behaviour. Data is at the core of our work; capturing data, using state of the art technology, analysing data, using world leading advanced analytical methods and transforming that data and insight into persuasive, engaging and innovative communications to inspire our clients' management action.
, '\n',

 

, '\n',

We are now seeking ambitious, inquisitive professionals who share our commitment to being an informant to our clients’ growth agendas, to join our high-performing team and initiate their careers in Analytics.

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

Analysts are the data scientists behind our brands.  Conducting advanced analytics using state-of-the-art methodology, Analysts interrogate data to reveal the truths lying untapped in the consumer psyche.  Working with Consultants, our Analysts transform data into insight for management action.  As an Analyst at Forethought, you will be responsible for:

, '\n',
  • Research design: defining objectives and hypothesis;
  • Sampling considerations, data collection, data management, data preparation;
  • Analysis of primary survey data and/or client behavioural data,;
  • Building and evaluating models and simulations;
  • Providing high quality, rigorously accurate analytical services;
  • Interpreting analytical findings and implications against the clients commercial context, in a clear and compelling manner to key stakeholders;
  • Contributing to draft proposals, reports and presentations for clients;
  • Providing thought leadership to the team.
, '\n',

You possess an outstanding academic record, with honours or post graduate qualifications in Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, Marketing, Science, Engineering, or Psychology.  A PhD, with a strong statistical or econometrics background would be an advantage. You are seeking to apply your skills in a fast paced, commercial environment with the opportunity to provide data-driven insights to inform our clients’ growth strategies. To be considered for this opportunity, you will demonstrate:

, '\n',
  • Analytical thinking, using data to inform decision making;
  • Intellectual curiosity, critical thinking and a passion for problem solving;
  • Exposure to research projects, planning projects and working to deadlines;
  • An ability to manage, analyse and model a variety of data;
  • Experience using  SPSS, R, SAS, SQL or other statistical packages;
  • A strong customer service focus , building both internal and external relationships;
  • The ability to work autonomously but also within a team environment managing different stakeholder expectations;
  • Ability to anticipate needs and exceed firm standards to get the job done;
  • Well-developed written and verbal communication skills, translating complex quantitative information in to logical and meaningful recommendations.
, '\n',

At Forethought, we're committed to:

, '\n',
  • Our culture - We will support you and connect you to build meaningful and authentic relationships with Colleagues.
  • Our people - We will challenge you, we support you in your goals, we offer the opportunity to work with like-minded Colleagues who are the leaders in their fields.
  • Our work - You'll be stretched, and know you've made a valuable difference. Your work has purpose in changing the landscape of our clients' businesses.
  • Our recognition - We accelerate your career, if you want to progress quickly, we will make it happen. We pay fairly based on your performance, and above market standards. Want 6 - 12 additional days leave per year?  You can have that. Want to work in New York? You can do that. Drinks on Friday? We do that. Like to attend industry events? We offer that. Want to become a thought leader and be invited as a key note at an industry conference? You will do that.
  • Your development - we are a learning environment. Every day we learn and grow. We will give you all the coaching, mentoring and training you need to develop and progress your career.
, '\n',

Visit our website for more information www.forethought.com.au/careers or email careers@forethought.com.au. If this description fits you, let's talk. Please call Tess Morgan, Talent Manager on 8199 3526.

, '\n']

title: b'Data Analyst - Immediate Start\r\n    '
jd:
['\n',

Our client within the Government sector is looking to fill an urgent Data Analyst role based centrally within the Melbourne CBD. This role is for an immediate start and would suit candidate with solid experience working across the production of reports from complex databases within excel and .csv format.

, '\n',

The Role

, '\n',

The data analysts will be required to extract raw data from the database, correct collate and validate the data to produce an annual report for this government branch.


Your Duties will be:

, '\n',
  • Develop and analysis reports for the branch annual report
  • Extract raw data, clean the data, and develop reports for the annual report.
  • Work with over 80 external clients to assist with the validation of data
  • Work within an xml format where all information is coded
  • Produced accurate and complex reports for use within an annual report
, '\n',


You will have:

, '\n',
  • Proficient experience in extracting data that is captured from numerous csv or xml tables.
  • Previous experience and strong understanding of a complex database
  • Understanding of IT systems and have the ability to undertake problem solving.
  • Good communication skills with the ability to communicate with a variety of different stakeholders
  • Confidence to engage with internal and external clients
  • Participate in team meetings/project groups
  • Knowledge of Lotus Notes, knowledge of webpages advantageous
, '\n',

The successful candidate will need to undergo an national police check.

Applicants that have lived internationally for more then 12 months in the last 10 years MUST hold a current international police clearance to be considered for this role.

, '\n',

If you are professional and experienced data analyst who is available immediately please, click 'apply now' to forward a current date copy of your CV in a plain word format. Alternatively you can email your CV to elizabeth.clampit@randstad.com.au

, '\n',

, '\n']

title: b'Data Analyst - Javascript or Python Scripting\r\n      '
jd:
['The role requires in-depth GIS based processes, SQL and reporting services, Data analytics, Web Mapping capability to assist with the data quality management, reporting and root cause analysis the business needs to identify opportunities and articulate\r\n solutions. The person will also need to have the ability to script small scale tactical solutions utilising python or auto hotkey solutions.',
, '\n',
, '\r\nJavascript or Python Scripting Experience is Mandatory',
, '\n',
, '\r\nSkills and Experience Required:\xa0',
, '\n',
  • Demonstrated experience of GIS mapping and CAD experience 
  • Knowledge of data management toolsets such as SSIS or other similar ETL tools, Oracle SQL, SQL server and Collibra 
  • Knowledge of Python scripting
  • Scripting experience
  • Excellent practical problem solving skills
  • Experience in the implementation of systems and products
  • Experience in auditing capability, ability to elicit, analyse and interpret business requirements/issues
  • Ability to perform root cause analysis, data mining and reporting  
, '\r\nAccountabilities of this role:\xa0',
, '\n',
  • Provide composition of maps, with varying levels of complexity, fitting with the operational need and requirements  
  • Perform Geo-processing and reporting to identify and highlight Data quality focus points, including concatenation of simple and complex attributes and spatial queries for map display and /or data extraction 
  • Assist in creating and modifying normalized and dimensional models, with the use of  metadata, data mapping, and data profiling concepts 
  • Conduct impact assessments of business process bottlenecks and high level solution themes, including an assessment of policy, people, process and technology that identify analysis-based opportunities and articulate rationale for recommendations.
  • Monitor/govern to end to end operational impacting interactions and drive stakeholders across all business units to deliver strategic improvements.
  • Assist with creation of automation scripting to support the organisation's agile delivery. 
, '\r\nTo register your interest and learn more about this exciting role, please apply online or send your application to Elin Gill at egill@launchrecruitment.com.au\r\n ']

title: b'Commercial / Data Analyst\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

With over 300 stores across Australia and growing internationally, Boost Juice, Salsas Fresh Mex and CIBO Espresso have become iconic brands across the retail landscape.
We are a vibrant & dynamic company dedicated to people - both those that buy our products & those that make them!

, '\n',

A fantastic opportunity has opened up for a talented and passionate Commercial/Data Analyst to join the Business Intelligence team at our Support Office in Chadstone.

, '\n',

This is a great role for someone looking to step up from their current role and to work closely with our brands and contribute to successful business outcomes.

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

Your responsibilities will include:

, '\n',
  • Ability to extract data & transform it into analytical solutions
  • Working with various business stakeholders to establish requirements that assist with the design & delivery of analytical solutions
  • Contribute to the delivery of financial and commercial strategies and decisions through evaluation and pursuit of opportunities
  • Support the Commercial Finance Team with data extraction and system usage
  • Providing education/training where required to new and existing users on updates and system improvements
  • Assist in the management and maintenance of the production databases, BI Platform and reporting systems/solutions
  • Provide data analysis to the business and assist with tracking trends/performance of our brands
  • Assist in developing & maintaining monthly KPI reporting
, '\n',

 

, '\n',

Essential Criteria:

, '\n',
, '\n',
  • 2 years or more graduate work experience in a relevant role (finance or BI disciplines) in a corporate environment or a consultancy  
  • Tertiary Qualifications in Accounting, Business, Finance, Economics, or relevant discipline
  • SQL skills (either Oracle or Microsoft)
  • Exceptional analytical skills (data manipulation & development of commercial analysis)
  • Strong communication skills with ability to engage with various levels of management
  • Excellent analytical and problem solving skills
  • Advanced Excel knowledge and skills
  • High level attention to detail 
  • Service orientated team player
  • Experience using Business Intelligence products will be favourably looked upon
, '\n',

 

, '\n',

You will be driven and passionate, and keen to work within a fast moving and vibrant environment and have a true desire to succeed!

, '\n',

In return, you will work with a passionate and driven team that works within a fast moving and vibrant environment and has a lot of fun along the way!

Please apply with your resume and cover letter.
 

, '\n',

Agencies please do not apply to this role - we just want to talk to amazing, real people.
