title: b'\r\n          Survey Data Analyst\r\n        '
jd:
[' ',

, ' ',

About the business and the role

, ' ',

Austraffic has over 30 years' experience in the traffic and transport industry as data collection specialists. Austraffic's expertise is in survey design, execution, quality assurance, data processing and presentation of results.  Austraffic specialises in data collection and market research for local and state government, consultants and private clients

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

Job tasks and responsibilities

, ' ',

The following are key responsibilities:

, ' ',

Primary Responsibilities

, ' ',

Data Management

, ' ',
  1. Review client survey requirements in order to assist with providing accurate quotes and timelines for analysis tasks.
  2. Provide timely, accurate and detailed professionally presented project reports.
  3. Complete quality checks for data processed by others as required.
  4. Send formatted results to Clients with outage and observation details and reports (as required).
  5. Identify problems and improvements and raise Notices, assign tasks and follow up appropriately on the Austraffic Business Management Interface.
  6. Review instructions to the processing team to ensure timely and accurate traffic counts.
  7. Update work status and manage task priorities using the online project management tools.
, ' ',

Business Development

, ' ',
  1. Continually review Austraffic data management systems to ensure ease of use, fit for purpose design with a focus on automation for standardising data processing.
  2. Influence system design to assist with timely and accurate completion of data processing and reporting tasks.
  3. Continually review Austraffic analytic software for easy use & report presentations.
, ' ',

Office Management

, ' ',
  1. Ensure that a safe work place is provided for all workers and visitors.
  2. Ensure that the office complies with the requirements of the Business Management System and Business Management Interface (Austraffic intranet) usage requirement.
  3. Ensure the office is secured at the close of business and sufficient access provided to workers and suppliers, including access to the warehouse and car park facility as needed.
, ' ',

Secondary Activities

, ' ',

Project Delivery

, ' ',
  1. Undertake survey activities as required including but not limited to:
    • Survey Set Up
    • Site Supervision
    • Data Collection
    • Field Audits
  2. Escalate unresolved or incomplete activities as necessary to ensure timely closure of projects.
, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

Skills and experience

, ' ',

To be considered for a position you must have excellent English comprehension, written and verbal communication skills. You will be responsible for managing traffic data quality, interacting with the Survey Management Teams and working with client project briefs.  We are looking for individuals with a high level of attention to detail, an ability to work with numbers and in particular identify traffic patterns and apply logic to validate and test the outcomes. You will be expected to identify process improvements and enhance the business by proactively engaging with the team to develop system solutions to minimise repetition, ensure accuracy in results and deliver high quality client reports.

, ' ',

Core business tools include inhouse Traffic Survey software primarily producing excel based client reports, a Business Management System (Intranet) for project management and compliance and Microsoft suite for general administration and communications.  

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

Job benefits and perks

, ' ',

The Victorian office is located in Croydon South, close to public transport. The hours of work will be between 8am-6pm, Monday-Friday or as otherwise required to meet project demand.   From time to time, there may be a requirement to travel to the New South Wales office (located in Rydalmere), for example to undertake training or provide project support.

, ' ',

Applications close: Monday, 8 May 2017.

, ' ',

Short listed applicants will be notified by email on Thursday, 11 May with first round interviews planned for Monday, 15 May 2017.

If this position is of interest to you, email your resume to office.vic@austraffic.com.au.

, ' ',

, ' ']

title: b'Data Analyst/Estimator Job\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

The Company

, '\n',

, '\n',

Broadspectrum is an operations, maintenance and construction services organisation, operating globally in the resources, energy, industrial, infrastructure, rail, property and defence sectors. This is a complex and evolving business offering the high profile projects, large-scale challenges and tailored support you need to achieve on the global stage.

, '\n',
, '\n',

The Role

Reporting to the General Manager, you will lead the Estimating Function through the end to end process in Tender proposal and submission. You will manage a skilled team of subject matter experts, hold a strong commercial acumen and the ability to develop strategic commercial solutions. 

Further, you will:

  • Manage estimating component of all EOI and tender submission related activities.
  • Provide leadership to the estimating team ensuring an understanding of bid scope, implementing bid strategies for projects, monitoring and meeting proposal preparation timelines.
  • Provide commercial and strategic solutions and advice
  • Ensure a thorough understanding of commercial estimating models and legal compliance as it relates to proposals and tenders
  • Manage estimating function through the gate process to ensure on time delivery of estimating data and solutions.
The successful candidate will have relevant tertiary qualifications and have demonstrated experience in an estimating or commercial role. You will be hands on, able to build influential relationships and manage a team in line with Broadspectrum Diversity and Inclusion Philosophy. You will be a leader with a collaborative team approach and the ability to deliver strong solutions.
, '\n',
, '\n',

In return for your commitment and expertise we can provide you with an environment centred on Learning & development, flexible working hours, internal career mobility and a team that will embrace ideas to improve the way business is inducted.

We acknowledge the importance of our people’s diverse experiences, talents and cultures that they bring to work with them each day. Embracing Diversity and Creating Inclusion is a key component of our Talent Management Strategy. The creation of a Diverse and Inclusive workforce is central to our ability to unlock potential and enhance our success, creating a high-performance business.

Job Requisition: 76911

 


, '\n',

, '\n']

title: b'Data Analyst (CRM & Digital)\r\n    '
jd:
['\n',

The Just Group is an established, progressive and growing multinational organisation with seven iconic retail brands, currently with over 1000 stores across Australia, New Zealand, Singapore, Malaysia, Hong Kong and the United Kingdom.

, '\n',

An exciting opportunity exists for a Data Analyst (CRM & Digital) to join the Just Group team.

, '\n',


Play a key role in identifying high value customers and formulate customer segmentations across our portfolio of brands; Just Jeans, Jacqui E, Jay Jays, Portmans, Peter Alexander, Dotti and Smiggle to support personalisation and optimisation strategies. Build data models to project the business benefit from new digital initiatives, and establish performance measures and KPIs.

, '\n',


This role offers a significant level of scope in influencing CRM and Digital channel strategies for The Just Group with opportunity for growth and progression within the business

, '\n',

In this role you will be responsible for, but not limited to;

, '\n',
  • Customer analytics projects that may include; Customer propensity/regression modelling (churn, acquisition, cross sell), segmentation analysis, marketing campaign analytics, customer lifetime value analysis, next best offer analysis etc.
  • Conduct end to end analysis including mining, preparation and building of data resulting in delivery of actionable insights presented in a digestible format for business stakeholders that clearly articulate the business value
  • Conduct deep-dive analysis of customer purchase journey (from completion of order online through to successful delivery to customer) and provide recommendations on enhancements based on effort/outcome
  • Extract value from analytics platforms associated with The Just Group's data to formulate insights, taking into account historical performance, web analytics, digital channel platforms, promotional calendars, Just Group financial reporting systems
  • Build data models to project sales, establish KPI's, online metrics and ROI for new proposed digital initiatives to support business case developme
  • 3+ years' experience with CRM campaign measurement and reporting
, '\n',

To be successful in this role you will possess;

, '\n',
  • Proven digital analytics experience in Coremetrics, Adobe Marketing Cloud or similar
  • Strong technical skills in extracting, manipulating and merging large customer data sets (e.g. SQL, Tableau)
  • Tertiary qualifications in Data Science, Analytics or related discipline
  • Knowledge of retail industry and relevant KPI's
  • Strong Excel skills
  • A passion for data and extensive experience mining and interpreting large data sets to produce actionable insights
, '\n',

We are seeking interest from both local and international specialists, with experience in commercially-focused retail environments.

, '\n',

To register your interest in this exciting opportunity, apply today.

, '\n',

Due to the fast paced nature of our business, the application close date may be subject to change. Don't delay and apply as soon as possible as we will assess applications as they are received.

, '\n']

title: b'Supply Chain Information Operations Analyst\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

Our client is a leading organisation that plays a central role in the Australian health sector. They are presently seeking to recruit a Supply Chain Data Analyst. This position will drive data integrity improvements in a state-wide revised customer catalogue whilst supporting the broader business by building and maintaining relationships with key stakeholders.

, '\n',

Core projects and supply chain transformation initiatives are now in motion and they are now entering a phase which has opened up this 12 month fixed term contract. The key skills required for this position revolve heavily around data analysis, business processes and operational Supply Chain activities with a focus on purchasing, supplier relationships and inventory.

, '\n',

The main duties and responsibilities can be summarised as follows;

, '\n',
  • Maintain and cleanse data for the product catalogue to provide consistency across multiple business units
  • Ensure all requests and correspondence is actioned and analyse issues arising from such
  • Act as the main point of contact for any issues that may arise with new users and support suppliers in the on-boarding process
  • Design, implement and maintain process to assist with the catalogue maintenance
  • Analyse and identify themes and trends from data
  • Develop, build and maintain working relationships with key internal and external stakeholders
, '\n',

The successful candidate will possess the following skills and attributes;

, '\n',
  • Tertiary qualification in business or related field coupled with experience in data analysis and supply chain, purchasing and procurement is highly regarded
  • Prior experience in catalogue management and GS1 standards is highly desirable
  • Very strong Excel skills and reporting proficiency
  • Exposure to inventory control, purchasing and supplier relationship management
  • Passion for problem solving and strong analytical process exposure
  • Ability to think on your feet and use initiative whilst collaborating in a team
, '\n',

This is an excellent opportunity to join a large organisation that has embarked on a significant supply chain transformation. A strong package plus numerous staff benefits is on offer for the suitable candidate. For more information please call Eilidh Steel on 03 9245 0458 or submit your application through the appropriate links.

, '\n']

, ' ',

Do you enjoy working in an environment with independence, no micromanagement and where you get to deal with stakeholders from top management down to work floor level? And do you have solid experience in SQL development, SSIS and SSRS? Then read on, as this will surely be of interest to you.

, ' ',

As a result of a merger, this promising company now has a strong financial backbone and a ambitious vision to grow. But in order to grow, they need to be in a position to analyse and find areas for improvement. Which is why the newly created Data Analyst position is a critical one to the business. Because the team is perceived to be much more than just service providing, they sit with the Finance department where they work closely with the business and can understand how the organisation operates. Therefore, good business acumen and communication skills are a must. This is a great role and perfect time to join, as it is expected that anyone who joins at the start of their growth, will having a higher chance of fast-tracking their career within this dynamic company.

, ' ',

In this specific role you will be involved in technical BI activities related to SQL and TSQL development, building ETL packages (SSIS), gathering business requirements, building reports (SSRS), implement a new visualisation tool (PowerBI or Tableau) and data migration projects. This role is primarily project-driven, with hardly any BAU work.

, ' ',

Key requirements asked in this role:

, ' ',
  • Good SQL/TSQL development experience
  • Experience in SSIS
  • Experience in SSRS
  • Good communication skills and experience to gather requirements directly with stakeholders
, ' ',
Does this sound like a great opportunity to you? Or would you want to know more about this? Please hit the Apply button and have us get back in touch with you.
, ' ',
 
, ' ',
Please note: Only those with a proven relevant background will be contacted.
, ' ']

title: b'Senior Data Analyst'
jd:
[' ',

Play an integral role enabling the generation of actionable insights for the Village Cinemas Business

, ' ',

The role you will play:

, ' ',

Partnering with key business stakeholders and with a direct reporting line to the Commercial Manager you will provide meaningful insights and greater visibility of business performance, supporting key management decisions. Your demonstrable experience with high level analysis will cover both financial and non-financial data providing sophisticated statistical and technical concepts.

, ' ',

You will both engage and educate key business stakeholders as you take responsibility for:

, ' ',
  • Creating data visualisations and drill down dashboard reporting
  • Creating analytical models to turn raw data into actionable insight to support fact-based decisions
  • Modelling data correlations, predictions, forecasting and what if analysis utilising a variety of statistical techniques
  • Leveraging statistical techniques including predictive and descriptive modelling, data mining, text analytics, OLAP manipulation, optimisation, simulation and statistical analysis techniques
  • Provide system training to other business users
  • Linking with the Village Roadshow corporate Data Analyst community and external interest groups to leverage and share best practice
, ' ',

Required Experience:

You will bring a high level of self motivation, initiative and flexibility coupled with effective planning, time management and a commitment to meeting deadlines. You will have demonstrable experience in a Data Analytics capacity through the use of predictive analytics and data visualisation software. Most importantly, your strong ability to communicate relatively sophisticated statistical and technical concepts with internal business partners at all levels of the organisation will see you succeed in this newly created role.

, ' ',

In return, Village Cinemas offer a collaborative team environment and opportunity to develop and grow your career with a large organisation while partnering with engaged and passionate individuals sharing a common goal of success.

, ' ',

Apply now!

title: b'Lead Data Management Analyst\r\n    '
jd:
[' ',

title: b'\r\n        Senior Analyst \xe2\x80\x93 Analytics/Data/Programming\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

Behind their commercial recommendations is a rigorous technical appreciation and knowledge of numbers that allows them to quantify and back-up their insights with statistical fact.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

They excel in complex analysis and modelling across a range of techniques – choice modelling, regression, market mix-modelling, max diff, decision hierarchies, experimental design, segmentation, multivariate analysis, preference mapping, hypothesis testing and the like.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

All of these advanced techniques are used in the service of big brand consumer clients to help with communication strategies, optimisation of product design, pricing points and new product launch evaluation and such like.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

The 3 key aspects:

, ' ',

 

, ' ',
  1. Analytics – working closely with the Analytics Director to run anything from low/mid/high level research analytics as listed above
  2. Data – working closely with the Operations Director on data processing, preparation, re-structuring and accuracy
  3. Operations – programming, automating and generally improving process development
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

The culture:

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

An ambitious award-winning consultancy, collaborative, sharp, proud and extremely well regarded in industry circles. You will sit in the Analytics team which will support 20+ experienced consultants juggling projects across multiple methodologies and industries.  At the beginning of the week, there is a weekly WIP to get the whole company across projects and goals and outcomes which is indicative of the collaboration and co-operation.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

The ideal candidate:

, ' ',

 

, ' ',
  • Extensive & proven experience in the techniques outlined above in a commercial setting
  • You will be able to work with multiple and large data sets
  • Experience of customer survey based research
  • You will have strong technical expertise – SPSS, Q, Excel etc.
  • Ideally programming knowledge – SQL and VBA
  • A problem solver
  • Looking for opportunities to learn and progress
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

To apply or for further information, please send your CV to Zoe Crouch at Resources Group: ZCrouch@resourcesgroup.com or call 02 9258 1121.

, ' ']

  • Perform Geo-processing and reporting to identify and highlight Data quality focus points, including concatenation of simple and complex attributes and spatial queries for map display and /or data extraction 
  • Assist in creating and modifying normalized and dimensional models, with the use of  metadata, data mapping, and data profiling concepts 
  • Conduct impact assessments of business process bottlenecks and high level solution themes, including an assessment of policy, people, process and technology that identify analysis-based opportunities and articulate rationale for recommendations.
  • Monitor/govern to end to end operational impacting interactions and drive stakeholders across all business units to deliver strategic improvements.
  • Assist with creation of automation scripting to support the organisation's agile delivery. 
, '\r\nTo register your interest and learn more about this exciting role, please apply online or send your application to Elin Gill at egill@launchrecruitment.com.au\r\n ']

title: b'\r\n          Junior Data Analyst\r\n        '
jd:
[' ',

The Business

, ' ',

M&T Growth Partners is a business advisory firm focused on generating growth for client companies. We identify and unlock the commercial opportunities that can help accelerate growth. We then implement agile plans to turn our insights into customer centric communication programmes[WR1] [T2]  for both B2C and B2B.

, ' ',

We are looking for an insightful Junior Data Analyst to join our team.

, ' ',

The role will expose the successful candidate to a number of exciting development opportunities and give them the ability to learn from people with a wealth of experience.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Position Responsibilities

, ' ',

The role will focus on data analytics, insights and KPI's for a number of clients within the realm of Insurance, Real Estate, Packaging, Leisure and Big Data, just to name a few.

, ' ',

The role will require the Junior Data Analyst to:

, ' ',
  • Gather data and critically evaluate data from multiple sources with great attention to detail (i.e. impact of multiple definitions)
  • Produce comprehensive insights for the team with clear conclusions supported by data
  • Produce both deep dive foundational pieces of work along with adhoc analytics turned around at a fast pace
  • Present data in an insightful and engaging way
  • Produce regular comprehensive dashboards of performance
  • Work with a number of stakeholders from partners to client sales people
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Adequate training and support will be provided to undertake these tasks capably but candidates must have strong analytic techniques, capabilities and an enquiring approach.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Suitable candidates will be:

, ' ',
  • Be curious. You possess strong analytical skills, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret and extrapolate data
  • Be insightful. The ability to critically derive context from unclear, incomplete and sometimes contradictory data
  • A doer. A multitasker that can get stuff done. You have the ability to work independently and collaboratively while managing initiatives simultaneously
  • Immense enthusiastic about his/her work and a willingness to learn
  • An Australian citizen
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Suitable candidates will have:

, ' ',
  • A current graduate with experience in a data analytics. Sufficient to have a confidence about themselves and a hunger to learn.
  • The ability to extract, clean, connect and process data from multiple sources
  • Mastery in Excel and the capability to organize large and sometimes complex data sets
  • Familiarity with Tableau, SPSS, R and the ability to pick up other data type software quickly.   
  • An interest in turning data into insights about behaviour and actions
  • A mastery of statistics and capability to learn what you don't know.
  • An understanding of eCommerce and the ability to quickly learn their way around Google Analytics and other digital software
  • Have highly developed communication skills in spoken and written English
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Benefits of working with M&T Growth Partners

, ' ',
  • You will have exposure to commercial experts which will credibility to your career development
  • Exposure to real-world marketing strategies, project management and implementation
  • Broad range of skills and opportunities to experience in our business focused environment
  • Opportunity to work closely with senior management and learn on the job
  • Competitive salary and the development flexibility of working in a small consulting firm
  • Exposure to a fast learning environment
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Apply now by emailing your Resume with a brief Cover Letter to,

, ' ',

Tim Stanford on wage@mandtgp.com,

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Learn more about M&T Growth Partners at www.mandtgp.com

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Applications close 5:00pm AEST 12 May

, ' ']

title: b'Data Analyst and Developer - Marketing Analytics\r\n        '
jd:
[' ',

Company

, ' ',

Our client is a small division of a well-known Australian company. The parent company has had strong market presence over the last 20 years, most recently in the digital space. Whilst the parent company may be well-known, this role is based in an entity that has been in operation for the last 4.5 years and is something of a quiet achiever in its space.

, ' ',

Due to the fact that the company operates semi-autonomously, working there offers all the advantages and flexibility of a small company, with the backing of a profitable parent entity.

, ' ',

As its business and clients continue to grow, the company is now looking to move into the next stage, whilst still maintaining its unique identity. To achieve this, they're looking for like-minded people to invoke change, shape their transition and grow alongside them.

, ' ',

Culture

, ' ',

The company are tech savvy, digital marketing enthusiasts who understand the benefits of creating a collaborative team environment. They build teams of people with marketing prowess that enable greater understanding of their client's end to end needs – from technical development phase right through to advertising.

, ' ',

More often than not, business cases for new tech come from the 'ground up'. A truly data driven culture, they strive to be on top of the latest ways to harness and review crucial market information for their client base.

, ' ',

They're successful, innovative and profitable – and they do it all with flexible hours and an enviable adherence to a work/life balance.

, ' ',

Role

, ' ',

On a daily basis, you'll undertake the following and more:

, ' ',
  • Setting up new clients with Google Analytics and Google AdWords, as well as be innovative in working toward new strategies beyond Google
  • Work with the company's clients to understand their aims and how best they can be realised
  • Provide and maintain daily, weekly, monthly web analytics reports/dashboards to internal stakeholders as well as managing ad-hoc analytics requests (internal and external)
  • Work with APIs to configure data visualisation tool for our clients
  • Data extraction from various sources to BI platform to allow analysis of campaign conversion effectiveness, as well as identifying areas for improvement
  • Campaign (Social,SEM,SEO) dashboard reporting and data processing
  • Providing implementation guidelines to development teams for implementing tracking codes on client platforms
  • Monitor web analytics tracking across different channels and provide solutions for any deficiencies
, ' ',

Skills & Experience

, ' ',

The successful candidate must have a strong marketing background (ideally digital) with minimum 3 years' experience in the following:

, ' ',
  • Javascript, JQuery (including plugins), HTML5, CSS, PHP
  • Python, Ruby or R
  • Web APIs: Ability to talk to third party REST APIs (Google Analytics, AdWords, Facebook Graph API etc.) over OAuth or Basic Auth
  • Ability to parse and transform data from JSON, XML, CSV, TSV to other formats
  • MySQL or PostgreSQL handling using Python or other scripting language using database drivers
  • Accurate and readily customizable reporting to meet client demands
  • Data - processing, cleaning and integration
  • Prediction Modeling
  • Business intelligence data feeds and platform integration
, ' ',

Desirable additional skills or knowledge:

, ' ',
  • .NET web development
  • Klipfolio Business Intelligence software
  • Experience deploying and managing Apache or ngnix hosting environments
  • Linux administration
, ' ',

In addition, we're seeking a person with a team oriented, proactive mindset who aligns with the company's culture as detailed above.

, ' ',

Why you'd want this role.

, ' ',
  • Huge capacity to develop your own personal, soft and technical skills
  • The company is gearing up for a new era and undergoing true reinvention – you can be part of the initial phase, even benchmark and help shape future roles for yourself
  • Primarily an end to end marketing company, you will be exposed to the latest technologies and strategies to achieve client results
  • An environment where management actively seek staff input  
  • Ongoing professional training
, ' ',

About Vivid

, ' ',

Vivid are a recently established company that aims to provide a far more transparent and open recruitment experience for Candidates and Clients alike. You can follow our most recent roles and developments at www.linkedin.com/company/vivid---clearly-different as well as reading more about us at www.vividcd.com

, ' ',

Further information

, ' ',

For further information about the role, please forward your CV to clearlydifferent@vividcd.com and be assured of full confidentiality.

, ' ',

Please note that only applicants based in and with unlimited rights to work in Australia can be considered for this position.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

 

, ' ']

title: b'Data Compliance Analyst\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

IRESS is a principal global supplier of share market and wealth management systems producing innovative, sophisticated solutions. We provide solutions that help with life's big decisions – from getting a mortgage approval, planning for retirement, to trading on the stock exchange – things that make a real difference to people's lives and financial well-being

, '\n',

We are looking for a Data Compliance Analyst to join our global team.

, '\n',

Ensuring internal and external compliance of exchange and contributed data is a top priority.  The goals of data compliance are:

, '\n',
  1. Set the standards and drive changes across the IRESS products to be in compliance.
  2. Facilitate the growth of IRESS revenue
  3. Support the business with regards to data contracts, markets data cost trends etc
  4. Minimise any monetary or reputational risk to IRESS.
, '\n',

As an experienced Data Analyst you'll be responsible for : 

, '\n',
  • Assessing the impact of monthly exchange product/licensing/billing changes and communicating with sales and product stakeholders about impact and drive changes where appropriate
  • Driving internal and external data usage policies across IRESS product suites including but not limited to white label, EDS, API/DDI usage and non-display
  • Driving changes to process, products and UE2 to ensure billing and permissioning is compliant
  • Conduct regular product reviews to ensure organisational compliance with all exchange regulatory, technical, contractual and pricing changes. Work with Product and Sales teams to achieve compliance if problems exists.
  • Communicating to clients regarding third party terms changes
  • Regular market data billing reviews to ensure the correct payment for products and services that IRESS is using
  • Assist Data Compliance Manager with exchange audit engagements
  • Collaborate with the Data Compliance Manager & Sales teams to grow revenue for white label / API service in a compliant manner
  • Support Head of Market Data with understanding cost changes and trend reporting in market data
, '\n',

Core Skills, Knowledge and Attributes:

, '\n',
  • Significant expertise with exchange/ data vendor management or data compliance is highly desirable
  • A university graduate with a first or second degree in financial services area
  • Understanding of market data terms and common policies
  • Prior experience with IRESS products highly desireable.
, '\n',

Key Competencies

, '\n',
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong interpersonal, collaborative and presentation skills for interacting with and influencing team members, clients and internal stakeholders
  • Proven ability to work independently and deliver to strict deadlines
  • Strong project management skills
  • Critical thinking and problem solving skills
  • Strong collaboration and teamwork skills
  • Demonstrable reporting and analytical skills
  • Attention to detail and ability to follow up
  • Ability to read and understand market data contracts
, '\n',

Culture and Perks

, '\n',

We recognize and reward hard work and celebrate our successes over a Friday afternoon drink and at various socials throughout the year. We don't sweat the small stuff either, our dress code is as relaxed as we are. As well as local charity events and initiatives, we hold global days and activities to make the most of our global strength and diversity. This includes a yearly global hackathon!

, '\n',

Perks include subsidized healthcare insurance, share scheme, community events, flexible working opportunities and access to various learning and development programs.

, '\n',

About IRESS

, '\n',

We began in 1993 as a small Australian tech start-up. Now we're a global team of over 1,400 brilliantly-minded people across five continents – and we're still growing. We're listed on the Australian Stock Exchange, with a strong financial track record and our continuous investment in product development and innovation is what keeps us ahead of the game. We may be one of the largest financial software providers, but we haven't forgotten our roots; we've kept the entrepreneurial spirit and agility that defined our early years - it's something we continue to look for and admire in our people.

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

 

, '\n']

title: b'\r\n          Infrastructure Cloud Pre Sales Consultant\r\n        '
jd:
[' ',

Do you have a passion for helping organizations on their journey to the cloud, accelerating their digital transformations by moving workloads and deploying net new cloud native projects? Do you have it in you to shape and deliver the cloud roadmap of your customer? Are you able to take ambiguity and complexity and turn it into a simple, clear set of key value based messages? Do you have a "can do" attitude? Is coaching and leading second nature to you? If so then you could be part of the Oracle Australia team that will be shaping this market moving forward!

, ' ',

Oracle has transformed itself into a hyper scale cloud player by aggressively rolling out an extensive and comprehensive portfolio of SaaS, PaaS and IaaS services. These services are delivering real outcomes for our customers. At Oracle, we're hiring highly technical consultants to engage with customers and partners to position value proposition and differentiation of Oracle's next generation Infrastructure cloud to business / functional stakeholders as well as deliver technical workshops, training, hands on labs, proof of concept for a lift & shift and workload migration projects to technical stakeholders.

, ' ',

The Infrastructure Cloud Sales Consultant will be instrumental in helping sales increase not just Infrastructure Cloud bookings, but driving Enterprise-class cloud platform-based change for Organisations across Australia and New Zealand.

, ' ',

Responsibilities:

, ' ',
  • An expert level Sales Consultant responsible for formulating and leading presales technical/functional support activity to prospective clients and customers. Acts as a technical resource and mentor for less experienced Sales Consultants.
  • Continuous improvement in self-research, learning and readiness on the new public and Hybrid cloud services offerings.
  • Stay abreast of global and regional cloud market and the competition.
  • Build / Leverage assets that help simplify available information into key sales messages helping sales teams with value based selling, business case definition, ROI analysis, position references and analyst data.
  • Extend and enlarge the knowledge base of their domain of expertise by defining new approaches, by coaching others and by leadership in their professional communities internally and externally. Write technical papers (white papers, competitive, technology, position papers, etc.)
  • Actively participate in organizational skill exchanges and transfers expertise to others.
  • Be creative with strong problem solving skills and the ability to adapt and succeed in a fast paced and ambiguous environment.
, ' ',

Competencies

, ' ',
  • Successful history of result oriented business development driving net new business sales as well as increasing the wallet share in existing customer base.
  • Fundamental knowledge of cloud architecture and understanding software development and lifecycle management concepts & methods as it relates to Cloud technologies
, ' ',
  • Ability to provide technical blue print to meet customer virtual software defined datacenter needs.
  • Proven track record of delivering technical proof of concepts, technical workshops, trainings and effectively handling technical questions and objections.
  • Minimum of 12+ years of relevant experience in positioning, selling enterprise software solutions. Minimum 5 years gained within major cloud vendors.
  • Credibility at all levels, including Lines of Business and CxO.
  • Demonstrate deep skill in at least 5 out of following 10 areas.
, ' ',

1. Cloud native application development using dev ops paradigm, leveraging docker , using both Oracle and Non Oracle technologies

, ' ',

2. Experience of moving Non Oracle workloads such a Non Oracle Java, C,C++, OSS, Non Oracle BI, Non Oracle ETL etc to Compute Cloud Service.

, ' ',

3. Migrating Application Unlimited Workload (EBS,PS, JDE, Siebel, etc.) to Compute Cloud Service..

, ' ',

4. In-depth knowledge of VMW and KVM

, ' ',

5. In-depth knowledge of Oracle's Cloud@Customer protfolio.

, ' ',

6. End to end DC Architecture and on the ground execution experience on moving bulk workloads to virtual software defined data centers.

, ' ',

7. Hand on experience covering Network Elements/Topology/security realms, connectivity options and specially Software Defined Network

, ' ',

8. Deep Technical Skills covering all aspects of Block, Archive and Object Storage Cloud Services

, ' ',

9. Skill / Certification covering Public and Hybrid Cloud Security

, ' ',

10. Build solutions involving Compute CS, Storage CS (Object,Block,Archive Storage), Network CS (VPN, Fast Connect) along with one /more of Oracle PaaS services.

, ' ']

title: b'Artificial Intelligence Lead Consultant - Melbourne\r\n      '
jd:
[About us:,
, ' ', EYC3 is the data and advanced analytics capability within EY Asia-Pacific working in multiple sectors including financial services, government & public sector, energy, mining & metals, and consumer products.  We have more than 250 specialist staff in Australia, New Zealand, Singapore, Hong Kong, Korea, The Philippines and Malaysia. EYC3 creates intelligent client organizations using data & advanced analytics. We implement information-driven strategies and systems that help grow, optimize and protect client organizations, and create a lasting culture that encourages people to use information creatively and intelligently to improve business outcomes. We go beyond strategy and provide end to end implementation of real life data environments and have some of the best architects, project managers, business analysts, data scientist, big data engineers, developers and consultants in the region.  ,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', Due to our continued growth we are looking for a Artificial Intelligence Lead Consultant to join our team in Melbourne. , ' ',

, ' ',

 

, ' ',
, ' ', About the role:,
, ' ',
The Artificial Intelligence Lead Consultant is responsible for helping our clients to identify, shape and execute on AI opportunities. The person in this role will split her/his time between practice development (25%), sales (50%) and overseeing client engagements (25%).
 
Responsibilities will include but not limited to:
 
- Develop AI-driven client proposals and solution offerings.
- Establish credibility with clients by demonstrating knowledge of AI best practices and trends in business.
- Build relationships with other practices within the firm, as well as external alliance partners.
- Oversee AI advisory engagements, with responsibility for client satisfaction and engagement financials.
- Support the recruitment, development and retention of an AI advisory team.
,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', We are looking for people with the following:,
, ' ',
- A demonstrable track record of selling AI advisory services to top-tier organisations in APAC.
- AI subject matter expert status, evidenced by previous publishing, social media and public speaking activity.
- A network across client and technology vendor organisations.
- Experience mobilising and leading at least two AI advisory or implementation projects.
- An AI-related degree (e.g. Computer Science, Electronic Engineering) or equivalent experience.
,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', What we will provide you: ,
, ' ', - We strive to recruit the best people. This means you will be surrounded by highly skilled and passionate individuals wherever you go at EY,
, ' ', - When you join our team, you open the door to a stimulating international career. It is rewarding to be part of an organisation that is at the forefront of analytics. You will get a chance to work on and support sophisticated and market-leading products. We are a global organisation with a promising future and lots of opportunities for you to evolve and grow,
, ' ', - A culture where respect, integrity and teaming define the way we work together. You'll also find support for your continuous growth and success.,
, ' ', For a career move that expands your horizons, apply today and join a firm that is committed to building an inclusive culture that supports a diverse workforce, helping you to gain experiences that will set you up for a lifetime.,
, ' ',

 

, ' ',
, ' ', Apply now:,
, ' ', Across every part of EY, we dig deeper in pursuit of better working. Does better begin with you? Click apply online to find out. ,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', The preferred applicant will be subject to employment screening by Ernst & Young or by their external third party provider.,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', © 2015 Ernst & Young Australia. All Rights Reserved., ' ',

, ' ']

title: b'Technical Data Officer'
jd:
[' ',

APS 5
Melbourne, VIC
$76,335 - $81,764 (plus super)* Inclusive of the Building Defence Capability Payment

, ' ',

The Technical Data Officer will work as a Data Analyst within the Aeronautical Information Service - Air Force (AIS-AF) which is part of Air Force's Air Warfare Centre. The Data Analyst uses a combination of geospatial tools, aeronautical knowledge and experience, to analyse Aeronautical Information to determine its accuracy and applicability, and resolve anomalies found in the source data. The Data Analyst enters analysed Aeronautical Information into geospatial databases and/or desktop publishing software, in compliance with approved processes, formats and internationally recognised specifications.

, ' ',

In addition, the Data Analyst performs validation checks on flight critical data, to ensure accuracy and compliance with processes, formats and specifications. The Data Analyst is expected to liaise with other AIS-AF teams, external authorities and stakeholders to assist with the production of Aeronautical Information products and services, including the preparation and management of NOTAM information.

, ' ',

The Data Analyst works in a dynamic environment with time pressures to meet International Civil Aviation Organisation distribution cycles and short notice Australian Defence Force contingencies. The majority of work is conducted in an office environment at Victoria Barracks Melbourne utilising proprietary design tools, geospatial databases, desktop publishing software and standard Microsoft applications.

, ' ',

A 5% performance bonus is also available

, ' ',

Application Closing Date: Wednesday 10 May 2017            

, ' ',

For further information please review the job information pack, reference AF/00919/17 on www.defence.gov.au/apscareers. 

, ' ']

title: b'Technical Data Officer'
jd:
[' ',

APS 5
Melbourne, VIC
$76,335 - $81,764 (plus super)* Inclusive of the Building Defence Capability Payment

, ' ',

The Technical Data Officer will work as a Data Analyst within the Aeronautical Information Service - Air Force (AIS-AF) which is part of Air Force's Air Warfare Centre. The Data Analyst uses a combination of geospatial tools, aeronautical knowledge and experience, to analyse Aeronautical Information to determine its accuracy and applicability, and resolve anomalies found in the source data. The Data Analyst enters analysed Aeronautical Information into geospatial databases and/or desktop publishing software, in compliance with approved processes, formats and internationally recognised specifications.

, ' ',

In addition, the Data Analyst performs validation checks on flight critical data, to ensure accuracy and compliance with processes, formats and specifications. The Data Analyst is expected to liaise with other AIS-AF teams, external authorities and stakeholders to assist with the production of Aeronautical Information products and services, including the preparation and management of NOTAM information.

, ' ',

The Data Analyst works in a dynamic environment with time pressures to meet International Civil Aviation Organisation distribution cycles and short notice Australian Defence Force contingencies. The majority of work is conducted in an office environment at Victoria Barracks Melbourne utilising proprietary design tools, geospatial databases, desktop publishing software and standard Microsoft applications.

, ' ',

A 5% performance bonus is also available

, ' ',

Application Closing Date: Wednesday 10 May 2017            

, ' ',

For further information please review the job information pack, reference AF/00919/17 on www.defence.gov.au/apscareers. 

, ' ']

title: b'Supply Chain Information Operations Analyst\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

Our client is a leading organisation that plays a central role in the Australian health sector. They are presently seeking to recruit a Supply Chain Data Analyst. This position will drive data integrity improvements in a state-wide revised customer catalogue whilst supporting the broader business by building and maintaining relationships with key stakeholders.

, '\n',

Core projects and supply chain transformation initiatives are now in motion and they are now entering a phase which has opened up this 12 month fixed term contract. The key skills required for this position revolve heavily around data analysis, business processes and operational Supply Chain activities with a focus on purchasing, supplier relationships and inventory.

, '\n',

The main duties and responsibilities can be summarised as follows;

, '\n',
  • Maintain and cleanse data for the product catalogue to provide consistency across multiple business units
  • Ensure all requests and correspondence is actioned and analyse issues arising from such
  • Act as the main point of contact for any issues that may arise with new users and support suppliers in the on-boarding process
  • Design, implement and maintain process to assist with the catalogue maintenance
  • Analyse and identify themes and trends from data
  • Develop, build and maintain working relationships with key internal and external stakeholders
, '\n',

The successful candidate will possess the following skills and attributes;

, '\n',
  • Tertiary qualification in business or related field coupled with experience in data analysis and supply chain, purchasing and procurement is highly regarded
  • Prior experience in catalogue management and GS1 standards is highly desirable
  • Very strong Excel skills and reporting proficiency
  • Exposure to inventory control, purchasing and supplier relationship management
  • Passion for problem solving and strong analytical process exposure
  • Ability to think on your feet and use initiative whilst collaborating in a team
, '\n',

This is an excellent opportunity to join a large organisation that has embarked on a significant supply chain transformation. A strong package plus numerous staff benefits is on offer for the suitable candidate. For more information please call Eilidh Steel on 03 9245 0458 or submit your application through the appropriate links.

, '\n']

title: b'Data Services Manager\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

TELSTRA HEALTH

, ' ',

The way healthcare is delivered is changing. Telstra Health is embracing that change by building solutions designed to create a better connected health system. We are committed to driving positive change through technology, and we've built a team of highly talented and passionate people who make this happen.

, ' ',

ABOUT THE ROLE

, ' ',

In Healthcare, data quality and service quality matters more.  In this role you will lead a small team of specialist healthcare directory data analysts to uphold the highest standards of quality in a range of data service contracts.  You will provide ongoing account management to internal and external customers, while managing day to day operations and budget responsibility.

, ' ',

SOME OF THE SPECIFICS AND KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES

, ' ',
  • Provide high quality data services to internal and external customers for a range of products and services and ensure they are delivered to expectations
  • Lead a highly effective Data Services team, who are responsible for data quality via comprehensive data analysis, data processing and auditing, bulk data audits and uploads, email campaigns, and site acquisition activities
  • Ensure activities of the group support the departmental and company business strategy
, ' ',

WHAT YOU'LL BRING

, ' ',
  • Passion for people leadership: you will love coaching, motivating and developing your team members individual abilities
  • Positive & professional approach to account management, with excellent customer service skills combined with an ability to develop effective solutions for business problems and contribute to business growth,
  • Strong data management, analysis and reporting skills, with high attention to detail
  • Proficient in Microsoft Excel and SQL
  • Knowledge and experience of the health sector is highly desirable
  • Tertiary qualification in Business, IT, Data Management, Health or a related discipline
, ' ',

If this sounds like the next step in your career, please apply!

, ' ']

title: b'STA (Data Warehousing/ETL) - Melbourne\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',

About Us

Planit is one of the leading software testing & training organisation in Asia Pacific with over 1,200 permanent employees globally and are currently experiencing a period of rapid growth. Due to this rapid expansion we are seeking highly experienced Senior Test Analysts with Data Warehousing / BI experience to join our Melbourne team on a permanent basis. You will be working with the best in the industry and enjoying a variety of employee incentives + much more...

, '\n',


About the Role

As an STA (DW/BI), you will consult to our top tier client base, covering all areas of the testing lifecycle in multiple domains. Knowledge & expertise on all Software Delivery methodologies & Test processes, you will use your technical capability in Business Intelligence & Data Warehousing to deliver large scale Programs/Projects on schedule and to the highest quality.

, '\n',


Testing Responsibilities:

, '\n',
  • Operational (day-to-day) management of test tasks or activities; including mentoring more junior team members providing feedback & acting as a point of contact to resolve technical challenges on a project
  • Creation of test scenarios and tests cases that will include the use of appropriate BI Test techniques and methods to ensure requirement coverage - this will include data profiling  and validation
  • Liaise with Clients for Business requirements, Acceptance criteria, Solution Design and other documentation that will provide the test basis for testing
  • Formulate estimates for test activities and test schedule.  Highlight risks, issues and undertake defect management
  • Ensure tracking of tasks and highlight any blockers or risks that may impact the test schedule or overall project timeline
  • Writing Test Plans that will outline the test approach and methodology that would be followed
  • Determine test conditions/test objectives
  • Identify requirement traceability to confirm test coverage of technical and business requirements
  • Responsible for test case execution; which includes executing sql scripts, analysing the outcome and reporting test results
  • Use of static testing techniques on documentation that may require facilitation of static reviews or  workshops
  • Responsible for raising and closing defects in line with the clients defect management process
  • Production of test status reports for different Stakeholders across the Business which provide a clear summary of progress
, '\n',


Technical Skills and Experience:

Must Have

, '\n',
  • Advanced SQL skills 
  • Experience in ETL & Dimension Modelling testing.
  • 2+ years of testing experience in Data Warehousing and Business Intelligence projects
  • Hands-on experience working with at least one or multiple ETL tools e.g. Informatica, IBM DataStage, SAS Data Management, SSIS, SAP Data Services etc
  • Undertaken Data Warehouse testing with Microsoft and Oracle tools
  • Experience of visualisation tools - Tableau, OBIEE, Alteryx, Splunk etc
  • Work experience in different Operating System Environments - Unix/Linux or Microsoft
, '\n',


Desirable

, '\n',
  • ISTQB Found. certification
  • Certified Agile tester certification
  • Knowledge/experience in ETL test automation
  • Working knowledge of Software Version Control tools - Git, Mercurial etc
  • Experience in testing large Data migration or Data Integration projects
  • Programming skills such as Python, Java or .Net
  • BI or Data warehousing certifications
, '\n',


Culture

Work with like-minded colleagues who have a passion for testing excellence. An encouraging and supportive environment, the team-orientated culture is helpful, friendly, inclusive and flexible. Our leadership team is accessible and you are paired with a Senior Buddy to help you reach your goals and grow your career.

, '\n',


Benefits

Planit operates with a flat-structure feel which enables you to have your contributions heard and acknowledged. We keep up-to-date with the ever-changing IT tools and throughout your career offer you the opportunity to focus on advancing your internationally recognised testing qualifications. In addition, we offer staff parties/activities, unrivalled employee benefits and a results-focussed culture that is inclusive, successful and we do it all with positivity and a smile.

, '\n',


www.planittesting.com

Apply now for the opportunity of a lifetime!

***NO AGENCIES PLEASE!!!***

, '\n']

title: b'Head of Product - Global Delivery Pod\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

SEEK is the global leader in the creation and operation of online employment markets. Established in 1997, SEEK is listed on the ASX where it is a top 50 company employing over 6,000 and with a market capitalisation close to AU $6billion. Worldwide SEEK has exposure to 4.1 billion people, owning leading employment and education businesses in Australia, New Zealand, China, Brazil, Mexico and across SE Asia. 

, ' ',

SEEKs purpose is to help our candidates live more fulfilling and productive working lives, through compelling employment and education propositions, and to help organisations succeed by accessing the best talent. 

, ' ',

The Opportunity:

, ' ',

A new role created through the continued investment in our Product Management capability, the Head of Product – GDP will take end to end ownership of a portfolio of product initiatives with global applicability.

, ' ',

Reporting to the Product & Technology Director in SEEK International, the successful candidate will lead a growing, distributed team of Product Managers, UX Designers and Data Analysts – based across Melbourne, Kuala Lumpur and Sao Paulo.  The role will require some short duration international travel.

, ' ',

The primary objective of the role is to lead the creation of world class products and services that our customers love, use and buy.

, ' ',

The Head of Product will provide the strategic insight, influence and leadership in defining each product's vision based upon an in-depth  knowledge of the customer problem we are solving, determining what success looks like and how to measure it, then designing and building a compelling solution that delivers a significant impact.

, ' ',

The successful candidate will need a strong set of servant leadership skills to successfully grow, develop and mentor a high performing distributed team.  S/he will be comfortable dealing with ambiguity, operating in the 'grey', with a relentless passion for finding solutions to new and challenging problems.

, ' ',

Essential Skills and Experience:

, ' ',
  • Outstanding product management professional with significant experience in leading online marketplace businesses.
  • Strong background in building new, or significantly improving existing, online product experiences to deliver better customer and business outcomes.
  • Highly analytical, able to use data effectively to understand key trends and then make informed decisions.
  • Naturally curious, displaying the vision to see beyond the immediately obvious, challenging the status quo and wanting to ask the tough questions.
  • A master in the art/science of prioritisation, able to maintain focus and use good judgement to make tough trade off decisions. 
  • Strong problem solving experience with a customer centric approach, able to think both strategically and tactically.
  • Passionate about working with distributed teams to deliver successful outcomes.
  • Resilient and action oriented, with a dedication to getting stuff done and ability to 'find a way' to persevere through tough challenges.
  • A strong communicator able to connect with people cross culturally with passion and energy
  • Track record of building and sustaining excellent relationships at multiple levels in the organisation through empathy, candour and a sense of humour.
, ' ',

Culture

, ' ',

At SEEK we really value our culture and the way we work together to get stuff done. Our commitment to fostering a work environment where people feel like they're making a difference everyday has helped us maintain a consistently high ranking in the annual Hewitt Best Employer Award. In other words, people like to come here – and we're proud of that! We work flexibly at SEEK. Chat with us about how we can embrace the idea of a flexible job for you.

, ' ',

How to apply

, ' ',

Click APPLY to submit your application. For a confidential discussion, please contact Celia Cameron, Talent Acquisition Consultant at ccameron@seek.com.au

, ' ',

Privacy Policy

, ' ',

All personal information received by us from you or about you will be stored, used and disclosed by us in accordance with our privacy policy, a copy of which can be found at www.seek.com.au/privacy. If you have any questions in relation to how we may use and store your personal information please contact us at usersupport@seek.com.au

, ' ',

 

, ' ']

title: b'Business Analysis & Data Manager\r\n      '
salary: b'Great annual salary and annual bonus'
jd:
['\n',

MLC Life Insurance was created out of the landmark $2.4bn deal between NAB and one of the world's leading life insurers, Nippon Life Insurance Company. Establishing a long term partnership in Australia, MLC Life Insurance aims to be the #1 Life Insurer in this country. MLC Life Insurance will be uniquely positioned: the joining of NAB's leading domestic franchise and Nippon Life's global insurance expertise will result in a powerful combination that will see a significant investment in the local business.

, '\n',

As a key member of our Technology Capability Practise, your fun and inspiring leadership skills will manage a large team of Business and Data Analysts. Fostering an Agile environment, you'll work with both leadership and delivery teams, accelerating delivery through the implementation of effective ways of working including BA Best Practise.

, '\n',

You will be joining an experienced Agile team, and will need to contribute to the further development of MLC Agility, bringing with you a suite of innovative and proven concepts. You'll be part of a leadership team that develops people to their fullest potential. We're not afraid of ambiguity, fast-paced activity, or digitising, in fact we embrace them. You don't just set strategies and goals, you achieve them. You're a leader.

, '\n',

We're going to be the number 1 digital life insurer in Australia. Help us do it.

, '\n',

Day to Day:

, '\n',
  • Drive the successful delivery of the BA & Data Practise vision and strategic road map through inspirational leadership and management
  • You will balance Platform demands for skills and resources against the development needs and career paths of individuals to optimise team development and business value delivery
  • Utilise indepth Agile experience to further embed an agile working environment
  • Challenging the status quo and 'comfort zones' of your team, by creating an open and safe work environment to drive growth and cross-skilling of your team
  • Developing and championing best in class technology practices, that can be leveraged by Platform teams to deliver business value more efficiently
  • Continuously develop the team's knowledge as they learn from each other, their mistakes, external resources, and training programs you and your team organise as required
  • Ensure team members' are aware of the simple, lightweight control and governance mechanisms as well as regulatory and legal landscape requirements
  • Manage resource requirements and deployment into Platform teams by working with Technology Platform Managers and balancing platform needs with individual's strengths and desires
  • Identify trends in the market as well as resource demands by the TPMs and forecast team capacity and availability
  • Identify and manage skill shortages through developing and implementing plans to either upskill the existing team or grow the team as needed.
, '\n',

To be successful in this role:

, '\n',

To be successful in this role, you'll need to have experience managing BA & Data (~20) teams in a complex Agile delivery environment. You'll talk in detail to your experience in best practise business analytics and data management. Your ability to successfully communicate, negotiate and influence across all levels of the MLC Life business is critical to the success of this role.

, '\n',

You are a curious person, with a positive approach. You'll always ask why first, and assess options, before making a decision.

, '\n',

For more information, please contact Bronwyn Wickett on 0405 133 068 or via email on Bronwyn.wickett@mlcinsurance.com.au

, '\n',

We embrace diversity of thought, style and working arrangements to ensure our workforce is representative of the community that we serve.

, '\n',

, '\n']

  • Challenging the status quo and 'comfort zones' of your team, by creating an open and safe work environment to drive growth and cross-skilling of your team
  • Developing and championing best in class technology practices, that can be leveraged by Platform teams to deliver business value more efficiently
  • Continuously develop the team's knowledge as they learn from each other, their mistakes, external resources, and training programs you and your team organise as required
  • Ensure team members' are aware of the simple, lightweight control and governance mechanisms as well as regulatory and legal landscape requirements
  • Manage resource requirements and deployment into Platform teams by working with Technology Platform Managers and balancing platform needs with individual's strengths and desires
  • Identify trends in the market as well as resource demands by the TPMs and forecast team capacity and availability
  • Identify and manage skill shortages through developing and implementing plans to either upskill the existing team or grow the team as needed.
, '\n',

To be successful in this role:

, '\n',

To be successful in this role, you'll need to have experience managing BA & Data (~20) teams in a complex Agile delivery environment. You'll talk in detail to your experience in best practise business analytics and data management. Your ability to successfully communicate, negotiate and influence across all levels of the MLC Life business is critical to the success of this role.

, '\n',

You are a curious person, with a positive approach. You'll always ask why first, and assess options, before making a decision.

, '\n',

For more information, please contact Bronwyn Wickett on 0405 133 068 or via email on Bronwyn.wickett@mlcinsurance.com.au

, '\n',

We embrace diversity of thought, style and working arrangements to ensure our workforce is representative of the community that we serve.

, '\n',

, '\n']

title: b'SQL Developer\r\n      '
jd:
['Our client has been operating successfully in their space delivering high quality services that have a positive impact on the community for over 25 years. \xa0They have been growing continually and technology is where they seek to gain a competitive advantage. They seek to add a permanent Reporting Analyst to their high performing team.',
, ' ',
, ' They have a significant investment in custom-built software and the Data / Reporting Analyst is required to provide timely reports and data insights to business users based on this software and the underlying database and data structures.',
, ' ',
, ' This role will report to the IT Manager and will have strong interactions with both Business Users ranging from the CEO to department heads and the Business Intelligence Architect.This role will suit candidates who have experience with fast paced environments where priorities change and you will have to think on your feet. This role will suit those candidates used to working off a 5 day plan as opposed to a 90 day plan! .You must have the ability to self-motivate, learn, adapt, innovate and create',
, ' ',
, ' ', Responsibilities include, '\xa0 ',
  • Work with IT and business users to understand data and reporting requirements;
  • Provide assistance to the Support & Small Projects Team by attending to production database support requests;
  • For support and projects, interpret data, analyse results, and provide ongoing reports;
  • Develop and implement databases, data analytics, and other strategies that optimise data efficiency and quality;
  • Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets;
  • Ensure timely delivery of work to agreed timeframes and to a high degree of quality;
  • Anticipate problems and pro-actively develop contingency plans;
  • Proactively identify process or technology improvements and "own' your journey into the standard way of working;
, ' ', Knowledge skills and attributes required., ' ',
  • In-depth experience and skill at Microsoft SQL;
  • Solid understanding of data modelling, ETL processes, and database designs;
  • Strong Microsoft Reporting Services (SRSS) and Microsoft Excel skills;
  • Basic database and user administration;
  • Experience with Microsoft Analysis and MDX is advantageous.
, ' ',
, ' This is a newly created position in a company that have modern technology stack, a very low turnover and promotes family values and a genuine work/life balance. Apply now to be considered. ']

title: b'\r\n          Digital Marketing & Content Specialist - Heavy on the Comms!\r\n        '
jd:
[' ',

, ' ',

About the business and the role

, ' ',

A maturing Australian-based start-up with a global footprint, now in strong scale-up and growth phase.  

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

With staff and offices in key markets around the world we now need someone who is digitally savvy who's a copy and content specialist to be based in our Head Office as a key member of our marketing team.

, ' ',

The role will be responsible for producing compelling content campaigns to drive brand awareness, grow prospect engagement and nurture existing members. 

, ' ',

You will need to have a strong understanding of the B2B sales process and buyer journey, the ability to understand customer pain points and execute content-led marketing campaigns to numb their pain. 

, ' ',

Just being creative is not enough, you need to really get to know our customers and our industry.  You will also need to have an eye for numbers to support a campaign marketer going forward to continuously optimise campaign results, test new creative and grow new markets.

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

Job tasks and responsibilities

, ' ',
  • Develop and own our B2B digital content strategy including conducting and leveraging customer research and completing a content audit to identify current gaps and opportunities
  • Work with our offshore sales teams to localise content for different geographic markets and adjust narrative and tone as required using your brilliant copywriting and editorial skills
  • The ability to re-purpose major pieces into multiple forms of digital media and content to maximise investment and audience engagement (industry thought leadership, product education and onboarding, customer support and retention)
  • Develop scalable processes and a data driven approach to define and measure success via relevant engagement metrics to ensure our content strategy is continuously optimised
  • Work with our research & data analysts to identify and communicate unique insights to retain our existing member community, minimising churn through the proactive delivery of unique and highly targeted industry commentary and insights
  • Collaboration with our existing in-house digital team to develop and present user experience mock-ups
  • Drive ongoing conversion rate optimisation utilising a strong "test & learn" approach
, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

Skills and experience

, ' ',

To be successful in this role, you will have:

, ' ',
  • Previous experience in SaaS offerings
  • A strong interest in property or real estate investment would be ideal
  • Proven experience developing content outreach programs to drive Lead Gen & Nurture campaigns
  • A strong understanding of UX/UI best practice and experience working with digital design and development resources to execute
  • Knowledge of SEO principles to ensure any content is highly searchable and content can be found
  • Proven ability to produce & re-purpose content into various formats
, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

Job benefits and perks

, ' ',
  • Join an energetic global start-up that's now in true scale-up phase
  • Take a leading role in a hard-working team that like to celebrate success
  • Work with people who really do care, are truly engaged and invested in the business
  • Flat structure, no office politics
  • Great location close to the Lake and The Tan
  • Great role to grow your experience and skills rapidly and work with 1st class marketing automation and CRM tools
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

, ' ']

title: b'Senior Tableau Developer\r\n      '
jd:
['At CSKnexus we focus on the smallest of details for both clients and our employees and we help people get where they want to go.',
, ' ',
, " We believe that there are some definable attributes to become part of the Nexus Network that go above and beyond just technical skills.\xa0 That's what we are looking for - the attributes of a CSKnexus consultant",
, ' ',
, ' Our client is seeking a dynamic BI Technical consultant for its BI Competency Centre. The role will have responsibility to deliver the roll-out of innovative reporting solutions to facilitate business processes, content integrity and ensure compliance with legal & regulatory obligations, predominately within the Tableau Analytics application.',
, ' ',
, ' You will be expected to:',
, ' ',
  • Build comprehensive dashboards and reports using Tableau Desktop
  • Perform end to end delivery activities from gathering requirements and designing solutions, through developing code / reports, to testing and release / deployment
  • Research and identify needs, goals, and business models by collaborating with the end users, stakeholders and support partners
  • Review, assess current state and identify improvement opportunities and best practice recommendations
  • Train, promote, collaborate and 'push' the Tableau BI brand within the organization
, ' Required Skills',
, ' \xa0 ',
  • Candidates must have 5+ years of Business Intelligence experience.
  • Extensive experience with Tableau including hands-on, pragmatic working knowledge
  • Agile experience required
  • Considerable BI development experience / background
  • Problem solving / troubleshooting experience /skills to assist Production Support in issue resolution
  • Proven ability to independently champion business intelligence principles with business owners, application owners, data analysts and DBAs
  • Proven ability to handle multiple projects while meeting deadlines and documenting progress towards those deadlines.
  • Excellent communication skills (must be able to interface with both technical and business leaders in the organisation)
  • Excellent requirements gathering skills
  • Ability to be a self-starter that can provide leadership
  • Comprehensive understanding of the Agile Development process
  • Ability to provide data visualization solutions
  • Bachelor's degree in computer science or related field
, ' ']

title: b'\r\n          Research Director\r\n        '
jd:
[' ',
  • Deliver national business plan targets across sector, product and channel for both new and existing customer growth initiativesw
  • Attractive salary negotiable based on experience
  • Location CBD
  • Established boutique full service agency specialising in customer experience improvement across Australia
, ' ',

Your role reports direct to the Managing Director and your primary mission is to identify and secure business growth in the Utilities and Government sectors.  Your early focus will be  to grow existing accounts through the introduction of new services & products, understanding what is required to bring new clients on board for the long term and learning and helping to champion a new range of services in the customer experience arena.

, ' ',

You will have a dedicated team to help you.  In addition you have access to a highly trained and proficient field services team, data analysts and consultants to  support you in achieving solutions that suit your customer's needs.

, ' ',

You must be able to point to a record of planning for and consistently securing business growth, entering into new markets, driving customer loyalty/advocacy and extracting value pricing from the market.  There is a very strong preference for recent experience in designing customer experience improvement programs through implementing research and analysis projects in customer environments.  Idealy you will know and have significant experience in service centre operations and you are tertiary qualified.  As a leader of researchers and analysts you'll need confidence in Quant and Qual research concepts and techniques.

, ' ',

This role offers true team involvement and an exciting, rewarding future.  To apply in strict confidence, please click on the Apply button below and include a covering letter.

, ' ']

title: b'Financial Analyst - Award Winning Entertainment Business\r\n    '
jd:
['\n',

Excellent opportunity for a part qualified Accountant leaving chartered to join a world renowned Entertainment Brand based in Central Melbourne, in an exciting analytically focused role that will see you tasked with making commercial decisions that will drive the business forwards.

, '\n',

Client Details

, '\n',

Our client is an ASX listed powerhouse known globally for their award winning productions across film and TV with a number of projects being nominated for international awards. Due to continuous expansion and internal promotion they are looking to add a talented analyst to their high performing finance team. Recognised as one of Melbourne's best employers due to high levels of professional development and excellent careers on offer this is truly a rare opportunity to step in to the commercial finance space with an exceptional brand.

, '\n',

Description

, '\n',

, '\n',

Reporting directly to the Financial Controller your duties will include but not be limited to:

, '\n',
  • Preparation of financial analysis and reporting;
  • Assisting with the ongoing maintenance of existing financial models and reconciliation of data;
  • Assisting the broader Analyst team with project work
  • Ad hoc financial analysis
  • Driving process improvements
  • Streamlining existing processes
  • Upgrading financial models
, '\n',

, '\n',

Profile

, '\n',

To be included on the shortlist you will be:

, '\n',
  • Degree qualified in a relevant subject
  • Part CA/CPA Qualified
  • Employed in a Chartered environment with a minimum of 12-18 months of professional experience
  • Well versed in the use of Excel - with a high level of competency dealing with large volumes of data
, '\n',

, '\n',

Job Offer

, '\n',
  • Chance to join one of Melbourne's most exciting businesses
  • Superb office location
  • Competitive salary package on offer
  • Study support available for CA/CPA
, '\n',

To apply online please click the 'Apply' button below. For a confidential discussion about this role please contact Jack Betton on +61 3 8640 3257

, '\n']
