title: b'Data Modelling Consultant\r\n    '
jd:
[' ',

FinXL IT Professional Services is a proudly Australian owned, privately held company known for delivering high value ICT services and solutions. As a trusted partner, we consistently deliver excellence and value to our clients.

, ' ',

Our outcome driven approach is achieved by combining exceptionally talented people with proven methodologies to deliver innovative and pragmatic solutions. This enables our clients to increase revenue and profitability, improve customer satisfaction and engagement and stay ahead in today’s rapidly changing world.

, ' ',

We have been engaged on a number of different projects with a large utilities organisations, and are seeking a capable Data Analyst with ETL expertise to join our team on-site

, ' ',

You will be working with a leading national telecommunications solution provider to work on a strategic business project.

, ' ',

You responsibilities:

, ' ',
  • Data Modelling and Analytics experience 
  • Authoring ETL/batch work flows connecting to various data sources (SOAP, REST, files, JMS, Kafka)
  • Designing, building and maintaining scalable data ingestion/collection systems and REST/RPC micro services
  • Building and maintaining DevOps tools and CD/CI pipelines using Jenkins
  • Cross skilling in frontend/Javascript development
  • Experience with Apache Spark
, ' ',

To be considered you must be able to write quality code and posses the following skill set;

, ' ',
  • Key Languages – Python (primary focus), SQL 
  • Demonstrable experience/Understanding of a DevOps model
  • Demonstrated ability to work through issues/problems, a lateral thinker with a sense of ownership and a can-do attitude
, ' ',

Please note:

, ' ',

-  The location will be Dockland Business District

, ' ',

-  6 - 12 Month Engagements

, ' ',

-  If you have working in the Telecommunication Domain previous it will be viewed upon favorably.

, ' ',

Please apply through the below link or Call Varsha Raghavan on 03 9617 3940 for more information.

, ' ']

title: b'Analytics & Insights Specialist\r\n    '
jd:
['The role requires you to wear two hats, part implementation specialist, and part data analyst. In addition to this, the role will provide you with the opportunity to get hands-on experience supporting the Digital Performance team in the implementation of strategic digital campaigns.',
, ' ',
, ' ', What you'll do,
, ' ',
  • Discover, analyse and present insights from web data 
  • Recommend, create and execute site tagging and analysis that drive fundamental improvements to clients
  • Assist in the optimisation of paid search, display campaigns and social campaigns.
  • Work closely with paid and earned media teams to identify gaps in data capture
  • Implement enhancements and campaign optimisations. 
, ' ',
, ' ', What you'll need ,
, ' ',
, ' ',
  • Some marketing analytics or digital strategy experience either agency or client side 
  • Working knowledge of digital analytics platforms. This includes web analytics (SiteCatalyst, Google Analytics or others)
  • Ability to take broad semi-structured data from all corners of the digital universe and use this information to build stories, simplify challenges and deepen relationships with clients
  • Fluency in Microsoft Office programs (PPT, DOC) is required
  • Significant experience in Excel (VLOOKUP, Pivot Tables etc)
  • You must be a self-starter and a problem solver, eager for keeping busy and engaged and always looking for the next opportunity to show off your skills
  • A working knowledge of Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, and similar analytics tools
  • Experience communicating findings from data
, ' ',
, ' Bonus if you have the below\xa0',
, ' ',
  • GA IQ certification (not essential)
  • Experience with SQL or programming languages would be a plus
  • Experience with data visualization or dashboarding tools such as Google Data Studio, Tableau, Qlikview or Datorama would also be a plus
  • Ability to stay apprised of website/app changes and updates
  • Ability to collaborate and communicate with multiple stakeholders
  • Debugging and QA across all platforms
, ' ',
, ' If this sounds like you, apply now!\xa0',
, ' ', Amanda Chan 
S2M , ' ']

title: b'Analytics Business Analyst - ERP Transformation\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

About the Role

, ' ',

The ERP Business Analyst- Data Analytics will support the ERP Analytics Lead in the development of an analytics and reporting solution that supports business transformation across the entire Programme. The role will work closely with business SMEs to understand in detail the analytics and reporting requirements of users impacted by the program across the works management, asset management, supply chain and procurement management, finance, P&C and Payroll streams.

, ' ',

The role will work closely with Data Modelers and Reporting Analysts in the Analytics stream of the program, developing high-quality requirements to drive delivery of analytics and reporting initiatives, delivering value to business users and empowering them to self-serve.

, ' ',

Key Responsibilities

, ' ',

, ' ',
  • Support the successful monitoring & delivery of ERP analytics initiatives
  • Identify the existing reports that are required to be migrated and design the migration strategy and solutions
  • Work with ERP Analytics SMEs to understand additional reporting requirements and provide recommendations on the reporting architecture and solutions for the ERP landscape
  • Provide leadership and mentoring to Data Modelers and Reporting Analysts, to help build AGL's capability in the development and delivery of high quality performance metrics
  • Develop design concepts, sketches, and initial idea visualisation
  • Develop wireframes, guided analysis paths, and interactive prototypes
  • To plan, design and deliver high quality performance metrics for AGL, using our strategic analytic toolsets
  • Conduct user experience walkthroughs, and user acceptance test walkthroughs
  • Understand the capabilities of AGLs strategic analytics toolset, and how to best leverage them for a suitable user experience
  • Ability to influence and guide information consumers on visualisation best practice
, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

About You

, ' ',

, ' ',
  • Good understanding of S/4HANA reporting capabilities and experience in design and implementing BI/reporting solutions for ERP.
  • Familiarity with the capabilities and applications of a range of reporting and analytical tools including but not limited to SAP Business Objects, Mobile Business Intelligence, Tableau
  • Communication and presentation skills to present options and recommendations.
  • Experience working in both waterfall and agile delivery environments for large organisations
  • Proactive stakeholder management skills to create trusted relationships
  • Strong data, reporting, analysis and conceptual skills
  • Understanding databases and database processes
  • A working knowledge of the Utilities industry and or corporate functions would be advantageous
, ' ', , ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

What's in it for you?

, ' ',

, ' ',
  • You'll be working in an A-grade building with state of the art activity based working facilities. Being supported by our new flexible ways of working. We call it Smarter Working.
  • You'll get the opportunity to work with some of the most engaged and innovative in the business. Being exposed to more opportunities to advance your skills and career.
  • Working in a company the size of ours the sky's the limit for your career aspirations and we're focused on developing you.
, ' ', , ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

About Us

, ' ',

It truly is an exciting time to be part of AGL Energy as we lead the way in generating sustainable energy solutions for all Australians. With a heritage of over 175 years and listed in the top 50 companies on the ASX, AGL offers a genuinely diverse, safe and supportive work environment, where "actions not words" fosters a culture of achievement and personal development.

, ' ',

, ' ',

How to Apply
Come with us on a journey of exploration and creativity, doing the same things differently, better, faster by encompassing innovation and passion for a more sustainable world.

, ' ',

, ' ',


Apply now to the AGL Careers team via the online application link.
For a confidential discussion, please call Liz Boast on 03 9206 8967 or Esther Baek 03 9206 8952.

, ' ']

['\n',

We are looking for new talent to work with our high-performing Analytics and Information Management team. As a progressive-thinking and innovative technologist in the area of data and analytics, you will work with new, market leading solutions and soak in KPMG's deep industry / sector experience and thought-leadership to deliver high-trust / high-value outcomes for our Tier 1 clients across Australia.

, '\n',

This is an excellent opportunity to make a significant difference to KPMG as a firm by helping to drive leading analytics and information management initiatives across our business.

, '\n',

Your new role:

, '\n',
  • An opportunity to demonstrate your deep problem solving skills to address complex enterprise data and analytics challenges faced by our clients across a range of industries and sectors – Banking, Insurance, Superannuation, Health, Utilities, Telco, Retail, Logistics and Public Sector.
  • Establish a vision for information delivery and management for our clients and help drive the execution of the roadmap; including the enterprise data warehouse, big data, BI & analytics, content and data management.
  • Work with our data architects, analysts, scientists and engineers to deliver the solutions that fulfill our client's business information needs and align their information vision, strategy and execution.
  • Engage in the end-to-end data and analytics lifecycle by connecting all the pieces of data to deliver high value insights and tangible solution outcomes.
  • Engage with clients across both the technology and business implications of analytics and information decision-making and help shape the future direction of their analytics and information agenda.
, '\n',

The capabilities we are looking for:

, '\n',
  • A minimum of 5+ years of work experience working across data or analytics focused roles utilising a consulting mindset to solving problem
  • Independent and motivated technologist with a passion for solving business problems through data and an eagerness to learn new skills and techniques, including new technologies, software and tools
  • Proven ability to develop and manage enduring client relationships, engendering a sense of trust and respect
  • Excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills with experience in engaging senior business stakeholders to communicate complex data and analytics concepts and ideas
  • The ability to exercise judgment on how to derive insight from ambiguous requirements, test your assumptions and results, and present the same to stakeholders at all levels of the organization
  • Experience with SQL databases and data warehousing applications such as Oracle, SQL Server, Teradata, AWS Redshift, Netezza
  • Demonstrated capability in statistical concepts, hypothesis testing, probability modelling and machine learning concepts with skills in R, Python, Spark ML and/or Julia is desirable
  • Advanced skills in interactive data visualisation, presentation and reporting across visualisation toolsets and libraries such as Tableau, Qlik, Datameer, D3.js
  • Experience in distributed computing and streaming technologies using toolsets such as Apache HDFS, Pig, Hive, Solr, ElasticSearch, Kafka, Spark, Storm and NiFi
  • Experience with graph / network database concepts and technologies such as Neo4j, GraphX and HBase
  • Experience in cloud-enabled analytical services such as Azure and/or AWS ecosystems is a plus
  • Degree in a quantitative discipline, such as mathematics/statistics, computer science, engineering, actuarial sciences or life sciences
, '\n',

What we offer

, '\n',

We offer rewarding careers for outstanding professionals, ongoing learning and development opportunities, a collaborative and inclusive culture, and flexible and agile work practices that focus on our people's wellbeing to drive innovation and entrepreneurship. We also believe that our business plays a distinct and vital role in helping solve important social and environmental issues; and use our unique skills and expertise to help create positive and lasting impacts for our communities.

We believe diversity of thought, background and experience strengthens relationships and delivers meaningful benefits to our people, our clients and communities. We are consistently recognised as an employer of choice for women, and our inclusive culture promotes the development of our people irrespective of gender, ethnicity, generation, flexible work status, family circumstances, sexual orientation or disability.

This is an exciting opportunity to be a part of KPMG and its ongoing success. So if you want a career where you can use your deep expertise to deliver real results, talk to us first.

Please apply for this position by submitting your confidential application online.

, '\n',


, '\n']

  • Experience with SQL databases and data warehousing applications such as Oracle, SQL Server, Teradata, AWS Redshift, Netezza
  • Demonstrated capability in statistical concepts, hypothesis testing, probability modelling and machine learning concepts with skills in R, Python, Spark ML and/or Julia is desirable
  • Advanced skills in interactive data visualisation, presentation and reporting across visualisation toolsets and libraries such as Tableau, Qlik, Datameer, D3.js
  • Experience in distributed computing and streaming technologies using toolsets such as Apache HDFS, Pig, Hive, Solr, ElasticSearch, Kafka, Spark, Storm and NiFi
  • Experience with graph / network database concepts and technologies such as Neo4j, GraphX and HBase
  • Experience in cloud-enabled analytical services such as Azure and/or AWS ecosystems is a plus
  • Degree in a quantitative discipline, such as mathematics/statistics, computer science, engineering, actuarial sciences or life sciences
, '\n',

What we offer

, '\n',

We offer rewarding careers for outstanding professionals, ongoing learning and development opportunities, a collaborative and inclusive culture, and flexible and agile work practices that focus on our people's wellbeing to drive innovation and entrepreneurship. We also believe that our business plays a distinct and vital role in helping solve important social and environmental issues; and use our unique skills and expertise to help create positive and lasting impacts for our communities.

We believe diversity of thought, background and experience strengthens relationships and delivers meaningful benefits to our people, our clients and communities. We are consistently recognised as an employer of choice for women, and our inclusive culture promotes the development of our people irrespective of gender, ethnicity, generation, flexible work status, family circumstances, sexual orientation or disability.

This is an exciting opportunity to be a part of KPMG and its ongoing success. So if you want a career where you can use your deep expertise to deliver real results, talk to us first.

Please apply for this position by submitting your confidential application online.

, '\n',


, '\n']

title: b'Datawarehouse Reports / Senior Front End Business Intelligence Developer\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

Senior ETL Developer / Analytics Report Developer – Front End
Interface Recruitment is a full service, Melbourne based specialist recruitment agency and Microsoft Partner. We specialise in contract and permanent placement of I.T. Professionals, from Programmer to Program Manager.
Our International client has a requirement for an experienced Senior ETL Reports Developer/ BI Analytics Report Developer to work on significant, challenging and ongoing exciting projects. You will join and eventually lead a Professional team to deliver innovative and high profile real time Dashboards, Reports and strategic programs of work.
You will be self-motivated, highly detail-oriented, creative and interested in learning new skills and Technologies and excited by roles that challenge you to think outside the box.
Responsibilities of the role include:
Your current or past roles will show evidence of Developing Data management Business solutions using the appropriate / essential Technologies including the following.
• Strong demonstrable experience with SharePoint Performance point, CSS and JavaScript, HTML5.
• Must have strong experience with Business Intelligence reporting tools in the Microsoft stack (SSRS,
SSAS and SSIS and SharePoint). Must have individually created 50+ new reports using SSRS.
• Strong communication skills with the ability to collaborate and contribute to a team positively.
• Strong analytical skills with the ability to translate business needs into technical solutions.
• Demonstrable strong data analysis and data mining skills (T-SQL and MDX)
• Exposure to Power BI Suite highly desirable
• Strong communication skills with the ability to collaborate and contribute to a team positively.
• The ideal candidate will have some experience with Management of end to end Reporting Projects, Green Field Cube Development and possibly the energy sector.

To secure the right person for the role, our client may entertain candidates with who have experiences including Datalynx Data Management Suite, BI / Data Warehousing, Data Integration, MDM, and Metadata Management. Designing and Developing reports using Qlikview and Microsoft SSRS or other tools. Developing dashboards with other Technologies.
To be considered you will have in-depth understanding of interactivity via radio buttons, drop down lists, tabs, check boxes, time slider or fish eyes You could have worked on different graphs/widgets like heat maps, bubble charts, gauges, maps, micro charts, Area / bar graphs, lines, pie charts, stacked graphs or funnels download as part of grid reports such as Excel or CSV file.
This role would be ideal for a driven and professional consultant, who has completed tertiary qualifications in I.T. related discipline and (ideally) a mastery of the Business Intelligence concepts. Excellent communication (you will be communicating and presenting to CxO Level and gathering requirements from Senior Business people in the business) skills are essential along with an ability to build relationships with High Level & key stakeholders and help our client achieve success.

In return you will work within a growing and dynamic International owned organisation, where you will have the opportunity to further your career within a dedicated and committed Team environment.

Sound like you? Please call Jeremy King on 9426-4888 for more information.

Interface Recruitment is always searching for the best available Information Technology professionals. For this, or other available roles, please send your résumé in the specified format today, or visit www.interfacerecruitment.com.au/positions.asp

title: b'Senior Business Intelligence Analyst\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

Cox Automotive Australia Pty Ltd ('Cox') is the Australian market leader in the provision of automotive remarketing services with an unrivalled range of products, services and expertise including brands such as Manheim, SellMyCar, Dealer Solutions and CarsGuide. Combining over 50 years of experience with the most advanced business practices, we provide clients with a range of solutions delivered to the highest standards.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

We are seeking a permanent, full-time Senior Business Intelligence Analyst who will be based at our Head Office in Altona, and report to the Head of Data and CRM.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

The Senior Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for business driver performance analysis and actionable insight generation including presentation of analyses and insights to executive leadership.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Key Accountabilities

, ' ',
  • Analyse business needs, provide data and make recommendations to support business functions.
  • Manage systems interfaces, identifying areas for improvement in data quality, accuracy of service and additional opportunities resulting from the re-use of data.
  • Expanding data solutions & reporting capability by incorporating current and new data sets, tools and technology.  The BI space is continuing to evolve; you need to be able to make suggestions that will improve our analysis and processes.
  • Provide business review / recommendation and ultimate ownership of chosen data visualisation deployment throughout the organisation.  We've got a growing user base; you'll have the responsibility for establishing a Tableau user forum and wider adoption across the business.
  • Experience as a BI team or project lead, with an aptitude and enthusiasm for teaching and mentoring others.
  • Producing relevant, accurate, meaningful, timely BI reports, dashboards, and analysis based on business need, including managing the work-flow and prioritisation.
  • Frequent travel may be required as the business is spread geographically around the country.
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

The Successful Candidate

, ' ',
  • Experience in a similar role in a medium to large organisation.
  • Previous experience in Salesforce
  • Experience in data visualisation tools (Tableau, Domo, Wave, Business Objects)
  • Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel
  • Exposure to sales and finance
  • Exemplary written and verbal communication skills.
  • Strong decision-making skills
  • Experience researching and manipulating complex and large data sets
  • High level of accuracy
  • Ability to adapt quickly and effectively to changing environments and initiatives
  • Ability to work independently and successfully execute complex assignments, correctly setting expectations with all stakeholders
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Desirable

, ' ',
  • Degree level qualification in a related field
  • Exposure to working in the automotive industry
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

This is an excellent opportunity not to be missed.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Due to our obligations with the State legislation, we are required to ensure all prospective employees who are applying for roles in Victoria complete a successful Police Check.

, ' ']

title: b'\r\n          Analyst/Developer, Business Intelligence\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',

About this job
Yarra Trams is looking for an experienced Business Intelligence Analyst/Developer to analyse, develop and maintain Business Intelligence reporting applications, supporting the solutions that meet business needs.

, '\n',

Yarra Trams operates the largest light rail network in the world and has a rich history stretching over 100 years. The strength of this Melbourne icon is underpinned by truly committed, diverse and passionate people who are all striving to deliver the vision of providing world-class customer service.

, '\n',

We are focused on continuously improving systems of work and processes, and at the heart of our efforts are four values – ‘Think like a passenger’, ‘Zero Harm’, ‘Respect for People’ and ‘Continuous Improvement’ and they shape our culture as we build for the next century of trams in Melbourne.

, '\n',

What the role entails
As a valued member of the ICT Function and reporting to the Manager, Business Intelligence & Corporate Applications, the Business Intelligence Analyst position will specifically involve:
• Developing Business Intelligence reports to meet the systems of work as required by the business;
• Providing advice to improve Business Intelligence report performance and efficiency;
• Review overall business needs for Business Intelligence analysis and reporting and provide advice to business in order to articulate and clarify business requirements;
• Monitor Business & Location Intelligence application services to ensure they are maintained at optimum performance;
• Analysing audit data to provide report usage and statistical Business Intelligence information;
• Providing planning and development advice of changes or impacts to Business Intelligence applications for Projects and Pipeline works;
• Providing support and advice with Business Intelligence application upgrades.

, '\n',

What you will need for this role
To be successful in this opportunity, you will have:
• Tertiary qualifications in Information Technology;
• Proven experience in developing and delivering Business intelligence application solutions;
• Experience in working with and directing business intelligence software developers and vendors;
• Experience in monitoring, maintaining and managing a suite of business intelligence applications involving both off-the-shelf and in house developed software;
• Extensive knowledge of database architecture;
• Strong demonstrable business analysis skills to conceptualise and assist the business in understanding the data available and how the data can be analysed and interpreted to produce business intelligence;
• Strong ability to engage with customers, to resolve issues and increase customer satisfaction;
• Excellent written and verbal communications skills to deal with wide ranging personnel including ICT users, ICT staff and management at all levels of the business;
• Strong analytical ability;
• A systems approach to problem solving;
• Ability to perform tasks with minimum supervision;
• Technical Knowledge and Methods experience - Business Objects, Tableau, Davies Web Mobile, ArcGIS, SQL Server Integration Services, Maximo, PowerPivot, Kestrel, SQL, Business & Location Intelligence/Data Warehousing architectures (e.g. Kimbal), ETL, SDLC, Project Delivery (e.g. PMBOK) and ITIL.

, '\n',

Interested? To apply for this vacancy, please visit our careers website at http://jobs.yarratrams.com.au and complete an online application form. Only completed online application forms will be accepted.

, '\n',

Applications close: 19th May 2017

, '\n']

title: b'Business Intelligence Support Analyst\r\n    '
jd:
['\n',
  • Opportunity to work for a values based organisation
  • Attractive Salary Packaging
  • Full Time Permanent role based out of Melbourne
, '\n',

St Vincent's Health Australia (SVHA) is the nation's largest not-for-profit Catholic health and aged care provider. Initially established in 1855 by the Sisters of Charity, SVHA is a clinical, research and education leader and operator of private hospitals, public hospitals and aged care services.  

, '\n',

SVHA is looking for a BI Support Analyst to join the Business Intelligence team in Melbourne. The BI Support Analyst will be responsible to provide Level 2 support for Business Intelligence application and be central point of call for business executives and management in ensuring the BI application is performing as expected. Additionally, the position will be responsible to:

, '\n',
  • support ETL (Extraction, Transformation and Loading) processes using Microsoft tools stack and ensure the data completeness and quality is to business expectations and
  • enhance existing processes and application by implementing improvements as identified by business or BI team
, '\n',

To be successful in this role you will have:

, '\n',
  • A minimum of 5 years' experience in working in Microsoft tool stack - SSRS, SSIS, SSAS MS SQL Server 2008/2012/2014
  • Minimum 2 years' experience working in Business Intelligence environment and projects
  • Solid understanding of components of Business Intelligence application
  • Demonstrated ability to understand business problems or requirement and take action to deliver to expectation
  • Excellent communication skills - can work with and communicate with both users and technical teams
  • Strong attention to detail and quality assurance
  • Strong experience in structured development processes – version control, testing, documentation
  • Demonstrated automation and data management process development
, '\n',

Previous experience in health industry and experience with other reporting and development tools such Tableau, SAS, QlikView would be highly desirable.

, '\n',

For further information about the role, please refer to the position description in the careers section of our website www.svha.org.au or email Sandra Mitich on Sandra.Mitich@svha.org.au.

, '\n',

If you believe you have the skills and experience please email your resume and cover letter addressing the requirements within the position description. 

, '\n',

Applications close 5pm, Friday 19th May 2017.

title: b'Graduate Developer - Business Intelligence\r\n    '
jd:
['\n',

About Us
Guild Group is the parent company of four key business units – Guild Insurance, Acerta, Guild Trustee Services and Meridian Lawyers. Our Finance, Technology, Human Resources and Risk, Audit and Compliance divisions partner with these businesses to deliver their strategy.

We are a values driven organisation with a genuine, friendly and collaborative culture that respects, rewards and values input and innovation from all levels of the business. We’re a nimble and dynamic business with big aspirations in a build and grow phase, and we seek talented specialists to join us on our journey.

About the Role
Guild is looking for a passionate Graduate Business Intelligence Developer to join our team to support our federated enterprise Business Intelligence solution, using the end to end Microsoft SQL Server technology stack and Tableau.

Successful candidates should demonstrate excellent big picture thinking combined with technical knowledge and understanding of Microsoft Business Intelligence technologies and solutions.

Key Responsibilities include ssupport in the analysis, design, enhancement and maintenance of the Data Warehouse, and new reporting requirements to meet the needs of the business. You will work with the rest of the Business Intelligence Team and fully support them in their roles. Critical to the success of this role is to ensure effective and direct engagement with business stakeholders.

, '\n',

About You
Applicants should be able to demonstrate: 

, '\n',
  • Relevant Tertiary Qualifications commensurate with an IT Qualification or Degree; specialisation in Business Intelligence, Data Warehousing and Data visualisation techniques is highly desired but not mandatory.
  • Logical, problem-solving thought processes; the ability to gather and analyse information skillfully; the ability to work well as part of a group to solve a problem.
  • Knowledge of SQL and associated technologies and concepts.
  • Knowledge of data modelling, especially Dimensional modelling concepts and applications a major plus.
  • Experience with, or knowledge of, Microsoft SQL Server, SSRS, SSAS, SSIS, SharePoint, Power BI and Tableau is desired, but not mandatory.
  • Exposure to design, build and maintenance enterprise Business Intelligence solutions is desired but not necessary.
, '\n',

Our ideal candidate will possess a delivery focused attitude, balanced with strong customer service focus. Your knowledge of Agile methodologies for software development is highly desirable. A genuine interest in Business Intelligence and the desire to build a career in this area will set you apart.

, '\n',

Why join us?
As an organisation, Guild Group encourages innovation across all areas of the business and, as a result, great ideas have a way of becoming great products, services, and customer experiences very quickly.

We attract highly specialised individuals who are looking for a career where they can genuinely make a difference on our journey through supporting the performance and strategic goals of the wider business.

If you’re looking for a role where you can make things happen, Guild Group is the right place for you.

Have you got what it takes to lift performance?

Next Steps
If this sounds like the right opportunity for you then please submit your details applying online.

, '\n',

 

, '\n']

title: b'Senior Business Intelligence and Analytics Lead\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',
  • Full time position, Melbourne VIC
  • Join a team committed to 'Zero Harm'
  • Australia's largest waste management company
, ' ',

Who we are

, ' ',

Cleanaway is the largest, publicly listed waste management company in Australia. We work with a diverse range of customers from small businesses through to government agencies and large multi-national clients. We believe that all waste is a resource and aim to incorporate recovery, recycling and reuse throughout our operations and those of our clients.

, ' ',

Cleanaway employs over 4,000 people from a wide range of cultures, educational and career backgrounds, and ages. We actively promote equal opportunity and employ, train, develop and promote employees based on merit, according to their interests, skills and ability. We are committed to building a safe working environment and ensuring the wellbeing of all our employees.

, ' ',

Your new role

, ' ',

Based in the Melbourne head office, you will be responsible for leading the BI team to strategically design and implement BI software and systems, including integration with databases and data warehouses. This includes selecting, blueprinting, gathering requirements, designing, and rolling out BI solutions and reports to end users.

, ' ',

Key responsibilities include:

, ' ',
  • Review and analyse the BI framework in accordance with the selected methodology and assist in defining the analytics strategy and vision
  • Establish and monitor governance and controls.
  • Significant experience working in the ICT industry within a leadership role developing BI solutions, data warehouse design and development, ideally using the Microsoft BI stack.
  • Experience managing a multi-cultural, geographically distributed team.
, ' ',
  • Evaluate new BI projects to determine feasibility, high level cost, resource allocation and time estimates to be used in business cases.
  • Research and make recommendations on fit for purpose BI related software products and services.
, ' ',
  • Experience in translating business requirements into application functional, architectural and technical specifications to ensure overall alignment with business strategies.
  • Previous experience identifying and rolling out a reporting capability model covering operational reporting through to self service reporting.
, ' ',

Your skills and experience

, ' ',

The successful candidate will have solid working knowledge of Analytical Software including SQL, Tableau or Qlik and a strong understanding of relational database structures, theories, principles, and practices. You will also have understanding of geospatial mapping solutions, working knowledge of machine learning principles and methodologies and an understanding of the operation and analysis of Microsoft relational database software and standards, as well as data retrieval methodologies.

, ' ',

We look for candidates with outstanding skills and abilities, as well as experience that fits with our business. Even more importantly, we seek employees who will live our values and have the drive, energy and determination to succeed. In return, we offer training and development opportunities, career advancement and competitive pay and benefits.

, ' ',

How you apply

, ' ',

Cleanaway encourages and values diversity and inclusion. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.

, ' ',

Applicants for this role will be required to meet Cleanaway's employment criteria which will include providing evidence of your right to work in Australia. Where relevant to the role, this may also include a satisfactory medical assessment with drug and alcohol testing, psychometric testing and the provision of a satisfactory Driving History from the relevant State Authority.

, ' ',

If this sounds like the opportunity you've been waiting for, please forward your resume and cover letter by clicking "Apply".

, ' ',

, ' ']

title: b'Project Manager - Business Intelligence\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',

We have a new opportunity for a Project Manager to lead and deliver complex, multi-disciplinary strategic and business improvement projects with a focus on strong stakeholder engagement and capability establishment.

, '\n',

You will be required to manage key relationships within the University and, particularly, with other areas in University Services to ensure project and service outcomes for clients.

, '\n',

Your duties will include:

, '\n',
  • Establish, manage and sustain relationship(s) with key stakeholders/project owners
  • Define resource requirements and leads recruitment processes
  • Management and overall accountable for delivery of allocated projects with large organisational technical complexity and business impact;
  • Providing assurance of successful delivery to project specifications including budget, schedule, requirements and quality
  • Focus on providing projects with mature planning practices; including scoping, estimating, assessing risks and facilitating benefit profiles as part of the project development and business case process
  • Develop, track and maintain project based records, reports, and presents to managing and governing bodies as required.
, '\n',

To be considered you will need:

, '\n',
  • Project management accreditation and/or relevant professional qualifications
  • Demonstrated ability to manage medium to large ($250k-$3m+) IT and business improvement projects in one or more of the following areas:
    • IT infrastructure,
    • enterprise applications,
    • cloud solution implementations,
    • business process improvement
  • Established experience successfully delivering business intelligence projects and an understanding of both technical and business requirements
  • Strong practical experience of project scheduling, forecasting, and overall financial management
  • Good commercial acumen and vendor management skills
  • Demonstrated ability to tailor and apply project delivery methodologies including PMBOK, Prince2, Agile; and frameworks such as ITIL and SDLC
, '\n',

Desirable

, '\n',
  • Experience with, and a good understanding of, change management practices and methods including Prosci and Kotter as applied to technology project implementations
  • Demonstrated experience with building project management practices/capabilities and embedding into organisations

title: b'BI/Reporting Analyst\r\n      '
jd:

Betfair, Business Intelligence Analyst

, ' ',
, ' ',

 

, ' ',
, ' ',

Betfair is the world’s leading online betting exchange. The Betfair model revolutionised the sports betting industry when launched in the UK in 2000. Betfair Australia is a forward-thinking company whose exchange-functionality offers better odds, greater choice and more control over the betting experience.
 
As an Analyst, you will be responsible for providing analytical support to the business while improving our general reporting needs. Working within the Analytics & Insights team, the key tasks are the provision of analysis relating to daily and weekly trading as well as  the delivery of basic financial reporting.
 
Responsibilities for this role include, however will not be limited to:
• Design and develop periodic reports and analysis to help measure performance
• Extracting, manipulating and translating data into reports 
• Support stakeholders to improve operational effectiveness
• Development of new analytical tools and methods to support business needs
• Ad-hoc reporting and data requests to assess projects and new initiatives
• Maintaining multiple data sources to support contractual and regulatory requirements

, ' ',
, ' ',

 
What you need:
• Experience in a similar role conducting data reporting analysis
• Experience in reporting and data mining tools such as SQL
• Understanding of data warehousing concepts
• Ability to provide accurate analysis and quality reporting in a timely manner
• Advanced verbal and written communication skills
• Ability to report and communicate complex data to senior stakeholders
• Advanced Microsoft Excel skills

• Knowledge of sporting/ betting/ racing industry is desirable

, ' ',
, ' ',

Applications close 14th May 2017.

['\n',

• Business Intelligence architectural strategist and thought leader
• Subject matter expert and visionary for all things BI
• MicroStrategy expertise essential

The Role

In a world where Information is becoming increasingly important to decision making, there is a need to ensure that the business is being enabled with technology solutions that make access to this information simple, intuitive and meaningful.

, '\n',

The BI Technical Architect will define the architectural strategy and vision for all things Business Intelligence and have the ability to ensure that we successfully deliver business outcomes that are aligned with this vision

To be successful, you'll have:

, '\n',

• Technical Expertise in the MicroStrategy Business Intelligence Stack, up to and including version 10
• Experience with a minimum of one additional Business Intelligence tool
• Implemented MicroStrategy technologies within a large / complex Data Warehousing environment
• Applied experience in the use of Business Intelligence in-memory technologies i.e. Cubes, Data Blending
• Understanding of Data Warehousing, specifically Dimensional Design principles and best practice
• Experience in the delivery of BI outcomes through Mobile channel(s)
• Strong understanding of the data visualisations market, tools and techniques
• Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate effectively with IT leadership and Architecture

, '\n',

Highly Desirable

, '\n',

• Exposure to the application of analytical models within Business Intelligence toolsets

, '\n',

Key Responsibilities

, '\n',

• Architecture for Business Intelligence (BI) solutions, with specific focus on the use of in-memory technologies, self-service visualisations and mobility
• Performance and Scalability of all Business Intelligence solutions, new and existing
• Security of all Business Intelligence solutions, new and existing
• Advisory role to the DW/BI Solution Architects on the best application of Business Intelligence technologies
• Input into the Business Intelligence roadmap, to align with the overall Information Delivery Strategy

, '\n',

Culture

, '\n',

Coles is a fast-paced, constantly changing business that focuses your talents and challenges you to perform at your best. As a team, we're bold with ideas and operate with pace and passion, always looking for better ways to transform retail and delight customers.

, '\n',

Benefits

Not only will you receive a competitive salary, you'll also have access to these great benefits:
• Cheaper groceries and other products. You'll get a 5% discount when shopping at Coles, Kmart, Officeworks and Target
• Learn new skills and develop your existing capabilities. We provide excellent ongoing training and development
• Take your experience to the next level. We always have new opportunities to help you build a great career
• 12 weeks of paid Parental Leave for primary care givers and 1 week of paid leave for secondary care givers
• No need to pay for car parking. You can park your car in our multi-level car park, which is exclusive to our team
• Get fitter, stronger and faster at our on-site gym

, '\n',

About Us

With 100,000 employees, over 2,200 retail outlets and the huge corporate support infrastructure behind these, Coles is one of the most significant businesses in Australia. This scope and its positive approach to lateral moves means employees have an amazing environment to apply and develop talents, opportunities to achieve significant goals personally and professionally, and to build and pursue an interesting career.

, '\n',

The pace of our business has made it a gathering place for passionate and talented people. In this environment, team members draw the motivation, focus, determination and personal growth required to achieve more, faster.

How to apply

If you have the drive to achieve your best every single day, then our team is waiting to transform your talents.
Click "Apply" to complete an application form and upload your current resume.

, '\n',

Please Note

, '\n',

We prefer to deal with you directly and have not engaged an agency for this role, so if you're interested, please apply.

, '\n',

At Coles, we aim to ensure our team represents the community we serve, embracing the richness of Australia's diverse population.

, '\n',

Note: Existing Coles Group Limited employees

We encourage you to advise your Line Manager of your application for this position.
In accordance with Company Policy it is expected that all Coles Group full time applicants will have occupied their current position for 12 months or more to be eligible to apply.

, '\n',
, '\n']

title: b'BI Developer\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

The Latitude Business Intelligence (BI) team services all business units across Australia & New Zealand, and is responsible for the delivery of information, reporting and measurement.

The BI team work with stakeholders ranging from Executive level, to team leaders and areas of responsibility from requirement gathering through to delivery and support.

An exciting opportunity has become available for an ambitious BI developer to join our Organization, where career development and employee engagement is a key cultural focus.


What you will do

As our new BI Developer, you will be involved in the design, delivery and implementation of Business Intelligence solutions. You will also be accountable for maintaining a level of standards across the broader BI team, including business processes and best practice, and will support the Business Intelligence leadership team.

You will develop a variety of technical and process solutions to meet business requirements while supporting the delivery of information to stakeholders on a regular, ongoing basis.

You will work with the BI team to support existing solutions as well as building new systems and solutions with support from our senior team members.

You will utilise Agile Methodologies daily to streamline and increase the efficiency of processes, allowing you to develop innovative solutions for Latitude.


Who you are

You are a driven, innovative professional with a tertiary qualification in a business or IT related discipline.

Your education is supported by at least four years of both BI development and SQL programming experience. As well as this, you will have a solid understanding of data warehousing principles, working knowledge of Agile methodologies and proficiency in PowerBI, SSRS and SSAS (Tabular).

Communication skills will be one of your strengths, with the ability to negotiate and influence stakeholders due to your excellent verbal and written presentation skills.

You are highly analytical and most of all ready to hit the ground running, as opportunities and challenges are readily available for you to take the next step in your career.


How you will be rewarded

In return, we offer a competitive salary plus an opportunity to operate in a dynamic environment within a business investing heavily in constantly improving customer experience.

We are in the process of transforming our business, concentrating on the areas where we lead the market, always placing our customers at the centre of everything we do.

, '\n']

title: b'Systems Integration Tester\r\n        '
jd:
[' ',

Our client is a government agency currently looking for a Systems Integration Tester to complete work over a 4 month contract, renewal may be offered.

, ' ',

Your duties will include:

, ' ',
  • Develop end-to-end system integration test strategy, plans, and scripts for a data warehouse, business intelligence, and analytics platform, including testing of reports, planning worksheets, cubes, and analysis outputs
  • Conduct end-to-end system integration testing for a data warehouse, business intelligence, and analytics platform, including testing of reports, planning worksheets, cubes, and analysis outputs
  • Document, analyse, communicate test results
  • Classify errors into data, software, configuration logic, and script/code bugs
, ' ',

To be considered you will need:

, ' ',
  • 10 years of experience in system integration testing
  • 5 years of experience in system integration testing of data warehouse, business intelligence & analytics platforms
  • 2 years of experience in automated testing tools
  • Must have operated in a Scrum/Agile environment (not just an understanding of or familiar with)
  • Patience & determination
  • Excellent communication skills
, ' ',

Preferred location is Canberra where the main team is located however consideration for Melbourne or Brisbane will be available.

, ' ',

Please note: only candidates who are suited to the role will be contacted.

, ' ',

Our client is an equal opportunity employer

, ' ',

title: b'Commercial Manager\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

An exciting Commercial Finance Manager job in Melbourne paying around $155000 + super.

Your new company
You will be working for a varied and fast paced business within the transport industry in Melbourne. This forward thinking and agile business has experienced impressive growth over the past year and intends to drive progress to achieve ambitious growth targets over the next few years, with this role playing an integral part in driving the business forward financially.

Your new role
You will play a key role in cutting costs and driving revenue within the business, working very closely with other senior leaders within this organisation. You will provide strategic recommendations to increase profits and reduce costs based on business intelligence and financial analysis. You will manage process improvements and contract negotiations for the business, with a hands on attitude to work.

What you'll need to succeed
You will ideally have come from a Big 4 or Second Tier background and will be CPA qualified with a solid background of commercial finance including managing bids and tenders in a hands on commercial role. You will have strong experience providing clear recommendations to a senior management team based on your own analysis and insights. You will be confident, proactive and keen to progress in a forward thinking and fast paced business.

What you'll get in return
You will have the opportunity to join a leading transport business at an exciting time for the organisation, with a real opportunity to drive the business forward. You will also receive between $160000 - $180000 package and will have the opportunity to progress within an innovative business.

What you need to do now
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.
If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact Sarah Gillespie on 93262149 or by emailing sarah.gillespie@hays.com.au for a confidential discussion on your career.

, '\n']

title: b'Product Manager - Industrial Chemicals\r\n      '
jd:

Product Manager

Axieo is a company that brings products, ideas and innovation from across the globe to Australasian manufacturers through our Masterbatch and Specialties businesses.

Axieo Specialties enjoys partnerships with Principals and trading partners around the world.  We combine their R&D with our application capability to provide innovative solutions for our customers through best in class food and nutrition ingredients, industrial raw materials and raw materials for plastics production.

We are currently seeking a Business Intelligence Planning and Reporting Specialist to join our client who are currently in huge growth mode for an initial 6 month contract.

Working within a small team, you will be an active team member who can take lead in actions and even come up with initiative ideas.

In this role you will be required to develop and implement Business Intelligence and other tools to automate and improve the delivery of key reporting and analysis. You will gather business requirements from various sources and internal databases and work proactively with key stakeholders for management analysis.

Some of your responsibilities will be:

, '\n',
  • Design, development, documentation and maintenance of dashboards and custom reporting.
  • Understand and capture reporting and analysis requirements.
  • Reporting and data visualization
  • Planning and scheduling
, '\n',


To be considered, you must demonstrate the following:

, '\n',
  • Logically minded with structured analytical thinking
  • Strong problem solving skills and experience
  • Effective interpersonal skills and ability to engage with people at all levels
  • Proven experience in the development of analytical and reporting tools
  • Experience in the development of Business Intelligence dashboards and reports
  • VBA programming for Excel spreadsheets
  • Microsoft Power BI
  • Primavera P6
, '\n']

title: b'BI Reports Developer - SSRS, PowerBI, Tableau\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',
RXP's Insight practice is growing extensively this year.  We have exciting 'Agile' projects that deliver business outcomes through implementing robust, high-value, Business Intelligence & Datawarehousing solutions.
, '\n',
 
, '\n',
Joining our Insight practice will allow you to be part of an amazing community of like-minded people whilst working in environments that add value to your skills and capabilities.
    
A position suited to your skills and experience
You are an ambitious and hard-working BI/DW Developer/Consultant who has demonstrable commercial experience with building and developing reports. You understand the BI implementation process and have expertise in MS SSRS, PowerBI and Tableau. Emphasis is on your PowerBI capability for this critical project
, '\n',
 
, '\n',
You thrive on a challenge and show enthusiasm in assisting clients achieve positive business outcomes. 
  
Key Skills & Experience
  • PowerBI
  • MS SQL Server
  • MS SSIS, SSRS, SSAS
  • Tableau
  • Requirements gathering
  • Development of reports, forms and dashboards
  • Data Analysis & profiling
  • Testing 
A workplace culture that encourages your growth and celebrates diversity
You will be part of a much larger team and immersed in a unique culture that takes pride in exceeding customer expectations and delivering excellence. You will work on shaping digital and technology solutions for well-known brands.  
 
Join RXP and be part of a society that values creative thinking and fosters industry leaders who strive to be the best versions of themselves.
 
About Us
RXP (ASX: RXP) is a technology consulting business that delivers award-winning services and solutions to Australia's leading brands. We continue our rapid growth journey and now employ over 780 people across our Australian and Hong Kong offices. Learn more about us: www.rxpservices.com 
, '\n']

["ASG is a leading IT business solutions provider in Australia - customer focused and responsive. We match our genuine people with proven solutions, partnering closely with our clients to help them achieve their goals.\xa0While our clients' needs continually change and evolve, our focus remains constant, to continuously adapt and provide the best outcomes for our clients.",
, ' \xa0',
, ' ASG has accumulated a wealth of knowledge in the IT services industry covering consulting, professional and managed services, hosted and cloud services.',
, ' \xa0',
, ' These services are used to deliver solutions across a wide range of technologies including business intelligence, core business applications, middleware, technical and hardware infrastructure.',
, ' \xa0',
, ' We currently have an opportunity for an experienced Power BI Specialist to join our team in Melbourne for up to 3 months. ',
, ' \xa0',
, ' The successful candidate will be responsible for migrating customised excel reports into working MS Power BI reports. We are ideally looking for someone with report analysis, report migration and Power BI development skills.',
, ' \xa0',
, ' This role will be directly client facing so excellent communication and consulting skills are a must. ',
, ' \xa0',
, ' The smart, career focussed and determined people who work for ASG flourish in a culture that empowers them to achieve customer outcomes and gives them a sense of ownership for the development of the company as a whole. Together we form a highly motivated, customer-focused workforce.',
, ' \xa0',
, ' If this sounds like you, apply now! ']

title: b'Graduate Education Analyst\r\n    '
jd:
['\n',

Job No. 562362
Faculty / Portfolio:
Provost and Senior Vice-President
University Planning and Statistics
Location: Clayton campus
Employment Type: Full-time
Duration: Continuing appointment
Remuneration:
$92,976 - $102,629 pa HEW Level 08
(plus 17% employer superannuation)

, '\n',
  • Achieve at a world top 100 university
  • Build a brighter future
  • Utilise advanced data analysis to direct the future of a leading university
, '\n',

If you're after a rewarding career, Monash University can help make it happen. With leading academics and world-class resources, combined with a ranking in the top 100 universities worldwide, we offer all you need to build a brighter future.

, '\n',

The Opportunity

, '\n',

An opportunity has arisen for a Graduate Education Analyst. If you are passionate about producing analysis and insights to support decision making, then this could be the role for you.

, '\n',

You will be responsible for the delivery of meaningful, actionable and insightful data analysis for the Graduate Education Portfolio. With senior stakeholders relying on your findings to direct their decision making, your analysis will be invaluable in setting the future direction of the University. You will be required to develop and implement plans, policies, processes and KPIs to drive the performance of the portfolio.

, '\n',

You will work collaboratively with faculties to develop a coherent, profitable and sustainable suite of graduate programs that deliver high-quality outcomes and are future-proofed against changes in government priorities and regulations. To achieve this you will have fantastic written and oral communication skills in order to effectively translate the findings of your analysis into meaningful reports and presentations that are easily understood by their target audience. Accuracy and attention to detail are essential to the role.

, '\n',

As an expert in your field, you will obtain an in-depth understanding of the business, its key drivers, its strategic aims, and how you can contribute to these. You will question the status quo and generate continuous improvements to refine your work.

, '\n',

As an expert in providing intelligence for business, you will share your specialist knowledge across the University and monitor emerging data and information needs. You will have the opportunity to provide a competitive advantage to the University by supporting a variety of projects and processes. Your ability to innovate in analytical processes, data visualisations and reporting will be key, as will your management of dirty data within the complexities of University’s data pool.

, '\n',

If you believe you fit this profile, we look forward to receiving your application.

This role is a full-time position; however, flexible working arrangements may be negotiated.

, '\n',

Your application must address the selection criteria. Please refer to "How to apply for Monash Jobs"

, '\n',

Enquiries

, '\n',

Ms Nicola Powell, Director, University Planning and Statistics, 03 9905 9659

, '\n',

Position Description

, '\n',

PD - Graduate Education Analyst

, '\n',

Closing Date

, '\n',

Sunday 21 May 2017, 11:55pm AEST

, '\n']

title: b'Manager, VGRS\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

 

, ' ',

Court Services Victoria (CSV) is a public entity established by the Court Services Victoria Act 2014 to provide expert administrative support to Victoria's courts: the Supreme Court, the County Court, the Magistrates' Court, the Children's Court, and the Coroners Court, as well as the Victorian Civil and Administrative Tribunal and the Judicial College of Victoria.　

, ' ',

This role operates within the Information Technology Services area, which is part of Jurisdiction Services (JS), CSV. JS provides support to all Victorian courts and tribunals to assist in the delivery of justice services. JS is responsible for providing courts and tribunals with a range of corporate support functions including human resources, finance, facilities, asset and contract management, planning and administration, business intelligence, communications, business review and improvement, technology and transcription services.　

, ' ',

To be successful in this role, you will be able to demonstrate a track record of successful leadership of teams in complex environments with a range of different stakeholder groups.  Your strengths will be in identifying and implementing actions to maintain or improve service levels, provision of strategic advice on Service delivery matters and building strong customer relationships to understand service needs.　

, ' ',

Relevant tertiary qualifications in Commerce or Business Management or another relevant discipline are required and or equivalent professional experience.

, ' ',

How to Apply:

, ' ',

Applicants are encouraged to apply online, outlining professional skills, knowledge and personal qualities.  Applications should include:

, ' ',

1) resume

, ' ',

2) a short covering letter and

, ' ',

3) completed application form (see file attachment).

, ' ',

You are only required to address the Key Selection Criteria listed in the Application Form. Individual responses to “key selection criteria” listed on the Position Description are not required. Attachments can be uploaded in either Microsoft Word or PDF format.

, ' ',

Applicants should view the full position description attached to this advertisement before applying. 

, ' ',

For all enquiries regarding this position, please contact  Justin Bree on (03) 9032 0450.

, ' ',

Applications close Monday 22 May 2017

, ' ']

[
, '\n',

The Role
In a world where Information is becoming increasingly important to decision making, there is a need to ensure that the business is being enabled with technology solutions that make access to this information simple and intuitive.

, '\n',

You are an astute business professional within the Information Management domain - with a passion and demonstrable competencies in ensuring project solution design aligns with exacting business requirements, to generate maximum value back to the business. You are a natural builder of relationships and translator of technical into business language.

To be successful, you'll have:

• Multiple years exp. working in the Information Management domain, with a several years exp. in a DW/BI Architecture role
• Proven experience working within large/complex Data Warehousing and Business Intelligence environments
• Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate effectively with leadership and delivery teams
• Hands on Data Modelling Experience, specifically Operational and Dimensional Modelling for Data Warehouses
• Strong database knowledge, specifically with the Oracle technologies
• Ability to present and resolve architecture key design decisions with the Enterprise Architecture governance forum

, '\n',

Key Responsibilities

, '\n',

• Ownership of the Insights solution architecture, including Data Warehousing, Operational Reporting and Business Intelligence Reporting and Self-Service
• Definition and maintenance of the governing principles that underpin the DW/BI solution architecture
• Champion the application of best-practice in solution design, with a specific focus on Data Modelling and Information Delivery
• Work closely with the Coles Enterprise Architecture group to ensure alignment with the broader Coles IT strategies and roadmaps
• Collaborate with the Information Architect providing a focused view with application related matters
• Review and endorsement of project deliverables to ensure alignment with the DW/BI solution architecture
• Contribute to the Insights Governance processes and documentation to support continuous improvement within the delivery teams
• Identify innovation opportunities that will bring value to our end users in the areas of Business Intelligence
• Work closely with delivery managers to assess change, effectively communicating the associated risk and complexity
• Mentoring and leadership of the project delivery leads

, '\n',

Culture

Coles is a fast-paced, constantly changing business that focuses your talents and challenges you to perform at your best. As a team, we're bold with ideas and operate with pace and passion, always looking for better ways to transform retail and delight customers.

, '\n',

Benefits

, '\n',

Not only will you receive a competitive salary, you'll also have access to these great benefits:
• Cheaper groceries and other products. You'll get a 5% discount when shopping at Coles, Kmart, Officeworks and Target
• Learn new skills and develop your existing capabilities. We provide excellent ongoing training and development
• Take your experience to the next level. We always have new opportunities to help you build a great career
• 12 weeks of paid Parental Leave for primary care givers and 1 week of paid leave for secondary care givers
• No need to pay for car parking. You can park your car in our multi-level car park, which is exclusive to our team
• Get fitter, stronger and faster at our on-site gym

, '\n',

About Us

, '\n',

With over 100,000 team members, over 2,200 retail outlets and the huge corporate support infrastructure behind these, Coles is one of the most significant businesses in Australia. This scope and its positive approach to lateral moves means employees have an amazing environment to apply and develop talents, opportunities to achieve significant goals personally and professionally, and to build and pursue an interesting career.

The pace of our business has made it a gathering place for passionate and talented people. In this environment, team members draw the motivation, focus, determination and personal growth required to achieve more, faster.

How to apply

, '\n',

If you have the drive to achieve your best every single day, then our team is waiting to transform your talents.
Click "Apply" to complete an application form and upload your current resume.

, '\n',

Please Note

, '\n',

We prefer to deal with you directly and have not engaged an agency for this role, so if you're interested, please apply.

, '\n',

At Coles, we aim to ensure our team represents the community we serve, embracing the richness of Australia's diverse population.

, '\n']

title: b'STA (Data Warehousing/ETL) - Melbourne\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',

About Us

Planit is one of the leading software testing & training organisation in Asia Pacific with over 1,200 permanent employees globally and are currently experiencing a period of rapid growth. Due to this rapid expansion we are seeking highly experienced Senior Test Analysts with Data Warehousing / BI experience to join our Melbourne team on a permanent basis. You will be working with the best in the industry and enjoying a variety of employee incentives + much more...

, '\n',


About the Role

As an STA (DW/BI), you will consult to our top tier client base, covering all areas of the testing lifecycle in multiple domains. Knowledge & expertise on all Software Delivery methodologies & Test processes, you will use your technical capability in Business Intelligence & Data Warehousing to deliver large scale Programs/Projects on schedule and to the highest quality.

, '\n',


Testing Responsibilities:

, '\n',
  • Operational (day-to-day) management of test tasks or activities; including mentoring more junior team members providing feedback & acting as a point of contact to resolve technical challenges on a project
  • Creation of test scenarios and tests cases that will include the use of appropriate BI Test techniques and methods to ensure requirement coverage - this will include data profiling  and validation
  • Liaise with Clients for Business requirements, Acceptance criteria, Solution Design and other documentation that will provide the test basis for testing
  • Formulate estimates for test activities and test schedule.  Highlight risks, issues and undertake defect management
  • Ensure tracking of tasks and highlight any blockers or risks that may impact the test schedule or overall project timeline
  • Writing Test Plans that will outline the test approach and methodology that would be followed
  • Determine test conditions/test objectives
  • Identify requirement traceability to confirm test coverage of technical and business requirements
  • Responsible for test case execution; which includes executing sql scripts, analysing the outcome and reporting test results
  • Use of static testing techniques on documentation that may require facilitation of static reviews or  workshops
  • Responsible for raising and closing defects in line with the clients defect management process
  • Production of test status reports for different Stakeholders across the Business which provide a clear summary of progress
, '\n',


Technical Skills and Experience:

Must Have

, '\n',
  • Advanced SQL skills 
  • Experience in ETL & Dimension Modelling testing.
  • 2+ years of testing experience in Data Warehousing and Business Intelligence projects
  • Hands-on experience working with at least one or multiple ETL tools e.g. Informatica, IBM DataStage, SAS Data Management, SSIS, SAP Data Services etc
  • Undertaken Data Warehouse testing with Microsoft and Oracle tools
  • Experience of visualisation tools - Tableau, OBIEE, Alteryx, Splunk etc
  • Work experience in different Operating System Environments - Unix/Linux or Microsoft
, '\n',


Desirable

, '\n',
  • ISTQB Found. certification
  • Certified Agile tester certification
  • Knowledge/experience in ETL test automation
  • Working knowledge of Software Version Control tools - Git, Mercurial etc
  • Experience in testing large Data migration or Data Integration projects
  • Programming skills such as Python, Java or .Net
  • BI or Data warehousing certifications
, '\n',


Culture

Work with like-minded colleagues who have a passion for testing excellence. An encouraging and supportive environment, the team-orientated culture is helpful, friendly, inclusive and flexible. Our leadership team is accessible and you are paired with a Senior Buddy to help you reach your goals and grow your career.

, '\n',


Benefits

Planit operates with a flat-structure feel which enables you to have your contributions heard and acknowledged. We keep up-to-date with the ever-changing IT tools and throughout your career offer you the opportunity to focus on advancing your internationally recognised testing qualifications. In addition, we offer staff parties/activities, unrivalled employee benefits and a results-focussed culture that is inclusive, successful and we do it all with positivity and a smile.

, '\n',


www.planittesting.com

Apply now for the opportunity of a lifetime!

***NO AGENCIES PLEASE!!!***

, '\n']

title: b'Reporting BI Business Analyst\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',

Bupa is extraordinary. We are a world leading health & care group with over 18,000 people in Australia and New Zealand, and our purpose is to help people live longer, healthier, and happier lives. We're making a difference in health & care through our leading health insurance, our modern Dental clinics, Bupa Optical stores and Bupa GP clinics, as well as personalised care at over 65 Bupa Aged Care Homes.

, '\n',

At Bupa our people are transforming and making a difference in the world of health & care.

, '\n',

About the opportunity

, '\n',

Reporting to the Enterprise BI Manager, the Reporting BI Business Analyst will focus on ensuring that new reporting requirements are documented from both a functional and technical perspective for developers. The Reporting BI Business Analyst, will work with business users to translate functional requirements into technical, and work with BI developers and the Reporting SME to rollout new solutions to businesses.

, '\n',

Your key responsibilities will include:

, '\n',
  • Documenting and working with business SME to produce visualization reporting requirements
  • Making sure requirements are signed off
  • Facilitating Prototype builds
  • Working on change requests for any new reporting requirements
  • Working with transformation team to define data requirements for reporting
  • Writing technical and functional reporting requirements for models and reports
  • Defining conceptual and logical data models
  • Defining and working with developers to define strategic reporting solutions
, '\n',

Your background

, '\n',

You will be inspired and driven by the opportunity to work with a global leader in health care that is on the path towards an exciting transformation.

, '\n',

To be successful in your application you will possess the following experience;

, '\n',
  • 8+ years’ experience in BI modelling and reporting requirements
  • Experience working in a centralised reporting team (IT, Finance, Centre of Excellence, etc.)
  • Knowledge of Business Intelligence and Data Warehousing concepts and principles
  • Knowledge of health insurance industry or related industry experience is advantageous.
  • Proficiency with desktop applications such as MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word)
  • Excellent problem solving skills and demonstrated ability working in a fast-paced environment
, '\n',

Bupa believes in hiring the best talent in the market. We are known for our vibrant, high performing and incredibly rewarding workplace, and we take pride in creating exceptional and meaningful work experiences, encouraging innovation, delivering award winning benefits to our employees and being involved with our communities.

, '\n',

Bupa has everything – growth, passion, results and a caring & supportive culture that surround a burning ambition and purpose that is the best in the world.

, '\n',

Find the purpose in your career!

, '\n']

title: b'Mid-Level BI Developer\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',

Bupa is extraordinary. We are a world leading health & care group with over 18,000 people in Australia and New Zealand, and our purpose is to help people live longer, healthier, and happier lives. We're making a difference in health & care through our leading health insurance, our modern Dental clinics, Bupa Optical stores and Bupa GP clinics, as well as personalised care at over 65 Bupa Aged Care Homes.

, '\n',

At Bupa our people are transforming and making a difference in the world of health & care.

, '\n',

About the opportunity

, '\n',

Reporting to the Enterprise BI Manager, the primary focus of the Mid-Level MSBI Developer will be improving the footprint of MSBI development across the Finance function. The key objective of this position will be ensuring that the reporting needs of the Health Insurance Sales & Growth business are met through the creation of data models and streamlined reporting solutions.

, '\n',

Your key responsibilities will include:

, '\n',
  • Supports the Health insurance business by producing and publishing reports and analysis as requested;
  • Working with stakeholders to capture reporting requirements and document these requirements for development;
  • Develop and automate current reporting requirements utilising Bupa’s BI technology stack;
  • Provides data clarifications and analysis of any data issues
  • Provides support to other finance reporting teams
  • Support change management activities and rollout of new functionality to the business
  • Monitors data integrity across multiple subject areas to ensure accurate reporting and analysis
, '\n',

Your background

, '\n',

You will be inspired and driven by the opportunity to work with a global leader in health care that is on the path towards an exciting transformation.

, '\n',

To be successful in your application you will possess the following experience;

, '\n',
  • 3-5 years’ experience in similar MS BI developer role. Familiar with MS BI tool stack (SSIS, SSAS, SSRS, Power Query, Power Pivot, etc.)
  • Experience working in a centralised reporting team (IT, Finance, Centre of Excellence, etc.)
  • Knowledge of Business Intelligence and Data Warehousing concepts and principles
  • Knowledge of health insurance industry or related industry experience is advantageous
  • SAS Enterprise Guide advantageous
  • Proficiency with desktop applications such as MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word)
  • Strong interpersonal skills
  • Strong time management and problem solving skills
, '\n',

Bupa believes in hiring the best talent in the market. , '\n',
