Bupa has everything – growth, passion, results and a caring & supportive culture that surround a burning ambition and purpose that is the best in the world.

, '\n',

Find the purpose in your career!

, '\n']

title: b'Commercial / Data Analyst\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

With over 300 stores across Australia and growing internationally, Boost Juice, Salsas Fresh Mex and CIBO Espresso have become iconic brands across the retail landscape.
We are a vibrant & dynamic company dedicated to people - both those that buy our products & those that make them!

, '\n',

A fantastic opportunity has opened up for a talented and passionate Commercial/Data Analyst to join the Business Intelligence team at our Support Office in Chadstone.

, '\n',

This is a great role for someone looking to step up from their current role and to work closely with our brands and contribute to successful business outcomes.

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

Your responsibilities will include:

, '\n',
  • Ability to extract data & transform it into analytical solutions
  • Working with various business stakeholders to establish requirements that assist with the design & delivery of analytical solutions
  • Contribute to the delivery of financial and commercial strategies and decisions through evaluation and pursuit of opportunities
  • Support the Commercial Finance Team with data extraction and system usage
  • Providing education/training where required to new and existing users on updates and system improvements
  • Assist in the management and maintenance of the production databases, BI Platform and reporting systems/solutions
  • Provide data analysis to the business and assist with tracking trends/performance of our brands
  • Assist in developing & maintaining monthly KPI reporting
, '\n',

 

, '\n',

Essential Criteria:

, '\n',
, '\n',
  • 2 years or more graduate work experience in a relevant role (finance or BI disciplines) in a corporate environment or a consultancy  
  • Tertiary Qualifications in Accounting, Business, Finance, Economics, or relevant discipline
  • SQL skills (either Oracle or Microsoft)
  • Exceptional analytical skills (data manipulation & development of commercial analysis)
  • Strong communication skills with ability to engage with various levels of management
  • Excellent analytical and problem solving skills
  • Advanced Excel knowledge and skills
  • High level attention to detail 
  • Service orientated team player
  • Experience using Business Intelligence products will be favourably looked upon
, '\n',

 

, '\n',

You will be driven and passionate, and keen to work within a fast moving and vibrant environment and have a true desire to succeed!

, '\n',

In return, you will work with a passionate and driven team that works within a fast moving and vibrant environment and has a lot of fun along the way!

Please apply with your resume and cover letter.
 

, '\n',

Agencies please do not apply to this role - we just want to talk to amazing, real people.

, '\n']

title: b'Sales Operations Analyst\r\n      '
jd:
["SEEK is a diverse group of companies, comprised of a strong portfolio of online employment, educational, commercial and volunteer businesses. SEEK operates across 19 countries with exposure to over 4 billion people and 26% of GDP. SEEK makes a positive contribution to people's lives on a global scale.",
, ' ',
, " Working within the Sales and Service Analytics team and \xa0reporting to the Senior Commercial Analyst the role has a strong focus on reporting, analysis and operational support. The roles' primary responsibility is to coordinate sales and operational reporting requirements through the service desk and supporting the analytics team in delivery and improvement of revenue planning, reporting and forecasting processes. \xa0",
, ' \xa0\xa0',
, ' While nested within the analytics team, the role is highly collaborative and involves working with other analysts and stakeholders across the business, including our sales, IT and finance teams.\xa0',
, ' ',
, ' ', So a day in the role looks something like this:,
, ' ',
  • Taking a lead role in coordinating sales and operational reporting queries
  • Assisting the team in delivering great business intelligence analysis and insights; 
  • Engaging with key stakeholders to ensure revenue targets, commissions, account ownership and revenue recognition is correctly reflected and clearly understood
  • Manage the sales commission and incentive process and on-going maintenance of policies in partnering with key stakeholders 
  • Drive on-going process excellence in reporting and system requirements, including CRM and SAP contract management
, ' ', What are we looking for:,
, ' ',
, ' Ideally you are degree qualified in business/ commerce/ IT (or working towards) and have a keen interest in analysing and investigating data and problem solving in a highly commercial context.',
, ' Although early in your career, you have some commercial experience. You are a\xa0',
, ' self-starter with a commitment to quality. A Great communicator and relationship builder you have excellent stakeholder management, and are adaptive to rapid change. Advanced excel skills are essential.\xa0',
, ' \xa0',
, ' ',
, ' ', Culture,
, " At SEEK we really value our culture and the way we work together to get stuff done. Our commitment to fostering a work environment where people feel like they're making a difference everyday has helped us maintain a consistently high ranking in the annual Hewitt Best Employer Award. In other words, people like to come here - and we're proud of that!",
, ' ',
, ' ', Privacy Policy,
, ' All personal information received by us from you or about you will be stored, used and disclosed by us in accordance with our privacy policy, a copy of which can be found at www.seek.com.au/privacy. \xa0If you\xa0have any questions in relation to how we may use and store your personal information please contact us at usersupport@seek.com.a ']

title: b'SQL Developer\r\n      '
jd:
['Our client has been operating successfully in their space delivering high quality services that have a positive impact on the community for over 25 years. \xa0They have been growing continually and technology is where they seek to gain a competitive advantage. They seek to add a permanent Reporting Analyst to their high performing team.',
, ' ',
, ' They have a significant investment in custom-built software and the Data / Reporting Analyst is required to provide timely reports and data insights to business users based on this software and the underlying database and data structures.',
, ' ',
, ' This role will report to the IT Manager and will have strong interactions with both Business Users ranging from the CEO to department heads and the Business Intelligence Architect.This role will suit candidates who have experience with fast paced environments where priorities change and you will have to think on your feet. This role will suit those candidates used to working off a 5 day plan as opposed to a 90 day plan! .You must have the ability to self-motivate, learn, adapt, innovate and create',
, ' ',
, ' ', Responsibilities include, '\xa0 ',
  • Work with IT and business users to understand data and reporting requirements;
  • Provide assistance to the Support & Small Projects Team by attending to production database support requests;
  • For support and projects, interpret data, analyse results, and provide ongoing reports;
  • Develop and implement databases, data analytics, and other strategies that optimise data efficiency and quality;
  • Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets;
  • Ensure timely delivery of work to agreed timeframes and to a high degree of quality;
  • Anticipate problems and pro-actively develop contingency plans;
  • Proactively identify process or technology improvements and "own' your journey into the standard way of working;
, ' ', Knowledge skills and attributes required., ' ',
  • In-depth experience and skill at Microsoft SQL;
  • Solid understanding of data modelling, ETL processes, and database designs;
  • Strong Microsoft Reporting Services (SRSS) and Microsoft Excel skills;
  • Basic database and user administration;
  • Experience with Microsoft Analysis and MDX is advantageous.
, ' ',
, ' This is a newly created position in a company that have modern technology stack, a very low turnover and promotes family values and a genuine work/life balance. Apply now to be considered. ']

title: b'\r\n          Java Developer\r\n        '
jd:
[' ',

"Our client is looking for a highly motivated self-started leverage synergising immaculate professional to join their exciting dynamic data driven web 2.0 team. Must have fifteen years experience in the following technologies..."

, ' ',

Have you read that same sad, grey ad twenty times today?

, ' ',

And every time you read that ad you imagine the sad, grey job you'd end up with if you were the successful applicant.

, ' ',

Well we're here to give you an opportunity at a job which is neither sad nor grey! Yellowfin is hiring new developers!

, ' ',

Yellowfin is a rapidly growing business intelligence software company headquartered in Melbourne. We value people who are creative and hard working and you'll be part of a team of great people.

, ' ',

Your role will initially involve maintaining existing parts of our product and will expand into developing new features. Over time you'll have the flexibility to find and take ownership of the parts of the product which you enjoy working on.

, ' ',

We write web based software with a Java backend, so it's great if you have experience with Java and JavaScript. We're pretty pragmatic about this, though – solid programming skill is more important to us than language specific knowledge. That said, you should tick the following boxes:

, ' ',
  • A reasonable grasp of SQL and RDBMSs.
  • 5+ years experience working in a development role, both as part of a team and by yourself.
  • A relevant degree (e.g. computer science or software engineering).
  • Australian citizenship or permanent residency.
  • Proficiency in English.
, ' ',

If you feel like this is the job for you then drop us a line and introduce yourself! Please note though that Elias doesn't like robots who apply to every single job on Seek. To let him know that you're not a robot please include a paragraph in your covering letter explaining why you're interested in this role.

, ' ']

title: b'Senior MSBI Developer\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',

Bupa is extraordinary. We are a world leading health & care group with over 18,000 people in Australia and New Zealand, and our purpose is to help people live longer, healthier, and happier lives. We're making a difference in health & care through our leading health insurance, our modern Dental clinics, Bupa Optical stores and Bupa GP clinics, as well as personalised care at over 65 Bupa Aged Care Homes.

, '\n',

At Bupa our people are transforming and making a difference in the world of health & care.

, '\n',

About the opportunity

, '\n',

Reporting to the Enterprise BI Manager, the Senior MSBI Developer will play a pivotal role in developing and supporting SSIS development across the Finance function. The Senior MSBI Developer will also provide thought leadership around the development of BI Solutions and work closely with the internal technical team to support best practice solutions at an enterprise level.

, '\n',

Your key responsibilities will include:

, '\n',
  • Supports the Health insurance & Customer Service business by producing end to end MSBI solutions, particularly focused on developing and supporting a growing business lead data-mart
  • Role will be primarily focused on producing datasets for power bi or tabular model development
  • Working with stakeholders to capture reporting requirements and document these requirements for development;
  • Provides support to other finance reporting teams, such as; end to end report development methodology, data SME (sales data), testing of IS corporate data models, and help formalise and embed BI best practice;
  • Support change management activities and rollout of new functionality to the business
  • Drive data improvement activities and identify continuous improvement opportunities for forecasting, report consolidation & creation of new data models for analysis
, '\n',

Your background

, '\n',

You will be inspired and driven by the opportunity to work with a global leader in health care that is on the path towards an exciting transformation.

, '\n',

To be successful in your application you will possess the following experience;

, '\n',
  • Degree qualified in Business/Commerce or IT
  • 8 years+ experience in MSBI development
  • Experience working within a centralised reporting team (IT, Finance, Centre of Excellence, etc.)
  • Knowledge of Business Intelligence and Data Warehousing concepts and principles
  • Knowledge of health insurance industry or related industry experience is advantageous
  • Previous experience using the infrastructure side of DWH/BI
  • Previous Senior level experience using SSIS / SSAS Tabular
  • Knowledge of SAS Enterprise Guide is advantageous
  • Excellent interpersonal & communication skills, with demonstrated success working as part of a team environment
, '\n',

Join us

, '\n',

Bupa believes in hiring the best talent in the market. We are known for our vibrant, high performing and incredibly rewarding workplace, and we take pride in creating exceptional and meaningful work experiences, encouraging innovation, delivering award winning benefits to our employees and being involved with our communities.

, '\n',

Bupa has everything – growth, passion, results and a caring & supportive culture that surround a burning ambition and purpose that is the best in the world.

, '\n',


Find the purpose in your career!

, '\n']

title: b'\r\n          Business Development Executive - Meat Wholesale\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',

Business Development Executive – Meat Wholesale

, '\n',

University Meat, a Division of University Food Group, is a 50 year old family owned business looking for an experienced sales professional to join our dynamic sales team, hit the ground running, and assist us with the execution of our new sales strategy.

To be considered for this role, the successful applicant must have the following skills:

  • Knowledge of the hospitality industry desirable
  • Competent computer and IT skills
  • Effective written and communication skills

This position is ideal for experienced professionals that have the desire to take the next step in our exciting growth phase.

Please forward your resume to: jobs@universityfood.com.au and "Attention GM- Sales and Marketing"
NO AGENCIES PLEASE

Only successful candidates will be contacted

jd:
["Our client, a well-known higher education institution, are currently seeking 2 Project Manager to join their Business Intelligence/ research portfolio. This portfolio already has 4 years' worth of work.",
, ' ',
, ' Lead and deliver complex, multi-disciplinary strategic and business improvement projects with a focus on strong stakeholder engagement and capability establishment.',
, ' \xa0',
, ' ', Key responsibilities, ' ',
  • Lead cross-functional teams
  • Establish, manage and sustain the day to day relationships with key stakeholders/project owners
  • Define resource requirements and leads recruitment processes
  • Accountability for delivery of allocated projects with large organisational technical complexity and business impact; providing assurance of successful delivery to project specifications including budget, schedule, requirements and quality
  • Focus on providing projects with mature planning practices; including scoping, estimating, assessing risks and facilitating benefit profiles as part of the project development and business case process.
  • Work with operational team members to ensure successful transition specifications are managed
  • Develop, track and maintain project based records, reports, and presents to managing and governing bodies as required
  • Manage and work with external consultants and vendors where appropriate to provide specialist knowledge, capability and components of project delivery
, ' ',
, ' ', Key skills and experience required, ' ',
  • Previous experience managing medium to large ($250k - $3m+) IT and business improvement projects ideally in : IT infrastructure, enterprise applications, cloud solution implementations, business process improvement
  • Demonstrated ability to work with clients and stakeholders through the full project lifecycle to identify, source / develop and implement solutions that meet requirements and enable realisation of business benefits.
  • Strong practical experience of project scheduling, forecasting, and overall financial management
  • Good commercial acumen and vendor management skills
  • Proven leadership skills and experience with cross functional teams in a matrix structure
  • Previous experince delivering business intelligence projects is an advantage (BI, big data, OBIEE etc)
  • Relevant postgraduate qualification with relevant project management accreditation /methodologies (including PMBOK, Prince2, Agile; and frameworks such as ITIL and SDLC)
, ' ',
, ' ', How to Apply,
, ' Apply now or call Ali from Talent on #03 9236 7708 for a confidential discussion ']

title: b'Information Management Consultants\r\n      '
jd:
["Servian is one of Australia's leading consultancies specialising in Information Management, Business Intelligence, Data Warehousing, UX and UI Design, Application Development and Cloud Data Service and everything Data!",
, ' ',
, ' Due to considerable growth over the last twelve months, we are seeking Data Warehouse and Business Intelligence Developers, of all levels of experience, to join our dynamic team. ',
, ' \xa0',
, ' As an Information Management Consultant you will bring demonstrated experience in Data Warehousing and Business Intelligence project delivery and possess first class communication skills. ',
, ' ',
, ' ', To be successful, you must:,
, ' ',
  • Understanding of Data Warehousing and Business Intelligence concepts
  • Data modelling knowledge - Inmon, Kimball and/or Vault (key part of interview assessment)

jd:

  • Support and Development role
, ' ',

Based in Melbourne's CBD, Prima Consulting is a Professional Services company specialising in Information Management and Business Intelligence. We provide a range of services from project management,  development, and support to a number of clients in different industries including Telecommunications, Banking, Finance, Government, Mining, and Transport.

, ' ',

Working as a key member of a small team, You will be providing Support to Clients across the country.  As such, You will be an IT Professional who is:

  • Willing to learn new skills
  • Able to solve simple and complex problems quickly and accurately
  • Confident dealing with people on the phone as well as face to face
  • Able to assist other Consultants with complex issues
  • Attentive to details to ensure correct help desk processes are followed

  • Database access and retrieval techniques
  • SQL Server 2005+and / or NEXUS Databases
  • HTML, Javascript, CSS
  • TFS
  • MSMQ
  • Windows and Office Support

, ' ',

With strong communication skills and a positive attitude, this is an ideal opportunity to develop and enhance your skillset in a supportive team environment.

, ' ',

Appropriate IT qualifications required, with certification in Microsoft highly desirable.

, ' ',

Click on the Apply button below and submit your resume in Word format.

, ' ']

title: b'Marketing Automation Developer/Analyst\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

Officeworks is Australia's leading retailer and supplier of office products for home, business and education and is committed to helping make bigger things happen for our customers every day. As part of the larger Wesfarmers group, Officeworks has an extensive national footprint of more than 160 retail stores and employs more than 7000 team members. We have a strong values platform, which underpins the way we do business, and is focused on our community, the environment and our people.

, '\n',

We are a leading business delivering inspiring solutions to our customers. We are committed to future growth and expansion through innovation, challenging the boundaries and through empowering our people to succeed. Our values underpin the way we do business which is focussed on our community, the environment and our people.

, '\n',

We are currently seeking an experienced IT professional to join our team based in our support office in East Bentleigh, Victoria.

, '\n',

Reporting to the IT Manager for Reporting and Analytics, and working as part of the IT team, this role has Technical SME for Marketing Automation platforms. Ideally you will have experience with Adobe Marketing suite, particularly Adobe Campaign, or you have a background in Business Intelligence / Analytics and looking to apply your skills to marketing personalisation.

, '\n',

Key responsibilities include:

, '\n',
  • Management of integration between Marketing automation tools (Adobe Suite) and Officeworks IT systems
  • Enhancements and updates to data models, workflows, reporting, campaigns, etc
  • Technical SME for Adobe suite, ensuring ongoing effective integration and change management with other Officeworks IT and external systems and teams
  • Ensuring integrity, privacy and accuracy of Officeworks customer data
  • Ensuring a high level of security and access management is in place
  • Capacity management and optimisation of platforms
  • Management of Production and non-production environments
  • Ensuring solution documentation is proactively updated and maintained
  • Monitoring and housekeeping of workflows, files, data tables, security, etc.
  • Monitoring of system interfaces / integration and platform capacity management
  • Problem-solving and error resolution
  • Manage marketing automation suite software / product upgrades with product vendor
, '\n',

You are degree qualified with experience ideally as a developer / analyst of the Marketing Automation Suite, particularly with Adobe Campaign. You have a strong interest in data, analytics, integration and understanding of our customers. You have experience as a project team member using agile methodologies, working with Marketing professionals, agencies, and with all areas of an IT department. You have outstanding communication skills, are a problem solver with advanced IT technical skills and enjoy being innovative and creative in your approach.
When you join Officeworks you will become part of a team who are helping make bigger things happen…We are an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to a diverse, inclusive and flexible workforce. We welcome enquiries and applications from everyone in the communities which we serve.

, '\n',
  • Please note this is initially a 6 - 12 month contract role and will be paid with a daily rate. Please indicate your approximate daily rate in the application form.
, '\n',

What's on offer? We offer a dynamic and rewarding working environment with competitive remuneration, discounts, learning and development opportunities.

, '\n',

When you join Officeworks, you will become part of a team who are helping make bigger things happen…We are an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to a diverse, inclusive and flexible workforce. We welcome enquiries and applications from everyone in the communities which we serve.

, '\n',

, '\n',
  • No recruitment agencies please.
, '\n']

title: b'\r\n          Data Solution Architect\r\n        '
jd:
[' ',

EXCITING DATA SOLUTION ARCHITECT POSITION FOR A MICROSOFT TRUSTED PARTNER WHO ARE BUILDING AN ELITE TECH TEAM! 

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

BCS Technology (BCS) is an award-winning Australian based Professional Services organisation focusing on the provision of quality consulting in the area of Business Intelligence, Data warehouse and Application Development. We are trusted partners of Cloudera and Microsoft and recently, BCS has been accepted as part of the Microsoft Practice Development Initiative to further develop our Analytics practice on Microsoft Azure.  

, ' ',

We are transforming into a digital provider for the entire world. Founded in 2001, Sydney Australia, BCS has emerged as a leading Professional Services provider, delivering tailored solutions and services to clients throughout the world. With offices now in Sydney, Melbourne, Jakarta, Manila and Delhi, BCS is currently on track to reinvent itself to be one of the world's most reliable data analytics solutions provider. If you are looking to learn and grow, we also sponsor training programs. Come join our team and be a part of this exciting opportunity.

, ' ',

What will you be doing?

, ' ',
  • You will be responsible for the architecture of new Data Analytics platforms on Azure that will allow senior stakeholders to analyse and generate business critical insight for the purpose of business decision making.
  • We prefer those with hands on experience in Azure data but it is not necessary.
  • Experience in databases and analytics, including relational databases, AWS, Data Warehousing, Big Data , NoSQL, Machine Learning, Stream Analytics, Data Factory, Event Hubs , Notification Hubs and business analytics.
  • Understanding of big data use-cases.
  • Understanding of Hadoop-based design patterns knowledge of real time/stream analytics.
, ' ',

Essentials:

, ' ',
  • Bachelor Degree or higher in IT or relevant discipline
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills.
  • Keen eye for detail.
  • Excellent time management.
  • Excellent problem solving and analytical skills.
  • Flexibility to travel - this position requires the person to travel to our international offices for short term assignments when required. 
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

If you are interested in pursuing a rewarding career by being a part of an organisation committed to the growth of its customers and employees equally, please don't hesitate to APPLY NOW.

, ' ',

Please send your Resume in Word and we will get in touch with the shortlisted candidates ASAP.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

To be considered, you must be a Permanent Resident or an Australian Citizen.

, ' ']

, ' As a result of success and a recent internal promotion, they are looking for a proven Business Development Manager in their Melbourne office.\xa0These roles will be tasked with new business development into an existing portfolio of circa 30 accounts and net new prospect clients. They work across all sectors/verticals and are especially well known in the banking and financial services sectors.\xa0',

  • Development of strategic business development plans

  • Ability to create strategic account and territory development plans
  • Extremely consultative approach to business development - experience of mid to long sales cycles (varied products and decision makers).

Excellent potential commission with a completely uncapped plan with multiple kickers and accelerators. Genuine career progression and development awaits for the successful applicant.\xa0',

, ' Please send through your CV to nick.jenkin@jenkinbeattie.com ']

title: b'BI ANALYST - MS Reports & PowerBI - Aged Care\r\n    '
jd:
[' ',

About the Role

, ' ',

Our client is seeking to appoint a Business Intelligence Analyst to its large IT Team. The role is responsible for building, implementing and supporting BI reports and dashboards. The right individual will possess experience in all stages of BI project work to build and deliver reports (requirements and logical design, physical design, implementation, testing and deployment). The BI Developer should have a firm grasp of BI implementation methodologies and will have had in-depth experience with PowerBI.

, ' ',

, ' ',

The role will be responsible for:

, ' ',
  • Data gathering, research and analytical abilities so as to develop insightful conclusions and generate solutions to address user needs
  • Analyse business requirements, design and develop complex reports, forms, and dashboards
  • Ability to reverse engineer current reports
  • Resolve end user reporting problems through collaboration with IT and Business Organisations
, ' ',

, ' ',

This role will require someone with the following skills:

, ' ',
  • At least 5 years BI Report Development (Microsoft SSRS) experience and 1-2 years directly with PowerBI
  • Understand and have expertise in the various technologies needed to implement PowerBI solutions.
  • General Relational Database development and SQL Language experience
  • Advanced level of writing stored procedures, reading query plans, tuning indexes and troubleshooting performance bottlenecks
  • 1-2 years ETL experience, including SSIS.
  • 1 year Data Warehousing experience utilizing SSAS.
  • Problem solving, analytical and communication abilities

title: b'\r\n          Research Director\r\n        '
jd:

Who is ORC International?

, ' ',

ORC International is part the Engine Group, a connected ecosystem of marketing services specialists, and boasts an impressive array of research capabilities under one roof. With 15 global office locations and clients in over 50 countries, ORC International is focused, efficient, and smart, as we integrate diverse approaches to answer today's business challenges. In Australia, our vision is to be the country's most progressive business intelligence firm, finding new ways to combine creativity, intellect and technology to add value for our clients, our people and our community.

title: b'ICT Security Specialist\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',

An ICT Security Specialist is needed to provide timely and accurate specialist review and advice on all ICT Security functions, conduct risk assessments, provide ICT security guidance and contribute to the formulation of a strategic ICT security framework.

, '\n',

Location: Melbourne (Tullamarine Airport), Canberra(CBD) or Brisbane (Airport)

, '\n',

Position-Specific

, '\n',
  • Maintain an up-to-date knowledge of all ICT security domains with associated threats and controls.
  • Contribute to the development and maintenance of enterprise level ICT security documentation and assisting with strategic documentation.
  • Conduct and analyse ICT system risk management plans.
  • Conduct and analyse ICT statements of applicability.
  • Conduct and analyse ICT system security plans.
  • Specialist application security knowledge, ability to create application security architectural patterns.
  • Through relationship management and engagement with the business, intercept and record requirements and analyse these with providers within the ICT Division.
, '\n',

Requirement:

, '\n',
  • Demonstrated experience in providing specialist ICT security advice in a dynamic enterprise environment.
  • Demonstrated experience in conducting threat and risk assessments (TRA) and IT security risk management
  • Experience with Outsourcing and Cloud Security integration
  • Experience with Data and Application Security concepts and architectures across technologies such as Identity and Access Management, Enterprise Service Bus and Business Intelligence.
  • Demonstrated record of effective stakeholder management and building effective working relationships with internal and external stakeholders in achieving business outcomes.
  • A sound working knowledge of ICT security compliance doctrine and best practices including: Protective Security Policy Framework and the Australian Government Information Security Manual.
  • A proven ability to exercise initiative and judgment in both an independent and team situation

    Qualifications

    • Essential: Degree or diploma qualifications in Engineering or Information Communications Technology;
    • Highly Desirable: Industry specific ICT security certifications (eg. IRAP or CISM)
, '\n',

Does this sound like you? If so, we will be pleased to receive your application.

, '\n',

Please Note: Only applicants evaluated as satisfying the essential skills & requirements will be contacted.

, '\n',

Security Clearance

, '\n',

An Australian Government Baseline Security Clearance is required for this role.

, '\n',

An Australian Government Negative Vetting Level 1 Security Clearance (or higher) is highly desirable.

, '\n']

[' ',

The Company

, ' ',

Our client is an Australian owned enterprise which continues to expand its international footprint. With lifestyle brands renowned for quality, style and comfort, our client’s products are distributed through a sophisticated store network and online channels.

, ' ',

Aligned with this growth strategy, the finance leadership team are seeking a hands on and ambitious Financial Planning & Analysis Manager to join its Melbourne based team.

, ' ',


The Role

, ' ',

Reporting to the Chief Financial Officer, you will be a hands on FP&A leader responsible for the Group’s management reporting, financial planning, analysis and budgeting process for the Group. You will be adept at providing business partnering, insights and analysis to a multitude of stakeholders from Executive management, Operations, Retail, e-Commerce and Sales/ Marketing. Ultimately, you will be responsible for making recommendations on business initiatives supported by robust business case and analytics.

, ' ',

Your broad remit within this international business environment will span :

, ' ',
  • Accountability for the delivery of monthly financial analysis to the leadership team and board of directors, sales & margin reporting and analysis;
  • Partnering with leaders in the business and provide analytic support (globally) on various business initiatives as a key part of decision making process;
  • Develop and continuously improve reporting capability within the business, this includes both finance reports (GL), sales and stock reports as well as other key metrics that are important to drive and monitor group performance;
  • Manage global Capex program, ensure business cases submitted for Capital Appropriation Request (CAR) are supported by robust analysis and ensure post implementation review is conducted to capture learnings from past experience;
  • Accountable for the management of the business intelligence reporting tool (TM1), acting as a super user for the Group
  • Provide coaching and leadership to junior team members on reporting, systems and analytics.
, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

Your Profile

, ' ',

CA/CPA qualified, you will have experience as a leader within a financial planning & analysis function, or as a highly talented Senior Business Analyst looking to step up. You will complement strong financial modelling and data analysis skills with a business partnering style adept at providing meaningful business insights.

, ' ',

You will be highly skilled at leading and empowering change, communicating effectively cross functionally and cross border and influencing outcomes across the enterprise.

, ' ',

Ideally, your experience will have been gained within Retail, FMCG or Pharmaceutical sectors which have international presence. You will also have experience using business intelligence tools and ERP systems.

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

Apply Today
Please send your resume by clicking on the apply button or for further information, contact Cameron Eustice or Rebecca Gist at our Melbourne office on 03 9691 3643

, ' ',

Learn more about our Melbourne recruitment services: http://www.roberthalf.com.au/recruitment-agency-melbourne

, ' ']

title: b'Consultant, Delivery (Accounting Operations T&O)\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',
  • Lead an offshore team of approx. 6 team members
  • Bring a process improvement approach to this high performing role
  • Permanent full time opportunity
, '\n',

At NAB, we believe success comes from our people. We're committed to supporting your talent and skills through your career, as you help us build a culture that affects change for our customers - and for the community too.

, '\n',

Data, Analytics & Reporting (DA&R) produces both external reporting submissions for financial and regulatory reporting, and business intelligence and internal reporting services across the enterprise.

, '\n',

The Consultant, Delivery role oversees and directs the work flow and deliverables of an offshore team (Bangalore based) of approximately 6 team members that execute key reporting tasks including Board reporting, Subsidiary accounting (Share capital/Equity/capitalisation and Dividends) and Reconciliations.

, '\n',

This role will see you achieving quality and timeliness targets in line with Service Level Agreements, drive continuous improvement in process efficiency/effectiveness toward achieving cost efficiency targets and drive uplift in quality of financial reporting and analytics.

Key Responsibilities include, but not limited to:

, '\n',

  • Allocation and monitoring of scheduled and unscheduled work to quality and timeliness targets within agreed SLA's

To succeed in this role you will have you will have strong stakeholder engagement and interpersonal skills with well-developed communication and influencing skills. title: b'Senior Software Engineer\r\n      '
jd:
[
, '\n',
ABOUT Bounce Inc
, '\n',

The extraordinary BOUNCE growth story has been driven by a universally appealing offer, and an awesome culture that aims to be life changing for the customers and staff who are part of the BOUNCE brand community.

A powerful global brand by any measure, BOUNCE is fast creating a new category in action-adventure entertainment.

  • Indoor Trampoline and Adrenaline Playground facility catering to customers ranging from pre-school kids and school groups to families and elite sports athletes.
  • A truly brand and culture led company that is built to a significant extent around unlocking the passion and talents of diverse characters and fostering human connection.
  • A fully systemised business model with proven application to divers cultures across the world from suburban Melbourne to Johannesburg in South Africa, to Abu Dhabi in the Middle East.
  • Over 6.5 million customers and 1,700 staff world wide
, '\n',
 
, '\n',

About our Technology Team

  • Bounce has developed a market-leading Customer Management and Booking System and is in the processes of rolling this out globally while also continuing to extend and upgrade the platform. 
  • Bounce has a small Melbourne-based technology and works with an offshore development team.
  • Bounce is now looking for a Senior Software Engineer with deep technical expertise and hands-on development strength who can take this capability to the next level.
  • As our current offshore development team is in Russia, we are looking for a Russian-speaker to engage directly with the development team.

 

About this job

Reporting to the Head of IT you will be working directly and closely with the leadership team of the business.

Key activities:

  • Lead a (primarily) offshore delivery team in the design and delivery of Bounce’s core booking and customer management systems.
  • Set the technical direction for the team and ensure the adoption of best practice engineering principles. 
  • Work collaboratively with the business to understand the intention of requirements, use technical expertise to estimate work, design and build initial POC’s & prototypes and manage technical delivery.
  • Develop advanced tools, approaches, libraries, etc. that will facilitate rapid development, testing and deployment of the platform.
  • Develop and implement a model for software engineering that allows Bounce international partners (franchisees) to contribute to the delivery of the platform. 
  • Actively identify and address operational concerns and long term maintainability.
, '\n',
 
, '\n',

Business need for this new role

Massive growth over the past few years has led to an increasing demand for technology to support the business globally.

We are now defining a roadmap to enhance our systems and roll out new features globally to support our international business.  We are looking for a highly capable Software Engineer to ensure our systems remain leading edge and work with developers to ensure best practices are followed.

This is an awesome opportunity for someone who likes to be in the middle of the action and can bring their deep technical skills and an Agile Delivery approach to this highly dynamic business.

 

Does this sound like you?

  • Deep technical expertise, willing and able to get hands-on in delivering software in addition to reviewing code and managing a small team (5-6 developers)
  • Experience working in an Agile Software delivery environment, preferably with Scrum.
  • Ability to design and develop an end-to-end framework for delivery of
    • Front End Capability (HTML, Javascript, PHP, CSS, etc.)
    • Back End Capability (Python, RDBMS design & development)
    • Hosting Capability (AWS)
    • Strength in collaborating with UX designers to develop front end UI, re-usable widgets and responsive UI design.
  • Experience with Dev Ops/ Continuous Integration tools will be highly regarded.
  • Experience with Management Information Systems will be highly regarded (ETL, data warehousing, business intelligence and reporting platforms).
  • Strong communications skills in both English and Russian.

 

I’m interested!  What’s next?

If you have the experience, drive, passion and commitment to make your, then we'd love to hear from you.

Click on the apply link and submit your Cover letter, CV & info! 

 

, '\n']

title: b'Melbourne - Open Source Data Consultant - Cloud, Big Data and Analytics.\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',
The Company:

We're proud to call this company a client and have supported them for a number of years in Australia. They continue to challenge the status quo around technology, drive both delivery and product build and have been involved in some of APAC's most complex and high profile Data programmes.

Unlike other Data companies these guys focus on technical quality, premium design concepts and the ability to develop highly complex and innovative technical solutions.

They don't mind calling them selves "geeks with flair" and love to work with the latest tech available. They build solutions from the ground up and have some of the smartest technical minds across APAC working for them.

The role:

2017 is shaping up to be one of the biggest yet with partnerships being created at a global level, customers empowering them to manage entire Data programmes and organic growth and progression internally. 

They require a number of technical gifted problem solvers who have the following attributes:
  • At least 12 months experience developing technical solutions in a Data, Analytics and Business Intelligence capacity.
  • Outstanding - and I do mean outstanding - core SQL skills with a track record of coding with SQL when building solutions. Stored Proc, Scripting, Coding, Indexes, Triggers etc.
  • Solid command of Open Source and Applications orientated languages within a Data focused environment - Java, Scala, R, Python, Spark etc.
  • Experience in the design of Data solutions using various source systems within RDBMs and Cloud based technical environments.
  • Great communication skills with a passion for solving business problems through the use of technology.
  • Passionate about technology and the build of solutions through the use of it.
  • A real geek at heart who loves to learn and educate others.
  • Understanding of mainstream Data and Reporting Technologies with traditional RDBMS and Cloud / Open Source Environments - Oracle, SQL Server, Teradata, AWS, Hadoop, Cassandra, Tableau, QlikView, Power BI.
What's in this for me?

Training, training and more training - seriously.....weekly training and education! Not to mention the chance to work on some of the best and most high profile programmes in Australia. Oh, and dont forget you will be working with a team that is unrivaled technically! Think the Google of Data or the Atlassian of Analytics!

What next?

Apply now via Seek and speak with Alloc8 to learn more. Alternatively send your resume to tom.sharp@alloc8.com.au today or contact Tom on (02) 9090 2761

Sponsorship available for candidates based in Australia.


, '\n']

jd:
[' ',
  • Diverse role with B2C focus
  • Financial Services Sector
  • Career Defining Opportunity
, ' ',

The B2C Campaign Specialist will provide support to the Group B2C Marketing Manager for the development and execution of all calendar marketing activities and ad-hoc projects.

, ' ',

You will gather intelligence data from front facing staff to inform effective campaign messaging and development and translate business insights into campaign briefs for internal creative teams. You will manage the development and delivery of campaigns to agreed deadlines and liaise with the Business Intelligence team on data briefs to ensure data is delivered on time and in the correct format for campaign execution.  You will be responsible for managing the delivery of stakeholder sign-off and execution of all marketing campaigns to ensure reach and awareness is maximised.

, ' ',

You will prepare and deliver internal campaign briefings, ensuring all activity is appropriately communicated across the business for quality execution and manage and influence stakeholders to deliver the right outcomes for the business. You will also assist in delivering the marketing requirements associated with new client launches and drive continuous improvement and efficiencies in workflow processes within the campaign marketing team

, ' ',

This role requires a minimum of 3 - 5 years' experience in a previous marketing role with a B2C focus. You will have proven capabilities in campaign development and implementation including marketing planning, project management, event management and communications. Experience developing and communicating a value proposition (internally and externally) and extensive experience in relationship and stakeholder management is also requires. Experience working in a medium to large organisation and/or financial industry is desirable.

, ' ',

For a confidential discussion, please contact Chris Hughes at (03) 8614 8213 or chrishughes@alexkaar.com.au.

, ' ',

 

, ' ']

['\n',

At Coles, we're passionate about creating the best customer experience and we're always on the lookout for people who share our passion.

flybuys will give you the opportunity to work with some of the richest customer data in the country whilst being a part of a team delivering world class retail loyalty analytics. You will be presented genuine opportunities to grow your career and be a part of a collaborative, innovative and supportive environment where diversity is valued.

This role will be reporting directly into the Manager of Advanced Analytics - flybuys and be responsible for:

, '\n',
  • Design of the data ecosystem required to deliver the Analytics roadmap
    o Designing the ecosystem for analytical data assets
    o Design and implement processes around data-loading, data-transformation, feature construction, insights, modelling and productionisation of data assets
    o Contribute to the design of algorithmic solutions for projects on the analytics roadmap
  • Building data assets and feature stores required for CTM
    o Setting up processes to ensure integrity around data asset
    o Building documentation and communicating processes / methodologies to internal and external stakeholders
    o Ensure data fluidity between the big data platform and existing platforms
  • Working closely with different stakeholders (IT / Coles Online / etc) to get relevant data available into the big data platform and setting up processes that facilitate the development of data assets
    o Identifying relevant data sets that will provide analytical value
    o Communicate with the wider flybuys and Coles team around the data assets to demonstrate the usage and value of the asset
, '\n',

The successful candidate will have:

, '\n',
  • An analytics professional background with a proven track record in business insights or intelligence unit or IT
  • Great influencing and relationship building skills
  • Proficient understanding of distributed computing principles and data management
  • Working knowledge in data mining, machine learning, natural language processing, or information retrieval
  • Proficient in designing efficient and robust ETL workflows and data modelling
  • Be able to deliver value-add business solutions
  • Team player / Collaborator working with others to clarify requirements
  • Be able to tune Hadoop solutions / or work with IT architects to improve performance and end-user experience
  • Good knowledge of querying tools, such as SQL, Pig, Hive, and Impala
  • Excellent knowledge of R, Python, Scala
, '\n',

Culture

, '\n',

Coles is a fast-paced, constantly changing business that focuses your talents and challenges you to perform at your best. As a team, we're bold with ideas and operate with pace and passion, always looking for better ways to transform retail and delight customers. At Coles, we aim to ensure our team represents the community we serve, embracing the richness of Australia's diverse population.

, '\n',

Benefits

Not only will you receive a competitive salary, you'll also have access to these great benefits:

, '\n',
  • Cheaper groceries and other products. You'll get a 5% discount when shopping at Coles, Kmart, Officeworks and Target
  • Learn new skills and develop your existing capabilities. We provide excellent ongoing training and development
  • Take your experience to the next level. We always have new opportunities to help you build a great career
  • 12 weeks of paid Parental Leave for primary care givers and 1 week of paid leave for secondary care givers
  • No need to pay for car parking. You can park your car in our multi-level car park, which is exclusive to our team
, '\n',

About Us

With over 100,000 team members, over 2,200 retail outlets and the huge corporate support infrastructure behind these, Coles is one of the most significant businesses in Australia. This scope and its positive approach to lateral moves means employees have an amazing environment to apply and develop talents, opportunities to achieve significant goals personally and professionally, and to build and pursue an interesting career.

, '\n',

The pace of our business has made it a gathering place for passionate and talented people. In this environment, team members draw the motivation, focus, determination and personal growth required to achieve more, faster.

, '\n',

How to apply

, '\n',

If you have the drive to achieve your best every day, then our team is waiting to transform your talents.
Click "Apply" to complete an application form and upload your current resume.

, '\n',

Please Note
We prefer to deal with you directly and have not engaged an agency for this role, so if you're interested, please apply.

, '\n']

,

ABOUT THE FIRM: James & Monroe ("J&M") are one of Australia and New Zealand's leading Oracle Business Intelligence and Enterprise Performance Management specialist consulting firms. Our expertise is recognised by the designation of Oracle Platinum Partner.

Must be available to travel interstate or internationally.

title: b'Senior Business Lead : Data Analytics & Digital Transformation\r\n    '
jd:
["One of Australia's leading ASX listed Financial Services client are seeking a senior Business Lead to join their organisation during an exciting period of digital disruption.\xa0",
, ' \xa0',
, ' You will need to draw on your deep understanding of business needs/opportunities and an equally deep understanding of opportunity/limitations of data to find new ways to solve business problems. You will own and deliver data driven programs and manage stakeholders across functional teams. ',
, ' \xa0',
, ' Key Responsibilities;',
, ' ',
  • Drive change in business performance through effective data utilisation
  • Identify business opportunities that data analytics can solve
  • Prioritise projects based on commercial viability and strategic value  
  • Strengthen the customer story through data by understand business needs, Identify and then innovate novel solutions for providing deep insight
  • Identify ways that data can strengthen customer relationships and potentially open new revenue streams
  • Drive an effective culture focused on innovation, agile work practices, collaboration and development of people
  • Provide thought leadership in the area of data and analytics including challenging conventional wisdom and short-term thinking
  • Help stakeholders see benefits in standardised approaches where this enables benefits such as a "single customer view", and "single source of truth" for business intelligence
, ' Whilst this role will be driven by data, this is not a technical role and as such we are looking for Business focused leaders.',
, ' ',
For further information, please contact Laura Frazer at Ampersand on 03 9008 5105. Alternatively, forward your application to Laura directly by using the 'apply now' link below., ' ']

title: b'Senior Analyst - Portfolio Analytics\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

About Us

, ' ',

Medibank is a leading private health insurer with 40 years of experience delivering better health to Australians. We look after the health cover needs of millions of customers and deliver a wide range of programs to support health and wellbeing in the community.

, ' ',

The Opportunity

, ' ',

As a Senior Analyst part of the Portfolio Analytics team, you will be responsible for providing insights and actionable recommendations relating to portfolio profitability, growth and customer value.

, ' ',

Reporting into the Portfolio Manager, you will assist in monitoring the profitability growth trends & reason for any deviations from those expectations. You will also support the Public Health Insurance (PHI) portfolio as well as the Customer Experience Transformation Team in relation to BAU as well as special projects.

, ' ',

Key responsibilities will include:

, ' ',
  • Developing analytics capabilities to track portfolio economics & in relation to customer value;
  • Providing target analysis on likely impacts of management initiatives on product level benefit outlays; and
  • Communicating and collaborating effectively with internal and external stakeholders to gather and analyse information requirements and deliver analytics and insights to meet customer and stakeholder expectations.
, ' ',

About You

, ' ',

To be successful in this role, you will have tertiary qualifications in a mathematics, statistics or other related discipline with a strong understanding of insurance financial accounts in relation to claims. You will have experience in the use of large datasets to ensure integrity, quality, accuracy and privacy of data for analysis.

, ' ',

Other requirements include:

, ' ',
  • Minimum of four years' experience in an analytic role within the health, health insurance or other insurance field;
  • Demonstrated experience and ability to undertake data and statistical analysis using relevant tools (SAS, R, SPSS, STATA);
  • Experience in the use of Business Intelligence tools (Tableau, Microstrategy, Business Objects) and
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills including the ability to translate technical concepts to a non-technical audience.
, ' ',

What We Offer

, ' ',

In return for your hard work we offer a range of great benefits, including subsidised private health insurance, travel insurance and pet insurance. Furthermore, we take the health and wellbeing of our employees seriously, offering flexible working conditions and encouraging wellbeing at all levels of life.

, ' ',

Medibank is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application to assist you through the recruitment process.

, ' ',

A Career at Medibank adds up to more. More achievement. More progress. More passion and more innovation for health.

, ' ',

, ' ',

For a career option that will suit you better, click to apply.

, ' ',
, ' ']

title: b'Chief Information Officer\r\n    '
jd:
['\n',

Are you an excellent people manager with experience in working effectively across a business? Are you looking for a strategic role in a values-driven environment that enables you to drive change and innovation? Monash College is looking for a highly skilled and proven CIO to join us at our Melbourne CBD offices.

, '\n',

Monash College is owned by Monash University, Australia's largest international university. Our programs enable around 9,000 international students each year to access Monash University's world-leading courses and to transition to a career.

, '\n',

Over the past four years, the College has more than doubled in size. Our strong growth has shifted our technology requirements with stakeholder engagement and business understanding key to supporting strategy.

, '\n',

The CIO reports to the Chief Operating Officer and holds a key leadership role as part of the Operations Leadership Team. Managing a team of around 30 professionals across IT and Business Intelligence functions you will lead the end to end IT operations and Business Intelligence teams.

, '\n',

This is an exciting opportunity with immediate priorities to implement the IT and enterprise data strategies, whilst ensuring IT and data operations provide the best possible solutions for the College. We see the major drivers of success being:

, '\n',

  • engaging with stakeholders to identify and address strategic opportunities and efficiencies;

  • effective communications and leadership with technology and data related matters;

  • implementing and maintaining a technology service that delivers to service levels and the ICT strategy;

  • managing and developing our relationship with Monash University to deliver core IT functions;  and

  • optimising development and delivery of in-house systems and projects.

, '\n',

Who are you? You are an experienced IT leader with strong stakeholder management skills and a proven track record in:

, '\n',

  • leading the vision of the IT function to be an enabler to the business

  • implementing IT Service Management,

  • leading IT functions to the delivery of end to end IT services,

  • delivering critical IT projects and

  • establishing governance frameworks.  

, '\n',

You possess in-depth knowledge of architecture and business application delivery models, Information Management and Data Warehouse technologies.  

, '\n',

Ideally, you will also be familiar with teaching technology such as Moodle and will bring a strong understanding of technologies including:

, '\n',

  • The Microsoft stack of operational tools (AD, FIM etc) and applications tools

  • Cloud computing, including SAAS and PAAS;

  • System Development Methodologies (eg Agile, Prototyping);

  • Sharepoint development, deployment and automation

  • Business Intelligence technology and techniques;

  • networking and security knowledge; and

  • utilisation of 3rd party control libraries and APIs.

, '\n',

Why would you work with us? It's simple really. You'll work in a fast paced dynamic environment and you'll be part of building our reputation as leaders in learning and teaching. While we work hard, we support you in return and value your development. This opportunity is for a 3 year fixed term in a Melbourne CBD location, and provides access to great facilities, a performance related bonus, health and wellbeing programs and salary packaging benefits.

, '\n',

So go on. Be part of supporting our journey in learning and teaching excellence and the success of our students at university and employment.

, '\n',

Location: Melbourne CBD

, '\n',

Enquiries: This role reports to our Chief Operating Officer, Taryn Rulton, please direct any initial enquiries to Angelica Vergara, Executive Assistant on 9902 0343

, '\n',

To obtain a copy of the position description and submit your application (including a cover letter addressing the key selection criteria and resume), please visit: http://www.monashcollege.edu.au/about-us/careers-at-monash-college

, '\n',

Applications close: 12 May 2017

, '\n']

title: b'BI Modeller\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',

Our client is a Government owned organisation, looking for a BI Modeller, with at least 8 years of experience data modelling for a business intelligence & analytics platform, to perform the following duties:

, '\n',
  • Conduct presentation and front-end data modelling for a business intelligence & analytics platform based on a guiding architecture
  • Develop multidimensional/star schema/extended star schema designs, analysis designs, and report designs using BEAM (Business Event Analysis & Modelling) Kimball and methodologies and business requirements
  • Write design documentation
  • Guide BI developers in configuration and customisation of front-end BI tools 
, '\n',

What will make you a great candidate for this role:

, '\n',
  • 8 years of experience data modelling for a business intelligence & analytics platform using best practices
  • Experience with BEAM and Kimball methodologies
  • 5 years of experience modelling in a Cognos environment preferred
  • Must have operated in a Scrum/Agile environment (not just an understanding of or familiar with)
  • Patience & determination
  • Excellent communication skills

    Preferred location is Canberra where the main team is located however consideration for Melbourne or Brisbane will be available.

    Please note: only candidates who are suited to the role will be contacted.

    Our client is an equal opportunity employer

, '\n']

  • Develop ETL mappings and staging rules based on best practice technical integration rules and business rules

title: b'Insights Analyst - Credit\r\n    '
jd:
[' ',

One of Australia's leading utilities companies is looking urgently to hire multiple Analytics Specialists for their Consumer Credit team within the Customer Operations business unit.

, ' ',

In this role you will be responsible for the development and delivery of accurate, timely and informative reporting, analysis and insights for Consumer Credit stakeholders. This position requires technical skills in designing and building user friendly dashboards, and using analytics tools to visualise data and effectively convey insights. The Insights Analyst is integral in helping drive a shift to automated, Business Warehouse based reporting.

, ' ',

Responsibilities:

, ' ',
  • Providing insight and intelligence on consumer debtor segments and credit operations (based on a combination of organisational, credit, market and industry knowledge)
  • Working alongside stakeholders to define, prioritise and deliver effective analytics
  • Partner with consumer credit team, and other key stakeholders, to deliver on Consumer Credit and the organisation's strategic goals
, ' ',

Qualifications:

, ' ',
  • 1-3 years experience in Business Intelligence and data analytics
  • Strong experience in dashboard reporting and advanced data visualisation tools e.g. PowerBI, Tableau, Business Objects or equivalent
  • Data and reporting analytics tools, including building data structures and reporting tools
  • experience in a customer facing role
, ' ',

If this sounds like something that would be a fit for your background please contact Tessa Gould for a confidential conversation on 03 8629 1020.

, ' ']

title: b'IT Trainers Wanted\r\n    '
jd:
[' ',

New Horizons Learning Centres are seeking experienced IT Trainers across a variety of products and disciplines to deliver and support students to qualification students. We are driven by our mission to empower people and organisations around the world to succeed through learning. We are a multi-award winning training solutions provider and a Microsoft Gold Certified Partner for Learning Solutions (one of two in Australia!).

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

The Candidate
To be successful you must have the following;

, ' ',
  • An Engaging trainer with minimum 2 years training experience in the currency in the area of expertise.
  • Must have TAE40110/TAE40116
  • Excellent communication skills with a passion for training
  • Open to ongoing personal and professional learning & development
  • Possess excellent written and verbal communication
  • MCT Certification highly desired
  • Post Graduate Qualifications in IT, Computer Science, Telecommunications etc highly desired
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

What's in it for you? 

, ' ',
  • Professional Development and supportive team
  • Collaborative environment
  • Development and training from industry experts
  • Career progression
  • Team and autonomous working environment
, ' ',

We need Trainers that can deliver to some or most of the below topics. If you are an expert in some or all of the below topics and are keen to increase your breadth of IT Trainer capability in the below, then New Horizons can get you there!

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

MICROSOFT PACKAGES

, ' ',
  • Office 365
  • Office 365 Transition
  • Project
  • Sharepoint
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

OTHER AREAS

, ' ',
  • Cloud Computing
  • Knowledge Management Systems
  • Project Management Methodologies
  • Business Analysis and Business Intelligence
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

CODING

, ' ',
  • HTML5
  • CSS
  • Javascript
  • SQL Server
  • Java8 (with eclipse)
  • Other programming languages
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Please apply only through the Seek Portal.

, ' ']

title: b'Data Manager\r\n    '
jd:
[Austin Hospital,
, ' Permanent Full Time',
, ' ',
, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

Austin Health is the major provider of tertiary health services, health professional education and research across 3 campuses in the northeast of Melbourne and state-wide. Austin Health is world-renowned for its research and specialist work in cancer, liver transplantation, spinal cord injuries, neurology, endocrinology, mental health and rehabilitation.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

An exciting opportunity currently exists for an enthusiastic and highly experienced Data Manager and Integration Specialist to join our Business Intelligence Unit (BIU) to support and administer Austin Health's new Clinical Research Data Warehouse (CRDW). This is a new position.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

The position will reside in the Business Intelligence Unit (BIU) whom are part of the Performance and Innovation Directorate.  The BIU is responsible for reporting non-financial performance information to the Board, Executive and hospital managers. The BIU do this through the Casemix Management Information System (CMIS), an in-house developed operational data store used to analyse and report patient related activity information.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

This role has been created to provide technical support to manage and develop the CRDW and work with clinical researchers and epidemiologists to create appropriate data sets to support approved research projects. The aim of the CRDW is to establish a sophisticated data sharing and data storage platform to allow transfer of data from multiple sources and permit access of data using tools designed for research and clinical data integration.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

The position will require a skilled applicant with:

, ' ',

 

, ' ',
  • Established expertise in the use of Microsoft Business Intelligence Solutions, specifically:
    • MS SQL Server & T SQL
    • Analysis Services – Multidimensional and Tabular
    • SSIS
  • Experience using these tools to develop business intelligence solutions within medium to large organisations.
  • A sound understanding of the principles of database and data warehouse design and development.
  • Expertise and experience in the use of T-SQL to write complex queries and create stored procedures and functions.
  • Good interpersonal skills.
  • The ability to work well within a multi-disciplinary team and to work with minimal supervision when required to achieve desired project outcomes.
  • A sound understanding of information technology including clinical systems, applications relevant to the Management of rostering and risk management reporting or as required for the role and/or department (desirable)
  • Experience working in a hospital environment and/or knowledge of Victorian public hospital data (desirable).
  • Experience with Microsoft Power BI (desirable)
  • Experience working with end users to develop reporting solutions (desirable).
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

To be successful in this role you must demonstrate/Key responsibilities will include:

, ' ',

 

, ' ',
  • Support and administer the day-to-day operation of the CRDW database and work on the on-going development and enhancement of the system.
  • Provide expertise to optimise the performance of the CRDW and be responsible for the on-going monitoring of performance and the resolution of any performance problems with the CRDW.
  • Work closely with clinical researchers to assist in query design, data extraction and reporting of data from the CRDW.
  • Assist clinical researchers with integrating their own specific data for clinical research that may not be in the CRDW, via the CRDW data entry tool.
  • Where relevant build additional data marts to further enhance the CRDW.
  • Monitor the quality and integrity of data in the CRDW and associated databases.
, ' ',

Work with us! Your reward is to work in a collaborative environment which will provide you with opportunities for ongoing training and development. Your benefits will include salary packaging, and employee assistance program.

, ' ',

All appointments are made subject to a satisfactory National Police Check conducted by Austin Health and if required, a Working With Children Check.

, ' ',

Austin Health is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to attracting and retaining a diverse workforce that reflects the community we serve.  Applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders are encouraged.

, ' ',
, ' ',
, ' ', Enquiries:, ' David Debono',
, ' ', Ph:, ' (03) 9496 5517',
, ' ', Applications Close:, ' 15/05/2017',
, ' ',
, " To view the position description or submit your application please click the 'Apply Now' button below.",
, ' ']

title: b'GP Representatives - Melbourne New Roles! CBD, South East and Eastern Suburbs\r\n    '
jd:
[' ',

Our client is a Multinational Top Tier Pharmaceutical company who is currently recruiting for GP/Medical Representatives Nationally.  We are seeking a dynamic GP/Medical Representative with a strong business acumen and technical skills to join the team.

, ' ',

Key responsibilities

, ' ',

·         Accountable to own and achieve territory business objectives, including sales growth and market share objectives for assigned products.   

, ' ',

·         Persuade and influence identified targets.   

, ' ',

·         Maintain high level of product knowledge, disease state, and competitor intelligence.   ·

, ' ',

·         Analyse Business and develop territory business plan to include:   

, ' ',

·         Sales activities, promotional programs, sample allocation plan, and annual investment requirements.  

, ' ',

·         Plan and execute call routing on identified targets, achieving frequency and reach with designated milestones agreed by territory selling team.   

, ' ',

·         Work in concert with territory selling team to achieve maximum business impact with customers with allocated samples, programs, and promotional materials.   

, ' ',

·         Utilize approved promotional materials on territory, consistent with current marketing strategy.   

, ' ',

·          

, ' ',

Candidate Requirements:

, ' ',

·         Experience in territory management sales in pharmaceutical would be beneficial however not essential.

, ' ',

·         To be successful in this role you will be an energetic and resourceful self-starter with strong communication and influencing skills.

, ' ',

·         Experience in a sales or medical related field is essential.

, ' ',

·         You must be resilient, possess a can do attitude, display sales drive and be achievement oriented.

, ' ',

-         Bachelor or Science or Nursing is preferred.

, ' ',

Benefits:

, ' ',

·         Exceptional training & development

, ' ',

·         Bi-Annual Sales Conferences

, ' ',

·         Competitive remuneration with significant recognition of achievement through holidays, bonuses & other cash incentives.

, ' ',

To express your general interest please forward your CV (MS word format only) and detailed covering letter to contactus@parasandpartners.com or for a confidential discussion contact Maree Paras on 0423 789 789 or Jo Kotsopoulos on 0414 544 925

, ' ',

Kindly note, only successful candidates will be contacted.

, ' ',

Paras & Partners Executive Search and Selection are a wholly owned Australian company. Our head office is based in Melbourne and our State offices are in Sydney, Brisbane and Perth.

, ' ',

Paras & Partners Executive Search and Selection provides recruitment services in the Pharmaceutical and Healthcare Industry. Our team of industry experienced Consultants and Researchers hold an exceptional track record in delivering recruitment solutions to clients nationally and across the globe. We recruit at all levels from entry level to senior management and we currently have a number of exciting opportunities available in Sales, Marketing, Medical, Regulatory, Clinical and Training. Please check our website for full details, or register here to express interest with our team of professional recruiters.

, ' ',

 

, ' ']

title: b'Account Director | Key Account Manager - Business Information Services\r\n    '
salary: b'$130k inc super + lucrative uncapped comms plan'
jd:
['As one of the most recognized providers of business information & software services across the globe, our client has a current opportunity for a polished and accomplished Senior Account Management professional to join their high performing Key Account Management team.',
, ' ',
, ' As a Senior Sales professional for this global organisation, you role will be to manage and develop a set portfolio of National blue-chip clients and ensure they are serviced effectively, and explored for additional up-sell/cross-sell opportunities.\xa0',
, ' ',
, " Given the diverse nature of this organisation's product portfolio, you will have access to a full suite of business intelligence products and services to take to market, and will have the unwavering support of a close knit team and supportive management team.",
, ' ',
, ' Based in centrally located Melbourne offices, you will communicate with your clients through a combination of telephone, email and face to face contact - whilst enjoying all the benefits that come with representing a truly divers product suite that is essential to most modern day businesses.\xa0',
, ' ',
, ' To be successful in this role you must hold a naturally consultative approach to business and enjoy creating and maintaining open channels of communication between yourself and your clients. You will have built a solid sales career in the corporate sales and account management space, and have ideally had exposure to working with blue-chip clientele.\xa0',
, ' \xa0',
, ' ', Who we are looking for:,
, ' ',
  • Someone who can demonstrate a successful track record in a true consultative sales environment.
  • A successful track record in business-to-business sales, ideally in a business intelligence, risk, software, media or subscription based sales capacity.
  • An ability to demonstrate a high degree of competency in working with senior clientele
  • Highly autonomous and able to self manage their activity.
  • Strong customer service skills, solid work ethic and be highly self motivated and passionate.
  • Professionally presented, articulate and able to easily develop and maintain relationships with team members and customers.
, ' As this position requires a high caliber sales professional, on offer is a generous base salary of $130K inc super, in addition to lucrative uncapped commission plan.',
, ' ',
, ' To apply for this position please click the ', APPLY NOW, ' button and attach a copy of an up to date resume today.\xa0',
, ' \xa0',
, ' ',
Insight Resourcing. 
, ' ',
www.insightresourcing.com.au
, ' ',

, ' ',
"Sales, Marketing and all things Digital"
, ' ']

title: b'Directors & Senior Managers | Data Analytics & Information Management:\r\n    '
jd:
[We are currently looking for Directors and Senior Management to join a growing & Innovative Data Analytics and Information Management Consulting team. We are interested in talking to Consulting Professionals who are looking for their next big career challenge & move to an award winning global innovator. ,
, '\n',
  • You career experience will include offering enterprise solutions & strategy across one or more of the following Information Management, Business Intelligence, Data Governance, Data Analytics & Insights, Big Data Engineering & Data Science.
  • You will possess mix of high level technical and functional skills, solution design, build and transition management. Solution skills will include knowledge across, Architecture, Development, to include the evolving data engineering landscapes and eco-systems.
  • Ideally, you will have experience working within a tier one consulting environment. With a proven track record of successful assignment delivery and client relationship management.
  • A team focussed style with strong organisational and project management skills. The ability to analyse business performance is essential and offer the right outcomes for the business.
  • An ability to present solutions in a clear and articulate manner,
  • Strong interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills.
, '\n',
If you have made a positive commitment to further your career and you possess the above attributes then please apply to this role, if you require further information on this then please contact 
, '\n',
 
, '\n',
DATA TALENT on 1300 763 895 for a confidential chat.
, '\n',

Data Talent is exclusively focused on Data Analytics, Insights & Big Data Recruitment across Australia. We are committed to your personal and professional career development.Please view www.datatalent.com.au/  for all our current opportunities 
, '\n',
