title: b'Chief Information Officer\r\n    '
jd:
['\n',

Are you an excellent people manager with experience in working effectively across a business? Are you looking for a strategic role in a values-driven environment that enables you to drive change and innovation? Monash College is looking for a highly skilled and proven CIO to join us at our Melbourne CBD offices.

, '\n',

Monash College is owned by Monash University, Australia's largest international university. Our programs enable around 9,000 international students each year to access Monash University's world-leading courses and to transition to a career.

, '\n',

Over the past four years, the College has more than doubled in size. Our strong growth has shifted our technology requirements with stakeholder engagement and business understanding key to supporting strategy.

, '\n',

The CIO reports to the Chief Operating Officer and holds a key leadership role as part of the Operations Leadership Team. Managing a team of around 30 professionals across IT and Business Intelligence functions you will lead the end to end IT operations and Business Intelligence teams.

, '\n',

This is an exciting opportunity with immediate priorities to implement the IT and enterprise data strategies, whilst ensuring IT and data operations provide the best possible solutions for the College. We see the major drivers of success being:

, '\n',

  • engaging with stakeholders to identify and address strategic opportunities and efficiencies;

  • effective communications and leadership with technology and data related matters;

  • implementing and maintaining a technology service that delivers to service levels and the ICT strategy;

  • managing and developing our relationship with Monash University to deliver core IT functions;  and

  • optimising development and delivery of in-house systems and projects.

, '\n',

Who are you? You are an experienced IT leader with strong stakeholder management skills and a proven track record in:

, '\n',

  • leading the vision of the IT function to be an enabler to the business

  • implementing IT Service Management,

  • leading IT functions to the delivery of end to end IT services,

  • delivering critical IT projects and

  • establishing governance frameworks.  

, '\n',

You possess in-depth knowledge of architecture and business application delivery models, Information Management and Data Warehouse technologies.  

, '\n',

Ideally, you will also be familiar with teaching technology such as Moodle and will bring a strong understanding of technologies including:

, '\n',

  • The Microsoft stack of operational tools (AD, FIM etc) and applications tools

  • Cloud computing, including SAAS and PAAS;

  • System Development Methodologies (eg Agile, Prototyping);

  • Sharepoint development, deployment and automation

  • Business Intelligence technology and techniques;

  • networking and security knowledge; and

  • utilisation of 3rd party control libraries and APIs.

, '\n',

Why would you work with us? It's simple really. You'll work in a fast paced dynamic environment and you'll be part of building our reputation as leaders in learning and teaching. While we work hard, we support you in return and value your development. This opportunity is for a 3 year fixed term in a Melbourne CBD location, and provides access to great facilities, a performance related bonus, health and wellbeing programs and salary packaging benefits.

, '\n',

So go on. Be part of supporting our journey in learning and teaching excellence and the success of our students at university and employment.

, '\n',

Location: Melbourne CBD

, '\n',

Enquiries: This role reports to our Chief Operating Officer, Taryn Rulton, please direct any initial enquiries to Angelica Vergara, Executive Assistant on 9902 0343

, '\n',

To obtain a copy of the position description and submit your application (including a cover letter addressing the key selection criteria and resume), please visit: http://www.monashcollege.edu.au/about-us/careers-at-monash-college

, '\n',

Applications close: 12 May 2017

, '\n']

title: b'\r\n          Executive Assistant & Marketing Support (Eastern Suburbs - Camberwell)\r\n        '
jd:
[' ',

The Role

, ' ',

Based in our office in Camberwell, this position is responsible for the provision of prompt, efficient and confidential administrative support to the Head of Sales, Australia and New Zealand as well as supporting marketing-related activities and projects.

, ' ',

You will be responsible for:

, ' ',
  • Provide timely, effective diary management by prioritising and organising meetings with internal and external stakeholders in consultation with the Head of Sales, Australia and New Zealand
  • Liaison with personnel from across the company on behalf of the Head of Sales, Australia and New Zealand
  • Provide administrative support, clerical support services and marketing-related initiatives and projects.  This includes records management, development of presentations  in an accurate and timely manner
  • Document and distribute minutes for various meetings and committees in-line with organisational expectations and requirements
  • Coordinate meetings, events and greeting visitors to the office and arrange travels as requested in an accurate and timely manner
  • Liaising with the building manager and contractors on building maintenance
  • Monitor and manage tasks delegated by the Head of Sales, Australia and New Zealand and provide feedback as to their progress in a timely manner
  • Deal with high level, urgent and confidential issues, maintaining the highest level of confidently at all times
  • Work with the Business Development Managers on materials and collaterals that support business development and sales activities
  • Establish effective working relationships to ensure a high standard of customer service with internal and external stakeholders is achieved.
, ' ',

To be Successful in applying for this role, you will have:

, ' ',
  • Qualifications / Certificates in Administration
  • Certificate IV in Business Administration 
  • 4 - 5 years Executive Assistant or equivalent experience
  • High level of written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong communication and influencing skills
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office, Word, Excel and PowerPoint
  • Ability to work independently and autonomously
  • High level of organisation / structure in their approach
, ' ',

What's in it for you?

, ' ',
  • Competitive Salary
  • Diverse and supportive culture
  • Car park roster
  • Volunteering opportunities
, ' ',

About Us: 

, ' ',

The Warranty Group Asia Pacific is a business intelligence group delivering convenience and brand loyalty. We deliver brand-adjusted customer experience based on data analytics, warranty and loyalty solutions, extended service contracts, compliant warranty programs and unparalleled customer service around the world. With more than 50 years industry expertise, we are trusted by over 100 million consumers worldwide and we handle more than 16.6 million unique policies across the automotive, appliance and technology, home and financial service industries.

, ' ',

To Apply:

, ' ',

Click on "Apply for this job". A full cover letter is required with all applications, detailing your suitability for the role, including indicative remuneration expectations. Only applications with full cover letters will be reviewed.

, ' ',

Suitable applicants will also be required to undertake a Police Check. Only successful candidates will be contacted.

, ' ',

For further information about The Warranty Group, please visit our website: http://www.thewarrantygroup.com.au/ or https://www.linkedin.com/company/the-warranty-group---asia-pacific?trk=biz-companies-cym

, ' ',

 

, ' ']

title: b'Jnr - Mid Relationship Manager (Account Manager) Market Intelligence Global Firm\r\n      '
salary: b'Great Base & Uncapped Bonuses. (No Cold Calling!)'
jd:
[' ',
Are you after a dream opportunity to be given a $1 million portfolio of premium accounts, with a reputable international business, guaranteeing great earning potential?

Want your new company to have a great welcoming work culture, excellent training world-class designed training, work from home allowances, and a prime CBD office location?  This is it! 
, ' ',
, ' ',
Position: 
, ' ',
As an Relationship Manager (Account Manager), you will be responsible for building relationships within your targeted $1 million portfolio to retain and up-sell/cross-sell your clients. Relationship Managers will strategically map out your accounts, and understand a practised sales process, as well as participate in induction and ongoing training to learn different sales techniques and your product portfolio. 
, ' ',
 
, ' ',
Company:
, ' ',
This organisation is a market intelligence consultancy known as best in the market for their data and market research offered through a platform-as-a-service that provides business intelligence. 
, ' ',

, ' ',
With a reputation honoured by major universities, government, top enterprises, as well as SMBs, this firm has doubled in size over the last year, providing intel that enables businesses to be more productive, efficient and successful. 
, ' ',
, ' ', Responsibilities: ,
, ' ',
  • Account Management of key corporate accounts ($1 million portfolio)
  • Build relationships, uphold systematic sales forecasts and manage pipeline
  • Occasional APAC travel as required to visit clients
, ' ', Requirements:,
, ' ',
  • 1 - 3 years' B2B account management or sales experience
  • An understanding of business intelligence, data, market research, or economics is preferable, but not necessary if you are a fast learner
, ' \xa0', The Perks: ,
, ' ',
  • International, well-established & reputable firm
  • Account Management role - no cold calling required
  • Awesome office location in the CBD
  • Casual Fridays & afternoon boardroom drinks, great team culture
  • Daily sales training to ensure your success
  • Great earning potential (excellent bonus structure, uncapped)
, ' ',
If you are interested in this opportunity, please reply to Clark Hawke with your resume in Microsoft Word format in response to this ad by clicking Apply below. 
, ' ',
, ' ', Clark Hawke
, 'Northbridge IT Recruitment',
, ' 9-13 Young Street\xa0Sydney',
, ' Mobile: ', 0426 797 606
, 'Landline\xa002-9037 4050',
, ' ', chawke@nbridgeit.com , ' ']

title: b'Manager, eFulfilment Service Delivery\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

Linfox is Australia's largest privately owned logistics company, rapidly expanding throughout Asia and New Zealand. We employ more than 23,000 people in 11 countries. At Linfox, the safety of our people, customers and the communities in which we operate is our number one priority. Linfox IT are embarking on a transformation phase with a new structure to expand our IT capability, reduce costs and improve our service to the business with modern technologies.

, '\n',

The Linfox IT team is currently recruiting for a Manager, eFulfilment Service Delivery to be based at the Linfox Global head office in Essendon Fields or in NSW at our Erskine Park state head office. Reporting to the Group Manager, Warehouse Solutions, the primary objective of the Manager, eFulfilment Service Delivery is to manage and support the implementation of new and existing eFulfilment solutions that support Linfox operations and deliver the platforms required to drive Linfox's 2020 Strategy. Applications and services under this portfolio include those used to deliver business capability in the eFulfilment domain; such as Warehouse and Transport Management Systems, e-Commerce systems, Business Intelligence Systems, Financial Systems and various other applications or service used to complement the eFulfilment end-to-end business process.

, '\n',

In this role, you will spearhead support and implementation of eFulfilment Solutions via internal resources and vendor-provided solutions nationally, aligning to frameworks, roadmaps and Linfox IT Architectural Standards. You will oversee activities including release management, BAU Support and build/test phases. Chairing service review meetings covering service performance, service improvements, service quality and processes to drive solid business outcomes will also form part of your role.

, '\n',

In addition to a proven track record in a management capacity in a multi-disciplined IT environment, you will have:

, '\n',

  • Proven ability to lead major change initiatives across the business and in the IT function

  • Solid understanding of the business operations and back office processes.

  • Strong leadership and interpersonal skills, ability to develop credibility with staff, clients, and senior leaders.

  • Sound knowledge of operational support best practices and the associated metrics that drive operational effectiveness and efficiencies including compliance requirements

  • An understanding of the impact of emerging technologies and legislative changes to organisations and individuals and risks associated with such technologies.

  • Experience delivering IT services in a complex and fast paced environment

  • Experience of waterfall (e.g. Prince II) and agile methodologies.

, '\n',

You will be required to meet Linfox's employment criteria which will include a current Criminal History Check and full medical with a drug and alcohol test.

, '\n',

Linfox encourages applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders.

, '\n',

Come and be part of Linfox!

, '\n']

Reporting to the Group Manager, Warehouse Solutions, the primary objective of the Manager, eFulfilment Service Delivery is to manage and support the implementation of new and existing eFulfilment solutions that support Linfox operations and deliver the platforms required to drive Linfox's 2020 Strategy. Applications and services under this portfolio include those used to deliver business capability in the eFulfilment domain; such as Warehouse and Transport Management Systems, e-Commerce systems, Business Intelligence Systems, Financial Systems and various other applications or service used to complement the eFulfilment end-to-end business process.

, '\n',

In this role, you will spearhead support and implementation of eFulfilment Solutions via internal resources and vendor-provided solutions nationally, aligning to frameworks, roadmaps and Linfox IT Architectural Standards. You will oversee activities including release management, BAU Support and build/test phases. Chairing service review meetings covering service performance, service improvements, service quality and processes to drive solid business outcomes will also form part of your role.

, '\n',

In addition to a proven track record in a management capacity in a multi-disciplined IT environment, you will have:

, '\n',

  • Proven ability to lead major change initiatives across the business and in the IT function

  • Solid understanding of the business operations and back office processes.

  • Strong leadership and interpersonal skills, ability to develop credibility with staff, clients, and senior leaders.

  • Sound knowledge of operational support best practices and the associated metrics that drive operational effectiveness and efficiencies including compliance requirements

  • An understanding of the impact of emerging technologies and legislative changes to organisations and individuals and risks associated with such technologies.

  • Experience delivering IT services in a complex and fast paced environment

  • Experience of waterfall (e.g. Prince II) and agile methodologies.

, '\n',

You will be required to meet Linfox's employment criteria which will include a current Criminal History Check and full medical with a drug and alcohol test.

, '\n',

Linfox encourages applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders.

, '\n',

Come and be part of Linfox!

, '\n']

title: b'Data Insights Consultant\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

About the Role

, ' ',

We are seeking a Data Insights Consultant who has a passion and flare for unleashing the power of data and crafting solutions to meet customer needs.

, ' ',

Understanding and optimizing databases and data visualization, designing and developing solutions, and delivering with high quality solutions.

, ' ',

, ' ',

Key responsibilities:

, ' ',

, ' ',
  • Work with customers to identify business requirements
  • Craft both high-level and detailed design documents and implement innovative solutions using the most recent technologies
  • Optimize customer's current data solutions and infrastructure
  • Continually learn and grow professionally
  • Take a leadership role on projects
  • Mentor other consultants to share your knowledge and experience
, ' ',

, ' ',

Successful Applicant:

, ' ',

, ' ',

To be successful in securing this role and performing in this role, we are looking for a strong background as a Data Insights Consultant. In particular we are looking for:

, ' ',

, ' ',
  • Deep technical or architectural knowledge of at least 2 of the following areas:
  • Database administration (preferably with SQL, including Azure SQL) - performance tuning, trouble-shooting, high availability / disaster recovery, security
  • Database development (preferably with SQL, including Azure SQL) - designing and building database solutions (tables / stored procedures / forms / queries / etc.)
  • Business intelligence - combining knowledge of SSIS/SSAS/SSRS/Power BI technologies with a deep understanding of data structure / data models to design, develop, and tune BI solutions and reports
  • Advanced data analytics - designing and building solutions using technologies such as Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake, HD Insights, SQL DWH, stream analytics, machine learning, R server.
  • Sc./B.A. or equivalent work experience combined with a relevant industry experience in a consulting role
  • Ability to communicate with a variety of different audiences and strong presentation skills
  • Demonstrated ability to match technical solutions with customer business requirements
  • Ability to lead and motivate technical communities
  • Ability to quickly grasp customers' business challenges and drive positive change.
, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

To be considered for this role please submit your CV to Aurec by clicking the APPLY FOR THIS JOB button.

*Only successful applicants will be contacted*

, ' ']

title: b'Tableau Developer\r\n      '

jd:

title: b'Consulting- CFO Data - Senior Consultant\r\n      '
jd:
[
, '\n',

About the Role

, '\n',

With the convergence of traditional BI/DW, Big Data and Advanced Analytics, and the rise of in-memory computing, advanced visualisations and data discovery tools, our business is growing rapidly and to meet this demand, Deloitte’s Analytics and Information Management practice is seeking talented people with demonstrated experience, from strategy to execution across Business Intelligence, Analytics and Big Data domains.

This is an opportunity to use emerging technologies to help our clients maximise the value of their data by generating actionable insights that provide real business outcomes. You will be part of a collaborative team that provides our clients with solutions that are practical as well as visionary and have an impact from the back office to the boardroom.

Key Responsibilities

, '\n',
  • Demonstrated experience across a broad range of industries
  • Ability to link industry specific business requirements to BI, Analytics and Big Data solutions
  • Ability to recommend BI/DW/Analytics processes, governance, organisational and platform models, tool selections, and data integration options to clients
  • Project experience through all phases of the project lifecycle from strategy and advisory, scoping and planning, requirements gathering, design, development, testing and deployment
, '\n',

About You
You’ll bring experience in one or more of the following competencies and enabling technologies:

, '\n',
  • Designing and implementing data structures to support Big Data, Analytical models and traditional BI/DW reporting solutions using technologies such as Microsoft SQL, Oracle, SAP, Cloudera, IBM Watsons, MuleSoft, Qlik Technologies or Informatica
  • Designing and developing data integration using Data Governance, Data Quality, MDM and Metadata management
  • Applying analytical models to predict business outcomes with tools such as SAS and R (advantageous but not mandatory)
, '\n',

About Us
We pride ourselves on our team of diverse, high performing professionals who are driven yet highly inclusive and social - our people are at the heart of our success. Our aim is to ensure that all our people feel comfortable to bring their whole selves to work, and as a result, create a workplace that encourages the true spirit of 'And different'.

Next Steps
If you have questions regarding this role, the Talent Acquisition Team is available to have a confidential discussion. Please contact Emily McBain via the Our Recruiters section on our careers website.

, '\n']

title: b'Analytics Lead- ERP Transformation\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

, ' ',

About the Role

, ' ',

, ' ',

The IT Analytics Lead will focus on leading the analytics and reporting solution, supporting the business transformation across the entire Programme. The role will define the analytics and reporting requirements across the program, and will set the reporting strategy across the works management, asset management, supply chain and procurement management, finance, P&C and Payroll streams. The ERP Analytics IT Lead will supervise the successful implementation of our S/4 Hana and Workday ERP and delivery of the end state reporting solution, assisting in the transition of reporting to the IT Operations Support Team.

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

The role will work closely with the Analytics Business Lead, Data Migration and Data Management stream leads to develop reporting architecture and solutions for the ERP transformation, and ensure alignment with data and analytics strategies across the AGL Group.

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

Key Responsibilities

, ' ',

, ' ',

  • Responsible for the overall analytics and reporting strategy across the ERP Programme.

  • Identify the existing reports that are required to be migrated and design the migration strategy and solutions

  • Work with ERP Analytics SMEs to understand reporting requirements and provide recommendations on the reporting architecture and solutions for the ERP landscape.

  • Work with the Data Migration lead and ERP Data Architect to understand data modelling across the various solutions and the required data mapping.

  • Design solutions that leverage AGL's data analytical platforms and are consistent with AGL's data visualisation principles and strategic toolsets

  • Oversee the data modelling, report build and deployment and the transition into BAU support.

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

About You

, ' ',

, ' ',

  • Experience with integrating ERP with Data Analytical Platforms.

  • Experience in building and leading multi-skilled teams with embedded third-party vendor resources

  • Good understanding of S/4HANA reporting capabilities and experience in design and implementing BI/reporting solutions for ERP.

  • Familiarity with the capabilities and applications of a range of reporting and analytical tools including but not limited to SAP Business Objects, Mobile Business Intelligence, Tableau

  • Communication and presentation skills to present options and recommendations.

  • Experience with Cloud technologies including IaaS, PaaS and SaaS.

  • Experience working in both waterfall and agile delivery environment for large organisations

  • SAP S/4HANA analytics experience is desirable

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',


, ' ',

What's in it for you?

, ' ',

, ' ',

You'll be working in an A-grade building with state of the art activity based working facilities. Being supported by our new flexible ways of working. We call it Smarter Working.

, ' ',

, ' ',

You'll get the opportunity to work with some of the most engaged and innovative in the business. Being exposed to more opportunities to advance your skills and career.

, ' ',

, ' ',

Working in a company the size of ours the sky's the limit for your career aspirations and we're focused on investing in you.

, ' ',

, ' ',


, ' ',

About us

, ' ',

, ' ',

It truly is an exciting time to be part of AGL Energy as we lead the way in generating sustainable energy solutions for all Australians. With a heritage of over 175 years and listed in the top 50 companies on the ASX, AGL offers a genuinely diverse, safe and supportive work environment, where "actions not words" fosters a culture of achievement and personal development.

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

How to Apply

, ' ',

, ' ',

Come with us on a journey of exploration and creativity, doing the same things differently, better, faster by encompassing innovation and passion for a more sustainable world.

, ' ',

, ' ',


Apply now to the AGL Careers team via the online application link. For a confidential discussion, please call Liz Boast on 03 9206 8967 or Esther Baek on 03 9206 8952

, ' ',

, ' ']

title: b'\r\n          Synergetic Management System Developer/Consultant\r\n        '

[' ',

Our consultancy has an opportunity for a highly skilled, qualified and experienced Synergetic Systems Specialist/Developer to add to our team in a full-time capacity.

, ' ',

Working under the guidance of a seasoned Synergetic Consultant and Systems Architect, you will utilise your technical and communication skills to plan, coordinate and design creative development and integration solutions to support our Education clients with their academic processes in Synergetic.

, ' ',
, ' ', Key Activities (Some of the below):,
, ' ',
, ' ',

  • REST API Development and building thorough REST based APIs
  • Very strong knowledge of HTML and CSS (advantageous to have HTML5 and CSS3)
  • Report to the Senior Manager of Data Technology, you will be integrating systems and third parties via the API ecosystem
  • Migration of Data Science algorithms into production
  • Introduce your own thoughts and proven technique of innovative data-driven technology

title: b'Data Insights Consultant | Microsoft Australia\r\n      '
jd:
[Are you ready to seize an opportunity to drive leading edge technology solutions with the customer? Do you value deploying  and working on the latest solutions with real world impact? Do you thrive by mentoring and leading by example? Would you love to help us accelerate the transformation towards data-driven organizations? Do you want to join an elite and distinguished team?
, '\xa0',
, ' If so, the ', Data Insights Consultant , 'position in the Microsoft Services Organization is for you!',
, ' \xa0',
, ' At Microsoft, we share knowledge, experiences, and resources to help each other achieve our career goals and grow both professionally and personally. We seek out people from diverse backgrounds who exhibit passion, technical competence, and experience in services delivery with complex projects or environments. Experience in this role will provide great opportunities to interact with break-through technologies, collaborate with product development teams and improve future versions of Microsoft products as a subject matter expert. Together, we can help billions of people around the globe using digital technology to achieve amazing things.',
, ' \xa0',
, " Our Consultants work with the latest technologies to design, build and optimize data-centric solutions and help our customers unlock the value of their data. We apply our broad and deep technology combined with a strong industry knowledge. As part of our team, you will deliver solutions to customers around the world. You will play a key role in allowing out clients to maximize their investment in Microsoft technology and introduce them to emerging technologies and solutions - to grow and optimize their business. To be successful, you will take advantage of our community of consultants, through sharing solutions and utilizing your early access to technology.\xa0 You'll be part of something bigger, through unleashing the power of data and crafting solutions to meet customer needs. You will provide technical leadership for other consultant teams and engage in the complete lifecycle of large data-driven projects. Your key to success is your passion for customers, demonstrated through professionalism and striving for excellence in all aspects of the customer experience: understanding and optimizing databases and data visualization, designing and developing solutions, and delivering with high quality on challenging engagements. ",
, ' \xa0',
, ' As a Data Insights Consultant, you will:\xa0',
, ' ',
  • Be part of a thriving practice that's constantly looking for ways to improve our customers' experience
  • Work with customers to identify business requirements
  • Craft both high-level and detailed design documents and implement innovative solutions using the most recent technologies
  • Optimize customer's current data solutions and infrastructure
  • Continually learn and grow professionally
  • Take a leadership role on projects
  • Mentor other consultants to share your knowledge and experience
, ' \xa0',
, ' ', Recommended Qualifications and Experience:,
, ' ',
  • Deep technical or architectural knowledge of at least 2 of the following areas:
    • Database administration (preferably with SQL, including Azure SQL) - performance tuning, trouble-shooting, high availability / disaster recovery, security
    • Database development (preferably with SQL, including Azure SQL) - designing and building database solutions (tables / stored procedures / forms / queries / etc.) 
    • Business intelligence - combining knowledge of SSIS/SSAS/SSRS/Power BI technologies with a deep understanding of data structure / data models to design, develop, and tune BI solutions and reports
    • Advanced data analytics - designing and building solutions using technologies such as Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake, HD Insights, SQL DWH, stream analytics, machine learning, R server.
  • B.Sc./B.A. or equivalent work experience combined with a relevant industry experience in a consulting role
  • Ability to travel domestically and internationally and work with different cultures and customers
  • Ability to communicate with a variety of different audiences and strong presentation skills
  • Demonstrated ability to match technical solutions with customer business requirements
  • Ability to lead and motivate technical communities
  • Ability to effectively recognize and adapt to change
  • Ability to quickly grasp customers' business challenges and drive positive change.
, ' ',
, ' ', This role is hired as a 12 month contract. We can offer a flexible working day based in our award winning offices, using state of the art activity based working facilities., ' ']

To be eligble to apply for this role, you must hold full working rights and be in Australia now.

['\n',


, '\n',
 
,
Tm1 EPM Consultant
, '\n',
  • Newly created growth orientated TM1 consulting roles
  • Great people - Strong Brand- Challenging Work
  • Visa Sponsorship Available
, '\n',

The Business

This privately held consulting business has spent the last decade developing innovative Data Driven solutions for clients across Australia & Asia.

They offer Data Management, EPM, BI, Advanced analytics and Data Visualisation solutions, and employ a range of talented people. 

Whilst their team all have different skills, they all share a touch of geekiness and love playing with and understanding new technology, as well as a passion for outstanding customer delivery.

The Job 

The Tm1  team are looking to add 2 consultants with preferably 3 years' experience or more, but lesser experienced candidates are encouraged to meet our team.

 

Since these are preferably Senior Consultant appointments, candidates will need a demonstrable aptitude for business intelligence solutions and be responsible for the analysis, design, development and delivery of solutions that meet and exceed client expectations.

This is a genuine opportunity to be part of a team that willingly shares ideas and skills in order to increase learnings and deliver outstanding results.  Most of your work will be undertaken from client premises. 

Key responsibilities will be:

  • Analysis and evaluation of business requirements through a structured and methodical approach using a combination of Waterfall and Agile Methodologies
  • Interpretation of technical and business requirements to design the business intelligence solution.
  • Implementation of the solution
  • Communicate with stakeholders, business and technical project teams, infrastructure and operational support to ensure the role and responsibilities of the solution delivery and support are understood.
  • Alignment of the solution with tactical and strategic values and plans within the client organisation.

 

As the successful applicant you will come with:

  • Proven experience and track record in the design and development of solutions using IBM Cognos TM1
  • Background in financial roles within the corporate sector is desirable but not essential
  • A keen interest in learning about our clients' businesses and developing an understanding of their objectives
  • A genuine talent for grasping complex business problems and engineering effective solutions
  • Good communication skills

 This position is for an experienced Tm1er, with good people skills. All candidates will undertake a complex technical test as part of the hiring process.

Overseas Candidates with Experience working in USA/CANADA/UK as well as candidates with 457 visa, who require their visa to be transferred are welcome to apply.


 

 

 

, '\n',
 
,
Josh Geller

title: b'IT Solution Architect (12 Month Contract)\r\n    '
jd:
['\n',

Insurance at AIG is all about assessing risk—and making difficult promises and keeping them. Since risk is all around us, insurance is everywhere too. We deliver on our promise by helping our clients plan for the future, recover from loss, and retire with confidence.

, '\n',

At AIG we are firmly committed to balancing your professional development and your career aspirations. We provide the freedom, resources, and support to help map your career path across our network of approximately 60,000 people in more than 100 countries and jurisdictions.

, '\n',


The Role:

, '\n',

This is a 12 month contract opportunity

, '\n',

As the Solution Architect you will be responsible for the successful delivery of the solution architecture design, ensuring that it is delivered on time and to a high level of quality, liaising closely with in-country and regional business stakeholders, project teams, delivery partners, service providers. The position reports directly into the Head of Architecture, Australasia of AIG Australia.

, '\n',

Responsibilities:

, '\n',

• Direct and control application, data, integration and infrastructure architecture activities and outcomes while maintaining design integrity and ensuring adherence to established principles and processes.
• Orchestrate architecture alignment between external / internal service providers and teams to ensure that the software design meets defined architectural goals and quality standards.
• Assist in defining the solution architecture road map and ensuring its alignment to business requirements and strategy.
• Identify, manage and resolve/mitigate all technical and architecture-related risks, issues and dependencies.
• Continually engage in and ensure stakeholder buy-in and support.
• Define and manage the creation and delivery of non-functional and technical specifications, ensuring adherence to corporate delivery and governance frameworks.

The ideal candidate will have:

, '\n',

• IT experience, specifically in system analysis, design, development and implementation.
• Experience in developing application architecture and standards.
• Experience in the insurance / financial services industry is essential.
• Proven exposure to core general insurance, financial and business intelligence systems and integration.

Knowledge and Skills:

• Formal qualifications majoring in Systems Information, Information Technology or Computer Engineering
• IT Architecture qualifications are definite advantages
• Exceptional relationship management, thought leadership and work prioritization skills
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills
• Sound business/solution analysis and design skills
• Able to work collaboratively with a broad range of constituencies and diverse groups, delivering under minimal supervision
• Broad knowledge of IT application development and service management practices, designs, methodologies, tools, and processes

, '\n',


Explore Your Potential!

This role will allow you to be in a dynamic environment, affording you an opportunity to drive and pioneer expansion within this core customer segment for AIG. Our readiness to change and adapt to the shifting dynamic of our marketplace means there are now new opportunities for people who are passionate, accountable, proactive and respectful to develop a range of innovative insurance projects and products. We strive to help our employees’ development and we actively promote these values through training and management.

, '\n',

About AIG

American International Group, Inc. (AIG) is a leading international insurance organization serving customers in more than 130 countries and jurisdictions. AIG companies serve commercial, institutional, and individual customers through one of the most extensive worldwide property-casualty networks of any insurer. In addition, AIG companies are leading providers of life insurance and retirement services in the United States.

AIG Property Casualty is a global market leader, one of the few truly global property casualty franchises.
AIG Life and Retirement is one of the largest life insurance organizations in the U.S., and provides protection, investment and income solutions needed for financial and retirement security.
United Guaranty Corporation is the marketplace leader in mortgage insurance in the U.S.

Additional information about AIG can be found at www.aig.com | YouTube: www.youtube.com/aig | Twitter: @AIG_LatestNews | LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/company/aig

, '\n']

title: b'Senior Tableau Consultant / Architect\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

An opportunity that you’re really excited by

Imagine spending your days working with an experienced, collaborative team; where your contribution is vital.

RXP Services (ASX: RXP) have developed a strong partnership with Tableau as a ‘Gold Partner’ and due to significant growth across a variety of our client environments who are now adopting Tableau as the way forward, we are seeking an experienced, Senior Tableau Consultant/Architect to lead our Tableau Capability within our Insight Practice in Melbourne.  Be empowered to take ownership of interpreting, developing and driving robust business outcomes and incredibly high value Business Intelligence solutions for a variety of our clients.

 

A position suited to your skills and experience

You take pride in your experience, knowing that you can leverage your skills and knowledge to contribute to solving our client's challenges utilising your strong BI background and Tableau capability.

 

Your previous experience must include:

  • Design & development capability with Tableau Analytical Frameworks & Dashboards
  • Working knowledge and / or experience with Alteryx
  • Solution Architecture Design & Development
  • The ability to quickly analyse, understand and interpret business and IT requirements
  • Ability to see the bigger picture with focus on tangible, business outcome based results that add value
  • Extensive engagement and liaison with key stakeholders with the ability to communicate clearly and effectively
  • Experience working within an Agile environment 

The right individual for this opportunity wakes up energised to:

  • Lead small to large scale and often complex Tableau / Alteryx projects
  • Manage and lead technical resources and technical output as required
  • Be hands on and lead by example
  • Engage with clients and provide solutions to business problems
  • Be part of a growing BI Practice

A workplace culture that encourages your growth and celebrates diversity

As an RXP employee, you will develop your skills on a daily basis. You'll receive industry recognised training opportunities to assist your professional and personal growth. Our aim is to mentor you through learning the latest methodologies and up skill your technical know-how and business acumen to ensure your continued success. 

 

You will be part of a much larger team and immersed in a unique culture that takes pride in exceeding customer expectations and delivering excellence. You will work on shaping digital and technology solutions for well-known brands.  Join RXP and be part of a society that values creative thinking and fosters industry leaders who strive to be the best version of themselves.

 

About Us

RXP Services (ASX: RXP) combine energy, creativity & technology to make a real and positive difference.  We deliver award-winning services and solutions to Australia’s leading brands. We continue our rapid growth journey and now employ over 780 people across our Australian and Hong Kong offices. Learn more about us: www.rxpservices.com

, '\n']

jd:
['\n',

Experienced manager required to lead a team of GIS/ spatial experts

Your new company
My client is seeking an experienced GIS to lead a small team of technical experts and drive effective use of spatial data and spatial information systems to support effective decision making. Based in the companies Head Quarters in Inner East Melbourne this role will be on a permanent basis.

Your new role
Reporting through to the Director of corporate strategy you will be responsible for the following core activities:

, '\n',
  • Lead the development and production of high quality spatial data analysis processes and spatial information products
  • Lead the maintenance of spatial data sets including robust quality assurance processes
  • Support sector initiatives and projects that require spatial data and GIS integration
  • Ensure the organisation develops and has access to state of the art spatial data and GIS capability
  • Manage crucial interdependencies with the organisations Business Intelligence domain to support effective decision making
  • Manage, lead and develop a team of spatial analysts
, '\n',



What you'll need to succeed

, '\n',
  • Experience in leading technical teams

Are you passionate about Business and Systems Analysis and Design? Do you enjoy working with the business on ICT projects? Are you seeking a varied role where you can learn from the best?

, ' ',

As our Project Support Analyst, you will support the consistent development of business requirements, acting as a conduit between the business and technology providers and providing support to the business on key initiatives and projects.

, ' ',

We are looking for a self-starter with strong self-management skills. This role requires flexibility, multitasking and a strong team ethic.

, ' ',

Desired skills and experience

, ' ',
  • Bachelor degree in IT or Business IT Systems or equivalent IT qualifications
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
  • Knowledge of Project Management methodologies.
  • Demonstrated ability to multi-task and manage conflicting priorities
  • Well-developed verbal and written communication and presentation skills
, ' ',

About us

, ' ',

Monash College is the preferred pathway to Monash University for international students. For over 20 years we have been leaders in our field, preparing the next generation of global professionals to succeed at university and in their careers.

, ' ',

Our functions comprise business intelligence, finance, risk management, information technology, student administration and student services.

, ' ',

We provide services that meet student's need and enable us to innovate. Our systems support growth and provide a thorough understanding of results to inform decision-making and business development.

, ' ',

This position is open to people with valid working rights in Australia.

, ' ',

Apply online: submit your application on our careers site. Visit monashcollege.edu.au/careers

, ' ',

Applications close: midnight Friday 5 May 2017

, ' ',

Salary: $76,555 to 88,039 plus 9.5% superannuation, dependent upon skills and experience

, ' ',

Location: Collins Street, Melbourne CBD

, ' ',

Enquiries: Siew Ying Cheong, Acting Project Manager, ICT on 9905 8664 or Libby Harris, HR Adviser on 9903 4397

, ' ',

Strictly no agencies please

, ' ']

title: b'\r\n          HR SPECIALIST, ASIA PACIFIC\r\n        '
jd:
[' ',

About the role: 

, ' ',

Reporting to the HR Director, APAC for the duration of the 10 month Maternity Leave contract, the main responsibilities of this position is to drive and support the key HR processes & projects across the Asia Pacific region. This includes developing and facilitating training, monitoring completion of initiatives and tasks and conducting regular reviews to ensure the HR processes and initiatives are completed accurately and on time.

, ' ',

Responsibilities: 

, ' ',
  • Drive and manage the Performance Review process across the region (both mid-year and year end). This includes developing & facilitating training, conducting calibration discussions and monitoring completion progress to ensure all key deadlines are achieved.
, ' ',
  • Drive and manage the Annual Commitment Setting process. This includes developing & facilitating training and monitoring completion progress to ensure all key deadlines are achieved. Periodically conduct audits to ensure Commitments meet company criteria.
, ' ',
  • Drive and manage the Annual Compensation Review processes. This includes developing & facilitating training and monitoring completion progress to ensure all key deadlines are achieved.
, ' ',
  • Facilitate job analysis processes for newly created or modified positions and draft Position Descriptions as required.
, ' ',
  • Assist the HR department and leadership team in driving change management initiatives across the region that support the growth of the business.
, ' ',
  • Assist in developing succession plans for key talent identified through the Succession Planning process. Utilise internal / external resources to develop performance and address skill gaps across the region.
, ' ',
  • Monitor the onboarding & off-boarding processes to ensure successful completion.
, ' ',
  • Guide and support managers in their understanding and application of HR issues, while keeping abreast of industry developments. Provide sound advice and guidance to staff and management on HR processes and procedural requirements.
, ' ',
  • Utilising the HRIS platforms, effectively manage data and reporting requirements to ensure all projects and processes are completed accurately and on time.
  • Assist with the implementation of adhoc projects as required.
, ' ',

About Us: 

, ' ',

The Warranty Group Asia Pacific is a business intelligence group delivering convenience and brand loyalty. We deliver brand-adjusted customer experience based on data analytics, warranty and loyalty solutions, extended service contracts, compliant warranty programs and unparalleled customer service around the world. With more than 50 years industry expertise, we are trusted by over 100 million consumers worldwide and we handle more than 16.6 million unique policies across the automotive, appliance and technology, home and financial service industries.

, ' ',

To Apply: 

, ' ',

Submit you CV & Cover Letter to employment@thewarrantygroup.com. 

, ' ']

title: b'\r\n          Network Test Manager\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',

"Vedainfo Australia"  is an IT Consulting, Staffing and Professional Services firm servicing Australia's IT professionals and various ICT Clients in Australia with the company corporate office located in USA. Vedainfo has foot print across continents, with subsidiary companies in UK and India also. Vedainfo serves clients across the globe from its offices in the United States, Australia, UK and India.

, '\n',

Areas of expertise include:
•             IT Staffing, Professional services
•             Design, Development, Implementation and Support/Maintenance of ERP systems and Business intelligence
•             Internet and Mobile application development.

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

Clients include multi-billion dollar companies to start ups across various industrial domains and business verticals.

, '\n',

We are looking for a Network Test Management profiles.

, '\n',

Years Experiences : 10 + yrs
No. of Openings : 4-5
Location : Melbourne, Australia
Duration : 3 months


Role - Test Manager
Short Description - Networking knowledge and working with Telecom service Provider is a must for this role The Network Test Manager is responsible for Defining Test Strategy, Master Test Plan for large programs. The Test Manager is also expected to have strong stakeholder management skills to manage multiple vendors and different customer groups and driving skills to deliver the outcomes within defined timeframes.
Experience with working with Telstra is a plus.
 

, '\n',

Roles and Responsibilities
· Work in client-facing roles to contribute towards the end-to-end delivery lifecycle of complex and large-scale Identity Management solutions.
· Hands-on Lead providing testing guidance to the implementation team throughout the life cycle of a project.
· Strong customer services focus with an ability to respond to changing customer priorities
· Defines test strategy and define test scenarios to handle all functional and non-functional requirements
· Lead and manage resources at on-shore, off-shore from testing perspective; able to work with architects, designers & developers
· Ensuring software developed is held to quality standards through code and design reviews.
· In addition to billable engagements, contribute towards account strategy initiatives.
· Ability to work independently with minimal assistance
· Excellent leadership and communication skills to efficiently manage client stake holders and Infosys internal teams.
· Ability to suggest solution/technology alternatives for a given task
· Ability to analyze bottlenecks in existing architectures and suggest solutions.


Skills /Competencies
· 7-10 years of experience in test management aspects and handled a team of 8 to 9 test engineers
· Must have played the role of a test manager for large projects.
· Able to define Master Test Plans
· Able to define Test Strategy
· Able to define interface agreements
· Usage of HPQC
· Define Test Environment needs/configuration management
· Define and Control Test Data
· Progress tracking and reporting
· Excellent Stakeholder management and strong communication skills
· Should have handled a team of 8-9 Test engineers
· Networking knowledge mandatory
· Experience with all phases of waterfall and Agile software development methodologies.


Educational Qualifications:
• Engineering Bachelors or master's degree level or equivalent

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

Candidates with valid work permit to Australia apply. Preferred PRs & Citizens.  

, '\n',

Please email us your word doc format resume with job  title in the subject line to us at junaid@vedainfo.com or call us on 0283550176.

, '\n',

Opportunities @ Australia.

, '\n',

1. Netezza Developers @ Melbourne (2 openings)
2. Java/J2EE Tech Architects @ Melbourne 
3. L1 Cisco Engineer @ Sydney
4. L2 Cisco Engineer @ Sydney
5. .Net Tech Lead @ Barangaroo Sydney
6. Java Developer @ Sydney (2) Melbourne (4)
7. Mobile Developers @ Melbourne(2)
8. Appian Developers @ Melbourne

, '\n',

Note: Candidates with valid work permit to Australia apply. Preferred PRs & Citizens.  

, '\n',

For more job details, please write to us..

, '\n',

Please email us your word doc format resume with job  title in the subject line to us at junaid@vedainfo.com or call us on 0283550176.

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

Linkedin: https://www.linkedin.com/groups/4955727

, '\n',

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/groups/australiaITjobs/

, '\n']

title: b'Senior BI Developer/ Data Warehouse Developer \r\n    '
jd:
[' ',

On behalf of my clients I am urgently looking for an experienced Senior BI Developer who is highly experienced with MS BI technology stack particularly SSAS and SSIS.

, ' ',

The role is being offered as an initial short term contract however view of extension depending on performance is highly likely.

, ' ',

You will be based from my clients ofifces in Central Melbourne and we are looking for somebody who can start more or less immediately.

, ' ',

, ' ',

THE ROLE - SENIOR BI DEVELOPER - SSIS, SSAS

, ' ',

As Senior BI Developer you will:

, ' ',
  • Work with the business to gather data requirements and understand what is needed from the solution
  • Design and develop scalable Data Warehouse functionality using T-SQL and SSAS
  • Develop data feeds using SSIS
  • Provide technical leadership for more junior developers
  • Work in an Agile way, collaborating closely with a team to solve complex data problems
, ' ',

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

, ' ',

In order to qualify for this Business Intelligence Role you will have:

, ' ',
  • Strong experience in Data Warehousing in SQL Server, including SSIS and ideally SSAS
  • Some knowledge of Data Modelling, architecture and design
  • Excellent SQL Development skills
  • Strong communication skills and a friendly cooperative approach to work
, ' ',

If you are interested in being considered for this role and would like further information please forward me a copy of your updated CV ASAP for immediate consideration.

, ' ']

title: b'SQL Developer\r\n      '
jd:
['Our client has been operating successfully in their space delivering high quality services that have a positive impact on the community for over 25 years. \xa0They have been growing continually and technology is where they seek to gain a competitive advantage. They seek to add a permanent Reporting Analyst to their high performing team.',
, ' ',
, ' They have a significant investment in custom-built software and the Data / Reporting Analyst is required to provide timely reports and data insights to business users based on this software and the underlying database and data structures.',
, ' ',
, ' This role will report to the IT Manager and will have strong interactions with both Business Users ranging from the CEO to department heads and the Business Intelligence Architect.This role will suit candidates who have experience with fast paced environments where priorities change and you will have to think on your feet. This role will suit those candidates used to working off a 5 day plan as opposed to a 90 day plan! .You must have the ability to self-motivate, learn, adapt, innovate and create',
, ' ',
, ' ', Responsibilities include, '\xa0 ',
  • Work with IT and business users to understand data and reporting requirements;
  • Provide assistance to the Support & Small Projects Team by attending to production database support requests;
  • For support and projects, interpret data, analyse results, and provide ongoing reports;
  • Develop and implement databases, data analytics, and other strategies that optimise data efficiency and quality;
  • Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets;
  • Ensure timely delivery of work to agreed timeframes and to a high degree of quality;
  • Anticipate problems and pro-actively develop contingency plans;
  • Proactively identify process or technology improvements and "own' your journey into the standard way of working;
, ' ', Knowledge skills and attributes required., ' ',
  • In-depth experience and skill at Microsoft SQL;
  • Solid understanding of data modelling, ETL processes, and database designs;
  • Strong Microsoft Reporting Services (SRSS) and Microsoft Excel skills;
  • Basic database and user administration;
  • Experience with Microsoft Analysis and MDX is advantageous.
, ' ',
, ' This is a newly created position in a company that have modern technology stack, a very low turnover and promotes family values and a genuine work/life balance. Apply now to be considered. ']

title: b'BI, Data and Analytics Manager\r\n    '
jd:
[' ',

We are looking for a Business Intelligence and Analytics Manager to head up our clients BI and Analytics function that sits within IT. This client is a national market leader that operates across a vast market, with a view to constantly re-evaluate and redefine what makes them successful.

, ' ',

Client Details

, ' ',

Work for one of Australia strongest brands, with a promising and exciting future ahead. Scheduled to move in a state-of-the-art new building by the end of year, this client is offering the opportunity to join the technical BI and Analytics team based in Melbourne, and have access to huge amounts of data across a number of different streams.

, ' ',

With existing road-maps in place to move large amounts of data up to the cloud, you will join the team that will directly re-shape the direction of the organisation.

, ' ',

Description

, ' ',

The successful applicant will inherit the following responsibilities:

, ' ',
  • Define analytics and BI strategy from a technical perspective
  • Create and develop road-maps for the future of the Business Intelligence function across a rapidly growing business
  • Define internal projects and data needs to support business objectives
  • Identify, scope and manage the analysis and interpretation of vast amounts of company-wide data
  • Oversee the design and generation of reporting frameworks which provide performance metrics for internal marketing programs
  • Manage and supervise medium sized team of developers and analysts including staff development plans and reviews
, ' ',

Profile

, ' ',

The profile of the successful applicant will be as close as possible to the below:

, ' ',
  • Tertiary degree in Computer Science, Economics or similar
  • 6+ years’ experience working with data to solve marketing or business problems
  • Extensive experience with campaign analysis, customer segmentation, hypothesis testing and modelling
  • Experience in managing and mentoring developers and analysts
  • Extensive experience in relational databases and integration tools (SQL, Tableau, Power BI etc.)
  • Experience or exposure to statistical methods and tools (SAS, Python, R etc.)
  • Ability to implement new initiatives for direct marketing and digital analytics
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
, ' ',

, ' ',

Job Offer

, ' ',
  • Work for a business at the very top of their market, with a monopoly of the market share across Australia.
  • Market leading, and attractive salary package.
  • Exciting brand new offices by the end of 2017.
  • Business on the verge of huge acquisition.
, ' ',

, ' ',

To apply online please click the 'Apply' button below. For a confidential discussion about this role please contact Tim Dillon on +61 3 9607 5628.

, ' ']

UX Agile Business Analyst | Contract | Geelong

, '\n',
  • Fantastic UX opportunity
  • Great daily rate
  • Start date ASAP
, '\n',


About the role
Reporting directly into the BI Lead, the Contract Agile Business Analyst will be responsible for facilitating the UX experience and capturing business requirements with the supply chain & merchandising stakeholders across the BI program of work.

, '\n',
  • Liaise with business stakeholders to elicit and document requirements for business
  • Create detailed UX designs translated from high-level business needs
  • Partner with technical teams to create business functional solutions
  • Establish & maintain effective relationships with business stakeholders and suppliers
  • Work with the business to identify business process improvement opportunities
, '\n',

Skills and experience

  • Proven ability to engage in consultation; act as a strong intermediary in constructive discussion to ensure that business/user requirements are delivered by managing expectations coupled with the ability to build/maintain trust.

title: b'Business Development Manager\r\n    '
jd:
[' ',

SQL Services is the leading supplier of Managed and Professional Services  and Business Intelligence  consulting for SQL Server and Oracle in Australia and New Zealand.

, ' ',

With offices in Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane, Auckland, Wellington, Christchurch and Nelson (HO), we continue to experience strong growth and are now seeking an experienced Business Development Manager in Melbourne to capitalise on the opportunities in the market and the traction we are currently achieving across Australia.  This is a unique opportunity to join a premier technology company that boasts an impressive client list covering a wide range of corporate and government interests across Australasia.

, ' ',

This is a varied and highly engaging role where every day you will represent the company in a sales capacity by building enduring relationships as well as liaising with partners to ensure customer satisfaction levels are constantly maintained and opportunities are converted.

, ' ',

To be successful in this role you will will be a hunter that possess excellent communication skills and will be extremely customer orientated.  Applicants will be credible conversing at CIO level about the issues faced in providing mission critical database platforms, be able to articulate the business benefits of data driven strategies, have a sound understanding of the capabilities and directions of the leading players in the market and demonstrate enthusiasm for seeking new opportunities.

, ' ',

You will be a great problem solver and a persistent and resilient operator who is results focused. An ability to prioritise and think on your feet is important, as is an ability to thrive under pressure. Managed Services sales or product management experience within the IT industry is desirable however we're looking for the right person so the ability to demonstrate transferable skills or knowledge will be acknowledged favourably.

, ' ',

SQL Services is a Microsoft Gold Partner and Oracle Platinum Partner, and a well-established brand with an excellent reputation across Australasia.  SQL Services believe in continual professional and personal improvement and invest heavily in our people, technology and processes. The successful candidate will be working for the market leader in a challenging and dynamic industry with a fun, supportive and positive team.

, ' ',

Only applicants that are legally entitled to work in Australia will be considered for advertised positions. Others may not necessarily be responded to.  No agents please.

, ' ',

For further information please contact Grant Newport at SQL Services Ltd on +64 3 546 2058 or email your details to jobs@sqlservices.com.

, ' ',

If you fit the bill then we want to hear from you now! Applications close Friday 5th May 2017.

, ' ']

title: b'\r\n          Business Analyst\r\n        '
jd:
[' ',

About Surefire Systems

, ' ',

SUREfire Systems is an Australian owned and operated technology company that is a leading provider of retail Point-of-Sale (POS) software to the retail industry. We are at the forefront of innovation in retail technology with our mobile POS and cloud based back-end solutions. We offer full end to end retail solutions including POS, inventory management, automated stock ordering, and support for customer loyalty management, Business Intelligence & Analytics, gift cards, and eCommerce.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

SUREfire Systems first started in 1996, and has been able to continually fund new development in our platform from our own revenues. We have continued to innovate and are currently aiming to 'disrupt ourselves' with exciting new capabilities delivered using cutting edge technologies, and a strong commitment to Agile product development, Continuous Delivery, and our maturing DevOps culture.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

About the Role

, ' ',

We are looking for a Business Analyst to join our development teams to act as a conduit between the Scrum teams and the Product Owner & customer community. The BA will extract, analyse, translate and formulate business requirements into user stories ready for the Scrum Team. The BA will also collaborate with Testers within Scrum Teams to ensure Acceptance Criteria are complete, and correctly verify the Product Owners' intent.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

About You

, ' ',

We are looking for a dynamic self-starter with the ability to adapt and work in a fast paced, changing environment. You will have a strong passion for Agile product development, and have an intense focus on customer success. You are professional and confident in front of customers, and have well developed facilitation and elicitation skills. Your written and oral communication skills will be excellent, and you take immense pride in the quality of your work.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

You will have a 3 year computer science tertiary degree or equivalent, preferably including a business component.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Any experience in an advanced Continuous Delivery environment, scripting/programming skills, and ability to supplement our UX capability will set you apart.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

To apply, please click  'Apply' and attach your CV and a cover letter clearly explaining your suitability for the role.

, ' ',

Only candidates with the right to work in Australia will be considered.

, ' ']

title: b'\r\n          Technical Business Analyst\r\n        '
jd:
[' ',

About Bolinda 
Bolinda has revolutionised the way people access and consume books. As the world's No.1 audiobook publisher and a leader in digital media, they combine a global reputation for excellence built over 20 years in audiobook publishing with the energy of their 5-year-old digital start-up.

, ' ',

Through their digital download solution, BorrowBox - your library in one app - Bolinda is the leading digital library provider in the world. BorrowBox, which enables members of public libraries, schools and universities to download and borrow eContent, is the fastest growing digital library platform in Australia and the UK. Bolinda has offices in Melbourne, the UK and NZ, doing business globally to provide great opportunities for exceptional people.

, ' ',

Bolinda believe that to enjoy the success that only the 1% have, you have to do what only the 1% do. They pride themselves on their innovative, cutting edge approach to business and follow Franklin Covey's 4 Disciplines of Execution and Robin Sharma's Lead Without a Title principles.

, ' ',

You will work in stylish, contemporary offices and in an organisation always pushing boundaries and forging new paths and opportunities.

, ' ',

About the Opportunity

, ' ',

We have an exciting opportunity for a highly driven Technical Business Analyst to join our dynamic team within an agile development environment, in Melbourne, VIC.

, ' ',

This is a technical role so we are looking for a hands-on business analyst with proven technical skills that you can expand on in your cover letter. In this fast-paced and diverse role you will be responsible for assisting senior solution architects, developers and business analysts and will work on a wide range of exciting initiatives. The role offers an incredible learning opportunity across a range of IT disciplines.

, ' ',

Your responsibilities will include:

, ' ',
  • Data analysis in both Microsoft Excel and SQL
  • Technical support for EDI, database management and SAP Business One
  • Creating reports in Crystal Server and SQL
, ' ',

It is a pre-requisite that you will have technical expertise in the following technical areas and be prepared to demonstrate these skills throughout the recruitment process:

, ' ',
  • SQL Querying
  • Advanced Excel
  • SAP B1
  • Crystal Reports
, ' ',

About You

, ' ',

To be successful in this role you will hold tertiary qualifications in an IT-related field such as Business Intelligence, Computer Science, Engineering, or similar related discipline. Alternatively, tertiary qualifications in a technical or mathematics driven field and a strong interest and understanding of modern IT systems will also be considered. You will be proficient in both written and spoken English.

, ' ',

You will be highly motivated, with a passion for new technology and a drive to succeed. You will be flexible and able to adapt to a fast-paced, highly varied environment. With a strong analytical mind, high attention to detail, intuition for innovation, and well developed problem solving abilities, you will be able to help identify and quickly implement new ideas and processes.

, ' ',

Bolinda strongly believes in prioritising the personal and professional development of their employees and you will have access to ongoing training and development, with significant room for advancement and growth within the organisation. You will be working alongside senior staff on the latest technology, and this is an amazing opportunity combined with an attractive base salary, negotiable in line with experience.

, ' ',

TO APPLY YOU MUST SUPPLY US WITH A COVERING LETTER DETAILING YOUR EXPERTISE AND EXPERIENCE IN THE ABOVE TECHNICAL AREAS. ANY APPLICATIONS NOT CONTAINING A COVER LETTER WILL BE DISREGARDED.

, ' ',

Please send your CV and cover letter to careers@bolinda.com

, ' ']

title: b'UX Designer'
jd:
['\n',

User Experience Designer - Customer centred programme of work

, '\n',
  • An initial 3 month contract with extensions
  • Work from Discovery phase through the lifecycle to delivery.
  • Progressive BI team - Work on the latest technologies with a highly motivated and talented team
  • Western suburbs Location - Easy commute from Melbourne or a chance to live and work close to home.
, '\n',

A fantastic opportunity exists for a highly skilled User Experience Designer to join a new and growing team.  We are looking for an experienced end to end designer with a strong humanistic focus. This is an opportunity to shape the future direction and to implement a customer centric solution.  

, '\n',

As an experienced UX designer you will be responsible for:

, '\n',
  • Liaise with business stakeholders to elicit and document requirements for business
  • Create detailed UX designs translated from high level business needs
  • Partner with technical teams to create business functional solutions
  • Facilitate and deliver across all phases of the lifecycle from user research, user centred design, core design principles, interaction design principles, and then user testing;
  • Establish & maintain effective relationships with business stakeholders and suppliers
  • Work with the business to identify business process improvement opportunities 
, '\n',

To be successful in the role you will possess:

, '\n',
  • Proven ability to engage in consultation; act as an intermediary to ensure that business/user requirements are delivered by managing expectations coupled with the ability to build / maintain trust.
  • Excellent analytical and problem resolution skills
  • Strong experience delivering within an agile framework
  • Experience in working as part of an agile team; Elicitation and documentation of user stories, functional and non-functional requirements from the business
  • Commercial experience working on user research, user centred design practices, core design principles, interaction design principles, and user testing approaches;
  • Demonstrated understanding and proven ability to deliver business analysis on Business Intelligence projects
  • Retail experience will be highly regarded.
, '\n',

This role requires the skills of an excellent communicator to work across the innovation stream of the business. They are looking for a customer focussed UX designer that has a passion for design thinking and someone who likes to add value at all phases of the cycle.

, '\n',

If you are looking for a new career opportunity with a growing organisation and Employer of Choice who truly values their staff, then we would love to hear from you. 

, '\n']

title: b'Data Analyst and Developer - Marketing Analytics\r\n        '
jd:
[' ',

Company

, ' ',

Our client is a small division of a well-known Australian company. The parent company has had strong market presence over the last 20 years, most recently in the digital space. Whilst the parent company may be well-known, this role is based in an entity that has been in operation for the last 4.5 years and is something of a quiet achiever in its space.

, ' ',

Due to the fact that the company operates semi-autonomously, working there offers all the advantages and flexibility of a small company, with the backing of a profitable parent entity.

, ' ',

As its business and clients continue to grow, the company is now looking to move into the next stage, whilst still maintaining its unique identity. To achieve this, they're looking for like-minded people to invoke change, shape their transition and grow alongside them.

, ' ',

Culture

, ' ',

The company are tech savvy, digital marketing enthusiasts who understand the benefits of creating a collaborative team environment. They build teams of people with marketing prowess that enable greater understanding of their client's end to end needs – from technical development phase right through to advertising.

, ' ',

More often than not, business cases for new tech come from the 'ground up'. A truly data driven culture, they strive to be on top of the latest ways to harness and review crucial market information for their client base.

, ' ',

They're successful, innovative and profitable – and they do it all with flexible hours and an enviable adherence to a work/life balance.

, ' ',

Role

, ' ',

On a daily basis, you'll undertake the following and more:

, ' ',
  • Setting up new clients with Google Analytics and Google AdWords, as well as be innovative in working toward new strategies beyond Google
  • Work with the company's clients to understand their aims and how best they can be realised
  • Provide and maintain daily, weekly, monthly web analytics reports/dashboards to internal stakeholders as well as managing ad-hoc analytics requests (internal and external)
  • Work with APIs to configure data visualisation tool for our clients
  • Data extraction from various sources to BI platform to allow analysis of campaign conversion effectiveness, as well as identifying areas for improvement
  • Campaign (Social,SEM,SEO) dashboard reporting and data processing
  • Providing implementation guidelines to development teams for implementing tracking codes on client platforms
  • Monitor web analytics tracking across different channels and provide solutions for any deficiencies
, ' ',

Skills & Experience

, ' ',

The successful candidate must have a strong marketing background (ideally digital) with minimum 3 years' experience in the following:

, ' ',
  • Javascript, JQuery (including plugins), HTML5, CSS, PHP
  • Python, Ruby or R
  • Web APIs: Ability to talk to third party REST APIs (Google Analytics, AdWords, Facebook Graph API etc.) over OAuth or Basic Auth
  • Ability to parse and transform data from JSON, XML, CSV, TSV to other formats
  • MySQL or PostgreSQL handling using Python or other scripting language using database drivers
  • Accurate and readily customizable reporting to meet client demands
  • Data - processing, cleaning and integration
  • Prediction Modeling
  • Business intelligence data feeds and platform integration
, ' ',

Desirable additional skills or knowledge:

, ' ',
  • .NET web development
  • Klipfolio Business Intelligence software
  • Experience deploying and managing Apache or ngnix hosting environments
  • Linux administration
, ' ',

In addition, we're seeking a person with a team oriented, proactive mindset who aligns with the company's culture as detailed above.

, ' ',

Why you'd want this role.

, ' ',
  • Huge capacity to develop your own personal, soft and technical skills
  • The company is gearing up for a new era and undergoing true reinvention – you can be part of the initial phase, even benchmark and help shape future roles for yourself
  • Primarily an end to end marketing company, you will be exposed to the latest technologies and strategies to achieve client results
  • An environment where management actively seek staff input  
  • Ongoing professional training
, ' ',

About Vivid

, ' ',

Vivid are a recently established company that aims to provide a far more transparent and open recruitment experience for Candidates and Clients alike. You can follow our most recent roles and developments at www.linkedin.com/company/vivid---clearly-different as well as reading more about us at www.vividcd.com

, ' ',

Further information

, ' ',

For further information about the role, please forward your CV to clearlydifferent@vividcd.com and be assured of full confidentiality.

, ' ',

Please note that only applicants based in and with unlimited rights to work in Australia can be considered for this position.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

 

, ' ']

title: b'Infor Support Analyst\r\n    '

['\n',

Our Client, a national and iconic Australian organisation is currently looking for an Infor M3 specialist to join their busy team. This role will focus on both Infor M3 Administrative support as well as some development.

You will need to be detail oriented and have significant prior M3 experience, and will need to be team orrientated as they have a tight knit IT team.

A detailed understanding of the operations of Gunnersen would also need to be developed to ensure an ability to undertake the guidance and assitance to the user community that will be required.

For more information please contact Matt Owen 03 8319 1223
