title: b'Senior Analyst, Transformation Designer/Developer\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',
  • Join a newly created agile team
  • Bring your superior stakeholder engagement skills to this high performing role
  • Fantastic opportunity to contribute to UI experiences
, '\n',

At NAB, we believe success comes from our people. We're committed to supporting your talent and skills through your career, as you help us build a culture that affects change for our customers - and for the community too.

, '\n',

Data, Analytics & Reporting (DA&R) produces both external reporting submissions for financial and regulatory reporting, and business intelligence and internal reporting services across the enterprise, and is responsible for the ongoing Management Information Transformation.

, '\n',

The Senior Analyst, Transformation Designer/Developer is responsible for overall design and development of reporting solutions and analytics solutions to standards and pattern which may span multiple reporting assets and align these with stakeholder business requirements, functional and non-functional requirements to deliver a better end UI (user experience), operational sustainability, and positioning for future trends/demands within DA&R, whilst always role modelling an agile mindset within the team, promoting the need to react and adapt to changes in the environment.

, '\n',

Key responsibilities include:

, '\n',
  • Define data and reporting solutions to design standards for reporting solutions within DA&R including alignment with the strategic asset direction across the business that ensure solution simplicity, scalability, compliance to internal & external data management policies to minimise risk, fit for business purpose and value for money.
  • Design and development of data management. & control framework for reporting solutions and develop re-usable capabilities for projects to align to and utilise e.g. reconciliation, error control, exception mgmt., data lineage and traceability etc.
  • Provide a consultancy and education service to all divisions/units providing insight at design sessions and development labs to help translate requirements into workable solutions; advocating for additional data and/or services when necessary to address key business issues
  • Promote agile methodology into the team for delivery of work items in focused manner.
  • Apply continuous improvement methodologies to uplift and/or enhance development practices (including process, systems, tools and capability) & actively contribute to driving DA&R Asset Roadmap execution
, '\n',

To be successful in the role you will have you will have strong stakeholder engagement and interpersonal skills with well-developed communication and influencing skills. Ideally you will have a management reporting background with proven experience developing reporting solutions using reporting systems (OBIEE). Knowledge of SQL and exposure to ETL tools would be looked upon favourably

, '\n',

To be eligible to apply, you must be an Australian / New Zealand citizen or hold permanent residency status in Australia

, '\n',

We embrace diversity of thought, style and working arrangements to ensure our workforce is representative of the community that we serve.

, '\n']

jd:

You will be required to:

title: b'BI Data Analytics Lead - ERP Transformation\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

About the Role

, ' ',

The BI Data Analytics Lead will be responsible for understanding the business requirements and developing processes for the analytics and reporting solution that supports business transformation across the entire Programme, providing business context to the solution to be delivered by the ERP IT Analytics Lead. The role will be instrumental in defining the analytics and reporting requirements of the business users impacted by the program across the works management, asset management, supply chain and procurement management, finance, P&C and Payroll streams.

, ' ',

As the Analytics Lead you will coordinate the activities of the Business Analysts, Data Modellers and Reporting Analysts, prioritising their work to ensure alignment with the objectives of the Program stream leads and at the same time ensuring the timely delivery of business value.

, ' ',

Key Responsibilities

, ' ',

, ' ',
  • Responsible for the analytics and reporting strategy across the ERP Programme
  • Identify the existing reports that are required to be migrated and design the migration strategy and solutions
  • Provide expert commentary, insights and thought leadership into these key metrics and reports
  • Work with ERP Analytics SMEs to understand additional reporting requirements and provide recommendations on the reporting architecture and solutions for the ERP landscape.
  • Build, develop and demonstrate a deep domain knowledge. Understanding how the business operates and external industry impacts, and understanding how performance metrics can help address these issues Design solutions that leverage AGL's data analytical platforms and are consistent with AGL's data visualisation principles and strategic toolsets
  • Oversee the data modelling, report build and deployment and the transition into BAU support.
  • Act as a quality assurance checkpoint for any assets produced from within the team
, ' ',

, ' ',

, ' ',

About You

, ' ',

, ' ',
  • Good understanding of S/4HANA reporting capabilities and experience in design and implementing BI/reporting solutions for ERP.
  • Familiarity with the capabilities and applications of a range of reporting and analytical tools including but not limited to SAP Business Objects, Mobile Business Intelligence, Tableau
  • Communication and presentation skills to present options and recommendations.
  • Experience working in both waterfall and agile delivery environment for large organisations
  • Proactive stakeholder management skills, and create trusted relationships
  • Strong data, reporting, analysis and conceptual skills
  • Understanding databases and database processes

title: b'Senior Finance Analyst \r\n    '
jd:
[' ',

Work closely with the senior management to analyse business and financial data to provide insight, guide conversations and support business decisions

, ' ',

, ' ',

Client Details

, ' ',

, ' ',

Our Client is a market leader that has established a strong reputation after 30 years operating in Australia. At an exciting time in their history, they are currently implementing an array of innovative programs that has led to this opportunity. The perfect time to join an organisation that is well known for providing great careers for its employees.

, ' ',

, ' ',

Description

, ' ',

As an integral member of the Finance team, you will Analyse business and financial data to provide insight, guide conversations and support business decisions. Additionally, you will support the leadership team by providing expert analysis and advice in understanding business and financial data, providing analysis around its completeness, guiding data cleansing and to provide insights to support informed decision making. Some of your specific responsibilities will include;

, ' ',
  • Enable evidence based decision making
  • Exploring new commercial models
  • Identifying new opportunities for existing customers
  • Design, develop and maintain financial forecasting models.
  • Undertake scenario based analysis.
  • Design, develop and maintain organisational reporting dashboards to support evidence based decision making.
, ' ',

Profile

, ' ',

You will be a highly motivated and driven professional with previous experience in an analytical role. You will have strong interpersonal, written and oral communication skills along with;

, ' ',
  • Degree in computer science, statistics, accounting, finance, commerce or a related field.
  • Experience with relational database technology e.g. Oracle, SQL
  • Experience with analytical visualisation tools/technology e.g. Excel (essential), QlikView (desired)
  • Experience with analysing large volumes of structured and semi-structured data (essential)
  • Experience with reporting and business intelligence (desired)
  • Strong interpersonal, written and oral communication skills.
  • Responsive to changing requirements.
  • Generating ideas and proven problem solving abilities.
  • Experience with financial modelling and forecasting
, ' ',

Job Offer

, ' ',

Your commitment and passion to drive innovation will be rewarded with a package that includes many additional benefits. You will enjoy functioning within a role which offers the opportunity to broaden your skill set and develop your capabilities.

, ' ',

To apply online please click the 'Apply' button below. For a confidential discussion about this role please contact Jake Densley on +61 3 9607 5629

, ' ']

title: b'\r\n          Solution Architect - Oracle CC&B\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',

We are looking for a candidate with a strong CIS implementation background in playing a technical architect/Solution architect role in implementing CIS solutions for Utilities specific to Oracle Utilities Customer Care and Billing (CC&B). The Candidate will need to have experience in implementing CC&B solutions in ANZ Utilities markets. They should have experience of playing the CC&B /Technical Architect role for 4-5 years along with experience in CC&B upgrade projects.

, '\n',

Skills & Expertise:

, '\n',

Technical Architect:

, '\n',

Typical responsibilities:

, '\n',
  • Should be able to design, build, test and deploy technical solution in Oracle CC&B with proficiency in RICEFW (Reports, Interface, Conversions, Extensions, Forms and Workflows).
  • Should be able to understand the technology impact to the business.
  • Should have experience on upgrade projects involving CC&B 2.2.x, 2.3.x to CC&B 2.4.x or 2.5.x
  • The candidate will be responsible for technical decisions regarding configuration, integration, system administration, instance strategy, upgrades, enhancements, deployments, and release management.
  • Strong organisational skills, technical expertise and architectural capabilities are essential in this role.
  • Should be able to work as part of a highly technical team of professionals who are responsible for the architectural design, development, and deployment of CC&B technical solution to meet business requirements.
  • Should be able to drive the overall design, web services and middleware architecture and technology for the implementation of CC&B and related applications.
  • Understand capabilities and potential of hardware, software and integration components with CC&B.
  • Work within a cross-functional team of CIS functional leads to provide technical expertise in the design and planning of CIS solutions specifically using Oracle CC&B platform.
  • Should be able to develop technical design documents from the functional specification documents and configure the package to meet requirements for projects in this area.
  • Should be able to support infrastructure team in task related to environment setup, patch installations, code deployment and CC&B Security Configuration.
  • Should be able to guide, mentor and lead a team of developers to develop the customisation required during development phase and help in issue resolutions during support /Post-Go Live phase.
  • Should be able to suggest and validate technical solution options for the requirements and lead the technical solution process with the functional teams who would provide the requirements for their specific Industry needs.
  • Maximise the performance, uptime, and supportability using the CC&B technology platforms.
  • The candidate must be a team player and is also expected to help the project team with any technical issues that may arise during the course of the project.
  • Provide mentorship and training to other associates at the same level or below on the technology, processes and tools; and to handle more complex issues/requests.
, '\n',

Skills required:

, '\n',

  • 12 years of total IT industry experience, with at least 4 years in implementing CIS Solutions for Utilities.

  • Through understanding of Java, J2EE, XAI and Scripting as well as Middleware platforms used for integration.

  • Experience of at least 1 or 2 full-cycle upgrade projects for a utility (Electricity/Water/ Gas Domain) with hands on technical and deployment experience in Oracle CC&B.

  • Familiarity with process integration of CC&B with other utility enterprise and operational systems such as core WAM, MDM, EBS, NMS, etc.

  • Very good knowledge in Oracle Utilities Application Framework (OUAF).

  • Hands on experience in Oracle CC&B Product Architecture, Data Model, web services & BPEL services.

  • Should be able to define the technical design – including customisations, integration, converting NFRs in to design and solution etc.

  • Good Programming knowledge in Java, SQL, PL/SQL, Knowledge on scripting Language (Shell Script/Perl/Ant Script/WLST etc.).

  • Good interpersonal communications and analytical ability.

  • Strong soft skills required.

  • Ready to travel to client locations as needed.

, '\n',

What's on Offer:

, '\n',
  • Excellent daily rates
  • Excellent technical environment.
  • Large enterprise.
, '\n',

To apply, please submit your CV ASAP for immediate consideration. Only shortlisted applicants will be contacted for this role; however we do keep applications on file for future opportunities.

, '\n',

Note: Only Australian Permanent residents / Citizens will be considered for this role

, '\n']

title: b'\r\n          Data Solution Architect\r\n        '
jd:
[' ',

EXCITING DATA SOLUTION ARCHITECT POSITION FOR A MICROSOFT TRUSTED PARTNER WHO ARE BUILDING AN ELITE TECH TEAM! 

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

BCS Technology (BCS) is an award-winning Australian based Professional Services organisation focusing on the provision of quality consulting in the area of Business Intelligence, Data warehouse and Application Development. We are trusted partners of Cloudera and Microsoft and recently, BCS has been accepted as part of the Microsoft Practice Development Initiative to further develop our Analytics practice on Microsoft Azure.  

, ' ',

We are transforming into a digital provider for the entire world. Founded in 2001, Sydney Australia, BCS has emerged as a leading Professional Services provider, delivering tailored solutions and services to clients throughout the world. With offices now in Sydney, Melbourne, Jakarta, Manila and Delhi, BCS is currently on track to reinvent itself to be one of the world's most reliable data analytics solutions provider. If you are looking to learn and grow, we also sponsor training programs. Come join our team and be a part of this exciting opportunity.

, ' ',

What will you be doing?

, ' ',
  • You will be responsible for the architecture of new Data Analytics platforms on Azure that will allow senior stakeholders to analyse and generate business critical insight for the purpose of business decision making.
  • We prefer those with hands on experience in Azure data but it is not necessary.
  • Experience in databases and analytics, including relational databases, AWS, Data Warehousing, Big Data , NoSQL, Machine Learning, Stream Analytics, Data Factory, Event Hubs , Notification Hubs and business analytics.
  • Understanding of big data use-cases.
  • Understanding of Hadoop-based design patterns knowledge of real time/stream analytics.
, ' ',

Essentials:

, ' ',
  • Bachelor Degree or higher in IT or relevant discipline
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills.
  • Keen eye for detail.
  • Excellent time management.
  • Excellent problem solving and analytical skills.
  • Flexibility to travel - this position requires the person to travel to our international offices for short term assignments when required. 
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

If you are interested in pursuing a rewarding career by being a part of an organisation committed to the growth of its customers and employees equally, please don't hesitate to APPLY NOW.

, ' ',

Please send your Resume in Word and we will get in touch with the shortlisted candidates ASAP.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

To be considered, you must be a Permanent Resident or an Australian Citizen.

, ' ']

title: b'Enterprise Architect - S/4 Hana implementation!\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

Sitting in the Enterprise Architecture function within the CTO, this Enterprise Architect lead and support the architecture design for our ERP Transformation Program as we implement S/4 Hana. The solution has a large number of leading edge software components, both SaaS and a broad range of SAP S/4HANA modules and will cover all AGL sites and business units, across a wide range of stakeholders and workforces with a series of releases, directly impacting maintenance, procurement and payroll processes in particular. The role will define the logical architecture including components and their interactions supporting the designed processes across streams in works management, asset management, supply chain and procurement management, finance, P&C and Payroll; and supervise the solution design and successful delivery of the ERP solutions and transitioning into operations.

, '\n',

, '\n',

Key Responsibilities

, '\n',
  • Provide architectural guidance and expert advice on the S/4 Hana solution design for the Program, which will be consistent with strategy and conforms to AGL architecture standards and guidelines.
  • Engage business stakeholders to understand the processes and requirements for the overall ERP Transformation;
  • Validate that the technical, functional and data solutions are holistic, and monitor and govern the quality of the deliverables.
  • Be responsible for the designing and implementing the overall program’s technical architecture and integration points with other programs;
  • Review vendor solutions to ensure appropriateness, compliance, completeness and give confidence in any cost estimate.
  • Educate functional solution architects and technical architects about AGL architecture principles, standards and processes, and ongoing management of solutions to ensure consistency and quality.
, '\n',

About You

, '\n',
  • Deep skills as an architect with exposure to SAP S/4HANA
  • Understanding the complexities and opportunities inherent in a large scale SAP implementation.
  • Previous team lead experience
  • Excellent planning & organisational skills, including the proven ability to adapt to a dynamic environment
  • Technical leadership experience in making technology selection decisions and the communication skills to present options and recommendations to senior stakeholders.
  • Maturity in process design, compliance management and process improvement, backed up by the gravitas to influence and matrix-manage a range of non-direct reports within the wider IT team.
  • Experience with Cloud technologies including IaaS, PaaS and SaaS.
  • Experience working in both waterfall and agile delivery environment for large organisations

, '\n',

What’s in it for you?

, '\n',
  • You’ll be working in an A-grade building with state of the art activity based working facilities. Being supported by our new flexible ways of working. We call it Smarter Working.
  • You’ll get the opportunity to work with some of the most engaged and innovative in the business. Being exposed to more opportunities to advance your skills and career.
  • Working in a company the size of ours the sky’s the limit for your career aspirations and we’re focused on developing you.
, '\n',

, '\n',

About Us

, '\n',

It truly is an exciting time to be part of AGL Energy as we lead the way in generating sustainable energy solutions for all Australians. With a heritage of over 175 years and listed in the top 50 companies on the ASX, AGL offers a genuinely diverse, safe and supportive work environment, where "actions not words" fosters a culture of achievement and personal development.

, '\n',

, '\n',

, '\n',

How to Apply
Come with us on a journey of exploration and creativity, doing the same things differently, better, faster by encompassing innovation and passion for a more sustainable world.

, '\n',

, '\n',

, '\n']

title: b'Senior Security Architect\r\n    '
jd:
['\n',

Unisys Security Solutions deliver advanced security in a trusted and efficient way that addresses our clients' most complex and mission-critical security challenges, providing the context and confidence needed to leverage the latest technology, embrace modern business realities and defend their enterprises. We combine experienced consulting, advanced products and efficient managed services to deliver dramatic improvement in security posture and operational efficiencies.

, '\n',

As a Security Architect, you will lead and deliver in onsite client engagements while interfacing with "C" level executives from client and account to plan a strategic direction to enhance the maturity of the client organisation's security program effectiveness and maturity.

, '\n',

Roles and Responsibilities:

, '\n',
  • Understanding of IT security risk analysis and management methodologies and proven ability to perform these
  • Ability to create and drive a security remediation program within client environments
  • Ability to demonstrate ROI from security investments and create business case accordingly
  • Thorough understanding of relevant security guidelines and legislations
  • Knowledge of, and ability to architect and drive deployment of a variety of security technologies (e.g. NGFW, SIEM, WAF, Content Filters, etc.)
  • Good understanding of managed security services and ability to drive this within client environments
  • Possess the ability to present technical concepts in simple terms to non-technical audiences
  • Understanding of network architectures, topologies, and networking services and protocols (e.g. BGP, MPLS, TCP/IP, IPSec, VLANs, VPNs, etc.)
  • Guides the activities of network engineers and security consultants and focused teams for network discovery, diagrams, toolset recommendations, and physical/logical architectures
  • Experience in one or more SIEM implementations or big data analytics
  • Ability to generate SOWs, BOEs, WBS, and product specifications and recommendations. Works in a leadership role with the customer to guide their security strategy
  • Manages the activities to configure and test the deployed infrastructure to achieve client sign-off
  • Creates complex design artifacts including network layouts and logical/physical designs
  • Contributes to the preparation and presentation of technical trade-offs and Total Cost of Ownership results to managers, customers and peers
  • Assists in pre-sales client engagements, such as Workshops, Proof of Concepts and Demonstrations, and provides input on infrastructure architectural designs, blueprints, integration of infrastructure architecture artifacts, and asset management/ reuse resulting in the creation and deployment of world-class solution
, '\n',

Preferred Skills, Experience & Qualifications

, '\n',
  • Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or advanced degree/Certifications in related discipline
  • Minimum 8 years of experience in network and security infrastructure
  • Highly knowledgeable on security and network tools including: network monitors, firewalls, VPN's
  • Experience participating in technical presentations, and designing and integrating client solutions involving multiple systems across an entire unit or organization
  • Ability to troubleshoot software issue and customer applications as required, specifically Network Interfacing (single and multiple NICs) on UNIX O/S server platforms, Linux Red Hat and/or AIX
  • Cisco experience and/or relevant certifications (i.e. CISSP, Security+, CCNP, CCNA, Network+, MCSA)
  • Experience with leading security products such as Intel (McAfee) or Symantec etc.
  • Experience deploying or integrating solutions in various Authentication Schemes; e.g. LDAP, Radius, Kerberos, Multi-Factor, Smartcard concepts (HSPD-12 vs. CAC), One Time Password (OTP), etc.
  • Advanced Host and Network Troubleshooting skills – TCP dumps, Network Debug Tools, etc.
  • Deployment and operations framework knowledge: e.g. ITIL Framework
  • Excellent documentation and technical writing skills are required
  • Travel required across APAC.
, '\n']

title: b'Solutions Architect\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

Our Vision
CPA Australia's Vision is to be known as the world's leading member service organisation, and with 155,000 members across 118 countries we are well positioned to make that vision a reality.  
A key part of making this happen is our Technology Business Unit who is responsible for planning, designing, implementing and maintaining our IT systems to further improve business performance.  
 

, '\n',

The Role

, '\n',

This is a fantastic opportunity for a Solution Architect with a strong digital and web technology background to progress your career with a globally recognised Australian brand. 
In this role, you operate as a specialist leader operating across all levels within CPA's Technology Business Unit (TBU) and the broader organisation. You will develop solution architectures that help to direct key projects and initiatives and will be involved in contributing towards the IT Strategy and Enterprise Architecture to ensure that what is delivered by the technical teams is consistent with the strategic intent of the enterprise.
 

, '\n',

Key Responsibilities

, '\n',

In this varied and challenging role the successful candidate will have responsibility for:
•    Providing consulting services relating to initiatives and projects in the inception            phase e.g. options and cost benefit analysis as well as specific domain strategies         and recommendation.
•    Developing the annual program of work together with the Strategy and Architecture        Manager.  
•    Identifying strategic and operational opportunities and risks to improve the delivery         of IT services and provide appropriate mitigation recommendations.
•    Leading internal and external technical resources during the development of the            architecture.
•    Providing governance of the architecture and solution design within projects.

, '\n',

Skills and Experience
Reporting to the Architecture and Strategy Manager you will be an experienced Solution Architect, with a track record of successful digital solutions implementations which will include transforming a business process or service using modern technologies (e.g. cloud computing, data/analytics, mobile, social, etc.). 

, '\n',

Your background in developing or designing solutions utilizing Sitecore, .NET, APIs, Web services and Microsoft Azure will be highly regarded. You will be pro-active, resilient and customer service focused.  We are seeking an excellent communicator with superior organizational skills to consult to all levels of our business involving technical, non-technical, end-user and executive audiences.    

, '\n',

To be considered for this opportunity you will need to meet the following criteria:

, '\n',

•    Tertiary level qualification in information technology (IT), computer science,                   computer engineering, electrical engineering and/or business management or                 equivalent practical experience.
•    Proven digital experience in a similar role covering application, infrastructure                 architectural design, delivery and governance.
•    Well-developed judgment and decision-making capabilities.
•    Excellent ability to conceptualise and design.
•    TOGAF or equivalent industry accreditation highly regarded.

, '\n',

If you are successful in this role, you will have opportunities for growth and career development through regular training to ensure your service skills are second to none. You will also have access to CPA Australia's employee benefits, which offers special terms on products and services such as health insurance, home loans, credit cards and publications.

, '\n',

At CPA Australia people are at the heart of what we do. We promote and encourage a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone can be their best.

, '\n']

title: b'Solution Architect - Transformation Program - Legacy Migration\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a major transformation program with the migration of a legacy platform from C/C++ to a modern architecture; a .Net, C#, JS Framework on SQL Server.

, ' ',

You will be part of the Enterprise and Solution Architecture Team reporting to the Lead Enterprise Architect. Your team will be providing:

, ' ',
  • Enterprise Architecture principles and direction
  • Solution Architectures
  • Architectural Guidance and Governance to Delivery Teams
, ' ',

The company operates a Scaled Agile Framework so experience working on Agile projects is highly desirable.

, ' ',

You will be responsible for contributing to Enterprise Architecture principles and direction, producing Solution Architecture artefacts and cost estimations supporting this transformation as well as guidance of Delivery teams and Governance of Architectural standards.

You will be required to collaborate with the wider Solution Architecture team as well as business analysts, project delivery teams and the infrastructure staff.

Your responsibilities:

, ' ',
  • Provide technical and design expertise to development projects.
  • Collaborative maintenance of EA principles and direction, capability models, data models, application models, technical models, localised technical standards and debt registers.
  • Understand technical environment to ensure solutions meet standard architectural principals.
  • Perform and provide advice on feasibility studies for new technology, platform functionality, and system integration.
  • Provide assistance in the root cause analysis of problems as required.
  • Guidance & Governance of Delivery teams to Architectural Standards.
, ' ',

Your skills and experience

, ' ',
  • Deep exposure to Solution Architecture in Microsoft environments.
  • Experience with transformation from legacy to modern architecture (C/C++ to C# environments ideal).
  • Strong communication skills, with the ability to lead discussions around solution design and technical problem resolution.
  • Experience within the financial services industry highly regarded but not essential.
, ' ',

Your qualifications

, ' ',
  • Minimum requirement is VCE (Year 12)
  • Tertiary qualifications in a technology discipline highly desired
  • At least 5 years of application design and development experience.
  • TOGAF certification
, ' ',

To discuss the role please call Anna Mercer on 03 8330 5002 or apply below.

( SK919247A )

title: b'Collaborative Business Architect - Appian\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

  • 12-Month Opportunity


  • Collaborative, high energy team environment


  • Based in Melbourne
, '\n',

 

, '\n',
, '\n', About The Role,
, '\n', Appian improves how work gets done, transforming your complex, interwoven processes, data, and systems into an easy to design, execute, manage, and optimize platform for getting more done. Available in the cloud, or on premise, Appian empowers you to:  ,
, '\n',

  • Easily drive growth


  • Optimize operational efficiency


  • Address governance, risk, and compliance


  • Enhance customer service


  • Rapid Development of new process applications with no coding


  • Flexible Deployment Architecture available as cloud or on-premise


  • Low-Maintenance Platform with a single integrated solution and fast self-optimizing data cache


  • One-Click Migration and Deployment of process applications or Change Mgmt


  • Open and Standards Based:  BPMN, XML, Web Services, SOA

The incumbent will be required to be technically capable to work on developing workflows and also co-ordinate with Business and other Technology Partners to deliver to project requirements.,

, '\n', About You,

  • Strong Appian (or BPM equivalent, such as Pega) experience

We’ve made it our business to be an organisation where people strive and are rewarded for excellence.,

, '\n', We know that working 9-5 doesn't suit everyone. Hear from our staff about how flexible working arrangements help them maintain a healthy work-life balance: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BGt2xObOnJc ,
, '\n',  ,
, '\n',  ,
, '\n', To find out more about working at ANZ or to view other opportunities visit www.anz.com/careers.,

[
, '\n',

The Role
In a world where Information is becoming increasingly important to decision making, there is a need to ensure that the business is being enabled with technology solutions that make access to this information simple and intuitive.

, '\n',

You are an astute business professional within the Information Management domain - with a passion and demonstrable competencies in ensuring project solution design aligns with exacting business requirements, to generate maximum value back to the business. You are a natural builder of relationships and translator of technical into business language.

To be successful, you'll have:

• Multiple years exp. working in the Information Management domain, with a several years exp. in a DW/BI Architecture role
• Proven experience working within large/complex Data Warehousing and Business Intelligence environments
• Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate effectively with leadership and delivery teams
• Hands on Data Modelling Experience, specifically Operational and Dimensional Modelling for Data Warehouses
• Strong database knowledge, specifically with the Oracle technologies
• Ability to present and resolve architecture key design decisions with the Enterprise Architecture governance forum

, '\n',

Key Responsibilities

, '\n',

• Ownership of the Insights solution architecture, including Data Warehousing, Operational Reporting and Business Intelligence Reporting and Self-Service
• Definition and maintenance of the governing principles that underpin the DW/BI solution architecture
• Champion the application of best-practice in solution design, with a specific focus on Data Modelling and Information Delivery
• Work closely with the Coles Enterprise Architecture group to ensure alignment with the broader Coles IT strategies and roadmaps
• Collaborate with the Information Architect providing a focused view with application related matters
• Review and endorsement of project deliverables to ensure alignment with the DW/BI solution architecture
• Contribute to the Insights Governance processes and documentation to support continuous improvement within the delivery teams
• Identify innovation opportunities that will bring value to our end users in the areas of Business Intelligence
• Work closely with delivery managers to assess change, effectively communicating the associated risk and complexity
• Mentoring and leadership of the project delivery leads

, '\n',

Culture

Coles is a fast-paced, constantly changing business that focuses your talents and challenges you to perform at your best. As a team, we're bold with ideas and operate with pace and passion, always looking for better ways to transform retail and delight customers.

, '\n',

Benefits

, '\n',

Not only will you receive a competitive salary, you'll also have access to these great benefits:
• Cheaper groceries and other products. You'll get a 5% discount when shopping at Coles, Kmart, Officeworks and Target
• Learn new skills and develop your existing capabilities. We provide excellent ongoing training and development
• Take your experience to the next level. We always have new opportunities to help you build a great career
• 12 weeks of paid Parental Leave for primary care givers and 1 week of paid leave for secondary care givers
• No need to pay for car parking. You can park your car in our multi-level car park, which is exclusive to our team
• Get fitter, stronger and faster at our on-site gym

, '\n',

About Us

, '\n',

With over 100,000 team members, over 2,200 retail outlets and the huge corporate support infrastructure behind these, Coles is one of the most significant businesses in Australia. This scope and its positive approach to lateral moves means employees have an amazing environment to apply and develop talents, opportunities to achieve significant goals personally and professionally, and to build and pursue an interesting career.

The pace of our business has made it a gathering place for passionate and talented people. In this environment, team members draw the motivation, focus, determination and personal growth required to achieve more, faster.

How to apply

, '\n',

If you have the drive to achieve your best every single day, then our team is waiting to transform your talents.
Click "Apply" to complete an application form and upload your current resume.

, '\n',

Please Note

, '\n',

We prefer to deal with you directly and have not engaged an agency for this role, so if you're interested, please apply.

, '\n',

At Coles, we aim to ensure our team represents the community we serve, embracing the richness of Australia's diverse population.

, '\n']

[' ',

Due to an internal promotion, we have a fantastic opportunity for a Senior Solutions Architect to join our highly complex technical environment.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

The Role

, ' ',

This role is responsible for the architecture and design of all components on MessageMedia's technology infrastructure and Products.  You will own the entire lifecycle of our product development, from architecture right through to ensuring the build and implementation is in accordance with design and requirements.  This is very much a hands-on role that will not only see you working at 50,000 feet but also get down into the detail.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

About you

, ' ',
  • Approximately 10 years in software/systems development roles;
  • A minimum of 5 years as a Solution Architect on software development and systems integration projects where you delivered high quality architecture and design outcomes that have led to successful systems implementation;
  • Experience working in micro-services architecture and an understanding of APIs;
  • Working with project teams of over 20+ people and with a variety of stakeholders across the business;
  • Application of Agile software development methodologies;
  • Experience with developing architecture and solutions for both in-house software development and configuration/customisation of third party products.
  • Ability to understand and distil complex technical decisions into options and recommendations that can be considered in business terms;

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

About Us

, ' ',

We are no ordinary company – far from it.  With a passionate team and advanced technology, we provide mobile messaging solutions to businesses to enable them to communicate with their customers and employees in a simple and economical way.  We are well known for our industry leading technical expertise, years of experience, quality support and service reliability.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Strictly no recruitment agencies please

, ' ',

title: b'\r\n          SOLUTION ARCHITECT\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',

 ABOUT US

, '\n',

We are focused on offering IT consulting, technology and outsourcing solutions and services.

, '\n',

We have a team of consultants who are experts in Banking and Financial Services, Health and Insurance, Automotive, Defense, Aerospace and Security, Energy, Semiconductors, Retail and Consumer Sector who help our clients remain up to date to changing technologies in their domain and remain ahead of competition, grow quickly and become more profitable.

, '\n',

Our operation is spread across United States, United Kingdom and Asia Pacific markets enabling clients to get access to expert local talent for their technological solutions and bringing cost advantages on hiring local talent and building a diversified talent pool.

, '\n',

We are a trusted partner to several Multinational Companies globally for managing their end-to-end Product Life Cycle and enhancing business processes.

, '\n',

ABOUT OUR CLIENT

, '\n',

Our client is one of the leading Information, Communications and Technology (ICT) company providing world-class business consulting, information technology and communication services and has development and delivery centre's across the globe serving several Fortune 500 companies.

, '\n',

Our client is a provider of financial technology products, legacy modernization services and consulting for core banking, corporate banking, wealth & asset management and insurance.

, '\n',

JOB DESCRIPTON –SOLUTION ARCHITECT

, '\n',

ROLE                                    :               Solution Architect

, '\n',

Work Type                            :               Fixed Term Permanent role(6 months)

, '\n',

No of Open positions           :                2
Work Location                     :               Melbourne 

, '\n',

We are looking for a candidate with a strong CIS implementation background in playing a technical architect/Solution architect role in implementing CIS solutions for Utilities specific to Oracle Utilities Customer Care and Billing (CC&B). The Candidate will need to have experience in implementing CC&B solutions in Utilities markets. She/he should have experience of playing the CC&B /Technical Architect role for 4-5 years along with experience in CC&B upgrade projects.

, '\n',
  • Should be able to design, build, test and deploy technical solution in Oracle CC&B with proficiency in RICEFW (Reports, Interface, Conversions, Extensions, Forms and Workflows)
  • Should be able to understand the technology impact to the business.
  • Should have experience on upgrade projects involving CC&B 2.2.x, 2.3.x to CC&B 2.4.x or 2.5.x
  • The candidate will be responsible for technical decisions regarding configuration, integration, system administration, instance strategy, upgrades, enhancements, deployments, and release management.
  • Strong organizational skills, technical expertise and architectural capabilities are essential in this role.
  • Should be able to work as part of a highly technical team of professionals who are responsible for the architectural design, development, and deployment of CC&B technical solution to meet business requirements.
  • Should be able to drive the overall design, web services and middleware architecture and technology for the implementation of CC&B and related applications.
  • Understand capabilities and potential of hardware, software and integration components with CC&B
  • Work within a cross-functional team of CIS functional leads to provide technical expertise in the design and planning of CIS solutions specifically using Oracle CC&B platform.
  • Should be able to develop technical design documents from the functional specification documents and configure the package to meet requirements for projects in this area.
  • Should be able to support infrastructure team in task related to environment setup, patch installations, code deployment and CC&B Security Configuration.
  • Should be able to guide, mentor and lead a team of developers to develop the customization required during development phase and help in issue resolutions during support /Post-Go Live phase.
  • Should be able to suggest and validate technical solution options for the requirements and lead the technical solutioning process with the functional teams who would provide the requirements for their specific Industry needs.
  • Maximize the performance, uptime, and supportability using the CC& B technology platforms.
  •  The candidate must be a team player and is also expected to help the project team with any technical issues that may arise during the course of the project Provide mentorship and training to other associates at the same level or below on the technology, processes and tools; and to handle more complex issues/requests.
, '\n',

Technical Skills [Mandatory]

, '\n',
  • 12 years of total IT industry experience, with atleast 4 years in implementing CIS Solutions for Utilities Through understanding of Java, J2EE, XAI and Scripting as well as Middleware platforms used for integration.
  • Experience of at least 1 or 2 full-cycle upgrade projects for a utility (Electricity/Water/ Gas Domain) with hands on technical and deployment experience in Oracle CC&B.
  • Familiarity with process integration of CC& B with other utility enterprise and operational systems such as core WAM, MDM, EBS, NMS, etc.
  • Very good knowledge in Oracle Utilities Application Framework (OUAF)
  • Hands on experience in Oracle CC& B Product Architecture, Data Model, web services & BPEL services
  • Should be able to define the technical design – including customizations, integration, converting NFRs in to design and solution etc.
  • Good Programming knowledge in Java, SQL, PL/SQL, Knowledge on scripting Language (Shell Script /Perl/Ant Script/WLST etc.) Good interpersonal communications and analytical ability Strong soft skills required
, '\n',
  • Ready to travel to client locations as needed
, '\n',

INTERESTED CANDIDATES PLEASE SHARE YOUR CV TO ANZTEAM@POWERITSERVICES.COM OR APPLY

, '\n']

title: b'Microsoft Business Intelligence Technical Architect / Consultant\r\n      '
salary: b'Attractive daily rate, perks and career-growth'
jd:
['\n',

This is an amazing career-growth opportunity for a Senior Microsoft Business Intelligence Technical Architect / Consultant with strong experience across SSRS, SSIS, SSAS, Power BI and solid data warehousing skills to join our clients national BI team and work across existing projects and new project deployments for blue-chip ASX listed corporations.

  • Experience in running Workshops, Client meetings, POC’s and building/maintaining client relationships

  • Proven experience building cubes with SSAS- Essential
  • Experience on Power BI – Essential
  • Excellent Dash boarding skills and excellent SSIS development skills - Essential
  • Technically strong in reports development SSRS - Essential

, '\n',
If you are a highly experienced Microsoft Business Intelligence Technical Architect / Consultant possessing all the requisite skills/experience, seeking an opportunity to join a market-leading consultancy, working on projects for ASX listed blue-chip clients, please apply with your resume to jobs@pbisearch.com.au immediately.

Interviewing now! 
, '\n']

title: b'Lead Data Management Analyst\r\n    '
jd:
[' ',

AustralianSuper is for all Australians and businesses; we help invest members' money to create the best possible retirement outcome. More than 2.1 million members trust us to invest more than $105 billion on their behalf. Our size has given us the ability to leverage significant investment opportunities for long term performance and lower fees that are passed onto our members.

, ' ',

We put members first in everything we do and are committed to the recruitment, development and support of a diverse workforce that share our values of Energy, Integrity, Generosity of Spirit and Excellent Outcomes.

, ' ',

Here's where you come in…

, ' ',

To support the growth of AustralianSuper we are seeking a Lead Data Management Analyst who will be responsible for leading a team of Business Analysts in supporting the Investments Platform team, who develop and deploy new investment management platform solutions and improvement initiatives. Reporting to the Manager, Data Architecture and Systems, this role represents an outstanding opportunity to help to on-board new Investment capabilities across new and existing platforms.

, ' ',

In this role, you will provide leadership and technical expertise in the implementation of data management systems.

, ' ',

You'll need…

, ' ',

A demonstrated background as a Senior Business Analyst in the financial services sector, with the capability to lead and develop a small team. It is integral you have broad Investment management knowledge with demonstrated expertise in a range of financial instruments/ asset management domains.

, ' ',

Additionally, you will be a strong communicator, with the ability to build strong relationships and convey your message to a variety of audiences.

, ' ',

If you would like the opportunity to work in a challenging, growing and rapidly evolving environment to deliver outstanding results that benefit members, please apply now!

, ' ',

Please note, this role is deemed to be an Access Person role. Disclosure and Personal Trading requirements apply to the successful candidate

, ' ',

Agencies please note: this vacancy is being managed directly by AustralianSuper's Recruitment team. We will contact our preferred agency partners should we require additional support. Thank you.

, ' ']

title: b'\r\n          IPTV / Software Solutions Architect - Melbourne\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',

AYAN InfoTech is looking for IPTV / Software Solutions Architect to join an exciting project based in Melbourne. The role offers you the opportunity to contribute towards an extremely well structured and mature environment, working on sophisticated enhancement projects.

, '\n',

Role: IPTV / Software Solutions Architect
Location: Melbourne
Contract Duration: 3 Months with possible extensions
Experience: 8 Years

, '\n',

Required Skills & Experience:

, '\n',
  • Solid understanding of architectural patterns, design patterns and hands-on knowledge in applying these concepts to practical problems
  • Experience in working with distributed systems and building/maintaining highly-available applications and services, preferably on a cloud platform such as AWS
  • Ability to systematically analyse and break down requirements to provide scalable architectural solutions that fit into the long term architectural roadmap
  • Solid written and verbal communication skills and the ability to articulate
  • Architectural details to stakeholders at different levels (executive, technical and non-technical) through UML diagrams, crisp documentation and white-boarding as required
  • Experience in building and managing micro-services based applications, with a solid understanding of the challenges presented by the architecture including inter-service communication, service discovery, distributed log collection, monitoring and independent scaling of services, etc.
  • Experience in working with asynchronous messaging frameworks such as RabbitMQ and Service Oriented Architecture (SOA)
  • Experience in data-modelling using RDBMS (Oracle, MySQL, etc.) and NoSQL databases (MongoDB, couchbase, DynamoDB, Cassandra, etc.), with a clear understanding of the right database for a given solution and the best practices around using that database solution
  • Experience in modelling data for, and using search solutions such as Solar, Elastic Search, etc.
  • Hands-on experience in building, designing and using web services, preferably REST APIs Understanding of API gateways, API lifecycle management and other considerations such as throttling/rate-limiting, secure access, etc.,
  • Preferably with hands-on experience on Apigee products such as Edge and BaaS
  • Understanding of application security considerations including regulations around Personally Identifiable Information, controlling access to services, financial transactions, etc.
  • Experience working in an Agile environment and the ability to work in a constantly evolving project, without losing sight of the requirements or the overall vision
  • Hands-on development experience in at least one Object Oriented Programming language such as Java Understanding of online video domain and the basics around streaming formats, delivery models, content protection, etc. is highly preferred
  • Self-motivated, analytical and driven to overcome challenges
  • Good oral and written communication skill, Customer interaction skill and collaborative team working.
, '\n',


Please note we will be able to contact only shortlisted candidates for this role. We thank you in advance for your interest.

, '\n']

title: b'SAP Development Architect\r\n    '
jd:
['\n',

As a development architect, you will be responsible for contributing to overall architecture of the solution, helping and guiding other developers solving complex technical problems. Our client is a leading organisation currently undertaking a SAP major transformation initiative across the organisation. This is a newly created role due to organisational growth and the project pipeline. 

, '\n',

Key Responsibilities

, '\n',
  • Build robust and scalable solution bringing in software engineering best practices.
  • Work closely with Internal and External stake holders gathering requirements and presenting technical point of view. 
  • Contribute to design and hands on development of multiple projects in different phases, ranging from early stage concepts to evolving products.
  • You will work with cross functional teams and collaborate with other teams in SAP to develop scalable and robust solutions. 
  • Define & Implement Development architecture/code modularization in ABAP
  • Custodian of Development standards for SAP stack (includes ABAP & Java)
  • Implement Test Driven Development framework (TDD) for ABAP
  • Optimise SAP batch/workflows (ideally a batch free environment)
  • Implement API architecture for SAP
  • Implement a transition free environment to ops (No Service Support Guide)
  • Implement Development Dashboards across CRM & IS-U landscapes 
, '\n',

Key Requirements

, '\n',
  • Minimum of 10-15 years of experience a SAP Development Developer/Architect, 5 full implementation life cycles in SAP Development teams.
  • Bringing a multifunctional team together and working as a single team
  • Significantly improving delivery costs whilst not compromising quality
  • Implementing New Products in a quickly evolving landscape
  • Exceptional interpersonal, presentation and communication skills
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Demonstrable initiative and ability to work without close supervision
, '\n',

Technical Skills

, '\n',
  • SAP Programming: ABAP, ABAP Objects, ABAP Query, ALV, BADIs, BAPIs, BSPs.
  • Knowledge and experience with Agile Software Engineering in ABAP and using TDD (Test Driven Development)
  • SAP Business Objects Data Services, SFTP, SAP Enterprise Portal, SAP Business Connector, SAP DCOM Connector, SAP Netweaver.
  • eCATT, SQL Server, MSDE, Oracle, mySQL, Microsoft Windows, Unix, HTML
  • Experience working with SAP CHARM, Rev-Trac and or Transport Expresso
  • Experience with Non SAP: VB , ASP, Microsoft DNA Web Development, VB Script, Java Script, ADO, COM is desirable
, '\n',

To be considered for this role please hit the 'APPLY FOR THIS JOB' button or call Xavier at MARS Recruitment on 03 9448 3010. 

, '\n']

['\n',

At Coles, we're passionate about creating the best customer experience and we're always on the lookout for people who share our passion.

flybuys will give you the opportunity to work with some of the richest customer data in the country whilst being a part of a team delivering world class retail loyalty analytics. You will be presented genuine opportunities to grow your career and be a part of a collaborative, innovative and supportive environment where diversity is valued.

This role will be reporting directly into the Manager of Advanced Analytics - flybuys and be responsible for:

, '\n',
  • Design of the data ecosystem required to deliver the Analytics roadmap
    o Designing the ecosystem for analytical data assets
    o Design and implement processes around data-loading, data-transformation, feature construction, insights, modelling and productionisation of data assets
    o Contribute to the design of algorithmic solutions for projects on the analytics roadmap
  • Building data assets and feature stores required for CTM
    o Setting up processes to ensure integrity around data asset
    o Building documentation and communicating processes / methodologies to internal and external stakeholders
    o Ensure data fluidity between the big data platform and existing platforms
  • Working closely with different stakeholders (IT / Coles Online / etc) to get relevant data available into the big data platform and setting up processes that facilitate the development of data assets
    o Identifying relevant data sets that will provide analytical value
    o Communicate with the wider flybuys and Coles team around the data assets to demonstrate the usage and value of the asset
, '\n',

The successful candidate will have:

, '\n',
  • An analytics professional background with a proven track record in business insights or intelligence unit or IT
  • Great influencing and relationship building skills
  • Proficient understanding of distributed computing principles and data management
  • Working knowledge in data mining, machine learning, natural language processing, or information retrieval
  • Proficient in designing efficient and robust ETL workflows and data modelling
  • Be able to deliver value-add business solutions
  • Team player / Collaborator working with others to clarify requirements
  • Be able to tune Hadoop solutions / or work with IT architects to improve performance and end-user experience
  • Good knowledge of querying tools, such as SQL, Pig, Hive, and Impala
  • Excellent knowledge of R, Python, Scala
, '\n',

Culture

, '\n',

Coles is a fast-paced, constantly changing business that focuses your talents and challenges you to perform at your best. As a team, we're bold with ideas and operate with pace and passion, always looking for better ways to transform retail and delight customers. At Coles, we aim to ensure our team represents the community we serve, embracing the richness of Australia's diverse population.

, '\n',

Benefits

Not only will you receive a competitive salary, you'll also have access to these great benefits:

, '\n',
  • Cheaper groceries and other products. You'll get a 5% discount when shopping at Coles, Kmart, Officeworks and Target
  • Learn new skills and develop your existing capabilities. We provide excellent ongoing training and development
  • Take your experience to the next level. We always have new opportunities to help you build a great career
  • 12 weeks of paid Parental Leave for primary care givers and 1 week of paid leave for secondary care givers
  • No need to pay for car parking. You can park your car in our multi-level car park, which is exclusive to our team
, '\n',

About Us

With over 100,000 team members, over 2,200 retail outlets and the huge corporate support infrastructure behind these, Coles is one of the most significant businesses in Australia. This scope and its positive approach to lateral moves means employees have an amazing environment to apply and develop talents, opportunities to achieve significant goals personally and professionally, and to build and pursue an interesting career.

, '\n',

The pace of our business has made it a gathering place for passionate and talented people. In this environment, team members draw the motivation, focus, determination and personal growth required to achieve more, faster.

, '\n',

How to apply

, '\n',

If you have the drive to achieve your best every day, then our team is waiting to transform your talents.
Click "Apply" to complete an application form and upload your current resume.

, '\n',

Please Note
We prefer to deal with you directly and have not engaged an agency for this role, so if you're interested, please apply.

, '\n']

title: b'Junior Big Data Engineer - Melbourne\r\n      '
jd:
[About us,
, '\n', EYC3 is the data and advanced analytics capability within EY Asia-Pacific working in multiple sectors including financial services, government & public sector, energy, mining & metals, and consumer products.  We have more than 250 specialist staff in Australia, New Zealand, Singapore, Hong Kong, Korea, The Philippines and Malaysia. EYC3 creates intelligent client organizations using data & advanced analytics. We implement information-driven strategies and systems that help grow, optimize and protect client organizations, and create a lasting culture that encourages people to use information creatively and intelligently to improve business outcomes. We go beyond strategy and provide end to end implementation of real life data environments and have some of the best architects, project managers, business analysts, data scientist, big data engineers, developers and consultants in the region. 
 
Due to our continued growth we are looking for a Junior Big Data Engineer to join our Melbourne team.  , '\n',

About you
To qualify for a this position, you must have:
 
- A degree in Computer Science / Software Engineering

- An effective communicator (verbally and in writing)

For a career move that expands your horizons, apply today and join a firm that is committed to building an inclusive culture that supports a diverse workforce, helping you to gain experiences that will set you up for a lifetime.
 
 
Apply now

Your new company
This critical government department is looking for an experienced Data Warehouse/ ETL Developer with specific experience of developing Azure cloud based data warehouse and ETL processes. This role will be based in the companies Head Quarters in Melbourne CBD for an initial 3 month engagement (extension thereafter as required).

title: b'Senior Systems Analyst\r\n      '
jd:
[
, ' ',

About the role

, ' ',

his role will allow you to apply your well-developed Systems Analyst skills and experiences, including in respect of producing high-quality Business Requirements documentation, supporting the Business Analyst team, working with our Enterprise Architect and vendors to develop solutions, lead process design, data modelling and business rule development and work with business stakeholders to manage all functional specifications for assigned projects, lead system test and sign-off phases of projects, work closely with end-users and secure User Acceptance Sign-Off. This is an initial 12 month appointment with a strong chance of extension. This role has the ability to be based in either Melbourne or Canberra.

, ' ',

About Engineers Australia

, ' ',

With over 100,000 members, Engineers Australia is the voice of the engineering profession in Australia. We are focused on the advancement of engineering and the professional development of our members through every stage of their careers.

, ' ',

About the role

, ' ',

Reporting to the ICT Senior Project Manager, and as part of our ICT team, your role will see you draw heavily on your past skills and experiences with a view to achieving the following:  

, ' ',

1. An advanced ability to understand & review the documented Business Requirements with a view to:

, ' ',

a. Supporting the Senior Business Analyst in their work;

, ' ',

b.Calling out inconsistencies/omissions/corrections to the Business Requirements;

, ' ',

c. Working with the Enterprise Architect & potential Vendors to propose Solution Options including:

, ' ',
  • High level Solution Architecture;
  • Assessing complexity & risk for each Solution Option;
  • Assessing the degree of fit with the existing technical environment;
  • Assessing the required technical skill-sets;
  • Assessing on-going support requirements;
  • Ball-park costing for each Solution Option;
  • Recommending a preferred solution.
, ' ',

d. Further detailing the:

, ' ',
  • Process design;
  • Data model;
  • Business rules;
, ' ',

2. An advanced ability to work with the Business Stakeholder(s), Business Analyst & Enterprise Architect to:

, ' ',
  • Produce & maintain the Functional Specifications(s) for the duration of the project;
  • Produce & maintain the Non-Functional Specification(s) for the duration of the project;
  • Produce & maintain the Test Plan/Test Cases for the duration of the project;
  • Produce & maintain the Solution Architecture for the duration of the project;
, ' ',

3. An advanced ability to work with the appointed Build Team(s) to:

, ' ',
  • Review and approve Solution Design documentation provided by the appointed Build Teams;
  • Test delivered technical components in the DEVELOPMENT Environment and log defects in CodeBase;
  • Approve deployments of working sub-systems into the TEST Environment;
  • Test the working sub-systems and log defects in CodeBase;
  • Work with the appointed Build Teams to ensure timely resolution of recorded CodeBase defects.
, ' ',

4. An advanced ability to work with the appointed Business Acceptance Testers to:

, ' ',
  • Provide direction on what they need to test?
  • Provide direction on how to conduct their testing;
  • Provide direction on how to record their findings;
  • Be the primary point of contact for discussing defects/enhancements;
  • Secure User Acceptance Sign-Off;
, ' ',

5. An advanced ability to work with the Project Manager regarding:

, ' ',
  • Change Requests for enhancements;
  • The status of the design/build/testing activities;
  • Senior Systems Analyst sign-off that the functionality (sprints) are working according to specification;
  • Updates to the Project Schedule;
  • Updates on issues delaying project progress
  • Involvement in Project Status Meetings.
, ' ',

Further, your experience in working with:   

, ' ',
  • Web Based Solutions;
  • Drupal/php; and
  • Oracle Middleware
, ' ',

               -  will be highly valued and regarded.

, ' ',

To succeed in this Role….

, ' ',

As the successful applicant you will be a skilled senior-level systems analyst professional, with a strong blend of solution design/delivery and project leadership. In addition to your influencing and decision-making skills in an ICT setting, you will bring a comprehensive understanding of ICT systems and solutions, have well-developed problem-solving skills and will be comfortable communicating across all levels of the organisation.  

, ' ',

Want to apply or know more?

, ' ',

If you have the necessary skills, energy, drive and experience to excel in our opportunity, please submit a covering letter and Resume by clicking the 'Apply for this Job' button below.

, ' ',

If you need more information, or wish to request a copy of the Position Description, please contact us at hr@engineersaustralia.org.au

, ' ',

Applications Close Monday 10 April 2017

, ' ']

As a Domain/Enterprise Architect you will be the go-to person across the design, management and overall digital transformation of the Wealth division.

, ' ',

This is a permanent role based in Melbourne, with a competitive salary on offer. To be successfully short listed for this position you must have Australian Working Rights.  

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

For further details and/or to express your interest apply now or send your resume (word format) to marie.s@interpropeople.com. Alternatively feel free to give Marie Sideris a call on 03 8592 7817.

, ' ',

Please note: only candidates who meet all of the above criteria will be shortlisted and contacted. 

, ' ']

['A leading consultancy is expanding their Architecture Practice and is seeking an accomplished Enterprise Architect to join their team. Based out of their Melbourne office, the successful candidate will be responsible for engaging with enterprise clients and consulting on their applications architecture. Responsible for designing and overseeing the implementation of your proposed solution, the successful candidate must be highly consultative and well versed in presenting and engaging with senior stakeholders.\xa0\xa0Experience in the health insurance industry would be highly regarded. ',
, ' ',  , '\xa0',
, ' ', Key responsibilities will include:,
, ' ',
  • Leads and/or participates in application strategy consulting engagements with clients, assessing the current state portfolio for health, risk etc., designing a future state in accordance with business and technical strategy and best practices (including Cloud and as-a-Service solutions), and planning, presenting and gaining buy-in from client decision-makers on a roadmap to the future state.
  • Gathers technical requirements and translates requirements into hardware and software capabilities 
  • Communicates technical architecture direction and coordinates technical proof of concept analyses 
  • Develops required work products for technology, application, and data domains of change 
  • Provides leadership and work guidance to less experienced personnel 
  • Communicates in formal presentation settings including proposal orals, client workshops and regional internal events; develops proposal sections, methodology work products and formal written deliverables 
, ' \xa0\xa0',
, ' ', To be considered for this position essential requirements include:,
, ' ',
  • Bachelor's degree in IT or related field
  • Five or more years of consulting experience with technical architecture analysis and design
  • Experience with formal architecture methodology eg. TOGAF
  • Knowledge and experience in cloud or web-scale application design, cloud readiness assessment, cloud migration
  • Knowledge and experience in DevOps concepts and practice
  • Knowledge and experience in Sparx EA or equivalent modelling tool(s)
  • Technical knowledge of application development (in one or more modern enterprise languages etc. Java, C#) , system design, IT infrastructure and database concepts
, ' \xa0A senior role, the successful candidate will be rewarded with an attractive remuneration package and challenging project work. APPLY today to secure your new role. Got questions? Contact Alana on 02 9236 4500.',
, ' \xa0',
, ' Please note, this position is based in Melbourne. ']

title: b'VMware(NSX) Linux SME (AWS)\r\n    '
jd:
[' ',

A leading organisation within the financial domain has exponentially expanded; therefore, there is a need for an experienced VMware Linux SME to fill a Permanent - Full-time position based in Melbourne. Work with a team made up of skilled resources and creative thinkers, to elevate the organisation to new heights.

, ' ',

The successful candidate will have worked within enterprise transformation projects and complex environments; they will also be a Linux guru and hold relevant Computer Science/IT Certifications.

, ' ',

Context of the position:

, ' ',
  • Provide the Infrastructure Technology Platform Manager (TPM) input from an Enterprise Cloud Computing perspective to support the development of the overall Infrastructure Platform strategy, in line with the overall business and technology strategy
  • Collaborate with your fellow Systems Administrator SMEs to develop the overall Enterprise Cloud Computing vision, strategy, architecture and policies , with input from the Infrastructure Technology Platform Manager, the Enterprise Architect and other Technology Platform teams
  • Collaborate with your fellow Systems Administrator SMEs to design, communicate and champion the medium to long term project roadmap for the Enterprise Cloud Computing capabilities, both internally and with vendor(s) responsible for delivering the cloud computing services
, ' ',

Skills required:

, ' ',
  • Proven hands-on experience in building and running VMware SDDC, specifically using vRealize suite, NSX, and related products.
  • Experienced in AWS
  • Solid experience in Linux server administration, particularly RHEL, with sound programming/scripting skills.
  • Good working knowledge of Storage Area Networks, ideally Dell Compellent Storage Centre.
  • Experience in AWS via command line interface.
  • Been responsible for the full life cycle of Enterprise Cloud Computing environments.
  • Experience in a DevOps/continuously integrated environment with high levels of automation.
  • Driven value from third party partners in a software defined data centre environment.
  • Contributed to and delivered technology strategies, architecture and policies.
, ' ',

Location: VIC - Melbourne

, ' ',

Type: Permanent - Full-time

, ' ',

Start Date: ASAP

, ' ',

Don’t delay. Apply now!

, ' ',

Apply now online with a Word version of your CV to be registered and please give a call to Jasio Dunford on 03 8319 1233 for a Confidential Discussion or email via jasio.dunford@randstad.com.au

, ' ',

Join my LinkedIn (https://au.linkedin.com/in/jasiodunford)

, ' ']

[' ',

The client:

, ' ',

My client is an established global company who work with complex web-based data applications and cutting edge technology, and are genuine market-leaders.  As a lead developer, join a team of like-minded professionals motivated by creating world-class technology.  

, ' ',

This company offer a highly modern and flexible working environment, with brand new and very cool CBD located offices, and the ability to also work from home as much, or as little, as you like!

, ' ',


You will need to be self-motivated with the ability to successfully prioritise and meet dead-lines.  Excellent interpersonal with written and verbal communication skills are essential as you will need to work well as part of a team or autonomously.  As well, the successful candidate will possess outstanding abilities on the technical side of development, and be a strong communicator.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

The role:

, ' ',

As a result of continued growth a position exists for an affable and talented lead developer who can work across all tiers of an application, and show flair and creativity. 

, ' ',

You will be responsible for the development and on-going growth of new cloud-based services, initially working with and reporting the the Enterprise Architect, and managing a team of high-performing, skilled engineers.

, ' ',

You are someone who enjoys working with colleagues as they enjoy working with you.  As part of this, very highly developed communication skills are pretty much non-negotiable.  

, ' ',

The role is a full-stack one, that will see you do very complex work in both Angular and SQL.  You will have full agile SDLC experience, ideally including DevOps experience around deployment, ElasticSearch, and Cloud.  

, ' ',

The role is particularly suited to someone who wants to fast track their career, because if you prove yourself there are very senior business roles waiting for you within this company in the short-medium term!

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Responsibilities:

, ' ',
  • Lead the development team; play a key role in hiring during a strong growth period; be a mentor 
  • Be intimately involved in strategic decision-making for the organisation
  • Build and Implement complex web applications
  • Maintain and manage application releases.
  • Contribute to the design of projects
  • Have the ability to work with technical precision under tight deadlines.
  • Show personal initiative and independence in achieving outcomes.
  • Possess the ability to work effectively within a team environment.
  • Have a willingness to accept a wide range of responsibilities.
  • Be enthusiastic, indeed passionate, about technology.
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Key skills with proven commercial experience:

, ' ',
  • Strong experience in C# (.NET 4.5/4.0/3.5/2.0), and ASP.Net
  • Experience architecting the data, middleware and application layers
  • Preferable experience working with (public/private/hybrid) cloud platforms
  • Excellent OO design, Web UI design and development
  • Proficient in Web Development Technologies and tools: Visual Studio, MVC, WCF, JQuery, Ajax, JSON Continuous build/integration using Team City, UAT and Production environment support expertise
  • Demonstrated experience with Angular.js
  • Experience with ElasticSearch (Lucene) preferred
, ' ',

Desirable skills include:

, ' ',
  • Azure/AWS
  • ElasticSearch or other similar Lucene based indexes or no-SQL document database
  • DevOps and deployment
  • Big Data processing and management
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

WANT TO KNOW MORE?

, ' ',

If you'd like to know more about what is really a great option for the right person then please, apply now with your CV in Word format for a confidential discussion.  Interview slots exist, but we will wait for the right person.

, ' ',

This is the role you have been waiting for!

, ' ']
