title: b'Solution Designer\r\n      '
jd:
[An exciting opportunity has just come for you to join ANZ as a Solution Architect.,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', • Melbourne CBD location,
, ' ', • 12 months contract ,
, ' ', • Contribute to the Bank’s Regional goal,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', About the role,
, ' ', The Solution Architect takes accountability the specification and design of information systems to meet defined business needs. The Solution Architect interprets conceptual and abstracted designs and translates into implementable design or selection of components within a broader solution design or existing technology implementation.,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', The Solution Architect is responsible for retention of compatibility with enterprise and solution architectures, and the adherence to corporate standards within constraints of cost, security and sustainability to ensure a robust, extensible, fit for purpose, cost effective, enterprise aligned technology solution design to deliver a more simplified, robust, supportable, scalable, extensible and agile capability. As a Solution Architect, you will analyse and interpret functional and non-functional requirements and solution designs to determine a detailed solution within the approved scope and solution design. The solution delivered will be more detailed than the solution architecture, and will be consistent with the solution design, Platform blueprints and roadmaps, and conformant with the platform standards. This design will be used to direct the work of the developers.,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', As the Solution Architect you will maintain ownership and leadership of design thinking and outcomes for your solution scope through the delivery cycle, dealing with issues discovered during development, testing or implementation phases of the project, and where necessary update and re-issue the design artefacts. You are also expected to expand the pool of design knowledge and re-usable designs by thoroughly documenting your work and actively sharing artefacts. As you will generally be involved in the design of solutions you may be required to collaborate with, lead or direct the team of people involved in design and development of components impacted by your solution scope, including domain architects, solution architects, application designers, systems analysts, development leads, and other SMEs as appropriate.,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', Outcome Expected: For any given business problem or opportunity, you will be expected to demonstrate excellent Design Thinking, Articulation of Design,
, ' ', (both verbal and written), Innovation in Design and Adherence to standards / governance norms. This should lead to fit for purpose designs and should be,
, ' ', captured and documented in ANZ standard artefacts.,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', Interaction: Works with stakeholders on day-to-day basis, such as Heads of Strategy & Architecture, Domain Architects, Solution Architects, other Designers, System Analysts, Delivery Managers, Project Managers, development leads / engineers, and technical SMEs, Infrastructure, Information Security, and Application Support and other technical staff across ANZ.,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', Adhere to IT Strategy, standards & Best Practices: Develops and designs specific architecture or design deliverables that are consistent with the,
, ' ', overarching Enterprise architectural policies and standards.,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', Exercise Reuse/Use across the Group: Identifies opportunities to leverage synergies across projects and Business Unit boundaries.,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', Provide Consultation: Provides technical consultancy and guides the development activity that occurs during the build &test phase of the project. Clearly,
, ' ', defines the scope of the solution and communicate the fundamentals of the solution to a diverse range of stakeholders,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', Maintain & Acquire Knowledge: Maintains current knowledge of the technologies and business practices within area of responsibility.,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', Plan Statement of Work: Provides input into the formulation of estimates, plans and budgets in relation to the design & development of ,
, ' ', application systems.,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', Review & Governance: Undertakes peer review of others designs to ensure compliance with established standards, performance guidelines and strategies.,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', Other: Performs analytical assignments as required by the Platform Architect or Delivery Manager, particularly in areas of difficulty and/or critical need.,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', About You  ,
, ' ', To be successful in this role, you will ideally bring the following:,
, ' ', • Has actively been involved in the implementation of Big Data technologies. This doesn’t mean a just developing a paper based reference architecture, or a proof of concept in a lab, but a production implementation,
, ' ', • Understands the analytics/insights lifecycle,
, ' ', • Technologies: ,
, ' ',    -Big Data: Apache Kafka, Apache Spark, Apache Hive, Apache Impala, Cloudera,
, ' ',    -Traditional Data: Teradata, ETL tools like IBM Datastage or Ab Initio,
, ' ',    -Analytics platforms like R, SAAS,
, ' ',    -BI/Discovery platforms like QlikView/QlikSense, OBIEE, Tableau, Microsoft ,
, ' ', • DevOps tooling experience / Working in agile environments,
, ' ', • The usual list of soft skills for an architect e.g. Influencing, Building Relationships, Effective Communication, Leading High Performing teams ,
, ' ', • They should be equally comfortable engaging business stakeholders to understand use cases to generate value from data (customer analytics etc), and engineering teams around architecture,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', About ANZ,
, ' ', ANZ is a leading regional bank with representation in 34 markets, focusing on core markets in Australia, New Zealand and Asia Pacific. As we continue our journey to build our global business and support our customers, we’re committed to attracting and retaining the best talent. We’ve made it our business to be an organisation where people strive, and are rewarded, for excellence.,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', At ANZ we aim to create a work environment where employee differences such as gender, age, culture, disability, sexual orientation, family and caring responsibilities and religion are valued.,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', Watch our Global Stories to see how ANZ aims to meet the needs of our customers and to attract and retain the best people in a changing world (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JK__FGv4dNU).,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', We work flexibly at ANZ. Talk to us about how this role could be flexible for you.,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', This is an opportunity to undertake a role offering exceptional opportunities for professional development with a broad range of career paths. It’s a place where the determined can succeed, the willing can grow and together, we can prosper.,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', We connect you to your world of opportunity.,
, ' ',  ,
, ' ', To find out more about working at ANZ or to view other opportunities visit www.anz.com/careers., ' ',

, ' ']

title: b'Enterprise Architect\r\n    '
jd:
[' ',

My client is clearly recognised as a true global leader yet continue to evolve, transform and push the boundaries of innovative technologies to provide a truly rewarding customer experience. As a result of this appetite to grow and become genuine disrupters in a highly competitive industry, we are looking to appoint an Enterprise Architect to take control of developing and implementing these key organisational strategies.

, ' ',

Reporting into the Head of Architecture & Strategy, you will ultimately charged with providing forward thinking architecture consulting services to the key business units and in turn helping to devise technology road-maps to drive innovation. Alongside this, you will take accountability for leading technology market scanning to personally identify the next key trends and providing leadership and personal development across the growing environment.

, ' ',

The successful candidate will have relevent tertiary qualifications as well demonstrating at least 5 years as an Enterprise Architect, with key a focus on digital and data strategies in large and complex environments. You will also be able to manage senior stakeholders up to C-level, showing great influencing and analytical skills.

, ' ',

This really is a unique opportunity to play a key and pivotal role in changing the way a whole industry will work through disruptive, customer focused technologies.

, ' ',

For further information, please contact Niall Ross on 03 86291016 or at

, ' ']

title: b'\r\n          Data Scientist\r\n        '
jd:

The successful candidate must have a hunger and passion for problem solving and must not be shy to take a hands on approach. You will be part of an excellent team with the opportunity to learn from Senior Data Scientists/Engineers and grow alongside the ever expanding team.',

  • Use Machine Learning tools and advanced analytics to uncover trends and patters among large data sets to uncover and solve business problems.

  • Work alongside Data Architects to develop automated analytics using machine learning tools.

, ' ',

, ' ']

title: b'Lead Dynamics 365 (CRM) Consultant - Major Dynamics 365/CRM Player - Lead Role !\r\n    '
jd:
['\n',

Absolute fantastic opportunity for experienced Dynamics CRM Consultant to move into an organisation that can offer real personal and professional growth in your Dynamics CRM career

, '\n',

Working here, You will enjoy: 

, '\n',
  • The opportunity to finally play the Lead role on Enterprise-Level Projects
  • Working on some of the earliest and biggest Dynamics 365 projects in Australia
  • A culture that is all about rising to the challenge, delivering excellence and having fun
  • A competitive salary package along with excellent employee benefits, bonuses and a real focus on work/life balance
, '\n',

The Company

, '\n',

This is one of the leading business software & technology provider in Australia, with over a 1,000 customers and relationships with most of the major software providers. There is an outstanding team of committed and knowledgeable professionals who thrive on providing expert consulting, development and advisory services.

, '\n',

The Role

, '\n',

As the Lead member of the CRM and Marketing Automation team you will be responsible for the design and development of Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM-based solutions (including Field Service, Professional Services Automations and Marketing Automation) to meet customer's business objectives.

, '\n',

This role will not only include hands-on development, but working collaboratively with customer stakeholders, including executives and end-users, to:

, '\n',
  • optimize business process design and the use of standard MS Dynamics 365 capabilities
  • promote customer relationship management best practice and
  • consistently implement and leverage MS Dynamics 365 using best development and implementation methodologies.
, '\n',

Responsibilities will include:

, '\n',

You will be responsible for, from a Leading perspective:

, '\n',
  • Hands-on technical implementation and deployment of Microsoft Dynamics CRM 2013 onwards
  • Configuration services to meet the customer's requirements using Microsoft Dynamics CRM Customization Tool, Workflow Tool, or SDK
  • Identify creative workarounds to meet requirements without the development of custom code
  • Conduct detailed scoping workshops and develop high level project work plans
  • Provide configuration and development estimates.
  • Understand the functional capabilities and limitations for out of the box functionality as well as custom code
  • Develop detailed functional and technical specifications
  • Design and integrate business processes and data flows between CRM applications and other applications, such as back office/ERP applications
  • Train customer personnel on the use and administration of Microsoft Dynamics CRM (including functional user and technical training)
  • Develop and implement data conversion and testing strategies
  • Lead technical discussions with customer stakeholders
, '\n',

Software & IT Skills Required:

, '\n',
  • 3-5+ years of Dynamics 365 / Dynamics CRM Development experience is required (latest version preferred)
  • CRM development or integration best practices
  • CRM forms, views, workflows, plugins and reports development
  • Technical specification documentation
  • Experience developing plug-ins and interfaces with other systems
  • Architect/design CRM system, related customizations, portals, and reports
  • 3-5+ years of CRM SDK and Developers Toolkit
  • Data migration experience and integration mappings using SQL Integration Services, Scribe or Web Services
  • SQL Reporting Services preferred
  • Hands on experience of analysis in a web development environment
  • Minimum 5 years consulting experience preferred
  • Significant experience and understanding of sales management, marketing, and/or customer service processes
  • Desirable experience with Project Services Automation, Field Services and ADX Studio.
, '\n',

Melbourne CBD-Based Role

, '\n',

Apply now, in strictest confidence, to daniel@etegroup.com.au , hit the APPLY tab, or call Daniel on +61 427 697 901.

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

ETE Group have one of the most extensive networks of Dynamics & SharePoint customers in Australia & New Zealand and always have several openings for experienced Dynamics & SharePoint professionals. If this role doesn't quite suit your requirements, please feel free to call or email for a consultation and I can hopefully provide another opportunity that isn't currently advertised.

, '\n',

 

, '\n']

title: b'Solution Architect\r\n      '
jd:

, ' ', Role:
,
, ' The primary objective of the Networking Solutions Architect is to ensure the design of solutions that enable automated and virtualised computing across client environments. They operate across BU, providing integrated BU solutions. \xa0To\xa0collaborate with clients, account executives and engineers to understand business requirements, design architectures and deliver professional proposals. A\xa0consultative technology and solution focused specialist who has the ability to create excellent client relationships with their technical expertise in solutions. In addition to being viewed as a trusted technical advisor to the client, the Networking Solutions Architect will also have responsibility for solution design and business development.',
, ' ',
, ' ', Responsibilities:
,
, ' Take responsibility for solution design and business development.\xa0Participate in and/or lead scope of work determination.\xa0Provide assistance on Networking solutions, product plans and roadmaps.\xa0Understand the client’s environment, business needs and provide expertise and consulting on the relevant solutions. \xa0Co-ordinate hardware and software quotations with account teams. \xa0Develop and deliver scope of works, hour/cost estimates, professional proposals and design documentation. \xa0Ensure the implementation of the solution using project management principles.',
, ' ',
, ' ', Experience and abilities:
,
, ' Extensive experience as a network architect or a similar roles including routing, switching and wireless.',
, ' Cisco certified - CCNP / CCDP /CCIE would be prefered',
, ' Experience in designing large scale campus or data centre networks',

, ' ',

['\n',

Urgent initial 6 month Contract opportunity for a Senior IT Solution Architect.

, '\n',

The IT Solution Architect will provide Strategy & Architecture Services, including governance and guidance on strategic IT planning, sourcing and technology direction to achieve its business objectives and maximize the value of its IT investments.

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

This position leads the development of architectures for complex systems, ensuring consistency with specified requirements agreed with both external, and internal customers. Takes full responsibility for the balance between functional, service quality and systems management requirements within a significant area of the organisation. Establishes policy and strategy for the selection of systems architecture components, and co-ordinates design activities, promoting the discipline to ensure consistency. Ensures that appropriate corporate, industry, national and international standards are adhered to. Within a business change program, manages the target design, policies and standards, working proactively to maintain a stable, viable architecture and ensure consistency of design across projects within the program.

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

The Solutions Architect will hold extensive and broadly based relevant IT Technical, Applications & Information Architecture experience and /or tertiary qualification in a relevant IT field with extensive experience as a computing professional engaged in Architectural assignments and in the management of IT projects. 

, '\n',
  • Experience in developing and presenting IT Solution Architecture models.
  • Strong understanding of IT Architecture and IT Governance requirements including Data, Information & Technology Architectural elements
  • Experience in reviewing IT project proposals and changes for compliance to Architectural standards
  • Broad and extensive technical knowledge to allow a balanced view to be maintained.
  • Flexibility and ability to manage multiple tasks and deadlines.
  • Ability to plan and meet targets (financial, deliverables and time based).
  • Ability to provide direction.
  • Ability to apply change management principles.
  • Experience in all aspect of SDLC requirements
  • Issue resolution and management
  • Responsible for reviewing and reporting on all IT projects and changes, prior to their approval, to confirm that compliance with IT Architectural standards.
  • Provision of IT Architecture related advice and guidance to Business Groups, IT Vendors and IT Services.
  • Development and delivery of relevant IT Architectural training/familiarization for both IT and the business.
  • Solution Architecture for IT projects and operations encompassing implementation and support considerations.
  • Create, maintain and review technical architecture standards and guidelines where relevant.
  • Lead or participate in the creation of methodologies related to the creation of enterprise-wide Architecture artifacts.
  • Be responsible for conceptual, logical, and physical system designs for new and ongoing projects
  • Provide advice and support to Manager Digital Strategy & Innovation for the delivery and maintenance of Digital Strategy and Implementation plan.
  • Recommend improvements to the IT Architectural Governance framework and Strategy
, '\n',

 

, '\n',

The key to securing this role is not only your experience as a senior IT Solution Architect but also your communication skills working with Senior stakeholders in a changing environment!

, '\n',

Due to the number of  responses only suitable candidates will be contacted. 

, '\n']

['A leading consultancy is expanding their Architecture Practice and is seeking an accomplished Enterprise Architect to join their team. Based out of their Melbourne office, the successful candidate will be responsible for engaging with enterprise clients and consulting on their applications architecture. Responsible for designing and overseeing the implementation of your proposed solution, the successful candidate must be highly consultative and well versed in presenting and engaging with senior stakeholders.\xa0\xa0Experience in the health insurance industry would be highly regarded. ',
, ' ',  , '\xa0',
, ' ', Key responsibilities will include:,
, ' ',
  • Leads and/or participates in application strategy consulting engagements with clients, assessing the current state portfolio for health, risk etc., designing a future state in accordance with business and technical strategy and best practices (including Cloud and as-a-Service solutions), and planning, presenting and gaining buy-in from client decision-makers on a roadmap to the future state.
  • Gathers technical requirements and translates requirements into hardware and software capabilities 
  • Communicates technical architecture direction and coordinates technical proof of concept analyses 
  • Develops required work products for technology, application, and data domains of change 
  • Provides leadership and work guidance to less experienced personnel 
  • Communicates in formal presentation settings including proposal orals, client workshops and regional internal events; develops proposal sections, methodology work products and formal written deliverables 
, ' \xa0\xa0',
, ' ', To be considered for this position essential requirements include:,
, ' ',
  • Bachelor's degree in IT or related field
  • Five or more years of consulting experience with technical architecture analysis and design
  • Experience with formal architecture methodology eg. TOGAF
  • Knowledge and experience in cloud or web-scale application design, cloud readiness assessment, cloud migration
  • Knowledge and experience in DevOps concepts and practice
  • Knowledge and experience in Sparx EA or equivalent modelling tool(s)
  • Technical knowledge of application development (in one or more modern enterprise languages etc. Java, C#) , system design, IT infrastructure and database concepts
, ' \xa0A senior role, the successful candidate will be rewarded with an attractive remuneration package and challenging project work. APPLY today to secure your new role. Got questions? Contact Alana on 02 9236 4500.',
, ' \xa0',
, ' Please note, this position is based in Melbourne. ']

title: b'Azure Solutions Architect\r\n    '

We're positioned to lead the change in the biggest transformation that the IT industry has seen in decades — and we need your talent, skill, and ambitious ideas. title: b'\r\n          Data Analyst\r\n        '
jd:
[' ',

 As a Product Data Analyst, you will maintain, update and quality control the CANSTAR database which is used by the majority of Australia's major financial institutions in both the banking and insurance sectors.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

What you will be doing

, ' ',

Product Management

, ' ',
  • Demonstrate knowledge of assigned product sectors within banking and general insurance, as evidenced by an understanding of the market, products, providers and consumer usage
  • Assist Research Analysts with ensuring databases sufficiently capture market changes and providing suggestions for improvements
  • Work collaboratively with Research Analysts to ensure the timely delivery of product action items
, ' ',

Data Management

, ' ',
  • Maintain and update a product database in accordance with assigned product areas
  • Update all data accurately and in a timely manner, ensuring a <0.5% error rate
  • Contribute proactively to the continuous improvement of data quality
  • Proactively follow up on the submission of Star Ratings audits to meet deadlines
, ' ',

Communication

, ' ',
  • Build trusting relationships with institutional contacts in order to maintain timely and accurate data
  • Respond to queries about assigned product sectors both internally and externally
  • Assist with all customer queries promptly and efficiently
  • Supply requested data to both internal and external stakeholders
  • Contribute actively in all Star Ratings meeting
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

What you will need to bring to the role

, ' ',
  • Entry level role for an individual experienced in data entry or with a background in banking
  • Competent with Microsoft Office, specifically Excel
  • High attention to detail and level of accuracy
  • Excellent time management
  • Ability to work both closely with others and independently as required
  • Confident communicating at a range of technical levels
  • Strong internal and external stakeholder management
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

What would give you the extra edge

, ' ',
  • Knowledge of banking and financial products is highly desirable
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Why Canstar?

, ' ',
  • Supportive and flexible working environment
  • Birthday leave
  • Free breakfast and fresh fruit
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Subsidised massages
  • Fun social club and company culture
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

How can you join our team?

, ' ',

If this sounds like you, and you are up for a fresh challenge with a great company, apply now. To apply for this position please send a copy of your resume and expression of interest to bianca.berry@canstar.com.au quoting the job title.  Applications close 5pm 19th May, 2017.

, ' ']

title: b'Data Analyst - Customer Insights, Loyalty & Campaigns\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

We are seeking a Data Analyst who is passionate about helping brands understand their customers through data insights. Use your analytical, critical thinking, and technical skills to analyse data to identify customer behaviours, help develop marketing automation campaigns, and present actionable insights.

, '\n',

Join us and together we can create customers for life.

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

You'll have

, '\n',

  • Demonstrable problem-solving skills using SQL for data extraction, manipulation and analysis

  • The ability to analyse, interpret and communicate insights drawn from multiple data sources. Exposure to data visualisation tools such as Tableau an advantage

  • The ability to work on multiple streams with multiple clients in an agile, iterative environment

  • Keen interest in customer loyalty and retail analytics for marketing programs

  • Strong attention to detail with a focus on quality, and sound organisational skills

  • Commercial acumen with ability to strategize, analyse, and articulate insights

  • Working knowledge of web, database, and marketing technologies

  • Hands on experience in a data-related function. Directly applicable experience (Campaign, Insights, BI Analyst, or Statistical Modeller) highly regarded but not essential

  • Understanding of the retail and consumer marketing industry would be ideal

  • Strong and confident verbal and written English communications skills

  • Comprehension of both technical and business language

  • Tertiary education in Business, Marketing, Computer Science, Statistics, or Mathematics
     

, '\n',

And bring:

, '\n',

  • Passion for identifying commercial insights that deliver client value and create exceptional data­-driven campaigns/marketing programmes

  • Passion for utilizing the commercial value of data

  • A self-motivated and goal-oriented work ethic

  • Ability to adapt to change quickly

  • A solutions-focused, lateral thinking approach

  • Willingness to be a team player, contributor and collaborator

  • Commitment to bringing innovation and inspiration to your work and team
     

, '\n',

To:

, '\n',

  • Use your critical thinking to analyse data and translate it into actionable insights

  • Drive the data side of the campaign and program development process from requirements, prospect segmentation and selection through to quality control, measurement and ongoing optimisation

  • Create business intelligence reporting and interactive dashboards reporting using Tableau for our iCentral platform

  • Provide analytical support and recommendations to enhance campaign and program effectiveness, and to inform strategic, tactical and operational decisions

  • Use transactional, other behavioural and demographic data to create segmentation models for tactical (target audience selection) and strategic purposes, with a particular focus on customer retention and growth

  • Liaise with database engineers to ensure data warehouse meets campaign and analysis/reporting requirements

  • Play a role in driving strategic customer program initiatives & campaigns, and identifying customer retention and growth opportunities

  • Develop and maintain industry expertise, keep abreast of trends and new ideas

  • Work collaboratively with cross-disciplined teams to ideate, problem solve, and present the best solutions
, '\n',


What we do:

, '\n',

Since 1997 we've been helping businesses keep and grow their customers. Specialising in creating customers for life, we help businesses understand their customers and develop measurable programs to keep them coming back. We mix technology, science, and marketing to engage customers and drive repeat business for our clients. Some of our brands you'll work alongside include Michael Hill, Suncorp, Flight Centre, Bridgestone, The Coffee Club, Hogs Breath Cafe among many other household names.

, '\n',


Our Culture:

, '\n',

It's the people that really makes us who we are, all with the shared passion for what we do. Our team of Customologists is filled with smart and energetic people who value curiosity, collaboration, contribution, and communication. Our playground-like office is designed to encourage interaction and conversation, with an onsite cafe, gym, swings, putt-putt, garden workspace, and creative breakout spaces.

, '\n',
, '\n']

title: b'Junior SQL Data Analyst (SQL / MS Excel / VBA) - Fantastic Team, Permanent Role.\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

 

, ' ',

One of our leading client is looking for a Junior SQL Data Analyst, to join their team based in the Brisbane CBD. The Data Operations Analyst is responsible for helping business users to get the most value of our corporate data. In conjunction with the Head of Business Intelligence and Business Intelligence Developers, the Data Operations Analyst will monitor data extract requests from business users and apply advanced SQL skills to provide the correct data sets. The Data Operations Analyst is also responsible for the coordination and execution of data solutions that are part of operations and make sure their outcomes are validated across the organisation.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Successful candidates should have 2+ years of experience in SQL / VBA / Excel. They like people who have the right attitude, who are engaged, energetic and are keen to learn and be taught!

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Experience and Qualifications:

, ' ',

Strong skills on database querying and programming using T-SQL;

, ' ',

Strong Excel VBA skills;

, ' ',

Sound knowledge of database design and implementation;

, ' ',

Strong knowledge of SQL Server Integration Services and ETL best practices;

, ' ',

Solid knowledge of SQL Server Reporting Services;

, ' ',

Relevant Microsoft Certification on SQL Server is desirable;

, ' ',

Excellent communication skills;

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Selection Criteria:

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

title: b'\r\n          Data Analyst (Casual / Part-Time)\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',

About smile.com.au

, '\n',

smile.com.au is a young and dynamic organisation with a growing innovative team. We're on a mission to make quality dental care more accessible for the people of Australia. smile.com.au is experiencing rapid growth as a result of a mission focused, innovative and creative team.

, '\n',

Primary Purpose

, '\n',

There's an exciting future at smile.com.au and in order to support the ongoing growth of smile.com.au we are looking for a motivated, highly organised and proactive Business & Data Analyst who will have the highly rewarding ability to help shape the organisation's rapid growth.

, '\n',

This position requires significant data analytical skills combined with the ability to develop effective business strategies. This person will be a highly effective communicator, ideally with experience informing and persuading senior management by building business and strategic cases.

, '\n',

Duties & Responsibilities

, '\n',
  • Provide strategic guidance to senior management that has the potential to lead to organisation-sweeping changes and grow smile.com.au
  • Undertake and interpret all data analytics to ensure strategic guidance is presented in a measured, justifiable and ROI positive manner.
  • Track any changes implemented by the organisation using our data analytics.
  • Develop and maintain an in-depth working knowledge of smile.com.au, including all products, services and processes.
  • Actively contribute to the identification of opportunities for improvement
  • Continually search, identify and suggest opportunities for business process improvement to increase efficiency and revenue
  • Work closely with management to prioritise member and dentist goals and needs
  • Provide input to help mould business direction, culture and corporate learning
, '\n',

Relevant Experience

, '\n',
  • Strong experience in data analysis (high priority)
  • Experience in developing Excel models from scratch
  • Experience in analysing Google Analytics and informing strategic business decisions
  • Experience in developing business strategies
  • Experience in B2B and B2C service or sales and/or building business and strategic cases (lower priority)
  • Experience working with deadlines 
  • Experience achieving set targets and KPIs
  • Experience in problem solving and finding appropriate solutions independently
  • Experience building strong working relationships
, '\n',

Education & Qualifications

, '\n',

Tertiary qualifications in business, actuarial, mathematics or engineering are preferred

Essential Skill Set

, '\n',
  • Excellent communication (written and verbal) skills
  • Microsoft Excel skills are essential, and a high level of skill is expected
  • High level mathematical skills are essential
  • Modelling will be a key component of this person's skill set
  • Interpretive skills are also essential
  • Strong problem solving skills and ability to think laterally
  • Attention to detail even in high pressure situations
  • Measured decision-making skills, based on primarily quantitative information
  • Be an active team player but also able to work independently
  • Self-motivated and proven ability to work autonomously
  • Enjoys being highly organised
  • Ethical in all dealings
  • Impeccable time management
  • Excellent multi-tasking and organisational skills
  • Persuasive, encouraging and motivating
, '\n',

If you have the experience and attributes outlined, please submit your cover letter and resume with hourly rate expectation. Applications close Monday, 14 May 2017.

, '\n']

title: b'Marketing Data Analyst\r\n      '
jd:
[
, ' ',

We're looking for a passionate Marketing Data Analyst to join the dream team at Youfoodz HQ on Brisbane's Northside in Virginia.

, ' ',

Here at Youfoodz, our mission is simple. We believe in freedom and we think people deserve more of it. We're a rapidly growing, innovative fresh meal company and we're all about giving our customers the convenience of a healthy lifestyle.

, ' ',

Being a customer focused company, our mission is to blow people away not only with our food; but our branding, design, and overall customer experience. Where most people want good, we want amazing! We like to push the envelope and can appreciate ruffling a few feathers to communicate a message

, ' ',

You will work closely with the General Manager & Head of Marketing to coordinate all tasks both directly & indirectly related to data analysis.

, ' ',

But enough about us, let's get down to the nitty gritty! These are the essentials we're looking for:

, ' ',
  • Digital marketer with a passion for data and analytics, ready to use your marketing foundation and data smarts to deliver actionable insights
  • Demonstrated experience (minimum 1-2 years) in analyzing data to answer questions and solve problems, preferably in a B2C or retail environment
  • Problem solving skills & the ability to focus on solutions over problems
  • Able to work in a fast paced team environment
  • Works well under pressure to achieve individual goals & help the team hit our KPI's
  • High attention to detail
  • Experience with Google Analytics
  • Expert skills across the Microsoft Office Suite (particularly Excel) on Mac
  • Excellent (& creative) written and verbal communication skills
  • Great customer service skills - able to always find the positive in any negative situation
  • Ability to take direction, adapt to situations and learn quickly
  • Can handle being proactive and reactive to whatever the market demands
, ' ',

Ideally, you're a marketing data analyst with a natural curiosity to discover how data can be used to answer questions and solve problems. Who knows how to motive themselves & coordinate tasks to achieve goals and hit targets. You'll need to collect, process and perform statistical analyses of data and work on varied projects across different departments.

, ' ',

What You'll Get At Youfoodz HQ:

, ' ',
  • In-house agency vibes
  • Work in a fun team of creative & innovative minds
  • Be a part of the fastest growing company in the industry
  • Sun filled studio with the latest gear
  • Food is everywhere (it's actually overwhelming)
  • Employee Discount Program (never worry about dinner again)
  • Epic staff parties
  • Surrounded by people who love what they do
, ' ',

We're a young, energetic crew at Youfoodz, our success to date is testament to the team we have and we definitely put 110% heart and soul into everything we do. We work hard (and sometimes play harder) and we are looking for someone to join the fam who share our family values.

, ' ',

If you think you've got what we need, we would love you to send through your epic resume and a cover letter explaining why we should want you to be the newest member of our dream team!

, ' ']

jd:
['Our client is looking for a motivated individual to join their team specialising in SQL database development and reporting. The successful candidate will be responsible for data querying, programming and to develop appropriate business reports and provide business insights focused on improving performance and efficiency.',
, ' ',
, ' ', Key Responsibilities: ,
, ' ',
  • Assist with planning and design of database platforms in collaboration with the Business Intelligence and Data Services team.
  • Monitor data requests from the business users and respond to them within agreed SLA time frames.
  • Coordinate and monitor the execution of data solutions.
  • Follow GS007 audit standards when implementing data requests.
  • Follow database development standards and implement industry good practices.
  • Build SSIS packages and develop and deploy SSRS reports.
  • Prompt and efficient turnarounds and assist with ad-hoc report and data analysis requests.
, ' ', Experience Required:, ' ',
  • Database querying and programming

Our local government client is actively seeking to engage a Data Analyst, to analyse data consistency with geo-spatial datasets of the same network.

, ' ',

The primary duties of the role include:

, ' ',
  • Previous experience in analysing datasets within legacy systems.
  • Experience in planning and undertaking data migration.
  • Familiarity with SQL and ability to construct queries against Oracle Databases.
  • Good understanding of the schemas used to represent the Road Inventory (the physical layers of construction that make up the road structure) within Road Inventory.
  • Understanding the geospatial data models used by esri within the Roads & Highways product and other department geospatial data sets.
  • Demonstrated knowledge of Asset Management principals and its application to a road network.
  • Previous experience relating to Asset Management processes and systems, particularly in a transport or infrastructure delivery environment.

If you're ready for a challenge and interested in hearing more - take the next step and APPLY NOW! Or for a confidential discussion, please contact Catherine Horn or Vidya Sadawarte on 3319 7501.

Applications for this role close by 5:00 PM Wednesday, April 26th.

title: b'Marketing Data Analyst\r\n    '
jd:
[' ',

Are you ready to take the next step in your marketing career?

, ' ',

We are on the hunt for an experienced Marketing Data Analyst to join our team. This dynamic role offers the right candidate an excellent work/life balance in a flexible, supportive environment. The focus of the department is to develop and promote Queensland based superannuation funds as well as retaining and growing membership and encouraging loyalty of employers.

, ' ',

Based in Brisbane, the successful candidate will aid the marketing and client relations team in improving customer engagement and identifying new business opportunities through the analysis of member data. You will be responsible for interpreting requirements from the business and using these requirements to design and develop insightful analytics and reporting solutions. This role will require a mix of data-related skills, particularly data manipulation, data analysis and data visualisation.

, ' ',

If this sounds like you, please read on.                                                                         

, ' ',

Your day will look like:  

, ' ',
  • Identifying, extracting, assessing and analysing data, along with the preparation of relevant outputs and solutions (e.g. reports, dashboards and customer segmentations)
  • Supporting the execution of acquisition and retention campaigns
  • Working with stakeholders, to identify and prioritise opportunities for analysis that may be carried out by the broader team
  • Provide analytical data assistance to member segmentation and targeting projects
  • Ensuring ongoing data integrity and managing any data inconsistencies
  • Identifying business development opportunities
, ' ',

To be successful in the role, you will have:

, ' ',
  • Previous experience with high volume data loading, extraction, manipulation, management and reporting
  • Minimum of 3 years experience in converting analytical findings into business insights
  • Advanced knowledge of CRM systems/architectures
  • SQL Server query writing experience
  • Data visualisation reports and dashboards e.g. Tableau, and Google Analytics
  • Demonstrated experience in using email automation software, ideally Vision6
  • Experience with Qualtrics would be advantageous
, ' ',

Why join our team?

, ' ',

This is an outstanding opportunity to join a specialist marketing team and be part of our company's future success. IFAA is an organisation which prides itself on a strong client focus and genuinely valuing its staff. We are dedicated to the mission of delivering successful retirement outcomes for our members. The Company offers excellent training, support towards ongoing study and professional development together with a flexible and friendly work environment.

, ' ',

For a full position description, please visit our website: www.ifaa.com.au

, ' ',

Next steps:

, ' ',

If you are passionate about marketing and providing a quality service to clients, please click Apply now, and include a full career resume (max 6 pages).

, ' ',

Agency candidates will not be considered

, ' ']

title: b'Data Analyst\r\n    '
jd:
['\n',

Do you want to be the person who exceeds your potential?

If you have a desire to succeed and drive your own career, Dimension Data offers you the opportunity to make that happen.

We're positioned to lead the change in the biggest transformation that the IT industry has seen in decades — and we need your talent, skill, and ambitious ideas. As a Global Top Employer to over 28,000 great people in more than 58 countries, you'll be working with teams across the world. You'll be doing great things for our clients and helping them achieve their business ambitions.


We're looking for a Data Analyst to join our team and assist our customer with:

  • Reviewing excel worksheets and content
  • Normalising information
  • Interact with internal stakeholders to verify information
, '\n',

Key Skills

, '\n',
  • Would suit a recent graduate
  • Strong knowledge if Excel and MS Office
  • Proficiency with Excel user forms, controls and functions
, '\n', In return for your skills and your commitment to our values, you will be rewarded with a responsive and balanced workplace, unparalleled IT industry positioning, industry leading benefits, an excellent salary and bonus structure along with a talented and focused team.


, Sound interesting? To join our growing global team and accelerate your career with Dimension Data, Apply today! ,
, '\n',
, '\n',
, '\n', Please note: We thank you for your interest and advise that due to the tight timelines for commencement, only applicants meeting the experience requirements and holding valid Australian working rights will be contacted.,

title: b'Spatial Data Analyst/ Programmer\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

About the Business:

, ' ',

Geoimage is a leading independent specialist, providing satellite imagery and related geospatial solutions.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

With decades of local, national and international experience working within the mining, engineering, oil and gas, agricultural, government and environmental industries, Geoimage are committed to the provision of specialised satellite imagery and related spatial services. They leverage the latest satellite products, spatial technologies and geo-sciences to provide client focused business solutions.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Translating innovative spatial technologies into solutions - Delivering greater efficiencies, lower costs & improved outcomes

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

About the Role:

, ' ',

With decades of experience of image processing and providing industry leading value added services, Geoimage seek high caliber employees to drive our business growth and transformation journey. Whilst your technical skills and knowledge are pertinent, it is your positive, dedicated and forward thinking approach that is critical. Your passion for the industry and broad technical knowledge will be utilised to develop and deliver the range of services and solutions.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Your background in application development and knowledge in addressing complex image analysis problems, often requiring creative custom code to be developed, will be the key to your success.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Your Skills and Attributes:

, ' ',
  • Raster and vector spatial database management, ideally MySQL;
  • Demonstrated capability with coding in Python, Java, JSON, XML & IDL;
  • Sound skills in both UX and interface design;
  • Application development experience – ideally web based map development;
  • Knowledge of Earth observation satellites and experience working with remotely sensed data and non-spatial datasets;
  • Experience in the following services / disciplines:
    • Spatial analytics for application development
    • Image Pre-processing (orthorectification, pan sharpening, mosaicking, deglinting, haze Removal, calibration).
    • DEM Generation
  • Experience in PCI Geomatica / ERDAS Imagine / Trimble eCognition or similar image processing and analytics software;
  • Proven capability to apply innovative solutions;
  • Demonstrated ability to prioritise in a demanding and constantly changing environment, and to meet multiple deadlines without sacrificing accuracy, timeliness or professionalism;
  • Proven ability to communicate effectively with clients and colleagues;
  • Ability to provide technical support and advice to the sales team and clients as required;
  • Demonstrated team focus with a proven ability to work with others to meet company and client objectives and outcomes.
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Remuneration

, ' ',

A competitive base salary plus superannuation will be offered, commensurate with your skills and experience.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Applications:
If this role sounds like the CAREER MOVE you've been looking for, please submit your application (CV and a cover letter outlining your suitability for the role) now!!

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Or for a confidential discussion please contact Kim Acworth on 0411 278 281 or finders@acworthrecruitment.com.au

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Please note that only applicants meeting the criteria outlined above will be contacted as part of the short-listing process.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

All applications will be treated as strictly confidential. Thank you in advance for your interest.

, ' ']

title: b'Risk Analyst (Data)\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

Reporting to the Senior Risk Leader, you will be responsible for intimately influencing the way risk is managed across the business and impacts multiple stakeholders.

, ' ',

, ' ',

Key Duties

, ' ',

, ' ',
  • Develop and control the database links between multiple business units
  • Analyse data, design and execution tests based on identified risks
  • Implement tests developed by Risk Analysts into Risk Management tools
  • Write scripts to efficiently use the data provided
  • Assist with the development and implementation of a centralised risk review function
  • Develop and enhance centralised monitoring processes to target specific risk areas and identify exceptions for targeted risk reviews
  • Investigate centralised monitoring exceptions
  • Analyse risk findings to enhance risk assessment, monitoring and mitigation
  • Implement changes to better identify and control misconduct
, ' ',

, ' ',

Key Requirements

, ' ',

, ' ',
  • Completion or working towards an Accounting or Risk qualification
  • Expertise in Microsoft Excel coupled with outstanding data extraction and manipulation techniques
  • Experience in database administration
  • Great customer service stakeholder engagement, excellent attention to detail, ability to multi-task and work to tight deadlines
  • Previous experience in industries with large customer/data requirements
, ' ',

, ' ',

This is an excellent opportunity to join a innovative market leading organisation in a growing role. You will have a direct impact on commercial decisions and help drive continued profitability through the analysis you provide.

, ' ',

, ' ',

Like to know more?

, ' ',

, ' ',

To submit your application, in strict confidence, please apply online using the appropriate link below.

, ' ']

title: b'Business / Data Analyst\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',

An exciting opportunity has recently arisen for a Senior Business / Data Analyst to join an organisation with the Building Construction and Maintenance field on a 6-month contract.

, '\n',


The Role:

, '\n',

• Maintenance and development of data and its interfaces with other systems (Excel, SAP) suing SQL scripting.
• Exploring data in order to support ongoing category profiling, planning, and management activities.
• Enhancing existing warehouse via the development of high-quality data integration and categorisation processes.
• Making use of strong technical and design skills.
• Leading and facilitating workshops for working groups in order to support shared data collection/collation.
• Develop and document conceptual and logical data flows in support of category management.
• Assist in the provision of data insights in order to progress the opportunities of the industry.
• Support BCM team through extraction of ad-hoc data in a timely manner.
• Set-up ongoing operational processes to measure and report data quality issues.
• Implementing past Business Intelligence experience in order to provide research, analysis and interpretation of data sourced from systems.
• Applying statistical, mathematical and analytical problem-solving and sound evaluations using Microsoft Power BI or similar.
• Apply design techniques in order to present data analysis in aesthetically pleasing formats.

, '\n',


The Candidate:

, '\n',


• Experience/qualifications with visualisation tools such as PowerBI, QlikView and/or Tableu preffered.

, '\n',


In order to be considered for this role it will be expected that you will have had proven previous experience in a similar role / roles.

, '\n',

If this is a role that you know you would relish then please apply below and follow the prompts. All applications will be responded to.

, '\n']

title: b'Senior Analyst with exceptional understanding of the Finance Function\r\n    '
jd:
[' ',

Bright Consulting is seeking a Senior Data Analyst with a finance background to support the Finance Function transformation. The role duration is 9 month with a possible extension.

, ' ',

To be successful in this role, you will have an explicit understanding of the Finance Function, including:

, ' ',
  • Financial and management accounting
  • Financial management and operations
  • Financial performance and data analysis
  • Financial policy and compliance.
, ' ',

Essential for this role is experience with:

, ' ',
  • Financial function reporting and analysis
  • Business intelligence and Technical awareness
  • Reports and dashboard creation
  • Facilitation of finance function current state and future state mapping
  • Excellent written and verbal communication 
  • Exceptional stakeholder engagement skills
  • Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
  • Finance function reporting needs analysis and identification of function wide systems improvement solutions
  • Interrogation and analysis of complex data including the ability to identify, develop and standardise reports for business application and provide quality assurance.
, ' ',

Desirable for the role:

, ' ',
  • Experience with analysis of workforce data
  • Experience using People Soft and SQL
, ' ',

Postgraduate qualifications with be looked upon favourably.

, ' ',

We look forward to discussing your suitability for this role.

, ' ']

title: b'Business Intelligence Specialist\r\n    '

FinXL IT Professional Services is an established innovative Australian company providing technology enabled business solutions and consulting services across a number of industries including Telecommunications, Commercial, Government and Finance.

In Queensland our growth continues, especially in our BI and Analytics practice.

, ' ',

If you have experience delivering meaningful dashboards, integrated with a range of datasources (including SaaS products like Salesforce, Youtube, facebook, etc) we’d like to see if we share a vision for the changing BI and Analytics space and explore opportunities for you to join our consulting practice either on a fulltime or contract basis.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

It’s essential that you have in-depth knowledge of PowerBI and other Microsoft BI tools, excellent communication skills with an engaging presence,  be able to understand business requirements and deliver exceptional outcomes for our customers.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

If you are interested and would like to discuss further, please apply now or contact Mellissa on 07 3232 2305.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

, '\n',
, '\r\nOur client is the market-leader in terms of number of clients and success rate when it comes to partnering with and influencing the business strategies of leading construction companies. \xa0By selling influential business intelligence that is collected on a global\r\n scale and presented on a number of innovative platforms. , '\n',

,
, '\r\nAs the business development manager you will target contractors, sub-contractors and a number of other verticals within the construction space. , '\n',

, '\n',

, ' This represents an outstanding opportunity to develop your career within a leading analytics software business that is growing rapidly across Australia. title: b'Business Intelligence Analyst\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

Overview

, '\n',

Hudson is seeking an experienced BI Analyst to join our client on a 2 month contract to design and develop the BI testing framework. This will include strategy, procedures and associated work instructions in relation to the BI and data warehouse applications. This role requires strong communication skills as you will be liaising with a range of stakeholders to assist with the development of testing documentation and align with the organizational goals of increased performance and effectiveness of the BI testing process.

, '\n',

Duties & Responsibilities

, '\n',
  • Define a clear vision and strategy for BI testing framework
  • Develop and document an effective lifecycle approach to testing
  • Develop data-centric testing
    • Data volume, variety, anomalies, data integration discrepancies, complexities etc.
  • Quality assurance
    • Testing of each stage of BI lifecycle (data collection, integration, storage and presentation)
  • Develop processes, tools and templates that can be standardized
  • Test data creation, test lab management reporting to identify areas of enhancement
, '\n',

Skills & Experience

, '\n',
  • Demonstrated experience developing protocols and documentation in relation to Business Intelligence
  • Strong understanding of test processes and test documentation
  • High level communication skills
  • Similar project experience
, '\n',

How to apply

, '\n',

APPLICATIONS FOR THIS ROLE CLOSE TUESDAY 2nd MAY at 4pm.

, '\n',

To submit your application, in strict confidence, please apply online using the appropriate link below. Alternatively, for a confidential discussion, please contact Kimberley Maclean in our Brisbane office on 07 3258 8356 quoting Ref No. 4A/17752.

, '\n']

title: b'Business Intelligence Specialist\r\n    '
jd:
[' ',

FinXL IT Professional Services is an established innovative Australian company providing technology enabled business solutions and consulting services across a number of industries including Telecommunications, Commercial, Government and Finance.

, ' ',

In Queensland our growth continues, especially in our Business Intelligence and Analytics practice and as a result we have a new role available in our team.

, ' ',

We require a BI professional with at least 5 years’ experience with Microsoft technologies (SSIS, SSAS, SSRS) and some exposure to Microsoft a BI Azure Services (Azure Data Warehouse, etc).  Ideally our new consultant will have experience in delivering PowerBI in an enterprise organisation, including the appropriate level of rigor around requirements gathering, stakeholder engagement and good governance for projects of various scales.

, ' ',

We seek a person that truly understands the value of innovation for our client organisations, and not just the technical aspects of delivery.  For us, BI and Analytics is all about understanding our clients businesses and challenges, delivering insights to help them continually improve their business operations and providing an engagement model that gives exceptional customer satisfaction and continual improvement.

, ' ',

If you enjoy working on a variety of engagements with different customers and are inspired to delivery change and continual improvement both for our customers and our own operations we'd love to hear from you.

, ' ',

In return you'll be joining a supportive team based in Brisbane and also be a part of a consulting workforce of more than 800 professionals Australia wide.  To succeed in this role you'll be passionate about technology and the differences we can deliver for our customers and their stakeholders.

, ' ',

The interview process is a quick three step process starting with you submitting your brief cv and a follow up call from our Consulting Care team.  Face to face and technical reviews will then be conducted.  We encourage you to ask as much from us as we ask from you during the interview process because we want to build a true partnership in the way we address our customers needs and in the way we work together to help you develop your career.

, ' ',

We encourage you to take the next step in your career by clicking apply now.  For more information please call Mellissa on 07 3232 2305.

, ' ']

[' ',

We are looking for an experienced business intelligence analyst with experience in MS SQL, SSRS and VBSCript on a contract role.

, ' ',

This contract scope includes surface and infrastructure works and will see us leading the way for over 5 years to deliver this project successfully and safely.

, ' ',

, ' ',

Based in the client office in the CBD and reporting to the overall Project IT Manager this contract role will be responsible for MS SQL database and SQL/TSQL queries, SSRS and report writing, VBA and VBScript, S3D Modelling/CAD Data Modelling.

, ' ',

It will be advantageous if you have experience with the following:

, ' ',
  • Digital isometrics (IDF/PCF files)
  • Steel data exchange formats (CIS2/IFC)
  • Bentley Microstation and .imodel/.i.dgn formats
  • Bentley eB
  • Bentley ProjectWise
  • Bentley ConstructSim
  • Familiarity with construction
, ' ',

, ' ',

This role is a contract for the duration of the Brisbane involvement in the overall project (at least until December 2017). You will have demonstrated experience, ideally within the Engineering, construction and procurement or large scale project environment.

, ' ',


To apply online, please click on the link below. Or, if you would like to have a confidential discussion, please contact Nisha Kumar on 07 3023 1024, quoting ref no. JO-1704-66900. Want to know more about Davidson? Visit us at www.davidsonwp.com

, ' ']

title: b'Senior Business Intelligence Analyst\r\n        '
jd:
['THE CLIENT',
, ' Drake International have partnered with a State Government Department located in the Brisbane CBD. This Government department is focused on creating opportunities and managing risks to enable sustainable food and fibre production. This focus is primarily achieved through effective management of community resources, application of scientific approaches and also leading the fight against animal and plant pests and diseases.',
, ' ',
, ' THE ROLE',
, ' Drake International, together with this State Government Department, are seeking an experienced Senior Business Intelligence Analyst for an 8 week contract, whose primary focus will be to assist business areas within our partner agency with reporting and analytics. Working with these business areas, you will gather and analyse business requirements, whilst assisting the business to frame their business issues and data challenges. This role will also involve the development and documentation of work packages for IT delivery based on technical requirements including designs for ETL, SSAS cubes, SSRS reports, MS Power BI dashboards and analytics.',
, ' ',
, ' THE SKILLS',
, ' In order to be successful in this role, the ideal candidate will possess:',
, ' • Proven, solid analytical skills',
, ' • Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills',
, ' • Solid experience working within the business intelligence domain',
, ' • Proven capability to design quality solutions and relevant documentation',
, ' • Significant experience around data analysis, data modelling, data integration, data warehousing and database design',
, ' ',
, ' THE CRITERIA',
, ' The successful candidate will also:',
, ' • Be able to work as part of a team environment, yet also autonomously',
, ' • Be highly self motivated, enthusiastic and results oriented to drive the project and meet critical deadlines',
, ' • Have knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server DB Query, SSIS, SSAS, SSRS and MDX',
, ' • Have knowledge of SQL 2008 R@, SQL 2012 and SQL2014',
, ' • Have knowledge of MS Self-Service BI toolsets including Excel usin PowerPivot, PowerView and PowerBI',
, ' • Have knowledge of Kimball dimensional modelling',
, ' ',
, ' HOW TO APPLY',
, ' If this role has piqued your interest and sounds like your next exciting venture, please click on the apply link NOW!!! Should you have any queries about the role, please call Shannon or Sonja on 07 3291 6099.',
, ' ']

title: b'Senior Business Intelligence Analyst\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

A contract opportunity exists for a Senior Business Intelligence Analyst to be responsible for the design and development of business intelligence and ETL solutions utilising the Microsoft BI Technologies.

, '\n',

Responsibilities:

, '\n',
  • Security and compliance: understanding the security options for information held on the database.
  • Monitoring and tuning: ensuring that the database is running to optimal levels and understanding the table structure within the database in order to 'tune' the database.
  • Backup and recovery: understanding the options for backing up and recovering data held within the database. There will be local policy and procedures for each of these processes.
  • Database maintenance and nightly batch processing: ensuring the scheduled database maintenance and batch processing is monitored and corrected when required.
  • Troubleshooting: investigate an issue and work to find the root cause of why there is a problem with the system. They must also be able to implement a solution to address the issues.
  • Designing databases and changes to database schemas.
  • Deploying schema changes to production databases from written deployment plans.
  • Maintaining documentation. 
  • Undertake maintenance and enhancement development of a number of applications
  • Contribute to the creation of effort estimates for requested enhancement and development work
  • Ensure that deliverables are prioritised and completed within the specified timeframes
, '\n',

Skill set required:

, '\n',
  • 3 - 5 years’ experience of working in the Business Intelligence (BI) space
  • Knowledge of Microsoft SQL server DB Query, SSIS, SSAS and SSRS and MDX.
  • Knowledge of MS Visual Studio for the creation of SSIS packages and SSAS cubes.
  • Knowledge of SQL 2008 R2, SQL 2012 and SQL 2014
  • Knowledge of MS Self-Service BI toolsets including Excel using PowerPivot, PowerView.
  • Knowledge of IBM Cognos - Framework manager model, Transformer cube build, Report studio and Powerplay studio.
  • Knowledge of Kimball dimensional modelling.
  • Knowledge and significant experience around data analysis, data modelling, data integration, data warehousing and database design.
  • Proven capability around delivering good quality solutions and technical documentation.
  • Strong communication skills.
  • Ability to work using agile system development practices.
, '\n',

 Desirable:

, '\n',
  • Knowledge of IBM Infosphere DataStage would be highly regarded.
  • Knowledge of DMX would be highly regarded.
  • Excellent analytical and problem solving skills.
  • Ability to converse at ease with people at all levels of business and explain technology in business terms.
, '\n',

 

, '\n',

If you wish to apply for this position, please submit your resume by clicking the 'Apply Now' button. For further information please contact Neeraj Kumar at Clicks IT Recruitment on 07 3027 2556, quoting reference NK267639.

, '\n']

title: b'Senior Business Intelligence Analyst\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

Lime Recruitment is currently recruiting a 6 month Senior Business Intelligence Analyst contract for a large Qld government department based in the Brisbane CBD.

, '\n',

The Business Intelligence Analyst will be responsible for the design and development of business intelligence and ETL solutions utilising the Microsoft BI Technologies. The Business Intelligence Analyst will work closely with business users, IT teams, system owners and administrators.

, '\n',

Job Details

, '\n',

The key responsibilities of the contractor will be to:

, '\n',
  • Security and compliance: understanding the security options for information held on the database.
  • Monitoring and tuning: ensuring that the database is running to optimal levels and understanding the table structure within the database in order to 'tune' the database.
  • Backup and recovery: understanding the options for backing up and recovering data held within the database. There will be local policy and procedures for each of these processes.
  • Database maintenance and nightly batch processing: ensuring the scheduled database maintenance and batch processing is monitored and corrected when required.
  • Troubleshooting: investigate an issue and work to find the root cause of why there is a problem with the system. They must also be able to implement a solution to address the issues.
  • Designing databases and changes to database schemas.
  • Deploying schema changes to production databases from written deployment plans.
  • Maintaining documentation.
  • Undertake maintenance and enhancement development of a number of applications
  • Contribute to the creation of effort estimates for requested enhancement and development work
, '\n',

Essential skills:

, '\n',
  • 3 - 5  years experience of working in the Business Intelligence (BI) space
  • Knowledge of Microsoft SQL server DB Query, SSIS, SSAS and SSRS and MDX.
  • Knowledge of MS Visual Studio for the creation of SSIS packages and SSAS cubes.
  • Knowledge of SQL 2008 R2, SQL 2012 and SQL 2014
  • Knowledge of MS Self-Service BI toolsets including Excel using PowerPivot, PowerView.
  • Knowledge of IBM Cognos - Framework manager model, Transformer cube build, Report studio and Powerplay studio.
  • Knowledge of Kimball dimensional modelling.
  • Knowledge and significant experience around data analysis, data modelling, data integration, data warehousing and database design.
  • Proven capability around delivering good quality solutions and technical documentation.
  • Strong communication skills.
  • Ability to work using agile system development practices.
, '\n',

Desirable:

, '\n',
  • Knowledge of IBM Infosphere DataStage would be highly regarded.
  • Knowledge of DMX would be highly regarded.
  • Excellent analytical and problem solving skills.
  • Ability to converse at ease with people at all levels of business and explain technology in business terms.
, '\n',

This position closes shortly so APPLY NOW or for more information contact Cassandra Manthey on 0432 717 634 or email cass@limejobs.com.au.  Lime Recruitment is Queensland owned and operated and is a Tier 1 preferred supplier to Queensland Government. For more information, visit www.limerecruitment.com.au

, '\n']

title: b'Health Information, Data & Planning Manager - Permanent Role\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',

Brisbane South PHN has an exciting opportunity to become part of our dynamic Knowledge, Planning and Performance team. This is a permanent, full time position that will provide strategic advice and expertise in the areas of population and primary health planning; effective data and business intelligence management; and program and performance reporting. In this role, you will lead a small team of analysts to support and enable the effective delivery of Brisbane South PHN strategic and operational outcomes. You will work collaboratively with our Brisbane South PHN teams, internal and external stakeholders and industry partners aiming to optimise the health of people in our communities and the delivery of health services within our region. 

, '\n',

About the Company

, '\n',

Brisbane South PHN covers a large, culturally diverse, geographic area south of the Brisbane River. This includes metropolitan, rural and remote island locations across local government areas in Brisbane, Logan, Redlands and the Scenic Rim. Our focus is on understanding the health needs of our communities and improving the coordination and delivery of health care services to ensure people receive the right care in the right place at the right time. 

, '\n',

To achieve success in this role, you will need:

, '\n',
  • Tertiary qualifications in information/data management (mandatory).
  • Qualifications in health and project management (highly desirable).
  • Strong track record leading the delivery of technical database/business intelligence services in a complex service industry (mandatory).
  • A strong understanding of digital health and use of emerging technology within the primary and aged healthcare sectors.
  • Experience working in the health sector (highly desirable).
  • Demonstrated experience in researching; critically analysing and interpreting health literature and data.
  • Demonstrated experience in extracting; analysing; interrogating and communicating data from large, complex datasets.
  • Experience working with Qlik Sense, SharePoint, SQL and MS Office products.
  • Excellent written and verbal skills.
  • Eligibility for Positive National Police Check
, '\n',

To gain a full understanding of the requirements of this job, please see the position description on our website www.bsphn.org.au. 

, '\n',

In return for your skills and capabilities, we offer:

, '\n',
  • Attractive remuneration and salary packaging option
  • Generous annual leave options
  • Private health insurance benefits
  • Employee Health & Wellbeing Program
  • Commitment to learning and development and performance excellence
  • Free Social Club.
, '\n',

Please visit our website at www.bsphn.org.au for more information.

, '\n',

To apply, please send your current resume with a covering letter outlining how you meet the skills, experience and knowledge requirements of the role by 5pm Tuesday 16 May 2017.

For further information on the role, please contact Tonia de Bruin, General Manager – Knowledge, Planning & Performance on 0402 794 866 during business hours. 

, '\n']

title: b'Data Warehouse Developer\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

Looking for a Data Warehouse Developer with strong experience in development and support of an SQL Data Warehouse, including data modelling, database design, SSIS, SSAS, and SSRS.

, ' ',

Key Responsibilities:

, ' ',


The primary responsibilities of this role are to provide Data Warehouse development and support, and Business Intelligence development and support.

, ' ',
  • Manage development tasks for projects involving data warehousing / business intelligence projects.
  • Gathering business requirements
  • Data modeling
  • T-SQL development of DDL and DML statements
  • Managing ETL packages using SSIS or other tools
  • Managing OLAP Cubes using SSAS or other tools
  • Developing and maintaining reports using SSRS, Tableau or other tools
  • Training / Support tasks, such as helping users find the right report to run, and managing security access to database and reporting systems.
  • Create and maintain good documentation that effectively describes the systems and processes relevant to the role.
, ' ',

Desired candidate profile:

, ' ',
  • Reliable, calm and disciplined
  • Have experience in communicating directly with end users
  • Experience in the development and support of an SQL Data Warehouse, including data modelling, database design, SSIS, SSAS, and SSRS is essential
  • Proficient in T-SQL commands used to manage and develop data warehouses
, ' ',

, ' ',

For more information please call Swati Arora (swati.arora@uandu.com) at u&u on 07 3232 9146, quoting reference number 8521. Alternatively, to submit an application, please click below.

, ' ',

Please submit your resume in Word format only.

, ' ']

title: b'Systems Integration Tester\r\n        '
jd:
[' ',

Our client is a government agency currently looking for a Systems Integration Tester to complete work over a 4 month contract, renewal may be offered.

, ' ',

Your duties will include:

, ' ',
  • Develop end-to-end system integration test strategy, plans, and scripts for a data warehouse, business intelligence, and analytics platform, including testing of reports, planning worksheets, cubes, and analysis outputs
  • Conduct end-to-end system integration testing for a data warehouse, business intelligence, and analytics platform, including testing of reports, planning worksheets, cubes, and analysis outputs
  • Document, analyse, communicate test results
  • Classify errors into data, software, configuration logic, and script/code bugs
, ' ',

To be considered you will need:

, ' ',
  • 10 years of experience in system integration testing
  • 5 years of experience in system integration testing of data warehouse, business intelligence & analytics platforms
  • 2 years of experience in automated testing tool
  • Must have operated in a Scrum/Agile environment (not just an understanding of or familiar with)
  • Patience & determination
  • Excellent communication skills
, ' ',

Preferred location is Canberra where the main team is located however consideration for Melbourne or Brisbane will be available.

, ' ',

Please note: only candidates who are suited to the role will be contacted.

, ' ',

Our client is an equal opportunity employer

, ' ']

jd:
