title: b'Data Governance Specialist\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

About Us

, ' ',

We are the world's leading specialist and expert in the creation and delivery of unique solutions that combine service, insurance and technology to provide worldwide protection and care. We specialise in assistance, international health & life, automotive and travel insurance direct to the customer or through business partners – in some case integrated into their customer offering.

, ' ',

With over 16,000 talented and dedicated employees across 76 countries speaking over 70 different languages we are here for our customers in time of need. 250 million people, or 4% of the world's total population, benefit from our assistance, travel insurance and personal services, with an intervention every 2 seconds around the world. We are proud to be part of the Allianz Group and we love, as a company, to help people.

, ' ',

Working at Allianz Worldwide Partners, you'll find the rewards are more than just financial.  Without your contribution, we wouldn't be the same. So it's important for you to enjoy what you do

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

About the role:

, ' ',

Allianz Worldwide Partners Australia is defining a controlled set of processes and ownership around key data to support a variety of initiatives. The goal is to have clear rule books, tools and auditing in place to understand when and how to make changes in the data.

, ' ',

The responsibility for the Data Governance Specialist includes the definition of the Data Governance framework and approach, implementation of ownership as well as data management processes (definition, stewardship, approvals). The Data Governance Specialist is an independent role that reports to the General Manager Business and Customer Insights and is expected to work closely together with the Data Quality and Master Data Management specialists.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

What will you be doing in the role?

, ' ',

Defining and implementing a framework for Data Governance and data stewardship, with the expectation to:

, ' ',
  • Champion Data Governance within AGA AU, creating awareness and drive to improve 'data'
  • Define a framework and approach that describes a set of processes and ownership for data
  • Support and extend the existing information models (logical, conceptual)
  • Work closely with business areas to implement guidelines, processes as well as tools and technologies to enable stewardship at a practical level
  • Collaborate with Data Quality specialists to leverage existing technologies and processes and embed these into the overall approach
  • Collaborate with Master Data Management and Business Intelligence specialists to leverage available technologies for supporting governance
  • Collaborate with IT and information security officers
  • Provide clear roadmaps and pro-actively drive initiatives related to Data Governance
, ' ',

What makes a successful Data Governance Specialist

, ' ',
  • Proven experience in applying (Data) Governance frameworks and approaches.
  • 10 years of experience in Information Modelling, Data Governance, Data Quality or related areas.
  • Strong information modelling and communication skills.
  • Experience with Data Quality and Master Data Management concepts and implementation.
  • Strong IT foundations, including familiarity with programming, scripting and software development principles – preferably computer science background
  • Experience with database technology, SQL and Business Intelligence concepts
  • Excellent knowledge of IT system design and its applications in business
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Benefits and Culture

, ' ',

Working at Allianz Worldwide Partners we value and develop our employees.

, ' ',

All employees are offered access to a few free insurance covers; such as roadside assistance, life and salary continuance. Being a part of the wider Allianz family we also gain access to discount home, motor vehicle, boat, travel and medical insurance.

, ' ',

Work is where we spend most of our time and you'll be ready to refer friends and family too – this is where we offer "refer a friend/ family" incentives. At Allianz Worldwide Partners we care and want to help you grow, we want you to stay with us for the long term. That's why our Leaders and Learning & Development team are committed to helping you advance your skills, knowledge and qualifications to ensure your career continues to flourish. We can never stop learning.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Interested in a career with us?

, ' ',

Simply click on 'APPLY' and we'll be in contact shortly.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

*Your privacy is important to us. Our Privacy Policy sets out how Allianz Worldwide Partners collects, stores, uses and discloses personal information. This can be viewed below:

, ' ',

https://www.allianzworldwidepartners.com.au/privacy-and-security/

, ' ']

[' ',

This is an exciting 3 month contract opportunity with the public service for a senior BI analyst specialising in mainly SQL Server, but also Cognos.  If you're passionate about the dark art that is BI and data modelling, read on.

, ' ',

You'll need ...

, ' ',
  • 3 - 5  years experience of working in the Business Intelligence (BI) space
  • Knowledge of Microsoft SQL server DB Query, SSIS, SSAS and SSRS and MDX.
  • Knowledge of MS Visual Studio for the creation of SSIS packages and SSAS cubes.
  • Knowledge of SQL 2008 R2, SQL 2012 and SQL 2014
  • Knowledge of MS Self-Service BI toolsets including Excel using PowerPivot, PowerView.
  • Knowledge of IBM Cognos - Framework manager model, Transformer cube build, Report studio and Powerplay studio.
  • Knowledge of Kimball dimensional modelling.
  • Knowledge and significant experience around data analysis, data modelling, data integration, data warehousing and database design.
  • Proven capability around delivering good quality solutions and technical documentation.
  • Strong communication skills.
  • Ability to work using agile system development practices.
, ' ',

It'd be great if you also had ...

, ' ',
  • Knowledge of IBM Infosphere DataStage would be highly regarded.
  • Knowledge of DMX would be highly regarded.
  • Excellent analytical and problem solving skills.
  • Ability to converse at ease with people at all levels of business and explain technology in business terms.
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Ready to apply?  To be considered for this role you need to provide us with:

, ' ',
  • A one to two page statement of suitability addressing the above-mentioned criteria and requirements
  • Your resume (maximum 5 pages)
  • Authority for Gilmore Resources to represent you quoting reference number CRF 77
, ' ',

Please provide all documents in MS Word.

, ' ',

Why Gilmore Resources?

, ' ',

Gilmore Resources is the only resourcing company with a mission - to do things the right way by contractors and employers alike.

, ' ',

We never charge more than 14% of the rate for our work and you'll always know how much is being charged to the employer and paid to the contractor.

, ' ',

Further, our contracts contain no exclusivity clauses, that is, you may work back with the employer either directly or via another agency at any time.

, ' ',

There are no hidden costs for payroll and we provide a weekly pay cycle.

, ' ',

Be part of the change.  Visit our website (www.gilmoreresources.com.au).

, ' ',

Closing date...

, ' ',

4pm 12 May 2017

, ' ']

title: b'Finance Solutions Analyst - Corporate\r\n      '
jd:
[
, ' ',

The Opportunity

, ' ',

We currently have a full time open term opportunity for an experienced Finance Solutions Analyst who enjoys identifying and driving continuous improvement. This Brisbane based role forms part of our high performing Financial Solutions team, responsible for providing Finance application support and advisory services across the QIC Group, as well as solution and process design for the Finance division.

, ' ',

You will use both your technical knowledge, ability to build relationships and effective communication to influence outcomes and deliver results to various levels of staff in the organisation. A vital aspect of the role will require you to utilise your previous experience in a traditional accounting role and your strong analytical and problem solving skills to quickly grasp and understand new concepts and translate them into opportunities for the operational improvement.

, ' ',

Working collaboratively within the dynamic Finance Solutions team you will establish, maintain and improve policies, procedures, work processes and internal controls, with a focus on systems capability and solution implementation within the broader finance division.

, ' ',

With your extensive experience working with tier 1/tier 2 Finance applications or ERP’s, you will support the development and ongoing maintenance of applications and business models within Finance for the QIC corporate business.

, ' ',

The ideal candidate

, ' ',

As a strong candidate for this role, you will have a degree in accounting, business or commerce and CA/CPA qualifications coupled with greater than 5 years’ experience in a Finance profession as an accountant, systems accountant or business intelligence specialist.

, ' ',

You will have experience working in a commercial environment with financial models or focusing on business analysis. Through previous experience you will be able to demonstrate courage and accountability in mindset by resolving problems, exploring & challenging the status quo, making decisions and taking action; and influence and collaboration by ensuring clarity around shared goals, working with others to achieve win-win outcomes and holding people accountable to deliver results in a constructive way.

, ' ',

A suitable candidate will also be highly organised with the ability to multitask and work in a pressure environment coupled with a good understanding of business drivers and internal controls. Finance systems or ERP implementation experience as well as funds

, ' ',

Why QIC

, ' ',

QIC Limited (QIC) is a leading global alternatives investment provider for sovereign wealth funds, superannuation funds and other institutional investors. QIC delivers services to over 90 like-minded institutional investors in Australia and internationally with more than A$76.3 billion (31 July 2016) in funds under management.

, ' ',

Spanning fixed interest and liquid strategies, infrastructure, real estate, private equity and multi-asset solutions, QIC adapts its approach to suit the investor and the investment context.

, ' ',

At QIC our pursuit is to be an inclusive organisation – one in which every employee has a true voice. We want every employee to have a sense of belonging within QIC and this includes feeling like his or her difference is valued, whatever the difference. We want to build people leader capability to reduce unintended bias and ensure we are leveraging the uniqueness of all our people. 

, ' ',

management and investment banking experience is preferred.

, ' ',

To apply

, ' ',

To apply, please submit a cover letter and CV via our careers portal by 15 May 2017.

, ' ',

Applications from Recruitment Agencies will not be considered.

, ' ',

Follow QIC on LinkedIn to receive the latest industry news and job updated at https://www.linkedin.com/company/qic.

, ' ',

 

, ' ']

title: b'\r\n          Reporting Analyst\r\n        '
jd:
[' ',

DXC Technology (NYSE: DXC) is the world's leading independent, end-to-end IT services company, helping clients harness the power of innovation to thrive on change. Created by the merger of CSC and the Enterprise Services business of Hewlett Packard Enterprise, DXC Technology serves nearly 6,000 private and public sector clients across 70 countries. The company's technology independence, global talent and extensive partner alliance combine to deliver powerful next-generation IT services and solutions. DXC Technology is recognized among the best corporate citizens globally. For more information, visit www.dxc.technology.

, ' ',

Our services are delivered on a world-class leveraged and reliable platform capable of meeting exceptional process, security, and regulatory demands.  BPS is a busy Loan Processing Centre which provides end-to-end loan processing for their client's commercial and retail loans.   The Business Support – Run team provides non-discretionary support services to the greater BPS, Programs and the client.   

, ' ',

Duties and Responsibilities

, ' ',

• Develop, implement and maintain business reporting & analytics to meet contractual requirements and help the business effectively manage its operations.

, ' ',

• Influence the continual development, automation and improvement of the data warehouse, BI and visualisation tools using established standards and processes.

, ' ',

• Identify risks or barriers to achieving contractual requirements and provide expert advice to BPS on corrective measures.

, ' ',

• Undertake data profiling, data quality and integrity analysis to provide guidance on source systems to the BPS SDE, Managers and Team Leaders.

, ' ',

• You will assist with production support of the BPS users including workflow and user administration and initiated change to the workflow system following the change management process.

, ' ',

• Monitoring business reporting and intelligence programs in relation to planned transformational project / initiative outcomes and key deliverables.

, ' ',

Qualifications and Experience

, ' ',

• Tertiary qualifications in Information Management / Information Management or mathematics are preferred

, ' ',

Relevant Experience
• Strong experience in data analysis, modelling and ETL methodologies

, ' ',

• Experience in working with corporate Data Warehouses

, ' ',

• Data extraction and manipulation skills

, ' ',

• Advanced skills with the Microsoft stack (DTS, SSIS,SSRS)

, ' ',

• Exposure to data visualization and BI tools – (Spotfire, PowerBI, SASVA)

, ' ',

• Business Analysis skills

, ' ',

• Advanced Microsoft Excel, Access and Visual Basic

, ' ',

• High-level written communication skills required to effectively write, edit and manage an internal communications function

, ' ',

• Excellent project management skills and the ability to coordinate multiple projects simultaneously to meet competing deadlines

, ' ',

• Strong time management ability and evidence of delivering projects on time

, ' ',

• Demonstrated ability to partner and provide agenda leadership in a senior team environment to deliver integrated outcomes

, ' ',

• High level analytical, research and problem solving skills

, ' ',

• Capable of delivering complex topics into a non-technical manner

, ' ',

• Highly development interpersonal and communication skills including the ability to establish positive working relationships with senior management and key internal and external stakeholders

, ' ',

• Change management processes, Agile or SCRUM environment knowledge

, ' ',

Please apply to this application without delay

, ' ',

EEO Tagline: DXC Technology is EEO F/M/Protected Veteran/ Individual with Disabilities

, ' ']

title: b'\r\n          Business / Systems Analyst - Operational Improvement Specialist\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',

Optimate is an established and respected consulting and systems integration company focused on delivering real-time operations information solutions for our diverse customer base. Due to our continued growth and expansion into advisory services (management consulting), we are seeking multiple Business / Systems Analysts, experienced in defining, designing & delivering solutions for asset-intensive industries (mining, rail, oil & gas, utilities, and power).  

, '\n',

Responsibility will be for understanding, resolving and syndicating the solutions for complex business problems to do with innovation, cost reduction, asset utilisation, and logistics.  Solutions may or may not require technology but will always be founded on realisable business-benefit.  

, '\n',

The role reports to the state regional manager and will encompass:-

, '\n',
  • Identify, initiate and lead activities that define and lead operational improvement, operational-intelligence, system integration, reporting and visualisation.
  • Quickly understand the business process and data issues of a client's organisation and industry, constructing a roadmap of activities to realise improvement over time.
  • Use formal business modelling skills to analyse a current process so as to be able to put recommendations together to improve process efficiency and  future-state models.
  • Review and edit requirements, specifications, business processes and recommendations related to a proposed solution
  • Develop functional specifications and system design specifications for client engagements
  • Carry out requirements elicitation and management, and define user-acceptance test criteria.
  • Facilitate end-user workshops
  • Develop business process and conceptual information models
  • Input and review solution design documents
  • Develop business case documents 
  • Lead evaluation and testing of applicable solutions and methods.
  • Produce clear and concise business & technical documentation and reports.
  • Author and deliver presentations to prospects, customers and internal personnel.
  • Understand and translate business requirements and written specifications into effective solutions utilizing ERP, Business Intelligence, MES, Historian, SCADA/PLC, or DCS systems where appropriate.
  • Develop conceptual and preliminary design requirements and design specifications.
, '\n',

The successful candidate will have the following skills and experiences:

, '\n',
  • Strong project based background in the mining,  oil & gas, utilities or power industries;
  • Ability to communicate with clients to determine needs and requirements
  • Ability to manage client expectations effectively.
  • Possess excellent communication and stakeholder management skills
  • Able to develop relationships with client personnel that foster client ties.
  • Possess sound analytical, conceptual and problem solving skills
  • Is able to deal with conflicting priorities in a fast paced environment.
  • Is self-motivated, able to work independently and as part of a team.
  • Working knowledge of in-pit operations (plan, drill & blast, load & haul) process, technologies and equipment
  • Knowledge of Asset Maintenance and Condition Monitoring in so far as it relates to a particular industry
  • Working knowledge of SCADA, Fleet and Train control systems and associated technologies
  • Some positions may have client-based travel requirements
, '\n',

Preferred requirements:

, '\n',
  • Working knowledge on OT (operational technology) including but not limited to MES and MES-infrastructure technologies spanning Asset Management, Asset Health, Condition Monitoring and Maintenance, Inventory, Downtime and delay systems, demand-chain planning & logistics scheduling, Crewing and shift management, and more.
  • Experience with application system integration across the levels in the ISA95 standard.
  • Experience or exposure to demand and supply chain management 
  • Degree qualification in Engineering, Systems or related fields. Extensive relevant experience may be acceptable in lieu of degree qualifications.
, '\n',

Applicants need to provide evidence of their abilities and work experience along with their application. The candidate will require the ability to work both autonomously and as part of a team and have aptitude for excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication, and outstanding client facing and social skills. Professional and personal references will be sought to assist with the candidate selection.

, '\n',

Please note these roles are Perth or Brisbane-based roles, and ideally we are looking for someone local to Perth or Brisbane, who would be available to start early June/July.

, '\n',

You MUST have full working rights for Australia to be considered for this role. 

, '\n']

title: b'\r\n          Junior Support Analyst\r\n        '
jd:
[' ',

MSL Solutions has provided fully integrated business solutions to the hospitality industry for over 30 years and is the business driver behind some of the biggest clubs and venues in Australia. MSL is an international company with offices in Australia, the UK and Denmark. We provide all the essential management systems, including business intelligence, point of sale, financial and membership systems to deliver excellent governance and member engagement to over 600 clients. Our open software platform, allows clients to build agile business systems to meet the needs of their members throughout community, golf, marina & yacht, private, social and sporting clubs as well as restaurants, pubs, theme parks, stadiums and retirement living.

, ' ',

Due to growth in our product range and customers, we need an addition to the team to help with Support. The role will require someone competent in writing SQL queries, a tenacity to solve problems, likes coding and has the confidence to work with internal and external stakeholders constructively and professionally. You will mostly be involved in customer support but will have the opportunity to participate in product development. For the right person we can offer career progression through the company.

, ' ',

Role Description

, ' ',
  • Level 3 Support for our Applications
  • Mostly external Clients
  • Working from our Brisbane City office
  • Core Hours are 9am - 5pm (after hours work will be required from time to time)
, ' ',

Tech Stack

, ' ',
  • SQL (SQL Server)
  • C#
  • ASP.NET MVC
  • Git (Bit Bucket)
  • HTML / CSS
, ' ',

Profile

, ' ',
  • Recent graduate in an IT related field
  • Strong customer service skills
  • Good Written and Verbal communication skills
  • Enthusiastic and willing to learn
  • Ability to solve problems
  • Passionate about Technology and familiar with Web technologies
, ' ',

About Us

, ' ',
  • Provide Point of Sale, Financial and Membership systems
  • Provide integration APIs and Web Applications
  • International presence
, ' ',

Only applicants with the right to work in Australia and based in Brisbane will be considered.

, ' ',

If you are a self-starter looking for a challenge and have the required skills we would love to hear from you.

, ' ']

title: b'\r\n          Business Performance Analyst\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',
  • Vibrant and dynamic team with a supportive culture
  • Head office Location
  • Leading local not-for-profit with vision and innovative service delivery
, '\n',

The Help Employment and Training is a not-for-profit values-based social enterprise that balances its successful commercial businesses with the delivery of Supported Employment, Employment & Training and Disability Support Services programs to people who live with disabilities.
Help Employment and Training are seeking a dynamic individual to join our team as proven Business Performance Analyst. The Business Performance Analyst is responsible for providing high level input and advice by analysing and reporting on Help Employment and Training division business performance. This includes research and analysis, identifying and implementing opportunities to improve business performance, and ensuring customer access to quality data and information

, '\n',

As the Business Performance Analyst you will be responsible for :
• Evaluating the performance and outcomes of the DES and jobactive businesses, and ability to provide recommendations for these programs based on performance predictions
• Building relationships with internal and external stakeholders
• Report writing
• Presenting "findings" to the Help E&T Operational business Leaders
• Reviewing business proposals
• Business & Financial modeling
• Interpret and analyse performance data to identify underlying drivers and provide actionable insights and forecasting, to lift business performance
• Influence performance improvement initiatives via effective communication across the organisation
• Develop scalable, innovative approaches to extracting, managing and analysing data.
• Identify and implement improvement opportunities in existing data collection and performance reporting practices
• Collaborate with external entities and regulatory bodies in relation to data performance reporting obligations
• Ensure compliance within HELP’s Integrated Management System
• Ensure efficiency and compliance with administrative processes driven by the policies, procedures and guidelines outlined in the funding Deeds and Internal documents.
• Interpret, interrogate and modify reports sourced from the ESS system using advanced excel based techniques.

, '\n',

The Ideal candidate must have:
• Essential
o Significant experience in a similar role preferably
o Demonstrated exceptional eye for detail and accuracy dealing with large volumes of, or complex data, and understanding of and commitment to quality and data quality practices under various DEEDS and legislations Identify, develop, and implement change to deliver efficient and effective process improvements in reporting
o Sound communication reasoning and stakeholder management skills including advanced listening, verbal and written skills and ability to communicate with non-financial managers.
o Experience with data base systems development involving the utilisation of high level MS excel skills and Business Intelligence Tools
o Tertiary or vocational qualifications in accounting, business or related field

, '\n',

• Desirable
o CA/CPA qualified or part qualified with 5 years’ experience
o Experience in Employment Services

, '\n',

 
Essential requirements
• Eligible to work in Australia
• Current driver's licence
• Criminal history check
• Working with Children Check

, '\n',

Rewards:
• An attractive salary
• Salary sacrifice options
• Ongoing training, career progression and professional development opportunities
• Work with an authentic provider of Disability Employment Services in Australia
• Job satisfaction, knowing that you are making a real difference

, '\n',

Your application will include your current resume and a cover letter in Word format (.doc) that addresses the criteria above and outlines how your qualifications, skills and experience would see you successfully fulfil this role. All Applicants must be willing to undergo a National Police Check as well as obtain a Working with Children Check.

, '\n',

Apply below by Monday 22 May 2017
Please note that only short-listed applicants will be contacted.
Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply

, '\n',

, '\n',


, '\n']

title: b'Data Analyst - Customer Insights, Loyalty & Campaigns\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

We are seeking a Data Analyst who is passionate about helping brands understand their customers through data insights. Use your analytical, critical thinking, and technical skills to analyse data to identify customer behaviours, help develop marketing automation campaigns, and present actionable insights.

, '\n',

Join us and together we can create customers for life.

, '\n',

 

, '\n',

You'll have

, '\n',

  • Demonstrable problem-solving skills using SQL for data extraction, manipulation and analysis

  • The ability to analyse, interpret and communicate insights drawn from multiple data sources. Exposure to data visualisation tools such as Tableau an advantage

  • The ability to work on multiple streams with multiple clients in an agile, iterative environment

  • Keen interest in customer loyalty and retail analytics for marketing programs

  • Strong attention to detail with a focus on quality, and sound organisational skills

  • Commercial acumen with ability to strategize, analyse, and articulate insights

  • Working knowledge of web, database, and marketing technologies

  • Hands on experience in a data-related function. Directly applicable experience (Campaign, Insights, BI Analyst, or Statistical Modeller) highly regarded but not essential

  • Understanding of the retail and consumer marketing industry would be ideal

  • Strong and confident verbal and written English communications skills

  • Comprehension of both technical and business language

  • Tertiary education in Business, Marketing, Computer Science, Statistics, or Mathematics
     

, '\n',

And bring:

, '\n',

  • Passion for identifying commercial insights that deliver client value and create exceptional data­-driven campaigns/marketing programmes

  • Passion for utilizing the commercial value of data

  • A self-motivated and goal-oriented work ethic

  • Ability to adapt to change quickly

  • A solutions-focused, lateral thinking approach

  • Willingness to be a team player, contributor and collaborator

  • Commitment to bringing innovation and inspiration to your work and team
     

, '\n',

To:

, '\n',

  • Use your critical thinking to analyse data and translate it into actionable insights

  • Drive the data side of the campaign and program development process from requirements, prospect segmentation and selection through to quality control, measurement and ongoing optimisation

  • Create business intelligence reporting and interactive dashboards reporting using Tableau for our iCentral platform

  • Provide analytical support and recommendations to enhance campaign and program effectiveness, and to inform strategic, tactical and operational decisions

  • Use transactional, other behavioural and demographic data to create segmentation models for tactical (target audience selection) and strategic purposes, with a particular focus on customer retention and growth

  • Liaise with database engineers to ensure data warehouse meets campaign and analysis/reporting requirements

  • Play a role in driving strategic customer program initiatives & campaigns, and identifying customer retention and growth opportunities

  • Develop and maintain industry expertise, keep abreast of trends and new ideas

  • Work collaboratively with cross-disciplined teams to ideate, problem solve, and present the best solutions
, '\n',


What we do:

, '\n',

Since 1997 we've been helping businesses keep and grow their customers. Specialising in creating customers for life, we help businesses understand their customers and develop measurable programs to keep them coming back. We mix technology, science, and marketing to engage customers and drive repeat business for our clients. Some of our brands you'll work alongside include Michael Hill, Suncorp, Flight Centre, Bridgestone, The Coffee Club, Hogs Breath Cafe among many other household names.

, '\n',


Our Culture:

, '\n',

It's the people that really makes us who we are, all with the shared passion for what we do. Our team of Customologists is filled with smart and energetic people who value curiosity, collaboration, contribution, and communication. Our playground-like office is designed to encourage interaction and conversation, with an onsite cafe, gym, swings, putt-putt, garden workspace, and creative breakout spaces.

, '\n',
, '\n']

title: b'Business Performance Reporting Analyst\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

Brisbane City Council’s multi-channel Contact Centre enjoys an enviable reputation for providing exceptional service to residents, business and visitors. As part of their ongoing commitment to enhancing service delivery we are now seeking to fill a new role for an initial 12 month contract for an experienced Reporting Analyst with strong exposure to Contact Centre service delivery environments.

In 2016 the Contact Centre was awarded National Contact Centre of the Year (under 20 FTE and 150-499 FTE) at the Auscontact Association Awards. This is a genuine opportunity to work with a fantastic team who continue to develop their operations to achieve outstanding success.

What will you be doing?

This position delivers a high standard performance reporting and analysis service to the Customer Delivery Section. You will develop and maintain business reporting solutions to provide timely and accurate information that supports decision making.  You will also assist in identifying business information needs and provide advice to senior management and key stakeholders, while also assisting in the preparation of data to meet Council’s strategic and operational performance reporting requirements.

When and where will you do it?

This role will work Monday to Friday generally during traditional business hours. The Contact Centre however operates 24 hours per day, 7 days per week and as such all staff must be flexible to work rotating rosters including the participation in an on-call emergency event roster.

We have 2 Contact Centre sites and an operational team based in the City.  While predominantly based at our Brisbane CBD site in this position you must be prepared to occasionally travel to our Contact Centre sites at Chermside and Yeerongpilly. 

What is on offer?

, '\n',
  • A commencement base salary of between $83,953 and $93,348 p.a. plus superannuation
  • Ongoing development
  • Accrual of annual and personal leave
  • The opportunity to accrue flex time to accrue rostered days off
  • The potential for extension or longer term permanent work based on individual performance and business needs
, '\n',


What we are seeking?

, '\n',
  • A proven ability to deliver highly effective reporting solutions, utilising a range of reporting, data visualisation or business intelligence tools for a diverse audience within a Contact Centre context.
  • Demonstrated knowledge and ability to provide strategic insight on business reporting systems, data definitions and related technical infrastructure. 
  • Demonstrated research, analysis and problem-solving skills including the ability to critically assess options that address organisational, process or business needs. 
  • High levels of accountabilities and a strong continuous improvement focus
  • A strong business acumen with commercial and organisational awareness
  • Well-developed interpersonal skills including the ability to influence and develop and maintain positive working relationships through a strong customer focus.
  • Ability to contribute to team direction, give and receive feedback and achieve agreed performance standards in order to contribute to a culture of performance excellence
  • Exceptionally good PC and systems skills with a solid understanding of contemporary Contact Centre technology
  • High levels of resilience and the ability to work autonomously
, '\n',


How do you apply?

If this sounds like you please click the apply link and ensure you attach an up-to-date resume and complete all contact details including your email address for a prompt acknowledgement of your application. Reference No. JN-12421. To apply you must have full permanent working rights in Australia.

Should you have any questions prior to submitting your application please contact Mark Gallen at TactiCall Recruitment on 07 3831 6333 during office hours.

Closing date midnight Monday 15 May 2017.

Due to the requirements of this role, a criminal history check will be undertaken on preferred applicants.  A criminal history does not necessarily preclude an applicant from appointment. Applicants may also be required to undertake a pre placement Medical Assessment.

Brisbane City Council is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
 

, '\n',

, '\n',

Before applying please ensure you read, understand and accept the terms outlined in our Privacy Policy which can be viewed at http://www.tacticall.com.au/page/about-us/privacy-statement/

For more positions visit http://www.tacticall.com.au where you can also stay in touch with new jobs by liking us on facebook and following us on twitter and Linkedin
 

, '\n',

, '\n']

title: b'Finance Solutions Analyst - Australian Real Estate\r\n      '
jd:
[
, ' ',

The Opportunity

, ' ',

We currently have a full time open term opportunity for an experienced Finance Solutions Analyst who enjoys identifying and driving continuous improvement. This Brisbane based role forms part of our high performing Financial Solutions team, responsible for providing Finance application support and advisory services across the QIC Group, as well as solution and process design for the Finance division.

, ' ',

You will use both your technical knowledge, ability to build relationships and effective communication to influence outcomes and deliver results to various levels of staff in the organisation. A vital aspect of the role will require you to utilise your previous experience in a traditional accounting role and your strong analytical and problem solving skills to quickly grasp and understand new concepts and translate them into opportunities for the operational improvement.

, ' ',

Working collaboratively within the dynamic Finance Solutions team you will establish, maintain and improve policies, procedures, work processes and internal controls, with a focus on systems capability and solution implementation within the broader finance division.

, ' ',

With your extensive experience working with tier 1/tier 2 Finance applications or ERP’s, you will support the development and ongoing maintenance of applications and business models within Finance for the QIC corporate business.

, ' ',

The ideal candidate

, ' ',

As a strong candidate for this role, you will have a degree in accounting, business or commerce and CA/CPA qualifications coupled with greater than 5 years’ experience in a Finance profession as an accountant, systems accountant or business intelligence specialist.

, ' ',

You will have experience working in a commercial environment with financial models or focusing on business analysis. Through previous experience you will be able to demonstrate courage and accountability in mindset by resolving problems, exploring & challenging the status quo, making decisions and taking action; and influence and collaboration by ensuring clarity around shared goals, working with others to achieve win-win outcomes and holding people accountable to deliver results in a constructive way.

, ' ',

A suitable candidate will also be highly organised with the ability to multitask and work in a pressure environment coupled with a good understanding of business drivers and internal controls. Finance systems or ERP implementation experience as well as funds management and investment banking experience is preferred.

, ' ',

Why QIC

, ' ',

QIC Limited (QIC) is a leading global alternatives investment provider for sovereign wealth funds, superannuation funds and other institutional investors. QIC delivers services to over 90 like-minded institutional investors in Australia and internationally with more than A$76.3 billion (31 July 2016) in funds under management.

, ' ',

Spanning fixed interest and liquid strategies, infrastructure, real estate, private equity and multi-asset solutions, QIC adapts its approach to suit the investor and the investment context.

, ' ',

At QIC our pursuit is to be an inclusive organisation – one in which every employee has a true voice. We want every employee to have a sense of belonging within QIC and this includes feeling like his or her difference is valued, whatever the difference. We want to build people leader capability to reduce unintended bias and ensure we are leveraging the uniqueness of all our people.

, ' ',

To apply

, ' ',

To apply, please submit a cover letter and CV via our careers portal by 15 May 2017.

, ' ',

Applications from Recruitment Agencies will not be considered.

, ' ',

Follow QIC on LinkedIn to receive the latest industry news and job

, ' ',

updated at https://www.linkedin.com/company/qic.

, ' ']

title: b'Business Analyst\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

With a network of more than 200 branches and 150 years in the industry, Tradelink is Australia’s trusted name in plumbing supplies. We are part of the Fletcher Building group, a multinational organisation with a diverse workforce of 19,000 operating in 25 businesses in more than 45 countries, manufacturing and distributing world-leading building and construction products.

We currently have an opportunity for an enthusiastic, self-motivated Business Analyst to join our team at Banyo. Reporting to the Senior Commercial Manager – Operations, you will develop strong relationships with Branch Managers and Regional Managers across the business in order to be able to provide information and financial analysis, enabling managers to be informed about key issues and possible solutions.

Other key responsibilities include P&L analysis, month end reporting, report preparation, working with large volumes of data and business partnering with the Senior Commercial Manager. You will also be required to provide insight and analysis on national initiatives, and proactively look for improvement opportunities.

You will also have a high attention to detail, the ability to manage competing tasks effectively and have exceptional interpersonal and communication (both written and verbal) skills. Advanced Excel skills are essential and experience with Business Intelligence tools will be highly regarded.

A qualification in Finance or Accounting as well as previous Business Analyst experience is essential.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we strive to create an inclusive environment for all our employees. We welcome applicants from diverse backgrounds to apply to any of our vacant positions. Talk to us about flexible working arrangements and career pathways.

Click to apply now!

, '\n']

title: b'Senior Analyst\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',
  • Opportunity to drive financial performance
  • Brisbane based
  • Flexible working arrangements i.e. 4-5 days per week with the opportunity to work from home 1 day per week
, '\n',

Summary

, '\n',

We currently have a great opportunity for an experienced Financial Analyst to join the team. The Financial Analyst will design, deliver and support forecasting, reporting, analytics, modelling and business insights within the Banking & Wealth function.

, '\n',

Our Bank Performance Management team has a strong focus on improving net income, collaborating with Bank product specialists, Group Customer Platforms and Finance stakeholders. This role is also required to develop solutions to automate/ transform existing and new reporting and insights.

, '\n',

Key Accountabilities

, '\n',
  • Understand the drivers of current performance (balance sheet, margin and profitability) and influence initiatives to drive improvement in the lending revenue outlook;
  • Design and implement rigorous modelling of Bank outcomes for initiatives, projects, new products and pricing changes affecting the Business or Retail Lending portfolio;
  • Design and develop business intelligence solutions to improve analytics and insights on bank revenue;
  • Realise the reporting and insight requirements using the Group's strategic BI platform (Netezza, IBM Cognos & Tableau), whilst ensuring accuracy, attention to detail and timely delivery;
  • Lead change across stakeholders with clear communications and strong relationship building.
, '\n',

Qualifications & Experience

, '\n',
  • Degree in Finance / Accounting / Commerce (required)
  • Experience in Analytics, Data Mining and Reporting/Dashboard development(desired)
  • Minimum 5 years' experience in Management Accounting / Reporting
  • Experience using/ implementing TM1 (preferred)
  • Extensive experience in Financial Services as an accountant, systems accountant, business intelligence specialist, (desired)
  • Experience working with Tableau and IBM Cognos business intelligence tools (desired)
  • Advanced skills in Microsoft Office (Access, Excel, PowerPoint)
, '\n',

, '\n',

If this sounds like you, apply online today. For further information contact Steven Cattley on (02) 8121 3276.

, '\n',

, '\n',

, '\n',

, '\n',

, '\n']

title: b'IT Information Security Specialist - Government, based in Brisbane CBD\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

 

, ' ',

One of our Leading Government Client is looking for an IT Information Security Specialist, to work on a Contract Role, based in the Brisbane CBD.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

The Information Security Strategy business unit’s objective is to develop and maintain Information Security Strategy, Governance Frameworks, Policy and Direction In-Line with Business Strategy, Security Trends, and Whole-Of-Government Policy and Direction.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Position-Specific Accountabilities:

, ' ',

Maintain an up-to-date knowledge of all ICT Security Domains with associated threats and controls.

, ' ',

Contribute to the development and maintenance of enterprise level ICT Security Documentation and assisting with Strategic Documentation.

, ' ',

Conduct and analyse ICT System Risk Management Plans.

, ' ',

Conduct and analyse ICT Statements of applicability.

, ' ',

Conduct and analyse ICT System Security Plans.

, ' ',

Specialist Application Security knowledge, ability to create application Security Architectural Patterns.

, ' ',

Through relationship management and engagement with the business, intercept and record requirements and analyse these with providers within the ICT Division.

, ' ',

Collaborate with management and staff of IM&T and contribute actively and positively in support of the Information Security Strategy Manager.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Position Requirements (skills, knowledge, experience and qualifications):

, ' ',

Demonstrated experience in providing specialist ICT Security Advice in a dynamic enterprise environment.

, ' ',

Demonstrated experience in conducting Threat and Risk Assessments (TRA) and IT Security Risk Management

, ' ',

Experience with Outsourcing and Cloud Security Integration

, ' ',

Experience with Data and Application Security concepts and architectures across technologies such as Identity and Access Management, Enterprise Service Bus and Business Intelligence.

, ' ',

Demonstrated record of effective stakeholder management and building effective working relationships with internal and external stakeholders in achieving business outcomes.

, ' ',

A sound working knowledge of ICT Security Compliance doctrine and best practices including: Protective Security Policy Framework and the Australian Government Information Security Manual

title: b'IT Security Specialist \r\n      '
jd:
[' ',


Contract opportunity for the experienced ICT Security Specialist to provide timely and accurate specialist review and advice on all ICT Security functions and to conduct risk assessments, provide ICT security guidance and contribute to the formulation of a strategic ICT security framework.

, ' ',

, ' ',

To be successful you will have:

, ' ',
  • Demonstrated experience in providing specialist ICT security advice in a dynamic enterprise environment.
  • Demonstrated experience in conducting threat and risk assessments (TRA) and IT security risk management
  • Experience with Outsourcing and Cloud Security integration
  • Experience with Data and Application Security concepts and architectures across technologies such as Identity and Access Management, Enterprise Service Bus and Business Intelligence.
  • Demonstrated record of effective stakeholder management and building effective working relationships with internal and external stakeholders in achieving business outcomes.

  • Proficient written and verbal communication skills, with an ability to liaise and negotiate with both internal and external stakeholders about highly confidential and sensitive issues
  • Degree or diploma qualifications in Engineering or Information Communications Technology;
  • An Australian Government Baseline Security Clearance.

, ' ',

Industry specific ICT security certifications (eg. IRAP or CISM) are highly desirable.

, ' ',

For more information please apply now or contact Dangira Venslovaite on 07 3124 5716

title: b'ICT Security Specialist\r\n      '
jd:

An enterprise and reputable Australian organization is looking for an ICT Security Specialist to join their Information Security team. You will develop and maintain security strategy, governance frameworks, and policy. You will be reporting to the Information Security Manager and provide advice and reviews on ICT Security Functions. Risk assessments, security guidance, and forming the strategic ICT security framework will be a core part of your role.

Responsibilities include:

, ' ',
  • Contribute to the development and maintenance of enterprise level ICT security documentation and assisting with strategic documentation.

  • Experience with working with vendors, outsourcing and Cloud Security Integration.
  • Experience with Data and Application Security, Identity and Access Management, Enterprise Service Bus and Business Intelligence.
  • Knowledge on Protective Security Policy Framework, Australian Government Information Security Manual, and other security compliance doctrine and best practices

To submit your application, in strict confidence, please apply online using the appropriate link below. Ref No. 4B/25657

title: b'\r\n          Data Engineer\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',

, '\n',

About the business and the role

, '\n',

Headquartered in Brisbane, Megaport pioneered the world's first SDN-based neutral fabric in order to change the way enterprises connect to services. Our vision is to enable service providers and users to connect over an elastic, Software Defined Network (SDN) allowing our customers wider coverage and speed to market; all while reducing costs and enabling real-time provisioning across one platform. The high demand for interconnection and the need for a change in bandwidth acquisition has positioned Megaport as the global leader in Elastic Interconnection.

, '\n',

Reporting to The Head of Software Development the role will be responsible for increasing our utilisation of data across the business.  You will monitor the output of operational processes for reported data quality issues and also look for ways to proactively monitor and improve data quality.  You will be comfortable liaising with stakeholders at all levels and understanding what various areas of the business wish to achieve from a reporting capacity.
 

, '\n',

, '\n',

, '\n',

Job tasks and responsibilities

, '\n',

  • Building custom dashboards, reports and data warehouses within complex environments

  • Run and contribute to workshops and training

  • Design, development and architecture of technical Business Intelligence solutions

  • Maintain familiarity with the BI and reporting tools to ensure seamless operation with the data warehouse

  • Perform detailed analysis of business problems and technical environments and use this in designing workable solutions whilst continuously addressing ongoing issues.
, '\n',

, '\n',

, '\n',

Skills and experience

, '\n',

  • Experience in building scalable reporting solutions that unlock business insights

  • Expertise in SQL development

  • Strong data analysis and reporting skills, and enjoy solving business challenges through your work.

  • A hands on approach with a flexible can do attitude

  • Comfortable with frequent consultation from internal and external stakeholders

  • Strong experience with SQL MSBI - SSIS, SSRS & SSAS

  • Strong understanding of ETL Design and Development

  • Ability to extract information from various applications

  • Experience with data visualization tools - e.g. MSBI, Tableau etc.

  • Bonuses: Software development skills, DevOps skills

  • 3-6 years experience
, '\n',

, '\n']

title: b'Principal Analyst - Permanent role\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',

Brisbane South PHN has an exciting opportunity to become part of our dynamic Knowledge, Planning and Performance (KPP) team. This is a permanent full-time role with a strong focus on the governance and use of data and information in primary health service planning, reporting and performance monitoring. You will work closely with KPP team members to provide professional analysis and advice that enables strategic program delivery. You will work collaboratively with our Brisbane South PHN teams, internal and external stakeholders and industry partners aiming to optimise the health of people in our communities and the delivery of health services within our region.

, '\n',

About the Company

, '\n',

Brisbane South PHN covers a large, culturally diverse, geographic area south of the Brisbane River. This includes metropolitan, rural and remote island locations across local government areas in Brisbane, Logan, Redlands and the Scenic Rim. Our focus is on understanding the health needs of our communities and improving the coordination and delivery of health care services to ensure people receive the right care in the right place at the right time.

, '\n',

To achieve success in this role, you will need:

, '\n',
  • 2-5 years' experience in a similar role.
  • Demonstrated experience in the use of health performance data analytics and business intelligence.
  • Experience with Qlik Sense, SharePoint, SQL and MS Office products.
  • Experience in the coordination and development of automated dashboards, reports and briefings.
  • High level of computer literacy and knowledge of software applications, databases and systems.
  • Understanding of digital health and use of emerging technology within primary healthcare.
  • Understanding of the primary, acute and aged health care sectors is highly desirable.
  • Tertiary qualification in a health/business related discipline is highly desirable.
  • Written and verbal communication and presentation skills to engage a range of stakeholders.
  • Ability to develop and maintain stakeholder relationships and deliver agreed outcomes.
  • Must return a positive National Police Check.
, '\n',

To gain a full understanding of the requirements of this job, please see the position description on our website www.bsphn.org.au. 

In return for your skills and capabilities, we offer:

, '\n',
  • Attractive remuneration and salary packaging option
  • Generous annual leave options
  • Private health insurance benefits
  • Employee Health & Wellbeing Program
  • Commitment to learning and development and performance excellence
  • Free Social Club
, '\n',

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.

Please visit our website at www.bsphn.org.au for more information.

, '\n',


To apply, please send your current resume with a covering letter outlining how you meet the skills, experience and knowledge requirements of the role by 5pm Tuesday 16 May 2017.

For further information on the role, please contact Tonia de Bruin, General Manager – Knowledge, Planning & Performance on 0402 794 866 during business hours. 

, '\n']

title: b'\r\n          Information Architect\r\n        '
jd:
[' ',

An organisation undertaking an exciting transformation has an opportunity to an experienced and qualified Information Architect to join the Architecture team.

, ' ',

The Information Architect will develop strategies and roadmaps for information management including master and meta data. In addition, the successful applicant will develop canonical data models, logical data models, high level data flows for a portfolio of over 200 applications.

, ' ',

The main duties of the position include:

, ' ',
  • Developing, implementing and supporting reporting, analytics and business intelligence/decision support solutions to meet the information needs and the strategic goals of the organisation
  • Developing roadmaps and solution architectures for transactional data, master and meta data, and business information
  • Design data integration architectures for all applications in the organisation
  • Help to inform the development of policy and governance for information management
  • Develop a centre of competency for the organisation for information management
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Our ideal candidate will be a highly experienced person able to manage their time independently, take ownership of issues, work as part of a team, be able to prioritise tasks, and have excellent technical, written and presentation skills.

, ' ',

In addition to a degree in Information Technology the following skills are required for this role;

, ' ',
  • Reporting and data analytics software experience
  • Solid knowledge of database design experience
  • Deep knowledge of one or more information management frameworks
  • Strong data modelling skills
  • Strong business analysis skills and solution design capabilities
  • Superior communication skills, together with excellent English oral and written abilities
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

This position will offer you the opportunity to impact the new direction for the organisation. You will drive innovation and make a difference that will take this organisation into the future. You will be rewarded with empowering career opportunities and a competitive remuneration package.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Please apply online with your resume and covering letter detailing your experience and suitability for this role.

, ' ',

For more information please email: recruitment@ucareqld.com.au

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Closing date for applications will be 5pm, Friday 12th May 2017.

, ' ']

title: b'BI Modeller\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',

Our client is a Government owned organisation, looking for a BI Modeller, with at least 8 years of experience data modelling for a business intelligence & analytics platform, to perform the following duties:

  • Develop multidimensional/star schema/extended star schema designs, analysis designs, and report designs using BEAM (Business Event Analysis & Modelling) Kimball and methodologies and business requirements

  • Guide BI developers in configuration and customisation of front-end BI tools 
, '\n',

What will make you a great candidate for this role:

  • Experience with BEAM and Kimball methodologies
  • 5 years of experience modelling in a Cognos environment preferred
  • Must have operated in a Scrum/Agile environment (not just an understanding of or familiar with)

  • Excellent communication skills

    Preferred location is Canberra where the main team is located however consideration for Melbourne or Brisbane will be available.

    Please note: only candidates who are suited to the role will be contacted.

    Our client is an equal opportunity employer

title: b'\r\n          Appointment Setter\r\n        '
jd:
[' ',

Appointment Setter

, ' ',

An excellent opportunity to work for Valmont, a leading organisation in the Design and Construction of Commercial Interiors.

, ' ',

We are seeking to appoint an experienced Appointment Setter working with opportunities in Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane and Perth.  The job will be based in Brisbane.

, ' ',

You will be joining a team of professionals in a dynamic and busy work environment and will be highly rewarded for your efforts.  The role will be part time – we aim to be flexible to suit the right candidate.

, ' ',

The role –

, ' ',

Working from existing Valmont business intelligence information you will:

, ' ',
  • Qualify sales opportunities for the relevant staff by confirming opportunities for Valmont and setting calendar invites for the relevant staff.
  • Maintain our Salesforce CRM system, with the emphasis on maintaining accurate data
  • Provide clear and accurate Reporting and Communication via the CRM system
  • Provide administrative support to the Tender Team
  • Demonstrate your initiative to identify and follow up opportunities with companies who are not already in our CRM system, Salesforce
  • Proactively follow up any additional leads generated from canvassing/trade shows by the Business Development Managers and previous contacts
  • Manage our CRM database, Salesforce, to a high degree of accuracy to ensure all tasks are completed on time and targeted marketing activity can take place to generate new business

    What are we looking for from you?

    Required Skills:

, ' ',
  • Previous experience in an outbound telesales environment and a desire to grow your career. Specific experience in Design, Project Management or Construction may be an advantage
  • Fluency with a CRM system, Salesforce an advantage
  • Competent at Microsoft outlook and its relevant functions
  • Experience in making high volume outbound calls
  • Ability to get through "gate keepers"
  • Personable and professional phone manner
  • Strong English communication skills, both written and verbal
  • Strong objection handling skills
  • Assist with submission writing in publisher 
  • Assist with tender preparation 
  • Assist with building customised profiles to send to potential clients
  • Assist with day to day operation office admin such as ordering stationery, groceries, travel, new starters, general admin etc
, ' ',

Desirable skills

, ' ',

Experience in construction tender submission and bid preparation

, ' ',

Knowledge of construction industry an advantage but not essential

, ' ',

Personal attributes:

, ' ',
  • Motivation to succeed
  • Solid persuasion and negotiation skills
  • Resilience and initiative, with a 'can do attitude'
  • Hungry, driven and self-motivating personality
  • Enthusiastic and positive attitude
  • Attention to detail and good communication skills
, ' ',

You must be able to work in Australia without any visa restrictions.

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Interested - call Cathy Ledger our Human Resources Manager on 0434 226 622 or visit our website www.valmont.com for more information about our company.

, ' ']

title: b'Data Co-ordinator\r\n    '
jd:
[' ',

Do you believe in possibilities?

, ' ',

We do.

, ' ',

Come and help us turn hope into reality for our clients

, ' ',
  • Help us shape our performance reporting and business intelligence capability
  • Full time position with negotiable flexibility in working arrangements and hours for the right candidate
  • Maternity leave contract until 30 October 2017
  • Located in either Spring Hill or Burleigh Heads (negotiable with successful candidate)
  • Salary packaging options available
, ' ',

About us

, ' ',

Lives Lived Well is a leading, not-for-profit organisation delivering innovative and accessible services aimed at influencing behaviour, reducing harm, aiding recovery and bringing about positive change in people's lives.

, ' ',

About the opportunity

, ' ',

With an important focus on reporting of clinical performance, the role is responsible for the delivery of data analysis, reports and dashboards to support internal and external reporting requirements, organisational decision making and performance measurement across LLW. Key duties include:

, ' ',
  • Data collection, entry & analysis and reporting in a meaningful, easily to understand and professional presentation.
  • Increasing the integrity and accuracy of LLW data sets - through your advice, support and training you will develop the staff capability of data management and use of relevant platforms.
  • Develop processes and guidelines to support effective data management practices.
, ' ',

What you will bring to role

, ' ',
  • Relevant tertiary studies, including research methodology and statistical analysis.
  • Applied knowledge of contemporary data management and analysis methodologies and systems
  • Demonstrated experience in data entry, analysis, interpretation and reporting
  • High level of proficiency in the use of data management and reporting databases and software.
  • Demonstrated capability to work independently and meet strict timeframes.
, ' ',

For full role duties and key selection criteria please see the position description using the link below.

, ' ',

Tick all these boxes? Share our passion?

, ' ',

We'd love to hear from you, just click "Apply now"

, ' ',

For further questions - please contact Julie Dignan, Business Manager, Quality, Risk and Reporting on m 0410 514 273 e Julie.dignan@liveslivedwell.org.au or Human Resources on e hr@liveslivedwell.org.au

, ' ',

To apply for this job go to: www.liveslivedwellcareers.org.au & enter ref code: 3481451.

, ' ',

Applications close 14 May 2017

title: b'Technical Underwriter\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

Job Summary

, ' ',

The job holder will play an integral role in the Technical Product Team for Health and Assistance by bringing analytical leadership (technical and financial modelling) to a wide range of regular and complex underwriting activities.

, ' ',

About Us

, ' ',

We are the world's leading specialist and expert in the creation and delivery of unique solutions that combine service, insurance and technology to provide worldwide protection and care. We specialise in assistance, international health & life, automotive and travel insurance direct to the customer or through business partners – in some case integrated into their customer offering.

, ' ',

With over 16,000 talented and dedicated employees across 76 countries speaking over 70 different languages we are here for our customers in time of need. 250 million people, or 4% of the world's total population, benefit from our assistance, travel insurance and personal services, with an intervention every 2 seconds around the world. We are proud to be part of the Allianz Group and we love, as a company, to help people.

, ' ',

Working at Allianz Worldwide Partners, you'll find the rewards are more than just financial.  Without your contribution, we wouldn't be the same. So it's important for you to enjoy what you do

, ' ',

What will you be doing?

, ' ',

The Technical Underwriter will work closely with the General Manager and Product Managers to lead or support tactical and strategic framework developments, be involved in practical hands-on implementation tasks, support regular underwriting processes as assigned, and provide cover for Product Managers as required. Wider stakeholders include Finance, Pricing, Sales, Market Management, and Business Intelligence.

, ' ',

Duties and responsibilities

, ' ',
  • Regular review of the standard quotation tools, Identify operational issues and tool development and scope technical developments in conjunction with pricing
  • Perform user-acceptance model testing and development of standard quotation strategies and efficiencies
  • Support Product Managers with activity for complex new and renewal pricing requirements
  • Support Product Managers with their activity for scoping monitoring requirements for contracts and clients
  • Support and strengthen underwriting controls and review and assess general data quality as required by the team
  • Further technical support as required by the General Manager
, ' ',

What makes a successful Technical Underwriter?

, ' ',
  • 5+ years relevant work experience, of which 2+ in a similar type role
  • Tertiary qualifications in a relevant discipline such as Actuarial Studies, Applied Statistics or Mathematics, Quantitative Analysis, or other relevant Insurance training.
  • Advanced user of Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Work and Microsoft PowerPoint
  • Strong numerical ability
  • Inductive reasoning skills
  • The ability to communicate in a clear and concise manner across a range of mediums and audiences
  • Able to assist Product Manager in influencing outcomes with relevant stakeholders
, ' ',

Benefits and Culture

, ' ',

Working at Allianz Worldwide Partners we value and develop our employees.

, ' ',

All employees are offered access to a few free insurance covers; such as roadside assistance, life and salary continuance. Being a part of the wider Allianz family we also gain access to discount home, motor vehicle, boat, travel and medical insurance.

, ' ',

Work is where we spend most of our time and you'll be ready to refer friends and family too – this is where we offer "refer a friend/ family" incentives. At Allianz Worldwide Partners we care and want to help you grow, we want you to stay with us for the long term. That's why our Leaders and Learning & Development team are committed to helping you advance your skills, knowledge and qualifications to ensure your career continues to flourish. We can never stop learning.

, ' ',

Interested in a career with us?

, ' ',

Simply click on 'APPLY' and we'll be in contact shortly.

, ' ',

*Your privacy is important to us. Our Privacy Policy sets out how Allianz Worldwide Partners collects, stores, uses and discloses personal information. This can be viewed below:

, ' ',

https://www.allianzworldwidepartners.com.au/privacy-and-security/

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

 

, ' ',

 

, ' ']

title: b'Business Performance Reporting Analyst\r\n      '
jd:
['Brisbane City Council’s multi-channel Contact Centre enjoys an enviable reputation for providing exceptional service to residents, business and visitors. As part of their ongoing commitment to enhancing service delivery we are now seeking to fill a new role for an initial 12 month contract for an experienced Reporting Analyst with strong exposure to Contact Centre service delivery environments.',
, ' ',
, ' In 2016 the Contact Centre was awarded National Contact Centre of the Year (under 20 FTE and 150-499 FTE) at the Auscontact Association Awards. This is a genuine opportunity to work with a fantastic team who continue to develop their operations to achieve outstanding success.',
, ' ',
, ' ', What will you be doing?,
, ' ',
, ' This position delivers a high standard performance reporting and analysis service to the Customer Delivery Section. You will develop and maintain business reporting solutions to provide timely and accurate information that supports decision making. \xa0You will also assist in identifying business information needs and provide advice to senior management and key stakeholders, while also assisting in the preparation of data to meet Council’s strategic and operational performance reporting requirements.',
, ' ',
, ' ', When and where will you do it?,
, ' ',
, ' This role will work Monday to Friday generally during traditional business hours. The Contact Centre however operates 24 hours per day, 7 days per week and as such all staff must be flexible to work rotating rosters including the participation in an on-call emergency event roster.',
, ' ',
, ' We have 2 Contact Centre sites and an operational team based in the City. \xa0While predominantly based at our Brisbane CBD site in this position you must be prepared to occasionally travel to our Contact Centre sites at Chermside and Yeerongpilly.\xa0',
, ' ',
, ' ', What is on offer?, ' ',
  • A commencement base salary of between $83,953 and $93,348 p.a. plus superannuation
  • Ongoing development
  • Accrual of annual and personal leave
  • The opportunity to accrue flex time to accrue rostered days off
  • The potential for extension or longer term permanent work based on individual performance and business needs
, ' ',
, ' ', What we are seeking?, ' ',
  • A proven ability to deliver highly effective reporting solutions, utilising a range of reporting, data visualisation or business intelligence tools for a diverse audience within a Contact Centre context.
  • Demonstrated knowledge and ability to provide strategic insight on business reporting systems, data definitions and related technical infrastructure. 
  • Demonstrated research, analysis and problem-solving skills including the ability to critically assess options that address organisational, process or business needs. 
  • High levels of accountabilities and a strong continuous improvement focus
  • A strong business acumen with commercial and organisational awareness
  • Well-developed interpersonal skills including the ability to influence and develop and maintain positive working relationships through a strong customer focus.
  • Ability to contribute to team direction, give and receive feedback and achieve agreed performance standards in order to contribute to a culture of performance excellence
  • Exceptionally good PC and systems skills with a solid understanding of contemporary Contact Centre technology
  • High levels of resilience and the ability to work autonomously
, ' ',
, ' ', How do you apply?,
, ' ',
, ' If this sounds like you please click the apply link and ensure you attach an up-to-date resume and complete all contact details including your email address for a prompt acknowledgement of your application. Reference No. JN-12421. To apply you must have full permanent working rights in Australia.',
, ' ',
, ' Should you have any questions prior to submitting your application please contact Mark Gallen at TactiCall Recruitment on 07 3831 6333 during office hours.',
, ' ',
, ' ', Closing date midnight Monday 15 2017.,
, ' ',
, ' ', Due to the requirements of this role, a criminal history check will be undertaken on preferred applicants.  A criminal history does not necessarily preclude an applicant from appointment. Applicants may also be required to undertake a pre placement Medical Assessment.,
, ' ',
, ' Brisbane City Council is an Equal Opportunity Employer.',
, ' \xa0 ',

, ' ',

Before applying please ensure you read, understand and accept the terms outlined in our Privacy Policy which can be viewed at http://www.tacticall.com.au/page/about-us/privacy-statement/

For more positions visit http://www.tacticall.com.au where you can also stay in touch with new jobs by liking us on facebook and following us on twitter and Linkedin
 

, ' ',

, ' ']

jd:

title: b'\r\n          Data Analyst\r\n        '
jd:
[' ',

e&e is a professional Business and Technology Consultancy providing services to our clients during business initiation, transformation and IT programs of work. e&e currently has a requirement for an experienced Data Analyst to work with one of our leading clients in Brisbane. This is an excellent opportunity to join a team of specialists working on an enterprise information management transformation program.  

, ' ',

You will be joining a high performing team and will be required to work with the business, technology and financial reporting teams.  

, ' ',

To be considered you will need the following;

, ' ',
  • At least 5 years experience in a Data Analyst role within a project environment.
  • An understanding of data modelling and profiling.
  • Excellent data analysis skills ensuring data quality.
  • The ability to work within tight time frames and enjoy working within a collaborative team environment.
  • Experience with Business Intelligence tools such as Tableau, Cognos or SAS desirable but not essential.
, ' ',

To find out more about this role please send your resume to info@eeitsolutions.com.au with REF DA891.

, ' ',

 

, ' ']

['\n',

The Company

, '\n',

Reward Hospitality is Australia's largest distributor of non-food consumables to a range of industries such as hospitality, catering, health & aged care, education, contract cleaning, mining & construction. Reward operates out of 18 sites across Australia and is owned by The E.CF Group, based in Paris. The E.CF Group was incorporated in 1880 and has developed into Europe's leader in the distribution of small Equipment, Tabletop, Kitchenware and Consumables to the mid to high end Food Service customers across France, Belgium, Luxemburg, Switzerland, northern Italy and more recently branched out into Morocco, Dubai and Australasia. The E.CF Group including Reward Hospitality employs 1,350 staff and its economical turnover (including franchised stores and affiliates) is in excess of $400m pa. Reward Hospitality's national capability is unmatched and it takes pride in its unique offering to the Australian market setting new benchmarks for the rest of the industry to aspire too.

, '\n',

The Role

, '\n',

Reporting to the Group Commercial Manager the scope of this role is to maintain the integrity, accuracy and optimum performance of the Company's Pricing strategy including, but not limited to, the company price list and customer contracted prices. This also includes responsibility for maintaining the inventory database as well as online ordering portals with customers.

, '\n',

Key Responsibilities of the Role

, '\n',

Price list management:

, '\n',
  • Maintain and review consistency of Reward's national price list, including Website, Hospitality Stores and the price list for our Sales team
  • Develop a pricing benchmark against our competitors by category, using materials provided by Reward's sales teams, information provided by category managers, suppliers and online benchmarks
  • Prepare and suggest national price reviews and related communication to the sales teams and to customers
  • Prepare promotional campaigns including pricing in coordination with Category Managers, Sales Teams and Marketing Manager
, '\n',

Pricing analysis and support for Sales

, '\n',
  • Analyse and review price points offered to customers / market segments and recommend reviews to the Sales Directors
  • Support the sales team in special project pricing and approve quotes and low prices whenever deemed relevant
  • Suggest and recommend GP% optimisation strategy to the Senior Management team
, '\n',

Database management

, '\n',
  • Audit and review the product database to ensure proper maintenance including but not limited to product costings, pack quantities, classification and sell price
  • Ensure regular maintenance and update of customers' online ordering portals in collaboration with the sales teams
  • Liaise with the Procurement team and Inventory Management team to develop regular Inventory Database reviews and develop processes to ensure compliance and efficiency
, '\n',

Essential Criteria 

, '\n',
  • 2 years or more graduate work experience in a relevant role (pricing, business analysis, financial controlling, etc) in a corporate environment or a consultancy   
  • Tertiary Qualifications in Accounting, Business, Finance, Economics or relevant discipline
  • Exceptional analytical skills (data manipulation & development of commercial analysis)
  • Strong communication skills with ability to engage with Sales Directors and Business Unit Managers and  to make sound commercial decisions
  • Advanced ERP and Business Intelligence Analyst (Pronto, Cognos or similar) system knowledge
  • Advanced Excel knowledge and skills
  • Project management skills enabling on time delivery of projects
  • High level attention to detail 
  • Service orientated and a team player
, '\n',

Desirable Criteria

, '\n',
  • Knowledge gained in the wholesale distribution industry with a high level of SKUs and multi- site national operation
, '\n',

Benefits

, '\n',

The remuneration package for this role includes a competitive annual Base Salary, 9.5% Superannuation, Staff pricing on our products, access to corporate rates for private health insurance and career development opportunities.

, '\n',

If you are interested in this role please click on the "Apply" button and complete our online application form and attach a copy of your resume and cover letter including salary expectations (range).

, '\n']
