title: b'UAT Test Coordinator\r\n      '
jd:
['Our Large Government client is currently seeking a UAT Test Coordinator for a Contract role based in Brisbane CBD, until October 2017.',
, ' ',
, ' You will work on a Business Transformation project, aimed at improving reporting and business intelligence capabilities, improved data integrity and transparency, reduced data errors, new and improved user experience with access to system available from any device with internet connection at any time, as well as improved operational efficiencies.',
, ' ',
, ' As the UAT Test Coordinator you will be responsible for facilitating User Acceptance Testing sessions, preparing test cases from complex business requirements documentation, executing test cases and recording the results and collaborating with other teams and external stakeholders as required to undertake timely preparation for testing, issue and defect resolution to enable test execution deadlines to be met to ensure timely release of functionality for the benefit of the department’s clients.',
, ' ',
, ' ', Other Responsibilities will include:,
, ' ',
  • Overcome logistical challenges planning User Acceptance Testing.
  • Facilitate User Acceptance Testing sessions.
  • Review and provide input to business requirements documentation.
  • Prepare test cases from complex business requirements documentation.
  • Execute test cases and record results
  • Utilisation of contemporary testing toolsets and understanding of testing methodologies
  • Facilitate defect identification, triage, and retesting activities.
  • Provision of input to all testing estimates.
  • Provision of input to the master test plan.
  • Prepare regular status reports.
  • Participate in the change request process
, ' ',

To be successful you will have the following experience:

, ' ',
  • Prior experience co-ordinating and facilitating UAT sessions within a large business transformation.
  • Prior experience testing within a Business Transformation Project
  • Minimum 5 years’ experience as a Senior Test Analyst with responsibility for developing and executing test cases within waterfall and agile project environments
  • Ability to apply experience of contemporary testing approaches and methodologies
, ' ',
 
, ' ',
 
, ' ',
, ' ',
, " To be considered for the role click the 'Apply' button or for more information about this and other opportunities please contact Anita Cunningham on 07 33395626. Please quote our job reference number: 200166071. "]

title: b'\r\n          Senior J2EE Software Engineer\r\n        '
jd:
['\n',

A large multi-national with a mining software product development centre here in Brisbane needs you to join their team. Their products generate and process large amounts of data from sensors, on-board models, and control algorithms in real-time creating real-world machine usage information. As part of the overall digital strategy, this organisation has developed an integrated family of mining machine-based information technology products that interconnect the mining machines to provide real time guidance, tracking, monitoring and supervisory control of the operational mining fleet. The product range links with other mining and business information systems and is an integral part of the organisation's Mining Technology Enabled Solutions vision.

, '\n',
, '\n',

As an Engineering Specialist in the Brisbane software product development centre, you will be a part of an exciting team environment providing huge benefits to mining customers in the area of mine haul truck fleet management, machine health monitoring, safety systems and autonomous mine machine operations. You will be a key contributor in the concept, development, and design of complex components, subsystems and processes. You will contribute to the planning and delivery of projects, continually learn and stay abreast of innovative technology and deepen your professional network. Working in a team environment with worldwide scope, you will combine your knowledge of information, communication or electronic technologies with customer requirements to advance the product in the marketplace.

, '\n',
, '\n',

Skills/Experience Required:

, '\n',
, '\n',

  • Strong experience of Java, Spring and Hibernate
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to assimilate knowledge from multiple sources
  • Knowledge of Geographical Information Systems
  • Have a strong quality focus
  • Experience in Agile methodology and use case development
  • Be prepared to be on call to support our customers
  • Previous experience in the analysis and specification of complex large scale site level software technology systems and products
  • Relevant engineering or IT degree Skills / Experience
, '\n',
, '\n',

Desired:

, '\n',
, '\n',

  • Experience in mining technology
  • Knowledge of software product development best practices
  • Experience with database, business intelligence or corporate reporting applications
  • Advanced degree in a relevant discipline
, '\n',
, '\n',

The role is based in the Brisbane CBD. The initial duration is 12 months with a strong possibility of extensions for the right person.

, '\n',
, '\n',

Please email your CV to jobs@taskgroup.com.au quoting job reference number TR2773.

, '\n']

title: b'Data Officer\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',
  • Full Time 6 month contract
  • Immediate Start
  • Milton Location
, ' ',

Overview of the ANFPP

, ' ',

Established in Australia in 2008, the Australian Nurse-Family Partnership Program (ANFPP) is a part of the Australian Government's commitment to improve the health of Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Island people, with particular focus on maternal health and early childhood development.  The ANFPP includes 18 critical model elements of the internationally recognised Nurse Family Partnership ©, with over 30 years of research showing compelling evidence of its effectiveness in improving pregnancy outcomes, child health and development, and parental life course.  For more information on the ANFPP, please visit www.anfpp.com.au.

, ' ',

The Opportunity

, ' ',

We are currently seeking a Data Officer to provide support to the Data Analyst and ANFPP National Knowledge Access (ANKA) Project Team in delivering a national online data and information system.

, ' ',

As a member of a small and innovative project team there will be opportunities to be creative, together with exposure to all aspects of project development and delivery.

, ' ',

This role is based at our Milton head office, and our working hours are between 8:30am – 5:00pm, Monday to Friday.

, ' ',

Key Duties

, ' ',

Undertake the day to day data activities for the ANKA Project including but not limited to:

, ' ',
  • Maintain the ANFPP Data Specification including change control and updates as required;
  • Assist with the migration of data from existing systems into a cloud-based platform including;
  • Identify the data mapping required for historical data sources;
  • Maintain a data dictionary of terms and definitions;
  • Extract and manipulate routine to complex data, ensuring the accuracy and integrity to support efficient monitoring and reporting processes;
  • Develop queries to extract annual reporting information and undertake data analysis activities as required;
  • Contribute to the delivery of contract deliverables by contributing to regular reporting responsibilities;
  • Undertake other reasonable duties as directed.
, ' ',

Key Requirements                                              

, ' ',
  • Demonstrated 2+ years of experience with SQL Server database querying and programming;
  • Strong analytical, problem solving and reporting skills;
  • Ability to understand data; transformation, mapping and cleansing rules and techniques;
  • Ability to meet tight deadlines and to react positively to manage priorities;
  • Ability to work both independently and as part of a team;
  • Excellent communication skills;
  • A background in business intelligence would be desirable;
  • Good general ICT technical knowledge.
, ' ',

 

, ' ',

Further Information & Application Details

, ' ',

Applications should be submitted online via the Careers page of Abt Associates' website: www.abtassoc.com.au/careers, where a full Position Description and further details on the opportunity can be found. 

, ' ',

Applications must include a cover letter, current CV (maximum 3 pages) and a clear indication of the position being applied for.

, ' ',

The closing date for applications is at 5pm, 5th May 2017 (AEST).

, ' ',

We welcome and thank all applications for this position, however only shortlisted applicants will be contacted.

, ' ',

Abt Associates – Who We Are

, ' ',

Abt Associates is a recognised leader in the international development sector. Working with our many partners, Abt Associates implements bold innovative solutions to improve the lives of the community and deliver valued outcomes for our clients. We provide a comprehensive range of services from policy to service delivery in the public and private sectors contributing to long term benefits for clients and communities. Operating in remote and challenging environments, we offer innovative solutions, extensive experience in the region, strong technical capacity, and a proven project management track record. We are committed to gender equity in our employment strategies and encourage applications from capable women. Abt Associates is a child safe organisation and promotes the safety, wellbeing and inclusion of all children.

, ' ',

For more information about our company and what we do visit our website at www.abtassociates.com.au.

, ' ']

title: b'Project Manager | Health\r\n      '
jd:
[' ',

Our client, QLD Health, are currently seeking a number of Project Managers to join a digital portfolio of work.

, ' ',

A summary of the programs they are currently seeking these roles for are as follows;

, ' ',

Integrated Care: This program is focused on the standardisation, digitalisation and automation of processes and systems that enable patient and family centric service delivery across the continuum of care.

, ' ',

Digital Hospital and Health Service: This program is focused on the standardisation, digitalisation and automation of internal clinical processes and systems.

, ' ',

Performance and Sustainability:This program is focused on providing the solutions that will enable the standardisation, digitalisation and automation of corporate services and performance management processes. Additionally this program will establish Health Intelligence services, improve our information management and business intelligence capabilities as well as deliver solutions to support world class research.

, ' ',

Digital Enablement: This program differentiates from the other programs (which are more system focused change) as this program primarily focuses on the physical technology that users interact with or are dependent upon to communicate, to collaborate and store and transfer data. This program is focused on optimising the use of the current technologies implemented across the organisation and the implementation of new technologies to enable improved care delivery, customer experience, and increased resilience as well as improving economic sustainability.

, ' ',

Responsibilities and experience required for this position are as follows;

, ' ',
  • Proven experience in the delivery of large scale complex IM/ICT program/project(s), preferably in the health care industry
  • Proven stakeholder relationship management skills to support effective business change, including the ability to initiate relationships and influence key stakeholders
  • Expertise in, and application of, appropriate project management methodologies (preferably PRINCE2), and an ability to promote and provide advice on the use of appropriate project management techniques, methodologies and tools
  • Proven excellent negotiation, consultation, facilitation and effective written and oral communication skills for use in a complex project environment
  • Proven experience in leading, managing and mentoring an effective multi-disciplinary team
, ' ',

Highly desirable;

, ' ',
  • Project Managers with a proven track record implementing large complex ICT solutions within Queensland Health
, ' ',

To submit your application, in strict confidence, please apply online using the appropriate link below quoting Ref No. 4A/17402.

, ' ',

Your interest will be treated in the strictest of confidence.

, ' ']

title: b'Project Manager\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

Lime Recruitment is currently recruiting a number of Project Manager contracts for one of our large Queensland government clients.  

, '\n',

A summary of the programs we are currently seeking these roles for is as below:

, '\n',

Integrated Care

, '\n',

This program is focused on the standardisation, digitalisation and automation of processes and systems that enable patient and family centric service delivery across the continuum of care.  Solutions to be implemented will improve patient care outcomes, consumer experience and improve economic sustainability with focus on clinical communications supporting the transition of care, integrated care planning, health information exchange enabling information sharing with partners and a longitudinal record for children and young people from pre-birth to adult.

, '\n',

Digital Hospital and Health Service

, '\n',

This program is focused on the standardisation, digitalisation and automation of internal clinical processes and systems. These processes are those business processes that are unique to the delivery of healthcare and as such will require solutions that are healthcare specific.  Solutions to be implemented are to be focused on improving patient care outcomes as well as improving economic sustainability.

, '\n',

Performance and Sustainability

, '\n',

This program is focused on providing the solutions that will enable the standardisation, digitalisation and automation of corporate services and performance management processes. Additionally this program will establish Health Intelligence services, improve our information management and business intelligence capabilities as well as deliver solutions to support world class research.

, '\n',

Digital Enablement

, '\n',

This program is focused on optimising the use of the current technologies implemented across and the implementation of new technologies to enable improved care delivery, customer experience, and increased resilience as well as improving economic sustainability.

, '\n',

This program differentiates from the other programs (which are more system focused change) as this program primarily focuses on the physical technology that users interact with or are dependent upon to communicate, to collaborate and store and transfer data.

, '\n',

Ideally you will have experience in the following:

, '\n',
  • Proven experience in the delivery of large scale complex IM/ICT program/project(s), preferably in the health care industry
  • Experience in or knowledge of the Cerner Millennium FirstNet and CareDelivery functionality
  • Experience in or knowledge of application integration methods and middleware technologies
  • Proven stakeholder relationship management skills to support effective business change, including the ability to initiate relationships and influence key stakeholders
  • Facilitate the appropriate governance structure and provide support to the sponsor & steering committee
  • Manage an appropriate relationship with vendors/providers, including monitor of contract
  • Develop & manage project controls such as budget, schedule, risk / issues, scope and benefits management
  • Ensure effective business change management is in place to support the project deployment
  • Plan with other PMs and Digital Delivery Office to allocate shared resources across projects and  contribute to whole of office scheduling and monitoring
  • Expertise in, and application of, appropriate project management methodologies (preferably PRINCE2), and an ability to promote and provide advice on the use of appropriate project management techniques, methodologies and tools
  • Proven excellent negotiation, consultation, facilitation and effective written and oral communication skills for use in a complex project environment
  • Proven experience in leading, managing and mentoring an effective multi-disciplinary team
, '\n',

This position closes shortly so APPLY NOW or for more information contact Cassandra Manthey on 0432 717 634 or email cass@limejobs.com.au.  Lime Recruitment is Queensland owned and operated. For more information, visit www.limerecruitment.com.au

, '\n']

title: b'Senior BI Analyst\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

My government client is seeking to engage a Senior Business Intelligence Analyst to work with partner agencies to assist business areas with reporting and analytics.

, '\n',

This engagement is to work with business to define reporting and analytics requirements, in addition to defining corresponding work packages on data cleansing, data migration, data integration and dashboard/report construction.

, '\n',

This position will  be based in the Brisbane CBD.

, '\n',

Key responsibilities

, '\n',
  • Work with business areas to gather and analyse business requirements.
  • Assist the business to frame their business issues and data challenges, and identify reporting and analytics requirements.
  • Identify strengths and weaknesses in reporting design plans and suggest improvement.
  • Assist in the development of reporting and analytics roadmaps for business areas.
  • Translate business requirements into technical requirements.
  • Model data using Kimball data modelling principles.
  • Develop and document work packages for IT delivery based on technical requirements drawn from business requirements, including:
    • Designs for ETL, data transformation and data management processes using SSIS;
    • Designs for SSAS cubes;
    • Designs for SSRS reports on both data warehouse and cubes;
    • Designs for Microsoft Power BI dashboards and analytics.
  • Participate in quality assurance processes including user acceptance testing.
, '\n',

Capabilities for success

, '\n',

Within the context of the duties described above, the ideal applicant will be someone who:

, '\n',
  • Solid analytical skills and experience in information data and reporting projects.
  • Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to communicate technical concepts to non-technical users.
  • High level knowledge and experience in the extraction, manipulation, presentation and dissemination of complex data sets.
  • Proven abilities to visualise, articulate, conceptualise and problem solve in order to prepare and present data using business intelligence systems.
  • Demonstrated ability to provide professional advice, liaise, consult and negotiate with a diverse range of stakeholders.
  • Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
, '\n',

 

, '\n',

Essential skills, experience and qualifications

, '\n',
  • 3-5 years of experience working in the business intelligence domain.
  • Knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server DB Query, SSIS, SSAS, SSRS and MDX.
  • Knowledge of SQL 2008 R2, SQL 2012 and SQL 2014.
  • Knowledge of MS Self-Service BI toolsets including Excel using PowerPivot, PowerView and Power BI.
  • Knowledge of Kimball dimensional modelling.
  • Knowledge and significant experience around data analysis, data modelling, data integration, data warehousing and database design.
  • Proven capability to design quality solutions and relevant documentation.
  • Strong communication skills.
, '\n',

Desirable:

, '\n',
  • Knowledge of IBM Infosphere DataStage.
  • Knowledge of IBM Cognos.
  • Knowledge of DMX.
, '\n',

If you are interested please apply immediately.

, '\n',

 

, '\n']

title: b'General Manager\r\n      '
jd:
['\n',

The role
A well established and very successful business which provides specialist technical systems and solutions to their client base throughout Australia is seeking a General Manager to continue the growth and profitability of the organisation.  This key role will be to provide leadership to the national team, focussing on strong relationships with customers, suppliers and industry.  Responsibilities will include management of sales, marketing, operations, finance as well as overall governance for the business.

The candidate
The ideal candidate will have the following skills & attributes:

, '\n',
  • Strong, proven cross-functional senior management experience, preferably at a national level, in a specialist provider environment, with the capability to drive business objectives by leading and motivating a technical/commercial team
  • Proven ability to drive business objectives, with strong financial, business and governance skills, comfortable in working to agreed KPIs 
  • A high level of business emotional intelligence and strategic approach, known for the ability to relate at all levels of the business, with strong communication and a strategic approach in managing relationships with a diverse range of stakeholders, whether it be customers, suppliers, regulatory authorities, research bodies or media
, '\n',

This is an excellent opportunity to provide leadership and general management in a long standing and well-established growing business in the healthcare space. For enquiries please call Mick Hay or Sharon Moloney on 07 3878 3411 or apply via www.rimfireresources.com.au

, '\n']

title: b'Data Warehouse Specialist \r\n      '
jd:
['A large financial organisation based in Brisbane are seeking the expertise of a Data Warehouse Specialist/ Data Modeller that has worked in big data environments to join them on a contractual bases. In this role you will apply your best practice experience to drive streamlined processes across the Finance Data Analytics team and organisation. ',
, ' \xa0',
, ' \xa0',
, ' As the\xa0Data Warehouse Specialist, you will lead enterprise data warehouse (EDW) development, including data modelling and the creation of data marts. You will understand financial services business needs and translate them into the data model, providing and proposing the appropriate data analysis solutions for EDW development and reporting purposes. You will also document ETL specs, and provide support for ETL developers.',
, ' \xa0',
, ' To be successful in this role it is imperative that you can demonstrate:',
, ' \xa0',
, ' To be successful for this position you will need to display:',
, ' ',
  • 8+ years of extensive technical experience in database design, architecture, and enterprise application integration 
  • Proven design and development expertise working in enterprise database development 
  • Experience working in a Data Vault environment is highly advantageous
  • Experience with Business Intelligence practices and processes, familiarity with data mart and data warehouse design and implementations 
  • Experience with a diverse range of Business Intelligence technologies
  • Able to accurately and effectively translate business and logical requirements to physical database models and designs 
  • Experience with multiple database platforms 
  • Able to analyse large data sets and evaluate data anomalies 
, ' \xa0',
, ' In return you will be offered a contract until the end of June 2017 with possible extensions and an attractive day rate. For more information please contact Anita Cunningham on 07 3339 5626',
, ' \xa0',
, ' ',
, " To be considered for the role click the 'Apply' button or for more information about this and other opportunities please contact Anita Cunningham on 07 33395626. Please quote our job reference number: 200166851. "]

title: b'Application Support Manager\r\n    '
jd:
['We are seeking a customer focused, results oriented ', Application Support Manager, " to join a leading software solutions' organisation, you will be based in their ", Brisbane CBD office, '. They are undergoing an exciting journey of continued growth and transformation. Your demonstrated experience leading and developing a large team and driving strategic outcomes is required.',
, ' \xa0\xa0',
, ' You will report directly into the General Manager and will be responsible for managing a geographically dispersed team located across 4 sites within Australia and New Zealand. The team provides Lv 1 and Lv 2 Application support (phone, email and remote access) to a large external user base. Your role will be to ensure that a first-class level of support is provided at all times, driving a culture of exceptional customer service.\xa0\xa0',
, ' ',
, " You will be a motivated and influential leader with a strong work ethic and good leadership, communication, interpersonal and organisational skills. You will need to have worked within a similar environment with at least 3 years' experience managing an Application Support team with the ability to work within a fast paced environment where you manage your workload and priorities effectively.",
, ' \xa0',
, ' ', Key Responsibilities:,
, ' ',
  • Lead and manage the delivery of application software support services through an effective Help Desk (Lv 1) and escalated technical application support team (Lv 2) for external commercial customers and stakeholders.
  • Lead, motivate and develop the application support team to equip them with the skills and knowledge to achieve high standards in the delivery of customer support services.
  • Lead and contribute to organisation-wide communications on key customer issues/experience to raise awareness and drive solution-oriented actions.
  • Effectively engage with internal business units ensuring a continuous improvement approach to enhance product and customer experience. 
, ' \xa0', As the leader of this key role, you will be required to have:,
, ' ',
  • Proven experience leading an IT Applications' Support Services' team, providing Tier 1 and Tier 2 application support services to commercial customers and stakeholders.
  • Experience in implementing and embedding 'best-in-class' service management practices and tools,  based on the Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL) framework, to achieve a step change in service delivery performance.
  • Experience in implementing/using business intelligence, analytical and reporting tools to measure and track team performance and gain call driver and customer insights to improve customer experience and improve business operations' efficiency.
  • Experience in implementing and managing a client-focused service delivery and performance management culture.
  • An ability to effectively manage high pressure situations in a calm and rationale manner.
  • An ability to communicate confidently and to a high standard (both verbal and written)
  • Effective, high quality customer and stakeholder engagement and relationship management skills.
, ' To be considered for this role you must possess the right to work in Australia and be able to travel to the other sites on a regular basis.\xa0 For a confidential discussion please contact Jelissa Taylor, 0415 430 303. ']

title: b'Project Manager (BI System Implementation)'
jd:
['\n',

This is a great opportunity to lead the planning, management and delivery of a significant BI system implementation within a large project environment. It will enable the provision of business critical intelligence and fundamentally shape the way information systems support financial and non-financial functions within one of the largest public sector projects in SEQ.

, '\n',

This role is primarily suited to a Project Manager with data warehouse experience, who is able to effectively engage stakeholders and manage expectations within a corporate services environment.

, '\n',

The requirements of this position include:

, '\n',
  • Provision of a powerful and cost effective BI platform to analyse and present information in an effective and succinct manner.
  • Procurement of the supporting tools to build and maintain backend data sets integrated with corporate raw data sources, both sourced on-prem.
  • Development and establishment of a centralised governance framework and supporting processes to manage end to end data and reporting lifecycle  of the organization. This will be supported by extant overarching frameworks and functional capability of the BI platform.
  • Deliver organisational capability to self-service, analyse, explore and present information to make informed decisions.
  • Develop and establish a QA framework to evaluate, publish and share high quality reports within the business.
  • Develop pilot datasets and visualisations as a proof of capability to test the effectiveness of tools, technology, infrastructure and the governance processes procured, developed and established during the course of the project.
, '\n',

Noting this position is primarily project driven, it’s desirable that you’re capable of working across multiple project methodologies. Project management aptitude as demonstrated by experience will be prioritised over academic qualification or PM certifications.

, '\n',

In return for your depth of technical IT experience, commercial acumen and stakeholder engagement capability you will be offered flexibility in the work you undertake, plenty of opportunity to move fluidly across a diverse mandate of projects, great leadership and a genuinely supportive culture.

, '\n',

This role is a long term proposition, ideally starting as soon as possible. It will enable you to strategically influence long-term enterprise strategy and offer a positive and functional contribution to the organisation that will be leveraged for many years to come. It is not suited to someone whose priority is chasing the highest bidder from contract to contract.

, '\n',

If you’d like to apply please submit a .doc resume. If you wish to discuss or would like more information please contact Scott Morgans on 3011 3044. 

, '\n',

SK927049A

, '\n']

title: b'Senior BI & Data Analytics Architect\r\n    '
jd:
['\n',
About the company and role:
Work for a rapidly expanding niche consultancy specialising in delivering Big Data & Analytics, Business Intelligence, Digital and Cloud solutions for a varied client base across Australia and New Zealand. My client has a fun and collaborative team environment where you are encouraged to learn and certification and studies are funded by the company.  The Brisbane office is newly established and is on track to follow the successes of the Sydney and Melbourne offices.

As a Senior Architect the role will involve you in a diverse range of customer engagements covering Big Data, Digital, Customer Engagement and Cloud projects and therefore we are seeking strong BI/DW and Data Analytics Architects with strong technical skills across all these domains.
You will enjoy solving problems, have strong business acumen and excellent presentation and communication skills.  

Skills and experience sought:
  • Strong background in developing proof of concepts, solution design through to development and testing
  • Background in Programming and Development with strengths in SQL
  • Some infrastructure and cloud based platforms knowledge is required
  • Background in leading teams and technical projects
Ideally looking for strengths in 3 or more of the following Technical areas:
  • Reporting: PowerBI, Tableau, Qlikview, Datameer
  • ETL: Talend, SSIS, Alteryx, Informatica
  • Big data: Cloudera, Hortonworks, MapR, Kafka, NiFi, Elasticsearch
  • Analytics: Spark, R, Teradata Aster
  • Database: SQL Server, Oracle, Teradata, PostgreSQL, Greenplum
  • Programming Languages: Python, SQL, Java, Scala, PHP, .NET, Javascript
  • Frameworks and Architectures: Lambda, ReactJS, AngularJS, EmberJS, NodeJS
If you are passionate about IT and looking for a customer focused consulting role where you will have the opportunity to lead others please "apply now" or for a confidential discussion please call Sasha Jensen on 0424 012 839.
, '\n']
